name: NAME_TRN_ID
description: NAME_TRN_ID Transaction ID for Name Service Transaction . Requestor places a unique value for each active transaction . Responder puts NAME_TRN_ID value from request packet in response packet .
:LABEL: field

name: OPCODE
description: OPCODE Packet type code   see table below .
:LABEL: field

name: NM_FLAGS
description: NM_FLAGS Flags for operation   see table below .
:LABEL: field

name: RCODE
description: RCODE Result codes of request . Table of RCODE values for each response packet below .
:LABEL: field

name: QDCOUNT
description: QDCOUNT Unsigned 16 bit integer specifying the number of entries in the question section of a Name
:LABEL: field

name: ANCOUNT
description: ANCOUNT Unsigned 16 bit integer specifying the number of resource records in the answer section of a Name Service packet .
:LABEL: field

name: NSCOUNT
description: NSCOUNT Unsigned 16 bit integer specifying the number of resource records in the authority section of a Name Service packet .
:LABEL: field

name: ARCOUNT
description: ARCOUNT Unsigned 16 bit integer specifying the number of resource records in the additional records section of a Name Service packet .
:LABEL: field

name: OPCODE
description: OPCODE 1-4 Operation specifier : 0 = query 5 = registration 6 = release 7 = WACK 8 = refresh
:LABEL: field

name: QUESTION_NAME
description: QUESTION_NAME The compressed name representation of the NetBIOS name for the request .
:LABEL: field

name: QUESTION_TYPE
description: QUESTION_TYPE The type of request . The values for this field are specified for each request .
:LABEL: field

name: QUESTION_CLASS
description: QUESTION_CLASS The class of the request . The values for this field are specified for each request .
:LABEL: field

name: RR_NAME
description: RR_NAME The compressed name representation of the NetBIOS name corresponding to this resource record .
:LABEL: field

name: RR_TYPE
description: RR_TYPE Resource record type code
:LABEL: field

name: RR_CLASS
description: RR_CLASS Resource record class code
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: TTL The Time To Live of a the resource record's name .
:LABEL: field

name: RDLENGTH
description: RDLENGTH Unsigned 16 bit integer that specifies the number of bytes in the RDATA field .
:LABEL: field

name: RDATA
description: RDATA RR_CLASS and RR_TYPE dependent field . Contains the resource information for the NetBIOS name .
:LABEL: field

name: FLAGS
description: The TYPE   FLAGS   and LENGTH fields are present in every session packet .
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: adjust refresh timeout value   TTL   for this name; return success; /* name can be added */
:LABEL: field

name: vrsn
description: vrsn 8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: packet length
description: packet length 16 bits ( min=7   max=65535 )
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: IEEE 802 networks may be used as IP networks of any class ( A   B   or C ). These systems use two Link Service Access Point ( LSAP ) fields of the LLC header in much the same way the ARPANET uses the " link " field . Further   there is an extension of the LLC header called the Sub-Network Access Protocol ( SNAP ).
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: The Broadcast Indicators are used to indicate the routing desired for a particular frame . A frame may be routed through a single specified route   through every distinct non-repeating route in a multi-ring network   or through a single route determined by a spanning tree algorithm such that the frame appears on every ring exactly once . The values which may be used at this time are ( in binary ):
:LABEL: field

name: LTH
description: The Length bits are used to indicate the length or the RI field   including the RC and RD fields . Only even values between 2 and 30 inclusive are allowed .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: The D bit specifies the order of the RD fields . If D equals 1   the routing-designator fields are specified in reverse order .
:LABEL: field

name: LF
description: The LF bits specify the maximum MTU supported by all bridges along a specific route . All multi-ring broadcast frames should be transmitted with a value at least as large as the supported MTU . The values used are :
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: These bits are reserved for future use and must be set to 0 by the transmitter and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: MsgDelivery
description: CoresidentEntity   MsgDelivery and SegmentSize fields are in use . The RequestCode field specifies the type of Request . It is analogous to a packet type field of the Ethernet   acting as a switch for higher-level protocols . The CoresidentEntity field   if used   designates a subgroup of the ServerEntityId group to which the Request should be routed   namely those members that are co-resident with the specified entity ( or entity group ). The primary intended use is to specify the manager for a particular service that is co-resident with a particular entity   using the well-known entity group identifier for the service manager in the ServerEntityId field and the identifier for the entity in the CoresidentEntity field . The next 12 octets are user - or application-specified .
:LABEL: field

name: Domain
description: Domain The 13-bit identifier specifying the naming and administration domain for the client and server named in the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length A 13-bit field that specifies the number of 32-bit words in the segment data portion of the packet ( if any )  excluding the checksum field . ( Every VMTP packet is required to be a multiple of 64 bits   possibly by padding out the segment data .) The minimum legal Length is 0   the maximum length is 4096 and it must be an even number .
:LABEL: field

name: RetransmitCount
description: RetransmitCount : 3 bits - the ordinal number of transmissions of this packet group prior to this one   modulo 8 . This field is used in estimation of roundtrip times . This count may wrap around during a message transaction . However   it should be sufficient to match acknowledgments and responses with a particular transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PGcount
description: PGcount : 8 bits The number of packet groups that this packet group represents in addition to that specified by the Transaction field . This is used in acknowledging multiple packet groups in streamed communication .
:LABEL: field

name: Transaction
description: Transaction : 32 bits : Identifier for this message transaction .
:LABEL: field

name: PacketDelivery
description: PacketDelivery : 32 bits : Delivery indicates the segment blocks contained in this packet . Each bit corresponds to one 512-octet block of segment data . A 1 bit in the i-th bit position ( counting the LSB as 0 ) indicates the presence of the i-th segment block .
:LABEL: field

name: RES
description: RES Reserved for future use . Must be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: MsgDelivery
description: MsgDelivery : 32 bits The segment blocks being transmitted ( in total ) in this packet group following the conventions for the PacketDelivery field . This field is ignored by the protocol and treated as an additional user data field if MDM is 0 . On transmission   the user level sets the MsgDelivery to indicate those portions of the segment to be transmitted . On receipt   the MsgDelivery field is modified by the VMTP module to indicate the segment data blocks that were actually received before the message control block is passed to the user or RPC level . In particular   the kernel does not discard the packet group if segment data blocks are missing . A Server or Client entity receiving a message with a MsgDelivery in use must check the field to ensure adequate delivery and retry the operation if necessary .
:LABEL: field

name: SegmentSize
description: SegmentSize : 32 bits Size of segment in octets   up to a maximum of 16 kilooctets without streaming and 4 megaoctets with streaming   if SDA is set . Otherwise   this field is ignored by the protocol and treated as an additional user data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : 32 bits . The 32-bit checksum for the header and segment data .
:LABEL: field

name: Transaction
description: Transaction Identifier for transaction   at least one greater than the previously issued Request from this Client .
:LABEL: field

name: RequestCode
description: RequestCode Request code for this request   indicating the operation to perform .
:LABEL: field

name: STI
description: STI 1 if this Response is using one or more of the transaction identifiers skipped by the Client after the Request to which this is a Response . STI in the Request essentially allocates up to 256 transaction identifiers for the Server to use in a run of Response packet groups .
:LABEL: field

name: PGcount
description: PGcount The number of consecutively previous packet groups that this response is acknowledging in addition to the one identified by the Transaction identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum 14   43 Checksum   not set 44 Client 7   10   38 Client timer 16 CMD 42   110 CMG 32   40 Co-resident entity 25 Code 42 CoResidentEntity 42   43 CRE 21   42
:LABEL: field

name: DGM
description: DGM 42 Digital signature   VMTP management 95   101 Diskless workstations 2 Domain 9   38 Domain 1 102 Domain 3 104
:LABEL: field

name: LEE
description: LEE 32   37 Little-endian 9
:LABEL: field

name: RAE
description: RAE 37 Rate control 18 Real-time 2   4 Realtime 22
:LABEL: field

name: SDA
description: SDA 42 Security 4   19 Segment block 41 Segment data 43 SegmentSize 42   43 Selective retransmission 18 Server 7   10   41 Server group 8 Sockets   VMTP 118 STI 26   40 Streaming 25   55 Strictly stable 8 Subgroups 21
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This memo specifies version 1 of IGMP . Version 0 is specified in RFC-988 and is now obsolete .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: There are two types of IGMP message of concern to hosts :
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused field   zeroed when sent   ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the 8-octet IGMP message . For computing the checksum   the checksum field is zeroed .
:LABEL: field

name: Group Address
description: In a Host Membership Query message   the group address field is zeroed when sent   ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: This is an integer indicating the stratum of the logical clock . A value of zero is interpreted as unspecified   one as a primary clock ( synchronized by outside means ) and remaining values as the stratum level ( synchronized by NTP ). For comparison purposes a value of zero is considered greater than any other value .
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: This is a signed integer indicating the precision of the logical clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two . For instance   a 60-Hz line-frequency clock would be assigned the value - 6   while a 1000-Hz crystal-derived clock would be assigned the value - 10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Synchronizing Distance
description: This is a fixed-point number indicating the estimated roundtrip delay to the primary clock   in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Drift Rate
description: This is a fixed-point number indicating the estimated drift rate of the local clock   in dimensionless units .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Clock Identifier
description: This is a code identifying the particular reference clock or server . The interpretation of the value depends on the stratum . For stratum values of zero ( unspecified ) or one ( primary clock )  the value is an ASCII string identifying the reason or clock   respectively . For stratum values greater than one ( synchronized by NTP )  the value is the 32-bit Internet address of the reference server .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port
description: UDP source port number . In the case of a client request this field is assigned by the client host   while for a server reply it is copied from the Destination Port field of the client request . In the case of symmetric mode   both the Source Port and Destination Port fields are assigned the NTP service-port number 123 .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port
description: UDP destination port number . In the case of a client request this field is assigned the NTP service-port number 123   while for a server reply it is copied from the Source Port field of the client request . In the case of symmetric mode   both the Source Port and Destination Port fields are assigned the NTP service-port number 123 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of the request or reply   including UDP header   in octets
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Standard UDP checksum
:LABEL: field

name: LI
description: Two-bit code warning of impending leap-second to be inserted at the end of the last day of the current month . Bits are coded as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: Three-bit code indicating the version number   currently one ( 1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Integer identifying stratum level of local clock . Values are defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Poll
description: Signed integer indicating the maximum interval between successive messages   in seconds to the nearest power of two .
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Signed integer indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two .
:LABEL: field

name: Synchronizing Distance
description: Fixed-point number indicating the estimated roundtrip delay to the primary synchronizing source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Drift Rate
description: Fixed-point number indicating the estimated drift rate of the local clock   in dimensionless units with fraction point to the left of the most significant bit .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Clock Identifier
description: Code identifying the particular reference clock . In the case of type 0 ( unspecified ) or type 1 ( primary reference )  this is a left-justified   zero-filled ASCII string   for example :
:LABEL: field

name: address type
description: address type ( 2 octets ) - a binary-encoded value in network order indicating the address type . The value 3 is used for X.25 addressing of this format .
:LABEL: field

name: address type
description: address type ( 2 octets ) - a binary-encoded value in network order . The value 2 is used .
:LABEL: field

name: TCP port
description: TCP port ( 2 octets ) - a binary-encoded value in network order .
:LABEL: field

name: IP address
description: IP address ( 4 octets ) - a binary-encoded value in network order .
:LABEL: field

name: Marker
description: The Marker field is 16 bits of all ones . This field is used to mark the start of a message . If the first two bytes of a message are not all ones then we have a synchronization error and the BGP connection should be closed after sending a notification message with opcode 5 ( connection not synchronized ). No notification data is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is 16 bits . It is the total length of the message   incluluding header   in bytes . If an illegal length is encountered ( more than 1024 bytes or less than 8 bytes )  a notification message with opcode 6 ( bad message length ) and two data bytes of the bad length should be sent and the BGP connection closed .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version field is 8 bits of protocol version number . The current BGP version number is 1 . If a bad version number is found   a notification message with opcode 8 ( bad version number ) should be sent and the BGP connection closed . The bad version number should be included in one byte of notification data .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is 8 bits of message type code . The following type codes are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: My Autonomous System
description: This field is our 16 bit autonomous system number . If there is a problem with this field   a notification message with opcode 9 ( invalid AS field ) should be sent and the BGP connection closed . No notification data is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Type
description: The Link Type field is a single octet containing one of the
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: The Authentication Data field is a variable length field containing authentication data . If the value of Authentication Code field is zero   the Authentication Data field has zero length . If authentication fails   a notification message with opcode 3 ( authentication failure ) and no data is sent and the BGP connection is closed .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway
description: The Gateway field is the address of a gateway that has routes to the Internet networks listed in the rest of the UPDATE message . This gateway MUST belong to the same AS as the BGP peer who advertises it . If there is a problem with the gateway field   a notification message with subcode 6 ( invalid gateway field ) is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: AS count
description: This field is the count of Direction and AS Number pairs in this UPDATE message . If an incorrect AS count field is detected   subcode 1 ( invalid AS count ) is specified in the notification message .
:LABEL: field

name: Direction
description: The Direction field is an octet containing the direction taken by the routing information when exiting the AS defined by the succeeding AS Number field . The following values are defined .
:LABEL: field

name: AS Number
description: This field is the AS number that transmitted the routing information . If there is a problem with this AS number   a notification message with subcode 3 ( invalid autonomous system ) is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Net Count
description: The Net Count field is the number of Metric and Network field pairs which follow this field . If there is a problem with this field   a notification with subcode 7 ( invalid net count field ) is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Network
description: The Network field is four bytes of Internet network number . If there is a problem with the network field   a notification message with subcode 8 ( invalid network field ) is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Metric
description: The Metric field is 16 bits of an unspecified metric . BGP metrics are comparable ONLY if routes have exactly the same AS path . A metric of all ones indicates the network is unreachable . In all other cases the metric field is MEANINGLESS and MUST BE IGNORED . There are no illegal metric values .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: The Opcode field describes the type of NOTIFICATION . The following opcodes have been defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: The Data field contains zero or more bytes of data to be used in diagnosing the reason for the NOTIFICATION . The contents of the Data field depend upon the opcode . See the opcode descriptions above for more details .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This memo specifies version 1 of IGMP . Version 0 is specified in RFC-988 and is now obsolete .
:LABEL: field

description: There are two types of IGMP message of concern to hosts :

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the 8-octet IGMP message . For computing the checksum   the checksum field is zeroed .
:LABEL: field

name: Group Address
description: In a Host Membership Query message   the group address field
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the kind of LCP packet . LCP Codes are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the LCP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field should be changed on each transmission . On reception   the Identifier field should be copied into the Identifier field of the appropriate reply packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Terminate-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 7 for Code-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the transmitter .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 8 for Protocol-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the
:LABEL: field

name: Rejected-Protocol
description: The Rejected-Protocol field is two octets and contains the Protocol of the Data Link Layer frame which is being rejected .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 9 for Echo-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching Echo - Requests and Echo-Replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting loopbacked links . Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST always be transmitted as zero and MUST always be ignored on reception . Further use of the Magic-Number is beyond the scope of this discussion .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Discard-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the Discard - Request transmitter .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting loopbacked links . Unless modified by a configuration option   the Magic-Number MUST always be transmitted as zero and MUST always be ignored on reception . Further use of the Magic-Number is beyond the scope of this discussion .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet and indicates the type of Configuration Option . The most up-to-date values of the Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 11 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet and indicates the length of this Configuration Option including the Type   Length and Data fields . If a negotiable Configuration Option is received in a Configure - Request but with an invalid Length   a Configure-Nak should be transmitted which includes the desired Configuration Option with an appropriate Length and Data .
:LABEL: field

description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the kind of LCP packet . LCP Codes are assigned as follows :

description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the LCP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .

Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST always be transmitted as zero and MUST always be ignored on reception . Further use of the Magic-Number is beyond the scope of this discussion .

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet and indicates the type of Configuration Option . The most up-to-date values of the Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet and indicates the length of this Configuration Option including the Type   Length and Data fields . If a negotiable Configuration Option is received in a Configure - Request but with an invalid Length   a Configure-Nak should be transmitted which includes the desired Configuration Option with an appropriate Length and Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: The Maximum-Receive-Unit field is two octets and indicates the new maximum receive unit . The Maximum-Receive-Unit covers only the Data Link Layer Information field but not the header   trailer or any transparency bits or bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Async-Control-Character-Map
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Async-Control-Character-Map
description: The Async-Control-Character-Map field is four octets and indicates the new async control character map . The map is encoded in big - endian fashion where each numbered bit corresponds to the ASCII control character of the same value . If the bit is cleared to zero   then that ASCII control character need not be mapped . If the bit is set to one   then that ASCII control character must remain mapped . E.g .  if bit 19 is set to zero   then the ASCII control character 19 ( DC3   Control-S ) may be sent in the clear .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Type
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Type
description: The Authentication-Type field is two octets and indicates the type of authentication protocol desired . Values for the Authentication-Type are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same authentication protocol . The most up-to-date values of the Authentication-Type field are specified in " Assigned Numbers " [ 2 ]. Initial values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and indicates a number which is very likely to be unique to one end of the link . A Magic - Number of zero is illegal and must not be sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Reporting-Period
description: The Reporting-Period field is four octets and indicates the maximum time in micro-seconds that the remote end should wait between transmission of LCP Link-Quality-Report packets . A value of zero is illegal and should always be nak'd or rejected . An LCP implementation is always free to transmit LCP Link-Quality-Report packets at a faster rate than that which was requested by   and acknowledged to   the remote end .
:LABEL: field

name: Out-Tx-Packets-Ctr
description: Out-Tx-Packets-Ctr is a 32-bit counter maintained by the Tx process which increases by one for each transmitted Data Link Layer packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Out-Tx-Octets-Ctr
description: Out-Tx-Octets-Ctr is a 32-bit counter maintained by the Tx process which increases by one for each octet in a transmitted Data Link Layer packet . All octets which are included in the FCS calculation MUST be counted   as should the FCS octets themselves . All other octets MUST NOT be counted .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Packets-Ctr
description: In-Rx-Packets-Ctr is a 32-bit counter maintained by the Rx process which increases by one for each successfully received Data Link Layer packet . Packets with incorrect FCS fields or other problems
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Octets-Ctr
description: In-Rx-Octets-Ctr is a 32-bit counter maintained by the Rx process which increases by one for each octet in a successfully received Data Link Layer packet . All octets which are included in an FCS calculation MUST be counted   as should the FCS octets themselves . All other octets MUST NOT be counted .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-LQRs
description: In-Tx-LQRs is an 8-bit state variable which indicates the number of Link-Quality-Report packets which the peer had to transmit in order for the local end to receive exactly one LQR . In-Tx-LQRs defines the length of the " period " over which In-Tx-Packets   In - Tx-Octets   In-Rx-Packets   and In-Rx-Octets were measured . In-Tx - LQRs is calculated by subtracting Last-In-Id from the received Identifier . If more than 255 LQRs in a row are lost   In-Tx-LQRs will be ambiguous since the Identifier field and all state variables based on it are only 8 bits . It is assumed that the Link Quality Monitoring policy will be robust enough to handle this case ( it should probably close down the link long before this happens ).
:LABEL: field

name: Last-In-Id
description: Last-In-Id is an 8-bit state variable which stores the value of the last received Identifier . Last-In-Id should be updated after In-Tx-LQRs has been calculated .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-Packets
description: In-Tx-Packets is a 32-bit state variable which indicates the number of packets which were transmitted on the inbound link during the last period . In-Tx-Packets is calculated by subtracting Last-Out-Tx-Packets-Ctr from the received Out-Tx - Packets-Ctr .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-Octets
description: In-Tx-Octets is a 32-bit state variable which indicates the number of octets which were transmitted on the inbound link during the last period . In-Tx-Octets is calculated by subtracting Last-Out - Tx-Octets-Ctr from the received Out-Tx-Octets-Ctr .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Packets
description: In-Rx-Packets is a 32-bit state variable which indicates the number of packets which were received on the inbound link during the last period . In-Rx-Packets is calculated by subtracting Last-In-Rx-Packets-Ctr from the received In-Rx-Packets-Ctr .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Octets
description: In-Rx-Octets is a 32-bit state variable which indicates the number of octets which were received on the inbound link during the last period . In-Rx-Octets is calculated by subtracting Last-In-Rx - Octets-Ctr from the received In-Rx-Octets-Ctr .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 12 for Link-Quality-Report .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and indicates the sequence number for this Link-Quality-Report . The Identifier field is copied from the Out-Identifier-Ctr counter on transmission . On reception   the Identifier field is used to calculate In-Tx-LQRs and is then stored in Last-In-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the LQM packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and all defined fields . Octets outside the range of the length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception . In order for the correct In-Tx-Octets and In-Rx-Octets values to be calculated   Link-Quality-Reports MUST be consistently transmitted with the same amount of padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting looped-back links . Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST always be transmitted as zero and MUST always be ignored on reception . If Magic-Numbers have been negotiated   incoming LQM packets should be checked to make sure that the local end is not seeing its own Magic-Number and thus a looped-back link .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-LQRs
description: The In-Tx-LQRs field is one octet and indicates the number of periods covered by the Measurements section of this Link-Quality - Report . The In-Tx-LQRs field is copied from the In-Tx-LQRs state variable on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: Last-In-Id
description: The Prev-In-Id field is one octet and indicates the age of the Measurements section of this Link-Quality-Report . The Last-In-Id field is copied from the Last-In-Id field on transmission . On reception   the Last-In-Id field may be compared with the Out - Identifier-Ctr to determine how many   if any   outbound Link - Quality-Reports have been lost .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: The V field is 1 bit and indicates whether or not the Measurements section of this Link-Quality-Report is valid . The V field is copied from the Measurements-Valid state variable on transmission . If the V field is not set to 1   then the In-Tx-LQRs   Last-In-Id   In-Tx-Packets   In-Tx-Octets   In-Rx-Packets and In-Rx-Octets fields should be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The Reserved field is 15 bits and is intended to pad the remaining
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-Packets
description: The In-Tx-Packets field is four octets and indicates the number of packets transmitted on the inbound link of the Link-Quality-Report transmitter during the last measured period . The In-Tx-Packets field is copied from the In-Tx-Packets state variable on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Tx-Octets
description: The In-Tx-Octets field is four octets and indicates the number of octets transmitted on the inbound link of the Link-Quality-Report transmitter during the last measured period . The In-Tx-Octets field is copied from the In-Tx-Octets state variable on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Packets
description: The In-Rx-Packets field is four octets and indicates the number of packets received on the inbound link of the Link-Quality-Report transmitter during the last measured period . The In-Rx-Packets field is copied from the In-Rx-Packets state variable on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Octets
description: The In-Rx-Octets field is four octets and indicates the number of octets received on the inbound link of the Link-Quality-Report transmitter during the last measured period . The In-Rx-Octets field is copied from the In-Rx-Octets state variable on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Packets
description: The In-Rx-Packets field is four octets and is used to calculate the number of packets received on the inbound link of the Link - Quality-Report receiver during a period . The In-Rx-Packets field is copied from the In-Rx-Packets-Ctr counter on reception . The In-Rx-Packets is not shown because it is not actually transmitted over the link . Rather   it is logically appended ( in an implementation dependent manner ) to the packet by the implementation's Rx process .
:LABEL: field

name: In-Rx-Octets
description: The In-Rx-Octets field is four octets and is used to calculate the number of octets received on the inbound link of the Link - Quality-Report receiver during a period . The In-Rx-Octets field is copied from the In-Rx-Octets-Ctr counter on reception . The In-Rx-Octets is not shown because it is not actually transmitted over the link . Rather   it is logically appended ( in an implementation dependent manner ) to the packet by the implementation's Rx process .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of PAP packet . PAP Codes are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the PAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Authenticate .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field should be changed each time a Authenticate is transmitted which is different from the preceding request .
:LABEL: field

name: Passwd-Length
description: The Passwd-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the Password field
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Authenticate-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be copied from the Identifier field of the Authenticate which caused this Authenticate-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Msg-Length
description: The Msg-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the Message field
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Authenticate-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be copied from the Identifier field of the Authenticate which caused this Authenticate-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Msg-Length
description: The Msg-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the Message field
:LABEL: field

name: Source-IP-Address
description: The four octet Source-IP-Address is the desired local address of the sender of a Configure-Request . In a Configure-Ack   Configure-Nak or Configure-Reject   the Source-IP-Address is the remote address of the sender   and is thus a local address with respect to the Configuration Option receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination-IP-Address
description: The four octet Destination-IP-Address is the remote address with respect to the sender of a Configure-Request . In a Configure-Ack   Configure-Nak or Configure-Reject   the Destination-IP-Address is the local address of the sender   and is thus a remote address with respect to the Configuration Option receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Compression-Type
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Compression-Type
description: The Compression-Type field is two octets and indicates the type of compression protocol desired . Values for the Compression-Type are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same compression protocol . The most up-to-date values of the Compression-Type field are specified in " Assigned Numbers " [ 2 ]. Initial values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: ST
description: This memo defines the Internet Stream Protocol   Version 2 ( ST-II )  an IP-layer protocol that provides end-to-end guaranteed service across an internet . This specification obsoletes IEN 119 " ST - A Proposed Internet Stream Protocol " written by Jim Forgie in 1979   the previous specification of ST . ST-II is not compatible with Version 1 of the protocol   but maintains much of the architecture and philosophy of that version . It is intended to fill in some of the areas left unaddressed   to make it easier to implement   and to support a wider range of applications .
:LABEL: field

name: ST
description: ST-II supports a wider variety of applications than did the original ST . The differences between ST and ST-II are fairly straight forward yet provide great improvements . Four of the more notable differences are :
:LABEL: field

name: ST
description: It is the responsibility of an ST application entity to exchange information among its peers   usually via IP   as necessary to determine the structure of the communication before establishing the ST stream . This includes :
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o Create a stream from an application at A to three peers at B   C and D
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Several options are defined in the CONNECT message . The special processing required to support each will be described in the following sections . The options are independent   i.e .  can be set to one ( 1   TRUE ) or zero ( 0   FALSE ) in any combination . However   the effect and implementation of the options is NOT necessarily independent   and not all combinations are supported .
:LABEL: field

name: SAP
description: RecvNet ( SAP ) -> result   src   dst   len   BufPTR )
:LABEL: field

name: SAP
description: SendNet ( src   dst   SAP   len   BufPTR ) -> result
:LABEL: field

name: SAP
description: GetNotification ( SAP ) -> result   infop
:LABEL: field

name: DetectorIPAddress
description: Several control messages contain the DetectorIPAddress field . It is used to identify the agent that caused the first instance of the message to be generated   i.e .  before it was propagated . It is copied from the received message into the copy of the message that is to be propagated to a previous-hop or next-hop . It use is primarily diagnostic .
:LABEL: field

name: ErroredPDU
description: The ErroredPDU parameter ( PCode = 1 ) is used for diagnostic purposes to encapsulate a received ST PDU that contained an error . It may be included in the ERROR-IN-REQUEST   ERROR - IN-RESPONSE   or REFUSE messages . It use is primarily diagnostic .
:LABEL: field

name: ErroredPDU
description: include the field or parameter identified by ErrorOffset; an ErrorOffset of zero would imply a problem with the IP Version Number or ST Version Number fields .
:LABEL: field

name: ReasonCode
description: Several errors may occur during protocol processing . All ST error codes are taken from a single number space . The currently defined values and their meaning is presented in the list below . Note that new error codes may be defined from time to time . All implementations are expected to handle new codes in a graceful manner . If an unknown ReasonCode is encountered   it should be assumed to be fatal .
:LABEL: field

name: ReasonCode
description: Figure 33 . ReasonCode
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G ( bit 8 ) is used to request a global   stream-wide change; the TargetList parameter may be omitted when the G bit is specified .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G ( bit 8 ) is used to request a global   stream-wide change; the TargetList parameter may be omitted when the G bit is specified .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H ( bit 8 ) is used for the HID Field option; see Section 3.6.1 ( page 44 ). It is set to one ( 1 ) only if the HID field contains either zero ( when the HID selection is being deferred )  or the proposed HID . This bit is zero ( 0 ) if the HID field does not contain valid data and should be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P ( bit 9 ) is used for the PTP option; see Section 3.6.2 ( page 44 ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reference is non-zero to inform the receiver that an ACK should be promptly sent so that the sender can update its round-trip time estimates . If the Reference is zero   no ACK should be sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Logical Record Length
description: This field indicates the length   in octets   of this logical record including the header length . The length is calculated BEFORE
:LABEL: field

name: Record Type
description: This field indicates the SNA record type . It should always be set to ' 12A0'X to indicate the General Data Stream ( GDS ) record type .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is currently not used .
:LABEL: field

name: Var Hdr Len
description: The length   in octets   of the variable portion of the header . Currently this is always ' 04'X .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This field contains the operation code . It is set to indicate the type of operation requested by the sender . The following are the valid values :
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: MAC Type : 0 : Reserved 1 : IEEE 802.3/Ethernet 2 : IEEE 802.4 3 : IEEE 802.5 4 : FDDI other : Assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Control
description: Frame Control : On 802.4   802.5   and FDDI LANs   there are a few octets preceding the Destination MAC Address   one of which is protected by the FCS . Since the MAC Type field defines the bit ordering   these are sent in MAC order . A pad octet is present to avoid odd machine address boundary problems .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination MAC Address
description: Destination MAC Address : As defined by the IEEE . Since the MAC Type field defines the bit ordering   this is sent in MAC order .
:LABEL: field

name: Source MAC Address
description: Source MAC Address : As defined by the IEEE . Since the MAC Type field defines the bit ordering   this is sent in MAC order .
:LABEL: field

name: LLC data
description: LLC data : This is the remainder of the MAC frame . This is that portion of the frame which is ( or would be were it present ) protected by the LAN FCS; for example   the 802.5 Access Control field   and Status Trailer are not meaningful to transmit to another ring   and are omitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow ID
description: Flow ID - A 32-bit identifier which uniquely distinguishes a flow in a given Encapsulator or Decapsulator . Flow IDs are specific to a single Encapsulator/Decapsulator Entity and are not global quantities .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow ID
description: Flow ID - This is the key for this table of information and represents the Flow ID relative to the current Encapsulator .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers
description: Vers 4 bits The version number of the encapsulation protocol . The version of the protocol described by this document is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: HL
description: HL 4 bits The header length of the Encapsulation Protocol Header in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: MT
description: MT 4 bits The message type of the Encapsulation Protocol message . A data message has a message type of 1 . An error message has a message type of 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: RC
description: RC 4 bits The reason code . This field is unused in the Data Message and must have a value of 0 . In the Error Message it contains the reason code for the Error Message . Defined reason code
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum 16 bits A one's complement checksum for the Encapsulation Protocol Header . This field is set to 0 upon calculation of the checksum and is filled with the checksum calculation result before the data message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow ID
description: Flow ID 32 bits The Flow ID as seen by the Decapsulator or Encapsulator to which this message is being sent . In the case of an Unknown Flow ID error   the Flow ID causing the error is used .
:LABEL: field

name: TOS
description: OSPF calculates separate routes for each Type of Service ( TOS ). When several equal-cost routes to a destination exist   traffic is distributed equally among them . The cost of a route is described by a single dimensionless metric .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name Protocol function __________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Discover/maintain neighbors 2 Database Description Summarize database contents 3 Link State Request Database download 4 Link State Update Database update 5 Link State Ack Flooding acknowledgment
:LABEL: field

name: Autype
description: Autype and Authentication Each OSPF packet exchange is authenticated . Authentication types are assigned by the protocol and documented in Appendix E . A different authentication scheme can be used for each OSPF area . The 64-bit authentication field is set by the appropriate authentication procedure ( determined by Autype ). This procedure should be the last called when forming the packet to be sent . The setting of the authentication field is determined by the packet contents and the authentication key ( which is configurable on a per-interface basis ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( transmit ) _________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 9.5 2 Database description Section 10.8 3 Link state request Section 10.9 4 Link state update Section 13.3 5 Link state ack Section 13.5
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( receive ) ________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 10.5 2 Database description Section 10.6 3 Link state request Section 10.7 4 Link state update Section 13 5 Link state ack Section 13.7
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Dest Area Path Type Cost Next Hop(s ) Adv . Router(s ) __________________________________________________________________________ N N1 0 intra-area 10 RT3 * N N2 0 intra-area 10 RT3 * N N3 0 intra-area 7 RT3 * N N4 0 intra-area 8 RT3 * N Ib 0 intra-area 7 * * N Ia 0 intra-area 12 RT10 * N N6 0 intra-area 8 RT10 * N N7 0 intra-area 12 RT10 * N N8 0 intra-area 10 RT10 * N N9 0 intra-area 11 RT10 * N N10 0 intra-area 13 RT10 * N N11 0 intra-area 14 RT10 * N H1 0 intra-area 21 RT10 * ASBR RT5 0 intra-area 6 RT5 * ASBR RT7 0 intra-area 8 RT10 * __________________________________________________________________________ N N12 * type 1 external 10 RT10 RT7 N N13 * type 1 external 14 RT5 RT5 N N14 * type 1 external 14 RT5 RT5 N N15 * type 1 external 17 RT10 RT7
