:LABEL: field

description: The stub networks are added to the tree in the procedure's second stage . In this stage   all router vertices are again examined . Those that have been determined to be unreachable in the above first phase are discarded . For each reachable router vertex ( call it V )  the associated router links advertisement is found in the link state database . Each stub network link appearing in the advertisement is then examined   and the following steps are executed :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description ________________________________ 1 Hello 2 Database Description 3 Link State Request 4 Link State Update 5 Link State Acknowledgment
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description __________________________________________________ 1 Point-to-point connection to another router 2 Connection to a transit network 3 Connection to a stub network 4 Virtual link
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Link ID ______________________________________ 1 Neighboring router's ID 2 IP address of Designated Router 3 IP network/subnet number 4 Neighboring router's ID
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T1 The state of a router interface changes . Interface state changes are documented in Section 9.3 . In general   they will cause new link state advertisements to be originated . The logging message produced should include the interface's IP address ( or other name )  interface type ( virtual link   etc .) and old and new state values ( as documented in Section 9.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T2 The state of a neighbor changes . Neighbor state changes are documented in Section 10.3 . The logging message produced should include the neighbor IP address   and old and new state values .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T3 The ( Backup ) Designated Router has changed on one of the attached networks . See Section 9.4 . The logging message produced should include the network IP address   and the old and new ( Backup ) Designated Routers .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T4 The router is originating a new instance of a link state advertisement . The logging message produced should indicate the LS type   Link State ID and Advertising Router associated with the advertisement ( see Section 12.4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T5 The router has received a new instance of a link state advertisement . The router receives these in Link State Update packets . This will cause recalculation of the routing table . The logging message produced should indicate the advertisement's LS type   Link State ID and Advertising Router . The message should also include the neighbor from whom the advertisement was received .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T6 An entry in the routing table has changed ( see Section 11 ). The logging message produced should indicate the Destination type   Destination ID   and the old and new paths to the destination .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E1 The checksum in a received link state advertisement is incorrect . The advertisement is discarded ( see Section 13 ). The logging message should include the advertisement's LS type   Link State ID and Advertising Router ( which may be incorrect ). The message should also include the neighbor from whom the advertisement was received .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E2 During the aging process   it is discovered that one of the link state advertisements in the database has an incorrect checksum . This indicates memory corruption or a software error in the router itself . The router should be dumped and restarted .
:LABEL: field

name: LS type
description: LS type Link State ID Advertising Router LS seq no LS age LS checksum _______________________________________________________________________________ 4 N15 RT7's ID * * *
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 9
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   start - ing with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum field is set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Addrs
description: Num Addrs The number of router addresses advertised in this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr Entry Size
description: Addr Entry Size The number of 32-bit words of information per each router address ( 2   in the version of the protocol described here ).
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime The maximum number of seconds that the router addresses may be considered valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 10
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Checksum The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   start - ing with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum field is set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   start - ing with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum field is set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Sent as 0; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: BGP Identifier
description: BGP Identifier : This 4-octet unsigned integer indicates the BGP Identifier of the sender . A given BGP speaker sets the value of its BGP Identifier to the IP address of one of its interfaces . The value of the BGP Identifier is determined on startup and is the same for every local interface and every BGP peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Attributes
description: This section discusses the path attributes of the UPDATE message .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The identifier is a value assigned by the DSLCP used to uniquely identify link setup transactions . It is intended to be used with the endpoint addresses by a link controller to identify a transaction .
:LABEL: field

name: Total length
description: The total length   in octets   including the header of this DSLCP control message .
:LABEL: field

name: Function
description: The operation to be processed or being responded to .
:LABEL: field

name: Event Status
description: The state of the controlled link   relative to the last function request .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the kind of LCP packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   a Code - Reject packet is transmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . When a packet is received with an invalid Identifier field   the packet is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the LCP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception . When a packet is received with an invalid Length field   the packet is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field SHOULD be changed on each transmission . On reception   the Identifier field should be copied into the Identifier field of the appropriate reply packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Terminate-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 7 for Code-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the transmitter .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 8 for Protocol-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the transmitter .
:LABEL: field

name: Rejected-Protocol
description: The Rejected-Protocol field is two octets and contains the Protocol of the Data Link Layer frame which is being rejected .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 9 for Echo-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching Echo - Requests and Echo-Replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST be transmitted as zero and MUST be ignored on reception . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Discard-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is for use by the Discard - Request transmitter .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Unless modified by a configuration option   the Magic-Number MUST be transmitted as zero and MUST be ignored on reception . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet and indicates the type of Configuration Option . The most up-to-date values of the LCP Option Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 11 ]. Current values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet and indicates the length of this Configuration Option including the Type   Length and Data fields . If a negotiable Configuration Option is received in a Configure - Request but with an invalid Length   a Configure-Nak SHOULD be transmitted which includes the desired Configuration Option with an appropriate Length and Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: The Maximum-Receive-Unit field is two octets and indicates the new maximum receive unit . The Maximum-Receive-Unit covers only the Data Link Layer Information field . It does not include the header   padding   FCS   nor any transparency bits or bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Async-Control-Character-Map
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Async-Control-Character-Map
description: The Async-Control-Character-Map field is four octets and indicates the new async control character map . The map is encoded in big - endian fashion where each numbered bit corresponds to the ASCII control character of the same value . If the bit is cleared to zero   then that ASCII control character need not be mapped . If the bit is set to one   then that ASCII control character must remain mapped . E.g .  if bit 19 is set to zero   then the ASCII control character 19 ( DC3   Control-S ) may be sent in the clear .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: The Authentication-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the authentication protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same authentication protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: The Quality-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the link quality monitoring protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same monitoring protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and indicates a number which is very likely to be unique to one end of the link . A Magic - Number of zero is illegal and MUST always be Nak'd   if it is not Rejected outright .
:LABEL: field

name: IP-Compression-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: IP-Compression-Protocol
description: The IP-Compression-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the compression protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same compression protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: IP-Address
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: IP-Address
description: The four octet IP-Address is the desired local address of the sender of a Configure-Request . If all four octets are set to zero   it indicates a request that the peer provide the IP-Address information .
:LABEL: field

name: IP-Compression-Protocol
description: 002d ( hex ) for Van Jacobson Compressed TCP/IP headers .
:LABEL: field

name: Max-Slot-Id
description: The Max-Slot-Id field is one octet and indicates the maximum slot identifier . This is one less than the actual number of slots; the slot identifier has values from zero to Max-Slot-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Comp-Slot-Id
description: The Comp-Slot-Id field is one octet and indicates whether the slot identifier field may be compressed .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: c025 ( hex ) for Link-Quality-Report
:LABEL: field

name: Reporting-Period
description: The Reporting-Period field is four octets and indicates the maximum time in hundredths of seconds between transmission of packets . The peer MAY transmit packets at a faster rate than that which was negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST be transmitted as zero and MUST be ignored on reception . If Magic-Numbers have been negotiated   incoming LQR packets SHOULD be checked to ensure that the local end is not seeing its own Magic-Number and thus a looped-back link . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutLQRs
description: The LastOutLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutLQRs on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutPackets
description: The LastOutPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutPackets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutOctets
description: The LastOutOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutOctets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInLQRs
description: The PeerInLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInLQRs on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInPackets
description: The PeerInPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInPackets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInDiscards
description: The PeerInDiscards field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInDiscards on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInErrors
description: The PeerInErrors field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInErrors on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInOctets
description: The PeerInOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInOctets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutLQRs
description: The PeerOutLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from OutLQRs on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutPackets
description: The PeerOutPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifOutUniPackets and ifOutNUniPackets on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutOctets
description: The PeerOutOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifOutOctets on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInLQRs
description: The SaveInLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from InLQRs on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInPackets
description: The SaveInPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifInUniPackets and ifInNUniPackets on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInErrors
description: The SaveInErrors field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifInErrors on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInOctets
description: The SaveInOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the current InGoodOctets on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: c023 ( hex ) for Password Authentication Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of PAP packet . PAP Codes are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the PAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Authenticate-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be changed each time an Authenticate-Request packet is issued .
:LABEL: field

name: Passwd-Length
description: The Passwd-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the Password field .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Authenticate-Ack;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be copied from the Identifier field of the Authenticate-Request which caused this reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Msg-Length
description: The Msg-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the Message field .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: c223 ( hex ) for Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Algorithm
description: The Algorithm field is one octet and indicates the one-way hash method to be used . The most up-to-date values of the CHAP Algorithm field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 2 ]. Current values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of CHAP packet . CHAP Codes are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching challenges   responses and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the CHAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Challenge;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet . The Identifier field MUST be changed each time a Challenge is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Value-Size
description: This field is one octet and indicates the length of the Value field .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Success;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be copied from the Identifier field of the Response which caused this reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port
description: Source Port Picked by originator of packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Number of bytes in UDP packet   including UDP header .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum Reference 2 describes rules for computing checksum . ( The implementor of this should be sure that the correct algorithm is used here .) Field contains zero if unused .
:LABEL: field

name: LI
description: Leap Indicator ( LI ): This is a two-bit code warning of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day   with bit 0 and bit 1   respectively   coded as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: Version Number ( VN ): This is a three-bit integer indicating the NTP version number   currently 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : This is a three-bit integer indicating the mode   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum : This is a eight-bit integer indicating the stratum level of the local clock   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision : This is an eight-bit signed integer indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two . The values that normally appear in this field range from - 6 for mains-frequency clocks to - 18 for microsecond clocks found in some workstations .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay : This is a 32-bit signed fixed-point number indicating the total roundtrip delay to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . Note that this variable can take on both positive and negative values   depending on the relative time and frequency errors . The values that normally appear in this field range from negative values of a few milliseconds to positive values of several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion : This is a 32-bit unsigned fixed-point number indicating the maximum error relative to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . The values that normally appear in this field range from zero to several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Transmission Unit
description: A 16-bit integer in Internet byte order which is the maximum number of bytes in the largest possible packet to be transmitted over this flow .
:LABEL: field

name: Token Bucket Rate
description: The token bucket rate is one of three fields used to define how traffic will be injected into the internetwork by the sending application . ( The other two fields are the token bucket size and the maximum transmission rate .)
:LABEL: field

name: Token Bucket Size
description: The token bucket size controls the maximum amount of data that the flow can send at the peak rate . More formally   if the token bucket size is B   and the token bucket rate is R   over any arbitrarily chosen interval T in the life of the flow   the amount of data that the flow sends cannot have exceeded B + ( R * T ) bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Transmission Rate
description: The maximum transmission rate limits how fast packets may be sent back to back from the host . Consider that if the token bucket is full   it is possible for the flow to send a series of back-to-back packets equal to the size of the token bucket . If the token bucket size is large   this back-to-back run may be long enough to significantly inhibit multiplexing .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum Delay Noticed
description: The minimum delay noticed field tells the internetwork that the host and application are effectively insensitive to improvements in end-to-end delay below this value . The network is encouraged to drive the delay down to this value but need not try to improve the delay further .
:LABEL: field

description: 1 - the application is moderately delay sensitive e.g .  avoid satellite links where possible ).
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Delay Variation
description: If a receiving application requires data to be delivered in the same pattern that the data was transmitted   it may be necessary for the receiving host to briefly buffer data as it is received so that the receiver can restore the old transmission pattern . ( An easy example of this is a case where an application wishes to send and transmit data such as voice samples   which are generated and played at regular intervals . The regular intervals may be distorted by queueing effects in the network and the receiver may
:LABEL: field

name: Loss Sensitivity
description: This field indicates how sensitive the flow's traffic is to losses . Loss sensitivity can be expressed in one of two ways : either as a number of losses of MTU-sized packets in an interval   or simply as a value indicating a level of sensitivity .
:LABEL: field

description: 1 - the flow is sensitive to loss ( where possible choose the path with the lowest loss rate ).
:LABEL: field

name: Burst Loss Sensitivity
description: This field states how sensitive the flow is to losses of consecutive packets . The field enumerates the maximum number of consecutive MTU-sized packets that may be lost .
:LABEL: field

name: Loss Interval
description: This field determines the period over which the maximum number of losses per interval are measured . In other words   given any arbitrarily chosen interval of this length   the number of losses may not exceed the number in the Loss Sensitivity field .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality of Guarantee
description: It is expected that the internetwork will likely have to offer more than one type of guarantee .
:LABEL: field

name: a
description: a is 1 bit called the Automatic bit   indicating that the Completeness and PathLength bits have been generated automatically by a router . The meaning of this characteristic and its setting are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: c
description: c is 1 bit of Completeness information . The meaning of this characteristic and its settings are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: a
description: a is 1 bit called the Automatic bit   set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: D1_Area_Size ( 8 bits ) should be sent as 3 . Destinations shall accept any value that HIPPI-FP defines as legal : from 3 to 127 ( 32 bit HIPPI ) or 3 to 255 ( 64 bit HIPPI ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Destination_IEEE_Address ( 48 bits ) shall contain the 48 bit Universal LAN MAC Address of the Destination if known   otherwise zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( bits 30   29 ) should be zero . Destinations shall accept any value for these bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Destination Address ( bits 11-0 ) shall contain the Switch Address of the Destination .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L = Locally defined ( 1 => entire I-field is locally defined ) W = Width ( 1 => 64 bit connection ) D = Direction ( 1 => swap Source and Destination Address ) PS = Path Selection ( 01 => Logical Address Mode ) C = Camp-on ( 1 => wait until Destination is free )
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L The " Locally Defined " bit   when set   indicates that the I-field is not in the standard format . The meaning of bits 30-0 are locally defined .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: W The Width bit   when set   requests a 64 bit connection through the switch . It is meaningless if Cable B is not installed at the Source . If W is set and either the Source or the requested Destination has no Cable B to the switch   the switch rejects the connection . Otherwise the switch connects both Cable A and Cable B if W is set   or Cable A only if W is clear . This feature is useful if both Source and Destination implementations can selectively disable or enable Cable B on each new connection .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D The Direction bit   when set   reverses the sense of the Source Address and Destination Address fields . In other words   D=1 means that the Source Address is in bits 0-11 and the Destination Address is in bits 12-23 . This bit was defined to give devices a simple way to route return messages . It is not useful for LAN operations .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C The Camp-on bit requests the switch not to reject the connection if the selected Destination is busy ( connected to another Source ) but wait and make the connection when the Destination is free .
:LABEL: field

name: Length LSB
description: Least significant byte of length field
:LABEL: field

name: DATA
description: DNA Phase IV Routing data   as specified in [ 2 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Alignment
description: This field specifies the offset of the beginning of the OSI NPDU relative to the beginning of the PPP packet header ( not including any leading Flag Sequences ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This octet is reserved and MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Net
description: The two octet AT-Net is the desired local AppleTalk network number of the sender of the Configure-Request . This two octet quantity represents a 16 bit unsigned number sent " network byte order " ( most significant octet first ).
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Node
description: The one octet AT-Node is the desired local AppleTalk node ID of the sender of the Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Routing-Protocol
description: The Routing-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the type of Routing-Protocol desired . This two octet quantity represents a 16 bit number sent " network byte order " ( most significant octet first ).
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Compression-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Compression-Protocol
description: The AT-Compression-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the compression protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same compression protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Server-class
description: The Server-class field is two octets and indicates the class of the communication server providing the remote end of the PPP connection .
:LABEL: field

name: Server-implementation-id
description: The Server-implementation-id field is four octets and indicates the version of the communication server providing the remote end of the PPP connection .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This octet is reserved and MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Net
description: The two octet AT-Net is the AppleTalk network number of the default router . This two octet quantity represents a 16 bit unsigned number sent in " network byte order " ( most significant octet first ).
:LABEL: field

name: AT-Node
description: The one octet AT-Node is the AppleTalk node ID of the default router .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version field is identical to that of IP . This field is set purely for compatibility with IP hosts . It is not checked by EIP hosts .
:LABEL: field

name: IHL
description: Internet Header Length is identical to that of IP . IHL is set to the length of EIP header purely for compatibility with IP . This field is not checked by EIP hosts . see below the EIP Extension Length field for more details )
:LABEL: field

name: Type of Service
description: The ToS field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Total Length
description: The Total Length field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: The Identification field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: The Fragment Offset field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Time to Live
description: The Time to Live field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: The Protocol field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Header Checksum
description: The Header Checksum field is identical to that of IP .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Host Number
description: The Source Host Number field is used for identifying the source host but is unique only within the source network ( the equivalent of the host portion of the source IP address ).
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Host Number
description: The Destination Host Number field is used for identifying the destination host but is unique only within the destination network ( the equivalent of the host portion of the destination IP address ).
:LABEL: field

name: EIP ID
description: The EIP ID field equals to 0x8A . The EIP ID value is chosen in such a way that   to IP hosts and IP routers   an EIP appears to be an IP packet with a new IP option of following parameters :
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: 0 ( do not copy to fragments )
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: 2 ( Debugging & Measurement )
:LABEL: field

name: Number
description: 18 ( F+C+Number = 82 )
:LABEL: field

name: ID Number
description: An arbitrary number used by the originator of the Outbound Packet to identify the ICMP Traceroute messages . It is NOT related to the ID number in the IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: ID Number
description: The ID Number as copied from the IP Traceroute option of the packet which caused this Traceroute message to be sent . This is NOT related to the ID number in the IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: a
description: a is 1 bit called the Automatic bit   indicating that the Completeness and PathLength bits have been generated automatically by a router . The meaning of this characteristic and its setting are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: c
description: c is 1 bit of Completeness information . The meaning of this characteristic and its settings are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: a
description: a is 1 bit called the Automatic bit   set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R(r d i h ) A route that means : " from router r   to go toward final destination d   replace the forward route identifier in the packet with i   and take next hop h ."
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Router C announces a route R(C Y 0 Y ) to router B . It includes in it an identifier Ri(C Y ) internal to C   that will allow C to find the route rapidly . ( A table index   or an actual memory address .)
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: Router A creates a route R(A Y Ri(B Y) B ) via router B . It has no one to announce it to .
:LABEL: field

name: version
description: As noted in the description of datagram format   it is possible to provide a mostly-transparent bridge between version 4 and version 7 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : BROADCAST flag
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : MUST BE ZERO ( reserved for future use )
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : BROADCAST flag
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : MUST BE ZERO ( reserved for future use )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the kind of LCP packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   a Code - Reject packet is transmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . When a packet is received with an invalid Identifier field   the packet is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the LCP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field are treated as padding and are ignored on reception . When a packet is received with an invalid Length field   the packet is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Options field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Terminate-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged . On reception   the Identifier field of the Terminate-Request is copied into the Identifier field of the Terminate-Ack packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 7 for Code-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Code-Reject sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 8 for Protocol-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Protocol-Reject sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Rejected-Protocol
description: The Rejected-Protocol field is two octets and contains the PPP Protocol field of the packet which is being rejected .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 9 for Echo-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Discard-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Discard-Request sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet and indicates the type of Configuration Option . Up-to-date values of the LCP Option Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet and indicates the length of this Configuration Option including the Type   Length and Data fields . If a negotiable Configuration Option is received in a Configure - Request but with an invalid Length   a Configure-Nak SHOULD be transmitted which includes the desired Configuration Option with an appropriate Length and Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: The Maximum-Receive-Unit field is two octets   and specifies the maximum number of octets in the Information and Padding fields . It does not include the framing   Protocol field   FCS   nor any transparency bits or bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Async-Control-Character-Map
description: The Async-Control-Character-Map field is four octets and indicates the set of control characters to be mapped . The map is sent most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: The Authentication-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the authentication protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Protocol field values for that same authentication protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: The Quality-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the link quality monitoring protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Protocol field values for that same monitoring protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and indicates a number which is very likely to be unique to one end of the link . A Magic - Number of zero is illegal and MUST always be Nak'd   if it is not Rejected outright .
:LABEL: field

name: IPX-Network-Number
description: The four octet IPX-Network-Number is the desired local IPX network number of the sender of the Configure-Request . This number may be zero   which is interpreted as being a local network of unknown number that is not used by the routing protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: IPX-Node-Number
description: The six octet IPX-Node-Number is the desired local IPX node number of the sender of the Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: IPX-Compression-Protocol
description: The IPX-Compression-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the compression protocol desired . Odd values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same compression protocol . Even values are used when the compression protocol is interleaved with IPX packets .
:LABEL: field

name: IPX-Routing-Protocol
description: The IPX-Routing-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the type of Routing-Protocol desired . This two octet quantity is sent most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: When set to one ( 1 )  the length flag indicates the inclusion of the IPX data length field in the compressed packet . When set to zero ( 0 )  the length flag indicates the omission of the IPX data length field in the compressed packet .
:LABEL: field

name: IPX-Compression-Protocol
description: 0002 ( hex ) for Telebit Compressed IPX headers ( CIPX ).
:LABEL: field

name: Max-Slot-Id
description: The Max-Slot-Id field is one octet and indicates the maximum
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: The Options field is one octet   and is comprised of the " logical or " of the following values :
:LABEL: field

description: This one-octet field identifies this as the ISO/IEC 8473 protocol; it MUST set to binary 1000 0001 .
:LABEL: field

description: Header Length is the length of the CLNP header in octets   and thus points to the beginning of the data . The value 255 is reserved . The header length is the same for all fragments of the same ( original ) CLNP packet .
:LABEL: field

description: This one-octet field identifies the version of the protocol; it MUST be set to a binary value 0000 0001 .
:LABEL: field

description: Like the TTL field of IP   this field indicates the maximum time the datagram is allowed to remain in the internet system . If this field contains the value zero   then the datagram MUST be destroyed; a host   however   MUST NOT send a datagram with a lifetime value of zero . This field is modified in internet header processing . The time is measured in units of 500 milliseconds   but since every module that processes a datagram MUST decrease the TTL by at least one even if it process the datagram in less than 500 millisecond   the TTL must be thought of only as an upper bound on the time a datagram may exist . The intention is to cause undeliverable datagrams to be discarded   and to bound the maximum CLNP datagram lifetime . [ Like IP   the colloquial usage of TTL in CLNP is as a coarse hop-count .]
:LABEL: field

description: Three flags are defined . These occupy bits 0   1   and 2 of the Flags/Type octet :
:LABEL: field

description: The type field distinguishes data CLNP packets from Error Reports from Echo packets . The following values of the type field apply :
:LABEL: field

description: Like the Total Length of the IP header   the Fragment length field contains the length in octets of the fragment ( i.e .  this datagram ) including both header and data .
:LABEL: field

description: A checksum is computed on the header only . It MUST be verified at each host/router that processes the packet; if header fields are changed during processing ( e.g .  the Lifetime )  the checksum is modified . If the checksum is not used   this field MUST be coded with a value of zero ( 0 ). See Appendix A for algorithms used in the computation and adjustment of the checksum . Readers are encouraged to see [ 10 ] for a description of an efficient implementation of the checksum algorithm .
:LABEL: field

description: CLNP uses OSI network service access point addresses ( NSAPAs ); NSAPAs serve the same identification and location functions as an IP address   plus the protocol selector value encoded in the IPv4 datagram header   and with additional hierarchy . General purpose
:LABEL: field

description: Like the Identification field of IP   this 16-bit field is used to distinguish segments of the same ( original ) packet for the purposes of reassembly . This field is present when the fragmentation permitted flag is set to one .
:LABEL: field

description: Like the Fragment Offset of IP   this 16-bit is used to identify the relative octet position of the data in this fragment with respect to the start of the data submitted to CLNP; i.e .  it indicates where in the original datagram this fragment belongs . The offset is measured in octets; the value of this field shall always be a multiple of eight ( 8 ). This field is present when the fragmentation permitted flag is set to one .
:LABEL: field

description: The total length of the CLNP packet in octets is determined by the originator and placed in the Total Length field of the header . The Total Length field specifies the entire length of the original datagram   including both the header and data . This field MUST NOT be changed in any fragment of the original packet for the duration of the packet lifetime . This field is present when the fragmentation permitted flag is set to one .
:LABEL: field

description: All CLNP options are " triplets " of the form < parameter code >  < parameter length >  and < parameter value >. Both the parameter code and length fields are always one octet long; the length parameter value   in octets   is indicated in the parameter length field . The following options are defined for CLNP for TUBA .
:LABEL: field

description: The following is a summary of the rules for processing an Error Report :
:LABEL: field

description: Table 5-1 provides a loose comparison of ICMP message types and codes to CLNP Error Type Codes ( values in Internet decimal ):
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: * Source Address ( including Reserved field )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 12 for Identification
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Identification sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 13 for Time-Remaining
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Time-Remaining sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Seconds-Remaining
description: The Seconds-Remaining field is four octets and indicates the number of integral seconds remaining in this session . This 32 bit
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: This field is one octet   and is comprised of the " logical or " of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum
description: This field specifies the largest number of padding octets which may be added to the frame . The value may range from 1 to 255   but values of 2   4   or 8 are most likely .
:LABEL: field

name: Operation
description: The Operation field is one octet and indicates the contents of the Message field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name Protocol function __________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Discover/maintain neighbors 2 Database Description Summarize database contents 3 Link State Request Database download 4 Link State Update Database update 5 Link State Ack Flooding acknowledgment
:LABEL: field

name: AuType
description: AuType and Authentication Each OSPF packet exchange is authenticated . Authentication types are assigned by the protocol and documented in Appendix D . A different authentication scheme can be used for each OSPF area . The 64-bit authentication field is set by the appropriate authentication procedure ( determined by AuType ). This procedure should be the last called when
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( transmit ) _________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 9.5 2 Database description Section 10.8 3 Link state request Section 10.9 4 Link state update Section 13.3 5 Link state ack Section 13.5
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( receive ) ________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 10.5 2 Database description Section 10.6 3 Link state request Section 10.7 4 Link state update Section 13 5 Link state ack Section 13.7
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Packets   with the initialize ( I )  more ( M ) and master ( MS ) bits set . This Database Description Packet should be otherwise empty . This Database Description Packet should be retransmitted at intervals of RxmtInterval until the next state is entered ( see Section 10.8 ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Packets   with the initialize ( I )  more ( M ) and master ( MS ) bits set . This Database Description Packet should be otherwise empty . This Database Description Packet should be retransmitted at intervals of RxmtInterval until the next state is entered ( see Section 10.8 ).
:LABEL: field

name: MS
description: Packets   with the initialize ( I )  more ( M ) and master ( MS ) bits set . This Database Description Packet should be otherwise empty . This Database Description Packet should be retransmitted at intervals of RxmtInterval until the next state is entered ( see Section 10.8 ).
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: LS age
description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds . It should be processed as an unsigned 16-bit integer . It is set to 0 when the link state advertisement is originated . It must be incremented by InfTransDelay on every hop of the flooding procedure . Link state advertisements are also aged as they are held in each router's database .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: The Options field in the link state advertisement header indicates which optional capabilities are associated with the advertisement . OSPF's optional capabilities are described in Section 4.5 . There are currently two optional capabilities defined; they are represented by the T-bit and E-bit found in the Options field . The rest of the Options field should be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: LS type
description: The LS type field dictates the format and function of the link state advertisement . Advertisements of different types have different names ( e.g .  router links or network links ). All advertisement types   except the AS external link advertisements ( LS type = 5 )  are flooded throughout a single area only . AS external link advertisements are flooded throughout the entire Autonomous System   excepting stub areas ( see Section 3.6 ). Each separate advertisement type is briefly described below in Table 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Link State ID
description: This field identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement . Depending on the advertisement's LS type   the Link State ID takes on the values listed in Table 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertising Router
description: This field specifies the OSPF Router ID of the advertisement's originator . For router links advertisements   this field is identical to the Link State ID field . Network link advertisements are originated by the network's Designated Router . Summary link advertisements are originated by area border routers . AS external link advertisements are originated by AS boundary routers .
:LABEL: field

name: LS sequence number
description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer . It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: LS checksum
description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement   excepting the LS age field . The LS age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum . The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum . It is documented in Annex B of [ RFC 905 ]. The link state advertisement header also contains the length of the advertisement in bytes; subtracting the size of the LS age field ( two bytes ) yields the amount of data to checksum .
:LABEL: field

description: The stub networks are added to the tree in the procedure's second stage . In this stage   all router vertices are again examined . Those that have been determined to be unreachable in the above first phase are discarded . For each reachable router vertex ( call it V )  the associated router links advertisement is found in the link state database . Each stub network link appearing in the advertisement is then examined   and the following steps are executed :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description ________________________________ 1 Hello 2 Database Description 3 Link State Request 4 Link State Update 5 Link State Acknowledgment
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description __________________________________________________ 1 Point-to-point connection to another router 2 Connection to a transit network 3 Connection to a stub network 4 Virtual link
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Link ID ______________________________________ 1 Neighboring router's Router ID 2 IP address of Designated Router 3 IP network/subnet number 4 Neighboring router's Router ID
:LABEL: field

name: AuType
description: AuType Description ___________________________________________ 0 No authentication 1 Simple password All others Reserved for assignment by the IANA ( iana@ISI.EDU )
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The version number of the XOT protocol is encoded in the first two octets . The version number MUST be 0 . Other values of this field are reserved for future use . If a value other than 0 is received   then the TCP connection MUST be closed .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the X.25 packet is encoded in the second two octets . Values must be legal X.25 packet lengths . If the Length field has an illegal value   then the TCP connection MUST be closed .
:LABEL: field

name: Pads
description: Any PPP frame may have padding inserted in the " Optional Data Link Layer Padding " field . This number tells the receiving system how many pad octets to strip off .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: Up-to-date values of the MAC Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 4 ]. Current values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Control
description: On 802.4   802.5   and FDDI LANs   there are a few octets preceding the Destination MAC Address   one of which is protected by the FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination MAC Address
description: As defined by the IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: Source MAC Address
description: As defined by the IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame FCS
description: Mentioned primarily for clarity . The FCS used on the PPP link is separate from and unrelated to the LAN FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Spanning Tree Protocol
description: Up-to-date values of the Spanning-Tree-Protocol field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 4 ]. Current values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: LAN Segment Number
description: A 12-bit number identifying the LAN segment   as defined in the IEEE 802.1D Source Routing Specification .
:LABEL: field

name: LAN Segment Number
description: A 12-bit number identifying the LAN segment   as defined in the IEEE 802.1D Source Routing Specification .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: One of the values of the PDU MAC Type field ( previously described in the " Bridged LAN Traffic " section ) that this system is prepared to receive and service .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2 octets plus 1 additional octet for each protocol that will be actively supported . Most systems will only support a single spanning tree protocol   resulting in a length of 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the kind of LCP
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies . When a packet is received with an invalid Identifier field   the packet is silently discarded without affecting the automaton .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets   and indicates the length of the LCP packet   including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . The Length MUST NOT exceed the MRU of the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Configure-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the contents of the Options field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Ack .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Nak .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Configure-Request which caused this Configure-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Terminate-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 7 for Code-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Code-Reject sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 8 for Protocol-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Protocol-Reject sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Rejected-Protocol
description: The Rejected-Protocol field is two octets   and contains the PPP Protocol field of the packet which is being rejected .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 9 for Echo-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets   and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Discard-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Discard-Request sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets   and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet   and indicates the type of Configuration Option . Up-to-date values of the LCP Option Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 2 ]. This document concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this Configuration Option including the Type   Length and Data fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Receive-Unit
description: The Maximum-Receive-Unit field is two octets   and specifies the maximum number of octets in the Information and Padding fields . It does not include the framing   Protocol field   FCS   nor any transparency bits or bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: The Authentication-Protocol field is two octets   and indicates the authentication protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Protocol field values for that same authentication protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: The Quality-Protocol field is two octets   and indicates the link quality monitoring protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Protocol field values for that same monitoring protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets   and indicates a number which is very likely to be unique to one end of the link . A Magic-Number of zero is illegal and MUST always be Nak'd   if it is not Rejected outright .
:LABEL: field

name: ACCM
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: ACCM
description: The ACCM field is four octets   and indicates the set of control characters to be mapped . The map is sent most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: Window
description: A value between 1 and 127 . This indicates the number of frames the receiver will buffer   which is the maximum number that the sender should send without receiving an acknowledgement . If window < 8   then modulo 8 sequencing is used on the link . Otherwise   modulo 128 sequencing is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The GRE flags are encoded in the first two octets . Bit 0 is the most significant bit   bit 15 is the least significant bit . Bits 13 through 15 are reserved for the Version field . Bits 5 through 12 are reserved for future use and MUST be transmitted as zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Type
description: The Protocol Type field contains the protocol type of the payload packet . In general   the value will be the Ethernet protocol type field for the packet . Currently defined protocol types are listed below . Additional values may be defined in other documents .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: The Address Family field contains a two octet value which indicates the syntax and semantics of the Routing Information field . The values for this field and the corresponding syntax and semantics for Routing Information are defined in other documents .
:LABEL: field

name: SRE Offset
description: The SRE Offset field indicates the octet offset from the start of the Routing Information field to the first octet of the active entry in Source Route Entry to be examined .
:LABEL: field

name: SRE Length
description: The SRE Length field contains the number of octets in the SRE . If the SRE Length is 0   this indicates this is the last SRE in the Routing field .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination TA
description: Destination TA : 64 bits . The Destination Transport Address . The concatenation of the 24 bit IEEE assigned Ethernet address and the 40 bit representation of the machines serial number for the remote node .
:LABEL: field

name: Source TA
description: Source TA : 64 Bits . The Source Transport Address . The concatenation of the 24 bit IEEE assigned Ethernet address and the 40 bit representation of the machines serial number for the local node .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port Number
description: Destination Port Number : 28 Bits . Identifies the specific application on the remote node .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port Number
description: Source Port Number : 28 Bits . Identifies the specific application on the local node .
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: QoS : 4 bits . The Quality of Service parameter may be set by the user application and passed down to a network layer that supports different levels of service .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : 64 Bits . The sequence number of the first data octet in this segment ( accept when the S bit is present ). If S bit is on   the sequence number is the initial sequence number ( ISN ) and the first data octet is ISN+1 . ( The ISN is computed using the existing algorithm ).
:LABEL: field

name: Acknowledgment Number
description: Acknowledgment Number : 64 Bits . If the A bit is set   this field contains the value of the next sequence number the sender of this segment is expecting to receive . Once a connection is established   this is always sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : 16 Bits . The checksum field has the same meaning as in the current version of TCP . The current 96 bit pseudo header is NOT used in calculating the checksum . The checksum covers only the information present in this header . The checksum field itself is set to zero for the calculation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 16 bits The type field identifies the particular option .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16 bits The length field represents the size of the option data to follow   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination TA
description: Destination TA : 64 bits . The Destination Transport Address . The concatenation of the 24 bit IEEE assigned Ethernet address and the 40 bit representation of the machines serial number for the remote node .
:LABEL: field

name: Source TA
description: Source TA : 64 Bits . The Source Transport Address . The concatenation of the 24 bit IEEE assigned Ethernet address and the 40 bit representation of the machines serial number for the local node .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port Number
description: Destination Port Number : 28 Bits . Identifies the specific application on the remote node .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port Number
description: Source Port Number : 28 Bits . Identifies the specific application on the local node .
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: QoS : 4 bits . The Quality of Service parameter may be set by the user application and passed down to a network layer that supports different levels of service .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16 bits The length parameter represents the length of the data area in octets . This value will be set to zero if no data is sent within this packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : 16 bits The checksum parameter has the same meaning as in the current version of UDP . The current 96 bit pseudo header is NOT used in calculating the checksum . The checksum covers only the information present in this header . The checksum field itself is set to zero for the calculation .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version 4-bit Internet Protocol version number = 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Label
description: Flow Label 28-bit field . See SIPP Quality of Service section .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: Payload Length 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of payload   i.e .  the rest of the packet following the SIPP header   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: Payload Type 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the SIPP header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ STD 2   RFC 1700 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . Decremented by 1 by each node that forwards the packet . The packet is discarded if Hop Limit is decremented to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Source Address 64 bits . An address of the initial sender of the packet . See [ ROUT ] for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: Destination Address 64 bits . An address of the intended recipient of the packet ( possibly not the ultimate recipient   if an optional Routing Header is present ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( Reserved ) 1-bit subfield . Initialized to zero for transmission; Ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: DP
description: DP ( Drop Priority ) 3-bit unsigned integer . Specifies the priority of the packet   relative to other packets from the same source   for being discarded by a router under conditions of congestion . Larger values indicates a greater willingness by the sender to allow the packet to be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow ID
description: Flow ID 24-bit subfield used to identify a specific flow .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: * Version - Internet Protocol version number . IPng has been assigned version number 6 . ( 4-bit field )
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Label
description: * Flow Label - This field may be used by a host to label those packets for which it is requesting special handling by routers within a network   such as non-default quality of service or " real - time " service . ( 28-bit field )
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: * Payload Length - Length of the remainder of the packet following the IPv6 header   in octets . To permit payloads of greater than 64K bytes   if the value in this field is 0 the actual packet length will be found in an Hop-by-Hop option . ( 16-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - Identifies the type of header immediately following the IPv6 header . The Next Header field uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field ( 8-bit selector field )
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: * Hop Limit - Used to limit the impact of routing loops . The Hop Limit field is decremented by 1 by each node that forwards the packet . The packet is discarded if Hop Limit is decremented to zero . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: * Source Address - An address of the initial sender of the packet . ( 128 bit field )
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: * Destination Address - An address of the intended recipient of the packet ( possibly not the ultimate recipient   if an optional Routing Header is present ). ( 128 bit field )
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - Identifies the type of header immediately following the Hop-by-Hop Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field . ( 8-bit selector )
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: * Hdr Ext Len - Length of the Hop-by-Hop Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: * Options - Contains one or more TLV-encoded options . ( Variable - length field   of length such that the complete Hop-by-Hop Options header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long .)
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: * Opt Data Len - Length of the Option Data field of this option   in octets . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: * Opt Data Len - Length of the Option Data field of this option   in octets . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: The Option Type identifiers are internally encoded such that their highest-order two bits specify the action that must be taken if the processing IPv6 node does not recognize the Option Type :
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - Identifies the type of header immediately following the Routing Header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field . ( 8-bit selector )
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Type
description: * Routing Type - Indicates the type of routing supported by this header . Value must be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: * Reserved - Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: SrcRouteLen
description: * SrcRouteLen - Source Route Length - Number of source route elements/hops in the SDRP Routing header . Length of SDRP routing header can be calculated from this value ( length = SrcRouteLen * 16 + 8 ) This field may not exceed a value of 24 . ( 8 bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: NextHopPtr
description: * NextHopPtr - Next Hop Pointer - Index of next element/hop to be processed; initialized to 0 to point to first element/hop in the source route . When Next Hop Pointer is equal to Source Route Length then the Source Route is completed . ( 8 bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Source Route
description: * Source Route - A list of IPv6 addresses indicating the path that this packet should follow . A Source Route can contain an arbitrary intermix of unicast and cluster addresses . ( integral multiple of 128 bits )
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - Identifies the type of header immediately following the Fragment header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field . ( 8 bit selector )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: * Reserved   Res - Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: * Reserved   Res - Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: * Fragment Offset - The offset   in 8-octet units   of the following payload   relative to the start of the original   unfragmented payload . ( 13-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: * Identification - A value assigned to the original payload that is different than that of any other fragmented payload sent recently with the same IPv6 Source Address   IPv6 Destination Address   and Fragment Next Header value . ( If a Routing header is present   the IPv6 Destination Address is that of the final destination .) The Identification value is carried in the Fragment header of all of the original payload's fragments   and is used by the destination to identify all fragments belonging to the same original payload . ( 32 bit field )
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - Identifies the type of header immediately following the Authentication header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field . ( 8-bit selector )
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Data Len
description: * Auth Data Len - Length of the Authentication Data field in 8 - octet units . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: * Reserved - Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: * Authentication Data - Algorithm-specific information required to authenticate the source of the packet and assure its integrity   as specified for the pre-established security association . ( Variable-length field   an integer multiple of 8 octets long .)
:LABEL: field

name: Initialization Vector
description: * Initialization Vector - This field is optional and its value depends on the SAID in use . For example   the field may contain cryptographic synchronization data for a block oriented encryption algorithm . It may also be used to contain a cryptographic initialization vector . A Privacy Header implementation will normally use the SAID value to determine whether this field is present and   if it is   the field's size and use . ( presence and length dependent on SAID )
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: * Next Header - encrypted - Identifies the type of header immediately following the Privacy header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field . ( 8 bit selector )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: * Length - encrypted - Length of the Privacy Header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets . ( 8-bit unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Original Length
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing the length in octets of the captured packet as received via a network .
:LABEL: field

name: Included Length
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing the length of the Packet Data field . This is the number of octets of the captured packet that are included in this packet record . If the received packet was truncated   the Included Length field will be less than the Original Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Record Length
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing the total length of this packet record in octets . This includes the 24 octets of descriptive information   the length of the Packet Data field   and the length of the Pad field .
:LABEL: field

name: Cumulative Drops
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing the number of packets that were lost by the system that created the packet file between the first packet record in the file and this one . Packets may be lost because of insufficient resources in the capturing system   or for other reasons . Note : some implementations lack the ability to count dropped packets . Those implementations may set the cumulative drops value to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp Seconds
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing the time   in seconds since January 1   1970   when the packet arrived .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp Microseconds
description: 32-bit unsigned integer representing microsecond resolution of packet arrival time .
:LABEL: field

name: Length LSB
description: Least significant byte of length field
:LABEL: field

name: DATA
description: DNA Phase IV Routing data   as specified in [ 2 ]
:LABEL: field

name: LI
description: Leap Indicator ( LI ): This is a two-bit code warning of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day   with bit 0 and bit 1   respectively   coded as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: VN
