description: Version Number ( VN ): This is a three-bit integer indicating the NTP version number   currently 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : This is a three-bit integer indicating the mode   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum : This is a eight-bit unsigned integer indicating the stratum level of the local clock   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision : This is an eight-bit signed integer indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two . The values that normally appear in this field range from - 6 for mains-frequency clocks to - 20 for microsecond clocks found in some workstations .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay : This is a 32-bit signed fixed-point number indicating the total roundtrip delay to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . Note that this variable can take on both positive and negative values   depending on the relative time and frequency offsets . The values that normally appear in this field range from negative values of a few milliseconds to positive values of several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion : This is a 32-bit unsigned fixed-point number indicating the nominal error relative to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . The values that normally appear in this field range from 0 to several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 37
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP Checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier If Code is zero   a value to aid in matching requests and replies . For example   it might be used like a port in TCP or UDP to identify a session . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number If Code is zero   a value to aid in matching requests and replies . For example   the number might be incremented on each request sent . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 38
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP Checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier Copied from the request .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Time-To-Live The number of seconds that the name may be cached . For historic reasons   this value is a signed 2s - complement number .
:LABEL: field

name: Time-To-Live
description: Time-To-Live The number of seconds that the name may be cached . For historic reasons   this value is a signed 2s - complement number .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o Create a stream from A to the peers at B   C and D
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o HelloTimer represents the time in millisecond since the agent was restarted   modulo the precision of the field . It is used to detect duplicate or delayed HELLO messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Data
description: The size of this field is variable .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: This field indicates the size of the Padding field . It does not include the Pad Length and Payload Type fields . The value typically ranges from 0 to 7   but may be up to 255 to permit hiding of the actual data length .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: This field indicates the contents of the Payload Data field   using the IP Protocol/Payload value . Up-to-date values of the IP Protocol/Payload are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " [ RFC-1700 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Type
description: Protocol Type Function
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: This PPP-specified field is one octet and contains the binary sequence 11111111 ( hexadecimal 0xFF )  the All-Stations address . PPP does not assign individual station addresses . The All-Stations address must be recognized and received by all devices . For more information on this field   refer to " The Point-to-Point Protocol ( PPP ) for the Transmission of Multi-protocol Datagrams over Point - to-Point Links ." ( References   [ 1 ])
:LABEL: field

name: Control
description: This PPP-specified field is one octet and contains the binary sequence 00000011 ( hexadecimal 0x03 )  the Unnumbered Information ( UI ) command with the P/F bit set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol-Type
description: The Protocol-Type field is two octets and contains the IETF-assigned protocol type value . Valid LAN extension interface protocol type values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of LCP packet that the LAN extension interface packet is sending . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and contains a randomly generated value . The value aids matching requests and replies . It is recommended that a non-zero value be used for the identifier . That is   zero could be used in the future for unsolicited messages from the LAN extension interface unit . Valid values are 0x01-0xFF .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the entire packet in octets   including the Code   Identifier   Length   and startup options fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: The Option-Type field is one octet and identifies the startup option being negotiated . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Length
description: The Option-Length field is one octet and specifies the length of the startup option fields   including the Option-Type   Option-Data   and Option-Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Data
description: The Option-Data field contains the data relating to the value specified in the Option-Type field . That is   if the Option-Type field specifies MAC type ( 0x01 )  then the Option-Data field contains the MAC type ( Ethernet   Token Ring   and so on ). If the Option-Type field specifies MAC address ( 0x03 )  then the Option-Data field contains the actual MAC address . If the Option-Type field specifies LAN Extension ( 0x05 )  then the Option-Data field contains LAN extension interface software information . The following table defines the contents of the Option-Data field for each possible Option-Type field value :
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: This PPP-specified field is a single octet and contains the binary sequence 11111111 ( hexadecimal 0xFF )  the All-Stations address . PPP does not assign individual station addresses . The All-Stations address must be recognized and received by all devices . For more information on this field   refer to " The Point-to-Point Protocol ( PPP ) for the Transmission of Multi-protocol Datagrams over Point - to-Point Links ." ( References   [ 1 ])
:LABEL: field

name: Control
description: This PPP-specified field is a single octet and contains the binary sequence 00000011 ( hexadecimal 0x03 )  the Unnumbered Information ( UI ) command with the P/F bit set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol-Type
description: The Protocol-Type field is two octets and contains the IETF-assigned protocol type value . Valid LAN extension interface protocol type values follow :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of PPP-LEX packet . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and contains a randomly generated value . The value aids matching requests and replies . It is recommended that a non-zero value be used for the identifier . That is   zero could be used in the future for unsolicited messages from the LAN extension interface unit . Valid values are 0x01-0xFF .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length in octets of the entire packet   including the Code   Identifier   Length   and remote command options fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: The Option-Type field is one octet and identifies the remote command option being transmitted . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Flags
description: This field is one octet and further specifies the remote command option   containing specific actions that must be followed .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Length
description: The Option-Length field is two octets and specifies the length in octets of the remote command option fields   including the Option - Type   Option-Flags   Option-Length   and Option-Data fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Data
description: Option-Data field contains data relating to the remote command option specified in the Option-Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Type
description: The Protocol Type field contains a 16-bit number that is any Ethernet type code . See the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC for the correct Ethernet type code .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Flags
description: Option-Flags None Option-Length 4 octets Option-Data None
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: Option-Type 0x08 ( Download Request ) Option-Flags None Option-Length The same value as that sent by the LEX_RCMD_REQUEST packet Option-Data Block Number   File Size   and Filename of the code/image to be downloaded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier The same value as that sent by LEX_RCMD_REQUEST packet Length 34 octets Option-Type 0x0B ( Inventory Request ) Option-Flags None Option-Length 26 octets Option-Data Inventory data . See the following " Option-Data Field Descriptions " section for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Flash Size
description: This field contains the LAN extension interface unit's Flash size in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Serial Number
description: This field provides the LAN extension interface unit's serial number . This is an unassigned   32-bit number .
:LABEL: field

name: HW Version
description: This field contains the version number of the LAN extension interface hardware unit .
:LABEL: field

name: PROM Major Ver
description: This field contains part of the version number of the PROM image . " Major " indicates which major software release this revision belongs to . For example   if the PROM version number is 1.2   then the major version number is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: PROM Minor Ver
description: This field contains part of the version number of the PROM image . " Minor " indicates which minor software release this revision belongs to . For example   if the PROM version number is 1.2   then the minor version number is 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flash Major Ver
description: This field contains the " major " version number of the Flash image . For example   if the Flash image version number is 1.2   then the major version number is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flash Minor Ver
description: This field contains the " minor " version number of the Flash image . For example   if the Flash image version number is 1.2   then the minor version number is 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: FLAGS
description: FLAGS report the boot status of the LAN extension interface unit . The flags are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: RAM Major Ver
description: This field contains the " major " version number of the running image in RAM . For example   if the RAM image version number is 1.2   then the major version number is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: RAM Minor Ver
description: This field contains the " minor " version number of the running image in RAM . For example   if the RAM image version number is 1.2   then the minor version number is 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: HDLC FLAG
description: HDLC FLAG
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: * F : Set bit F if the LAN FCS field is present . Because PPP-LEX data packets do not contain the LAN FCS field   this bit should not be set ( field=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Z
description: * F : Set bit F if the LAN FCS field is present . Because PPP-LEX data packets do not contain the LAN FCS field   this bit should not be set ( field=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: * F : Set bit F if the LAN FCS field is present . Because PPP-LEX data packets do not contain the LAN FCS field   this bit should not be set ( field=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: * I : Set bit I if the LAN ID field is present . Because PPP-LEX data packets do not contain the field   this bit should not be set ( field=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Z
description: * Z : Set bit Z if IEEE 802.3 Pad must be zero filled to minimum size .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad
description: Any PPP frame may have padding inserted in the Optional Data Link Layer Padding field . The value tells the receiving system how many pad octets to strip off . The LAN extension interface protocol does not support the Optional Data Link Layer Padding field   so the value of this field should be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination MAC Address
description: This field is 6 octets and contains the MAC address of the destination system as defined by IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: Source MAC Address
description: This field is 6 octets and contains the MAC address of the destination system as defined by IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: LLC Data
description: This field is the remainder of the MAC frame which is ( or would be if it were present ) protected by the LAN FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Data
description: The size of this field is variable .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: This field indicates the size of the Padding field . It does not include the Pad Length and Payload Type fields . The value typically ranges from 0 to 7   but may be up to 255 to permit hiding of the actual data length .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: This field indicates the contents of the Payload Data field   using the IP Protocol/Payload value . Up-to-date values of the IP Protocol/Payload are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " [ RFC-1700 ].
:LABEL: field

name: vrsn
description: vrsn 8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: packet length
description: packet length 16 bits ( min=7   max=65535 )
:LABEL: field

name: Primary-DNS-Address
description: The four octet Primary-DNS-Address is the address of the primary DNS server to be used by the local peer . If all four octets are set to zero   it indicates an explicit request that the peer provide the address information in a Config-Nak packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Primary-NBNS-Address
description: The four octet Primary-NBNS-Address is the address of the primary NBNS server to be used by the local peer . If all four octets are set to zero   it indicates an explicit request that the peer
:LABEL: field

name: Secondary-DNS-Address
description: The four octet Secondary-DNS-Address is the address of the primary NBNS server to be used by the local peer . If all four octets are set to zero   it indicates an explicit request that the peer provide the address information in a Config-Nak packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Secondary-NBNS-Address
description: The four octet Secondary-NBNS-Address is the address of the secondary NBNS server to be used by the local peer . If all four octets are set to zero   it indicates an explicit request that the peer provide the address information in a Config-Nak packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Changes in the way IP header options are encoded allows for more efficient forwarding   less stringent limits on the length of options   and greater flexibility for introducing new options in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version 4-bit Internet Protocol version number = 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prio .
description: Prio . 4-bit priority value . See section 7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Label
description: Flow Label 24-bit flow label . See section 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: Payload Length 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of payload   i.e .  the rest of the packet following the IPv6 header   in octets . If zero   indicates that the payload length is carried in a Jumbo Payload hop-by-hop option .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the IPv6 header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . Decremented by 1 by each node that forwards the packet . The packet is discarded if Hop Limit is decremented to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Source Address 128-bit address of the originator of the packet . See [ RFC-1884 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: Destination Address 128-bit address of the intended recipient of the packet ( possibly not the ultimate recipient   if a Routing header is present ). See [ RFC-1884 ] and section 4.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type 8-bit identifier of the type of option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: Opt Data Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Option Data field of this option   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: Option Data Variable-length field . Option-Type-specific data .
:LABEL: field

description: Individual options may have specific alignment requirements   to ensure that multi-octet values within Option Data fields fall on natural boundaries . The alignment requirement of an option is specified using the notation xn+y   meaning the Option Type must appear at an integer multiple of x octets from the start of the header   plus y octets . For example :
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Hop-by-Hop Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Hop-by-Hop Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options Variable-length field   of length such that the complete Hop-by-Hop Options header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long . Contains one or more TLV-encoded options   as described in section 4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Routing header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Routing header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Type
description: Routing Type 8-bit identifier of a particular Routing header variant .
:LABEL: field

name: Segments Left
description: Segments Left 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination .
:LABEL: field

name: type-specific data
description: type-specific data Variable-length field   of format determined by the Routing Type   and of length such that the complete Routing header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Routing header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Routing header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets . For the Type 0 Routing header   Hdr Ext Len is equal to two times the number of addresses in the header   and must be an even number less than or equal to 46 .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Type
description: Segments Left 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination . Maximum legal value = 23 .
:LABEL: field

name: Segments Left
description: Segments Left 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination . Maximum legal value = 23 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 8-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the initial header type of the Fragmentable Part of the original packet ( defined below ). Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 8-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: Fragment Offset 13-bit unsigned integer . The offset   in 8-octet units   of the data following this header   relative to the start of the Fragmentable Part of the original packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res 2-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification 32 bits . See description below .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Destination Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC-1700 et seq .].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Destination Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options Variable-length field   of length such that the complete Destination Options header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long . Contains one or more TLV-encoded options   as described in section 4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused This field is unused for all code values . It must be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver . Description
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 2
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU The Maximum Transmission Unit of the next-hop link .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused This field is unused for all code values . It must be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4
:LABEL: field

name: Pointer
description: Pointer Identifies the octet offset within the invoking packet where the error was detected .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 128
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier An identifier to aid in matching Echo Replies to this Echo Request . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: A sequence number to aid in matching Echo Replies to this Echo Request . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 129
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier The identifier from the invoking Echo Request message .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Response Delay
description: In Query messages   the maximum time that responding Report messages may be delayed   in milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused Initialized to zero by the sender; ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Address
description: The address of the multicast group about which the message is being sent . In Query messages   the Multicast Address field may be zero   implying a query for all groups .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: Synchronization source ( SSRC ): The source of a stream of RTP packets   identified by a 32-bit numeric SSRC identifier carried in the RTP header so as not to be dependent upon the network address . All packets from a synchronization source form part of the same timing and sequence number space   so a receiver groups packets by synchronization source for playback . Examples of synchronization sources include the sender of a stream of packets derived from a signal source such as a microphone or a camera   or an RTP mixer ( see below ). A synchronization source may change its data format   e.g .  audio encoding   over time . The SSRC identifier is a randomly chosen value meant to be globally unique within a particular RTP session ( see Section 8 ). A participant need not use the same SSRC identifier for all the RTP sessions in a multimedia session; the binding of the SSRC identifiers is provided through RTCP ( see Section 6.4.1 ). If a participant generates multiple streams in one RTP session   for example from separate video cameras   each must be identified as a different SSRC .
:LABEL: field

name: CSRC
description: Contributing source ( CSRC ): A source of a stream of RTP packets that has contributed to the combined stream produced by an RTP mixer ( see below ). The mixer inserts a list of the SSRC identifiers of the sources that contributed to the generation of a particular packet into the RTP header of that packet . This list is called the CSRC list . An example application is audio conferencing where a mixer indicates all the talkers whose speech was combined to produce the outgoing packet   allowing the receiver to indicate the current talker   even though all the audio packets contain the same SSRC identifier ( that of the mixer ).
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V ): 2 bits This field identifies the version of RTP . The version defined by this specification is two ( 2 ). ( The value 1 is used by the first draft version of RTP and the value 0 is used by the protocol initially implemented in the " vat " audio tool .)
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: padding ( P ): 1 bit If the padding bit is set   the packet contains one or more additional padding octets at the end which are not part of the
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: extension ( X ): 1 bit If the extension bit is set   the fixed header is followed by exactly one header extension   with a format defined in Section 5.3.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: CC
description: CSRC count ( CC ): 4 bits The CSRC count contains the number of CSRC identifiers that follow the fixed header .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: marker ( M ): 1 bit The interpretation of the marker is defined by a profile . It is intended to allow significant events such as frame boundaries to be marked in the packet stream . A profile may define additional marker bits or specify that there is no marker bit by changing the number of bits in the payload type field ( see Section 5.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: payload type ( PT ): 7 bits This field identifies the format of the RTP payload and determines its interpretation by the application . A profile specifies a default static mapping of payload type codes to payload formats . Additional payload type codes may be defined dynamically through non-RTP means ( see Section 3 ). An initial set of default mappings for audio and video is specified in the companion profile Internet-Draft draft-ietf-avt-profile   and may be extended in future editions of the Assigned Numbers RFC [ 6 ]. An RTP sender emits a single RTP payload type at any given time; this field is not intended for multiplexing separate media streams ( see Section 5.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: sequence number
description: sequence number : 16 bits The sequence number increments by one for each RTP data packet sent   and may be used by the receiver to detect packet loss and to restore packet sequence . The initial value of the sequence number is random ( unpredictable ) to make known-plaintext attacks on encryption more difficult   even if the source itself does not encrypt   because the packets may flow through a translator that does . Techniques for choosing unpredictable numbers are discussed in [ 7 ].
:LABEL: field

name: timestamp
description: timestamp : 32 bits The timestamp reflects the sampling instant of the first octet in the RTP data packet . The sampling instant must be derived
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: SSRC : 32 bits The SSRC field identifies the synchronization source . This identifier is chosen randomly   with the intent that no two synchronization sources within the same RTP session will have the same SSRC identifier . An example algorithm for generating a random identifier is presented in Appendix A.6 . Although the probability of multiple sources choosing the same identifier is low   all RTP implementations must be prepared to detect and resolve collisions . Section 8 describes the probability of collision along with a mechanism for resolving collisions and detecting RTP-level forwarding loops based on the uniqueness of the SSRC identifier . If a source changes its source transport address   it must also choose a new SSRC identifier to avoid being interpreted as a looped source .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V ): 2 bits Identifies the version of RTP   which is the same in RTCP packets as in RTP data packets . The version defined by this specification is two ( 2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: padding ( P ): 1 bit If the padding bit is set   this RTCP packet contains some additional padding octets at the end which are not part of the control information . The last octet of the padding is a count of how many padding octets should be ignored . Padding may be needed by some encryption algorithms with fixed block sizes . In a compound RTCP packet   padding should only be required on the last individual packet because the compound packet is encrypted as a whole .
:LABEL: field

name: RC
description: reception report count ( RC ): 5 bits The number of reception report blocks contained in this packet . A value of zero is valid .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: packet type ( PT ): 8 bits Contains the constant 200 to identify this as an RTCP SR packet .
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: length : 16 bits The length of this RTCP packet in 32-bit words minus one   including the header and any padding . ( The offset of one makes zero a valid length and avoids a possible infinite loop in scanning a compound RTCP packet   while counting 32-bit words avoids a validity check for a multiple of 4 .)
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: SSRC : 32 bits The synchronization source identifier for the originator of this SR packet .
:LABEL: field

name: RTP timestamp
description: RTP timestamp : 32 bits Corresponds to the same time as the NTP timestamp ( above )  but in the same units and with the same random offset as the RTP timestamps in data packets . This correspondence may be used for intra - and inter-media synchronization for sources whose NTP timestamps are synchronized   and may be used by media - independent receivers to estimate the nominal RTP clock frequency . Note that in most cases this timestamp will not be equal to the RTP timestamp in any adjacent data packet . Rather   it is calculated from the corresponding NTP timestamp using the relationship between the RTP timestamp counter and real time as maintained by periodically checking the wallclock time at a sampling instant .
:LABEL: field

name: sender's packet count
description: sender's packet count : 32 bits The total number of RTP data packets transmitted by the sender since starting transmission up until the time this SR packet was generated . The count is reset if the sender changes its SSRC identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: sender's octet count
description: sender's octet count : 32 bits The total number of payload octets ( i.e .  not including header or padding ) transmitted in RTP data packets by the sender since starting transmission up until the time this SR packet was generated . The count is reset if the sender changes its SSRC identifier . This field can be used to estimate the average payload data rate .
:LABEL: field

name: fraction lost
description: fraction lost : 8 bits The fraction of RTP data packets from source SSRC_n lost since the previous SR or RR packet was sent   expressed as a fixed
:LABEL: field

name: cumulative number of packets lost
description: cumulative number of packets lost : 24 bits The total number of RTP data packets from source SSRC_n that have been lost since the beginning of reception . This number is defined to be the number of packets expected less the number of packets actually received   where the number of packets received includes any which are late or duplicates . Thus packets that arrive late are not counted as lost   and the loss may be negative if there are duplicates . The number of packets expected is defined to be the extended last sequence number received   as defined next   less the initial sequence number received . This may be calculated as shown in Appendix A.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: extended highest sequence number received
description: extended highest sequence number received : 32 bits The low 16 bits contain the highest sequence number received in an RTP data packet from source SSRC_n   and the most significant 16 bits extend that sequence number with the corresponding count of sequence number cycles   which may be maintained according to the algorithm in Appendix A.1 . Note that different receivers within the same session will generate different extensions to the sequence number if their start times differ significantly .
:LABEL: field

name: interarrival jitter
description: interarrival jitter : 32 bits An estimate of the statistical variance of the RTP data packet interarrival time   measured in timestamp units and expressed as an unsigned integer . The interarrival jitter J is defined to be the mean deviation ( smoothed absolute value ) of the difference D in packet spacing at the receiver compared to the sender for a pair of packets . As shown in the equation below   this is equivalent to the difference in the " relative transit time " for the two packets; the relative transit time is the difference between a packet's RTP timestamp and the receiver's clock at the time of arrival   measured in the same units .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: packet type ( PT ): 8 bits Contains the constant 202 to identify this as an RTCP SDES packet .
:LABEL: field

name: SC
description: source count ( SC ): 5 bits The number of SSRC/CSRC chunks contained in this SDES packet . A value of zero is valid but useless .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: packet type ( PT ): 8 bits Contains the constant 203 to identify this as an RTCP BYE packet .
:LABEL: field

name: SC
description: source count ( SC ): 5 bits The number of SSRC/CSRC identifiers included in this BYE packet . A count value of zero is valid   but useless .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: version ( V )  padding ( P )  length : As described for the SR packet ( see Section 6.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: subtype
description: subtype : 5 bits May be used as a subtype to allow a set of APP packets to be defined under one unique name   or for any application-dependent data .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: packet type ( PT ): 8 bits Contains the constant 204 to identify this as an RTCP APP packet .
:LABEL: field

name: name
description: name : 4 octets A name chosen by the person defining the set of APP packets to be unique with respect to other APP packets this application might receive . The application creator might choose to use the application name   and then coordinate the allocation of subtype values to others who want to define new packet types for the application . Alternatively   it is recommended that others choose a name based on the entity they represent   then coordinate the use of the name within that entity . The name is interpreted as a sequence of four ASCII characters   with uppercase and lowercase characters treated as distinct .
:LABEL: field

description: [ 1 ] If set an add lock occured last timeout period so triple the timeout value ( to a max of 81 minutes ).
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] Calculate number of channels to remove ( difference between number in use and number in desired ).
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] Request the number of channels required . If greater than the number available after removing the number of channels indicated in the incoming message reduce the number of channels to remove and set a remove lock .
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] Calculate number of channels to add ( difference between number desired and number in use ).
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] If the number of channels requested will put us over the maximum number of channels allowed for the session reduce the channel count .
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] If the number of channels requested will put us over the maximum number of channels allowed for the session reduce the channel count .
:LABEL: field

description: [ 2 ] If current bandwidth less than suggested band - width and removes are not locked   store the requested bandwidth and initiate a remove trans - action ( Enter Remove Action ).
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A Initial state B Sent version request   waiting for version response . C Waiting for version request .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A Add request sent to answerer   waiting for add response from the answerer . B Caller waiting for call complete notification for calls placed . C Answerer waiting for add complete message from caller .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A Remove request sent   waiting for remove response B Remove response sent   waiting for remove complete
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A Waiting for call complete after session down notification B Waiting for call complete after session terminate notification . C Waiting for close response after session close request sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Count
description: The Hop Count field carries the maximum number of routers an SDRP data packet may traverse . It is decremented by 1 as an SDRP data packet traverses a router which forwards the packet using SDRP forwarding . Once the Hop Count field reaches the value of 0   the router should discard the data packet and generate a control packet ( see Section 5.2.6 ). A router that receives a packet with a Hop Count value of 0 should discard the data packet   and generate a control packet ( see Section 5.2.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Source Route Identifier
description: The BR that originates the SDRP packet should insert a 32 bit value in this field which will serve as an identifier for the source route . This value needs to be unique only in the context of the originating BR .
:LABEL: field

name: Target Router
description: This field is meaningful only in control packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: The Prefix field contains an IP address prefix . Only the number of bits specified in the Prefix Length are significant . The Prefix field is used to prevent routing loops when using BGP or IDRP to route to the next AS in a loose source route ( see Section 4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Source Route Change
description: Loose/Strict Source Route Change ( bit 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Type
description: Flow Type 0 is used to change the encapsulation of IPv4 packets from the default encapsulation .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Type
description: Flow Type 1 is designed for protocols such as UDP and TCP in which the first four octets after the IPv4 header specify a Source Port number and a Destination Port number .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Type
description: For Flow Type 2   Flow Type = 2 and Flow ID Length = 3 ( 32 bit words ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 14 for Reset-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MAY remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: This field is specific to each OUI   and indicates a compression type for that OUI . There is no standardization for this field . Each OUI implements its own values .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol ID
description: The PPP Protocol ID field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The optional Length field is present in every SDTP packet upon successful negotiation of the Length-Field-Present Configuration Option .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: The optional Port field is present in every SDTP packet upon successful negotiation of the Multi-Port Option .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: The format of the first octet of the Header field is shown below :
:LABEL: field

name: Transported Data
description: The transported data field contains the transported serial data .
:LABEL: field

name: Format
description: 0 Header-Last ( default ) 1 Header-First
:LABEL: field

name: Header-Type
description: This option selects the type of the Header field . The Header-Type of H-and-CS means that the CS octet will be present if indicated by the E-bit in the H-octet . The Header-Type of H-and-CS-Always signifies that both the H and CS octets are present in every packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Header-Type
description: 0 H-Only ( default ) 1 H-and-CS 2 H-and-CS-Always
:LABEL: field

name: Length-Size
description: 0 No Length Field ( default ) 1 Length field of 1 octet 2 Length field of 2 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Max-Port-Num
description: The maximum port number that can be used . The number of ports present is Max-Port-Num + 1 . The value can range from 0 to 254 .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: The port for which this option applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: The transport mode to be used for this port .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Frame-Size
description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of octets allowed in a transported data frame .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: The port for which this option applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Frame-Size
description: The maximum allowed length of a transported data frame in octets . Default is 10 000 . Negotiable range is 1 to 2**31 - 1 . The value 0 is reserved to mean no limit . This field is transmitted most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: The port for which this option applies .
:LABEL: field

name: FCS-Type
description: By default   the transported data frame FCS is transported . This option allows the FCS to be removed by the transmitter and regenerated by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: The port for which this option applies .
:LABEL: field

name: FCS-Type
description: 0 Transparent-Transport ( Default ) 1 16-bit ITU-T CRC 2 32-bit ITU-T CRC
:LABEL: field

name: Flow-Expiration-Time
description: As described in section 2.2   Flow-Off messages expire after T1 seconds . By default   T1 is 10 seconds . This configuration option allows the value of T1 to be changed .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow-Expiration-Time
description: The Flow-Expiration-Time field contains a 16 bit unsigned integer which is used to specify the value to be assigned to T1 as follows : T1 = Flow-Expiration-Time / 10 seconds . Therefore this value is in units of 1/10 of a second   with allowable values from 1 to 2^16-1 ( 0.1 to 6553.5 seconds ). It is transmitted most significant octet first . The default value is 100 ( 10 seconds )  which all must support .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: DCP-Header
description: The DCP-Header is nominally one octet in length   but may be extended through the use of the extension bit .
:LABEL: field

name: History Count
description: The History Count field is two octets   most significant octet first   and specifies the maximum number of Compression Histories .
:LABEL: field

name: Check Mode
description: The Check Mode indicates support of LCB and/or Sequence checking . The use of check mode None ( 0 ) MUST NOT be used for history counts greater than zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Process Mode
description: The Process Mode specifies how uncompressed packets are handled . A value of None ( 0 ) indicates that uncompressed packets are not processed by the decompressor . A value of Process-Uncompressed
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 14 for Reset-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier SHOULD remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: This field is specific to each OUI   and indicates an encryption type for that OUI . There is no standardisation for this field . Each OUI implements its own values .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 to 254   indicating the encryption protocol option being negotiated . DESE [ 6 ] is option type 1 . Refer to the latest Assigned Numbers RFC for other encryption protocols .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1   to indicate the DESE protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: These fields MUST be present unless the PPP Address and Control Field Compression option ( ACFC ) has been negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: Control
description: These fields MUST be present unless the PPP Address and Control Field Compression option ( ACFC ) has been negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: The value of this field is 0x53 or 0x55; the latter indicates that ciphertext includes headers for the Multilink Protocol   and REQUIRES that the Individual Link Encryption Control Protocol has reached the opened state . The leading zero MAY be absent if the PPP Protocol Field Compression option ( PFC ) has been negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: variable MTU - a link that does not have a well-defined MTU ( e.g .  IEEE 802.5 token rings ). Many links ( e.g .  Ethernet ) have a standard MTU defined by the link - layer protocol or by the specific document describing how to run IP over the link layer .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: variable MTU - Neighbor Discovery allows routers to specify a MTU for the link   which all nodes then use . All nodes on a link must use the same MTU ( or Maximum Receive Unit ) in order for multicast to work properly . Otherwise when multicasting a sender   which can not know which nodes will receive the packet   could not determine a minimum packet size all receivers can process .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 133
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 134
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Cur Hop Limit
description: Cur Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . The default value that should be placed in the Hop Count field of the IP header for outgoing IP packets . A value of zero means unspecified ( by this router ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M 1-bit " Managed address configuration " flag . When set   hosts use the administered ( stateful ) protocol for address autoconfiguration in addition to any addresses autoconfigured using stateless address autoconfiguration . The use of this flag is described in [ ADDRCONF ].
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O 1-bit " Other stateful configuration " flag . When set   hosts use the administered ( stateful ) protocol for autoconfiguration of other ( non-address ) information . The use of this flag is described in [ ADDRCONF ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved A 6-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Retrans Timer
description: Retrans Timer 32-bit unsigned integer . The time   in milliseconds   between retransmitted Neighbor Solicitation messages . Used by address resolution and the Neighbor Unreachability Detection algorithm ( see Sections 7.2 and 7.3 ). A value of zero means unspecified ( by this router ).
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU SHOULD be sent on links that have a variable MTU ( as specified in the document that describes how to run IP over the particular link type ). MAY be sent on other links .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 135
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 136
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Router flag . When set   the R-bit indicates that the sender is a router . The R-bit is used by Neighbor Unreachability Detection to detect a router that changes to a host .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Solicited flag . When set   the S-bit indicates that the advertisement was sent in response to a Neighbor Solicitation from the Destination address . The S-bit is used as a reachability confirmation for Neighbor Unreachability Detection . It MUST NOT be set in multicast advertisements or in unsolicited unicast advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O Override flag . When set   the O-bit indicates that the advertisement should override an existing cache entry and update the cached link-layer address . When it is not set the advertisement will not update a cached link-layer address though it will update an existing Neighbor Cache entry for which no link-layer address is known . It SHOULD NOT be set in solicited advertisements for anycast addresses and in solicited proxy advertisements . It SHOULD be set in other solicited advertisements and in unsolicited advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 29-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 137
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8-bit identifier of the type of option . The options defined in this document are :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option in units of 8 octets . The value 0 is invalid . Nodes MUST silently discard an ND packet that contains an option with length zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the option in units of 8 octets . For example   the length for IEEE 802 addresses is 1 [ IPv6-ETHER ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The number of leading bits in the Prefix that are valid . The value ranges from 0 to 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L 1-bit on-link flag . When set   indicates that this prefix can be used for on-link determination . When not set the advertisement makes no statement about on-link or off-link properties of the prefix . For instance   the prefix might be used for address configuration with some of the addresses belonging to the prefix being on-link and others being off-link .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A 1-bit autonomous address-configuration flag . When set indicates that this prefix can be used for autonomous address configuration as specified in [ ADDRCONF ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved1 6-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved2 This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix An IP address or a prefix of an IP address . The Prefix Length field contains the number of valid leading bits in the prefix . The bits in the prefix after the prefix length are reserved and MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver . A router SHOULD NOT send a prefix option for the link-local prefix and a host SHOULD ignore such a prefix option .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the option in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved These fields are unused . They MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 5
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 1
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU 32-bit unsigned integer . The recommended MTU for the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 14 for Reset-Request;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: On transmission   the Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Data field changes   and whenever a valid reply has
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: The Data field contains the two octet History Number of the compression history that is to be reset   most significant octet first . This History Number value is 1 when no history number is present .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is a 2 octet field described in the Point - to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: History Count
description: The History Count field is two octets   most significant octet first   and specifies the maximum number of Compression Histories .
:LABEL: field

name: Check Mode
description: The Check Mode field indicates support of LCB   CRC or Sequence checking   and other future extensions to this standard . This field comprises 2 sub-fields   and is considered to be bit-mapped . The 3 least significant bits comprise 5 mutually exclusive values . The upper 5 bits are all " Reserved " bit locations must be set to " 0 " to allow for future backward-compatible extensions to this standard .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Coherency Count
description: The coherency count is used to assure that the packets are sent in proper order and that no packet has been dropped . This count is initialized to the value 0x000   and is always increased by 1 after each PPP packet is sent . When all bits are 1   the count returns to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: When attempting to compress certain types of Packets or Fragments the compressor may not be effective . When this occurs the uncompressed data is added to the compression History Buffer and sent across the link in frame with the Compressed/Uncompressed Flag(C ) set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: CID
description: Since PPP will transport multiple protocol datagrams it may be advantageous to compress each protocol or each virtual circuit in a different History Buffer or Context . The CID allows the compressor to indicate to the decompressor which History Buffer the compressor decided to use for a given Packet . The basis of this decision is up to the implementor . The number of buffers and size of each buffer is negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: PIB
description: To ensure that Packets are being compressed and decompressed correctly and to ensure History Buffer synchronization is maintained   a Packet Integrity Byte is added to the packet header .
:LABEL: field

name: FE
description: FE - Features
:LABEL: field

name: History
description: Defines the size of the compression history buffer . Valid values are defined in the full protocol specification .
:LABEL: field

name: # Contexts
description: This is the number of contexts . Each context implies the creation of a History Buffer for that context of the size indicated in the Context History field . Values are 1-63 . This value includes both the Packet by Packet context and the number of contexts for which history is maintained . Therefore   when this value is 1 and the P ( Packet by Packet ) flag is also 1   then only in packet compression is supported and history context is not retained across packet boundaries . The Context Identifier ( CID ) starts with 1 for contexts where the history is maintained .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: When 1   packet by packet compression is enabled for the context whose context ID is 0 . When P is 0   packet by packet compression is not supported .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: 1 Mode-1 ( No Additional Negotiation ) 2 Mode-2 ( Full PPP Negotiation and State Machine )
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode-1 devices use LZS-DCP Compression Packets as specified in [ 4 ]. These packets include the capabilities of DCP : Reset-Request and Acknowledge   Compressed/Transparent   etc . Since the packets include signalling   these packets can be sent with an empty data field to signal a reset request if no data packets are ready for piggy-backed signalling .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence
description: The sequence number is sent most significant octet first . It starts at 0 when the dictionary is cleared   and is incremented by 1 after each packet   including uncompressed packets . The sequence number after 65535 is zero . In other words   the sequence number " wraps " in the usual way .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 21 or 0x15 for BSD compress .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers
description: Must be the binary number 001 .
:LABEL: field

name: Dict
description: The size in bits of the largest code used . It can range from 9 to 16 . A common choice is 12 . The code included below can support code sizes from 9 to 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence
description: The sequence number is sent most significant octet first . It starts at 0 when the dictionary is cleared   and is incremented by 1 for each packet   including uncompressed packets . The sequence number after 65535 is zero . In other words   the sequence number " wraps " in the usual way .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 26 for PPP Deflate .
:LABEL: field

name: Window
description: Represents the maximum window size the decompressor is willing to allocate; expressed as the base-2 logarithm of the LZ77 window size   minus 8 . ' Deflate ' compliant decompressors must be willing to accept the maximum 32KB window size   represented by a value of 7 . A ' deflate ' compliant compressor is at liberty to use a reduced window size   so a PPP Deflate compressor MUST either honor the restriction requested or reject the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Method
description: Must be the binary number 1000 . Represents the ' zlib ' Compression Method identifier of ' 8 ' for ' deflate ' compression with up to 32K window size .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: Must be all 0 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Chk
description: Must be 00 to specify sequence number check method .
:LABEL: field

name: Quality-Protocol
description: c025 ( hex ) for Link-Quality-Report
:LABEL: field

name: Reporting-Period
description: The Reporting-Period field is four octets and indicates the maximum time in hundredths of seconds between transmission of packets . The peer MAY transmit packets at a faster rate than that which was negotiated .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links which are in the looped-back condition . Unless modified by a Configuration Option   the Magic-Number MUST be transmitted as zero and MUST be ignored on reception . If Magic-Numbers have been negotiated   incoming LQR packets SHOULD be checked to ensure that the local end is not seeing its own Magic-Number and thus a looped-back link . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutLQRs
description: The LastOutLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutLQRs on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutPackets
description: The LastOutPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutPackets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: LastOutOctets
description: The LastOutOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received PeerOutOctets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInLQRs
description: The PeerInLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInLQRs on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInPackets
description: The PeerInPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInPackets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInDiscards
description: The PeerInDiscards field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInDiscards on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInErrors
description: The PeerInErrors field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInErrors on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerInOctets
description: The PeerInOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the most recently received SaveInOctets on transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutLQRs
description: The PeerOutLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from OutLQRs on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutPackets
description: The PeerOutPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifOutUniPackets and ifOutNUniPackets on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: PeerOutOctets
description: The PeerOutOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifOutOctets on transmission . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInLQRs
description: The SaveInLQRs field is four octets   and is copied from InLQRs on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInPackets
description: The SaveInPackets field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifInUniPackets and ifInNUniPackets on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInDiscards
description: The SaveInDiscards field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifInDiscards on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInErrors
description: The SaveInErrors field is four octets   and is copied from the current MIB ifInErrors on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: SaveInOctets
description: The SaveInOctets field is four octets   and is copied from the current InGoodOctets on reception . This number MUST include this LQR .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: One or two octets . The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: History
description: One octet . The History field specifies the maximum size of the compression history in powers of 2 . Valid values range from 12 to 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication-Protocol
description: c223 ( hex ) for Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Algorithm
description: The Algorithm field is one octet and indicates the authentication method to be used . Up-to-date values are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " [ 2 ]. One value is required to be implemented :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet and identifies the type of CHAP packet . CHAP Codes are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching challenges   responses and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the CHAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Challenge;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet . The Identifier field MUST be changed each time a Challenge is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Value-Size
description: This field is one octet and indicates the length of the Value field .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Success;
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching requests and replies . The Identifier field MUST be copied from the Identifier field of the Response which caused this reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: A router on a mobile node's home network which tunnels datagrams for delivery to the mobile node when it is away from home   and maintains current location information for the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Indicates the particular type of Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the data field within this Extension . The length does NOT include the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 6 + 4*N )  where N is the number of care-of addresses advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Registration required . Registration with this foreign agent ( or another foreign agent on this link ) is required rather than using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Busy . The foreign agent will not accept registrations from additional mobile nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Home agent . This agent offers service as a home agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F Foreign agent . This agent offers service as a foreign agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use minimal encapsulation [ 15 ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use GRE encapsulation [ 8 ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V Van Jacobson header compression . This agent supports use of Van Jacobson header compression [ 10 ] over the link with any registered mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 19 ( Prefix-Lengths Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length N   where N is the value of the Num Addrs field in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 ( Registration Request )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Simultaneous bindings . If the ' S ' bit is set   the mobile node is requesting that the home agent retain its prior mobility bindings   as described in Section 3.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Broadcast datagrams . If the ' B ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that the home agent tunnel to it any broadcast datagrams that it receives on the home network   as described in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D Decapsulation by mobile node . If the ' D ' bit is set   the mobile node will itself decapsulate datagrams which are sent to the care-of address . That is   the mobile node is using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . If the ' M ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use minimal encapsulation [ 15 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . If the ' G ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use GRE encapsulation [ 8 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V The mobile node requests that its mobility agent use Van Jacobson header compression [ 10 ] over its link with the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: rsv
description: rsv Reserved bits; sent as zero
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 ( Registration Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code A value indicating the result of the Registration Request . See below for a list of currently defined Code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 32
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 33
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 34
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Lifetime field in the Registration Reply will contain the maximum Lifetime value which that foreign agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . The mobile node MAY attempt to register with this same agent   using a Lifetime in the Registration Request that MUST be less than or equal to the value specified in the Reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Identification field in the Registration Reply will contain a value that allows the mobile node to synchronize with the home agent   based upon the style of replay protection in effect ( Section 5.6 ). The mobile node MUST adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the information in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: This code is returned by a home agent when the mobile node is performing dynamic home agent address resolution as described in Sections 3.6.1.1 and 3.6.1.2 . In this case   the Home Agent field within the Reply will contain the unicast IP address of the home agent returning the Reply . The mobile node MAY then attempt to register with this home agent in future Registration Requests . In addition   the mobile node SHOULD adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the corresponding field in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: Copied from the Protocol field in the original IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: 0 The Original Source Address field is not present . The length of the minimal tunneling header in this case is 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: Sent as zero; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Header Checksum
description: The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of all 16-bit words in the minimal forwarding header . For purposes of computing the checksum   the value of the checksum field is 0 . The IP header and IP payload ( after the minimal forwarding header ) are not included in this checksum computation .
:LABEL: field

name: Original Destination Address
description: Copied from the Destination Address field in the original IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface-Token
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Interface-Token
description: The 32-bit Interface-Token which is very likely to be unique on the link or zero if a good source of uniqueness can not be found .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6-Compression-Protocol
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6-Compression-Protocol
description: The IPv6-Compression-Protocol field is two octets and indicates the compression protocol desired . Values for this field are always the same as the PPP Data Link Layer Protocol field values for that same compression protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface-Token
description: Interface-Token
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6-Compression-Protocol
description: IPv6-Compression-Protocol
:LABEL: field

name: LI
description: Leap Indicator ( LI ): This is a two-bit code warning of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day   with bit 0 and bit 1   respectively   coded as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: Version Number ( VN ): This is a three-bit integer indicating the NTP/SNTP version number . The version number is 3 for Version 3 ( IPv4 only ) and 4 for Version 4 ( IPv4   IPv6 and OSI ). If necessary to distinguish between IPv4   IPv6 and OSI   the encapsulating context must be inspected .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : This is a three-bit integer indicating the mode   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum : This is a eight-bit unsigned integer indicating the stratum level of the local clock   with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision : This is an eight-bit signed integer indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two . The values that normally appear in this field range from - 6 for mains-frequency clocks to - 20 for microsecond clocks found in some workstations .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay : This is a 32-bit signed fixed-point number indicating the total roundtrip delay to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . Note that this variable can take on both positive and negative values   depending on the relative time and frequency offsets . The values that normally appear in this field range from negative values of a few milliseconds to positive values of several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion : This is a 32-bit unsigned fixed-point number indicating the nominal error relative to the primary reference source   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . The values that normally appear in this field range from 0 to several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Identifier
description: Reference Identifier : This is a 32-bit bitstring identifying the particular reference source . In the case of NTP Version 3 or Version 4 stratum-0 ( unspecified ) or stratum-1 ( primary ) servers   this is a four-character ASCII string   left justified and zero padded to 32 bits . In NTP Version 3 secondary servers   this is the 32-bit IPv4 address of the reference source . In NTP Version 4 secondary servers   this is the low order 32 bits of the latest transmit timestamp of the reference source . NTP primary ( stratum 1 ) servers should set this field to a code identifying the external reference source according to the following list . If the external reference is one of those listed   the associated code should be used . Codes for sources not listed can be contrived as appropriate .
:LABEL: field

name: SBIT
description: Start bit position ( SBIT ): 3 bits Number of most significant bits that should be ignored in the first data octet .
:LABEL: field

name: EBIT
description: End bit position ( EBIT ): 3 bits Number of least significant bits that should be ignored in the last data octet .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Motion Vector flag ( V ): 1 bit Set to 0 if motion vectors are not used in this stream . Set to 1 if motion vectors may or may not be used in this stream . The sense of this bit may not change during the course of the session .
:LABEL: field

name: GOBN
description: GOB number ( GOBN ): 4 bits Encodes the GOB number in effect at the start of the packet . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: MBAP
description: Macroblock address predictor ( MBAP ): 5 bits Encodes the macroblock address predictor ( i.e . the last MBA encoded in the previous packet ). This predictor ranges from 0-32 ( to predict the valid MBAs 1-33 )  but because the bit stream cannot be fragmented between a GOB header and MB 1   the predictor at the start of the packet can never be 0 . Therefore   the range is 1-32   which is biased by - 1 to fit in 5 bits . For example   if MBAP is 0   the value of the MBA predictor is 1 . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: QUANT
description: Quantizer ( QUANT ): 5 bits Quantizer value ( MQUANT or GQUANT ) in effect prior to the start of this packet . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: HMVD
description: Horizontal motion vector data ( HMVD ): 5 bits Reference horizontal motion vector data ( MVD ). Set to 0 if V flag is 0 or if the packet begins with a GOB header   or when the MTYPE of the last MB encoded in the previous packet was not MC . HMVD is encoded as a 2's complement number   and ` 10000 ' corresponding to the value - 16 is forbidden ( motion vector fields range from +/- 15 ).
:LABEL: field

name: VMVD
description: Vertical motion vector data ( VMVD ): 5 bits Reference vertical motion vector data ( MVD ). Set to 0 if V flag is 0 or if the packet begins with a GOB header   or when the MTYPE of the last MB encoded in the previous packet was not MC . VMVD is encoded as a 2's complement number   and ` 10000 ' corresponding to the value - 16 is forbidden ( motion vector fields range from +/- 15 ).
:LABEL: field

name: FSN
description: First Sequence Number ( FSN ): 16 bits Identifies the first sequence number lost .
:LABEL: field

name: BLP
description: Bitmask of following lost packets ( BLP ): 16 bits A bit is set to 1 if the corresponding packet has been lost   and set to 0 otherwise . BLP is set to 0 only if no packet other than that being NACKed ( using the FSN field ) has been lost .
