BLP is set to 0x00001 if the packet corresponding to the FSN and the following packet have been lost   etc .
:LABEL: field

name: Type specific
description: Interpretation depends on the value of the type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: The Fragment Offset is the data offset in bytes of the current packet in the JPEG scan .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The type field specifies the information that would otherwise be present in a JPEG abbreviated table-specification as well as the additional JFIF-style parameters not defined by JPEG . Types 0-127 are reserved as fixed   well-known mappings to be defined by this document and future revisions of this document . Types 128-255 are free to be dynamically defined by a session setup protocol ( which is beyond the scope of this document ).
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: The Q field defines the quantization tables for this frame using an algorithm that determined by the Type field ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: Width
description: This field encodes the width of the image in 8-pixel multiples ( e.g .  a width of 40 denotes an image 320 pixels wide ).
:LABEL: field

name: Height
description: This field encodes the height of the image in 8-pixel multiples ( e.g .  a height of 30 denotes an image 240 pixels tall ).
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : Unused . Must be set to zero in current specification . This space is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: TR
description: TR : Temporal-Reference ( 10 bits ). The temporal reference of the current picture within the current GOP . This value ranges from 0-1023 and is constant for all RTP packets of a given picture .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : Unused . Must be set to zero in current specification . This space is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Sequence-header-present ( 1 bit ). Normally 0 and set to 1 at the occurrence of each MPEG sequence header . Used to detect presence of sequence header in RTP packet .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : Beginning-of-slice ( BS ) ( 1 bit ). Set when the start of the packet payload is a slice start code   or when a slice start code is preceded only by one or more of a Video_Sequence_Header   GOP_header and/or Picture_Header .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : End-of-slice ( ES ) ( 1 bit ). Set when the last byte of the payload is the end of an MPEG slice .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Picture-Type ( 3 bits ). I ( 1 )  P ( 2 )  B ( 3 ) or D ( 4 ). This value is constant for each RTP packet of a given picture . Value 000B is forbidden and 101B - 111B are reserved to support future extensions to the MPEG ES specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Frag_offset
description: Frag_offset : Byte offset into the audio frame for the data in this packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as padding and should be ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it should be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4096 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the reply from the RADIUS server   and is used in the password hiding algorithm .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Access-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet random number   called the Request Authenticator . The value SHOULD be unpredictable and unique over the lifetime of a secret ( the password shared between the client and the RADIUS server )  since repetition of a request value in conjunction with the same secret would permit an attacker to reply with a previously intercepted response . Since it is expected that the same secret MAY be used to authenticate with servers in disparate geographic regions   the Request Authenticator field SHOULD exhibit global and temporal uniqueness .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The value of the Authenticator field in Access-Accept   Access - Reject   and Access-Challenge packets is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of : the RADIUS packet   beginning with the Code field   including the Identifier   the Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Access-Request packet   and the response Attributes   followed by the shared secret . That is   ResponseAuth = MD5(Code+ID+Length+RequestAuth+Attributes+Secret ) where + denotes concatenation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Access-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MUST remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator value MUST be changed each time a new Identifier is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 3 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this Attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Request but with an invalid Length   an Access-Reject SHOULD be transmitted . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Accept   Access-Reject or Access-Challenge packet with an invalid length   the packet MUST either be treated as an Access-Reject or else silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the Attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 for User-Name .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 2 for User-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: At least 18 and no larger than 130 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 3 for CHAP-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: CHAP Ident
description: This field is one octet   and contains the CHAP Identifier from the user's CHAP Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 4 for NAS-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 5 for NAS-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 6 for Service-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 7 for Framed-Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8 for Framed-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS should allow the user to select an address ( e.g . Negotiated ). The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an address for the user ( e.g . Assigned from a pool of addresses kept by the NAS ). Other valid values indicate that the NAS should use that value as the user's IP address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 9 for Framed-IP-Netmask .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets specifying the IP netmask of the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 10 for Framed-Routing .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 11 for Filter-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 12 for Framed-MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 64 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 for Framed-Compression .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 14 for Login-IP-Host .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS SHOULD allow the user to select an address . The value 0 indicates that the NAS SHOULD select a host to connect the user to . Other values indicate the address the NAS SHOULD connect the user to .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 15 for Login-Service .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 16 for Login-TCP-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 18 for Reply-Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 19 for Callback-Number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 20 for Callback-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 22 for Framed-Route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 23 for Framed-IPX-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an IPX network for the user ( e.g . assigned from a pool of one or more IPX networks kept by the NAS ). Other values should be used as the IPX network for the link to the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 24 for State .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 25 for Class .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 26 for Vendor-Specific .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order   as defined in the Assigned Numbers RFC [ 2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 27 for Session-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of seconds this user should be allowed to remain connected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 28 for Idle-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of consecutive seconds of idle time this user should be permitted before being disconnected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 29 for Termination-Action .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 30 for Called-Station-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 31 for Calling-Station-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 32 for NAS-Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 33 for Proxy-State .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 34 for Login-LAT-Service .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 35 for Login-LAT-Node .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 36 for Login-LAT-Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 37 for Framed-AppleTalk-Link .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value of 0 indicates that this is an unnumbered serial link . A value of 1-65535 means that the serial line between the NAS and the user should be assigned that value as an AppleTalk network number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 38 for Framed-AppleTalk-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value 0 indicates that the NAS should assign a network for the user   using its default cable range . A value between 1 and 65535 ( inclusive ) indicates the AppleTalk Network the NAS should probe to find an address for the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 39 for Framed-AppleTalk-Zone .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 60 for CHAP-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 61 for NAS-Port-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . " Virtual " refers to a connection to the NAS via some transport protocol   instead of through a physical port . For example   if a user telnetted into a NAS to
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 62 for Port-Limit .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of ports this user should be allowed to connect to on the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 63 for Login-LAT-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as padding and should be ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it should be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4096 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the messages between the client and RADIUS accounting server .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Accounting-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet MD5 [ 3 ] checksum   called the Request Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field in an Accounting-Response packet is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of the Accounting - Response Code   Identifier   Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Accounting-Request packet being replied to   and the response attributes if any   followed by the shared secret . The resulting 16 octet MD5 hash value is stored in the Authenticator field of the Accounting-Response packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Accounting-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator of an Accounting-Request contains a 16 - octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Request Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Accounting-Request which caused this Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator of an Accounting-Response contains a 16-octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Response Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 2 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an attribute is received in an Accounting-Request with an invalid Length   the entire request should be silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 40 for Acct-Status-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 41 for Acct-Delay-Time .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 42 for Acct-Input-Octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 43 for Acct-Output-Octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 44 for Acct-Session-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 45 for Acct-Authentic .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 46 for Acct-Session-Time .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 47 for Acct-Input-Packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 48 for Acct-Output-Packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 49 for Acct-Terminate-Cause
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing an integer specifying the cause of session termination   as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 50 for Acct-Multi-Session-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 51 for Acct-Link-Count .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   and contains the number of links seen so far in this Multilink Session .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 11 bits ) SHALL contain zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Destination_IEEE_Address ( 48 bits ) SHALL contain the 48 bit Universal LAN MAC Address of the Destination if known   otherwise zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( bits 30   29 ) should be zero . Destinations SHALL accept any value for these bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Destination Address ( bits 11-0 ) SHALL contain the Switch Address of the Destination .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L = Locally defined ( 1 => entire I-field is locally defined ) W = Width ( 1 => 64 bit connection ) D = Direction ( 1 => swap Source and Destination Address ) PS = Path Selection ( 01 => Logical Address Mode ) C = Camp-on ( 1 => wait until Destination is free )
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L The " Locally Defined " bit   when set   indicates that the I-field is not in the standard format . The meaning of bits 30-0 are locally defined .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: W The Width bit   when set   requests a 64 bit connection through the switch . It is meaningless if Cable B is not installed at the Source . If W is set and either the Source or the requested Destination has no Cable B to the switch   the switch rejects the connection . Otherwise the switch connects both Cable A and Cable B if W is set   or Cable A only if W is clear . This feature is useful if both Source and Destination implementations can selectively disable or enable Cable B on each new connection .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D The Direction bit   when set   reverses the sense of the Source Address and Destination Address fields . In other words   D=1 means that the Source Address is in bits 0-11 and the Destination Address is in bits 12-23 . This bit was defined to give devices a simple way to route return messages . It is not useful for LAN operations .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C The Camp-on bit requests the switch not to reject the connection if the selected Destination is busy ( connected to another Source ) but wait and make the connection when the Destination is free .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2 + ( Number of NetBIOS names * 17 )
:LABEL: field

name: Added
description: This is a one octet field which plays a dual role . The Added field in the Name-Projection Request packet contains the type of NetBIOS name added . A summary of name types is listed below .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer-class
description: The Peer-class field is one octet . It identifies the sender's implementation type .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast-Forward-Period
description: The Multicast-Forward-Period field is two octets and indicates the maximum period in seconds at which multicast packets can be sent . The maximum value for this field is 60 ( one minute ). A value of zero indicates that there is no maximum period at which multicast packets can be sent . A value of hex type FFFF indicates that the Multicast-Forward-Period is unknown . A value of five indicates that multicast packets will not be sent at a rate more frequent than once every five seconds . This two octet value represents a 16 bit unsigned number sent with the most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: The Priority field is one octet long and indicates if multicast packets have priority over other packets when being sent . A value of 0 indicates that directed packets have priority . A value of 1 indicates that multicast packets have priority .
:LABEL: field

name: Foreign Agent
description: A routing entity that resides in a NAS on a remote network that allows a mobile node to utilize a home network address . It tunnels datagrams to   and detunnels datagrams from   the home agent for the given home network .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node
description: A host that wishes to use a Home Network address while physically connected by a point-to-point link ( phone line   ISDN   etc .) to a NAS that does not reside on the Home Network . Also referred to as the client .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 for Registration Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier A 16 bit number used to match replies with requests . A new value should be provided in each new request . Retransmissions of the same request should use the same identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Foreign Agent
description: Foreign Agent The IP address of the foreign agent issuing the request ( typically the same as the UDP source address ).
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node
description: Mobile Node The IP address to be used by the mobile node . This is the mobile node's home address . This field can be all 0's if IPX is to be tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node Mask
description: Mobile Node Mask The network bit mask for the mobile node . Currently this value should be set to all 1's .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node IPX Net
description: Mobile Node IPX Net The Network portion of the mobile node's IPX address . This value should be set to all 0's if only IP is to be tunneled .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 2 for Challenge Request
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier A 16 bit number used to match replies with requests . A new value should be provided in each new request . Retransmissions of the same request should use the same identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: Authenticator A series of 16 octet values randomly generated by the Home Agent . The receiving Foreign Agent is to perform an MD5 [ 7 ] hash of these values along with a shared secret . The resultant digest is returned in the Challenge Reply . See Sec . 2.3 Retransmissions of the Challenge Request should use the same Authenticator value .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: Result Code If non-zero   this value indicates the error condition that occurred . See Sec . 2.8 for a list of Result Code values and their meanings .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 for Challenge Reply
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier Copied from the corresponding Deregistration Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Reply Length
description: Reply Length This field specifies the length of the challenge reply computation based on the received Authenticator and the shared secret . For MD5 this length will always be 16 . This field is provided for future extensibility .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4 for Registration Reply
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier Copied from the corresponding Registration Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: Result Code Specifies the result of the registration and authentication attempt by the Foreign Agent . Sec . 2.8 for a list of Result Code values and their meanings .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID This is the identifier used to indicate a given mobility binding between a given Mobile Node and Home Agent . This identifier is used to distinguish multiple tunnels between a given Foreign Agent-Home Agent pair . It is carried in the " key " field of the GRE [ 1 ] tunnel packets that ATMP uses as the tunnel protocol . It is also used in Deregistration Requests and Error Notification messages to indicate the particular mobility binding to which they relate .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 5 for Deregistration Request
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier A 16 bit number used to match replies with requests . A new value should be provided in each new request . Retransmissions of the same request should use the same identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID Tunnel identifier of the mobility binding to be terminated .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 6 for Deregistration Reply
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier Copied from the corresponding Deregistration Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: Result Code Specifies the result of the registration and authentication attempt by the Foreign Agent . Sec . 2.8 for a list of Result Code values and their meanings .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID Tunnel identifier of the mobility binding specified in the Deregistration Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version The ATMP protocol version . MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 7 for Error Notification
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier If issued in response to a received reply type message   this value should be copied from the identifier field of the reply . Otherwise the identifier should be the value that would be used for the next generated request .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: Result Code This indicates the type of error detected . The possible result codes are defined in Sec . 2.8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID Tunnel identifier of the mobility binding to which this message pertains . If the Error Notification is being sent in response to an unsolicited reply   the Tunnel ID is copied from the reply .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: 3 Receipt of a packet that matches on a ( S G ) entry whose SPT-bit is cleared triggers the following if the packet arrived on the correct incoming interface and there is a (*  G ) or (* *  RP ) entry with a different incoming interface : a ) the router sets the SPT-bit on the ( S G ) entry   and b ) the router sends a Join/Prune message towards the RP with S and a set RPT-bit in the prune list .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The ( S G ) Entry-timer is restarted by Registers arriving from that source to that group .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: * [ Random-Delay-Join-Timeout ] This is the maximum interval between the time when the RPF neighbor changes   and the time at which a triggered Join/Prune message is sent . { Default : 4.5 seconds .}
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 0 = Hello 1 = Register 2 = Register-Stop 3 = Join/Prune 4 = Bootstrap 5 = Assert 6 = Graft ( used in PIM-DM only ) 7 = Graft-Ack ( used in PIM-DM only ) 8 = Candidate-RP-Advertisement
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Mask Length Mask length is 8 bits . The value is the number of contiguous bits left justified used as a mask which describes the address . The mask length must be less than or equal to Addr Length * 8 . If the message is sent for a single source then the Mask length must equal Addr length * 8 . In version 2 of PIM   it is strongly recommended that this field be set to 32 for IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: Mask Length Mask length is 8 bits . The value is the number of contiguous bits left justified used as a mask which describes the address . The mask length must be less than or equal to Addr Length * 8 . If the message is sent for a single source then the Mask length must equal Addr length * 8 . In version 2 of PIM   it is strongly recommended that this field be set to 32 for IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above . { Note that the checksum for Registers is done only on the PIM header   excluding the data packet portion .}
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above . { Note that the checksum for Registers is done only on the PIM header   excluding the data packet portion .}
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B The Border bit . If the router is a DR for a source that it is directly connected to   it sets the B bit to 0 . If the router is a PMBR for a source in a directly connected cloud   it sets the B bit to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N The Null-Register bit . Set to 1 by a DR that is probing the RP before expiring its local Register-Suppression timer . Set to 0 otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S The Sparse bit is a 1 bit value   set to 1 for PIM-SM . It is used for PIM v.1 compatibility .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: W The WC bit is a 1 bit value . If 1   the join or prune applies to the (*  G ) or (* *  RP ) entry . If 0   the join or prune applies to the ( S G ) entry where S is Source Address . Joins and prunes sent towards the RP must have this bit set .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R The RPT-bit is a 1 bit value . If 1   the information about ( S G ) is sent towards the RP . If 0   the information must be sent toward S   where S is the Source Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R RPT-bit is a 1 bit value . If the IP multicast datagram that triggered the Assert packet is routed down the RP tree   then the RPT-bit is 1; if the IP multicast datagram is routed down the SPT   it is 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr length
description: PIM Version   Type   Addr length   Checksum Described above .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A The Authoritative bit . This bit indicates that the BSR should not override the group-prefix information indicated in the C-RP Advertisement . In most cases C-RPs set this bit to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Supported Bits
description: This field is 4 octets   most significant octet first . The least significant bit in the least significant octet set to 1 indicates desire to negotiate MPPC .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Coherency Count
description: The coherency count is used to assure that the packets are sent in proper order and that no packet has been dropped . This count starts at 0 and is always increased by 1 and NEVER decreases or goes back . When all bits are 1   the count returns to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Policy
description: Policy ID Value Meaning
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Failure Code
description: Flow Failure Code - for the Flow ID IE above .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Discriminator
description: Description
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 23 for Link Discriminator option .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Discriminator
description: The Link Discriminator field is 2 octets in Length   and it contains a unique identifier used to indicate a particular link in a multilink bundle . The Link Discriminator for a link MUST be unique among the Link Discriminators assigned by this endpoint for this bundle . The Link Discriminator MAY be assigned in a sequential   monotonically increasing manner .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 for Favored-Peer
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets   and indicates a number which is very likely to be unique to one end of the link . A Magic-Number of zero is illegal and MUST always be Nak'd .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet and identifies the type of BAP datagram packet . Datagram types are defined as follows . This field is coded in binary coded hexadecimal .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and is binary coded . It aids in matching Requests and Indications with Responses . Call-Status - Indication packets MUST use the same Identifier as was used by the original Call-Request or Callback-Request that was used to initiate the call . All other Request or Indication packets MUST use a unique Identifier for each new Request or Indication . All Response packets MUST use the same Identifier as the Identifier in the Request or Indication packet being responded to . When re - transmitting a request or indication   the Identifier MUST be the same as the Identifier used on the previous transmission of the request or indication .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the packet including the Type   Identifier   Length and Options fields . It is binary encoded . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Code
description: The Response Code is only present in Response datagrams . It is binary coded and can have the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The type field is one octet   and indicates the type of the BAP Datagram Option . This field is binary coded Hexadecimal . The following options are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this BAP Option including the Type   Length   and Data fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 01 for Link-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this BAP Option including the Type   Length and Link Type fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Type
description: The Link Type field is a bit mask . It is 1 octet in length . Bit 0 of the Link Type field corresponds to bit 39 of the Link-Type BAP Option as described above . If a bit is set   it indicates support of the corresponding link type . If the link indicated is different than the supported link types   no bit will be set . Otherwise   at least one bit MUST be set . If an implementation supports more than one link type   more than one bit MAY be set .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 02 for Phone-Delta .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this BAP Option including the Type   Length   and Sub-Option fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Option Type
description: The following Sub-Option Types are defined for the Phone-Delta option .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 03 for No-Phone-Number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 04 for Reason .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this BAP Option including the Type   Length and Reason String fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 05 for Link-Discriminator
:LABEL: field

name: Link Discriminator
description: The Link Discriminator field is 2 octets in length . It contains the Link Discriminator that was contained in the LCP Link - Discriminator Configuration Option sent by the receiver of the packet containing the Link Discriminator .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 06 for Call-Status .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The Status field is 1 octet in length . If the call was successful   the value MUST be set to 0 . A non-zero value indicates a call failure . A value of 255 indicates a non-specific failure   and a more specific call status MAY be indicated by using the same number as the Q.931 cause value ( i.e .  1 is unassigned number   17 is user busy   etc .)
:LABEL: field

name: Action
description: The Action octet indicates what action the calling implementation is taking after a failed call . If the call was sucessful   the Action octet MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Source IP address
description: Source IP address : source IP address of flow Destination IP address : destination IP address of flow
:LABEL: field

name: VCID Type
description: VCID Type : Currently   VCID Type = 1 is defined . VCID Length : Length of VCID field VCID : VCID described previous
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : BROADCAST flag
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : MUST BE ZERO ( reserved for future use )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as padding and should be ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it should be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4096 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the reply from the RADIUS server   and is used in the password hiding algorithm .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Access-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet random number   called the Request Authenticator . The value SHOULD be unpredictable and unique over the lifetime of a secret ( the password shared between the client and the RADIUS server )  since repetition of a request value in conjunction with the same secret would permit an attacker to reply with a previously intercepted response . Since it is expected that the same secret MAY be used to authenticate with servers in disparate geographic regions   the Request Authenticator field SHOULD exhibit global and temporal uniqueness .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The value of the Authenticator field in Access-Accept   Access - Reject   and Access-Challenge packets is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of : the RADIUS packet   beginning with the Code field   including the Identifier   the Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Access-Request packet   and the response Attributes   followed by the shared secret . That is   ResponseAuth = MD5(Code+ID+Length+RequestAuth+Attributes+Secret ) where + denotes concatenation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Access-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MUST remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator value MUST be changed each time a new Identifier is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 3 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this Attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Request but with an invalid Length   an Access-Reject SHOULD be transmitted . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Accept   Access-Reject or Access-Challenge packet with an invalid length   the packet MUST either be treated an Access-Reject or else silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the Attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 for User-Name .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 2 for User-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: At least 18 and no larger than 130 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 3 for CHAP-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: CHAP Ident
description: This field is one octet   and contains the CHAP Identifier from the user's CHAP Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 4 for NAS-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 5 for NAS-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 6 for Service-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 7 for Framed-Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8 for Framed-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS should allow the user to select an address ( e.g . Negotiated ). The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an address for the user ( e.g . Assigned from a pool of addresses kept by the NAS ). Other valid values indicate that the NAS should use that value as the user's IP address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 9 for Framed-IP-Netmask .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets specifying the IP netmask of the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 10 for Framed-Routing .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 11 for Filter-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 12 for Framed-MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 64 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 for Framed-Compression .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 14 for Login-IP-Host .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS SHOULD allow the user to select an address . The value 0 indicates that the NAS SHOULD select a host to connect the user to . Other values indicate the address the NAS SHOULD connect the user to .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 15 for Login-Service .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 16 for Login-TCP-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 18 for Reply-Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 19 for Callback-Number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 20 for Callback-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 22 for Framed-Route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 23 for Framed-IPX-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an IPX network for the user ( e.g . assigned from a pool of one or more IPX networks kept by the NAS ). Other values should be used as the IPX network for the link to the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 24 for State .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 25 for Class .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 26 for Vendor-Specific .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order   as defined in the Assigned Numbers RFC [ 3 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 27 for Session-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of seconds this user should be allowed to remain connected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 28 for Idle-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of consecutive seconds of idle time this user should be permitted before being disconnected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 29 for Termination-Action .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 30 for Called-Station-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 31 for Calling-Station-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 32 for NAS-Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 33 for Proxy-State .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 34 for Login-LAT-Service .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 35 for Login-LAT-Node .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 36 for Login-LAT-Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 37 for Framed-AppleTalk-Link .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value of 0 indicates that this is an unnumbered serial link . A value of 1-65535 means that the serial line between the NAS and the user should be assigned that value as an AppleTalk network number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 38 for Framed-AppleTalk-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value 0 indicates that the NAS should assign a network for the user   using its default cable range . A value between 1 and 65535 ( inclusive ) indicates the AppleTalk Network the NAS should probe to find an address for the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 39 for Framed-AppleTalk-Zone .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 60 for CHAP-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 61 for NAS-Port-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . " Virtual " refers to a connection to the NAS via some transport protocol   instead of through a physical port . For example   if a user telnetted into a NAS to authenticate himself as an Outbound-User   the Access-Request might include NAS-Port-Type = Virtual as a hint to the RADIUS server that the user was not on a physical port .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 62 for Port-Limit .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of ports this user should be allowed to connect to on the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 63 for Login-LAT-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as padding and should be ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it should be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4096 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the messages between the client and RADIUS accounting server .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Accounting-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet MD5 [ 3 ] checksum   called the Request Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field in an Accounting-Response packet is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of the Accounting - Response Code   Identifier   Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Accounting-Request packet being replied to   and the response attributes if any   followed by the shared secret . The resulting 16 octet MD5 hash value is stored in the Authenticator field of the Accounting-Response packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Accounting-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions where the contents are identical   the Identifier MUST remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator of an Accounting-Request contains a 16 - octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Request Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Accounting-Request which caused this Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator of an Accounting-Response contains a 16-octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Response Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 2 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an attribute is received in an Accounting-Request with an invalid Length   the entire request should be silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 40 for Acct-Status-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 41 for Acct-Delay-Time .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 42 for Acct-Input-Octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 43 for Acct-Output-Octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 44 for Acct-Session-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 45 for Acct-Authentic .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 46 for Acct-Session-Time .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 47 for Acct-Input-Packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 48 for Acct-Output-Packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 49 for Acct-Terminate-Cause
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing an integer specifying the cause of session termination   as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 50 for Acct-Multi-Session-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 51 for Acct-Link-Count .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   and contains the number of links seen so far in this Multilink Session .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 for Vendor Specific
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed for each Vendor Specific packet sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic-Number
description: The Magic-Number field is four octets and aids in detecting links that are in the looped-back condition . Until the Magic-Number Configuration Option has been successfully negotiated   the Magic - Number MUST be transmitted as zero . See the Magic-Number Configuration Option for further explanation .
:LABEL: field

name: OUI
description: three octets . The vendor's Organizationally Unique Identifier . The bits within the octet are in canonical order   and the most significant octet is transmitted first .
:LABEL: field

name: Kind
description: one octet . Indicates a sub-type for the OUI . There is no standardization for this field . Each OUI implements its own values .
:LABEL: field

name: OUI
description: three octets . The vendor's Organizationally Unique Identifier . The bits within the octet are in canonical order   and the most significant octet is transmitted first .
:LABEL: field

name: Kind
description: one octet . Indicates a sub-type for the OUI . There is no standardization for this field . Each OUI implements its own values .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version This protocol document defines version 1 of the Service Location protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The number of bytes in the message   including the Service Location Header .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O The ' Overflow ' bit . See Section 18 for the use of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M The ' Monolingual ' bit . Requests with this bit set indicate the User Agent will only accept responses in the language ( see section 17 ) that is indicated by the Service or Attribute Request .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U The ' URL Authentication Present ' bit . See sections 4.2   4.3   9   and 11 for the use of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A The ' Attribute Authentication Present ' bit . See sections 4.2   4.3   and 13 for the use of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F If the ' F ' bit is set in a Service Acknowledgement   the directory agent has registered the service as a new entry   not as an updated entry .
:LABEL: field

name: rsvd
description: rsvd MUST be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Dialect
description: Dialect Dialect tags will be used by future versions of the Service Location Protocol to indicate a variant of vocabulary used . This field is reserved and MUST be set to 0 for compatibility with future versions of the Service Location Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime The length of time that the registration is valid   in the absence of later registrations or deregistration .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the Authenticator
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime ( seconds ): 16-bit unsigned integer URL ( at least ): service:<srvtype>://<addr-spec > Attributes ( if any ): ( ATTR1=VALUE) KEYWORD (ATTR2 = VAL1   VAL2 )
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : 10800 URL : service:lpr://igore.wco.ftp.com:515/draft Attributes : ( SCOPE=DEVELOPMENT )  ( PAPER COLOR=WHITE )  ( PAPER SIZE=LETTER )  UNRESTRICTED_ACCESS   ( LANGUAGE=POSTSCRIPT   HPGCL )  ( LOCATION=12 FLOOR )
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : 10800 URL : service:lpr://igore.wco.ftp.com:515/draft Attributes : ( SCOPE=ENTWICKLUNG )  ( PAPIERFARBE=WEISS )  ( PAPIERFORMAT=BRIEF )  UNBEGRENTZTER_ZUGANG   ( DRUECKERSPRACHE=POSTSCRIPT HPGCL )  ( STANDORT=11 ETAGE )
:LABEL: field

name: URL
description: URL : service:directory-agent://SLP-RESOLVER.CATCH22.COM SCOPE List : ADMIN
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name Protocol function __________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Discover/maintain neighbors 2 Database Description Summarize database contents 3 Link State Request Database download 4 Link State Update Database update 5 Link State Ack Flooding acknowledgment
:LABEL: field

name: AuType
description: AuType and Authentication Each OSPF packet exchange is authenticated . Authentication types are assigned by the protocol and are documented in Appendix D . A different authentication procedure can be used for each IP network/subnet . Autype indicates the type of authentication procedure in use . The 64-bit authentication field is then for use by the chosen authentication procedure . This procedure should be the last called when forming the packet to be sent . See Section D.4 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( transmit ) _________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 9.5 2 Database description Section 10.8 3 Link state request Section 10.9 4 Link state update Section 13.3 5 Link state ack Section 13.5
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet name detailed section ( receive ) ________________________________________________________ 1 Hello Section 10.5 2 Database description Section 10.6 3 Link state request Section 10.7 4 Link state update Section 13 5 Link state ack Section 13.7
:LABEL: field

description: Type Dest Area Path Type Cost Next Adv . Hops(s ) Router(s ) __________________________________________________________________ N N1 1 intra-area 4 RT1 * N N2 1 intra-area 4 RT2 * N N3 1 intra-area 1 * * N N4 1 intra-area 3 RT3 * R RT3 1 intra-area 1 * * __________________________________________________________________ N Ib 0 intra-area 22 RT5 * N Ia 0 intra-area 27 RT5 * R RT3 0 intra-area 21 RT5 * R RT5 0 intra-area 8 * * R RT7 0 intra-area 14 RT5 * R RT10 0 intra-area 22 RT5 * R RT11 0 intra-area 25 RT5 * __________________________________________________________________ N N6 0 inter-area 15 RT5 RT7 N N7 0 inter-area 19 RT5 RT7 N N8 0 inter-area 18 RT5 RT7 N N9-N11 H1 0 inter-area 36 RT5 RT11 __________________________________________________________________ N N12 * type 1 ext . 16 RT5 RT5 RT7 N N13 * type 1 ext . 16 RT5 RT5 N N14 * type 1 ext . 16 RT5 RT5 N N15 * type 1 ext . 23 RT5 RT7
