description: Peer's Call ID The value of the Call ID assigned by the PAC to this call .
:LABEL: field

name: Send ACCM
description: Send ACCM The send ACCM value the client should use to process outgoing PPP packets . The default value used by the client until this message is received is 0XFFFFFFFF . See [ 7 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Receive ACCM
description: Receive ACCM The receive ACCM value the client should use to process incoming PPP packets . The default value used by the client until this message is received is 0XFFFFFFFF . See [ 7 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Call ID
description: A session is defined by the triple ( PAC   PNS   Call ID ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C ( Bit 0 ) Checksum Present . Set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( Bit 1 ) Routing Present . Set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: K ( Bit 2 ) Key Present . Set to one ( 1 ). S ( Bit 3 ) Sequence Number Present . Set to one ( 1 ) if a payload ( data ) packet is present . Set to zero ( 0 ) if payload is not present ( GRE packet is an Acknowledgment only ).
:LABEL: field

name: s
description: s ( Bit 4 ) Strict source route present . Set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Recur
description: Recur ( Bits 5-7 ) Recursion control . Set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A ( Bit 8 ) Acknowledgment sequence number present . Set to one ( 1 ) if packet contains Acknowledgment Number to be used for acknowledging previously transmitted data .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( Bits 9-12 ) Must be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver ( Bits 13-15 ) Must contain 1 ( enhanced GRE ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Event
description: This 4-octet field contains the number of the event . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Delta options mask
description: This 4-octet field contains a bit map specifying the feature(s ) gained or lost by the neighbor switch ( events 2 and 3 only ). Valid values are as specified for the next field   Current options mask .
:LABEL: field

name: Current options mask
description: This 4-octet field contains a bit map specifying the features of the neighbor switch . Bit assignments are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Port number
description: This 4-octet field contains the logical number of the local port for which the event was generated .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor chassis IP address
description: This 4-octet field contains the Internet Protocol ( IP ) address of the chassis of the neighbor switch .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor functional level
description: This 4-octet field contains the functional level of the neighbor switch   as determined by the version level of the SecureFast VLAN software under which this switch is operating . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Topology agent
description: This 4-octet field contains a pointer to the topology agent that generated the event . The pointer here can reference any of the topology agents that send Interswitch Keepalive messages -- that is   any agent running the VlanHello protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Next event
description: This 4-octet field contains a pointer to the next event relay structure in the list .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This 2-octet field identifies the type of data carried within the frame . The type field of ISMP packets contains the value 0x81FD .
:LABEL: field

name: ISMP Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the InterSwitch Message Protocol to which this ISMP packet adheres . The VlanHello protocol uses ISMP Version 3.0 .
:LABEL: field

name: ISMP message type
description: This 2-octet field contains a value indicating which type of ISMP message is contained within the message body . VlanHello Interswitch Keepalive messages have a message type of 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: This 2-octet field contains an internally generated sequence number used by the various protocol handlers for internal synchronization of messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Code length
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of octets in the Authentication code field of the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication code
description: This variable-length field contains an encoded value used for authentication of the ISMP message .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the VlanHello protocol to which this message adheres . This document describes VlanHello Version 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Switch type
description: This 2-octet field contains the type of the switch . Currently   the only value recognized here is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Functional level
description: This 4-octet field contains the functional level of the sending switch   as determined by the version level of the SecureFast VLAN software under which this switch is operating . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: This 4-octet field contains a bit map specifying the features of the switch . Bit assignments are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Base MAC count
description: This 2-octet field contains the number of entries in the list of Base MAC entries .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet Name Protocol Function
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The type of network to which the interface is attached -- point - to-point or broadcast ( multi-access ). This data item is initialized to point-to-point when the interface becomes operational . If a second neighbor is detected on the link after the first neighbor has been discovered   the link interface type is changed to broadcast . The type remains as broadcast until the interface is declared down   at which time the type reverts to point-to-point .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: A 4-octet number identifying individual Database Description packets . When the neighbor state ExStart is entered and the database exchange process is started   the sequence number is set to a value not previously seen by the neighboring switch . ( One possible scheme is to use the switch's time of day counter .) The sequence number is then incremented by the master with each new Database Description packet sent . See Section 7.2 for more information on the database exchange process .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description Link ID
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Packet Name Function Description
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This 2-octet field identifies the type of data carried within the frame . The type field of ISMP packets contains the value 0x81FD .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the InterSwitch Message Protocol to which this ISMP packet adheres . This document describes ISMP Version 2.0 . ISMP message type
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: This 2-octet field contains an internally generated sequence number used by the various protocol handlers for internal synchronization of messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This 1-octet field contains the packet type . Possible values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Packet length
description: This 2-octet field contains the length of the protocol packet   in bytes   calculated from the start of the VLSP header   at offset 20 of the ISMP message body . If the packet length is not an integral number of 16-bit words   the packet is padded with an octet of zero ( see the description of the checksum field   below ).
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: This 2-octet field contains the packet checksum value . The checksum is calculated as the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of all the 16-bit words in the packet   beginning with the VLSP header   excluding the authentication field . If the packet length is not an integral number of 16-bit words   the packet is padded with an octet of zero before calculating the checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: HelloInt
description: This 2-octet field contains the interval   in seconds   at which this switch sends Hello packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: This 1-octet field contains the optional capabilities supported by the switch   as described in Section 10.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: This 1-octet field contains the switch priority used in selecting the designated switch and backup designated switch ( see Section 6.3.1 ). If the value here is zero   the switch is ineligible to become the designated switch or the backup designated switch .
:LABEL: field

name: DeadInt
description: This 4-octet field contains the length of time   in seconds   that neighboring switches will wait before declaring the interface down once they stop receiving Hello packets over the interface . The value here is equal to the value of SwitchDeadInterval   as found in the interface data structure .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: This 1-octet field contains the optional capabilities supported by the switch   as described in Section 10.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: This 1-octet field contains a set of bit flags that are used to coordinate the database exchange process . The format of this octet is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: This 4-octet field is used to sequence the Database Description packets during the database exchange process . The two switches involved in the exchange process agree on the initial value of the sequence number during the master/slave negotiation . The number is then incremented for each Database Description packet in the exchange .
:LABEL: field

name: Link state type
description: This 4-octet field contains the link state type of the requested link state advertisement   as stored in the advertisement header .
:LABEL: field

name: # advertisements
description: This 4-octet field contains the number of link state advertisements included in the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Name Function Description
:LABEL: field

name: Age
description: This 2-octet field contains the time   in seconds   since this instance of the link state advertisement was originated .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: This 1-octet field contains the optional capabilities supported by the advertising switch   as described in Section 10.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: This 4-octet field is used to sequence the instances of a particular link state advertisement . The number is incremented for each new instance .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: This 2-octet field contains the checksum of the complete contents of the link state advertisement   excluding the age field . The checksum used is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum and is documented in [ RFC905 ]. Note that since this checksum is calculated for each separate advertisement   a protocol packet containing lists of advertisements or advertisement headers will contain multiple checksum values .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This 2-octet field contains the total length   in octets   of the link state advertisement   including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: # links
description: This 2-octet field contains the number of links described by this advertisement . This value must be equal to the total number of functioning network links attached to the switch .
:LABEL: field

name: Link type
description: This 1-octet field contains the type of link being described . Possible values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: # TOS
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of nonzero type of service metrics specified for the link . Since the current version of VLSP does not support routing based on nonzero types of service   this field contains a value of zero .
:LABEL: field

name: TOS 0 metric
description: This 2-octet field contains the cost of using this link for the zero TOS . This value is expressed in the link state metric and must be greater than zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Tag
description: This 4-octet field specifies the type of address contained in the structure . The following address types are currently supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Value length
description: This 1-octet field contains the length of the value of the address . The value here depends on the address type and actual value .
:LABEL: field

name: Address value
description: This variable-length field contains the value of the address . The length of this field is stored in the Value length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This 2-octet field identifies the type of data carried within the frame . Except where otherwise noted   the type field of ISMP packets contains the value 0x81FD .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the InterSwitch Message Protocol to which this ISMP packet adheres . This document describes ISMP Version 2.0 .
:LABEL: field

name: ISMP message type
description: This 2-octet field contains a value indicating which type of ISMP message is contained within the message body . The following table lists each ISMP message   along with its message type and the section within this document that describes the message in detail :
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: This 2-octet field contains an internally generated sequence number used by the various protocol handlers for internal synchronization of messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 4   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation type of the message . For an Interswitch BPDU message   the value should be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message flags
description: This 2-octet field is currently unused . It is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 4   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation type of the message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Message flags
description: This 2-octet field is currently unused . It is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 5   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation code of the message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field contains the status of a Resolve response message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Call tag
description: This 2-octet field contains the call tag of the endstation packet for which this Resolve request is issued . The call tag is a 16 - bit value ( generated by the originating switch ) that uniquely identifies the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of address attributes requested or returned . This is the number of items in the resolve list .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This section describes version 3 of the Interswitch Resolve message .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation code of the message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field contains the status of a Resolve response message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Call tag
description: This 2-octet field contains the call tag of the endstation packet for which this Resolve request is issued . The call tag is a 16 - bit value ( generated by the originating switch ) that uniquely identifies the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of address attributes requested or returned . This is the number of items in the resolve list .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 5   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation code of the message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field contains the status of a New User response message . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Call tag
description: This 2-octet field contains the call tag of the endstation packet for which this New User request is issued . The call tag is a 16 - bit value ( generated by the originating switch ) that uniquely identifies the packet that caused the switch to identify the endstation as a new user .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of VLAN identifiers returned . This is the number of items in the resolve list . This field is written by the previous owner switch .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 7   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation code of the message . The value here should be 1   indicating the message is a flood request .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field is currently unused . It is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Call tag
description: This 2-octet field contains the call tag of the endstation packet encapsulated within this tag-based flood message . The call tag is a 16-bit value ( generated by the originating switch ) that uniquely identifies the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of VLAN identifiers included in the VLAN list .
:LABEL: field

name: VLAN identifier
description: This 2-octet field contains the VLAN identifier of the packet source .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This section describes version 2 of the Interswitch Tag - Based Flood message .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: This 2-octet field contains the operation code of the message . Valid values here are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field is currently unused . It is reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Call tag
description: This 2-octet field contains the call tag of the endstation packet encapsulated within this tag-based flood message . The call tag is a 16-bit value ( generated by the originating switch ) that uniquely identifies the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: This 1-octet field contains the number of VLAN identifiers included in the VLAN list .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: This 2-octet field contains the version number of the message type . This document describes ISMP message type 8   version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: tet field contains the operation type of the message . ues are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 2-octet field contains the current status of the tap request . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Error code
description: This 2-octet field contains the response message error code of the requested operation . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Header type
description: This 2-octet field contains the type of information contained in the header field . Currently   valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Header length
description: This 2-octet field contains the length of the header field . Currently   this field always contains a value of 12 .
:LABEL: field

name: Direction
description: This 2-octet field contains a value indicating the type of tap . Valid values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Probe port
description: This 4-octet field contains the logical port number ( on the probe switch ) to which the probe is attached .
:LABEL: field

name: RR
description: Reserved ( RR ): 2 bits MUST be set to zero by sender   SHOULD be ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: LLL
description: Interleave ( LLL ): 3 bits MUST have a value between 0 and 5 inclusive . The remaining two values ( 6 and 7 ) MUST not be used by senders . If this field is non-zero   interleaving is enabled . All receivers MUST support interleaving . Senders MAY support interleaving . Senders that do not support interleaving MUST set field LLL and NNN to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: NNN
description: Interleave Index ( NNN ): 3 bits MUST have a value less than or equal to the value of LLL . Values of NNN greater than the value of LLL are invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory ( M ) bit : Controls the behavior required of an implementation which receives an AVP which it does not recognize . If the M bit is set on an unrecognized AVP within a message associated with a particular session   the session associated with this message MUST be terminated . If the M bit is set on an unrecognized AVP within a message associated with the overall tunnel   the entire tunnel ( and all sessions within ) MUST be terminated . If the M bit is not set   an unrecognized AVP MUST be ignored . The control message must then continue to be processed as if the AVP had not been present .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory ( M ) bit : Controls the behavior required of an implementation which receives an AVP which it does not recognize . If the M bit is set on an unrecognized AVP within a message associated with a particular session   the session associated with this message MUST be terminated . If the M bit is set on an unrecognized AVP within a message associated with the overall tunnel   the entire tunnel ( and all sessions within ) MUST be terminated . If the M bit is not set   an unrecognized AVP MUST be ignored . The control message must then continue to be processed as if the AVP had not been present .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Hidden ( H ) bit : Identifies the hiding of data in the Attribute Value field of an AVP . This capability can be used to avoid the passing of sensitive data   such as user passwords   as cleartext in an AVP . Section 4.3 describes the procedure for performing AVP hiding .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Encodes the number of octets ( including the Overall Length and bitmask fields ) contained in this AVP . The Length may be calculated as 6 + the length of the Attribute Value field in octets . The field itself is 10 bits   permitting a maximum of 1023 octets of data in a single AVP . The minimum Length of an AVP is 6 . If the length is 6   then the Attribute Value field is absent .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: Vendor ID : The IANA assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes " [ RFC1700 ] value . The value 0   corresponding to IETF adopted attribute values   is used for all AVPs defined within this document . Any vendor wishing to implement their own L2TP extensions can use their own Vendor ID along with private Attribute
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: Attribute Type : A 2 octet value with a unique interpretation across all AVPs defined under a given Vendor ID .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The Message Type AVP   Attribute Type 0   identifies the control message herein and defines the context in which the exact meaning of the following AVPs will be determined .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code AVP   Attribute Type 1   indicates the reason for terminating the control channel or session .
:LABEL: field

name: Firmware Revision
description: The Firmware Revision AVP   Attribute Type 6   indicates the firmware revision of the issuing device .
:LABEL: field

name: Assigned Tunnel ID
description: The Assigned Tunnel ID AVP   Attribute Type 9   encodes the ID being assigned to this tunnel by the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Assigned Session ID
description: The Assigned Session ID AVP   Attribute Type 14   encodes the ID being assigned to this session by the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Call Serial Number
description: The Call Serial Number AVP   Attribute Type 15   encodes an identifier assigned by the LAC or LNS to this call .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum BPS
description: The Minimum BPS AVP   Attribute Type 16   encodes the lowest acceptable line speed for this call .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum BPS
description: The Maximum BPS AVP   Attribute Type 17   encodes the highest acceptable line speed for this call .
:LABEL: field

name: Physical Channel ID
description: The Physical Channel ID AVP   Attribute Type 25   encodes the vendor specific physical channel number used for a call .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved - Not used   MUST be 0 CRC Errors - Number of PPP frames received with CRC errors since call was established Framing Errors - Number of improperly framed PPP packets received Hardware Overruns - Number of receive buffer over-runs since call was established Buffer Overruns - Number of buffer over-runs detected since call was established Time-out Errors - Number of time-outs since call was established Alignment Errors - Number of alignment errors since call was established
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type ( Tx ) Connect Speed Framing Type
:LABEL: field

name: Physical Channel ID
description: Physical Channel ID
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type ( Tx ) Connect Speed Framing Type
:LABEL: field

name: ELT
description: ELT 000001 binary   the six-bit extended label type [ EDNS0 ] assigned to the Bit-String Label .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: Count The number of significant bits in the Label field . A Count value of zero indicates that 256 bits are significant . ( Thus the null label representing the DNS root cannot be represented as a Bit String Label .)
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type 8-bit value C2 ( hexadecimal ).
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: Opt Data Len 8-bit value 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Jumbo Payload Length
description: Jumbo Payload Length 32-bit unsigned integer . Length of the IPv6 packet in octets   excluding the IPv6 header but including the Hop-by-Hop Options header and any other extension headers present . Must be greater than 65 535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: There are three types of MLD messages :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Initialized to zero by the sender; ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The standard ICMPv6 checksum   covering the entire MLD message plus a " pseudo-header " of IPv6 header fields [ ICMPv6 IPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Response Delay
description: The Maximum Response Delay field is meaningful only in Query messages   and specifies the maximum allowed delay before sending a responding Report   in units of milliseconds . In all other messages   it is set to zero by the sender and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Initialized to zero by the sender; ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Address
description: In a Query message   the Multicast Address field is set to zero when sending a General Query   and set to a specific IPv6 multicast address when sending a Multicast-Address-Specific Query .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 - Request 2 - Response
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 - EAP TLS
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests . The Identifier field MUST be changed on each Request packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   and TLS Response fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 - EAP TLS
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags
:LABEL: field

name: TLS Message Length
description: The TLS Message Length field is four octets   and is present only if the L bit is set . This field provides the total length of the TLS message or set of messages that is being fragmented .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and MUST match the Identifier field from the corresponding request .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifir   Length   Type   and TLS data fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 - EAP TLS
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags
:LABEL: field

name: TLS Message Length
description: The TLS Message Length field is four octets   and is present only if the L bit is set . This field provides the total length of the TLS message or set of messages that is being fragmented .
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Header
description: FEC Header : The FEC header is the header information contained in an FEC packet .
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Payload
description: Associated : An FEC packet is said to be " associated " with one or more media packets when those media packets are used to generate the FEC packet ( by use of the exclusive or operation ).
:LABEL: field

description: p = wait_for_packet(); /* get packet from network */
:LABEL: field

name: SN base
description: SN base : 8 [ min(8 9 )] len . rec .: 1 [ 8 xor 9 ] E : 0 PTI rec .: 25 [ 11 xor 18 ] mask : 3 TS rec .: 6 [ 3 xor 5 ]
:LABEL: field

name: datagram_size
description: datagram_size : The encoded size of the entire IP datagram . The value of datagram_size SHALL be the same for all link fragments of an IP datagram and SHALL be one less than the value of Total Length in the datagram's IP header ( see STD 5   RFC 791 ).
:LABEL: field

name: ether_type
description: ether_type : This field is present only in the first link fragment and SHALL have a value of 0x0800   which indicates an IPv4 datagram .
:LABEL: field

name: fragment_offset
description: fragment_offset : This field is present only in the second and subsequent link fragments and SHALL specify the offset   in octets   of the fragment from the beginning of the IP datagram . The first octet of the datagram ( the start of the IP header ) has an offset of zero; the implicit value of fragment_offset in the first link fragment is zero .
:LABEL: field

name: dgl
description: dgl : The value of dgl ( datagram label ) SHALL be the same for all link fragments of an IP datagram . The sender SHALL increment dgl for successive   fragmented datagrams; the incremented value of dgl SHALL wrap from 65 535 back to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: hw_addr_len
description: hw_addr_len : This field indicates the size   in octets   of the 1394-dependent hardware address associated with an IP address and SHALL have a value of 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: IP_addr_len
description: IP_addr_len : This field indicates the size   in octets   of an IP version 4 ( IPv4 ) address and SHALL have a value of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: sender_max_rec
description: sender_max_rec : This field SHALL be equal to the value of max_rec in the sender's configuration ROM bus information block .
:LABEL: field

name: sspd
description: sspd : This field SHALL be set to the lesser of the sender's link speed and PHY speed . The link speed is the maximum speed at which the link may send or receive packets; the PHY speed is the maximum speed at which the PHY may send   receive or repeat packets . The table below specifies the encoding used for sspd; all values not specified are RESERVED for future standardization .
:LABEL: field

name: sender_unicast_FIFO_hi
description: sender_unicast_FIFO_hi and sender_unicast_FIFO_lo : These fields together SHALL specify the 48-bit offset of the sender's FIFO available for the receipt of IP datagrams in the format specified by section 6 . The offset of a sender's unicast FIFO SHALL NOT change   except as the result of a power reset .
:LABEL: field

name: sender_unicast_FIFO_lo
description: sender_unicast_FIFO_hi and sender_unicast_FIFO_lo : These fields together SHALL specify the 48-bit offset of the sender's FIFO available for the receipt of IP datagrams in the format specified by section 6 . The offset of a sender's unicast FIFO SHALL NOT change   except as the result of a power reset .
:LABEL: field

name: sender_IP_address
description: sender_IP_address : This field SHALL specify the IP address of the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: target_IP_address
description: target_IP_address : In a 1394 ARP request   this field SHALL specify the IP address from which the sender desires a response . In a 1394 ARP response   it SHALL be IGNORED .
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: length : This field SHALL contain the size   in octets   of the entire MCAP message .
:LABEL: field

name: message data
description: message data : The remainder of the MCAP message is variable in length and SHALL consist of zero or more group address descriptors with the format illustrated below .
:LABEL: field

name: length
description: length : This field SHALL contain the size   in octets   of the MCAP group address descriptor .
:LABEL: field

name: type
description: type : This field SHALL have a value of one   which indicates a group address descriptor .
:LABEL: field

name: expiration
description: expiration : The usage of this field varies according to opcode . For solicit messages the expiration field SHALL be IGNORED . Otherwise   for advertisements   this field SHALL contain a time - stamp   in seconds   that specifies a future time after which the channel number specified by channel may no longer be used .
:LABEL: field

name: channel
description: channel : This field is valid only for advertise messages   in which case it SHALL specify an allocated channel number   in the range zero to 63 inclusive . All other values are RESERVED .
:LABEL: field

name: speed
description: speed : This field is valid only for advertise messages   in which case it SHALL specify the speed at which stream packets for the indicated channel are transmitted . Table 2 specifies the encoding used for speed .
:LABEL: field

name: group_address
description: group_address : This variable length field SHALL specify the IP address of a particular IP multicast group . The length of group_address   in octets   is derived from the length of the group address descriptor by subtracting 12 from the length field .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 1999 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Compulsory = 0 ( not a compulsory extension ) u : Unused and MUST be set to zero . Type = 0x0009 Length = 0x0008
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

description: Mechanisms for describing and naming objects and events for the purpose of management . The first version of this Structure of Management Information ( SMI ) is called SMIv1 and described in STD 16   RFC 1155 [ 2 ]  STD 16   RFC 1212 [ 3 ] and RFC 1215 [ 4 ]. The second version   called SMIv2   is described in STD 58   RFC 2578 [ 5 ]  STD 58   RFC 2579 [ 6 ] and STD 58   RFC 2580 [ 7 ].
:LABEL: field

name: n_subid
description: The number ( 0-128 ) of sub-identifiers in the object identifier . An ordered list of " n_subid " 4-byte sub-identifiers follows the 4-byte header .
:LABEL: field

name: prefix
description: An unsigned value used to reduce the length of object identifier encodings . A non-zero value " x " is interpreted as the first sub-identifier after " internet " ( 1.3.6.1 )  and indicates an implicit prefix " internet.x " to the actual sub - identifiers encoded in the Object Identifier . For example   a prefix field value 2 indicates an implicit prefix " 1.3.6.1.2 ". A value of 0 in the prefix field indicates there is no prefix to the sub-identifiers .
:LABEL: field

name: include
description: Used only when the Object Identifier is the start of a SearchRange   as described in section 5.2   " SearchRange ".
:LABEL: field

description: A 4-byte unsigned integer   encoded according to the header's NETWORK_BYTE_ORDER bit .
:LABEL: field

name: v.type
description: Indicates the variable binding's syntax   and must be one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: h.version
description: The version of the AgentX protocol ( 1 for this memo ).
:LABEL: field

name: h.type
description: The PDU type; one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: h.flags
description: A bitmask   with bit 0 the least significant bit . The bit definitions are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: h.sessionID
description: The session ID uniquely identifies a session over which AgentX PDUs are exchanged between a subagent and the master agent . The session ID has no significance and no defined value in the agentx-Open-PDU sent by a subagent to open a session with the master agent; in this case   the master agent will assign a unique session ID that it will pass back in the corresponding agentx-Response-PDU . From that point on   that same session ID will appear in every AgentX PDU exchanged over that session between the master and the subagent . A subagent may establish multiple AgentX sessions by sending multiple agentx-Open-PDUs to the master agent .
:LABEL: field

name: h.transactionID
description: The transaction ID uniquely identifies   for a given session   the single SNMP management request ( and single SNMP PDU ) with which an AgentX PDU is associated . If a single SNMP management request results in multiple AgentX PDUs being sent by the master agent with the same session ID   each of these AgentX PDUs must contain the same transaction ID; conversely   AgentX PDUs sent during a particular session   that result from distinct SNMP management requests   must have distinct transaction IDs within the limits of the 32 - bit field ).
:LABEL: field

name: h.packetID
description: A packet ID generated by the sender for all AgentX PDUs except the agentx-Response-PDU . In an agentx-Response-PDU   the packet ID must be the same as that in the received AgentX PDU to which it is a response . A master agent might
:LABEL: field

name: h.payload_length
description: The size in octets of the PDU contents   excluding the 20 - byte header . As a result of the encoding schemes and PDU layouts   this value will always be either 0   or a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: c.reason
description: An enumerated value that gives the reason that the master agent or subagent closed the AgentX session . This field may take one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: r.timeout
description: The length of time   in seconds   that a master agent should allow to elapse after dispatching a message on a session before it regards the subagent as not responding . r.timeout applies only to messages that concern MIB objects within r.subtree . It overrides both the session's default value ( if any ) indicated when the AgentX session with the master agent was established   and the master agent's default timeout . The default value for r.timeout is 0 ( no override ).
:LABEL: field

name: r.priority
description: A value between 1 and 255   used to achieve a desired configuration when different sessions register identical or overlapping regions . Subagents with no particular knowledge of priority should register with the default value of 127 .
:LABEL: field

name: r.range_subid
description: Permits specifying a range in place of one of r.subtree's sub-identifiers . If this value is 0   no range is being specified and there is no r.upper_bound field present in the PDU . In this case the MIB region being registered is the single subtree named by r.subtree .
:LABEL: field

name: u.priority
description: The priority at which this region was originally registered .
:LABEL: field

name: u.range_subid
description: Indicates a sub-identifier in u.subtree is a range lower bound .
:LABEL: field

name: g.non_repeaters
description: The number of variables in the SearchRangeList that are not repeaters .
:LABEL: field

name: g.max_repetitions
description: The maximum number of repetitions requested for repeating variables .
:LABEL: field

name: h.sessionID
description: If this is a response to an agentx-Open-PDU   then it contains the new and unique sessionID ( as assigned by the master agent ) for this session .
:LABEL: field

name: h.transactionID
description: Must be identical to the h.transactionID value in the PDU to which this PDU is a response .
:LABEL: field

name: h.packetID
description: Must be identical to the h.packetID value in the PDU to which this PDU is a response .
:LABEL: field

name: res.sysUpTime
description: This field contains the current value of sysUpTime for the context indicated within the PDU to which this PDU is a response . It is relevant only in agentx response PDUs sent from the master agent to a subagent in response to the set of administrative PDUs listed in section 6.1   " AgentX PDU Header ".
:LABEL: field

name: res.error
description: Indicates error status . Within responses to the set of " administrative " PDU types listed in section 6.1   " AgentX PDU Header "  values are limited to the following :
:LABEL: field

name: res.index
description: In error cases   this is the index of the failed variable binding within a received request PDU . ( Note : As explained in section 5.4   " Value Representation "  the index values of variable bindings within a variable binding list are 1 - based .)
:LABEL: field

name: v.type
description: - An unrecognized value is encountered for h.type   v.type   etc .
:LABEL: field

description: 2 ) Use that value to fully qualify the MIB region(s )  and attempt to register using the default priority .
:LABEL: field

description: ( a ) if the second VarBind is not snmpTrapOID.0   res.error is set to ` processingError ' and res.index to 2
:LABEL: field

description: ( a ) if the first VarBind is not snmpTrapOID.0   res.error is set to ` processingError ' and res.index to 1
:LABEL: field

description: If a subagent does not receive a response to its pings   or if it is able to detect ( from the underlying transport ) that the master agent is not able to receive AgentX messages   then it eventually must initiate a new AgentX session   re-register its MIB regions   etc .
:LABEL: field

description: Because AgentX supports registration of duplicate and overlapping regions   it is possible for the master agent to obtain a value for a requested varbind from within multiple registered MIB regions .
:LABEL: field

description: The master agent may choose to send agentx-Get-PDUs while servicing an SNMP GetNextRequest-PDU . The master agent may choose to send agentx-Get-PDUs or agentx-GetNext-PDUs while servicing an SNMP GetBulkRequest-PDU . One possible reason for this would be if the current iteration has targeted instance-level registrations .
:LABEL: field

description: For Get/GetNext/GetBulk operations   at any stage of the possibly iterative process   the master agent may need to dispatch several SearchRanges to a particular subagent session . The master agent may send one   some   or all of the SearchRanges in a single AgentX PDU .
:LABEL: field

description: The master agent chooses a timeout value for each MIB region being queried   which is
:LABEL: field

description: Within a lexicographically ordered set of registered MIB regions   valid for the indicated context   locate the authoritative region ( according to section 7.1.4.1   " Handling Duplicate and Overlapping Subtrees ") that contains the binding's name .
:LABEL: field

description: Within a lexicographically ordered set of registered MIB regions   valid for the indicated context   locate the authoritative region ( according to section 7.1.4.1   " Handling Duplicate and Overlapping Subtrees ") that
:LABEL: field

description: ( 2 ) If the starting OID exactly matches the name of a variable instantiated by this subagent within the indicated context and session   v.type and v.data are encoded to represent the variable's syntax and value   as described in section 5.4   " Value Representation ".
:LABEL: field

name: Max-RSVP-hops
description: An octet specifying the maximum number of RSVP hops over which information will be collected . If an error condition in the middle of the path prevents the DREQ packet from reaching the specified ending node   the Max-RSVP-hops field may be used to perform an expanding-length search to reach the point just before
:LABEL: field

name: RSVP-hop-count
description: Records the number of RSVP hops that have been traversed so far . If the starting and ending nodes are the same   this value will be 1 in the resulting DREP message .
:LABEL: field

name: SENDER_TEMPLATE object
description: This IPv4/IPv6 SENDER_TEMPLATE object contains the IP address and the port of a sender for the session being diagnosed . The DREQ packet is forwarded hop-by-hop towards this address .
:LABEL: field

name: RSVP Node List
description: A list of RSVP node IPv4 addresses . The number of addresses in this list can be computed from the object size .
:LABEL: field

name: R-pointer
description: Used in DREP messages only ( see Section 4.2 for details )  but it is incremented as each hop adds its incoming interface address in the ROUTE object .
:LABEL: field

name: DREQ Arrival Time
description: A 32-bit NTP timestamp specifying the time the DREQ message arrived at this node . The 32-bit form of an NTP timestamp consists of the middle 32 bits of the full 64-bit form   that is   the low 16 bits of the integer part and the high 16 bits of the fractional part .
:LABEL: field

name: Incoming Interface Address
description: Specifies the IP address of the interface on which messages from the sender are expected to arrive   or 0 if unknown .
:LABEL: field

name: Outgoing Interface Address
description: Specifies the IP address of the interface through which the DREQ message arrived and to which messages from the given sender and for the specified session address flow   or 0 if unknown .
:LABEL: field

name: Previous-RSVP-Hop Router Address
description: Specifies the IP address from which this node receives RSVP PATH messages for this source   or 0 if unknown . This is also the interface to which the DREQ will be forwarded .
:LABEL: field

name: D-TTL
description: The number of IP hops this DREQ message traveled from the down - stream RSVP node to the current node .
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: The refresh timer multiple ( defined in [ RSVP ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Timer value
description: The local refresh timer value in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: A B C - routers * - boundary interface + - interface
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version : The version defined in this document is version 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Big  scope bit ( B ): If clear   indicates that the addresses in the scoped range are not subdividable   and that address allocators may utilize the entire range . If set   address allocators should not use the entire range   but should learn an appropriate sub-range via another mechanism ( e.g .  AAP [ 7 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: PTYPE
description: Packet Type ( PTYPE ): The packet types defined in this document are : 0 : Zone Announcement Message ( ZAM ) 1 : Zone Limit Exceeded ( ZLE ) 2 : Zone Convexity Message ( ZCM ) 3 : Not-Inside Message ( NIM )
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: Address Family : The IANA-assigned address family number [ 10 11 ] identifying the address family for all addresses in the packet . The families defined for IP are : 1 : IPv4 2 : IPv6
:LABEL: field

name: Zone Start Address
description: Zone Start Address : 32 bits ( IPv4 ) or 128 bits ( IPv6 ) This gives the start address for the scope zone boundary . For example   if the zone is a boundary for 239.1.0.0 to 239.1.0.255   then Zone Start Address is 239.1.0.0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Zone End Address
description: Zone End Address : 32 bits ( IPv4 ) or 128 bits ( IPv6 ) This gives the ending address for the scope zone boundary . For example   if the zone is a boundary for 239.1.0.0 to 239.1.0.255   then Zone End Address is 239.1.0.255 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Origin
description: Message Origin : 32 bits ( IPv4 ) or 128 bits ( IPv6 ) This gives the IP address of the interface that originated the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Zone ID Address
description: Zone ID Address : 32 bits ( IPv4 ) or 128 bits ( IPv6 ) This gives the lowest IP address of a boundary router that has been observed in the zone originating the message . Together with Zone Start Address and Zone End Address   it forms a unique ID for the zone . Note that this ID is usually different from the ID of the Local Scope zone in which the origin resides .
:LABEL: field

name: ZT
description: Zones Traveled ( ZT ): 8 bits This gives the number of Local Zone IDs contained in this message path .
:LABEL: field

name: ZTL
description: Zones Traveled Limit ( ZTL ): 8 bits This gives the limit on number of local zones that the packet can traverse before it MUST be dropped . A value of 0 indicates that no limit exists .
:LABEL: field

name: Hold Time
description: Hold Time : The time   in seconds   after which the receiver should assume the scope no longer exists   if no subsequent ZAM is received . This should be set to [ ZAM-HOLDTIME ].
:LABEL: field

name: ZNUM
description: Number of ZBR addresses ( ZNUM ): 8 bits This field gives the number of ZBR Addresses contained in this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Hold Time
description: Hold Time : The time   in seconds   after which the receiver should assume the sender is no longer reachable   if no subsequent ZCM is received . This should be set to [ ZCM-HOLDTIME ].
:LABEL: field

name: MZAP Header
description: MZAP Header : Header fields identifying the scope X . The Name Count may be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: ZTL
description: The ZAM packet also contains a Zones Traveled Limit ( ZTL ). If the number of Local Zone IDs in the ZAM path becomes equal to the Zones Traveled Limit   the packet will be dropped . The ZTL field is set when the packet is first sent   and defaults to 32   but can be set to a lower value if a network administrator knows the expected size of the zone .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2000 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 131 ( skippable ) [ 7 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length in bytes of the MN-NAI field
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version = the version of KEEPER being used ( in this document   the version is 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Version = the version of KEEPER being used ( in this document   the version is 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: Version = the version of KEEPER being used ( in this document   the version is 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: volume
description: volume : For DTMF digits and other events representable as tones   this field describes the power level of the tone   expressed in dBm0 after dropping the sign . Power levels range from 0 to - 63 dBm0 . The range of valid DTMF is from 0 to - 36 dBm0 ( must accept); lower than - 55 dBm0 must be rejected ( TR-TSY-000181   ITU-T Q.24A ). Thus   larger values denote lower volume . This value is defined only for DTMF digits . For other events   it is set to zero by the sender and is ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: duration
description: duration : Duration of this digit   in timestamp units . Thus   the event began at the instant identified by the RTP timestamp and has so far lasted as long as indicated by this parameter . The event may or may not have ended .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : If set to a value of one   the " end " bit indicates that this packet contains the end of the event . Thus   the duration parameter above measures the complete duration of the event .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : This field is reserved for future use . The sender MUST set it to zero   the receiver MUST ignore it .
:LABEL: field

name: modulation
description: modulation : The modulation frequency   in Hz . The field is a 9-bit unsigned integer   allowing modulation frequencies up to 511 Hz . If there is no modulation   this field has a value of zero .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : If the " T " bit is set ( one )  the modulation frequency is to be divided by three . Otherwise   the modulation frequency is taken as is .
:LABEL: field

name: volume
description: volume : The power level of the tone   expressed in dBm0 after dropping the sign   with range from 0 to - 63 dBm0 . ( Note : A preferred level range for digital tone generators is - 8 dBm0 to - 3 dBm0 .)
:LABEL: field

name: duration
description: duration : The duration of the tone   measured in timestamp units . The tone begins at the instant identified by the RTP timestamp and lasts for the duration value .
:LABEL: field

name: frequency
description: frequency : The frequencies of the tones to be added   measured in Hz and represented as a 12-bit unsigned integer . The field size is sufficient to represent frequencies up to 4095 Hz
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : This field is reserved for future use . The sender MUST set it to zero   the receiver MUST ignore it .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): The assignment of an RTP payload type for this new packet format is outside the scope of this document   and will not be specified here . It is expected that the RTP profile for a particular class of applications will assign a payload type for this encoding   or if that is not done then a payload type in the dynamic range shall be chosen .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker ( M ) bit : Set to one if the pointer icon is changed in this packet .
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: Extension ( X ) bit : Defined by the RTP profile used .
:LABEL: field

name: CC
description: CC and CSRC fields are used as described in RFC 1889 [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: PIN
description: PIN : Pointer Icon Number ( 3 bits ) selects a pointer icon . The association between the PIN numbers and the icon pictures MUST be established out-of-band . PIN = 0 represents a default pointer icon . Applications which only support a single pointer icon SHOULD set the PIN field to zero . Applications MAY ignore non-zero PIN values on reception   and display a default icon .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies . The RADIUS server can detect a duplicate request if it has the same client source IP address and source UDP port and Identifier within a short span of time .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field MUST be treated as padding and ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it MUST be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4096 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the reply from the RADIUS server   and is used in the password hiding algorithm .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Access-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet random number   called the Request Authenticator . The value SHOULD be unpredictable and unique over the lifetime of a secret ( the password shared between the client and the RADIUS server )  since repetition of a request value in conjunction with the same secret would permit an attacker to reply with a previously intercepted response . Since it is expected that the same secret MAY be used to authenticate with servers in disparate geographic regions   the Request Authenticator field SHOULD exhibit global and temporal uniqueness .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The value of the Authenticator field in Access-Accept   Access - Reject   and Access-Challenge packets is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of : the RADIUS packet   beginning with the Code field   including the Identifier   the Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Access-Request packet   and the response Attributes   followed by the shared secret . That is   ResponseAuth = MD5(Code+ID+Length+RequestAuth+Attributes+Secret ) where + denotes concatenation .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Access-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions   the Identifier MUST remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator value MUST be changed each time a new Identifier is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 3 for Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Reject .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 11 for Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Access-Request which caused this Access-Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator value is calculated from the Access - Request value   as described earlier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 6 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this Attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Request but with an invalid Length   an Access-Reject SHOULD be transmitted . If an Attribute is received in an Access-Accept   Access-Reject or Access-Challenge packet with an invalid length   the packet MUST either be treated as an Access-Reject or else silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the Attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 for User-Name .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 2 for User-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: At least 18 and no larger than 130 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 3 for CHAP-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: CHAP Ident
description: This field is one octet   and contains the CHAP Identifier from the user's CHAP Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 4 for NAS-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 5 for NAS-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 6 for Service-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 7 for Framed-Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8 for Framed-IP-Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS Should allow the user to select an address ( e.g . Negotiated ). The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an address for the user ( e.g . Assigned from a pool of addresses kept by the NAS ). Other valid values indicate that the NAS should use that value as the user's IP address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 9 for Framed-IP-Netmask .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets specifying the IP netmask of the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 10 for Framed-Routing .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 11 for Filter-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 12 for Framed-MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 64 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 for Framed-Compression .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 14 for Login-IP-Host .
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS SHOULD allow the user to select an address . The value 0 indicates that the NAS SHOULD select a host to connect the user to . Other values indicate the address the NAS SHOULD connect the user to .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 15 for Login-Service .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 16 for Login-TCP-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 18 for Reply-Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 19 for Callback-Number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 20 for Callback-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 22 for Framed-Route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 23 for Framed-IPX-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . The value 0xFFFFFFFE indicates that the NAS should select an IPX network for the user ( e.g . assigned from a pool of one or more IPX networks kept by the NAS ). Other values should be used as the IPX network for the link to the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 24 for State .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 25 for Class .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 26 for Vendor-Specific .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order   as defined in the " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 27 for Session-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of seconds this user should be allowed to remain connected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 28 for Idle-Timeout .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of consecutive seconds of idle time this user should be permitted before being disconnected by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 29 for Termination-Action .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value of 0 indicates that this is an unnumbered serial link . A value of 1-65535 means that the serial line between the NAS and the user should be assigned that value as an AppleTalk network number .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 38 for Framed-AppleTalk-Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Despite the size of the field   values range from 0 to 65535 . The special value 0 indicates that the NAS should assign a network for the user   using its default cable range . A value between 1 and 65535 ( inclusive ) indicates the AppleTalk Network the NAS should probe to find an address for the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 39 for Framed-AppleTalk-Zone .

name: Type
description: 60 for CHAP-Challenge .

name: Type
description: 61 for NAS-Port-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . " Virtual " refers to a connection to the NAS via some transport protocol   instead of through a physical port . For example   if a user telnetted into a NAS to
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 62 for Port-Limit .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer with the maximum number of ports this user should be allowed to connect to on the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 63 for Login-LAT-Port .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The Code field is one octet   and identifies the type of RADIUS packet . When a packet is received with an invalid Code field   it is silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet   and aids in matching requests and replies . The RADIUS server can detect a duplicate request if it has the same client source IP address and source UDP port and Identifier within a short span of time .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets . It indicates the length of the packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Authenticator and Attribute fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field MUST be treated as padding and ignored on reception . If the packet is shorter than the Length field indicates   it MUST be silently discarded . The minimum length is 20 and maximum length is 4095 .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field is sixteen ( 16 ) octets . The most significant octet is transmitted first . This value is used to authenticate the messages between the client and RADIUS accounting server .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: In Accounting-Request Packets   the Authenticator value is a 16 octet MD5 [ 5 ] checksum   called the Request Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Authenticator field in an Accounting-Response packet is called the Response Authenticator   and contains a one-way MD5 hash calculated over a stream of octets consisting of the Accounting - Response Code   Identifier   Length   the Request Authenticator field from the Accounting-Request packet being replied to   and the response attributes if any   followed by the shared secret . The resulting 16 octet MD5 hash value is stored in the Authenticator field of the Accounting-Response packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 4 for Accounting-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field MUST be changed whenever the content of the Attributes field changes   and whenever a valid reply has been received for a previous request . For retransmissions where the contents are identical   the Identifier MUST remain unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Authenticator
description: The Request Authenticator of an Accounting-Request contains a 16-octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Request Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 5 for Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is a copy of the Identifier field of the Accounting-Request which caused this Accounting-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Response Authenticator
description: The Response Authenticator of an Accounting-Response contains a 16-octet MD5 hash value calculated according to the method described in " Response Authenticator " above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 6 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an attribute is received in an Accounting-Request with an invalid Length   the entire request MUST be silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of the RADIUS Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 5 ]. Values 192-223 are reserved for experimental use   values 224-240 are reserved for implementation-specific use   and values 241-255 are reserved and should not be used . This specification concerns the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is one octet   and indicates the length of this attribute including the Type   Length and Value fields . If an attribute is received in a packet with an invalid Length   the entire request should be silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Type and Length fields .

name: Type
description: 70 for ARAP-Password .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This attribute contains a 16 octet string   used to carry the dial-in user's response to the NAS challenge and the client's own challenge to the NAS . The high-order octets ( Value1 and Value2 ) contain the dial-in user's challenge to the NAS ( 2 32-bit numbers   8 octets ) and the low-order octets ( Value3 and Value4 ) contain the dial-in user's response to the NAS challenge ( 2 32-bit numbers   8 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 71 for ARAP-Features .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is a compound string containing information the NAS should send to the user in the ARAP " feature flags " packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value1 : If zero   user cannot change their password . If non-zero user can . ( RADIUS does not handle the password changing   just the attribute which indicates whether ARAP indicates they can .)
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value3 : Password creation date in Macintosh format   defined as 32 unsigned bits representing seconds since Midnight GMT January 1   1904 .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value3 : Password creation date in Macintosh format   defined as 32 unsigned bits representing seconds since Midnight GMT January 1   1904 .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value4 : Password Expiration Delta from create date in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value5 : Current RADIUS time in Macintosh format .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 72 for ARAP-Zone-Access .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets encoding an integer with one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 73 for ARAP-Security .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing an integer specifying the security module signature   which is a Macintosh OSType . ( Macintosh OSTypes are 4 ascii characters cast as a 32-bit integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 74 for ARAP-Security-Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 75 for Password-Retry .

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing an integer specifying the number of password retry attempts to permit the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 76 for Prompt .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 77 for Connect-Info .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 78 for Configuration-Token .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 79 for EAP-Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 80 for Message-Authenticator
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 84 for ARAP-Challenge-Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field contains an 8 octet response to the dial-in client's challenge . The RADIUS server calculates this value by taking the dial-in client's challenge from the high order 8 octets of the ARAP-Password attribute and performing DES encryption on this value with the authenticating user's password as the key . If the user's password is less than 8 octets in length   the password is padded at the end with NULL octets to a length of 8 before using it as a key .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 85 for Acct-Interim-Interval .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field contains the number of seconds between each interim update to be sent from the NAS for this session . The value MUST NOT be smaller than 60 . The value SHOULD NOT be smaller than 600   and careful consideration should be given to its impact on network traffic .
:LABEL: field

description: 87 for NAS-Port-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 88 for Framed-Pool
:LABEL: field

name: Pads
description: Any PPP frame may have padding inserted in the " Optional Data Link Layer Padding " field . This number tells the receiving system how many pad octets to strip off .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: Up-to-date values of the MAC Type field are specified in the most recent " Assigned Numbers " RFC [ 4 ]. Current values are assigned as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Control
description: On 802.4   802.5   and FDDI LANs   there are a few octets preceding the Destination MAC Address   one of which is protected by the FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination MAC Address
description: As defined by the IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: Source MAC Address
description: As defined by the IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame FCS
description: Mentioned primarily for clarity . The FCS used on the PPP link is separate from and unrelated to the LAN FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Pads

description: On 802.4   802.5   and FDDI LANs   there are a few octets preceding the Destination MAC Address   one of which is protected by the FCS .

name: Destination MAC Address
description: As defined by the IEEE . The MAC Type field defines the bit ordering .

name: LAN Segment Number
description: A 12-bit number identifying the LAN segment   as defined in the IEEE 802.1D Source Routing Specification .
:LABEL: field

name: LAN Segment Number
description: A 12-bit number identifying the LAN segment   as defined in the IEEE 802.1D Source Routing Specification .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: One of the values of the PDU MAC Type field ( previously described in the " Bridged LAN Traffic " section ) that this system is prepared to receive and service .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2 octets plus 1 additional octet for each protocol that will be actively supported . Most systems will only support a single spanning tree protocol   resulting in a length of 3 .
