:LABEL: field

name: R
description: This single bit field is used to identify which ring this packet is designated for . The designation is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: PRI
description: This three bit field indicates the priority level of the SRP packet ( 0 through 7 ). The higher the value the higher the priority . Since there are only two queues in the transit buffer ( HPTB and LPTB ) a packet is treated as either low or high priority once it is on the ring . Each node determines the threshold value for determining what is considered a high priority packet and what is considered a low priority packet . However   the full 8 levels of priority in the SRP header can be used prior to transmission onto the ring ( transmit queues ) as well as after reception from the ring ( receive queues ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Type
description: The protocol type is a two octet field like that used in EtherType representation . Current defined values relevant to SRP are defined in Table 3 below .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Ver
description: This one octet field is the version number associated with the control type field . Initially   all control types will be version 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Type
description: This one octet field represents the control message type . Table 4 contains the currently defined control types .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Type
description: Control Type Description
:LABEL: field

name: Control TTL
description: The Control TTL is a control layer hop-count that must be decremented every time a node forwards a control packet . If a node receives a control packet with a control TTL <= 1   then it should accept the packet but not forward it .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Checksum
description: The checksum field is the 16 bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of all 16 bit words starting with the control version . If there are an odd number of octets to be checksummed   the last octet is padded on the right with zeros to form a 16 bit word for checksum purposes . The pad is not transmitted as part of the segment . While computing the checksum   the checksum field itself is replaced with zeros . This is the same checksum algorithm as that used for TCP . The checksum does not cover the 32 bit SRP FCS .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload
description: The payload is a variable length field dependent on the control type .
:LABEL: field

name: Topology Length
description: This two octet field represents the length of the topology message in octets starting with the first MAC Type/MAC Address binding .
:LABEL: field

name: Originator MAC Address
description: This is the MAC address of the originator of the IPS message . It is not necessarily the same as the SRP Header Source Address as a node may be simply propagating an IPS message ( see the section " SRP IPS Protocol Rules " Rule P.8 as an example ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 138 ( decimal )  the ICMPv6 type value assigned to Router Renumbering
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0 for a Router Renumbering Command 1 for a Router Renumbering Result 255 for a Sequence Number Reset . The Sequence Number Reset is described in section 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMPv6 checksum   as specified in [ ICMPV6 ]. The checksum covers the IPv6 pseudo-header and all fields of the RR message from the Type field onward .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags A combination of one-bit flags . Five are defined and three bits are reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: The flags T   R   A and S have defined meanings in an RR Command message . In a Result message they MUST be copied from the corresponding Command . The P flag is meaningful only in a Result message and MUST be zero in a transmitted Command and ignored in a received Command .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: The flags T   R   A and S have defined meanings in an RR Command message . In a Result message they MUST be copied from the corresponding Command . The P flag is meaningful only in a Result message and MUST be zero in a transmitted Command and ignored in a received Command .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Result requested -- 0 indicates that a Result message MUST NOT be sent ( but other forms of logging are not precluded); 1 indicates that the router MUST send a Result message upon completion of processing the Command message;
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A All interfaces -- 0 indicates that the Command MUST NOT be applied to interfaces which are administratively shut down; 1 indicates that the Command MUST be applied to all interfaces regardless of administrative shutdown status .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Site-specific -- This flag MUST be ignored unless the router treats interfaces as belonging to different " sites ". 0 indicates that the Command MUST be applied to interfaces regardless of which site they belong to; 1 indicates that the Command MUST be applied only to interfaces which belong to the same site as the interface to which the Command is addressed . If the destination address is appropriate for interfaces belonging to more than one site   then the Command MUST be applied only to interfaces belonging to the same site as the interface on which the Command was received .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P Processed previously -- 0 indicates that the Result message contains the complete report of processing the Command;
:LABEL: field

name: MaxDelay
description: MaxDelay An unsigned 16-bit field specifying the maximum time   in milliseconds   by which a router MUST delay sending any reply to this Command . Implementations MAY generate the random delay between 0 and MaxDelay milliseconds with a finer granularity than 1ms .
:LABEL: field

name: OpLength
description: OpLength The total length of this Prefix Control Operation   in units of 8 octets . A valid OpLength will always be of the form 4N+3   with N equal to the number of UsePrefix parts ( possibly zero ).
:LABEL: field

name: Ordinal
description: Ordinal An 8-bit field which MUST have a different value in each Prefix Control Operation contained in a given RR Command message . The value is otherwise unconstrained .
:LABEL: field

name: MatchLen
description: MatchLen An 8-bit unsigned integer between 0 and 128 inclusive specifying the number of initial bits of MatchPrefix which are significant in matching .
:LABEL: field

name: MinLen
description: MinLen An 8-bit unsigned integer specifying the minimum length which any configured prefix must have in order to be eligible for testing against the MatchPrefix .
:LABEL: field

name: MaxLen
description: MaxLen An 8-bit unsigned integer specifying the maximum length which any configured prefix may have in order to be eligible for testing against the MatchPrefix .
:LABEL: field

name: UseLen
description: UseLen An 8-bit unsigned integer less than or equal to 128 specifying the number of initial bits of UsePrefix to use in creating a new prefix for an interface .
:LABEL: field

name: KeepLen
description: KeepLen An 8-bit unsigned integer less than or equal to ( 128 - UseLen ) specifying the number of bits of the prefix or address which matched the associated Match-Prefix which should be retained in the new prefix . The retained bits are those at positions UseLen through ( UseLen+KeepLen-1 ) in the matched address or prefix   and they are copied to the same positions in the New Prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: FlagMask
description: FlagMask An 8-bit mask . A 1 bit in any position means that the corresponding flag bit in a Router Advertisement ( RA ) Prefix Information Option for the New Prefix should be set from the RAFlags field in this Use-Prefix Part . A 0 bit in the FlagMask means that the RA flag bit for the New Prefix should be copied from the corresponding RA flag bit of the Matched Prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: RAFlags
description: RAFlags An 8 bit field which   under control of the FlagMask field   may be used to initialize the flags in Router Advertisement Prefix Information Options [ ND ] which advertise the New Prefix . Note that only two flags have
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V A 1-bit flag indicating that the valid lifetime of the New Prefix MUST be effectively decremented in real time .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P A 1-bit flag indicating that the preferred lifetime of the New Prefix MUST be effectively decremented in real time .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B A one-bit flag which   when set   indicates that one or more fields in the associated PCO were out of bounds . The bounds check is described in section 4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F A one-bit flag which   when set   indicates that one or more Use-Prefix parts from the associated PCO were not honored by the router because of attempted formation of a forbidden prefix format   such as a multicast or loopback address .
:LABEL: field

name: Ordinal
description: Ordinal Copied from the Prefix Control Operation whose MatchPrefix matched the MatchedPrefix on the interface indicated by InterfaceIndex .
:LABEL: field

name: MatchedLen
description: InterfaceIndex The router's numeric designation of the interface on which the MatchedPrefix was configured . This MUST be the same as the value of ipv6IfIndex which designates that index in the SNMP IPv6 MIB General Group [ IPV6MIB ].
:LABEL: field

name: OpCode
description: OpCode must be a defined value .
:LABEL: field

name: OpLength
description: OpLength must be of the form 4N+3 and consistent the the length of the Command packet and the PCO's offset within the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: MatchLen
description: MatchLen must be between 0 and 128 inclusive
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T(N ) The time between Command transmissions N and N+1 is V*T(N ) + MaxDelay   where V is random and roughly uniform in the range [ 0.75   1.0 ]. T(1 ) = Ti and for N > 1   T(N ) = min(2*T(N-1 )  Tu ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R(N F ) The total number of RR Result messages   including duplicates   received by the end of the Nth interval from those routers which were NOT heard from in any of the first F intervals .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: R(N F ) The total number of RR Result messages   including duplicates   received by the end of the Nth interval from those routers which were NOT heard from in any of the first F intervals .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This 2-octet unsigned integer indicates the total length of the message   including the header   in octets . Thus   e.g .  it allows one to locate in the transport-level stream the start of the next message . The value of the Length field must always be at least 4 and no greater than 4096   and may be further constrained   depending on the message type . No " padding " of extra data after the message is allowed   so the Length field must have the smallest value required given the rest of the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : This 1-octet unsigned integer indicates the type code of the message . The following type codes are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : This 1-octet field is reserved . MUST be set to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version : This 1-octet unsigned integer indicates the protocol version number of the message . The current MASC version number is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: AddrFam
description: AddrFam : This 5-bit field is the IANA-assigned address family number of the encoded prefix [ IANA ]. These include ( among others ):
:LABEL: field

name: Rol
description: My Role ( Rol ): This 2-bit field indicates the proposed relationship of the sending system to the receiving system : 00 = INTERNAL_PEER ( sent from one internal peer to another ) 01 = CHILD ( sent from a child to its parent ) 10 = SIBLING ( sent from one sibling to another ) 11 = PARENT ( sent from a parent to its child )
:LABEL: field

name: Hold Time
description: Hold Time : This 2-octet unsigned integer indicates the number of seconds that the sender proposes for the value of the Hold Timer . Upon receipt of an OPEN message   a MASC speaker MUST calculate the value of the Hold Timer by using the smaller of its configured Hold Time for that peer and the Hold Time received in the OPEN message . The Hold Time MUST be either zero or at least three seconds . An implementation may reject connections on the basis of the Hold Time . The calculated value indicates the maximum number of seconds that may elapse between the receipt of successive KEEPALIVE and/or UPDATE messages by the sender . RECOMMENDED value is [ HOLDTIME ] seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The Length is the length of the entire attribute   including the length   type   and data fields . If other attributes are nested within the data field   the length includes the size of all such nested attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : This 1-octet unsigned integer indicates the type code of the attribute . The following type codes are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : This 1-octet field is reserved . MUST be set to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved1 : This 1-octet field is reserved . MUST be set to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D-bit : DEPRECATED_PREFIX bit . If set   indicates that the advertised address prefix is Deprecated   otherwise the prefix is Active ( see Section 4.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: AddrFam
description: AddrFam : This 5-bit field is the IANA-assigned address family number of the encoded prefix [ IANA ].
:LABEL: field

name: Rol
description: Rol : This 2-bit field indicates the relationship/role of the Origin of the message to the node sending that message : 00 = INTERNAL ( originated by the sender's domain ) 01 = CHILD ( originated by a child of the sender's domain ) 10 = SIBLING ( originated by a sibling of the sender's domain ) 11 = PARENT ( originated by a parent of the sender's domain )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved2 : This 2-octet field is reserved . MUST be set to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Timestamp
description: Claim Timestamp : The timestamp of the claim when it was originated . The timestamp is expressed in number of seconds since midnight ( 0 hour )  January 1   1970   Greenwich .
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Lifetime
description: Claim Lifetime : The time in seconds between the Claim Timestamp   and the time at which the prefix will become free .
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Holdtime
description: Claim Holdtime : The time in seconds between the Claim Timestamp   and the time at which the claim should be deleted from the local cache . For PREFIX_IN_USE and PREFIX_MANAGED claims it should be equal to Claim Lifetime; for CLAIM_TO_EXPAND   NEW_CLAIM   and CLAIM_DENIED it should be equal to [ WAITING_PERIOD ].
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O-bit : Open-bit . If zero   it indicates that the sender will close the connection . If ' 1 '  it indicates that the sender has chosen to keep the connection open .
:LABEL: field

name: Error subcode
description: Error subcode : This 1-octet unsigned integer provides more specific information about the nature of the reported error . Each Error Code may have one or more Error Subcodes associated with it . If no appropriate Error Subcode is defined   then a zero ( Unspecific ) value is used for the Error Subcode field   and the O-bit must be zero ( i.e . the connection will be closed ). The notation used in the error description below is : MC = Must Close connection = O-bit is zero; CC = Can Close connection = O-bit might be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: Data : This variable-length field is used to diagnose the reason for the NOTIFICATION . The contents of the Data field depend upon the Error Code and Error Subcode . See Section 8 for more details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Role   D-bit   Type
:LABEL: field

name: AddrFam
description: o AddrFam
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Timestamp
description: o Claim Timestamp
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Lifetime
description: o Claim Lifetime
:LABEL: field

name: Claim Holdtime
description: o Claim Holdtime
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: o Transmission Sequence Number ( TSN ): A 32-bit sequence number used internally by SCTP . One TSN is attached to each chunk containing user data to permit the receiving SCTP endpoint to acknowledge its receipt and detect duplicate deliveries .
:LABEL: field

name: Verification Tag
description: o Verification Tag : A 32 bit unsigned integer that is randomly generated . The Verification Tag provides a key that allows a receiver to verify that the SCTP packet belongs to the current association and is not an old or stale packet from a previous association .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: TSN - Transmission Sequence Number
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port Number
description: This is the SCTP sender's port number . It can be used by the receiver in combination with the source IP address   the SCTP destination port and possibly the destination IP address to identify the association to which this packet belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port Number
description: This is the SCTP port number to which this packet is destined . The receiving host will use this port number to de-multiplex the SCTP packet to the correct receiving endpoint/application .
:LABEL: field

name: Verification Tag
description: The receiver of this packet uses the Verification Tag to validate the sender of this SCTP packet . On transmit   the value of this Verification Tag MUST be set to the value of the Initiate Tag received from the peer endpoint during the association initialization   with the following exceptions :
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: This field contains the checksum of this SCTP packet . Its calculation is discussed in Section 6.8 . SCTP uses the Adler - 32 algorithm as described in Appendix B for calculating the checksum
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Type
description: This field identifies the type of information contained in the Chunk Value field . It takes a value from 0 to 254 . The value of 255 is reserved for future use as an extension field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: The usage of these bits depends on the chunk type as given by the Chunk Type . Unless otherwise specified   they are set to zero on transmit and are ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Length
description: This value represents the size of the chunk in bytes including the Chunk Type   Chunk Flags   Chunk Length   and Chunk Value fields . Therefore   if the Chunk Value field is zero-length   the Length field will be set to 4 . The Chunk Length field does not count any padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Value
description: The Chunk Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the chunk . The usage and format of this field is dependent on the Chunk Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Should be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field indicates the length of the DATA chunk in bytes from the beginning of the type field to the end of the user data field excluding any padding . A DATA chunk with no user data field will have Length set to 16 ( indicating 16 bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: This value represents the TSN for this DATA chunk . The valid range of TSN is from 0 to 4294967295 ( 2**32 - 1 ). TSN wraps back to 0 after reaching 4294967295 .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier S
description: Identifies the stream to which the following user data belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Sequence Number n
description: This value represents the stream sequence number of the following user data within the stream S . Valid range is 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Protocol Identifier
description: This value represents an application ( or upper layer ) specified protocol identifier . This value is passed to SCTP by its upper layer and sent to its peer . This identifier is not used by SCTP but can be used by certain network entities as well as the peer application to identify the type of information being carried in this DATA chunk . This field must be sent even in fragmented DATA chunks ( to make sure it is available for agents in the middle of the network ).
:LABEL: field

name: Initiate Tag
description: The receiver of the INIT ( the responding end ) records the value of the Initiate Tag parameter . This value MUST be placed into the Verification Tag field of every SCTP packet that the receiver of the INIT transmits within this association .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Outbound Streams
description: Defines the number of outbound streams the sender of this INIT chunk wishes to create in this association . The value of 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Inbound Streams
description: Defines the maximum number of streams the sender of this INIT chunk allows the peer end to create in this association . The value 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial TSN
description: Defines the initial TSN that the sender will use . The valid range is from 0 to 4294967295 . This field MAY be set to the value of the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: Contains an IPv4 address of the sending endpoint . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: Contains an IPv6 address of the sending endpoint . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: Host Name
description: This field contains a host name in " host name syntax " per RFC1123 Section 2.1 [ RFC1123 ]. The method for resolving the host name is out of scope of SCTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Initiate Tag
description: The receiver of the INIT ACK records the value of the Initiate Tag parameter . This value MUST be placed into the Verification Tag field of every SCTP packet that the INIT ACK receiver transmits within this association .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Outbound Streams
description: Defines the number of outbound streams the sender of this INIT ACK chunk wishes to create in this association . The value of 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Inbound Streams
description: Defines the maximum number of streams the sender of this INIT ACK chunk allows the peer end to create in this association . The value 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial TSN
description: Defines the initial TSN that the INIT-ACK sender will use . The valid range is from 0 to 4294967295 . This field MAY be set to the value of the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : variable size   depending on Size of Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : Variable Size .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to all zeros on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Cumulative TSN Ack
description: This parameter contains the TSN of the last DATA chunk received in sequence before a gap .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and the Heartbeat Information field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Ack Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and the Heartbeat Information field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Chunk Flags : 8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and all the Error Cause fields present .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the length of the parameter . Set to 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Cumulative TSN Ack
description: This parameter contains the TSN of the last chunk received in sequence before any gaps .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and all the Error Cause fields present .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Code
description: Defines the type of error conditions being reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Length
description: Set to the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Cause Code   Cause Length   and Cause-Specific Information fields
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier
description: Contains the Stream Identifier of the DATA chunk received in error .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It is set to all 0's on transmit and Ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Unresolvable Address
description: The unresolvable address field contains the complete Type   Length and Value of the address parameter ( or Host Name parameter ) that contains the unresolvable address or host name .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Chunk
description: The Unrecognized Chunk field contains the unrecognized Chunk from the SCTP packet complete with Chunk Type   Chunk Flags and Chunk Length .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Parameters
description: The Unrecognized Parameters field contains the unrecognized parameters copied from the INIT ACK chunk complete with TLV . This error cause is normally contained in an ERROR chunk bundled with the COOKIE ECHO chunk when responding to the INIT ACK   when the sender of the COOKIE ECHO chunk wishes to report unrecognized parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN value
description: The TSN value field contains the TSN of the DATA chunk received with no user data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the 4 bytes of the chunk header and the size of the Cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Cookie
description: This field must contain the exact cookie received in the State Cookie parameter from the previous INIT ACK .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Chunk Flags : 8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B ) " Z " shall respond immediately with an INIT ACK chunk . The destination IP address of the INIT ACK MUST be set to the source IP address of the INIT to which this INIT ACK is responding . In the response   besides filling in other parameters   " Z " must set the Verification Tag field to Tag_A   and also provide its own Verification Tag ( Tag_Z ) in the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: C ) An old State Cookie is received from someone that the receiver is not interested in having an association with and the ABORT chunk was lost .

name: B
description: C ) Re-enable heartbeat on a specific destination transport address of a given association   and
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: - The endpoint shall always fill in the Verification Tag field of the outbound packet with the destination endpoint's tag value if it is known .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: - If the receiver is in COOKIE-ECHOED or COOKIE-WAIT state the procedures in section 8.4 SHOULD be followed   in other words it should be treated as an Out Of The Blue packet .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Format : ASSOCIATE(local SCTP instance name   destination transport addr   outbound stream count ) -> association id [  destination transport addr list ] [  outbound stream count ]
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Format : SEND(association id   buffer address   byte count [  context ] [  stream id ] [  life time ] [  destination transport address ] [  unorder flag ] [  no-bundle flag ] [  payload protocol-id ] ) -> result
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: If a message can not be delivered SCTP shall invoke this notification on the ULP .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: When SCTP loses communication to an endpoint completely ( e.g .  via Heartbeats ) or detects that the endpoint has performed an abort operation   it shall invoke this notification on the ULP .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 0x01 : Refresh ( overhead ) reduction capable
:LABEL: field

name: Vers
description: Protocol version number . This is version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 0x01 : Refresh ( overhead ) reduction capable
:LABEL: field

name: Msg type
description: 12 = Bundle
:LABEL: field

name: RSVP checksum
description: The one's complement of the one's complement sum of the entire message   with the checksum field replaced by zero for the purpose of computing the checksum . An all-zero value means that no checksum was transmitted . Because individual sub - messages may carry their own checksum as well as the INTEGRITY object for authentication   this field MAY be set to zero . Note that when the checksum is not computed   the header of the bundle message will not be covered by any checksum . If the checksum is computed   individual sub-messages MAY set their own checksum to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Send_TTL
description: The IP TTL value with which the message was sent . This is used by RSVP to detect a non-RSVP hop by comparing the Send_TTL with the IP TTL in a received message .
:LABEL: field

name: RSVP length
description: The total length of this RSVP Bundle message in bytes   including the bundle header and the sub-messages that follow .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 0x01 = ACK_Desired flag
:LABEL: field

name: Epoch
description: A value that indicates when the Message_Identifier sequence has reset . SHOULD be randomly generated each time a node reboots or the RSVP agent is restarted . The value SHOULD NOT be the same as was used when the node was last operational . This value MUST NOT be changed during normal operation .
:LABEL: field

name: Message_Identifier
description: When combined with the message generator's IP address   the Message_Identifier field uniquely identifies a message . The values placed in this field change incrementally and only decrease when the Epoch changes or when the value wraps .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: No flags are currently defined . This field MUST be zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Epoch
description: The Epoch field copied from the message being acknowledged .
:LABEL: field

name: Message_Identifier
description: The Message_Identifier field copied from the message being acknowledged .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: No flags are currently defined . This field MUST be zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Epoch
description: The Epoch field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the state being refreshed .
:LABEL: field

name: Message_Identifier
description: The Message_Identifier field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the state being refreshed . One or more Message_Identifiers may be included .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: No flags are currently defined . This field MUST be zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Epoch
description: The Epoch field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the state being refreshed .
:LABEL: field

name: Message_Identifier
description: The Message_Identifier field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the Path state being refreshed . One or more Message_Identifiers may be included . Each Message_Identifier MUST be followed by the source IP address corresponding to the sender described in the Path state being refreshed .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: No flags are currently defined . This field MUST be zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Epoch
description: The Epoch field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the state being refreshed .
:LABEL: field

name: Message_Identifier
description: The Message_Identifier field from the MESSAGE_ID object corresponding to the trigger message that advertised the Path state being refreshed . One or more Message_Identifiers may be included . Each Message_Identifier MUST be followed by the source IP address corresponding to the sender of the Path state being refreshed   and the destination IP address of the session .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2000 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Version Number . The version number field MUST be set to 1 ( SAPv2 announcements which use only SAPv1 features are backwards compatible   those which use new features can be detected by other means   so the SAP version number doesn't need to change ).
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Address type . If the A bit is 0   the originating source field contains a 32-bit IPv4 address . If the A bit is 1   the originating source contains a 128-bit IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Reserved . SAP announcers MUST set this to 0   SAP listeners MUST ignore the contents of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : Message Type . If the T field is set to 0 this is a session announcement packet   if 1 this is a session deletion packet .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : Encryption Bit . If the encryption bit is set to 1   the payload of the SAP packet is encrypted . If this bit is 0 the packet is not encrypted . See section 7 for details of the encryption process .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Compressed bit . If the compressed bit is set to 1   the payload is compressed using the zlib compression algorithm [ 3 ]. If the payload is to be compressed and encrypted   the compression MUST be performed first .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Version Number   V : The version number of the authentication format specified by this memo is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Padding Bit   P : If necessary the authentication data is padded to be a multiple of 32 bits and the padding bit is set . In this case the last byte of the authentication data contains the number of padding bytes ( including the last byte ) that must be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth
description: Authentication Type   Auth : The authentication type is a 4 bit encoded field that denotes the authentication infrastructure the sender expects the recipients to use to check the authenticity and integrity of the information . This defines the format of the authentication subheader and can take the values : 0 = PGP format   1 = CMS format . All other values are undefined and SHOULD be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Intra-domain
description: Much of the initial work on accounting management has focused on intra-domain accounting applications . However   with the increasing deployment of services such as dial-up roaming   Internet fax   Voice and Video over IP and QoS   applications requiring inter-domain accounting are becoming increasingly common .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet loss
description: As packet loss is a fact of life on the Internet   accounting protocols dealing with session data need to be resilient against packet loss . This is particularly important in inter-domain accounting   where packets often pass through Network Access Points
:LABEL: field

name: Device reboots
description: In the event of a device reboot   it is desirable to minimize the loss of data on sessions in progress . Such losses may be significant even if the devices themselves are very reliable   due to long-lived sessions   which can comprise a significant fraction of total resource consumption . To guard against loss of these high-value sessions   interim accounting data is typically transmitted over the wire . When interim accounting in-place is combined with non-volatile storage it becomes possible to guard against data loss in much shorter sessions . This is possible since interim accounting data need only be stored in non-volatile memory until the session completes   at which time the interim data may be replaced by the session record . As a result   interim accounting data need never be sent over the wire   and it is possible to decrease the interim interval so as to provide a very high degree of protection against data loss .
:LABEL: field

name: Memory
description: In accounting systems without non-volatile storage   accounting data must be stored in volatile memory during the period between when it is generated and when it is transferred . The resulting memory consumption will depend on retry and retransmission algorithms . Since systems designed for high reliability will typically wish to retry for long periods   or may store interim accounting data   the resulting memory consumption can be considerable . As a result   if non-volatile storage is unavailable   it may be desirable to compress accounting data awaiting transmission .
:LABEL: field

name: CPU requirements
description: CPU consumption of the managed and managing nodes will be proportional to the complexity of the required accounting processing . Operations such as ASN.1 encoding and decoding   compression/decompression   and encryption/decryption can consume considerable resources   both on accounting clients and servers .
:LABEL: field

name: Efficiency measures
description: 2.2.6 . Efficiency measures
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): The assignment of an RTP payload type for this new packet format is outside the scope of this document   and will not be specified here . It is expected that the RTP profile for a particular class of applications will assign a payload type for this encoding   or if that is not done then a payload type in the dynamic range SHALL be chosen by means of an out of band signaling protocol ( e.g .  H.245   SIP   etc ).

name: X
description: Sequence Number : Incremented by one for each RTP data packet sent   starting   for security reasons   with a random initial value .

name: M
description: Marker ( M ) bit : The marker bit is set to one to indicate the last RTP packet ( or only RTP packet ) of a VOP . When multiple VOPs are carried in the same RTP packet   the marker bit is set to one .

name: PT

:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker ( M ) bit : The marker bit indicates audioMuxElement boundaries . It is set to one to indicate that the RTP packet contains a complete audioMuxElement or the last fragment of an audioMuxElement .

name: Free

name: IP address

name: T

name: Length
description: Length Length in bytes of this extension   not including the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type NVSE-TYPE-NUMBER 133
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Length in bytes of this extension   not including the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Vendor/Org-ID The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order   as defined in the Assigned Numbers RFC [ 2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label : Label Value   20 bits Exp : Experimental Use   3 bits S : Bottom of Stack   1 bit TTL : Time to Live   8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: This bit is set to one for the last entry in the label stack ( i.e .  for the bottom of the stack )  and zero for all other label stack entries .
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: This eight-bit field is used to encode a time-to-live value . The processing of this field is described in section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: Address Family Address Encoding
:LABEL: field

name: Status Code
description: Status Code 32-bit unsigned integer encoding the event being signaled . The structure of a Status Code is :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory Parameters Variable length set of required message parameters . Some messages have no required parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: Hold Time
description: Hold Time   Hello hold time in seconds . An LSR maintains a record of Hellos received from potential peers ( see Section " Hello Message Procedures "). Hello Hold Time specifies the time the sending LSR will maintain its record of Hellos from the receiving LSR without receipt of another Hello .
:LABEL: field

name: PVLim
description: PVLim   Path Vector Limit The configured maximum path vector length . Must be 0 if loop detection is disabled ( D = 0 ). If the loop detection procedures would require the LSR to send a path vector that exceeds this limit   the LSR will behave as if a loop had been detected for the FEC in question .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: 0 Merge not supported 1 VP Merge supported 2 VC Merge supported 3 VP & VC Merge supported
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: 0 Merge not supported 1 Merge supported
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits
:LABEL: field

name: Label TLV
description: Label TLV variable See below
:LABEL: field

name: Label TLV
description: Label TLV variable See below
:LABEL: field

name: Status Code
description: Status Code E Status Data Section Title
:LABEL: field

name: Message Class
description: 0 Management ( MGMT ) Message [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 1 Transfer Messages [ M3UA ] 2 SS7 Signalling Network Management ( SSNM ) Messages [ M3UA/SUA ] 3 ASP State Maintenance ( ASPSM ) Messages [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 4 ASP Traffic Maintenance ( ASPTM ) Messages [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 5 Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport ( QPTM ) Messages [ IUA ] 6 MTP2 User Adaptation ( MAUP ) Messages [ M2UA ] 7 Connectionless Messages [ SUA ]
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Tag
description: The Tag field is a 16 bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Parameter Tag   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . The Parameter Length does not include any padding bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Value
description: The Parameter Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the parameter .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifier ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifier ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted )
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: The request from R1 and R6 contains ( re 1 255 ) and ( bl 1 255 )  respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Count
description: By combining the color mechanism and the hop count mechanism   we can prevent loops without requiring any node to remember more than one color and one hop count per link for each LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers
description: Vers ( 4 bit unsigned integer ): DTCP version number . MUST be DTCP_VERSION .
:LABEL: field

name: Com
description: Com ( 4 bit unsigned integer ): Command field   possible values are 1 - JOIN A message announcing that the feed sending this message is up and running . 2 - LEAVE A message announcing that the feed sending this message is being shut down .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Interval ( 8 bit unsigned integer ): Interval in seconds between HELLO messages for the IP protocol in " IP Vers ". Must be > 0 . The recommended value is HELLO_INTERVAL . If this value is increased   the feed MUST continue to send HELLO messages at the old rate for at least the old HELLO_LEAVE period .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence
description: Sequence ( 16 bit unsigned integer ): Random value initialized at boot time and incremented by 1 every time a value of the HELLO message is modified .
:LABEL: field

name: res
description: F ( 1 bit ): bit indicating the type of feed : 0 = Send-only feed 1 = Receive-capable feed
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): bit indicating the type of feed : 0 = Send-only feed 1 = Receive-capable feed
:LABEL: field

name: IP Vers
description: IP Vers ( 4 bit unsigned integer ): IP protocol version of the feed bidirectional IP addresses ( FBIP ): 4 = IP version 4 6 = IP version 6
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel Type
description: Tunnel Type ( 8 bit unsigned integer ): tunneling protocol supported by the feed . This value is the IP protocol number defined in [ RFC1700 ] [ iana/protocol-numbers ] and their legitimate descendents . Receivers MUST use this form of tunnel encapsulation when tunneling to the feed . 47 = GRE [ RFC2784 ] ( recommended ) Other protocol types allowing link-layer encapsulation are permitted . Obtaining new values is documented in [ RFC2780 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Nb of FBIP
description: Nb of FBIP ( 8 bit unsigned integer ): Number of bidirectional IP feed addresses which are enumerated in the HELLO message
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: Feed BDL IP addr ( 32 or 128 bits ). The bidirectional IP address feed is the IP address of a feed bidirectional interface ( tunnel end - point ) reachable via the Internet . A feed has ' Nb of FBIP ' IP addresses which are operational tunnel end-points . They are enumerated in preferred order . FBIP1 being the most suitable tunnel end-point .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2001 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: Supported Bits
description: This field is 4 octets   most significant octet first .
:LABEL: field

name: PPP Protocol
description: The PPP Protocol field is described in the Point-to-Point Protocol Encapsulation [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Coherency Count
description: The coherency count is used to assure that the packets are sent in proper order and that no packet has been dropped . It is a monotonically increasing counter which incremented by 1 for each packet sent . When the counter reaches 4095 ( 0x0FFF )  it is reset to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : Not sent when the offset from the sequence number of the compressed header is constant . When the offset is not constant   the sequence number may be compressed by sending LSBs . See 5.8.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: Pad Length : Dynamic . Always sent . 14th octet from end of packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Authentication Data : Can have variable length   but when compression of NULL-encryption ESP header is attempted   it is assumed to have length 12 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: This field will usually have the same value in all packets of a packet stream . It encodes the type of the subsequent header . Only when extension headers are sometimes present and sometimes not   will the field change its value during the lifetime of the stream . The field is therefore classified as STATIC .
:LABEL: field

name: Client ID
description: The client ID parameter specifies an RSIP client ID . Client ID's by an RSIP gateway to differentiate RSIP hosts .
:LABEL: field

name: Bind ID
description: The bind ID parameter specifies an RSIP bind ID . Bind ID's are used by RSIP hosts and gateways to differentiate an RSIP host's bindings .
:LABEL: field

name: Error
description: The error parameter specifies an error . The currently defined error values are presented in Appendix A .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type CVSE-TYPE-NUMBER 38
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Reserved for future use . MUST be set to 0 on sending   MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Length in bytes of this extension   not including the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type NVSE-TYPE-NUMBER 134
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Length in bytes of this extension   not including the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Reserved for future use . To be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .

description: Type 141
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 142
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Reserved 32-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 32-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 9 for Source Address List 10 for Target Address List
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   and the Reserved fields ) in units of 8 octets . The minimum value for Length is 3   for one IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Source Address List MUST fit in one IND Solicitation message . Therefore in case all IPv6 addresses of an interface do not fit in one messages   the option does not contain a complete list . For a complete list of IPv6 addresses   a node should rely on the IND Advertisement message .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory ( M ) bit : MUST be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory ( M ) bit : MUST be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Length : The length of the entire attribute in octets   expressed as a single octet . The length MUST be at least 11 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the entire attribute in octets   expressed as a single octet . The length MUST be at least 11 .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: Vendor ID : A two octet value in network byte order; set to 0 to indicate that this is an IETF-assigned attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: Attribute Type : A two octet value in network byte order; set to 46 ( PPP Disconnect Cause Code ).
:LABEL: field

name: Disconnect Code
description: Disconnect Code : A two octet value in network byte order . ( Described in section 3 of this document .)
:LABEL: field

name: Control Protocol Number
description: Control Protocol Number : The PPP Control Protocol number of the primary protocol known to have caused the error   if any . This field may be 0 unless mentioned otherwise in the description of the Disconnect Codes in section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Direction
description: Direction : A single octet value; specifies the direction in which the Disconnect Code applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 for Source Link-layer address . 2 for Target Link-layer address . Length 3 ( in units of 8 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: max_rec
description: max_rec This field MUST be equal to the value of max_rec in the node's configuration ROM .
:LABEL: field

name: spd
description: spd This field MUST be set to the lesser of the node's link speed and PHY speed . The link speed is the maximum speed at which the link may send or receive packets; the PHY speed is the maximum speed at which the PHY may send   receive or repeat packets . The encoding used for spd is specified in the Table 2 of [ IP1394 ].
:LABEL: field

name: unicast_FIFO
description: unicast_FIFO This field MUST specify the 48-bit offset of the node's FIFO available for the receipt of IPv6 datagrams . The offset of a node's unicast FIFO MUST NOT change   except as the result of a power reset .
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: reserved This field MUST be set to all zeros by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 95 for NAS-IPv6-Address
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 96 for Framed-Interface-Id
:LABEL: field

name: Interface-Id
description: The Interface-Id field is 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 97 for Framed-IPv6-Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: At least 4 and no larger than 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field   which is reserved and MUST be present   is always set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix-Length
description: The length of the prefix   in bits . At least 0 and no larger than 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: The Prefix field is up to 16 octets in length . Bits outside of the Prefix-Length   if included   must be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 98 for Login-IPv6-Host
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: The Address field is 16 octets in length . The value 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF indicates that the NAS SHOULD allow the user to select an address or name to be connected to . The value 0 indicates that the NAS SHOULD select a host to connect the user to . Other values indicate the address the NAS SHOULD connect the user to .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 99 for Framed-IPv6-Route
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 100 for Framed-IPv6-Pool
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: The Next Header field is set to 108   IPComp Datagram   [ RFC1700 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: 8-bit selector . Stores the IPv4 Protocol field or the IPv6 Next Header field of the original IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 8-bit field . Reserved for future use . MUST be set to zero . MUST be ignored by the receiving node .
:LABEL: field

name: Compression Parameter Index
description: 16-bit index . The CPI is stored in network order . The values 0-63 designate well-known compression algorithms   which require no additional information   and are used for manual setup . The values themselves are identical to IPCOMP Transform identifiers as defined in [ SECDOI ]. Consult [ SECDOI ] for an initial set of defined values and for instructions on how to assign new values . The values 64-255 are reserved for future use . The values 256-61439 are negotiated between the two nodes in definition of an IPComp Association   as defined in section 4 . Note : When negotiating one of the well-known algorithms   the nodes MAY select a CPI in the pre-defined range 0-63 . The values 61440-65535 are for private use among mutually consenting parties . Both nodes participating can select a CPI value independently of each other and there is no relationship between the two separately chosen CPIs . The outbound IPComp header MUST use the CPI value chosen by the decompressing node . The CPI in combination with the destination IP address uniquely identifies the compression algorithm characteristics for the datagram .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: In addition to the basic data transfer operation described above   PGM specifies several end-to-end options to address specific application requirements . PGM specifies options to support fragmentation   late joining   redirection   Forward Error Correction ( FEC )  reachability   and session synchronization/termination/reset . Options MAY be appended to PGM data packet headers only by their original transmitters . While they MAY be interpreted by network elements   options are neither added nor removed by network elements .
:LABEL: field

name: SPM's Sequence Number
description: SPM_SQN
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Note that in NAKs and N-NAKs   unlike the other packets   the field SPORT contains the Data-Destination port and the field DPORT contains the Data-Source port . As a general rule   the content of SPORT/DPORT is determined by the direction of the flow : in packets which travel down-stream SPORT is the port number chosen in the data source ( Data-Source Port ) and DPORT is the data destination port number ( Data-Destination Port ). The opposite holds for packets which travel upstream . This makes DPORT the protocol endpoint in the recipient host   regardless of the direction of the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: PGM specifies several end-to-end options to address specific application requirements . PGM specifies options to support fragmentation   late joining   and redirection .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Options are all in the TLV style   or Type   Length   Value . The Type field is contained in the first byte   where bit 0 is the OPT_END bit   followed by 7 bits of type . The OPT_END bit MUST be set in the last option in the option list   whichever that might be . The Length field is the total length of the option in bytes   and directly follows the Type field . Following the Length field are 5 reserved bits   the OP_ENCODED flag   the 2 Option Extensibility bits OPX and the OP_ENCODED_NULL flag . Last are 7 bits designated for option specific information which may be defined on a per-option basis . If not defined for a particular option   they MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Total length of all options
description: The total length in octets of all option extensions including OPT_LENGTH .
:LABEL: field

name: First Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number of the PGM DATA/RDATA packet containing the first fragment of the APDU .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: The byte offset of the fragment from the beginning of the APDU ( OPT_FRAG_OFF ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The total length of the original APDU ( OPT_FRAG_LEN ).
:LABEL: field

name: Requested Sequence Number
description: A list of up to 62 additional sequence numbers to which the NAK applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum Sequence Number
description: The minimum sequence number defining the initial trailing edge of the receive window for a late joining receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Code
description: The 6 bit error code field is used to forward an error code down to the receivers from the source .
:LABEL: field

name: Transmission Group Size
description: The transmission group size advertised in the OPT_PARITY_PRM option on SPMs MUST be a power of 2 and constant for the duration of the session . However   the actual transmission group size used MAY not be constant for the duration of the session   and MAY not be a power of 2 . When a TG size different from the one advertised in OPT_PARITY_PRM is used   the TG size advertised in OPT_PARITY_PRM MUST be interpreted as specifying the maximum effective size of the TG .
:LABEL: field

name: Transmission Group Size
description: The number of data packets in the transmission group over which the parity packets are calculated . If a variable transmission group size is being used   then this becomes the maximum effective transmission group size across the session .
:LABEL: field

name: Parity Group Number
description: The number of the group of k parity packets amongst the h parity packets within the transmission group to which the parity packet belongs   where the first k parity packets are in group zero . PRM_GROUP MUST NOT be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Actual Transmission Group Size
description: The actual number of data packets in this transmission group . This MUST be less than or equal to the maximum transmission group size PARITY_PRM_TGS in OPT_PARITY_PRM .
:LABEL: field

name: Congestion Report Reference SQN
description: A SQN in the ODATA space that serves as a temporal reference point for the load report values .
:LABEL: field

name: NE Worst Link
description: Reports the load in the worst link as detected though NE internal measurements
:LABEL: field

name: NE Worst Path
description: Reports the load in the worst end-to-end path as detected though NE internal measurements
:LABEL: field

name: Rcvr Worst Path
description: Reports the load in the worst end-to-end path as detected by receivers
:LABEL: field

name: POLL's Sequence Number
description: POLL_SQN
:LABEL: field

name: POLL's Round
description: POLL_ROUND
:LABEL: field

name: POLL's Sub-type
description: POLL_S_TYPE
:LABEL: field

name: POLL's Back-off Interval
description: POLL_BO_IVL
:LABEL: field

name: Matching Bit-Mask
description: POLL_MASK
:LABEL: field

name: POLR's Sequence Number
description: POLR_SQN
:LABEL: field

name: POLR's Round
description: POLR_ROUND
:LABEL: field

name: NAK Back-Off Interval
description: The value of NAK-generation Back-Off Interval in microseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum NAK Back-Off Interval
description: The maximum value of NAK-generation Back-Off Interval in microseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum NAK Back-Off Interval
description: The minimum value of NAK-generation Back-Off Interval in microseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Path NLA
description: The NLA of the interface on the originating PGM network element that it uses to send multicast SPMs to the recipient of the packet containing this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L3PID
description: an identifier of the layer 3 protocol using this path . Standard Ethertype values are used .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L3PID
description: an identifier of the layer 3 protocol using this path . Standard Ethertype values are used .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Setting this bit to one indicates that the node is capable of merging in the data plane
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum VPI
description: This 12 bit field specifies the lower bound of a block of Virtual Path Identifiers that is supported on the originating switch . If the VPI is less than 12-bits it MUST be right justified in this field and preceding bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum VCI
description: This 16 bit field specifies the lower bound of a block of Virtual Connection Identifiers that is supported on the originating switch . If the VCI is less than 16-bits it MUST be right justified in this field and preceding bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum VPI
description: This 12 bit field specifies the upper bound of a block of Virtual Path Identifiers that is supported on the originating switch . If the VPI is less than 12-bits it MUST be right justified in this field and preceding bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum VCI
description: This 16 bit field specifies the upper bound of a block of Virtual Connection Identifiers that is supported on the originating switch . If the VCI is less than 16-bits it MUST be right justified in this field and preceding bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L3PID
description: an identifier of the layer 3 protocol using this path . Standard Ethertype values are used .
:LABEL: field

name: DLI
description: DLCI Length Indicator . The number of bits in the DLCI . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum DLCI
description: This 23-bit field specifies the lower bound of a block of Data Link Connection Identifiers ( DLCIs ) that is supported on the originating switch . The DLCI MUST be right justified in this field and unused bits MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum DLCI
description: This 23-bit field specifies the upper bound of a block of Data Link Connection Identifiers ( DLCIs ) that is supported on the originating switch . The DLCI MUST be right justified in this field and unused bits MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The L bit is an attribute of the subobject . The L bit is set if the subobject represents a loose hop in the explicit route . If the bit is not set   the subobject represents a strict hop in the explicit route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type indicates the type of contents of the subobject . Currently defined values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the L   Type and Length fields . The Length MUST be at least 4   and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The L bit is an attribute of the subobject . The L bit is set if the subobject represents a loose hop in the explicit route . If the bit is not set   the subobject represents a strict hop in the explicit route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 0x01 IPv4 address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 8 .

name: L

:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 20 .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 0x01 IPv4 address
:LABEL: field

name: Length

description: 0x01 Local protection available
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 0x02 IPv6 address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags

:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 0x03 Label
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields .

name: Flags
