:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: The C-Type of the included Label Object . Copied from the Label Object .
:LABEL: field

name: Contents of Label Object
description: The contents of the Label Object . Copied from the Label Object
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 tunnel end point address
description: IPv4 address of the egress node for the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: A 16-bit identifier used in the SESSION that remains constant over the life of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: A 32-bit identifier used in the SESSION that remains constant over the life of the tunnel . Normally set to all zeros . Ingress nodes that wish to narrow the scope of a SESSION to the ingress-egress pair may place their IPv4 address here as a globally unique identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: A 16-bit identifier used in the SESSION that remains constant over the life of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: A 16-byte identifier used in the SESSION that remains constant over the life of the tunnel . Normally set to all zeros . Ingress nodes that wish to narrow the scope of a SESSION to the ingress-egress pair may place their IPv6 address here as a globally unique identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 tunnel sender address
description: IPv4 address for a sender node
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: A 16-bit identifier used in the SENDER_TEMPLATE and the FILTER_SPEC that can be changed to allow a sender to share resources with itself .
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: A 16-bit identifier used in the SENDER_TEMPLATE and the FILTER_SPEC that can be changed to allow a sender to share resources with itself .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 0x01 Local protection desired
:LABEL: field

name: Name Length
description: The length of the display string before padding   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Exclude-any
description: A 32-bit vector representing a set of attribute filters associated with a tunnel any of which renders a link unacceptable .
:LABEL: field

name: Include-any
description: A 32-bit vector representing a set of attribute filters associated with a tunnel any of which renders a link acceptable ( with respect to this test ). A null set ( all bits set to zero ) automatically passes .
:LABEL: field

name: Include-all
description: A 32-bit vector representing a set of attribute filters associated with a tunnel all of which must be present for a link to be acceptable ( with respect to this test ). A null set ( all bits set to zero ) automatically passes .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: 0x01 Local protection desired
:LABEL: field

name: Name Length
description: The length of the display string before padding   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Src_Instance
description: a 32 bit value that represents the sender's instance . The advertiser maintains a per neighbor representation/value . This value MUST change when the sender is reset   when the node reboots   or when communication is lost to the neighboring node and otherwise remains the same . This field MUST NOT be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Dst_Instance
description: The most recently received Src_Instance value received from the neighbor . This field MUST be set to zero ( 0 ) when no value has ever been seen from the neighbor .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: A router on a mobile node's home network which tunnels datagrams for delivery to the mobile node when it is away from home   and maintains current location information for the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The termination point of a tunnel toward a mobile node   for datagrams forwarded to the mobile node while it is away from home . The protocol can use two different types of care-of address : a " foreign agent care-of address " is an address of a foreign agent with which the mobile node is registered   and a " co-located care-of address " is an externally obtained local address which the mobile node has associated with one of its own network interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: An IP address that is assigned for an extended period of time to a mobile node . It remains unchanged regardless of where the node is attached to the Internet .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: An index identifying a security context between a pair of nodes among the contexts available in the Mobility Security Association . SPI values 0 through 255 are reserved and MUST NOT be used in any Mobility Security Association .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Indicates the particular type of Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the data field within this Extension . The length does NOT include the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the data field within this Extension . It does NOT include the Type   Length and Sub-Type bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the extension   in bytes   excluding the extension Type and the extension Length fields . This field MUST be set to 1 plus the total length of the data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The maximum length of time that the Advertisement is considered valid in the absence of further Advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Addrs
description: The number of Router Addresses advertised in this message . Note that in an Agent Advertisement message   the number of router addresses specified in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message MAY be set to 0 . See Section 2.3.1 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 6 + 4*N )  where 6 accounts for the number of bytes in the Sequence Number   Registration Lifetime   flags   and reserved fields   and N is the number of care-of addresses advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The count of Agent Advertisement messages sent since the agent was initialized ( Section 2.3.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Lifetime
description: The longest lifetime ( measured in seconds ) that this agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . This field has no relation to the " Lifetime " field within the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Registration required . Registration with this foreign agent ( or another foreign agent on this link ) is required even when using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Busy . The foreign agent will not accept registrations from additional mobile nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Home agent . This agent offers service as a home agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F Foreign agent . This agent offers service as a foreign agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use minimal encapsulation [ 34 ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use GRE encapsulation [ 16 ].
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Foreign agent supports reverse tunneling [ 27 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The advertised foreign agent care-of address(es ) provided by this foreign agent . An Agent Advertisement MUST include at least one care-of address if the ' F ' bit is set . The number of care-of addresses present is determined by the Length field in the Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 19 ( Prefix-Lengths Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length N   where N is the value ( possibly zero ) of the Num Addrs field in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: The number of leading bits that define the network number of the corresponding Router Address listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message . The prefix length for each Router Address is encoded as a separate byte   in the order that the Router Addresses are listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: S Simultaneous bindings . If the ' S ' bit is set   the mobile node is requesting that the home agent retain its prior mobility bindings   as described in Section 3.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Simultaneous bindings . If the ' S ' bit is set   the mobile node is requesting that the home agent retain its prior mobility bindings   as described in Section 3.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Broadcast datagrams . If the ' B ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that the home agent tunnel to it any broadcast datagrams that it receives on the home network   as described in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D Decapsulation by mobile node . If the ' D ' bit is set   the mobile node will itself decapsulate datagrams which are sent to the care-of address . That is   the mobile node is using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . If the ' M ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use minimal encapsulation [ 34 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . If the ' G ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use GRE encapsulation [ 16 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Reverse Tunneling requested; see [ 27 ].
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: x Sent as zero; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates a request for deregistration . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The IP address for the end of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number   constructed by the mobile node   used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . See Sections 5.4 and 5.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 ( Registration Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code A value indicating the result of the Registration Request . See below for a list of currently defined Code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: If the Code field indicates that the registration was accepted   the Lifetime field is set to the number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates that the mobile node has been deregistered . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . If the Code field indicates that the registration was denied   the contents of the Lifetime field are unspecified and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . The value is
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 32
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 33
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 34
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Lifetime field in the Registration Reply will contain the maximum Lifetime value which that foreign agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . The mobile node MAY attempt to register with this same agent   using a Lifetime in the Registration Request that MUST be less than or equal to the value specified in the Reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Identification field in the Registration Reply will contain a value that allows the mobile node to synchronize with the home agent   based upon the style of replay protection in effect ( Section 5.7 ). The mobile node MUST adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the information in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: This code is returned by a home agent when the mobile node is performing dynamic home agent address resolution as described in Sections 3.6.1.1 and 3.6.1.2 . In this case   the Home Agent field within the Reply will contain the unicast IP address of
:LABEL: field

name: Client ID Length
description: Client ID Length : This declares how many bytes of Client ID data follow .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Authenticator : a 16 byte MD5 digest [ 6 ] calculated on the following data fields   concatenated together
:LABEL: field

name: protocol version number
description: protocol version number : contains the hex constant 0xff80 ( big-endian integer ).
:LABEL: field

name: protocol version number
description: protocol version number : contains the hex constant 0x0001 ( big-endian integer ). ( The reply message has the same format as the original change password protocol .)
:LABEL: field

name: result code
description: result code ( 16 bits ) ( result codes 0-4 are from the original change password protocol ):
:LABEL: field

name: CMR
description: CMR ( 4 bits ): Indicates a codec mode request sent to the speech encoder at the site of the receiver of this payload . The value of the CMR field is set to the frame type index of the corresponding speech mode being requested . The frame type index may be 0-7 for AMR   as defined in Table 1a in [ 2 ]  or 0-8 for AMR-WB   as defined in Table 1a in [ 4 ]. CMR value 15 indicates that no mode request is present   and other values are for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): If set to 1   indicates that this frame is followed by another speech frame in this payload; if set to 0   indicates that this frame is the last frame in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits ): Frame type index   indicating either the AMR or AMR-WB speech coding mode or comfort noise ( SID ) mode of the corresponding frame carried in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( 1 bit ): Frame quality indicator . If set to 0   indicates the corresponding frame is severely damaged and the receiver should set the RX_TYPE ( see [ 6 ]) to either SPEECH_BAD or SID_BAD depending on the frame type ( FT ).
:LABEL: field

name: CMR
description: R : is a reserved bit that MUST be set to zero . All R bits MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : is a reserved bit that MUST be set to zero . All R bits MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: ILL
description: ILL ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signalled out-of-band for the session . ILL=L indicates to the receiver that the interleaving length is L+1   in number of frame-blocks .
:LABEL: field

name: ILP
description: ILP ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signalled . ILP MUST take a value between 0 and ILL   inclusive   indicating the interleaving index for frame-blocks in this payload in the interleave group . If the value of ILP is found greater than ILL   the payload SHOULD be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: FT ( 4 bits unsigned integer ): see definition in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits unsigned integer ): see definition in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( 1 bit ): see definition in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved bits
description: Reserved bits : MUST be set to 0 when written   and a reader MUST ignore them .
:LABEL: field

name: CHAN
description: CHAN ( 4 bit unsigned integer ): Indicates the number of audio channels contained in this storage file . The valid values and the order of the channels within a frame block are specified in Section 4.1 in [ 24 ].
:LABEL: field

name: PSC
description: PSC PHB Scheduling Class . The set of one or more PHB(s ) that are applied to the Behavior Aggregate(s ) belonging to a given OA . For example   AF1x is a PSC comprising the AF11   AF12 and AF13 PHBs . EF is an example of PSC comprising a single PHB   the EF PHB .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 28 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: MAPnb
description: MAPnb : 4 bits Indicates the number of MAP entries included in the DIFFSERV Object . This can be set to any value from 0 to 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 13 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: EXP
description: EXP : 3 bits This field contains the value of the EXP field for the ` EXP<-->PHB mapping ' defined in this MAP entry .
:LABEL: field

name: PHBID
description: PHBID : 16 bits This field contains the PHBID of the PHB for the ` EXP<-->PHB mapping ' defined in this MAP entry . The PHBID is encoded as specified in [ PHBID ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 16 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: PSC
description: PSC : 16 bits The PSC indicates a PHB Scheduling Class to be supported by the LSP . The PSC is encoded as specified in [ PHBID ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 27 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: MAPnb
description: MAPnb : 4 bits Indicates the number of MAP entries included in the DIFFSERV Object . This can be set to any value from 1 to 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 13 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: EXP
description: EXP : 3 bits This field contains the value of the EXP field for the ` EXP<-->PHB mapping ' defined in this MAP entry .
:LABEL: field

name: PHBID
description: PHBID : 16 bits This field contains the PHBID of the PHB for the ` EXP<-->PHB mapping ' defined in this MAP entry . The PHBID is encoded as specified in [ PHBID ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 15 bits This field is reserved . It must be set to zero on transmission and must be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: PSC
description: PSC : 16 bits The PSC indicates a PHB Scheduling Class to be supported by the LSP . The PSC is encoded as specified in [ PHBID ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: General Switch Management Protocol ( GSMP ) V3
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2002 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: x : Reserved Flags . These are generally used by specific messages and will be defined in those messages .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Stacked Label Indicator Label Stacking is discussed below in section 3.1.3.5
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits 0 10 2 23
:LABEL: field

name: IQS
description: IQS   OQS Input and Output QoS Model Selector : The QoS Model Selector is used to specify a QoS Model for the connection . The values of IQS and OQS determine respectively the interpretation of the Input Service Selector and the Output Service Selector   and SHOULD be interpreted as a priority   a QoS profile   a service specification   or an ARM specification as shown :
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: 0x100 PPP 0x200 FRF.5 0x201 FRF.8
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : Multicast Multicast flags are used as a hint for point-to-multipoint or multipoint-to-point connections in the Add Branch message . They are not used in any other connection management messages and in these messages they SHOULD be set to zero . There are two instances of the M-bit in the Add Branch message; one for input branch specified by the Input Port and Input Label fields and one for the output branch specified by the Output Port and Output Label fields . If set for the input branch ( in front of Input Label field )  it indicates that the connection is very likely to be a point-to-multipoint connection . If zero   it indicates that this connection is very likely to be a point - to-point connection or is unknown . If set for the output branch ( in front of the Output Label field )  it indicates that the connection is very likely to be a multipoint-to-point connection . If zero   it indicates that this connection is very likely to be a point-to-point connection or is unknown .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : Bi-directional The Bi-directional flag applies only to the Add Branch message . In all other Connection Management messages it is not used . It may only be used when establishing a point-to-point connection . The Bi-directional flag in an Add Branch message   if set   requests that two unidirectional connections be established   one in the forward direction   and one in the reverse direction . It is equivalent to two Add Branch messages   one specifying the forward direction   and one specifying the reverse direction . The forward direction uses the values of Input Port   Input Label   Output Port and Output Label as specified in the Add Branch message . The reverse direction is derived by exchanging the values specified in the Input Port and Input Label fields   with those of the Output Port and Output Label fields respectively . Thus   a connection in the reverse direction originates at the input port specified by the Output Port field   on the label specified by the Output Label field . It departs from the output port specified by the Input Port field   on the label specified by the Input Label field .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Connection Replace The Connection Replace flag applies only to the Add Branch message and is not used in any other Connection Management messages . The R flag is used in cases when creation of multipoint-to-point connections is undesirable ( e.g .  POTS applications where fan-in is meaningless ). If the R flag is set   the new connection replaces any existing connection if the label is already in use at the same Output Port .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Connection Replace The R flag shall only be checked when the Function field = 1 ( Bring Up ). If the R flag is set in the Port Management request message   it indicates that a switch controller requests the switch port to support the Connection Replace mechanism .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : Port Up Bit 0   ( most significant bit ) D : Port Down Bit 1   I : Invalid Label Bit 2   N : New Port Bit 3   Z : Dead Port Bit 4   A : Adjacency Event Bit 5   x : Unused Bits 6-15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q : Query If the Query flag is set in a request message   the switch MUST respond with the current range of valid labels . The current label range is not changed by a request message with the Query flag set . If the Query flag is zero   the message is requesting a label change operation .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : Multipoint Query If the Multipoint Query flag is set the switch MUST respond with the current range of valid specialized multipoint labels . The current label range is not changed by a request message with the Multipoint Query flag set .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : Non-contiguous Label Range Indicator This flag will be set in a Query response if the labels available for assignment belong to a non-contiguous set .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label The Label flag use is port type specific .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Multipoint Capable Indicates label range that can be used for multipoint connections .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label If the Label flag is set   the message refers to a range of VPI's only . The Min VCI and Max VCI fields are unused . If the Label flag is zero the message refers to a range of VCI's on either one VPI or on a range of VPI's .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label The Label flag is not used .
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits 0 10 2 23
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label The Label flag is not used .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Valid Record In the success response message the Valid Record flag is used to indicate an invalid Activity Record . The flag MUST be zero if any of the fields in this Activity Record are invalid   if the input port specified by the Input Port field does not exist   or if the specified connection does not exist . If the Valid Record flag is zero in a success response message   the Counter flag   the Activity flag   and the Traffic Count field are undefined . If the Valid Record flag is set   the Activity Record is valid   and the Counter and Activity flags are valid . The Valid Record flag is not used in the request message .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Counter In a success response message   if the Valid Record flag is set   the Counter flag   if zero   indicates that the value in the Traffic Count field is valid . If set   it indicates that the value in the Activity flag is valid . The Counter flag is not used in the request message .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Activity In a success response message   if the Valid Record and Counter flags are set   the Activity flag   if set   indicates that there has been some activity on this connection since the last Connection Activity message for this connection . If zero   it indicates that there has been no activity on this connection since the last Connection Activity message for this connection . The Activity flag is not used in the request message .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : All Connections If the All Connections flag is set   the message requests the connection state for all connections that originate at the input port specified by the Input Port field . In this case the Input Label field and the Label flag are unused .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : ATM VPI The ATM VPI flag may only be set for ports with PortType=ATM . If the switch receives a Report Connection State message in which the ATM VPI flag set and in which the input port specified by the Input Port field does not have PortType=ATM   the switch MUST return a Failure response " 28 : ATM Virtual Path switching is not supported on non-ATM ports ".
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: V : ATM VPI For the first Connection Record in each success response message   the All Connections and the ATM VPI flags MUST be the same as those of the request message . For successive Connection Records in the same success response message   these flags are not used .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : ATM VPI For the first Connection Record in each success response message   the All Connections and the ATM VPI flags MUST be the same as those of the request message . For successive Connection Records in the same success response message   these flags are not used .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : ATM VPC The ATM VPC flag may only be set for ports with PortType=ATM . The ATM VPC flag   if set and only if set   indicates that the Connection Record refers to an ATM virtual path connection .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Connection Replace flag If set   indicates that connections being established by an Add Branch message with a corresponding R-bit set will replace any previously established connection if a clash between the established output branch and the requested output branch occurs [ see chapter 4.2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: x : Unused .
:LABEL: field

name: PortType
description: 1 : PortType is ATM 2 : PortType is FR 3 : PortType is MPLS
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Service Model If set   indicates that Service Model data follows the PortSpecific port configuration data .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : VP Switching The ATM VPC flag may only be set for ports with PortType=ATM . The VP Switching flag   if set   indicates that this input port is capable of supporting virtual path switching . Else   if zero   it indicates that this input port is only capable of virtual channel switching .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : Multicast Labels The Multicast Labels flag   if set   indicates that this output port is capable of labelling each output branch of a point-to-multipoint tree with a different label . If zero   it indicates that this output port is not able to label each output branch of a point-to-multipoint tree with a different label .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : Logical Multicast The Logical Multicast flag   if set   indicates that this output port is capable of supporting more than a single branch from any point-to-multipoint connection . This capability is often referred to as logical multicast . If zero   it indicates that this output port can only support a single output branch from each point-to-multipoint connection .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Label Range The Label Range flag   if set   indicates that this switch port is capable of reallocating its label range and therefore accepts the Label Range message . Else   if zero   it indicates that this port does not accept Label Range messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q : QoS The QoS flag   if set   indicates that this switch port is capable of handling the Quality of Service messages defined in section 9 of this specification . Else   if zero   it indicates that this port does not accept the Quality of Service messages .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label The Label flag is port type specific .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Multipoint Capable This flag indicates that the label range may be used for multipoint connections .
:LABEL: field

name: Receive Data Rate
description: The maximum rate of data that may arrive at the input port in;
:LABEL: field

name: Transmit Data Rate
description: The maximum rate of data that may depart from the output port in;
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Label If the Label flag is set   the message refers to a range of VPI's only . The Min VCI and Max VCI fields are unused . If the Label flag is zero the message refers to a range of VCI's on either one VPI or on a range of VPI's .
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len DLCI bits 0 10 2 23
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : Usage Parameter Control The Usage Parameter Control sub-field indicates the availability of Usage Parameter Control for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : Packet Discard The Packet Discard sub-field indicates the availability of Packet Discard for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : Ingress Shaping The Ingress Shaping sub-field indicates the availability of Ingress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate and Cell Delay Variation Tolerance for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : Egress Shaping   Peak Rate The Egress Shaping   Peak Rate sub-field indicates the availability of Egress Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate and Cell Delay Variation Tolerance for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Egress Traffic Shaping   Sustainable Rate The Egress Shaping   Sustainable Rate sub-field   if set   indicates that Egress Traffic Shaping to the Sustainable Cell Rate and Maximum Burst Size is available for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : VC Merge The VC Merge sub-field indicates the availability of ATM Virtual Channel Merge ( i.e .  multipoint to point ATM switching with a traffic control to avoid AAL5 PDU interleaving ) capability for the specified Service and Capability Set .
:LABEL: field

name: CLR
description: CLR : Cell Loss Ratio The Cell Loss Ratio parameter indicates the CLR guaranteed by the switch for the specified Service . A cell loss ratio is expressed as an order of magnitude n   where the CLR takes the value of ten raised to the power of - n   i.e .  log(CLR)=-n . The value n is coded as a binary integer   having a range of 1 <= n <= 15 . In addition   the value 0b1111 1111 indicates that no CLR guarantees are given .
:LABEL: field

name: CTD
description: CTD : Cell Transfer Delay The CTD value is expressed in units of microseconds . It is coded as a 24-bit integer .
:LABEL: field

name: CDV
description: CDV : Peak-to-peak Cell Delay Variation The CDV value is expressed in units of microseconds . It is coded as a 24-bit integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Controls
description: Traffic Controls : - ( U ) Usage Parameter Control - ( I ) Ingress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate - ( E ) Egress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate and Cell Delay Variation Tolerance - ( D ) Packet Discard
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Controls
description: Traffic Controls : - ( U ) Usage Parameter Control - ( I ) Ingress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate - ( E ) Egress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Cell Rate and Cell Delay Variation Tolerance - ( S ) Egress Traffic Shaping to the Sustainable Cell Rate and Maximum Burst Size - ( P ) Packet Discard - ( V ) VC Merge
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Controls

:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: CIR Multiplier

name: Mag
description: Committed Burst Size = 10^(Mag ) * ( CBS Multiplier )
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Mag

:LABEL: field

name: EBS Multiplier
description: Excess Burst Size = 10^(Mag ) * ( EBS Multiplier )
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : Usage Parameter Control When set   this flag indicates that Usage Parameter Control is requested .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : Packet Discard When set   this flag indicates that Packet Discard is requested .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : Ingress Shaping When set   this flag indicates the availability of Ingress Traffic Shaping to the Peak Rate and Delay Variation Tolerance is requested .
:LABEL: field

name: E

:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Egress Traffic Shaping   Sustainable Rate When set   this flag indicates that Egress Traffic Shaping to the Sustainable Rate and Maximum Burst Size is requested .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : VC Merge When set   this flag indicates that ATM Virtual Channel Merge ( i.e .  multipoint to point ATM switching with a traffic control to avoid AAL5 PDU interleaving ) is requested .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Port When set indicates that traffic block pertains to Ingress Port .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: The controller may set ( to one ) the flag corresponding to the requested Traffic Control if the corresponding Traffic Control has been indicated in the Service Configuration response message ( Section 8.4 ) as available for application to connections that use the requested Capability Set on a per connection basis . ( The requested Capability Set is indicated by the Capability Set ID the least significant byte of the Service Selector field of the Add Branch message .) If the Traffic Control has been indicated in the Service Configuration response message as either not available in the Capability Set or applied to all connections that use the Capability Set then the controller sets the flag to zero and the switch ignores the flag .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A The Sender Instance in the incoming message matches the value stored from a previous message by the " Update Peer Verifier " operation .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B The Sender Instance   Sender Port   Sender Name and Partition ID fields in the incoming message match the values stored from a previous message by the " Update Peer Verifier " operation .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C The Receiver Instance   Receiver Port   Receiver Name and Partition ID fields in the incoming message match the values of the Sender Instance   Sender Port   Sender Name and Partition ID currently sent in outgoing SYN   SYNACK   and ACK messages .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .

name: Rx Minimum BPS
description: The Rx Minimum BPS   Attribute Type 40   encodes the lowest acceptable line speed for this call in the receive direction   for these cases where asymmetric transmission is required .

name: Rx Maximum BPS

:LABEL: field

name: T1
description: All time values for lifetimes   T1 and T2 are unsigned integers . The value 0xffffffff is taken to mean " infinity " when used as a lifetime ( as in RFC2461 [ 17 ]) or a value for T1 or T2 .

name: Interface Identifier
description: Interface Identifier - The Interface Identifier identifies the physical interface at the SG for which the signalling messages are sent/received . The format of the Interface Identifier parameter can be text or integer   the values of which are assigned according to network operator policy . The values used are of local significance only   coordinated between the SG and ASP .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Class
description: 0 Management ( MGMT ) Message [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 1 Transfer Messages [ M3UA ] 2 SS7 Signalling Network Management ( SSNM ) Messages [ M3UA/SUA ] 3 ASP State Maintenance ( ASPSM ) Messages [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 4 ASP Traffic Maintenance ( ASPTM ) Messages [ IUA/M2UA/M3UA/SUA ] 5 Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport ( QPTM ) Messages [ IUA ] 6 MTP2 User Adaptation ( MAUP ) Messages [ M2UA ] 7 Connectionless Messages [ SUA ] 8 Connection-Oriented Messages [ SUA ] 9 Routing Key Management ( RKM ) Messages ( M3UA ) 10 Interface Identifier Management ( IIM ) Messages ( M2UA ) 11 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined Message Class extensions
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Tag
description: The Type field is a 16 bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 . The common parameters used by the adaptation layers are in the range of 0x00 to 0xff . The M2UA specific parameters have Tags in the range 0x300 to 0x3ff .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Parameter Tag   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . Thus   a parameter with a zero-length Parameter Value field would have a Length field of 4 . The Parameter Length does not include any padding bytes .
:LABEL: field

description: The Signalling Data Link Identifier parameter is mandatory . It identifies the Signalling Data Link Identifier associated with the SS7 link for which the ASP is registering . The format is as follows :

description: The Registration Result Status field indicates the success or the reason for failure of a registration request .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifier
description: The Interface Identifier field contains the Interface Identifier for the associated Link Key if the registration is successful . It is set to " 0 " if the registration was not successful . The format of integer-based and text-based Interface Identifier parameters are shown in Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifier
description: Interface Identifier ( mandatory )
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifier
description: The Interface Identifier parameter contains a Interface Identifier indexing the Application Server traffic that the sending ASP is currently registered to receive from the SGP but now wishes to de-register . The format of integer-based and text-based Interface Identifier parameters are shown in Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifier
description: The Interface Identifier field contains the Interface Identifier value of the matching Link Key to de-register   as found in the DEREG REQ . The format of integer-based and text-based Interface Identifier parameters are shown in Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance - The Network Appearance is a M3UA local reference shared by SG and AS ( typically an integer ) that together with an Signaling Point Code uniquely identifies an SS7 node by indicating the specific SS7 network it belongs to . It can be used to distinguish between signalling traffic associated with different networks being sent between the SG and the ASP over a common SCTP association . An example scenario is where an SG appears as an element in multiple separate national SS7 networks and the same Signaling Point Code value may be reused in different networks .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: Routing Context - A value that uniquely identifies a Routing Key . Routing Context values are either configured using a configuration management interface   or by using the routing key management procedures defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Class
description: Message Class : 8 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The following list contains the message types for the defined messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Tag
description: The Tag field is a 16-bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 . Common parameters used by adaptation layers are in the range of 0x00 to 0x3f . M3UA-specific parameters have Tags in the range 0x0200 to 0x02ff . The parameter Tags defined are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance 0x0200 Reserved 0x0201 Reserved 0x0202 Reserved 0x0203 User/Cause 0x0204 Congestion Indications 0x0205 Concerned Destination 0x0206 Routing Key 0x0207 Registration Result 0x0208 Deregistration Result 0x0209 Local_Routing Key Identifier 0x020a Destination Point Code 0x020b Service Indicators 0x020c Reserved 0x020d Originating Point Code List 0x020e Circuit Range 0x020f Protocol Data 0x0210 Reserved 0x0211 Registration Status 0x0212 Deregistration Status 0x0213
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Parameter Tag   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . Thus   a parameter with a zero-length Parameter Value field would have a Length field of 4 . The Parameter Length does not include any padding bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Value
description: The Parameter Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the parameter .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance Optional Routing Context Optional Protocol Data Mandatory Correlation Id Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: The Network Appearance parameter identifies the SS7 network context for the message and implicitly identifies the SS7 Point Code format used   the SS7 Network Indicator value   and the MTP3 and possibly the MTP3-User protocol type/variant/version used within the specific SS7 network . Where an SG operates in the context of a single SS7 network   or individual SCTP associations are dedicated to each SS7 network context   the Network Appearance parameter is not required . In other cases the parameter may be configured to be present for the use of the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The Routing Context parameter contains the Routing Context value associated with the DATA message . Where a Routing Key has not been coordinated between the SGP and ASP   sending of Routing Context is not required . Where multiple Routing Keys and Routing Contexts are used across a common association   the Routing Context MUST be sent to identify the traffic flow   assisting in the internal distribution of Data messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Data
description: The Protocol Data parameter contains the original SS7 MTP3 message   including the Service Information Octet and Routing Label .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Point Code

:LABEL: field

name: Originating Point Code
description: Destination Point Code   Originating Point Code
:LABEL: field

name: SLS
description: Signalling Link Selection Code ( SLS ).
:LABEL: field

name: Originating Point Code
description: Originating Point Code : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Destination Point Code : 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: User Protocol Data
description: The User Protocol Data field contains a byte string of MTP-User information from the original SS7 message starting with the first byte of the original SS7 message following the Routing Label .
:LABEL: field

name: Correlation Id
description: The Correlation Id parameter uniquely identifies the MSU carried in the Protocol Data within an AS . This Correlation Id parameter is assigned by the sending M3UA .
:LABEL: field

name: Mask
description: The Mask field can be used to identify a contiguous range of Affected Destination Point Codes . Identifying a contiguous range of Affected DPCs may be useful when reception of an MTP3 management message or a linkset event simultaneously affects the availability status of a series of destinations at an SG .
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: The optional INFO String parameter can carry any meaningful UTF-8 [ 10 ] character string along with the message . Length of the INFO String parameter is from 0 to 255 octets . No procedures are presently identified for its use but the INFO String MAY be used for debugging purposes .
:LABEL: field

The absence of the SI parameter in the Routing Key indicates the use of any SI value   excluding of course MTP management . Where an SI parameter does not contain a multiple of four SIs   the parameter is padded out to 32-byte alignment .

name: Home Agent
description: A router on a mobile node's home network which tunnels datagrams for delivery to the mobile node when it is away from home   and maintains current location information for the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The termination point of a tunnel toward a mobile node   for datagrams forwarded to the mobile node while it is away from home . The protocol can use two different types of care-of address : a " foreign agent care-of address " is an address of a foreign agent with which the mobile node is registered   and a " co-located care-of address " is an externally obtained local address which the mobile node has associated with one of its own network interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: An IP address that is assigned for an extended period of time to a mobile node . It remains unchanged regardless of where the node is attached to the Internet .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: An index identifying a security context between a pair of nodes among the contexts available in the Mobility Security Association . SPI values 0 through 255 are reserved and MUST NOT be used in any Mobility Security Association .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Indicates the particular type of Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the data field within this Extension . The length does NOT include the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the data field within this Extension . It does NOT include the Type   Length and Sub-Type bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the extension   in bytes   excluding the extension Type and the extension Length fields . This field MUST be set to 1 plus the total length of the data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The maximum length of time that the Advertisement is considered valid in the absence of further Advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Addrs
description: The number of Router Addresses advertised in this message . Note that in an Agent Advertisement message   the number of router addresses specified in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message MAY be set to 0 . See Section 2.3.1 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 6 + 4*N )  where 6 accounts for the number of bytes in the Sequence Number   Registration Lifetime   flags   and reserved fields   and N is the number of care-of addresses advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The count of Agent Advertisement messages sent since the agent was initialized ( Section 2.3.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Lifetime
description: The longest lifetime ( measured in seconds ) that this agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . This field has no relation to the " Lifetime " field within the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Registration required . Registration with this foreign agent ( or another foreign agent on this link ) is required even when using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Busy . The foreign agent will not accept registrations from additional mobile nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Home agent . This agent offers service as a home agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F Foreign agent . This agent offers service as a foreign agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use minimal encapsulation [ 34 ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use GRE encapsulation [ 16 ].
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Foreign agent supports reverse tunneling [ 27 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The advertised foreign agent care-of address(es ) provided by this foreign agent . An Agent Advertisement MUST include at least one care-of address if the ' F ' bit is set . The number of care-of addresses present is determined by the Length field in the Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 19 ( Prefix-Lengths Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length N   where N is the value ( possibly zero ) of the Num Addrs field in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: The number of leading bits that define the network number of the corresponding Router Address listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message . The prefix length for each Router Address is encoded as a separate byte   in the order that the Router Addresses are listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 ( Registration Request )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Simultaneous bindings . If the ' S ' bit is set   the mobile node is requesting that the home agent retain its prior mobility bindings   as described in Section 3.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Broadcast datagrams . If the ' B ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that the home agent tunnel to it any broadcast datagrams that it receives on the home network   as described in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D Decapsulation by mobile node . If the ' D ' bit is set   the mobile node will itself decapsulate datagrams which are sent to the care-of address . That is   the mobile node is using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . If the ' M ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use minimal encapsulation [ 34 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . If the ' G ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use GRE encapsulation [ 16 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Reverse Tunneling requested; see [ 27 ].
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: x Sent as zero; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates a request for deregistration . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The IP address for the end of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number   constructed by the mobile node   used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . See Sections 5.4 and 5.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 ( Registration Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code A value indicating the result of the Registration Request . See below for a list of currently defined Code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: If the Code field indicates that the registration was accepted   the Lifetime field is set to the number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates that the mobile node has been deregistered . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . If the Code field indicates that the registration was denied   the contents of the Lifetime field are unspecified and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . The value is
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 32
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 33
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 34
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Lifetime field in the Registration Reply will contain the maximum Lifetime value which that foreign agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . The mobile node MAY attempt to register with this same agent   using a Lifetime in the Registration Request that MUST be less than or equal to the value specified in the Reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Identification field in the Registration Reply will contain a value that allows the mobile node to synchronize with the home agent   based upon the style of replay protection in effect ( Section 5.7 ). The mobile node MUST adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the information in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: This code is returned by a home agent when the mobile node is performing dynamic home agent address resolution as described in Sections 3.6.1.1 and 3.6.1.2 . In this case   the Home Agent field within the Reply will contain the unicast IP address of the home agent returning the Reply . The mobile node MAY then attempt to register with this home agent in future Registration Requests . In addition   the mobile node SHOULD adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the corresponding field in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2002 ). All Rights Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document and translations of it may be copied and furnished to others   and derivative works that comment on or otherwise explain it or assist in its implementation may be prepared   copied   published and distributed   in whole or in part   without restriction of any kind   provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are included on all such copies and derivative works . However   this document itself may not be modified in any way   such as by removing the copyright notice or references to the Internet Society or other Internet organizations   except as needed for the purpose of developing Internet standards in which case the procedures for copyrights defined in the Internet Standards process must be followed   or as required to translate it into languages other than English .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Sequence Number
description: An accounting Data Record level sequence number   which is attached to all data messages to facilitate reliable and in-sequence delivery .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version field indicates the supported CRANE protocol implementation . This field MUST be set to 1 to indicate the CRANE protocol Version 1.0 . CRANE protocol Version 1.0 only supports Ipv4 addressing; however   it can be used to transfer information related to Ipv6 flows .
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: The Session ID field identifies the session with which the message is associated . The session ID is ignored in the case of GET SESS and GET SESS RSP messages . More details about session can be found in Section 2.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Flags
description: The Message Flags field can be used to identify options associated with the message . For CRANE Version 1.0   all the flags are reserved; unless otherwise specified   the flags are set to zero on transmit and are ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: The Message Length field is the total length of the CRANE message in octet including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Flow Start message is sent from a CRANE server to a CRANE client to indicate that the CRANE server is ready to receive CRANE messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Flow Start Acknowledge message is sent by a CRANE client to acknowledge the reception of a START message from a specific CRANE server . It is sent only to that server to indicate that the client considers it ready to receive CRANE messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Client Boot Time
description: The Client Boot Time field is the timestamp of the last client startup in seconds from 1970 . This field can be combined with the DSN and the client's IP address to serve as a system wide unique record identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Flow Stop message is sent from a CRANE server to a CRANE client to instruct it to stop sending data ( to that server ). The STOP message does not disconnect the server; it only stops the CRANE client from sending " DATA " messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Flow Stop Acknowledgement message acknowledges the STOP message issued by a CRANE server .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The CONNECT message is sent from a CRANE server to a CRANE client to identify itself . The message MUST be the first message sent over a transport layer connection between the server and the client .
:LABEL: field

name: Server Address
description: The Server Address field is the server's IP address ( IPV4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Server Port
description: The Server Port field is the server's port number for the transport layer ( the port number specified here doesn't necessarily have to match the port number used by the transport layer )
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: A CRANE client sends the Template Data message to a CRANE server after a START or a START NEGOTIATE message was received from the server . The message MUST contain all the templates that are going to be used for the session . It SHOULD also include the template for the status records ( See section 2.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: Config . ID
description: The Configuration ID field identifies the version number associated with a template set . Changes to any of the templates would result in a new template version   and the version number would be incremented by one . An implementation SHOULD handle rollovers of the version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field identifies any options associated to the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Templates
description: The Number of Templates field is the number of Templates ( a template is described by a Template Block ) specified by the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Template Block
description: The Template Block field is of variable length and aligned to 32 bit boundary . It is the specification of a template .
:LABEL: field

name: Template ID
description: The Template ID field identifies a specific template .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Keys
description: The Number of Keys field is the number of keys included in the template .
:LABEL: field

name: Template Flags
description: The Template Flags field is composed of flags that indicate different attributes of the template . In CRANE Version 1.0   only the ' T ' bit is defined   other bits in the field SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Description Length
description: The Description Length field is the length of the Description field . If no description is supplied   the length MUST be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Template Block Length
description: The Template Block Length is the length of the template block in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Description field contains the text description of the template ( e.g .  " Aggregated by interface and ToS bits "). It is a variable length field of up to 64Kb long   and padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Block
description: A key Block contains the specification of a key within a template .
:LABEL: field

name: Key ID
description: The Key ID field identifies the key within a template . See section 2.4 for more details .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Type ID
description: The Key Type ID field specifies the data type of the key .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Attribute Vector
description: The Key Attribute Vector field indicates different attributes of the key . In CRANE Version 1   only the ' K ' bit is defined   other bits in the field SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Template Data Acknowledge message is sent from a CRANE server to a CRANE client after a TMPL DATA message has been received . It proposes changes of the templates and/or key status changes ( enable/disable ) for the templates .
:LABEL: field

name: Config . ID
description: See Section 4.6 . The value MUST be identical to the Config . ID field of the acknowledged TMPL DATA message .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Template Changes
description: The Number of Template Changes field is the number of changed Templates ( a changed template is described by a Template Change Block ) specified by the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Template Change Block
description: Template Change Block
:LABEL: field

name: Template ID
description: See Section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Keys
description: See Section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Block
description: See Section 4.6   only relevant keys are described .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Final Template Data message is sent by a CRANE client to all the CRANE servers in a session   to convey the finalize templates . It is similar to the TMPL DATA message   with the only difference that a server must accept the templates in this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The CRANE server acknowledges reception of the TMPL DATA or FINAL TMPL DATA by sending a Final Template Data Acknowledge message . It does not carry any changes to the templates . Unlike TMPL DATA ACK messages   a FINAL TMPL DATA ACK message indicates the acceptance of the templates for the session . A server MAY respond with this message to a TMPL DATA ( if it does not want any changes in the templates ). A server MUST respond with this message to a FINAL TMPL DATA .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Get Sessions message is sent by a CRANE server to a CRANE client to query what are the sessions it should participate . This is typically done just before a UI configuration of the CRANE client's templates . As each session has its own set of templates   there is a need to know the server's participation of all the sessions .
:LABEL: field

name: Request ID
description: The Request ID field identifies the specific request issued by the server . The same Request ID MUST be placed in the responding message in order to associate it with the request .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Get Sessions Response message is sent by a CRANE client to a CRANE server as a reply to a GET SESS request . The message MUST contain all the information related to any session with which the requesting server is associated .
:LABEL: field

name: Request ID
description: See Section 4.10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Sessions
description: The Number of Sessions field is the number of session blocks in the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor String Length
description: The Vendor String Length field is the length of Vendor String field in octet . The field limits vendor strings to 64Kb long . If no such string is supplied   the length MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor String
description: The Vendor String field is a variable length field . It identifies the vendor that created the session . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary . The information differentiates similar templates from different vendors . The actual format of the information is application specific and outside the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Block
description: Session Block
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: See Section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Name Length
description: The Session Name Length field is the length of the Session Name field . The field limits the session name strings to 64 Kb long . As a name is mandatory to differentiate between sessions   this field MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Description Length
description: The Session Description Length field is the length of a session description . The field limits the session description to 64Kb long . If no such Description is supplied   the length MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Name
description: The Session Name field is the name for a session   which MAY be displayed to end-users . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary . Session Name MUST be unique within a CRANE client . This field is mandatory and MUST be a part of any Session Block .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Description
description: The Session Description field is the text description of a session; it could be displayed to end-users . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Get Templates message is sent by a CRANE server to a CRANE client to query templates in a session .
:LABEL: field

name: Request ID
description: See Section 4.10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Get Templates Response message is sent by a CRANE client to a CRANE server as a response to a GET TMPL message . The message SHOULD contain all templates available for the specific session .
:LABEL: field

name: Request ID
description: See Section 4.10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Templates
description: See Section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Template Block
description: Same as the template block defined in the TMPL DATA message ( see Section 4.6 ). However   Extended Key Blocks MUST be used instead of Key Blocks . Extended key Block field provides extensive informational data that MAY be displayed to end-users .
:LABEL: field

name: Key ID
description: Same as section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Type ID
description: Same as section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Name Length
description: The Key Name Length field is the length of the Key Name field . The field limits Key Name strings to 64 Kb long . As a name is mandatory to a key   this field MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Label Length
description: The Key Label Length field is the length of the Key Label field . The field limits Key Label strings to 64 Kb long . Length of 0 means that the Label field is to be skipped .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Help Length
description: The Key Help Length field is the length of the Key Help field . The field limits Key Help strings to 64 Kb long . Length of 0 means that the Help field is to be skipped .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Name
description: The Key Name field is the name for the key   which could be displayed to end users . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary . Key Name MUST be unique ( within the template ) and case sensitive . This field is mandatory and MUST be a part of any Extended Key Block .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Label
description: The Key Label field is a descriptive label   which could be displayed to end users concerning this key . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary . This field SHOULD be a part of any Extended Key Block .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Help
description: The Key Help field is any Help string that could be displayed to end users concerning this key . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary . This field MAY be a part of any Extended Key Block .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Attribute Vector
description: Same as section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Start Negotiation message is sent by a CRANE server after the configuration process has completed . The message should initiate template negotiation by the client with all CRANE servers in a session . The CRANE server MAY re-send this message up to 3 times with repeat interval of 5 seconds unless it is acknowledged by the CRANE client . Otherwise   the CRANE user will be informed . The client should send TMPL DATA message to the servers after acknowledged the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Start Negotiation Acknowledge message MUST be sent by a CRANE client to the server to acknowledge the reception of the START NEGOTIATE message .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The DATA message carries actual data records from a CRANE client to a CRANE server . A data record is a structured collection of fields that matches a specific template .
:LABEL: field

name: Template ID
description: See Section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field is composed of flag bits that indicate processing requirements of the data records . The CRANE Version 1 defined two flags for these purposes . Unless otherwise specified   the other flags are set to zero on transmit and are ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Sequence Number
description: The Data Sequence Number field is the record sequence number used for preserving data orders and detecting data losses . The DSN MUST be incremented by one for each new record transmitted . The selection of the initial DSN number is implementation specific .
:LABEL: field

name: Record Data
description: The Record Data field carries the actual accounting/billing data that is structured according to the template identified by the Template ID field .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Data Acknowledgement message is sent from a CRANE server to acknowledge receipt of records . It acknowledges the maximal in - sequence DSN received .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Sequence Number
description: See Section 4.16 . It MUST be DSN of the last in-sequence record that was received by the server .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Error message MAY be issued by either a CRANE server or client . It indicates an error condition that was detected by the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: The Timestamp field is a timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 GMT   January 1   1970 .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Code
description: The Error Code field is a code assigned to an error condition .
:LABEL: field

name: Description Length
description: The Description Length field is the length of the Description field . The field limits Description strings to 64 Kb long . Length of 0 means that the Description field is to be skipped .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Description field is a text description that allows the sender to provide more detailed information about the error condition . It MUST be padded with 0 to the next 32 bit boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: CRANE servers MAY inquire general operation status of a client by sending the Status Request message . The status information SHOULD include a collection of states   counters   accumulators of the data collection functions that reside with the client . The status MAY include more information about the CRANE client itself .
:LABEL: field

name: Description
description: The Status Response message contains a status report that MUST be compatible with the status template of the session . It is client's response to a STATUS REQ message from a server .
:LABEL: field

name: Template ID
description: See Section 4.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Record Length
description: The Record Length field is the length of the Record Data field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Record Data
description: The Record Data field contains the status data that complies with the status template . For more details see section 2.4
:LABEL: field

name: Server Boot Time
description: The Server Boot Time field is the timestamp of the last server startup in seconds from 1970 .
:LABEL: field

name: C '
description: The ' C '  ' R '  ' A '  ' N ' fields are ASCII encoded characters to identify the CRANE server .
:LABEL: field

name: R '
description: The ' C '  ' R '  ' A '  ' N ' fields are ASCII encoded characters to identify the CRANE server .
:LABEL: field

name: A '
description: The ' C '  ' R '  ' A '  ' N ' fields are ASCII encoded characters to identify the CRANE server .
:LABEL: field

name: Additional Protocols Count
description: The Additional Protocols Count field specifies the number of additional protocols supported by the client . In the case that only the default protocol is supported   the field MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Transport Type
description: 1 - TCP   2 - SCTP
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Version
description: Version number of the CRANE protocol supported over the specific transport layer   the current version is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Port Number
description: Port number ( either SCTP or TCP port ) used for the protocol
:LABEL: field

name: Sender Current Time
description: This field represents the current clock of the sender at the time this packet was transmitted   measured in units of 1ms and computed modulo 2^32 units from the start of the session .
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Payload ID
description: The length and format of the FEC Payload ID depends on the FEC Encoding ID as described in the FEC building block [ 10 ]. The FEC Payload ID format is determined by the FEC Encoding ID that MUST be communicated in the Session Description . The Session Description MAY specify that more than one FEC Encoding ID is used in the session   in which case the Session Description MUST contain a mapping that identifies which Codepoint values correspond to which FEC Encoding IDs . This mapping   if used   is outside the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Block Number
description: The Source Block Number identifies from which source block of the object the encoding symbol(s ) in the payload are generated . These blocks are numbered consecutively from
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: The Encoding Symbol ID identifies which specific encoding symbol(s ) generated from the source block are carried in the packet payload . The exact details of the correspondence between Encoding Symbol IDs and the encoding symbol(s ) in the packet payload are dependent on the particular encoding algorithm used as identified by the FEC Encoding ID and by the FEC Instance ID .
:LABEL: field

name: HEL
