description: Hidden ( H ) bit : Identifies the hiding of data in the Attribute Value field of an AVP . This capability can be used to avoid the passing of sensitive data   such as user passwords   as cleartext in an AVP . Section 5.3 describes the procedure for performing AVP hiding .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Contains the number of octets ( including the Overall Length and bit mask fields ) contained in this AVP . The Length may be calculated as 6 + the length of the Attribute Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: Vendor ID : The IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes " [ RFC1700 ] value . The value 0   corresponding to IETF-adopted attribute values   is used for all AVPs defined within this document . Any vendor wishing to implement its own L2TP extensions can use its own Vendor ID along with private Attribute values   guaranteeing that they will not collide with any other vendor's extensions or future IETF extensions . Note that there are 16 bits allocated for the Vendor ID   thus limiting this feature to the first 65 535 enterprises .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: Attribute Type : A 2-octet value with a unique interpretation across all AVPs defined under a given Vendor ID .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: If the M bit is set on an AVP that is unrecognized by its recipient   the session or control connection associated with the control message containing the AVP MUST be shut down . If the control message containing the unrecognized AVP is associated with a session ( e.g .  an ICRQ   ICRP   ICCN   SLI   etc .)  then the session MUST be issued a CDN with a Result Code of 2 and Error Code of 8 ( as defined in Section 5.4.2 ) and shut down . If the control message containing the unrecognized AVP is associated with establishment or maintenance of a Control Connection ( e.g .  SCCRQ   SCCRP   SCCCN   Hello )  then the associated Control Connection MUST be issued a StopCCN with Result Code of 2 and Error Code of 8 ( as defined in Section 5.4.2 ) and shut down . If the M bit is not set on an unrecognized AVP   the AVP MUST be ignored when received   processing the control message as if the AVP were not present .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The Message Type AVP   Attribute Type 0   identifies the control message herein and defines the context in which the exact meaning of the following AVPs will be determined .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: The Mandatory ( M ) bit within the Message Type AVP has special meaning . Rather than an indication as to whether the AVP itself should be ignored if not recognized   it is an indication as to whether the control message itself should be ignored . If the M bit is set within the Message Type AVP and the Message Type is unknown to the implementation   the control connection MUST be cleared . If the M bit is not set   then the implementation may ignore an unknown message type . The M bit MUST be set to 1 for all message types defined in this document . This AVP MUST NOT be hidden ( the H bit MUST be 0 ). The Length of this AVP is 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code AVP   Attribute Type 1   indicates the reason for terminating the control connection or session .
:LABEL: field

name: Assigned Control Connection ID
description: The Assigned Control Connection ID AVP   Attribute Type 61   contains the ID being assigned to this control connection by the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Local Session ID
description: The Local Session ID AVP ( analogous to the Assigned Session ID in L2TPv2 )  Attribute Type 63   contains the identifier being assigned to this session by the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Session ID
description: The Remote Session ID AVP   Attribute Type 64   contains the identifier that was assigned to this session by the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Serial Number
description: The Serial Number AVP   Attribute Type 15   contains an identifier assigned by the LAC or LNS to this session .
:LABEL: field

name: L2-Specific Sublayer
description: The L2-Specific Sublayer AVP   Attribute Type 69   indicates the presence and format of the L2-Specific Sublayer the sender of this AVP requires on all incoming data packets for this L2TP session .
:LABEL: field

name: Physical Channel ID
description: The Physical Channel ID AVP   Attribute Type 25   contains the vendor-specific physical channel number used for a call .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 2 octets of Reserved data is present ( providing longword alignment within the AVP of the following values ). Reserved data MUST be zero on sending and ignored upon receipt . Hardware Overruns : Number of receive buffer overruns since call was established . Buffer Overruns : Number of buffer overruns detected since call was established . Timeout Errors : Number of timeouts since call was established . Alignment Errors : Number of alignment errors since call was established .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type
:LABEL: field

name: L2-Specific Sublayer Type
description: This is a new registry for IANA to maintain .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Sequencing Level
description: This is a new registry for IANA to maintain .
:LABEL: field

name: Signal Type
description: This field indicates the type of Elementary Signal that comprises the requested LSP . Several transforms can be applied successively on the Elementary Signal to build the Final Signal being actually requested for the LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: RCC
description: This field is used to request the optional SONET/SDH contiguous concatenation of the Elementary Signal .
:LABEL: field

name: NCC
description: This field indicates the number of identical SONET SPEs/SDH VCs ( i.e .  Elementary Signal ) that are requested to be concatenated   as specified in the RCC field .
:LABEL: field

name: NVC
description: This field indicates the number of signals that are requested to be virtually concatenated . These signals are all of the same type by definition . They are Elementary Signal SPEs/VCs for which signal types are defined in this document   i.e .  VT1.5_SPE/VC-11   VT2_SPE/VC-12   VT3_SPE   VT6_SPE/VC-2   STS-1_SPE/VC-3 or STS-3c_SPE/VC-4 .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 40 ( not skippable ) ( see [ 1 ] and section 8 )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype A number assigned to identify the way in which the MN-FA Key Generation Nonce Request Subtype Data is to be used when generating the registration key .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The 16-bit Length field indicates the length of the extension . It is equal to the number of bytes in the MN-FA Key Generation Nonce Request Subtype Data plus 4 ( for the Mobile Node SPI field ).
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node SPI
description: Mobile Node SPI The Security Parameters Index that the mobile node will assign for the Mobility Security Association created for use with the registration key .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 41 ( not skippable ) ( see [ 1 ] and section 8 )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype A number assigned to identify the way in which the MN-FA Key Generation Nonce Reply Subtype Data is to be used to obtain the registration key .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The 16-bit Length field is equal to the number of bytes in the MN-FA Key Generation Nonce Reply Subtype Data .
:LABEL: field

name: AAA SPI
description: AAA SPI A 32-bit opaque value   indicating the SPI that the mobile node must use to determine the transform to use for establishing the Mobility Security Association between the mobile node and its prospective foreign agent .
:LABEL: field

name: FA SPI
description: FA SPI The SPI for the Mobility Security Association to the FA that the mobile node creates using the Key Generation Nonce .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 42 ( not skippable ) ( see [ 1 ] and section 8 )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype a number assigned to identify the way in which the MN-HA Key Generation Nonce Request Subtype Data is to be used when generating the registration key .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The 16-bit Length field indicates the length of the extension . It is equal to the number of bytes in the MN-HA Key Generation Nonce Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Node SPI
description: Mobile Node SPI The Security Parameters Index that the mobile node will assign for the Mobility Security Association created for use with the registration key .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 43 ( not skippable ) ( see [ 1 ] and section 8 )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype a number assigned to identify the way in which the MN-HA Key Generation Nonce Reply Subtype Data is to be used to obtain the MN-HA key .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The 16-bit Length field indicates the length of the extension . It is equal to the number of bytes in the MN - HA Key Generation Nonce Reply Subtype Data plus 4 ( for the Lifetime field ).
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime This field indicates the duration of time ( in seconds ) for which the MN-HA key is valid .
:LABEL: field

name: AAA SPI
description: AAA SPI A 32-bit opaque value   indicating the SPI that the mobile node must use to determine the transform to use for establishing the Mobility Security Association between the mobile node and its home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: HA SPI
description: HA SPI The SPI for the Mobility Security Association to the HA that the mobile node creates using the Key Generation Nonce .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Network Prefix
description: An IPv6 prefix delegated to a Mobile Router and advertised in the Mobile Network . More than one Mobile Network Prefix could be advertised in a Mobile Network .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: The Mobile Router Flag is set to indicate to the Home Agent that the Binding Update is from a Mobile Router . If the flag is set to 0   the Home Agent assumes that the Mobile Router is behaving as a Mobile Node   and it MUST NOT forward packets destined for the Mobile Network to the Mobile Router .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: The Mobile Router Flag is set to indicate that the Home Agent that processed the Binding Update supports Mobile Routers . It is set to 1 only if the corresponding Binding Update had the Mobile Router Flag set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Eight-bit unsigned integer indicating the length in octets of the option   excluding the type and length fields . Set to 18 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Eight-bit unsigned integer indicating the prefix length of the IPv6 prefix contained in the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile Network Prefix
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the Mobile Network Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: A one-bit flag that when set indicates that the Mobile Router wants to discover Home Agents supporting Mobile Routers .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: A one-bit flag that when set indicates that the Home Agents listed in this message support Mobile Routers .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: A one-bit flag that when set indicates that the Home Agent supports Mobile Routers .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Pad Length   Reserved   CGA Parameters   and Padding fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: The number of padding octets beyond the end of the CGA Parameters field but within the length specified by the Length field . Padding octets MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: An 8-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: CGA Parameters
description: A variable-length field containing the CGA Parameters data structure described in Section 4 of [ 11 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: A variable-length field making the option length a multiple of 8   containing as many octets as specified in the Pad Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Reserved   Key Hash   Digital Signature   and Padding fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: A 16-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Hash
description: A 128-bit field containing the most significant ( leftmost ) 128 bits of a SHA-1 [ 14 ] hash of the public key used for constructing the signature . The SHA-1 hash is taken over the presentation used in the Public Key field of the CGA Parameters data structure carried in the CGA option . Its purpose is to associate the signature to a particular key known by the receiver . Such a key can either be stored in the certificate cache of the receiver or be received in the CGA option in the same message .
:LABEL: field

name: Digital Signature
description: A variable-length field containing a PKCS#1 v1.5 signature   constructed by using the sender's private key over the following sequence of octets :
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: This variable-length field contains padding   as many bytes long as remain after the end of the signature .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: 5.3 . Timestamp and Nonce Options
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Reserved   and Timestamp fields ) in units of 8 octets; i.e .  2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: A 48-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: A 64-bit unsigned integer field containing a timestamp . The value indicates the number of seconds since January 1   1970   00:00 UTC   by using a fixed point format . In this format   the integer number of seconds is contained in the first 48 bits of the field   and the remaining 16 bits indicate the number of 1/64K fractions of a second .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   and Nonce fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The ICMP checksum [ 6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer field   acting as an identifier to help match advertisements to solicitations . The Identifier field MUST NOT be zero   and its value SHOULD be randomly generated . This randomness does not have to be cryptographically hard   as its purpose is only to avoid collisions .
:LABEL: field

name: Component
description: This 16-bit unsigned integer field is set to 65 535 if the sender seeks to retrieve all certificates . Otherwise   it is set to the component identifier corresponding to the certificate that the receiver wants to retrieve ( see Sections 6.4.2 and 6.4.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The ICMP checksum [ 6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer field   acting as an identifier to help match advertisements to solicitations . The Identifier field MUST be zero for advertisements sent to the All-Nodes multicast address and MUST NOT be zero for others .
:LABEL: field

name: All Components
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer field   used to inform the receiver of the number of certificates in the entire path .
:LABEL: field

name: Component
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer field   used to inform the receiver which certificate is being sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: An unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Name Type   Pad Length   and Name fields )  in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Name Type
description: The type of the name included in the Name field . This specification defines two legal values for this field :
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: The number of padding octets beyond the end of the Name field but within the length specified by the Length field . Padding octets MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: A variable-length field making the option length a multiple of 8   beginning after the previous field ends and continuing to the end of the option   as specified by the Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Cert Type   Pad Length   and Certificate fields )  in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Cert Type
description: The type of the certificate included in the Certificate field . This specification defines only one legal value for this field :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: An 8-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: A variable length field making the option length a multiple of 8   beginning after the ASN.1 encoding of the previous field [ 7   15 ] ends and continuing to the end of the option   as specified by the Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Prune state is associated with an ( S G ) pair . When a new member for a group G appears in a pruned area   a router can " graft " toward the source S for the group   thereby turning the pruned branch back into a forwarding branch .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For every source/group pair ( S G )  a router stores the following state :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For every source/group pair ( S G )  a router stores the following state :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: ( S G ) state : For each interface : Local Membership : State : One of {" NoInfo "  " Include "}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: PIM ( S G ) Prune State : State : One of {" NoInfo " ( NI )  " Pruned " ( P )  " PrunePending " ( PP )} Prune Pending Timer ( PPT ) Prune Timer ( PT )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: ( S G ) Assert Winner State : State : One of {" NoInfo " ( NI )  " I lost Assert " ( L )  " I won Assert " ( W )} Assert Timer ( AT ) Assert winner's IP Address Assert winner's Assert Metric
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The macros pim_include(* G ) and pim_include(S G ) indicate the interfaces to which traffic might or might not be forwarded because of hosts that are local members on those interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The macros pim_include(* G ) and pim_include(S G ) indicate the interfaces to which traffic might or might not be forwarded because of hosts that are local members on those interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The macros pim_include(* G ) and pim_include(S G ) indicate the interfaces to which traffic might or might not be forwarded because of hosts that are local members on those interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Pruned ( P ) The set   olist(S G )  is empty . The router will not forward data from S addressed to group G .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Pruned ( P ) The set   olist(S G )  is empty . The router will not forward data from S addressed to group G .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: When the Upstream(S G ) state machine is in the Pruned ( P ) state   the following events may trigger a transition :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Graft message to RPF'(S ). The Graft Retry Timer ( GRT(S G )) MUST be set to Graft_Retry_Period .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: OT(S G ) Expires The OverrideTimer ( OT(S G )) expires . The router MUST send a Join(S G ) to RPF'(S ). The Upstream(S G ) state machine remains in the AckPending ( AP ) state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: OT(S G ) Expires The OverrideTimer ( OT(S G )) expires . The router MUST send a Join(S G ) to RPF'(S ). The Upstream(S G ) state machine remains in the AckPending ( AP ) state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: See GraftAck(S G ) from RPF'(S ) A GraftAck is received from RPF'(S ). The GraftRetry Timer MUST be cancelled   and the Upstream(S G ) state machine MUST transition to the Forwarding(F ) state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: See GraftAck(S G ) from RPF'(S ) A GraftAck is received from RPF'(S ). The GraftRetry Timer MUST be cancelled   and the Upstream(S G ) state machine MUST transition to the Forwarding(F ) state .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: When the Prune(S G ) Downstream state machine is in the Pruned ( P ) state   the following events may trigger a transition .
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: for each interface I in pim_nbrs { if ( TTL(SRM ) == 0 OR ( TTL(SRM ) - 1 ) < Threshold(I )) continue; /* Out of TTL   skip this interface */ if ( boundary(I G )) continue; /* This interface is scope boundary   skip it */ if ( I == iif ) continue; /* This is the incoming interface   skip it */ if ( lost_assert(S G I ) == TRUE ) continue; /* Let the Assert Winner do State Refresh */
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: for each interface I in pim_nbrs { if ( TTL(SRM ) == 0 OR ( TTL(SRM ) - 1 ) < Threshold(I )) continue; /* Out of TTL   skip this interface */ if ( boundary(I G )) continue; /* This interface is scope boundary   skip it */ if ( I == iif ) continue; /* This is the incoming interface   skip it */ if ( lost_assert(S G I ) == TRUE ) continue; /* Let the Assert Winner do State Refresh */
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: if ( I contained in prunes(S G )) { set Prune Indicator bit of SRM ' to 1;
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: NotOriginator(NO ) This is the starting state of the Origination(S G ) state machine . While in this state   a router will not originate State Refresh messages for the ( S G ) pair .
:LABEL: field

name: O

name: S
description: CouldAssert(S G I ) = ( RPF_interface(S ) != I )
:LABEL: field

name: S

:LABEL: field

name: S
description: AT(S G I ) Expires The ( S G ) Assert Timer ( AT(S G I )) expires . The Assert state machine MUST transition to the NoInfo ( NI ) state .
:LABEL: field

description: AT(S G I ) Expires The ( S G ) Assert Timer ( AT(S G I )) expires . The Assert state machine MUST transition to the NoInfo ( NI ) state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: AT(S G I ) Expires The ( S G ) Assert Timer ( AT(S G I )) expires . The Assert state machine MUST transition to NoInfo ( NI ) state . The router MUST delete the Assert Winner's address and metric . If CouldAssert == TRUE   the router MUST evaluate any possible transitions to its Upstream(S G ) state machine .
:LABEL: field

name: S

The router MUST delete the Assert Winner's address and metric . If CouldAssert == TRUE   the router MUST evaluate any possible transitions to its Upstream(S G ) state machine .
:LABEL: field

The router MUST delete the Assert Winner's address and metric . If CouldAssert == TRUE   the router MUST evaluate any possible transitions to its Upstream(S G ) state machine .

description: Per ( S G ) Pair : ( S G ) Assert Timer : AT(S G I ) ( S G ) Prune Timer : PT(S G I ) ( S G ) PrunePending Timer : PPT(S G I )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Per ( S G ) Pair : ( S G ) Graft Retry Timer : GRT(S G ) ( S G ) Upstream Override Timer : OT(S G ) ( S G ) Prune Limit Timer : PLT(S G ) ( S G ) Source Active Timer : SAT(S G ) ( S G ) State Refresh Timer : SRT(S G )
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit forbidden_zero_bit . The H.264 specification declares a value of 1 as a syntax violation .
:LABEL: field

name: NRI
description: NRI : 2 bits nal_ref_idc . A value of 00 indicates that the content of the NAL unit is not used to reconstruct reference pictures for inter picture prediction . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of the reference pictures . Values greater than 00 indicate that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of the reference pictures .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: decoding order number ( DON ): A field in the payload structure   or a derived variable indicating NAL unit decoding order . Values of DON are in the range of 0 to 65535   inclusive . After reaching the maximum value   the value of DON wraps around to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: DON : Decoding Order Number DONB : Decoding Order Number Base DOND : Decoding Order Number Difference FEC : Forward Error Correction FU : Fragmentation Unit IDR : Instantaneous Decoding Refresh IEC : International Electrotechnical Commission ISO : International Organization for Standardization ITU-T : International Telecommunication Union   Telecommunication Standardization Sector MANE : Media Aware Network Element MTAP : Multi-Time Aggregation Packet MTAP16 : MTAP with 16-bit timestamp offset MTAP24 : MTAP with 24-bit timestamp offset NAL : Network Abstraction Layer NALU : NAL Unit SEI : Supplemental Enhancement Information STAP : Single-Time Aggregation Packet STAP-A : STAP type A STAP-B : STAP type B TS : Timestamp VCL : Video Coding Layer
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker bit ( M ): 1 bit Set for the very last packet of the access unit indicated by the RTP timestamp   in line with the normal use of the M bit in video formats   to allow an efficient playout buffer handling . For aggregation packets ( STAP and MTAP )  the marker bit in the RTP header MUST be set to the value that the marker bit of the last NAL unit of the aggregation packet would have been if it were transported in its own RTP packet . Decoders MAY use this bit as an early indication of the last packet of an access unit   but MUST NOT rely on this property .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload type ( PT ): 7 bits The assignment of an RTP payload type for this new packet format is outside the scope of this document and will not be specified here . The assignment of a payload type has to be performed either through the profile used or in a dynamic way .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit forbidden_zero_bit . A value of 0 indicates that the NAL unit type octet and payload should not contain bit errors or other syntax violations . A value of 1 indicates that the NAL unit type octet and payload may contain bit errors or other syntax violations .
:LABEL: field

name: NRI
description: NRI : 2 bits nal_ref_idc . The semantics of value 00 and a non-zero value remain unchanged from the H.264 specification . In other words   a value of 00 indicates that the content of the NAL unit is not used to reconstruct reference pictures for inter picture prediction . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of the reference pictures . Values greater than 00 indicate that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of the reference pictures .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: In the interleaved packetization mode   the transmission order of NAL units is allowed to differ from the decoding order of the NAL units . Decoding order number ( DON ) is a field in the payload structure or a derived variable that indicates the NAL unit decoding order . Rationale and examples of use cases for transmission out of decoding order and for the use of DON are given in section 13 .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) < 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = DON(n ) - DON(m )

name: C
description: Candidate Access Router Discovery ( CARD )
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2005 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: An AR to which an MN has a choice when performing IP-level handover .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Upon receipt of an AR-AR CARD Request   a CAR shall extract the sending AR's capabilities   if the sending AR has included its capabilities . The CAR SHALL store the received capabilities in its CAR table and set the timer for individual capabilities appropriately . The values of the table entries ' timeouts depend on the nature of capabilities in the AR-AR CARD Reply message . The CAR must include the same sequence number in the AR-AR CARD Reply Message as that received in the AR-AR CARD Request Message . The AR-AR CARD Reply shall include the CAR's capabilities as list of attribute-value pairs in the Capability Container message parameter . If the sending AR has appended an optional Preferences sub-option   the CAR MAY perform capability filtering and send back only those capabilities of interest to the requesting AR   identified according to the
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Experimental Mobility type ( assigned by IANA for IPv4 and IPv6   see [ Ke04 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code : 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The ICMP checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype : Experimental Mobility subtype for CARD; see [ Ke04 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : This field is currently unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Preferences
description: Preferences ( optional ): The Preferences sub-option carries information about attributes of interest to the requesting entity . Attributes are encoded according to the AVP encoding rule   which is described in Section 5.1.4 . For proper settings of AVP Code and Data field   see Section 5.1.3.2 . This sub-option is used only if optional capability pre-filtering is performed on ARs   and it provides only capabilities of interest to a requesting MN .
:LABEL: field

name: Requirements
description: Requirements ( optional ): The Requirements sub-option carries information about attribute-value pairs required for pre - filtering of CARs on the MN's current AR . This parameter conveys MN specific attribute-value pairs to allow the MN's current AR to send only information about CARs of interest back to the requesting MN . CARs are filtered on ARs according to the CARs ' capability parameters and given policy or threshold   as encoded in the Requirements sub -
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 8-bit identifier of the type of option   assigned by IANA . See [ Ke04 ] for CARD Request and CARD Reply values .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option   including the type and length fields in units of 8 octets . The value 0 is invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers .
description: Vers .: 3-bit version code . For this specification   Vers.=1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Assigned by IANA for IPv4 and IPv6; see [ Ke04 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the option in units of 8 octets   including the type and length fields as well as sub-options .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers .
description: Flags : P-flag : Indicates the CARD-protocol message piggybacking capability of the CARD Request message sender . A description for proper use of this flag can be found in Section 4.4 of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C-flag : Indicates that the requesting entity is also interested in associated CARs ' capabilities . If the MN wants the AR to append CARs ' capability parameters to the CARD Reply in addition to address information   the MN must set this flag .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A-flag : Indicates that the requesting entity does NOT want the receiver of this message to perform reverse address translation . This flag is set if CARD protocol messages are piggybacked with a protocol that performs reverse address translation . For details   refer to Section 4.4 of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T-flag : Indicates that the requesting entity is interested in obtaining all certificates from the responder . This flag is only valid on the AR-AR interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Initialized to zero   ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : Allows requests to be correlated with replies .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Assigned by IANA for IPv4 and IPv6 [ Ke04 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the option in units of 8 octets   including the type and length fields as well as sub-options .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers .

:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U-flag : Indicates an unsolicited CARD Reply . This flag is only valid on the AR-AR interface .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L-flag : Set if this message is the last message in a multiple ICMP message reply . This flag is only valid on the MN-AR interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Initialized to zero   ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : Allows requests to be correlated with replies .
:LABEL: field

description: Status Code : This field allows ARs to inform a requesting entity about processing results for a particular L2 ID . The L2 ID sub-option MUST be sent back to the requesting entity with a CARD Reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: Preferences
description: Preferences : List of capability attribute values ( see Section 5.1.4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Requirements
description: AVPs MUST be encoded according to the rule described in Section 5.1.4 . Both the ATTRIBUTE ( AVP Code ) and VALUE ( Data ) fields MUST be present and set appropriately . The end of the Requirements list can be determined when an ATTRIBUTE value of 0x0 is read .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Initialized to zero   ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: AVPs
description: AVPs : AVPs are a method of encapsulating capability information relevant for the CARD protocol . See Section 5.1.4 for the AVP encoding rule and list parsing .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: 0x01 IPv4 0x02 IPv6
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved

:LABEL: field

name: Component

:LABEL: field

name: Trusted Anchor Name
description: Trusted Anchor Name : DER encoding for the X.501 name of certification path component(see [ Arkko04 ] for more detail on certification path component name encoding ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved

:LABEL: field

name: All Components

:LABEL: field

name: Component
description: Component : 2 octet unsigned integer giving the location of this certificate in the certification path .
:LABEL: field

name: AVP Code
description: AVP Code : Identifies the attribute uniquely . The AVP Code 0x0000 is reserved and MUST NOT be assigned to a capability .

name: AVP Length

Proxied Originator ) 4 Link-Layer Address of the source of the RtSolPr or PrRtAdv message 5 The access point identified by the LLA belongs to the current interface of the router 6 No prefix information available for the access point identified by the LLA 7 No fast handovers support available for the access point identified by the LLA

description: The V-bit is used to determine if the message is for a particular DLC or if it is applicable for all the DLCs in the carrier . The possible values of the V-bit are listed below :

description: Type IPv6 Neighbor Discovery option . 23 .

description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option and MUST be set to 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Dist
description: Dist A 4-bit unsigned integer identifying the Distance Between MAP and the receiver of the advertisement . Its default value SHOULD be set to 1 if Dynamic MAP discovery is used . The Distance MUST be set to 1 if the MAP is on the same link as the mobile node . This field need not be interpreted as the number of hops between MAP and the mobile node . The only requirement is that the meaning of the Distance field is consistently interpreted within one Domain . A Distance value of Zero MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Pref
description: Pref The preference of a MAP . A 4-bit unsigned integer . A decimal value of 15 indicates the highest availability .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R When set to 1   it indicates that the mobile node MUST form an RCoA based on the prefix in the MAP option .
:LABEL: field

name: Valid Lifetime
description: Valid Lifetime The minimum value ( in seconds ) of both the preferred and valid lifetimes of the prefix assigned to the MAP's subnet . This value indicates the validity of the MAP's address and consequently the time for which the RCoA is valid .
:LABEL: field

name: SIO

name: Spare
description: The Spare field SHOULD be set to all zeroes ( 0's ) by the sender and ignored by the receiver . The Spare field SHOULD NOT be used for proprietary information .

:LABEL: field

name: PRI
description: PRI - Priority used only in national MTP defined in [ JT-Q703 ] and [ JT-Q704 ]. These bits are spare for other MTP versions .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: iSNS Functions : A bitmapped field defining the functions supported by the iSNS servers . The format of this field is described in section 2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: iSNS Functions
description: iSNS Functions : A bitmapped field defining the functions supported by the iSNS servers . The format of this field is described in section 2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: iSNS Server Security Bitmap
description: iSNS Server Security Bitmap : Contains the iSNS server security settings specified in section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: iSNS Server Security Bitmap
description: The format of the iSNS server security Bitmap field is shown in Figure 5 . If valid   this field communicates to the DHCP client the security settings that are required to communicate with the indicated iSNS server .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2005 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: A dynamically allocated payload type field that designates the payload as uncompressed video .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: If progressive scan video is being transmitted   the marker bit denotes the end of a video frame . If interlaced video is being transmitted   it denotes the end of the field . The marker bit MUST be set to 1 for the last packet of the video frame/field . It MUST be set to 0 for other packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The low-order bits for RTP sequence number . The standard 16-bit sequence number is augmented with another 16 bits in the payload header in order avoid problems due to wrap-around when operating at high rate rates .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Sequence Number
description: The high order bits of the extended 32-bit sequence number   in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Number of octets of data included from this scan line   in network byte order . This MUST be a multiple of the pgroup value .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset of the first pixel of the payload data within the scan line . If YCbCr format data is being transported   this is the pixel offset of the luminance sample; if RGB format data is being transported   it is the pixel offset of the red sample; if BGR format data is being transported   it is the pixel offset of the blue sample . The
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: Identifies which field the scan line belongs to   for interlaced data . F=0 identifies the first field and F=1 the second field . For progressive scan data ( e.g .  SMPTE 296M format video )  F MUST always be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Determines if an additional scan line header follows the current scan line header in the RTP packet . Set to 1 if an additional header follows   implying that the RTP packet is carrying data for more than one scan line . Set to 0 otherwise . Several scan lines MAY be included in a single packet   up to the path MTU limit . The only way to determine the number of scan lines included per packet is to parse the payload headers .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Header
description: Each AC-3 RTP payload MUST begin with the payload header shown in Figure 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: o MBZ ( Must Be Zero ): Bits marked MBZ SHALL be set to the value zero and SHALL be ignored by receivers . The bits are reserved for future extensions .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: o FT ( Frame Type ): This two-bit field indicates the type of frame(s ) present in the payload . It takes the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: NF
description: o NF ( Number of frames/fragments ): An 8-bit field whose meaning depends on the Frame Type ( FT ) in this payload . For complete frames ( FT of 0 )  it is used to indicate the number of AC-3 frames in the RTP payload . For frame fragments ( FT of 1   2   or 3 )  it is used to indicate the number fragments ( and therefore packets ) that make up the current frame . NF MUST be identical for packets containing fragments of the same frame .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC
description: Message Authentication Code
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the length of this attribute in multiples of four bytes . The maximum length of an attribute is 1024 bytes . The length includes the Attribute Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

description: This message MUST NOT include AT_MAC   AT_IV   or AT_ENCR_DATA .

description: AT_IV and AT_ENCR_DATA attributes can be used to transmit encrypted information between the EAP-SIM peer and server .

description: AT_IV and AT_ENCR_DATA attributes can be used to transmit encrypted information between the EAP-SIM peer and server .

name: AUTN
description: AKA parameter . AUTN is an authentication value generated by the AuC   which   together with the RAND   authenticates the server to the peer   128 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: AUTS
description: AKA parameter . A value generated by the peer upon experiencing a synchronization failure   112 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: RAND
description: An AKA parameter . Random number generated by the AuC   128 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: RES
description: Authentication result from the peer   which   together with the RAND   authenticates the peer to the server   128 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: Indicates the particular type of attribute . The attribute type values are listed in Section 11 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the length of this attribute in multiples of 4 bytes . The maximum length of an attribute is 1024 bytes . The length includes the Attribute Type and Length bytes .

description: AT_IV and AT_ENCR_DATA attributes can be used to transmit encrypted information between the EAP-AKA peer and server .

name: AT_PADDING
description: AT_IV and AT_ENCR_DATA attributes can be used to transmit encrypted information between the EAP-AKA peer and server .

name: AT_CHECKCODE
description: The AT_MAC attribute is not used in the very first EAP-AKA messages during the AKA-Identity round   because keying material has not been derived yet . The peer and the server may exchange one or more pairs of EAP-AKA messages of the Subtype AKA-Identity before keys are derived and before the AT_MAC attribute can be applied . The EAP /- AKA-Identity messages may also be used upon fast re-authentication .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_MAC
description: The AT_MAC attribute is used for EAP-AKA message authentication . Section 9 specifies in which messages AT_MAC MUST be included .
:LABEL: field
