name: Prf
description: Prf ( Default Router Preference ) 2-bit signed integer . Indicates whether to prefer this router over other default routers . If the Router Lifetime is zero   the preference value MUST be set to ( 00 ) by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the Reserved ( 10 ) value is received   the receiver MUST treat the value as if it were ( 00 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd ( Reserved ) A 3-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 24
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) in units of 8 octets . The Length field is 1   2   or 3 depending on the Prefix Length . If Prefix Length is greater than 64   then Length must be 3 . If Prefix Length is greater than 0   then Length must be 2 or 3 . If Prefix Length is zero   then Length must be 1   2   or 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prf
description: Prf ( Route Preference ) 2-bit signed integer . The Route Preference indicates whether to prefer the router associated with this prefix over others   when multiple identical prefixes ( for different routers ) have been received . If the Reserved ( 10 ) value is received   the Route Information Option MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd ( Reserved ) Two 3-bit unused fields . They MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Vers
description: Protocol version number . This is version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The following bit-values are defined . All other bits are reserved and should be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Msg Type
description: The following values are defined . All other values are reserved
:LABEL: field

name: LMP Length
description: The total length of this LMP message in bytes   including the common header and any variable-length objects that follow .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: The N flag indicates if the object is negotiable ( N=1 ) or non - negotiable ( N=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Class
description: The Class indicates the object type . Each object has a name   which is always capitalized in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field indicates the length of the object in bytes   including the N   C-Type   Class   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Class
description: Class = 1
:LABEL: field

name: CC_Id
description: This MUST be node-wide unique and non-zero . The CC_Id identifies the control channel of the sender associated with the message .
:LABEL: field

name: CC_Id
description: This identifies the remote node's CC_Id and MUST be non-zero .
:LABEL: field

name: HelloInterval
description: Indicates how frequently the Hello packets will be sent and is measured in milliseconds ( ms ).
:LABEL: field

name: HelloDeadInterval
description: If no Hello packets are received within the HelloDeadInterval   the control channel is assumed to have failed . The HelloDeadInterval is measured in milliseconds ( ms ). The HelloDeadInterval MUST be greater than the HelloInterval   and SHOULD be at least 3 times the value of HelloInterval .
:LABEL: field

name: TxSeqNum
description: This is the current sequence number for this Hello message . This sequence number will be incremented when the sequence number is reflected in the RcvSeqNum of a Hello packet that is received over the control channel .
:LABEL: field

name: RcvSeqNum
description: This is the sequence number of the last Hello message received over the control channel . RcvSeqNum=0 is used to indicate that a Hello message has not yet been received .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The following flags are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: VerifyInterval
description: This is the interval between successive Test messages and is measured in milliseconds ( ms ).
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Data Links
description: This is the number of data links that will be verified .
:LABEL: field

name: EncType
description: This is the encoding type of the data link . The defined EncType values are consistent with the LSP Encoding Type values of [ RFC3471 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Verify Transport Mechanism
description: This defines the transport mechanism for the Test Messages . The scope of this bit mask is restricted to each encoding type . The local node will set the bits corresponding to the various mechanisms it can support for transmitting LMP test messages . The receiver chooses the appropriate mechanism in the BeginVerifyAck message .
:LABEL: field

name: TransmissionRate
description: This is the transmission rate of the data link over which the Test messages will be transmitted . This is expressed in bytes per second and represented in IEEE floating-point format .
:LABEL: field

name: Wavelength
description: When a data link is assigned to a port or component link that is capable of transmitting multiple wavelengths ( e.g .  a fiber or waveband-capable port )  it is essential to know which wavelength the test messages will be transmitted over . This value corresponds to the wavelength at which the Test messages will be transmitted over and has local significance . If there is no ambiguity as to the wavelength over which the message will be sent   then this value SHOULD be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: VerifyDeadInterval
description: If a Test message is not detected within the VerifyDeadInterval   then a node will send the TestStatusFailure message for that data link .
:LABEL: field

name: Verify_Transport_Response
description: The recipient of the BeginVerify message ( and the future recipient of the TEST messages ) chooses the transport mechanism from the various types that are offered by the transmitter of the Test messages . One and only one bit MUST be set in the verification transport response .
:LABEL: field

name: Verify_Id
description: This is used to differentiate Test messages from different TE links and/or LMP peers . This is a node-unique value that is assigned by the recipient of the BeginVerify message .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The following flags are defined . All other bit-values are reserved and should be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The following flags are defined . All other bit-values are reserved and should be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type indicates the type of contents of the subobject . Currently defined values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Wavelength
description: Type = 2   Wavelength
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length MUST be at least 4   and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Switching Type
description: This is used to identify the local Interface Switching Type of the TE link as defined in [ RFC3471 ].
:LABEL: field

name: EncType
description: This is the encoding type of the data link . The defined EncType values are consistent with the LSP Encoding Type values of [ RFC3471 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Wavelength
description: This value indicates the wavelength carried over the port . Values used in this field only have significance between two neighbors .
:LABEL: field

name: Channel_Status
description: This indicates the status condition of a data channel . The following values are defined . All other values are reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: LMP Object Class name space and Class type ( C-Type )
:LABEL: field

name: Trace Type
description: The type of the trace message . The following values are defined . All other values are reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: Trace Length
description: This is the length in bytes of the trace message ( as specified by the Trace Type ).
:LABEL: field

name: Trace Type
description: Defined in Section 4.1.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: o TRACE Class name ( 21 ) - Type 1 ( C-Type = 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type indicates the type of contents of the sub-object .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field contains the total length of the sub-object in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length MUST be at least 4   and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Group ID
description: The main purpose of the Link Group ID is to reduce control traffic during failures that affect many data links . A local ID may be assigned to a group of data links . This ID can be used to reduce the control traffic in the event of a failure by enabling a single ChannelStatus message with the LINK GROUP CHANNEL_STATUS object ( see Section 2.4.1 ) to be used for a group of data links instead of individual ChannelStatus messages for each data link . A data link may be a member of multiple groups . This is achieved by including multiple Link Group ID sub-objects in the LinkSummary message .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Group ID
description: Link Group ID 0xFFFFFFFF is reserved and indicates all data links in a TE link . All data links are members of Link Group 0xFFFFFFFF by default .
:LABEL: field

name: BER
description: This object provides an estimate of the BER for the data link .
:LABEL: field

name: BER
description: The exponent from the BER representation described above . That is   if the BER is 10 to the minus X   the BER field is set to X .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Flags
description: Encoding for Link Flags is defined in Section 7 of [ RFC3471 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Span Length
description: This value represents the total length of the WDM span in meters   expressed as an unsigned ( long ) integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Administrative Group
description: The administrative group ( or Color ) to which the data link belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Administrative Group
description: A 32-bit value   as defined in [ RFC3630 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Link Group ID
description: The Link Group ID 0xFFFFFFFF is reserved and indicates all data links in a TE link . All data links are members of the Link Group 0xFFFFFFFF by default .
:LABEL: field

name: Channel Status
description: The values for the Channel Status field are defined in [ RFC4204 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The version field contains the version of the IUA adaptation layer . The supported versions are the following :
:LABEL: field

name: Message Class
description: 0 Management ( MGMT ) Message 1 Reserved for Other SIGTRAN Adaptation Layer 2 Reserved for Other SIGTRAN Adaptation Layers 3 ASP State Maintenance ( ASPSM ) Messages 4 ASP Traffic Maintenance ( ASPTM ) Messages 5 Q.921/Q.931 Boundary Primitives Transport ( QPTM ) Messages 6 Reserved for Other SIGTRAN Adaptation Layer 7 Reserved for Other SIGTRAN Adaptation Layer 8 Reserved for Other SIGTRAN Adaptation Layer 9 to 127 Reserved by the IETF 128 to 255 Reserved for IETF-Defined Message Class extensions
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The Reserved field is 8 bits . It SHOULD be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: The Message Length defines the length of the message in octets   including the Common Header . The Message Length MUST include parameter padding bytes   if any .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Tag
description: The Tag field is a 16-bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 . Common parameters used by adaptation layers are in the range of 0x00 to 0x3f . The parameter Tags defined are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Parameter Tag   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . The Parameter Length does not include any padding bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Value
description: The Parameter Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the parameter .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: Reason
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Data
description: Protocol Data
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Data
description: Protocol Data
:LABEL: field

name: ASP Identifier
description: ASP Identifier ( Optional ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: ASP Identifier
description: The optional ASP Identifier parameter contains a unique value that is locally significant among the ASPs that support an AS . The SG should save the ASP Identifier to be used   if necessary   with the Notify message ( see Section 3.3.3.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: INFO String ( optional )
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: The format for the ASPDN message parameters is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text-formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifiers
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text-formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type ( Mandatory ) Interface Identifier ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifiers
description: Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted )
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: The format for the ASP Inactive message parameters using integer - formatted Interface Identifiers is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifiers
description: Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) - Combination of integer and integer ranges   OR - string ( text formatted ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Data
description: The format for the BEAT message is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Diagnostic Information
description: When included   the optional Diagnostic information can be any information germane to the error condition   to assist in identification of the error condition . The Diagnostic information SHOULD contain the offending message .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status ( Mandatory ) ASP Identifier ( Optional ) Interface Identifiers ( Optional ) INFO String ( Optional )
:LABEL: field

name: Status Type
description: The Status Type parameter identifies the type of the Notify message . The following are the valid Status Type values :
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: This unsigned 32-bit field contains a counter value that increases by one for each packet sent   i.e .  a per-SA packet sequence number . For a unicast SA or a single-sender multicast SA   the sender MUST increment this field for every transmitted packet . Sharing an SA among multiple senders is permitted   though generally not recommended . ESP provides no means of synchronizing packet counters among multiple senders or meaningfully managing a receiver packet counter and window in the context of multiple senders . Thus   for a multi-sender SA   the anti-replay features of ESP are not available ( see Sections 3.3.3 and 3.4.3 .)
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: To support high-speed IPsec implementations   Extended Sequence Numbers ( ESNs ) SHOULD be implemented   as an extension to the current   32-bit sequence number field . Use of an ESN MUST be negotiated by an SA management protocol . Note that in IKEv2   this negotiation is implicit; the default is ESN unless 32-bit sequence numbers are explicitly negotiated . ( The ESN feature is applicable to multicast as well as unicast SAs .)
:LABEL: field

name: Pad Length
description: The Pad Length field indicates the number of pad bytes immediately preceding it in the Padding field . The range of valid values is 0 to 255   where a value of zero indicates that no Padding bytes are present . As noted above   this does not include any TFC padding bytes . The Pad Length field is mandatory .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: The Next Header is a mandatory   8-bit field that identifies the type of data contained in the Payload Data field   e.g .  an IPv4 or IPv6 packet   or a next layer header and data . The value of this field is chosen from the set of IP Protocol Numbers defined on the web page of the IANA   e.g .  a value of 4 indicates IPv4   a value of 41 indicates IPv6   and a value of 6 indicates TCP .
:LABEL: field

name: Certificate Data
description: o Certificate Data ( variable length ) - Actual encoding of certificate data . The type of certificate is indicated by the Certificate Encoding field .
:LABEL: field

name: Certification Authority
description: o Certification Authority ( variable length ) - Contains an encoding of an acceptable certification authority for the type of certificate requested .
:LABEL: field

name: Selector Length
description: o Selector Length - Specifies the length of this Traffic Selector Substructure including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: o Value ( 0 or more octets ) - The variable-length value of this Configuration Attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Signal Type
description: This field ( 8 bits ) indicates the type of G.709 Elementary Signal that comprises the requested LSP . The permitted values are :
:LABEL: field

name: NMC
description: The NMC field ( 16 bits ) indicates the number of ODU tributary slots used by an ODUj when multiplexed into an ODUk ( k > j ) for the requested LSP . This field is not applicable when an ODUk is mapped into an OTUk and irrelevant at the Optical Channel layer . In both cases   it MUST be set to zero ( NMC = 0 ) when sent and should be ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: NVC
description: The NVC field ( 16 bits ) is dedicated to ODUk virtual concatenation ( i.e .  ODUk Inverse Multiplexing ) purposes . It indicates the number of ODU1   ODU2   or ODU3 Elementary Signals that are requested to be virtually concatenated to form an ODUk-Xv signal . By definition   these signals MUST be of the same type .
:LABEL: field

name: t2
description: The specification of the fields t1   t2   and t3 self-consistently characterizes the ODUk label space . The value space for the t1   t2   and t3 fields is defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: LI
description: Leap Indicator ( LI ): This is a two-bit code warning of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day . This field is significant only in server messages   where the values are defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: Version Number ( VN ): This is a three-bit integer indicating the NTP/SNTP version number   currently 4 . If necessary to distinguish between IPv4   IPv6   and OSI   the encapsulating context must be inspected .
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : This is a three-bit number indicating the protocol mode . The values are defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum : This is an eight-bit unsigned integer indicating the stratum . This field is significant only in SNTP server messages   where the values are defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision : This is an eight-bit signed integer used as an exponent of two   where the resulting value is the precision of the system clock in seconds . This field is significant only in server messages   where the values range from - 6 for mains-frequency clocks to - 20 for microsecond clocks found in some workstations .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay : This is a 32-bit signed fixed-point number indicating the total roundtrip delay to the primary reference source   in seconds with the fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . Note that this variable can take on both positive and negative values   depending on the relative time and frequency offsets . This field is significant only in server messages   where the values range from negative values of a few milliseconds to positive values of several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion : This is a 32-bit unsigned fixed-point number indicating the maximum error due to the clock frequency tolerance   in seconds with the fraction point between bits 15 and 16 . This field is significant only in server messages   where the values range from zero to several hundred milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Identifier
description: Reference Identifier : This is a 32-bit bitstring identifying the particular reference source . This field is significant only in server messages   where for stratum 0 ( kiss-o'-death message ) and 1 ( primary server )  the value is a four-character ASCII string   left justified and zero padded to 32 bits . For IPv4 secondary servers   the value is the 32-bit IPv4 address of the synchronization source . For IPv6 and OSI secondary servers   the value is the first 32 bits of the MD5 hash of the IPv6 or NSAP address of the synchronization source .
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: VN 1-4 copied from 1-4 request
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode 3 4 5
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum 0 0-15 0-15
:LABEL: field

name: Poll
description: Poll 0 ignore ignore
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision 0 ignore ignore
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay 0 ignore ignore
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion 0 ignore ignore
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Identifier
description: Reference Identifier 0 ignore ignore
:LABEL: field

name: VN
description: VN 1-4 copied from 4 request
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode 3 4 5
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum ignore 1 1
:LABEL: field

name: Poll
description: Poll ignore copied from log2 poll request interval
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision ignore - log2 server - log2 server significant significant bits bits
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay ignore 0 0
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion ignore 0 0
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Identifier
description: Reference Identifier ignore source ident source ident
:LABEL: field

name: Default Gateway
description: * The default gateway's IP address on the home network .
:LABEL: field

name: DHCP Server
description: * The DHCP server's IP address in the home network .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 134
:LABEL: field

name: Data Offset
description: Data Offset : 8 bits The offset from the start of the packet's DCCP header to the start of its application data area   in 32-bit words . The receiver MUST ignore packets whose Data Offset is smaller than the minimum-sized header for the given Type or larger than the DCCP packet itself .
:LABEL: field

name: CCVal
description: CCVal : 4 bits Used by the HC-Sender CCID . For example   the A-to-B CCID's sender   which is active at DCCP A   MAY send 4 bits of information per packet to its receiver by encoding that information in CCVal . The sender MUST set CCVal to zero unless its HC-Sender CCID specifies otherwise   and the receiver MUST ignore the CCVal field unless its HC-Receiver CCID specifies otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: CsCov
description: Checksum Coverage ( CsCov ): 4 bits Checksum Coverage determines the parts of the packet that are covered by the Checksum field . This always includes the DCCP header and options   but some or all of the application data may be excluded . This can improve performance on noisy links for applications that can tolerate corruption . See Section 9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : 16 bits The Internet checksum of the packet's DCCP header ( including options )  a network-layer pseudoheader   and   depending on Checksum Coverage   all   some   or none of the application data . See Section 9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( Res ): 3 bits Senders MUST set this field to all zeroes on generated packets   and receivers MUST ignore its value .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Reserved ( Res ): 3 bits Senders MUST set this field to all zeroes on generated packets   and receivers MUST ignore its value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 4 bits The Type field specifies the type of the packet . The following values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Meaning ---- ------- 0 DCCP-Request 1 DCCP-Response 2 DCCP-Data 3 DCCP-Ack 4 DCCP-DataAck 5 DCCP-CloseReq 6 DCCP-Close 7 DCCP-Reset 8 DCCP-Sync 9 DCCP-SyncAck 10-15 Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: Extended Sequence Numbers ( X ): 1 bit Set to one to indicate the use of an extended generic header with 48-bit Sequence and Acknowledgement Numbers . DCCP-Data   DCCP - DataAck   and DCCP-Ack packets MAY set X to zero or one . All DCCP-Request   DCCP-Response   DCCP-CloseReq   DCCP-Close   DCCP - Reset   DCCP-Sync   and DCCP-SyncAck packets MUST set X to one; endpoints MUST ignore any such packets with X set to zero . High - rate connections SHOULD set X to one on all packets to gain increased protection against wrapped sequence numbers and attacks . See Section 7.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 16 or 8 bits Senders MUST set this field to all zeroes on generated packets   and receivers MUST ignore its value .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Code
description: Service Code : 32 bits Describes the application-level service to which the client application wants to connect . Service Codes are intended to provide information about which application protocol a connection intends to use   thus aiding middleboxes and reducing reliance on globally well-known ports . See Section 8.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Code
description: Service Code : 32 bits MUST equal the Service Code on the corresponding DCCP-Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Reset Code
description: Reset Code : 8 bits Represents the reason that the sender reset the DCCP connection .
:LABEL: field

name: Data 1
description: Data 1   Data 2   and Data 3 : 8 bits each The Data fields provide additional information about why the sender reset the DCCP connection . The meanings of these fields depend on the value of Reset Code .
:LABEL: field

name: Data 2
description: Data 1   Data 2   and Data 3 : 8 bits each The Data fields provide additional information about why the sender reset the DCCP connection . The meanings of these fields depend on the value of Reset Code .
:LABEL: field

name: Reset Code
description: Reset Code Name Data 1 Data 2 & 3 ----- ---- ------ ---------- 0 Unspecified 0 0 1 Closed 0 0 2 Aborted 0 0 3 No Connection 0 0 4 Packet Error pkt type 0 5 Option Error option # option data 6 Mandatory Error option # option data 7 Connection Refused 0 0 8 Bad Service Code 0 0 9 Too Busy 0 0 10 Bad Init Cookie 0 0 11 Aggression Penalty 0 0 12-127 Reserved 128-255 CCID-specific codes
:LABEL: field

name: CMR
description: CMR ( 4 bits ): This indicates a codec mode request sent to the speech encoder at the site of the receiver of this payload . CMR value 15 indicates that no mode request is present   and other unused values are reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : This is a reserved bit that MUST be set to zero . The receiver MUST ignore all R bits .
:LABEL: field

name: ILL
description: ILL ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signaled out-of-band for the session . ILL=L indicates to the receiver that the interleaving length is L+1   in number of frame-blocks .
:LABEL: field

name: ILP
description: ILP ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signaled . ILP MUST take a value between 0 and ILL   inclusive   indicating the interleaving index for frame-blocks in this payload in the interleave group . If the value of ILP is found greater than ILL   the payload SHOULD be discarded .
:LABEL: field

description: Payload s+L ( the last packet of this interleave group ): ILL=L   ILP=L   Carry frame-blocks : n+L   n+L+(L+1 )  n+L+2*(L+1 )  ...  n+L + ( N-1)*(L+1 )
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): If set to 1   indicates that this frame is followed by another speech frame in this payload; if set to 0   indicates that this frame is the last frame in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits ): Frame type index whose value is chosen according to Table 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( 1 bit ): Frame quality indicator . If set to 0   indicates that the corresponding frame is corrupted . During the interoperable mode   the receiver side ( with AMR-WB codec ) should set the RX_TYPE to either SPEECH_BAD or SID_BAD depending on the frame type ( FT )  if Q=0 . The VMR-WB encoder always sets Q bit to 1 . The VMR-WB decoder may ignore the Q bit .
:LABEL: field

name: ISF
description: ISF ( 5 bits ): Indicates the Internal Sampling Frequency employed for all frames in this payload . The index value corresponds to internal sampling frequency as specified in Table 24 in [ 1 ]. This field SHALL be set to 0 for payloads containing frames with Frame Type values 0-13 .
:LABEL: field

name: TFI
description: TFI ( 2 bits ): Transport Frame Index   from 0 ( first ) to 3 ( last )  indicating the position of the first transport frame of this payload in the AMR-WB + super-frame structure . For payloads with frames of only Frame Type values 0-9   this field SHALL be set to 0 by the sender . The TFI value for a frame of type 0-9 SHALL be ignored by the receiver . Note that the frame type is coded in the table of contents ( as discussed later); hence   the mentioned dependencies of the frame type can be applied easily by interpreting only values carried in the payload header . It is not necessary to interpret the audio bit stream itself .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L ( 1 bit ): Long displacement field flag for payloads in interleaved mode . If set to 0   four-bit displacement fields are used to indicate interleaving offset; if set to 1   displacement fields of eight bits are used ( see Section 4.3.2.2 ). For payloads in the basic mode   this bit SHALL be set to 0 and SHALL be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): If set to 1   indicates that this ToC entry is followed by another ToC entry; if set to 0   indicates that this ToC entry is the last one in the ToC .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Type
description: Frame Type ( FT ) ( 7 bits ): Indicates the audio codec frame type used for the group of frames referenced by this ToC entry . FT designates the combination of AMR-WB + core and stereo rate   one of the special AMR-WB + frame types   the AMR-WB rate   or comfort noise   as specified by Table 25 in [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): See definition in 4.3.2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Type
description: Frame Type ( FT ) ( 7 bits ): See definition in 4.3.2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: #frames
description: DIS1...DISn ( 4 bits ): A list of n ( n=#frames ) displacement fields indicating the displacement of the i:th ( i=1..n ) audio frame relative to the preceding audio frame in the payload   in units of frames . The four-bit unsigned integer displacement values may be between 0 and 15   indicating the number of audio frames in decoding order between the ( i-1):th and the i:th frame in the payload . Note that for the first ToC entry of the payload   the value of DIS1 is meaningless . It SHALL be set to zero by a sender and SHALL be ignored by a receiver . This frame's location in the decoding order is uniquely defined by the RTP timestamp and TFI in the payload header . Note also that for subsequent ToC entries   DIS1 indicates the number of frames between the last frame of the previous group and the first frame of this group .
:LABEL: field

name: Padd
description: Padd ( 4 bits ): To ensure octet alignment   four padding bits SHALL be included at the end of the ToC entry in case there is odd number of frames in the group referenced by this entry . These bits SHALL be set to zero and SHALL be ignored by the receiver . If a group containing an even number of frames is referenced by this ToC entry   these padding bits SHALL NOT be included in the payload .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): See definition in 4.3.2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Type
description: Frame Type ( FT ) ( 7 bits ): See definition in 4.3.2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: #frames
description: DIS1...DISn ( 8 bits ): A list of n ( n=#frames ) displacement fields indicating the displacement of the i:th ( i=1..n ) audio frame relative to the preceding audio frame in the payload   in units of frames . The eight-bit unsigned integer displacement values may be between 0 and 255   indicating the number of audio frames in decoding order between the ( i-1):th and the i:th frame in the payload . Note that for the first ToC entry of the payload   the value of DIS1 is meaningless . It SHALL be set to zero by a sender and SHALL be ignored by a receiver . This frame's location in the decoding order is uniquely defined by the RTP timestamp and TFI in the payload header . Note also that for subsequent ToC entries   DIS1 indicates the displacement between the last frame of the previous group and the first frame of this group .
:LABEL: field

description: where TSprev denotes the timestamp of the last frame in the previous group . The timestamps of the subsequent frames in the group are computed in the same way as for the first group .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Value 0 : IANA-assignable type using the " First Come First Serve " policy
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value 0 : IANA-assignable type using the " First Come First Serve " policy
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value 1 : Part of this Type Field space is for IANA assignable types using either the Standard Action or the Early IANA Allocation policy . The rest of this Type Field space is for Experimental use .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Value 0 : The community is transitive across ASes
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value 0 : The community is transitive across ASes
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value 1 : The community is non-transitive across ASes
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 89 for Chargeable-User-Identity .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 3
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 MPLS echo request 2 MPLS echo reply
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 Do not reply 2 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet 3 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet with Router Alert 4 Reply via application level control channel
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- -------
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The MTU is the size in octets of the largest MPLS frame ( including label stack ) that fits on the interface to the Downstream LSR .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the Downstream IP Address and Downstream Interface fields . The resulting total for the initial part of the TLV is listed in the table below as " K Octets ". The Address Type is set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: DS Flags
description: The DS Flags field is a bit vector with the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Two flags are defined currently   I and N . The remaining flags MUST be set to zero when sending and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: When this flag is set   it indicates that the replying router SHOULD include an Interface and Label Stack Object in the echo reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Echo request messages will be used to diagnose non-IP flows . However   these messages are carried in IP packets . For a router that alters its ECMP algorithm based on the FEC or deep packet examination   this flag requests that the router treat this as it would if the determination of an IP payload had failed .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Type
description: The following Multipath Types are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Depth Limit
description: The Depth Limit is applicable only to a label stack and is the maximum number of labels considered in the hash; this SHOULD be set to zero if unspecified or unlimited .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Length
description: The length in octets of the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Label
description: The set of labels in the label stack as it would have appeared if this router were forwarding the packet through this interface . Any Implicit Null labels are explicitly included . Labels are treated as numbers   i.e .  they are right justified in the field .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: The Protocol is taken from the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 Drop Pad TLV from reply 2 Copy Pad TLV to reply 3-255 Reserved for future use
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the IP Address and Interface fields . The resulting total for the initial part of the TLV is listed in the table below as " K Octets ". The Address Type is set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label-L : the label from the actual stack currently being examined . Requires no initialization .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label-stack-depth : the depth of label being verified . Initialized to the number of labels in the received label stack S .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 MPLS echo request 2 MPLS echo reply
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 Do not reply 2 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet 3 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet with Router Alert 4 Reply via application level control channel
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Sub-Type Value Field ---- -------- ----------- 1 Target FEC Stack 1 LDP IPv4 prefix 2 LDP IPv6 prefix 3 RSVP IPv4 LSP 4 RSVP IPv6 LSP 5 Not Assigned 6 VPN IPv4 prefix 7 VPN IPv6 prefix 8 L2 VPN endpoint 9 " FEC 128 " Pseudowire ( Deprecated ) 10 " FEC 128 " Pseudowire 11 " FEC 129 " Pseudowire 12 BGP labeled IPv4 prefix 13 BGP labeled IPv6 prefix 14 Generic IPv4 prefix 15 Generic IPv6 prefix 16 Nil FEC 2 Downstream Mapping 3 Pad 4 Not Assigned 5 Vendor Enterprise Number 6 Not Assigned 7 Interface and Label Stack 8 Not Assigned 9 Errored TLVs Any value The TLV not understood 10 Reply TOS Byte
:LABEL: field

name: i
description: i : 32 bit   MANDATORY Identifier of the time interval i   corresponding to the key K_i   which is used to calculate the TESLA MAC of the current packet ( and other packets sent in the current time interval i ).
:LABEL: field

name: Disclosed Key
description: Disclosed Key : variable length   MANDATORY The disclosed key ( K_(i-d ))  which can be used to authenticate previous packets from earlier time intervals [ RFC4082 ]. A Section 4.3 parameter establishes the size of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: TESLA MAC
description: TESLA MAC ( Message Authentication Code ): variable length   MANDATORY The MAC computed using the key K'_i ( derived from K_i ) [ RFC4082 ]  which is disclosed in a subsequent packet ( in the Disclosed Key field ). The MAC coverage is defined in Section 4.6 . A Section 4.3 parameter establishes the size of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: TESLA MAC
description: TESLA MAC HMAC-SHA1 HMAC-SHA1 ( TRUNCATED ) BIT-OUTPUT LENGTH n_m 80 80
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: These bits MAY be used by for per-payload signaling . Their semantics MUST be defined in the PW specification .
:LABEL: field

name: FRG
description: These bits are used when fragmenting a PW payload . Their use is described in [ FRAG ]  which is currently a work in progress . When the PW is of a type that will never need payload fragmentation   these bits may be used as general purpose flags .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: When the PSN path between the PEs includes an Ethernet segment   the PW packet arriving at the CE-bound PE from the PSN may include padding appended by the Ethernet Data Link Layer . The CE-bound PE uses the length field to determine the size of the padding added by the PSN   and hence extract the PW payload from the PW packet .
:LABEL: field

name: GID
description: The GID is not needed when exchanging information within an IB subnet though it may be included in any packet . It is an absolute necessity when transmitting across the IB subnet since the IB routers use the GID to correctly forward the packets . The source and destination GIDs are fields included in the GRH .
:LABEL: field

name: Queue Pair Number
description: Every unicast UD communication is always directed to a particular queue pair ( QP ) at the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: GID
description: This is one of the GIDs of the port associated with the IPoIB interface [ IBTA ]. IB associates multiple GIDs with a port . It is RECOMMENDED that the GID formed by the combination of the IB subnet prefix and the port's " Port GUID " [ IBTA ] be included in the link-layer/hardware address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Source Link-layer address 1 Target Link-layer address 2
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker bit ( M ): The marker bit SHALL be set to 1 if the RTP packet includes one or more whole text samples or the last fragment of a text sample; otherwise   it is set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): The payload type is set dynamically and sent by out-of-band means .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U ( 1 bit ) " UTF Transformation flag ": This is used to inform RTP receivers whether UTF-8 ( U=0 ) or UTF-16 ( U=1 ) was used to encode the text string . UTF-16 text strings transported by this payload format MUST be serialized in big endian order   a.k.a . network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o R ( 4 bits ) " Reserved bits ": for future extensions . This field MUST be set to zero ( 0x0 ) and MUST be ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: TYPE
description: o TYPE ( 3 bits ) " Type Field ": This field specifies which specific header fields follow . The following TYPE values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o LEN   in this case   represents the length of the ( complete ) text sample plus eight ( 8 ) bytes of headers . For finding the length of the text sample in the Sample Size Box of 3GP files   see Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o LEN   in this case   represents the length of the ( complete ) text sample plus eight ( 8 ) bytes of headers . For finding the length of the text sample in the Sample Size Box of 3GP files   see Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: TYPE
description: o LEN   in this case   represents the length of the ( complete ) text sample plus eight ( 8 ) bytes of headers . For finding the length of the text sample in the Sample Size Box of 3GP files   see Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: SIDX
description: o SIDX ( 8 bits ) " Text Sample Entry Index ": This is an index used to identify the sample descriptions .
:LABEL: field

name: SDUR
description: o SDUR ( 24 bits ) " Text Sample Duration ": indicates the sample duration in RTP timestamp units of the text sample . For this field   a length of 3 bytes is preferred to 2 bytes . This is because   for a typical clockrate of 1000 Hz   16 bits would allow for a maximum duration of just 65 seconds   which might be too short for some streams . On the other hand   24 bits at 1000 Hz allow for a maximum duration of about 4.6 hours   while for 90 KHz   this value is about 3 minutes . These values should be enough for streaming applications . However   if a larger duration is needed   the extension mechanism specified in Section 4.3 SHALL be used .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U   R   and TYPE   as defined in Section 4.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o U   R   and TYPE   as defined in Section 4.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: TYPE
description: o U   R   and TYPE   as defined in Section 4.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: SIDX
description: Note that the U   SIDX   and SDUR fields are meaningful since partial text strings can also be displayed .
:LABEL: field

name: SDUR
description: Note that the U   SIDX   and SDUR fields are meaningful since partial text strings can also be displayed .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o LEN indicates the length of the modifier contents . Its value is obtained upon fragmentation . Additionally   the LEN field MUST be greater than six ( 0x0006 ). Otherwise   the unit MUST be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: LEN indicates as for TYPE 3 the length of the modifier contents and SHALL also be obtained upon fragmentation . The LEN field MUST be greater than six ( 0x0006 ). Otherwise   the unit MUST be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: The LEN field indicates the length of the sample description   plus three units accounting for the SIDX and LEN field itself . Thus   this field MUST be greater than three ( 0x0003 ). Otherwise   the unit MUST be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: i . If SIDX=Z is not stored   then store the sample description . Go to beginning of step 4 ( wait state ). ii . Else   go to the beginning of step 4 ( wait state ).
:LABEL: field

name: TLEN
description: o Text strings   TLEN   U bit   and modifiers from the Media Data Box ( mdat ). Text strings   16-bit text string byte count   Byte Order Mark ( BOM   indicating UTF encoding )  and modifier boxes can be found here .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The identifier of the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the Value field in bytes . Thus   if no Value field is present the Length field contains the value zero . Each Value field must be zero padded at the end to take it up to a four byte boundary -- the padding is not included in the length so that a one byte value would be encoded in an eight byte TLV with Length field set to one .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . This length must be a multiple of 4 and must be at least 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P-picture : A picture that is coded using motion compensated prediction from past reference fields or frames .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker bit ( M ): 1 bit This bit is set to 1 if the RTP packet contains an Access Unit containing a complete VC-1 frame or the last fragment of a VC-1 frame .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload type ( PT ): 7 bits This document does not assign an RTP payload type for this RTP payload format . The assignment of a payload type has to be performed either through the RTP profile used or in a dynamic way .
:LABEL: field

name: AU Control
description: AU Control : 8 bits The usage of the AU Control field is defined in section 5.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: RA Count
description: RA Count : 8 bits Random Access Point Counter . This field is a binary modulo 256 counter . The value of this field MUST be incremented by 1 each time an AU is transmitted where the RA bit in the AU Control field is set to 1 . The initial value of this field is undefined and MAY be chosen randomly .
:LABEL: field

name: AUP Len
description: AUP Len : 16 bits Access Unit Payload Length . Specifies the size   in bytes   of the payload of the Access Unit . The field does not include the size of the AU header itself . The field MUST be included in each AU header in an RTP packet   except for the last AU header in the packet . If this field is not included   the payload of the Access Unit SHALL be assumed to extend to the end of the RTP payload .
:LABEL: field

name: PTS Delta
description: PTS Delta : 32 bits Presentation time delta . Specifies the presentation time of the frame as a 2's complement offset ( delta ) from the timestamp field in the RTP header of this RTP packet . The PTS Delta field MUST use the same clock rate as the timestamp field in the RTP header .
:LABEL: field

name: DTS Delta
description: DTS Delta : 32 bits Decode time delta . Specifies the decode time of the frame as a 2's complement offset ( delta ) between the presentation time and the decode time . Note that if the presentation time is larger than the decode time   this results in a value for the DTS Delta field that is greater than zero . The DTS Delta field MUST use the same clock rate as the timestamp field in the RTP header . If this field is not included   the decode time of the frame SHALL be assumed to be identical to the presentation time of the frame .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: PT : 1 bit PTS Delta Present . This bit MUST be set to 1 if the AU header includes the PTS Delta field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type DYNAMIC-HA-ADDRESS ( skippable ) 139 is the type   which specifies the dynamic HA address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Indicates the length of the extension not including the type   subtype   and length fields . Length is always 4 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: HA-Address
description: HA-Address Address of the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused This field is unused for all code values . It must be initialized to zero by the originator and ignored by the receiver . Description

description: Type 2
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code Set to 0 ( zero ) by the originator and ignored by the receiver .

name: MTU
description: MTU The Maximum Transmission Unit of the next-hop link .
