name: Type
description: Type 3
:LABEL: field

name: Unused
description: Unused This field is unused for all code values . It must be initialized to zero by the originator and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4
:LABEL: field

name: Pointer
description: Pointer Identifies the octet offset within the invoking packet where the error was detected .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 128
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier An identifier to aid in matching Echo Replies to this Echo Request . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: A sequence number to aid in matching Echo Replies to this Echo Request . May be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 129
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Sequence Number
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The sequence number from the invoking Echo Request message .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2006 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Status Code
description: Status Code Specified in Section ==================================================================== " Illegal C-Bit " 6.1 " Wrong C-Bit " 6.2 " Incompatible bit-rate " [ CEP ] " CEP/TDM mis-configuration " [ CEP ] " PW status " 5.4.2 " Unassigned/Unrecognized TAI " 5.3.3 " Generic Misconfiguration Error " [ SAToP ] " Label Withdraw PW Status Method Not Supported " 5.4.1
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The bit ( C ) is used to flag the presence of a control word as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2006 ).
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: 0x0002 ATM AAL5 SDU VCC transport 0x0003 ATM Cell transport Port Mode 0x0009 ATM Cell transport VCC Mode 0x000A ATM Cell transport VPC Mode
:LABEL: field

name: ATM-Specific Sublayer
description: This section defines a new ATM-Specific Sublayer   an alternative to the Default L2-Specific Sublayer as mentioned in Section 4.6 of [ RFC3931 ]. Four new flag bits ( T   G   C   and U ) are defined that concur with Section 8.2 of [ PWE3ATM ].
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: * B and E bits
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Bit ( T ) of the ATM-Specific Sublayer indicates whether the packet contains an ATM admin cell or an AAL5 payload . If T = 1   the packet contains an ATM admin cell   encapsulated according to the VCC cell relay encapsulation of Section 5.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: The ingress LCCE device SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the Explicit Forward Congestion Indication ( EFCI ) bit of the final cell of the incoming AAL5 payload is set to 1   or if the EFCI bit of the single ATM cell to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise   this bit SHOULD be set to 0 . The egress LCCE device SHOULD set the EFCI bit of all the outgoing cells that transport the AAL5 payload to the value contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The ingress LCCE device SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the Cell Loss Priority ( CLP ) bit of any of the incoming ATM cells of the AAL5 payload is set to 1   or if the CLP bit of the single ATM cell that is to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise this bit SHOULD be set to 0 . The egress LCCE device SHOULD set the CLP bit of all outgoing cells that transport the AAL5 CPCS-PDU to the value contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: When FRF.8.1 Frame Relay / ATM PVC Service Interworking ( see [ FRF8.1 ]) traffic is being transported   the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 CPCS-PDU may contain the Frame Relay C/R bit . The ingress LCCE device SHOULD copy this bit to the U bit of the ATM-Specific Sublayer . The egress LCCE device SHOULD copy the U bit to the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 payload .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: 0x0002 ATM AAL5 SDU VCC transport 0x0003 ATM Cell transparent Port Mode 0x0009 ATM Cell transport VCC Mode 0x000A ATM Cell transport VPC Mode
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Upper Layer Abort Reason
description: o Upper Layer Abort Reason - Reason of the abort to be passed to the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Upper Layer Abort Reason
description: o Upper Layer Abort Reason - The abort reason specified in case of a user-initiated abort .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Data
description: Key Data ( variable length ) - This is the actual key data   which is dependent on the Key Type algorithm for its format .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature Timestamp
description: Signature Timestamp ( 15 octets ) - This is the time value when the digital signature was applied . This field contains the timestamp in UTF-8 format YYYYMMDDHHMMSSZ   where YYYY is the year ( 0000 - 9999 )  MM is the numerical value of the month ( 01 - 12 )  DD is the day of the month ( 01 - 31 )  HH is the hour of the day ( 00 - 23 )  MM is the minute within the hour ( 00 - 59 )  SS is the seconds within the minute ( 00 - 59 )  and the letter Z indicates that this is Zulu time . This format is loosely based on [ RFC3161 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L - If set   indicates that TDM data carried in the payload is invalid due to an attachment circuit fault . When the L bit is set the payload MAY be omitted in order to conserve bandwidth . The CE - bound IWF MUST play out an appropriate amount of filler data regardless of the payload size . Once set   if the fault is rectified   the L bit MUST be cleared .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R - If set by the PSN-bound IWF   indicates that its local CE-bound IWF is in the packet loss state   i.e .  has lost a preconfigured number of consecutive packets . The R bit MUST be cleared by the PSN-bound IWF once its local CE-bound IWF has exited the packet loss state   i.e .  has received a preconfigured number of consecutive packets .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: RSV and FRG ( bits 6 to 9 ) - MUST be set to 0 by the PSN-bound IWF and MUST be ignored by the CE-bound IWF . RSV is reserved . FRG is fragmentation; see [ PWE3-FRAG ].
:LABEL: field

name: FRG
description: RSV and FRG ( bits 6 to 9 ) - MUST be set to 0 by the PSN-bound IWF and MUST be ignored by the CE-bound IWF . RSV is reserved . FRG is fragmentation; see [ PWE3-FRAG ].
:LABEL: field

name: LEN
description: LEN ( bits 10 to 15 ) - MAY be used to carry the length of the SAToP packet ( defined as the size of the SAToP header + the payload size ) if it is less than 64 bytes   and MUST be set to zero otherwise . When the LEN field is set to 0   the preconfigured size of the SAToP packet payload MUST be assumed to be as described in Section 5.1   and if the actual packet size is inconsistent with this length   the packet MUST be considered malformed .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: Sequence number - used to provide the common PW sequencing function as well as detection of lost packets . It MUST be generated in accordance with the rules defined in Section 5.1 of [ RFC3550 ] for the RTP sequence number :
:LABEL: field

name: Extension Type
description: Extension Data Length : 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Extension Data field of this option   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Extension Data Length
description: Extension Data Length : 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Extension Data field of this option   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Extension Data
description: Extension Data : Variable-length field . Extension-Type-specific data .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver : The 3-bit version field MUST be set to 1 to indicate this version of BFCP .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : At this point   the 5 bits in the reserved field SHOULD be set to zero by the sender of the message and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Primitive
description: Primitive : This 8-bit field identifies the main purpose of the message . The following primitive values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: Payload Length : This 16-bit field contains the length of the message in 4-octet units   excluding the common header .
:LABEL: field

name: Conference ID
description: Conference ID : This 32-bit field identifies the conference the message belongs to .
:LABEL: field

name: Transaction ID
description: Transaction ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that allows users to match a given message with its response . The value of the Transaction ID in server-initiated transactions is 0 ( see Section 8 ).
:LABEL: field

name: User ID
description: User ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that uniquely identifies a participant within a conference .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : This 7-bit field contains the type of the attribute . Each attribute   identified by its type   has a particular format . The attribute formats defined are :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : The ' M ' bit   known as the Mandatory bit   indicates whether support of the attribute is required . If an unrecognized attribute with the ' M ' bit set is received   the message is rejected . The ' M ' bit is significant for extension attributes defined in other documents only . All attributes specified in this document MUST be understood by the receiver so that the setting of the ' M ' bit is irrelevant for these . In all other cases   the unrecognised attribute is ignored but the message is processed .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This 8-bit field contains the length of the attribute in octets   excluding any padding defined for specific attributes . The length of attributes that are not grouped includes the Type   ' M ' bit
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Contents
description: Attribute Contents : The contents of the different attributes are defined in the following sections .
:LABEL: field

name: Beneficiary ID
description: Beneficiary ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that uniquely identifies a user within a conference .
:LABEL: field

name: Floor ID
description: Floor ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that uniquely identifies a floor within a conference .
:LABEL: field

name: Floor Request ID
description: Floor Request ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that identifies a floor request at the floor control server .
:LABEL: field

name: Prio
description: Prio : This field contains a 3-bit priority value   as shown in Table 3 . Senders SHOULD NOT use values higher than 4 in this field . Receivers MUST treat values higher than 4 as if the value received were 4 ( Highest ). The default priority value when the PRIORITY attribute is missing is 2 ( Normal ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : At this point   the 13 bits in the reserved field SHOULD be set to zero by the sender of the message and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Status
description: Request Status : This 8-bit field contains the status of the request   as described in the following table .
:LABEL: field

name: Queue Position
description: Queue Position : This 8-bit field contains   when applicable   the position of the floor request in the floor request queue at the server . If the Request Status value is different from Accepted   if the floor control server does not implement a floor request queue   or if the floor control server does not want to provide the client with this information   all the bits of this field SHOULD be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Code
description: Error Code : This 8-bit field contains an error code from the following table . If an error code is not recognised by the receiver   then the receiver MUST assume that an error exists   and therefore that the message is processed   but the nature of the error is unclear .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Specific Details
description: Error Specific Details : Present only for certain Error Codes . In this document   only for Error Code 4 ( Unknown Mandatory Attribute ). See Section 5.2.6.1 for its definition .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the ERROR-CODE attribute is 32-bit aligned . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Unknown Type
description: Unknown Type : These 7-bit fields contain the Types of the attributes ( which were present in the message that triggered the Error message ) that were unknown to the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : At this point   this bit is reserved . It SHOULD be set to zero by the sender of the message and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Text
description: In some situations   the contents of the Text field may be generated by an automaton . If this automaton has information about the preferred language of the receiver of a particular ERROR-INFO attribute   it MAY use this language to generate the Text field .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the ERROR-INFO attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Text
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the PARTICIPANT-PROVIDED-INFO attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the PARTICIPANT-PROVIDED-INFO attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Text
description: In some situations   the contents of the Text field may be generated by an automaton . If this automaton has information about the preferred language of the receiver of a particular STATUS-INFO attribute   it MAY use this language to generate the Text field .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the STATUS-INFO attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Supp . Attr .
description: Supp . Attr .: These fields contain the Types of the attributes that are supported by the floor control server in the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Reserved : This bit MUST be set to zero upon transmission and MUST be ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Two octets of padding added so that the contents of the SUPPORTED-ATTRIBUTES attribute is 32-bit aligned . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Primitive
description: Primitive : These fields contain the types of the BFCP messages that are supported by the floor control server . See Table 1 for the list of BFCP primitives .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the SUPPORTED-PRIMITIVES attribute is 32-bit aligned . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Text
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the USER-DISPLAY-NAME attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the USER-DISPLAY-NAME attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Text
description: Text : This field contains the UTF-8 encoded user's contact URI   that is   the URI used by the user to set up the resources ( e.g .  media streams ) that are controlled by BFCP . For example   in the context of a conference set up by SIP   the USER-URI attribute would carry the SIP URI of the user .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : One   two   or three octets of padding added so that the contents of the USER-URI attribute is 32-bit aligned . The Padding bits SHOULD be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver . If the attribute is already 32-bit aligned   no padding is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Beneficiary ID
description: Beneficiary ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that uniquely identifies a user within a conference .
:LABEL: field

name: Floor Request ID
description: Floor Request ID : This field contains a 16-bit value that identifies a floor request at the floor control server .
:LABEL: field

name: Floor ID
description: Floor ID : this field contains a 16-bit value that uniquely identifies a floor within a conference .
:LABEL: field

name: Floor Request ID
description: Floor Request ID : this field contains a 16-bit value that identifies a floor request at the floor control server .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: version ( V ): 2 bits This field identifies the RTP version . The current version is 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: padding ( P ): 1 bit If set   the padding bit indicates that the packet contains additional padding octets at the end that are not part of the control information but are included in the length field .
:LABEL: field

name: FMT
description: Feedback message type ( FMT ): 5 bits This field identifies the type of the FB message and is interpreted relative to the type ( transport layer   payload - specific   or application layer feedback ). The values for each of the three feedback types are defined in the respective sections below .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload type ( PT ): 8 bits This is the RTCP packet type that identifies the packet as being an RTCP FB message . Two values are defined by the IANA :
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of packet sender
description: SSRC of packet sender : 32 bits The synchronization source identifier for the originator of this packet .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of media source
description: SSRC of media source : 32 bits The synchronization source identifier of the media source that this piece of feedback information is related to .
:LABEL: field

name: PID
description: Packet ID ( PID ): 16 bits The PID field is used to specify a lost packet . The PID field refers to the RTP sequence number of the lost packet .
:LABEL: field

name: BLP
description: bitmask of following lost packets ( BLP ): 16 bits The BLP allows for reporting losses of any of the 16 RTP packets immediately following the RTP packet indicated by the PID . The BLP's definition is identical to that given in [ 6 ]. Denoting the BLP's least significant bit as bit 1   and its most significant bit as bit 16   then bit i of the bit mask is set to 1 if the receiver has not received RTP packet number ( PID+i ) ( modulo 2^16 ) and indicates this packet is lost; bit i is set to 0 otherwise . Note that the sender MUST NOT assume that a receiver has received a packet because its bit mask was set to 0 . For example   the least significant bit of the BLP would be set to 1 if the packet corresponding to the PID and the following packet have been lost . However   the sender cannot infer that packets PID+2 through PID+16 have been received simply because bits 2 through 15 of the BLP are 0; all the sender knows is that the receiver has not reported them as lost at this time .
:LABEL: field

name: First
description: First : 13 bits The macroblock ( MB ) address of the first lost macroblock . The MB numbering is done such that the macroblock in the upper left corner of the picture is considered macroblock number 1 and the number for each macroblock increases from left to right and then from top to bottom in raster-scan order ( such that if there is a total of N macroblocks in a picture   the bottom right macroblock is considered macroblock number N ).
:LABEL: field

name: Number
description: Number : 13 bits The number of lost macroblocks   in scan order as discussed above .
:LABEL: field

name: PictureID
description: PictureID : 6 bits The six least significant bits of the codec-specific identifier that is used to reference the picture in which the loss of the macroblock(s ) has occurred . For many video codecs   the PictureID is identical to the Temporal Reference .
:LABEL: field

name: PB
description: PB : 8 bits The number of unused bits required to pad the length of the RPSI message to a multiple of 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: Payload Type : 7 bits Indicates the RTP payload type in the context of which the native RPSI bit string MUST be interpreted .
:LABEL: field

name: Native RPSI bit string
description: Native RPSI bit string : variable length The RPSI information as natively defined by the video codec .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Name : RTPFB Long name : Generic RTP Feedback Value : 205 Reference : RFC 4585 .
:LABEL: field

name: SBIT
description: Number of most significant bits that should be ignored in the first data octet .
:LABEL: field

name: EBIT
description: Number of least significant bits that should be ignored in the last data octet .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Set to 0 if motion vectors are not used in this stream . Set to 1 if motion vectors may or may not be used in this stream . The meaning of this bit should not be changed during the course of the session .
:LABEL: field

name: GOBN
description: Encodes the GOB number in effect at the start of the packet . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: MBAP
description: Encodes the macroblock address predictor ( i.e .  the last MBA encoded in the previous packet ). This predictor ranges from 0 - 32 ( to predict the valid MBAs 1 - 33 )  but because the bit stream cannot be fragmented between a GOB header and MB 1   the predictor at the start of the packet shall not be 0 . Therefore   the range is 1 - 32   which is biased by - 1 to fit in 5 bits . For example   if MBAP is 0   the value of the MBA predictor is 1 . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: QUANT
description: Quantizer value ( MQUANT or GQUANT ) in effect prior to the start of this packet . Set to 0 if the packet begins with a GOB header .
:LABEL: field

name: HMVD
description: Reference horizontal motion vector data ( MVD ). Set to 0 if V flag is 0 or if the packet begins with a GOB header   or when the MTYPE of the last MB encoded in the previous packet was not motion compensation ( MC ). HMVD is encoded as a 2s complement number   and ' 10000 ' corresponding to the value - 16 is forbidden ( motion vector fields range from +/- 15 ).
:LABEL: field

name: VMVD
description: Reference vertical motion vector data ( MVD ). Set to 0 if V flag is 0 or if the packet begins with a GOB header   or when the MTYPE of the last MB encoded in the previous packet was not MC . VMVD is encoded as a 2s complement number   and ' 10000 ' corresponding to the value - 16 SHALL not be used ( motion vector fields range from +/- 15 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The Internet Society ( 2006 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Relay Header Length
description: The Frame Relay Header Length Type is a 2-octet unsigned integer with the following values defined in this document :
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F - FECN ( bit 12 ): FR FECN ( Forward Explicit Congestion Notification ) bit [ Q922 ].
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B - BECN ( bit 13 ):
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D - DE ( bit 14 ) FR DE bit indicates the discard eligibility [ Q922 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: o Must Be Zero ( MBZ ): Bits marked MBZ SHALL be set to the value zero and SHALL be ignored by receivers . The bits are reserved for future extensions .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: o Frame Type ( F ): This one-bit field indicates the type of frame(s ) present in the payload . It takes the following values : 0 - One or more complete frames . 1 - Fragment of frame . ( Note that the M bit in the RTP header is set for the final fragment .)
:LABEL: field

name: NF
description: o Number of frames/fragments ( NF ): An 8-bit field whose meaning depends on the Frame Type ( F ) in this payload . For complete frames ( F of 0 )  it is used to indicate the number of E-AC-3 frames in the RTP payload . For frame fragments ( F of 1 )  it is used to indicate the number of fragments ( and therefore packets ) that make up the current frame . NF MUST be identical for packets containing fragments of the same frame .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For every source/group pair ( S G )  a router keeps the following state :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For every source/group pair ( S G )  a router keeps the following state :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For each interface :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o State : One of {" NoInfo " ( NI )  " Join " ( J )  " Prune - Pending " ( PP )}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o State : One of {" NoInfo " ( NI )  " I lost Assert " ( L )  " I won Assert " ( W )}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o State : One of {" NotJoined(S G )"  " Joined(S G )"}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o Upstream ( S G ) Join/Prune Timer ( JT )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o SPTbit ( indicates ( S G ) state is active )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o ( S G ) Keepalive Timer ( KAT )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o Register state : One of {" Join " ( J )  " Prune " ( P )  " Join-Pending " ( JP )  " NoInfo " ( NI )}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o PMBR : the first PMBR to send a Register for this source with the Border bit set .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For every source/group pair ( S G ) for which a router also has (*  G ) state   it also keeps the following state :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: For each interface :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o State : One of {" NoInfo "  " Pruned "  " Prune - Pending "}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o State : One of {" RPTNotJoined(G )"  " NotPruned(S G rpt )"  " Pruned(S G rpt )"}
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: pim_include(S G ) = { all interfaces I such that : ( ( I_am_DR ( I ) AND lost_assert(S G I ) == FALSE ) OR AssertWinner(S G I ) == me ) AND local_receiver_include(S G I ) }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: pim_exclude(S G ) = { all interfaces I such that : ( ( I_am_DR ( I ) AND lost_assert(* G I ) == FALSE ) OR AssertWinner(* G I ) == me ) AND local_receiver_exclude(S G I ) }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Update_SPTbit(S G iif ) oiflist = NULL
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Update_SPTbit(S G iif ) is defined in Section 4.2.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: UpstreamJPState(S G ) is the state of the finite state machine in Section 4.5.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: void CheckSwitchToSpt(S G ) { if ( ( pim_include(* G ) (-) pim_exclude(S G ) (+) pim_include(S G ) != NULL ) AND SwitchToSptDesired(S G ) ) { # Note : Restarting the KAT will result in the SPT switch set KeepaliveTimer(S G ) to Keepalive_Period } }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The ( S G ) SPTbit is used to distinguish whether to forward on (* *  RP)/(* G ) or on ( S G ) state . When switching from the RP tree to the source tree   there is a transition period when data is arriving due to upstream (* *  RP)/(* G ) state while upstream ( S G ) state is being established   during which time a router should continue to forward only on (* *  RP)/(* G ) state . This prevents temporary black-holes that would be caused by sending a Prune(S G rpt ) before the upstream ( S G ) state has finished being established .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: void Update_SPTbit(S G iif ) { if ( iif == RPF_interface(S ) AND JoinDesired(S G ) == TRUE AND ( DirectlyConnected(S ) == TRUE OR RPF_interface(S ) != RPF_interface(RP(G )) OR inherited_olist(S G rpt ) == NULL OR ( ( RPF'(S G ) == RPF'(* G ) ) AND ( RPF'(S G ) != NULL ) ) OR ( I_Am_Assert_Loser(S G iif ) ) { Set SPTbit(S G ) to TRUE } }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The macro " CouldRegister " in the state machine is defined as :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The per-interface state machine for receiving ( S G ) Join/Prune messages is given below and is almost identical to that for (*  G ) messages . There are three states :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Expiry Timer ( ET ) This timer is set when a valid Join(S G ) is received . Expiry of the Expiry Timer causes this state machine to revert to NoInfo state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The per-interface state machine for receiving ( S G rpt ) Join/Prune messages is given below . There are five states :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The per-interface state machines for ( S G ) hold join state from downstream PIM routers . This state then determines whether a router needs to propagate a Join(S G ) upstream towards the source .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Not Joined The downstream state machines and local membership information do not indicate that the router needs to join the shortest-path tree for this ( S G ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine transitions to NotJoined state . Send Prune(S G ) to the appropriate upstream neighbor   which is RPF'(S G ). Cancel the Join Timer ( JT )  and set SPTbit(S G ) to FALSE .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Send Join(S G ) to the appropriate upstream neighbor   which is RPF'(S G ). Restart the Join Timer ( JT ) to expire after t_periodic seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Send Join(S G ) to the appropriate upstream neighbor   which is RPF'(S G ). Restart the Join Timer ( JT ) to expire after t_periodic seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Let t_joinsuppress be the minimum of t_suppressed and the HoldTime from the Join/Prune message triggering this event .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine remains in Joined state . If the Join Timer is set to expire in more than t_override seconds   reset it so that it expires after t_override seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine remains in Joined state . If the Join Timer is set to expire in more than t_override seconds   reset it so that it expires after t_override seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine remains in Joined state . If the Join Timer is set to expire in more than t_override seconds   reset it so that it expires after t_override seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine remains in Joined state . If the Join Timer is set to expire in more than t_override seconds   reset it so that it expires after t_override seconds . If the Join Timer is set to expire in less than t_override seconds   leave it unchanged .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The upstream ( S G ) state machine remains in Joined state . If the Join Timer is set to expire in more than t_override seconds   reset it so that it expires after t_override seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: ( S G rpt ) Joins and Prunes are ( S G ) Joins or Prunes sent on the RP tree with the RPT bit set   either to modify the results of (*  G ) Joins   or to override the behavior of other upstream LAN peers . The next section describes the rules for sending triggered messages . This section describes the rules for including a Prune(S G rpt ) message with a Join(* G ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: if ( SPTbit(S G ) == TRUE ) { # Note : If receiving ( S G ) on the SPT   we only prune off the # shared tree if the RPF neighbors differ . if ( RPF'(* G ) != RPF'(S G ) ) { add Prune(S G rpt ) to compound message } } else if ( inherited_olist(S G rpt ) == NULL ) { # Note : all (*  G ) olist interfaces received RPT prunes for ( S G ). add Prune(S G rpt ) to compound message } else if ( RPF'(* G ) != RPF'(S G rpt ) { # Note : we joined the shared tree   but there was an ( S G ) assert # and the source tree RPF neighbor is different . add Prune(S G rpt ) to compound message }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The state machine for ( S G rpt ) triggered messages is required per - ( S G ) when there is (*  G ) or (* *  RP ) join state at a router   and the router or any of its upstream LAN peers wishes to prune S off the RP tree .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Pruned(S G rpt ) (*  G ) or (* *  RP(G )) Joined   but ( S G rpt ) pruned
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Pruned(S G rpt ) (*  G ) or (* *  RP(G )) Joined   but ( S G rpt ) pruned
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: PruneDesired(S G rpt)->TRUE See macro above . This event is relevant in the " NotPruned " and " RPTNotJoined(G )" states .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: PruneDesired(S G rpt)->FALSE See macro above . This transition is only relevant in the " Pruned " state .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: RPTJoinDesired(G)->FALSE This event is relevant in the " Pruned " and " NotPruned " states .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: RPTJoinDesired(G)->FALSE This event is relevant in the " Pruned " and " NotPruned " states .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The ( S G ) Assert state machine for interface I is shown in Figure 10 . There are three states :
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: NoInfo ( NI ) This router has no ( S G ) assert state on interface I .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Assert Timer Expires The ( S G ) Assert Timer expires . As we're in the Winner state   we must still have ( S G ) forwarding state that is actively being kept alive . We resend the ( S G ) Assert and restart the Assert Timer ( Actions A3 below ). Note that the assert winner's Assert Timer is engineered to expire shortly before timers on assert losers; this prevents unnecessary thrashing of the forwarder and periodic flooding of duplicate packets .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Assert Timer Expires The ( S G ) Assert Timer expires . We transition to NoInfo state   deleting the ( S G ) assert information ( Actions A5 below ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: A1 : Send Assert(S G ). Set Assert Timer to ( Assert_Time - Assert_Override_Interval ). Store self as AssertWinner(S G I ). Store spt_assert_metric(S I ) as AssertWinnerMetric(S G I ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: bool lost_assert(S G rpt I ) { if ( RPF_interface(RP(G )) == I OR ( RPF_interface(S ) == I AND SPTbit(S G ) == TRUE ) ) { return FALSE } else { return ( AssertWinner(S G I ) != NULL AND AssertWinner(S G I ) != me ) } }
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o A router MUST NOT send an ( S G rpt ) Join/Prune message for any reason .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o A router MUST NOT forward packets based on (*  G ) or ( S G rpt ) state . The (*  G )- and ( S G rpt)-related state summarization macros are NULL for any SSM address   for the purposes of packet forwarding .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o Upstream ( S G ) state machine ( Section 4.5.7 )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o Downstream ( S G ) state machine ( Section 4.5.3 )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o ( S G ) Assert state machine ( Section 4.6.1 )
:LABEL: field

name: Z
description: Admin Scope [ Z]one indicates the group range is an admin scope zone . This is used in the Bootstrap Router Mechanism [ 11 ] only . For all other purposes   this bit is set to zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S The Sparse bit is a 1-bit value   set to 1 for PIM-SM . It is used for PIM version 1 compatibility .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: W The WC ( or WildCard ) bit is a 1-bit value for use with PIM Join/Prune messages ( see Section 4.9.5.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R The RPT ( or Rendezvous Point Tree ) bit is a 1-bit value for use with PIM Join/Prune messages ( see Section 4.9.5.1 ). If the WC bit is 1   the RPT bit MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: Holdtime is the amount of time a receiver must keep the neighbor reachable   in seconds . If the Holdtime is set to ' 0xffff '  the receiver of this message never times out the neighbor . This may be used with dial-on-demand links   to avoid keeping the link up with periodic Hello messages .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: The LAN Prune Delay option is used to tune the prune propagation delay on multi-access LANs . The T bit specifies the ability of the sending router to disable joins suppression . Propagation_Delay and Override_Interval are time intervals in units of milliseconds . A router originating a LAN Prune Delay option on interface I sets the Propagation_Delay field to the configured value of Propagation_Delay(I ) and the value of the Override_Interval field to the value of Override_Interval(I ). On a receiving router   the values of the fields are used to tune the value of the Effective_Override_Interval(I ) and its derived timer values . Section 4.3.3 describes how these values affect the behavior of a router .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: o OptionType 18 : deprecated and should not be used .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: DR Priority is a 32-bit unsigned number and should be considered in the DR election as described in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: Generation ID is a random 32-bit value for the interface on which the Hello message is sent . The Generation ID is regenerated whenever PIM forwarding is started or restarted on the interface .
:LABEL: field

name: OptionType
description: The contents of the Address List Hello option are described in Section 4.3.4 . All addresses within a single Address List must belong to the same address family .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B The Border bit . If the router is a DR for a source that it is directly connected to   it sets the B bit to 0 . If the router is a PMBR for a source in a directly connected cloud   it sets the B bit to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N The Null-Register bit . Set to 1 by a DR that is probing the RP before expiring its local Register-Suppression Timer . Set to 0 otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o The combination of a (*  G ) Prune and a ( S G rpt ) Join is also not generated . ( S G rpt ) Joins are only sent when the router is receiving all traffic for a group on the shared tree and it wishes to indicate a change for the particular source . As a (*  G ) prune indicates that the router no longer wishes to receive shared tree traffic   the ( S G rpt ) Join would be meaningless .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: PIM Version   Type   Reserved   Checksum Described in Section 4.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R RPT-bit is a 1-bit value . The RPT-bit is set to 1 for Assert(* G ) messages and 0 for Assert(S G ) messages .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Neighbor Liveness Timer : NLT(N I )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: ( S G ) Join Expiry Timer : ET(S G I )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o The PIM-SM forwarding rule " iif == RPF_interface(S )" is relaxed to be TRUE if iif is any interface that is not part of the PIM-SM component of the PMBR ( see Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Signal Type
description: This field indicates the type of Elementary Signal that constitutes the requested Label Switched Path ( LSP ). Several transforms can be applied successively on the Elementary Signal to build the Final Signal actually being requested for the LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: RCC
description: This field is used to request the optional SONET/SDH contiguous concatenation of the Elementary Signal .
:LABEL: field

name: NCC
description: This field indicates the number of identical SONET SPEs/SDH VCs ( i.e .  Elementary Signal ) that are requested to be concatenated   as specified in the RCC field .
:LABEL: field

name: NVC
description: This field indicates the number of signals that are requested to be virtually concatenated . These signals are all of the same type by definition . They are Elementary Signal SPEs/VCs for which signal types are defined in this document; i.e .  VT1.5_SPE/VC-11
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: 1 . S=1->N is the index of a particular STS-3/AUG-1 inside an STS-N/STM-N multiplex . S is only significant for SONET STS-N ( N>1 ) and SDH STM-N ( N>0 ). S must be 0 and ignored for STS-1 and STM-0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: * 139 - NI Query
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: * For NI Query
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: o Qtype - A 16-bit field that designates the type of information requested in a Query or supplied in a Reply . Its value in a Reply is always copied from the corresponding Query by the Responder . Five values of Qtype are specified in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Qtype
description: o Qtype - A 16-bit field that designates the type of information requested in a Query or supplied in a Reply . Its value in a Reply is always copied from the corresponding Query by the Responder . Five values of Qtype are specified in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: o Flags - Qtype-specific flags that may be defined for certain Query types and their Replies . Flags not defined for a given Qtype must be zero on transmission and ignored on reception   and must not be copied from a Query to a Reply unless so specified in the definition of the Qtype .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: o Nonce - An opaque 64-bit field to help avoid spoofing and/or to aid in matching Replies with Queries . Its value in a Query is chosen by the Querier . Its value in a Reply is always copied from the corresponding Request by the Responder .
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: o Data - In a Query   the Subject Address or Name . In a Reply   Qtype-specific data is present only when the ICMPv6 Code field is zero . The length of the Data may be inferred from the IPv6 header's Payload Length field [ 6 ]  the length of the fixed portion
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: o TTL ( Time to Live ) - MUST be zero . Any non-zero value received MUST be treated as zero . This field is no longer used but is present to preserve backward compatibility with older implementations .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: o S - If set to 1   Site-local addresses [ 12 ] are requested . However   Site-local addresses are now deprecated [ 15 ] and this flag is for backward compatibility .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o S - If set to 1   Site-local addresses [ 12 ] are requested . However   Site-local addresses are now deprecated [ 15 ] and this flag is for backward compatibility .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: o C - If set to 1   IPv4-compatible ( now deprecated ) and IPv4-mapped addresses [ 3 ] are requested . Responses SHOULD include IPv4 addresses in IPv4-mapped form .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: o C - If set to 1   IPv4-compatible ( now deprecated ) and IPv4-mapped addresses [ 3 ] are requested . Responses SHOULD include IPv4 addresses in IPv4-mapped form .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o A - If set to 1   all the Responder's unicast addresses ( of the specified scope(s )) are requested . If 0   only those addresses are requested that belong to the interface ( or any one interface ) that
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: o T - Defined in a Reply only   indicates that the set of addresses is incomplete for space reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o A - If set to 1   all the Responder's unicast addresses are requested . If 0   only those addresses are requested that belong to the interface ( or any one interface ) that has the Subject Address .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: o T - Defined in a Reply only   indicates that the set of addresses is incomplete for space reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: MRU
description: Figure 4 : L2TP Maximum Receive Unit ( MRU ) AVP
:LABEL: field

name: MRRU
description: Figure 5 : L2TP Maximum Reassembled Receive Unit ( MRRU ) AVP
:LABEL: field

name: RR
description: Reserved bits . It SHALL be zero and MUST be ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Indicates the picture start or a picture segment ( GOB/Slice ) start or a video sequence end ( EOS or EOSBS ). Two bytes of zero bits then have to be prefixed to the payload of such a packet to compose a complete picture/GOB/slice/EOS/EOSBS start code . This bit allows the omission of the two first bytes of the start codes   thus improving the compression ratio .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Indicates the presence of an 8-bit field containing information for Video Redundancy Coding ( VRC )  which follows immediately after the initial 16 bits of the payload header   if present . For syntax and semantics of that 8-bit VRC field   see Section 5.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: PLEN
description: Length   in bytes   of the extra picture header . If no extra picture header is attached   PLEN is 0 . If PLEN>0   the extra picture header is attached immediately following the rest of the payload header . Note that the length reflects the omission of the first two bytes of the picture start code ( PSC ). See Section 6.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: PEBIT
description: Indicates the number of bits that shall be ignored in the last byte of the picture header . If PLEN is not zero   the ignored bits shall be the least significant bits of the byte . If PLEN is zero   then PEBIT shall also be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: Thread ID . Up to 7 threads are allowed . Each frame of H.263 + VRC data will use as reference information only sync frames or frames within the same thread . By convention   thread 0 is expected to be the " canonical " thread   which is the thread from which the sync frame should ideally be used . In the case of corruption or loss of the thread 0 representation   a representation of the sync frame with a higher thread number can be used by the decoder . Lower thread numbers are expected to contain representations of the sync frames equal to or better than higher thread numbers in the absence of data corruption or loss . See [ Vredun ] for a detailed discussion of VRC .
:LABEL: field

name: Trun
description: Monotonically increasing ( modulo 16 ) 4-bit number counting the packet number within each thread .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: A bit that indicates that the packet content is for a sync frame . An encoder using VRC may send several representations of the same " sync " picture   in order to ensure that   regardless of which thread of pictures is corrupted by errors or packet losses   the reception of at least one representation of a particular picture is ensured ( within at least one thread ). The sync picture can then be used for the prediction of any thread . If packet losses have not occurred   then the sync frame contents of thread 0 can be used   and those of other threads can be discarded ( and similarly for other threads ). Thread 0 is considered the " canonical " thread   the use of which is preferable
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Codec options ( F I J K N P T ): These options MUST NOT appear unless the sender of these SDP parameters is able to decode those options . These options designate receiver capabilities even when sent in a " sendonly " offer .
:LABEL: field

description: This means that the sender of this message can decode an H.263 bit stream with a preferred custom picture size of 640x480 at a maximum frame rate of 25 frames per second using a custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz . If that is not possible   then the 640x480 picture size is also supported at up to 30/2.002 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz . If neither of those is possible   then the CIF and QCIF picture sizes are also supported at up to 50 frames per second using the custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz or up to 30/1.001 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz   and CIF is preferred over QCIF .
:LABEL: field

description: This means that the sender of this message can decode an H.263 bit stream with a preferred custom picture size of 640x480 at a maximum frame rate of 25 frames per second using a custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz . If that is not possible   then the 640x480 picture size is also supported at up to 30/2.002 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz . If neither of those is possible   then the CIF and QCIF picture sizes are also supported at up to 50 frames per second using the custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz or up to 30/1.001 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz   and CIF is preferred over QCIF .
:LABEL: field

description: This means that the sender of this message can decode an H.263 bit stream with a preferred custom picture size of 640x480 at a maximum frame rate of 25 frames per second using a custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz . If that is not possible   then the 640x480 picture size is also supported at up to 30/2.002 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz . If neither of those is possible   then the CIF and QCIF picture sizes are also supported at up to 50 frames per second using the custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz or up to 30/1.001 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz   and CIF is preferred over QCIF .
:LABEL: field

description: This means that the sender of this message can decode an H.263 bit stream with a preferred custom picture size of 640x480 at a maximum frame rate of 25 frames per second using a custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz . If that is not possible   then the 640x480 picture size is also supported at up to 30/2.002 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz . If neither of those is possible   then the CIF and QCIF picture sizes are also supported at up to 50 frames per second using the custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz or up to 30/1.001 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz   and CIF is preferred over QCIF .
:LABEL: field

description: This means that the sender of this message can decode an H.263 bit stream with a preferred custom picture size of 640x480 at a maximum frame rate of 25 frames per second using a custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz . If that is not possible   then the 640x480 picture size is also supported at up to 30/2.002 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz . If neither of those is possible   then the CIF and QCIF picture sizes are also supported at up to 50 frames per second using the custom picture clock frequency of 50 Hz or up to 30/1.001 frames per second using the ordinary picture clock frequency of 30/1.001 Hz   and CIF is preferred over QCIF .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: A status code used by the foreign agent to supply status information to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance - The Network Appearance is a M3UA local reference shared by SG and AS ( typically an integer ) that   together with an Signaling Point Code   uniquely identifies an SS7 node by indicating the specific SS7 network to which it belongs . It can be used to distinguish between signalling traffic associated with different networks being sent between the SG and the ASP over a common SCTP association . An example scenario is where an SG appears as an
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: Routing Context - A value that uniquely identifies a Routing Key . Routing Context values are configured either using a configuration management interface   or by using the routing key management procedures defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Class
description: Message Class : 8 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The following list contains the message types for the defined messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The Reserved field SHOULD be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: The Message Length defines the length of the message in octets   including the Common Header . The Message Length MUST include parameter padding octets   if there are any .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Tag
description: The Tag field is a 16-bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 . Common parameters used by adaptation layers are in the range of 0x00 to 0x3f . M3UA-specific parameters have Tags in the range 0x0200 to 0x02ff . The parameter Tags defined are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance 0x0200 Reserved 0x0201 Reserved 0x0202 Reserved 0x0203 User/Cause 0x0204 Congestion Indications 0x0205 Concerned Destination 0x0206 Routing Key 0x0207 Registration Result 0x0208 Deregistration Result 0x0209 Local Routing Key Identifier 0x020a Destination Point Code 0x020b Service Indicators 0x020c Reserved 0x020d Originating Point Code List 0x020e Reserved 0x020f Protocol Data 0x0210 Reserved 0x0211 Registration Status 0x0212 Deregistration Status 0x0213 Reserved by the IETF 0x0214 to 0xffff
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in octets   including the Parameter Tag   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . Thus   a parameter with a zero-length Parameter Value field would have a Length field of 4 . The Parameter Length does not include any padding octets . If the parameter contains subparameters   the Parameter Length field will include all the octets of each subparameter   including subparameter padding octets ( if there are any ).
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Value
description: The Parameter Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the parameter .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance Optional Routing Context Conditional Protocol Data Mandatory Correlation Id Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: The Network Appearance parameter identifies the SS7 network context for the message and implicitly identifies the SS7 Point Code format used   the SS7 Network Indicator value   and the MTP3 and possibly the MTP3-User protocol type/variant/version used within the specific SS7 network . Where an SG operates in the context of a single SS7 network   or if individual SCTP associations are dedicated to each SS7 network context   the Network Appearance parameter is not required . In other cases   the parameter may be configured to be present for the use of the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The Routing Context parameter contains the Routing Context value associated with the DATA message . Where a Routing Key has not been coordinated between the SGP and ASP   sending of Routing Context is not required . Where multiple Routing Keys and Routing Contexts are used across a common association   the Routing Context MUST be sent to identify the traffic flow   assisting in the internal distribution of Data messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Data
description: The Protocol Data parameter contains the original SS7 MTP3 message   including the Service Information Octet and Routing Label .
:LABEL: field

name: SLS
description: Signalling Link Selection Code ( SLS )
:LABEL: field

name: User Protocol Data
description: MTP3-User protocol elements ( e.g .  ISUP   SCCP   or TUP parameters )
:LABEL: field

name: Originating Point Code
description: Originating Point Code : 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Point Code
description: The Originating and Destination Point Code fields contains the OPC and DPC from the routing label of the original SS7 message in Network Byte Order   justified to the least significant bit . Unused bits are coded ` 0 '.
:LABEL: field

name: User Protocol Data
description: The User Protocol Data field contains an octet string of MTP-User information from the original SS7 message   starting with the first octet of the original SS7 message following the Routing Label [ 7][8][26 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Correlation Id
description: The Correlation Id parameter uniquely identifies the MSU carried in the Protocol Data within an AS . This Correlation Id parameter is assigned by the sending M3UA .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance Optional Routing Context Conditional Affected Point Code Mandatory INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: The description of Network Appearance in Section 3.3.1 applies   with the exception that Network Appearance does not have to be the first parameter in this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The conditional Routing Context parameter contains the Routing Context values associated with the DUNA message . Where a Routing Key has not been coordinated between the SGP and ASP   sending of Routing Context is not required . Where multiple Routing Keys and Routing Contexts are used across a common association   the Routing Context(s ) MUST be sent to identify the concerned traffic flows for which the DUNA message applies   assisting in outgoing traffic management and internal distribution of MTP-PAUSE indications to MTP3-Users at the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Mask
description: The Mask field can be used to identify a contiguous range of Affected Destination Point Codes . Identifying a contiguous range of Affected DPCs may be useful when receipt of an MTP3 management message or a linkset event simultaneously affects the availability status of a series of destinations at an SG .
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: The optional INFO String parameter can carry any meaningful UTF-8 [ 10 ] character string along with the message . Length of the INFO String parameter is from 0 to 255 octets . No procedures are presently identified for its use   but the INFO String MAY be used for debugging purposes . An INFO String with a zero-length parameter is not considered an error ( a zero length parameter is one in which the Length field in the TLV will be set to 4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: Network Appearance Optional Routing Context Conditional Affected Point Code Mandatory INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

description: Network Appearance Optional Routing Context Conditional Affected Point Code Mandatory INFO String Optional

name: ASP Identifier
description: ASP Identifier Optional INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: ASP Identifier
description: The optional ASP Identifier parameter contains a unique value that is locally significant among the ASPs that support an AS . The SGP should save the ASP Identifier to be used   if necessary   with the Notify message ( see Section 3.8.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: ASP Identifier
description: ASP Identifier Optional INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: INFO String
description: INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

description: INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Data
description: The format for the BEAT message is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: The optional Traffic Mode Type parameter identifies the traffic mode of operation of the ASP(s ) within an Application Server . The format of the Traffic Mode Type Identifier is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Point Code
description: The Destination Point Code parameter is mandatory   and it identifies the Destination Point Code of incoming SS7 traffic for which the ASP is registering . For an alias point code configuration   the DPC parameter would be repeated for each point code . The format is the same as described for the Affected Destination parameter in the DUNA message ( see Section 3.4.1 ). Its format is :
:LABEL: field

name: Network Appearance
description: The optional Network Appearance parameter field identifies the SS7 network context for the Routing Key   and it has the same format as in the DATA message ( see Section 3.3.1 ) with the exception that it does not have to be the first parameter in the message . If the Network Appearance is not specified and the Routing Key applies to all Network Appearances   then this Routing Key MUST be the only one registered for the association; that is   Routing Context is implied   and DATA and SSNM messages are discriminated on Network Appearance rather than on Routing Context . Where Network Appearance is not specified and there is only one Network Appearance   then Network Appearance is implied . Its format is :
:LABEL: field

name: SI
description: The optional SI [ 7 8 ] field contains one or more Service Indicators from the values described in the MTP3-User Identity field of the DUPU message . The absence of the SI parameter in the Routing Key indicates the use of any SI value   excluding of course MTP management . Where an SI parameter does not contain a multiple of four SIs   the parameter is padded out to 32-byte alignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Status
description: The Registration Result Status field indicates the success or the reason for failure of a registration request .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The Routing Context field contains the Routing Context value for the associated Routing Key if the registration was successful . It is set to " 0 " if the registration was not successful .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The format for the DEREG REQ message is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The Routing Context parameter contains ( a list of ) integers indexing the Application Server traffic that the sending ASP is currently registered to receive from the SGP but now wishes to deregister .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The Routing Context field contains the Routing Context value of the matching Routing Key to deregister   as found in the DEREG REQ message .
:LABEL: field

name: Deregistration Status
description: The Deregistration Result Status field indicates the success or the reason for failure of the deregistration .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type Optional Routing Context Optional INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: The Traffic Mode Type parameter identifies the traffic mode of operation of the ASP within an AS . The valid values for Traffic Mode Type are shown in the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: The optional Routing Context parameter contains ( a list of ) integers indexing the Application Server traffic that the sending ASP is configured/registered to receive .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Mode Type
description: Traffic Mode Type Optional Routing Context Optional INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

description: Routing Context Optional INFO String Optional
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Context
description: Routing Context Optional INFO String Optional

name: Error Code
description: Error Code Mandatory Routing Context Mandatory* Network Appearance Mandatory* Affected Point Code Mandatory* Diagnostic Information Conditional
:LABEL: field

name: Error Code
description: The Error Code parameter indicates the reason for the Error Message . The Error parameter value can be one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Diagnostic Information
description: When included   the optional Diagnostic Information can be any information germane to the error condition   to assist in identification of the error condition . The Diagnostic Information SHOULD contain the offending message . A Diagnostic Information parameter with a zero length parameter is not considered an error ( this means that the Length field in the TLV will be set to 4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Status Type
description: The Status Type parameter identifies the type of the Notify message . The following are the valid Status Type values :
:LABEL: field

name: Status Information
description: The Status Information parameter contains more detailed information for the notification   based on the value of the Status Type . If the Status Type is AS-State_Change the following Status Information values are used :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . The format is described below :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets . Supported values include :
:LABEL: field

name: String
description: The String field is at least one octet in length and contains the VLAN Name as defined in [ IEEE-802.1Q ] clause 12.10.2.1.3 ( a ). [ RFC3629 ] UTF-8 encoded 10646 characters are RECOMMENDED   but a robust implementation SHOULD support the field as undistinguished octets .
:LABEL: field

name: String
description: The String field is 8 octets in length and includes a table that maps the incoming priority ( if it is set -- the default is 0 ) into one of eight regenerated priorities . The first octet maps to incoming priority 0   the second octet to incoming priority 1   etc . The values in each octet represent the regenerated priority of the frame .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : The length of this option is variable . The minimum length is 3 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: what
description: what : The ' what ' element describes to which location the DHCP entry refers . Currently   three options are defined : the location of the DHCP server ( a value of 0 )  the location of the network element believed to be closest to the client ( a value of 1 )  or the location of the client ( a value of 2 ). Option ( 2 ) SHOULD be used   but may not be known . Options ( 0 ) and ( 1 ) SHOULD NOT be used unless it is known that the DHCP client is in close physical proximity to the server or network element .
:LABEL: field

name: country code
description: country code : The two-letter ISO 3166 country code in capital ASCII letters   e.g .  DE or US . ( Civic addresses always contain country designations   suggesting the use of a fixed-format field to save space .)
:LABEL: field

name: what
description: what : See above ( Section 3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: country code
description: country code : See above ( Section 3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: CAtype
description: CAlength : The length   in octets   of the CAvalue   not including the CAlength field itself .
:LABEL: field

name: CAlength
description: CAlength : The length   in octets   of the CAvalue   not including the CAlength field itself .
:LABEL: field

name: CAtype
description: Brief description : Short description identifying the meaning of the element .
:LABEL: field

description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: o Message Length : A 4-byte signed integer value representing the total length of the SASP message . It is said to be a signed 4-byte value to make any Java implementations easier ( or any other implementations without unsigned values); however   no negative lengths are valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: o Message Length : A 4-byte signed integer value representing the total length of the SASP message . It is said to be a signed 4-byte value to make any Java implementations easier ( or any other implementations without unsigned values); however   no negative lengths are valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: o Message ID : Each request message is given a 4-byte Message ID by the message originator   which is simply returned in the Message ID field of the reply . This field is meant to assist the requester in correlating replies to the appropriate request when many requests have been sent . In the Send Weights message ( the only message transaction that has no reply )  this field serves no purpose .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: o Protocol : The assigned number of the IP transport layer used in the Protocol Field of the IP header . These are defined in [ RFC1700 ]; however   a current list is maintained at http://www.iana.org . for example : TCP = 0x06   UDP = 0x11   etc .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: o Port : The port number used for communication to the member . *** A value of 0 can be given for the Protocol and Port to signify a system level member . However   0 shouldn't be perceived as a wildcard for either Port or Protocol fields ( i.e .  a deregistration request that includes a MemberData component with a 0 for the port doesn't mean deregister all applications listening on any port of that IP and protocol ).
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: o Label : A UTF8 string that may be set while registering a member . This string is opaque to the GWM and is simply included with any correspondence containing the member data component . Note that the size of this label is <= 255 bytes . Because UTF8 character encodings may be up to 6 bytes   care must be exercised by the load balancer or member to make sure the UTF8 string it sends the GWM is in fact <= 255 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: LB UID Length
description: o LB UID : A UTF8 string used as a unique identifier and a context for the Group Name ( e.g .  a UTF8 representation of the MAC address of the load balancer or some type of Universally Unique Identifier ( UUID )). This string is used by the Group Workload Manager to associate application registration and deregistration   and to set state messages with the correct load balancer . This unique identifier should not be any longer than 64 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Group Name Len
description: o Group Name Len : Length of the Group Name field to follow ( in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: State Field
description: o State Field : This field is used by the member to communicate state information to the scheduler . The information placed in this field is opaque to the GWM and will simply be forwarded to the scheduler with the member weights . There are no defined values for this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: o Flags Field : This field has several flag values that describe several attributes of the member .
:LABEL: field

name: Weight
description: o Weight : This field represents the GWM's recommendation for the relative amount of work that should be sent to this member . This is a 16-bit field with a possible range of 0 to 65536 . Load balancers should be prepared to receive a wide range of weight values . Load balancers with limited maximum weight values may restrict the granularity of management by the GWM and in turn cause less than optimal performance . Many existing implementations have supported a minimum raw weight range from 0 to 100 .
:LABEL: field

name: State Field
description: o State Field : This field is used by the member to communicate state information to the load balancer or scheduler . There are no defined values for this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: o Flags Field : This field describes attributes of the member . Currently the only flag value defined is that of the quiesce flag . The quiesce flag is used when an administrator would like to temporarily remove a member from the weight calculation   but not deregister it from the group . When quiesced   the member will still show up in the weights   but the quiesce flag will be set
:LABEL: field

name: Member Count
description: o Member Count : The number of Member Data Components immediately following the Group Data structure .
:LABEL: field

name: Weight Entry Count
description: o Weight Entry Count : The number of Member Data / Weight Entry combinations to follow the Group Data TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Member State Instance Count
description: o Member State Instance Count : The number of Member Data / Member State Instance combinations following the Group Data component .
:LABEL: field

name: Flag Field
description: A . Load Balancer Flag
:LABEL: field

name: Group of Member Data Count
description: o Group of Member Data Count : The number of " Group of Member Data " components immediately following the Registration Request component .
:LABEL: field

name: Flag Field
description: A . Load Balancer Flag
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason : Byte describing the reason for deregistering the group or instance .
:LABEL: field

name: Group of Member Data Count
description: o Group of Member Data Count : The number of " Group of Member Data " components immediately following the DeRegistration Request component .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: o Return Code : A byte return code indicating the status of action taken .
:LABEL: field

name: Group Data Count
description: o Group Data Count : The number of " Group Data " components immediately following the Get Weights Request TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: o Return Code : A byte return code indicating the status of action taken .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: o Interval : These two bytes indicate a recommended polling interval for the load balancer to use . The Group Workload Manager is stating that any polling interval smaller than the suggested interval would probably retrieve values before they have had a chance to change .
:LABEL: field

name: Flag Field
description: A . Load Balancer Flag
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: o Return Code : A byte return code indicating the status of action taken .
:LABEL: field

name: LB UID Length
description: o LB UID Length : one-byte length field describing the size of the following LB UID .
:LABEL: field

name: LB Health
description: o LB Health : This field gives the load balancer a chance to pass in a metric describing its own health or state .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: o Return Code : A byte return code indicating the status of action taken .
:LABEL: field

name: LB Health
description: LB Health : 0x00 Flags : 0000 0010
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 26 for Vendor-Specific
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field MUST be set equal to the sum of the Vendor-Length fields of the sub-attributes contained in the Vendor-Specific Attribute   plus six ( Type + Length + Vendor-Id ).
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: This field MUST be set to decimal 3561   the enterprise number assigned to the ADSL Forum [ IANA ].
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: The Vendor-Type field is one octet in length and contains the sub-attribute type   as assigned by the DSL Forum .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Length
description: The Vendor-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of the entire sub-attribute   including the Vendor-Type   Vendor-Length   and Value fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is zero or more octets and contains information specific to the sub-attribute . The format and length of the Value field is determined by the Vendor-Type and Vendor-Length fields . The format of the value field is one of 2 data types   string or integer [ RFC2865 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 1 for Agent-Circuit-Id
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 2 for Agent-Remote-Id
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 129 ( 0x81 ) for Actual-Data-Rate-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's actual data rate upstream of a synchronized DSL link . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 130 ( 0x82 ) for Actual-Data-Rate-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's actual data rate downstream of a synchronized DSL link . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 131 ( 0x83 ) for Minimum-Data-Rate-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's minimum upstream data rate ( as configured by the operator ). The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 132 ( 0x84 ) for Minimum-Data-Rate-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's minimum downstream data rate ( as configured by the operator ). The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 133 ( 0x85 ) for Attainable-Data-Rate-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's actual DSL attainable upstream data rate . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 134 ( 0x86 ) for Attainable-Data-Rate-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field contains a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the subscriber's actual DSL attainable downstream data rate . The rate is coded in bits per second .
