name: Vendor-Type
description: 135 ( 0x87 ) for Maximum-Data-Rate-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value of the subscriber's DSL maximum upstream data rate . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 136 ( 0x88 ) for Maximum-Data-Rate-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value of the subscriber's DSL maximum downstream data rate . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 137 ( 0x89 ) for Minimum-Data-Rate-Upstream-Low-Power
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value of the subscriber's DSL minimum upstream data rate when in low power state ( L1/L2 ). The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 138 ( 0x8A ) for Minimum-Data-Rate-Downstream-Low-Power
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value of the subscriber's DSL minimum downstream data rate . The rate is coded in bits per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 139 ( 0x8B ) for Maximum-Interleaving-Delay-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value in milliseconds of the subscriber's DSL maximum one-way upstream interleaving delay .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 140 ( 0x8C ) for Actual-Interleaving-Delay-Upstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value in milliseconds of the subscriber's DSL actual upstream interleaving delay .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 141 ( 0x8D ) for Maximum-Interleaving-Delay-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value in milliseconds of the subscriber's DSL maximum one-way downstream interleaving delay .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 142 ( 0x8E ) for Actual-Interleaving-Delay-Downstream
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a 4-byte unsigned integer   indicating the numeric value in milliseconds of the subscriber's DSL actual downstream interleaving delay .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 144 ( 0x90 ) for Access-Loop-Encapsulation
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: This field is a string 3 bytes in length   logically divided into three 1-byte sub-fields as shown in the following diagram :
:LABEL: field

name: Data Link
description: 0x01 AAL5 0x02 Ethernet
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: 254 ( 0xFE ) for IWF-Session
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2006 ).
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: o N-active commands . N-active commands are MIDI commands that do not appear before one of the following commands in the session history : MIDI Control Change numbers 123-127 ( numbers with All Notes Off semantics ) or 120 ( All Sound Off )  and any Reset State command .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: o C-active commands . C-active commands are MIDI commands that do not appear before one of the following commands in the session history : MIDI Control Change number 121 ( Reset All Controllers ) and any Reset State command .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: By default   the U   W   and Z bits MUST be set to 0 . If all parameter logs in the list code RPN parameters   the U bit MAY be set to 1 . If all parameter logs in the list code NRPN parameters   the W bit MAY be set to 1 . If the parameter numbers of all RPN and NRPN logs in the list lie in the range 0-127 ( and thus have an MSB value of 0 )  the Z bit MAY be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: TCOUNT
description: If the T header bit is set to 1   the 8-bit TCOUNT field appears in the command log . If the C header bit is set to 1   the 8-bit COUNT field appears in the command log . TCOUNT and COUNT are interpreted as unsigned integers .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o A : Poly Aftertouch ( 0xA ) o B : System Reset ( 0xFF ) o C : Control Change ( 0xB ) o F : System Time Code ( 0xF1 ) o G : System Tune Request ( 0xF6 ) o H : System Song Select ( 0xF3 ) o J : System Common Undefined ( 0xF4 ) o K : System Common Undefined ( 0xF5 ) o N : NoteOff ( 0x8 )  NoteOn ( 0x9 ) o P : Program Change ( 0xC ) o Q : System Sequencer ( 0xF2   0xF8   0xF9   0xFA   0xFB   0xFC ) o T : Channel Aftertouch ( 0xD ) o V : System Active Sense ( 0xFE ) o W : Pitch Wheel ( 0xE )
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: o X : SysEx ( 0xF0 ) o Y : System Real-Time Undefined ( 0xF9 ) o Z : System Real-Time Undefined ( 0xFD )
:LABEL: field

name: FREQIDX
description: 0x0 96000 0x1 88200 0x2 64000 0x3 48000 0x4 44100 0x5 32000 0x6 24000 0x7 22050 0x8 16000 0x9 12000 0xa 11025 0xb 8000 0xc reserved 0xd reserved 0xe reserved 0xf escape value
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: basic ( B ): 1 bit - While set to 1   the basic flag indicates that the PDU has BASIC part of the RAQMON PDU . A value of zero is considered valid and indicates a RAQMON NULL PDU .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: trailer ( T ): 3 bits - Total number of Application-Specific Extensions that follow the BASIC part of RAQMON PDU . A value of zero is considered valid as many times as there is no application - specific information to add to the basic information .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: padding ( P ): 1 bit - If the padding bit is set   the BASIC part of the RAQMON PDU contains some additional padding octets at the end of the BASIC part of the PDU that are not part of the monitoring information . Padding may be needed in some cases   as reporting is based on the intent of a RDS to report certain parameters . Also   some parameters may be reported only once at the beginning of the reporting session   e.g .  Data Source Name   Receiver Name   payload type   etc . Actual padding at the end of the BASIC part of the PDU is 0   8   16   or 24 bits to make the length of the BASIC part of the PDU a multiple of 32 bits
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Source IP version Flag ( S ): 1 bit - While set to 1   the source IP version flag indicates that the Source IP address contained in the PDU is an IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Receiver IP version Flag ( R ): 1 bit - While set to 1   the receiver IP version flag indicates that the receiver IP address contained in the PDU is an IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: RC
description: record count ( RC ): 4 bits - Total number of application records contained in the BASIC part of the PDU . A value of zero is considered valid but useless   with the exception of the case of a NULL PDU indicating the end of a RDS reporting session .
:LABEL: field

name: DSRC
description: DSRC : 32 bits - Data Source identifier represents a unique RAQMON reporting session descriptor that points to a specific reporting session between RDS and RRC . Uniqueness of DSRC is valid only within a reporting session . DSRC values should be randomly generated using vendor-chosen algorithms for each communication session . It is not sufficient to obtain a DSRC simply by calling random () without carefully initializing the state . One could use an algorithm like the one defined in Appendix A.6 in [ RFC3550 ] to create a DSRC . Depending on the choice of algorithm   there is a finite probability that two DSRCs from two different RDSs may be the same . To further reduce the probability that two RDSs pick the same DSRC for two different reporting sessions   it is recommended that an RRC use parameters like Data Source Address ( DA )  Data Source Name ( DN )  and layer 2 Media Access Control ( MAC ) Address in the PDU in conjunction with a DSRC value . It is not mandatory for RDSs to send parameters like Data Source Address ( DA )  Data Source Name ( DN )  and MAC Address in every PDU sent to RRC   but occasionally sending these parameters will reduce the probability of DSRC collision drastically . However   this will cause an additional overhead per PDU .
:LABEL: field

name: RC_N
description: RC_N : 8 bits - The Record Count number indicates a sub-session within a communication session . A value of zero is a valid record number . The maximum number of records that can be described in one RAQMON Packet is 256 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Duration
description: Session Duration : 32 bits - The Session ( sub-session ) Duration metric is defined in section 5.9 of [ RFC4710 ]. Session Duration is an unsigned integer expressed in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Source Device Port Used
description: Data Source Device Port Used : 16 bits - This parameter is defined in section 5.5 of [ RFC4710 ] and describes the port number used by the Data Source as used by the application in RC_N session while this RAQMON PDU was generated .
:LABEL: field

name: Receiver Device Port Used
description: Receiver Device Port Used : 16 bits - This parameter is defined in section 5.6 of [ RFC4710 ] and describes the receiver port used by the application to communicate to the receiver . It follows same syntax as Source Device Port Used .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Payload Type
description: Source Payload Type : 8 bits - This parameter is defined in section 5.24 of [ RFC4710 ] and specifies the payload type of the data source of the communication sub-session RC_N as defined in [ RFC3551 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Receiver Payload Type
description: Receiver Payload Type : 8 bits - This parameter is defined in section 5.25 of [ RFC4710 ] and specifies the receiver payload type of the communication sub-session RC_N as defined in [ RFC3551 ].
:LABEL: field

name: CPU Utilization
description: CPU Utilization : 8 bits - This parameter   defined in section 5.30 of [ RFC4710 ]  represents the percentage of CPU used during session RC_N from the last report until the time this RAQMON PDU was generated . The CPU Utilization is expressed in percents in the range 0 to 100 . The value should indicate not only CPU utilization associated to a session RC_N but also actual CPU Utilization   to indicate a snapshot of the CPU utilization of the host running the RDS while session RC_N in progress .
:LABEL: field

name: Memory Utilization
description: Memory Utilization : 8 bits - This parameter   defined in section 5.31 of [ RFC4710 ]  represents the percentage of total memory used during session RC_N up until the time this RAQMON PDU was generated . The memory utilization is expressed in percents 0 to 100 . The Memory Utilization value should indicate not only the memory utilization associated to a session RC_N but the total memory utilization   to indicate a snapshot of end-device memory utilization while session RC_N is in progress .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Setup Delay
description: Session Setup Delay : 16 bits - The Session ( sub-session ) Setup Delay metric is defined in section 5.8 of [ RFC4710 ] and expressed in milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Application Delay
description: Application Delay : 16 bits - The Application Delay is defined in section 5.13 of [ RFC4710 ] and is represented as an unsigned integer expressed in milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: IP Packet Delay Variation
description: IP Packet Delay Variation : 16 bits - The IP Packet Delay Variation is defined in section 5.15 of [ RFC4710 ] and is represented as an unsigned integer expressed in milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2006 ).
:LABEL: field

name: VPI
description: The ingress router MUST copy the VPI field from the incoming cell into this field . For particular emulated VCs   the egress router MAY generate a new VPI and ignore the VPI contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: VCI
description: The ingress router MUST copy the VCI field from the incoming ATM cell header into this field . For particular emulated VCs   the egress router MAY generate a new VCI .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The sequence number is not required for all services .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Bit ( M ) of the control byte indicates whether the packet contains an ATM cell or a frame payload . If set to 0   the packet contains an ATM cell . If set to 1   the PDU contains an AAL5 payload .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Bit ( V ) of the control byte indicates whether the VCI field is present in the packet . If set to 1   the VCI field is present for the cell . If set to 0   no VCI field is present . In the case of a VCC   the VCI field is not required . For VPC   the VCI field is required and is transmitted with each cell .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The Cell Loss Priority ( CLP ) field indicates CLP value of the encapsulated cell .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: These bits are reserved and MUST be set to 0 upon transmission and ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Bit ( T ) of the control word indicates whether the packet contains an ATM admin cell or an AAL5 payload . If T = 1   the packet contains an ATM admin cell   encapsulated according to the N-to - one cell relay encapsulation   Figure 4 . If not set   the PDU contains an AAL5 payload . The ability to transport an ATM cell in the AAL5 SDU mode is intended to provide a means of enabling administrative functionality over the AAL5 VCC ( though it does not endeavor to preserve user-cell and admin-cell arrival/transport ordering ).
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The ingress router   PE1   SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the EFCI bit of the final cell of those that transported the AAL5 CPCS-SDU is set to 1   or if the EFCI bit of the single ATM cell to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise   this bit
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The ingress router   PE1   SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the CLP bit of any of the ATM cells that transported the AAL5 CPCS-SDU is set to 1   or if the CLP bit of the single ATM cell to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise this bit SHOULD be set to 0 . The egress router   PE2   SHOULD set the CLP bit of all cells that transport the AAL5 CPCS-SDU to the value contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: When FRF.8.1 Frame Relay/ATM PVC Service Interworking [ RFC3916 ] traffic is being transported   the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 CPCS-PDU may contain the Frame Relay C/R bit . The ingress router   PE1   SHOULD copy this bit to the U bit of the control word . The egress router   PE2   SHOULD copy the U bit to the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 CPCS PDU .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: This field is used to convey the EFCI state of the ATM cells . The EFCI state is indicated in the middle bit of each ATM cell's PTI field .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This field is used to convey the cell loss priority of the ATM cells .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: where the Type   Length   Subtype   and SPI are as shown in Section 5 . The Preceding Mobile IP data refers to the UDP payload ( the Registration Request or Registration Reply data ) and all prior extensions in their entirety . The resulting function call   as described in [ RFC2104 ]  would be :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: where the Type   Length   Subtype   and SPI are as shown in Section 5 . The Preceding Mobile IP data refers to the UDP payload ( the Registration Request or Registration Reply data ) and all prior extensions in their entirety . The resulting function call   as described in [ RFC2104 ]  would be :
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: where the Type   Length   Subtype   and SPI are as shown in Section 5 . The Preceding Mobile IP data refers to the UDP payload ( the Registration Request or Registration Reply data ) and all prior extensions in their entirety . The resulting function call   as described in [ RFC2104 ]  would be :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type   Subtype ( if present )  Length   SPI ) ||
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Type   Subtype ( if present )  Length   SPI ) ||
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Type   Subtype ( if present )  Length   SPI ) ||
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: Type   Subtype ( if present )  Length   SPI ) ||
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the DSR Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC1700 ]. If no header follows   then Next Header MUST have the value 59   " No Next Header " [ RFC2460 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: Flag bit . MUST be set to 0 . This bit is set in a DSR Flow State header ( Section 7.1 ) and clear in a DSR Options header .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be sent as 0 and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: The length of the DSR Options header   excluding the 4-octet fixed portion . The value of the Payload Length field defines the total length of all options carried in the DSR Options header .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 1 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields . MUST be set equal to ( 4 * n ) + 6   where n is the number of addresses in the Route Request Option .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A unique value generated by the initiator ( original sender ) of the Route Request . Nodes initiating a Route Request generate a new Identification value for each Route Request   for example based on a sequence number counter of all Route Requests initiated by the node .
:LABEL: field

name: Target Address
description: The address of the node that is the target of the Route Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 2 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields . MUST be set equal to ( 4 * n ) + 1   where n is the number of addresses in the Route Reply Option .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: Set to indicate that the last hop given by the Route Reply ( the link from Address[n-1 ] to Address[n ]) is actually an arbitrary path in a network external to the DSR network; the exact route outside the DSR network is not represented in the Route Reply . Nodes caching this hop in their Route Cache MUST flag the cached hop with the External flag . Such hops MUST NOT be returned in a cached Route Reply generated from this Route Cache entry   and selection of routes from the Route Cache to route a packet being sent SHOULD prefer routes that contain no hops flagged as External .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be sent as 0 and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 3 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Type
description: The type of error encountered . Currently   the following type values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reservd
description: Reserved . MUST be sent as 0 and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Salvage
description: A 4-bit unsigned integer . Copied from the Salvage field in the DSR Source Route option of the packet triggering the Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Source Address
description: The address of the node originating the Route Error ( e.g .  the node that attempted to forward a packet and discovered the link failure ).
:LABEL: field

name: Error Destination Address
description: The address of the node to which the Route Error must be delivered . For example   when the Error Type field is set to NODE_UNREACHABLE   this field will be set to the address of the node that generated the routing information claiming that the hop from the Error Source Address to Unreachable Node Address ( specified in the Type-Specific Information ) was a valid hop .
:LABEL: field

name: Unreachable Node Address
description: The IP address of the node that was found to be unreachable ( the next-hop neighbor to which the node with address Error Source Address was attempting to transmit the packet ).
:LABEL: field

name: Unsupported Opt
description: The Option Type of option triggering the Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 160 . Nodes not understanding this option will remove the option and return a Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: The Identification field is set to a unique value and is copied into the Identification field of the Acknowledgement option when returned by the node receiving the packet over this hop .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 32 . Nodes not understanding this option will remove the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Copied from the Identification field of the Acknowledgement Request option of the packet being acknowledged .
:LABEL: field

name: ACK Source Address
description: The address of the node originating the acknowledgement .
:LABEL: field

name: ACK Destination Address
description: The address of the node to which the acknowledgement is to be delivered .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 96 . Nodes not understanding this option will drop the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields . For the format of the DSR Source Route option defined here   this field MUST be set to the value ( n * 4 ) + 2   where n is the number of addresses present in the Address[i ] fields .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: Set to indicate that the first hop indicated by the DSR Source Route option is actually an arbitrary path in a network external to the DSR network; the exact route outside the DSR
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: Set to indicate that the last hop indicated by the DSR Source Route option is actually an arbitrary path in a network external to the DSR network; the exact route outside the DSR network is not represented in the DSR Source Route option . Nodes caching this hop in their Route Cache MUST flag the cached hop with the External flag . Such hops MUST NOT be returned in a Route Reply generated from this Route Cache entry   and selection of routes from the Route Cache to route a packet being sent SHOULD prefer routes that contain no hops flagged as External .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be sent as 0 and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Salvage
description: A 4-bit unsigned integer . Count of number of times that this packet has been salvaged as a part of DSR routing ( Section 3.4.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Segs Left
description: Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 224 . Nodes not understanding this option will drop the packet and return a Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 0 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields . The size of the Option Data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: A number of zero-valued octets equal to the Opt Data Len .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the DSR Flow State header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ RFC1700 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: Flag bit . MUST be set to 1 . This bit is set in a DSR Flow State header and clear in a DSR Options header ( Section 6.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Count
description: 7-bit unsigned integer . The number of hops through which this packet has been forwarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 128 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore the option and return a Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Timeout
description: The number of seconds for which this flow remains valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 129 . Nodes not understanding this option will ignore the option and return a Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: New Flow Identifier
description: Indicates the next identifier to store in the Flow ID field of the DSR Options header .
:LABEL: field

name: New IP Destination Address
description: Indicates the next address to store in the Destination Address field of the IP header .
:LABEL: field

name: Original IP Destination Address
description: The IP Destination Address of the packet that caused the error .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow ID
description: The Flow ID contained in the DSR Flow ID option that caused the error .
:LABEL: field

name: Original IP Destination Address
description: The IP Destination Address of the packet that caused the error .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 160 . Nodes not understanding this option will remove the option and return a Route Error .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Identifier
description: The Packet Identifier field is set to a unique number and is copied into the Identification field of the DSR Acknowledgement option when returned by the node receiving the packet over this hop .
:LABEL: field

name: ACK Request Source Address
description: The address of the node requesting the DSR Acknowledgement .
:LABEL: field

description: where initiator is the value of the Source Address field in the IP header of the packet carrying the Route Request ( the address of the initiator of the Route Discovery )  and each Address[i ] is a node through which this Route Request has passed   in turn   during
:LABEL: field

description: where initiator is the value of the Destination Address field in the IP header of the packet carrying the Route Reply ( the address of the initiator of the Route Discovery )  and each Address[i ] is a node through which the source route passes   in turn   on the route to the target of the Route Discovery . Address[n ] is the address of the target . If the Last Hop External ( L ) bit is set in the Route Reply   the node MUST flag the last hop from the Route Reply ( the link from Address[n-1 ] to Address[n ]) in its Route Cache as External . The value n here is the number of addresses in the source route being returned in the Route Reply option   or ( Opt Data Len - 1 ) / 4 .
:LABEL: field

description: Otherwise ( i.e .  if Salvage is nonzero )  the routing information from the DSR Source Route is the sequence of hop addresses
:LABEL: field

description: where source is the value of the Source Address field in the IP header of the packet carrying the DSR Source Route option ( the original sender of the packet )  each Address[i ] is the value in the Address[i ] field in the DSR Source Route option   and destination is the value of the Destination Address field in the packet's IP header ( the last-hop address of the source route ). The value n here is the number of addresses in source route in the DSR Source Route option   or ( Opt Data Len - 2 ) / 4 .
:LABEL: field

description: where initiator is the address of the initiator of this Route Request   each Address[i ] is an address from the Route Request   and target is the target of the Route Request ( the Target Address field in the Route Request ). The value n here is the number of addresses recorded in the Route Request   or ( Opt Data Len - 6 ) / 4 .
:LABEL: field

description: where initiator is the address of the initiator of this Route Request   each Address[i ] is an address from the Route Request   and c-route is the sequence of hop addresses in the source route to this target node   obtained from the node's Route Cache . In appending this cached route to the source route for the reply   the address of this node itself MUST be excluded   since it is already listed as Address[n ].
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: If set to a value of one   the " end " bit indicates that this packet contains the end of the event . For long-lasting events that have to be split into segments ( see below   Section 2.5.1.3 )  only the final packet for the final segment will have the E bit set .
:LABEL: field

name: modulation
description: modulation : The modulation frequency   in Hz . The field is a 9-bit unsigned integer   allowing modulation frequencies up to 511 Hz . If there is no modulation   this field has a value of zero . Note that the amplitude of modulation is not indicated in the payload and must be determined by out-of-band means .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : If the T bit is set ( one )  the modulation frequency is to be divided by three . Otherwise   the modulation frequency is taken as is .
:LABEL: field

name: volume
description: volume : The power level of the tone   expressed in dBm0 after dropping the sign   with range from 0 to - 63 dBm0 . ( Note : A preferred level range for digital tone generators is - 8 dBm0 to - 3 dBm0 .)
:LABEL: field

name: duration
description: duration : The duration of the tone   measured in timestamp units and presented in network byte order . The tone begins at the instant identified by the RTP timestamp and lasts for the duration value . The value of zero is not permitted   and tones with such a duration SHOULD be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: frequency
description: frequency : The frequencies of the tones to be added   measured in Hz and represented as a 12-bit unsigned integer . The field size is sufficient to represent frequencies up to 4095 Hz   which exceeds the range of telephone systems . A value of zero indicates silence . A single tone can contain any number of frequencies . If no frequencies are specified   the packet reports a period of silence .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : This field is reserved for future use . The sender MUST set it to zero   and the receiver MUST ignore it .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The flags field is broken up into 8 bits each representing a binary flag . The field is defined as the Logical OR of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: MAC ID
description: The MAC field specifies the cryptographic hash used to generate the keyed hash value . The following are currently supported :
:LABEL: field

name: DH Group ID
description: The Diffie-Hellman group field specifies the group used in the Diffie-Hellman computations . The following are currently supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Public Key ID
description: The Public Key ID field specifies the cipher used to encrypt the client's EAP-Response in PAX_SEC-2 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBS
description: MBS ( 4 bits ): maximum bit rate supported . Indicates a maximum bit rate to the encoder at the site of the receiver of this payload . The value of the MBS field is set according to the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits ): Frame type of the frame(s ) in this packet   as per the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C A Control word [ 7 ] MUST or MUST NOT be present when sending VPLS packets to this PE   depending on whether C is 1 or 0   respectively
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Sequenced delivery of frames MUST or MUST NOT be used when sending VPLS packets to this PE   depending on whether S is 1 or 0   respectively
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Control bit ( C ): This bit is used to signal the use of the control word as specified in [ RFC4447 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Attachment Group Identifier ( AGI )  Length   Value : The unique name of this VPLS . The AGI identifies a type of name   and Length denotes the length of Value   which is the name of the VPLS . We use the term AGI interchangeably with VPLS identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Type field . This field MUST be set to 0x0404 . This identifies the TLV type as MAC List TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length field . This field specifies the total length in octets of the MAC addresses in the TLV . The length MUST be a multiple of 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: KDF(Key   Label   Msg   Length ) R := [] ;; null string for i := 0 to FLOOR(Length/20)-1 do R := R | H-SHA1(Key   Label   Msg   i ) return R[0...(Length-1 )]
:LABEL: field

name: AT_ENCR_DATA
description: The AT_IV and AT_ENCR_DATA attributes can be used to transmit encrypted information between the Server and the Peer . The value field of AT_IV contains an initialization vector ( IV ) if one is required by the encryption algorithm used . It is not mandatory that the AT_IV attribute be included whenever the AT_ENCR_DATA attribute is .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the number of octets in an EAP message including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   and Data fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: To be assigned .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The EAP-SAKE method as described herein is version 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: The Session ID is a 1-byte random number that MUST be freshly generated by the Server that must match all EAP messages in a particular EAP conversation .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: EAP-SAKE subtype : SAKE/Challenge   SAKE/Confirm   SAKE/Auth-Reject   and SAKE/Identity . All messages of type " EAP-SAKE " that are not of these subtypes MUST silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1-byte unsigned integer; see Table below .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The total number of octets in the attribute   including Type and Length .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Request
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: A random number . See [ EAP ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the entire EAP packet in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: EAP-SAKE
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A random number chosen by the server to identify this EAP-Session .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 1 for SAKE/Challenge
:LABEL: field

name: AT_RAND_S
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Server nonce RAND_S parameter . The RAND_S attribute MUST be present in EAP.Request/SAKE/Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_SERVERID
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Server identifier ( e.g .  a non-null terminated string ). The AT_SERVERID attribute SHOULD be present in EAP.Request/SAKE Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Response
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: A number that MUST match the Identifier field from the corresponding Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the entire EAP packet in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: EAP-SAKE
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A number matching all other EAP messages in this EAP session .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 1 for SAKE/Challenge
:LABEL: field

name: AT_RAND_P
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Peer nonce RAND_P parameter . The AT_RAND_P attribute MUST be present in the EAP.Response/SAKE/Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_PEERID
description: The value field of this attribute contains the NAI of the Peer . The Peer identity follows the same Network Access Identifier format that is used in EAP.Response/Identity   i.e .  including the NAI realm portion . The identity is the permanent identity   or a temporary identity . The identity does not include any terminating null characters . The AT_PEERID attribute is optional in the EAP.Response/SAKE/Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_SPI_P
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Peer's ciphersuite list SPI_P parameter . The AT_SPI_P attribute is optional in the EAP.Response/SAKE/Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_MIC_P
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Peer MIC_P parameter . The AT_MIC_P attribute MUST be present in the EAP.Response/SAKE/Challenge .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 for Request
:LABEL: field

description: A random number . See [ EAP ].

:LABEL: field

description: EAP-SAKE
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A number matching all other EAP messages in this EAP session .

name: Subtype
description: 2 for SAKE Confirm
:LABEL: field

name: AT_SPI_S
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Server chosen ciphersuite SPI_S parameter . The AT_SPI_S attribute is optional in the EAP.Request/SAKE/Confirm .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_IV
description: This attribute is optional to use in this message . The value field of this attribute contains the Initialization Vector that is used with the encrypted data following .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_ENCR_DATA
description: This attribute is optional to use in this message . The encrypted data   if present   may contain an attribute AT_NEXT_TMPID   containing the NAI the Peer should use in the next EAP authentication .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_MSK_LIFE
description: This attribute is optional to use in this message . The value field of this attribute contains the MSK Lifetime in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_MIC_S
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Server MIC_S parameter . The AT_MIC_S attribute MUST be present in the EAP.Request/SAKE/Confirm .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Response

name: Identifier
description: A number that MUST match the Identifier field from the corresponding Request .

name: Length
description: The length of the entire EAP packet in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: EAP-SAKE
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A number matching all other EAP messages in this EAP session .

name: Subtype
description: 2 for SAKE Confirm
:LABEL: field

name: AT_MIC_P
description: The value field of this attribute contains the Peer's MIC_P parameter . The AT_MIC_P attribute MUST be present in the EAP.Response/SAKE/Confirm .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_PADDING
description: The value field is set to zero . Added to achieve 32-bit alignment of the EAP-SAKE packet .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: AT_PERM_ID_REQ
description: The AT_PERM_ID_REQ attribute is optional   to be included in cases where the Server requires the Peer to give its permanent identifier ( i.e .  PermID ). The AT_PERM_ID_REQ MUST NOT be included if the AT_ANY_ID_REQ attribute is included . The value field only contains two reserved bytes   which are set to zero on sending and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_ANY_ID_REQ
description: The AT_ANY_ID_REQ attribute is optional   to be included in cases where the Server requires the Peer to send any identifier ( e.g .  PermID   TempID ). The AT_ANY_ID_REQ MUST NOT be included if AT_PERM_ID_REQ is included . The value field only contains two reserved bytes   which are set to zero on sending and ignored on reception . One of the AT_PERM_ID_REQ and AT_ANY_ID_REQ MUST be included .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_SERVERID
description: The value field of this attribute contains the identifier/realm of the Server . The AT_SERVERID attribute is optional but RECOMMENDED to include in the EAP.Request/SAKE/Identity .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 2 for Response
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: A number that MUST match the Identifier field from the corresponding Request .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the entire EAP packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: EAP-SAKE
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A number matching all other EAP messages in this EAP session .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 4 for SAKE/Identity
:LABEL: field

name: AT_PEERID
description: The value field of this attribute contains the NAI of the Peer . The AT_PEERID attribute MUST be present in EAP.Response/SAKE/Identity .
:LABEL: field

name: RAND_S
description: * Send a 16-byte random challenge ( RAND_S ). RAND_S was called RA in Section 3.2
:LABEL: field

name: ID_S
description: * State its identity ( ID_S ). ID_S was denoted by A in Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: RAND_P
description: * Send another 16-byte random challenge ( RAND_P ). RAND_P was called RB in Section 3.2
:LABEL: field

name: ID_P
description: * State its identity ( ID_P ). ID_P was denoted by B in Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : The length of this option is variable . The minimum length is 3 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: what
description: what : The ' what ' element describes to which location the DHCP entry refers . Currently   three options are defined : the location of the DHCP server ( a value of 0 )  the location of the network element believed to be closest to the client ( a value of 1 )  or the location of the client ( a value of 2 ). Option ( 2 ) SHOULD be used   but may not be known . Options ( 0 ) and ( 1 ) SHOULD NOT be used unless it is known that the DHCP client is in close physical proximity to the server or network element .
:LABEL: field

name: country code
description: country code : The two-letter ISO 3166 country code in capital ASCII letters   e.g .  DE or US . ( Civic addresses always contain country designations   suggesting the use of a fixed-format field to save space .)
:LABEL: field

name: what
description: what : See above ( Section 3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: country code
description: country code : See above ( Section 3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: CAtype
description: CAlength : The length   in octets   of the CAvalue   not including the CAlength field itself .
:LABEL: field

name: CAlength
description: CAlength : The length   in octets   of the CAvalue   not including the CAlength field itself .
:LABEL: field

name: CAtype
description: Brief description : Short description identifying the meaning of the element .
:LABEL: field

description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Count
description: The number of times this alarm has been repeated as determined by the reporting node . This field MUST NOT be set to zero   and TLVs received with this field set to zero MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on generation   MUST be ignored on receipt   and MUST be forwarded unchanged and unexamined by transit nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: Impact
description: Indicates the impact of the alarm indicated in the TLV . See [ M.20 ] for a general discussion on classification of failures . The following values are defined in this document . The details of the semantics may be found in [ M.20 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Severity
description: Indicates the impact of the alarm indicated in the TLV . See [ RFC3877 ] and [ M.3100 ] for more information on severity . The following values are defined in this document . The details of the semantics may be found in [ RFC3877 ] and [ M.3100 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: Global Timestamp
description: Global Timestamp : 32 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Local Timestamp
description: Number of seconds reported by the local system clock at the time the associated alarm was detected on the node that originates this TLV . This number is expected to be meaningful in the context of the originating node . For example   it may indicate the number of seconds since the node rebooted or may be a local representation of an unsynchronized real-time clock .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Inhibit Alarm Communication ( I ): 1 bit When set   indicates that alarm communication is disabled for the LSP and that nodes SHOULD NOT add local alarm information .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

description: For the default algorithms   K_MAC   K_ENC   and SRK SHALL be 16 octets . For other cases   the key lengths will be as determined by the negotiated algorithms . The MSK and the EMSK SHALL each be 64 octets   in conformance with [ 1 ]. Therefore   in the case of default algorithms   the " dkLen " parameter from Section 5.2 of [ 6 ] SHALL be set to 176 ( the combined length of K_MAC   K_ENC   SRK   MSK   and EMSK ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 1 - Request
:LABEL: field

description: Identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is 1 octet and aids in matching responses with requests . For a more detailed description of this field and how to use it   see [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is 2 octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   Version   Flags   and TLV-based EAP-POTP message fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Identifies use of a particular OTP algorithm with EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This octet is reserved for future use . It SHALL be set to zero for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this octet for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

description: The TLVs within EAP POTP-X are used to carry parameters between the EAP peer and the EAP server . An EAP peer may not necessarily implement all the TLVs supported by an EAP server   and to allow for interoperability   a special TLV allows an EAP server to discover if a TLV is supported by the EAP peer .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of the EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: The following TLV types are defined for use with EAP-POTP :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 3 in EAP-Requests   2 in EAP-Responses
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . This octet MUST be set to zero for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this octet for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Highest
description: This field contains an unsigned integer representing the highest protocol version supported by the sender . If a value provided by a peer to an EAP server falls between the server's " Highest " and " Lowest " supported version ( inclusive )  then that value will be the negotiated version for the authentication session .
:LABEL: field

name: Lowest
description: This field contains an unsigned integer representing the lowest version acceptable by the EAP server . The field MUST be present in an EAP-Request . The field MUST NOT be present in an EAP - Response . A peer SHALL respond to an EAP-Request of type POTP-X with an EAP-Response of type Nak ( 3 ) if the peer's highest supported version is lower than the value of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 25 + length of Server Identifier field
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . All 7 bits MUST be set to zero for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: The N bit signals that the peer MUST NOT attempt to resume any session it has stored associated with this server .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Identifier
description: An 8-octet identifier for the session about to be negotiated . Note that   in the case of session resumption   this session identifier will not be used ( the session identifier for the resumed session will continue to be used ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 7 + length of Authentication Data field
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . All 9 bits SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore these bits for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: The A bit MUST be set in an EAP-Request if and only if the request immediately follows an EAP-Response of type POTP-X containing a New PIN TLV ( see Section 4.11.5 )  and the new PIN in the response was accepted by the EAP server . In this case   the A bit signals that the EAP-server has accepted the PIN   and that the peer SHALL use the newly established PIN when calculating the response ( when applicable ). The A bit MUST NOT be set if the S bit is set . If a request has both the S bit and the A bit set   the peer SHALL regard the request as invalid   and return an empty POTP-X EAP - Response message .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: In an EAP-Request   the P bit indicates that the OTP in the response MUST be protected . Use of this bit also indicates that mutual authentication will take place   as well as generation of keying material . It is RECOMMENDED to always set the P bit . If a peer receives an EAP-Request with an OTP TLV that does not have the P bit set   and the peer's policy dictates protected mode   the peer MUST respond with an empty POTP-X EAP-Response message . All peers MUST support protected mode .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The C bit carries meaning only when the OTP algorithm in question makes use of server challenges . For other OTP algorithms   the C bit SHALL always be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: In an EAP-Request   the N bit   when set   indicates that the OTP to calculate SHALL be based on the next token " state "  and not the current one . As an example   for a time-based token   this means the next time slot . For an event-based token   this could mean the next counter value   if counter values are used . This bit will normally not be set in initial EAP-Request messages   but may be set in subsequent ones . Further   the N bit carries no meaning in an EAP-Request if a challenge is present and the C bit is not set   and SHALL be set to 0   in this case . If a request that has the N bit set also contains a challenge   but does not have the C bit set   the peer SHALL regard the request as invalid   and return an empty POTP-X EAP-Response message . Note that setting the N bit in an EAP-Request will normally advance the internal state of the token .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: The T bit only carries meaning for OTP methods normally incorporating a user PIN in the OTP computation .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: In an EAP-Request   the E bit   when set   indicates that the peer MUST NOT use any stored pepper value associated with this server in the PBKDF2 computation . Rather   it MUST generate a new pepper ( if supported by the peer ) and/or use the iteration count parameter to protect the OTP ( if the server's Max Pepper Length is 0   then the peer MUST rely on the iteration count only to protect the OTP ). This bit will usually not be set in initial EAP-Request messages   but may be set in subsequent ones   e.g .  if the server   upon receipt of an OTP TLV with a pepper identifier   detects that it does not have a pepper with that identifier in storage . This bit carries no meaning   and MUST be set to zero   when the P bit is not set . If a request has the E bit set but not the P bit   a peer SHALL regard the request as invalid   and return an empty POTP-X EAP-Response message .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: In an EAP-Request   the S bit (" Same ")  when set   indicates that the peer SHOULD calculate its response based on the same OTP value as was used for the preceding response . This bit MAY be set when the EAP server has received an OTP TLV from the peer protected with a pepper   of which the server is no longer in possession . Since the server has not attempted validation of the provided data   there is no need for the EAP peer to retrieve a new OTP value . This bit carries no meaning   and MUST be set to zero   when the E bit is not set . A peer SHALL regard a request where the S bit is set   but not the E bit   as invalid   and return an empty POTP-X EAP-Response message . Further   the S bit MUST NOT be set when the A bit also is set; see above .
:LABEL: field

name: Pepper Length
description: This octet SHALL be present if and only if the P bit is set . When present   it contains an unsigned integer   having a value between 0 and 255 ( inclusive ). In an EAP-Request   the integer represents the maximum length ( in bits ) of a client-generated pepper the server is prepared to search for . Peers MUST NOT generate peppers longer than this value . If the value is set to zero   it means the peer MUST NOT generate a pepper for the PBKDF2 calculation . In an EAP-Response   it indicates the length of the used pepper .
:LABEL: field

name: Iteration Count
description: These 4 octets SHALL be present if and only if the P bit is set . When present   they contain an unsigned   4-octet integer in network byte order . In an EAP-Request   the integer represents the maximum iteration count the peer may use in the PBKDF2 computation . Peers MUST NOT use iteration counts higher than this value . In an EAP - Response   it indicates the actual iteration count used .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: EAP-Request : In an EAP-Request   the Authentication Data field   when present   contains an optional " challenge ". The challenge is an octet string that SHOULD be uniquely generated for each request in which it is present ( i.e .  it is a " nonce ")  and SHOULD be 8 octets or longer . To avoid fragmentation ( i.e .  EAP messages longer than the minimum EAP MTU size; see [ 1 ])  the challenge MUST NOT be longer than 64 octets . When the challenge is not present   the OTP will be calculated on the current token state only . The peer MAY ignore a provided challenge if and only if the OTP token the peer is interacting with is not capable of including a challenge in the OTP calculation . In this case   EAP server policies will determine whether or not to accept a provided OTP value .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 6 + cumulative total length of embedded TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The Vendor-Id field is 4 octets   and contains the Vendor-Id of the TLV that was not supported . The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the Structure of Management Information ( SMI ) Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order . The Vendor-Id field MUST be zero for TLVs that are not Vendor-Specific TLVs . For Vendor-Specific TLVs   the Vendor-ID MUST be set to the SMI code .
:LABEL: field

name: NAK-Type
description: The type of the unsupported TLV . The TLV MUST have been included in the most recently received EAP message .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2 + length of the PIN field ( as specified in the PIN Length field ) + ( 0   1   or 2 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . All six bits SHALL be set to zero for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore these bits for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: The Q bit   when set in an EAP-Request   indicates that an accompanying PIN is required   i.e .  the peer ( user ) is not free to choose another PIN . When the Q bit is set   there MUST be an accompanying PIN and the provided PIN MUST be used in subsequent OTP generations . A peer SHALL respond with an empty POTP-X EAP - Response message if the Q bit is set but there is not any accompanying PIN . When the Q bit is not set   any provided PIN is suggested only   and the peer is free to choose another PIN   subject to local policy .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: This bit allows methods that distinguish between two different PIN types ( e.g .  decimal vs . alphanumeric ) to designate whether the augmented set is to be used ( when set ) or not ( when not set ). The A bit carries no meaning   and SHALL be set to zero   in an EAP - Response .
:LABEL: field

name: PIN Length
description: This field contains an unsigned integer representing the length of the provided PIN ( this implies that the maximum length of a PIN will be 255 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: Min . PIN Length
description: This field MAY be present in an EAP-Request . This field MUST NOT be present in an EAP-Response . It SHALL be interpreted as an unsigned integer in network byte order representing the minimum length allowed for a new PIN .
:LABEL: field

name: Max . PIN Length
description: This field MUST NOT be present in an EAP-Request unless the Min . PIN Length field is present   in which case it MAY be present . The field MUST NOT be present in an EAP-Response . It SHALL be interpreted as an unsigned integer in network byte order representing the maximum length allowed for a new PIN . The value of this field   when present   MUST be equal to   or larger than   the value of the Min . PIN Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 17 or 37 + length of IV in requests   1 in responses .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . These 7 bits SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore these bits for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The C bit   when set in an EAP-Request   indicates that the EAP server intends to send more EAP-Requests of type POTP-X in this session   after receipt of a Confirm TLV from the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: Authentication Data
:LABEL: field

name: Pepper Identifier
description: In an EAP-Request   the truncated MAC MAY optionally be followed by an encrypted pepper and its identifier . This initial   4-octet field identifies a pepper generated by the server .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 4 + cumulative total length of inner Vendor TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . This octet SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this octet for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Identifier
description: An 8-octet identifier for the session the peer is trying to resume .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: Upon receipt of the Server-Info TLV   and if the N bit is not set   the peer searches for any stored sessions associated with the server identified by the Server Name field . If a stored session is found   the peer generates a random   16-octet nonce   " c_nonce "  and calculates :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of User Identifier   >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Token Key Identifier   >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Time Stamp field   >= 20 ( depending on precision )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Counter field   >= 1 ( depending on precision )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Challenge field   >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP - POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved for future use . This bit SHALL be set to zero ( 0 ) for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this bit for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: >= 4 ( at least one class of algorithms and one algorithm for that class needs to be present )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . This octet MUST be set to zero for this version . Recipients SHALL ignore this octet for this version of EAP-POTP .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Alg . Length
description: The length of the MAC Algorithms field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The Checksum field contains the standard IP checksum of the entire contents of the LLS block .
:LABEL: field

name: LLS TLVs
description: The contents of the LLS data block is constructed using TLVs . See Figure 4 for the TLV format .
:LABEL: field

description: LLS Type Name Reference 0 Reserved 1 Extended Options [ RFC4813 ] 2 Cryptographic Authentication [ RFC4813 ] 3-32767 Reserved for assignment by the IANA 32768-65535 Private Use
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 123 for Delegated-IPv6-Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the entire attribute   in bytes . At least 4 ( to hold Type/Length/Reserved/Prefix-Length for a 0-bit prefix )  and no larger than 20 ( to hold Type/Length/ Reserved/Prefix - Length for a 128-bit prefix )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Always set to zero by sender; ignored by receiver
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix-Length
description: The length of the prefix being delegated   in bits . At least 0 and no larger than 128 bits ( identifying a single IPv6 address )
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 1 byte ( unsigned integer ) This value SHOULD be set to zero on transmit and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the length of the Padding Data plus 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding Data
description: Padding Data : n bytes ( unsigned integer ) This holds the Padding Data . The Padding Data MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the length of the Padding Data plus 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N and P bits : These bits are used to explicitly relay negative and positive pointer adjustments events across the PSN . The use of N and P bits is OPTIONAL . If not used   N and P bits MUST be set to 0 . See Section 9 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number [ 0:15 ]: The packet sequence number MUST continuously cycle from 0 to 0xFFFF . It is generated and processed in accordance with the rules established in [ RTP ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: P : Padding . No padding is required . The P bit MUST be set to 0 by sender and ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Padding . No padding is required . The P bit MUST be set to 0 by sender and ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: X : Header extension . No extensions are defined . The X bit MUST be set to 0 by sender and ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: CC
description: CC : CSRC count . The CC field MUST be set to 0 by sender and ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : Marker . The M bit MUST be set to 0 by sender and ignored by receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: PT [ 0:6 ]: Payload type . A PT value SHOULD be allocated from the range of dynamic values for each direction of the PW . The same PT value MAY be reused both for direction and between different CEP PWs .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number [ 0:15 ]: The packet sequence number MUST continuously cycle from 0 to 0xFFFF . It is generated and processed in accordance with the rules established in [ RTP ]. The CEP receiver MUST sequence packets according to the Sequence Number field of the CEP header and MAY verify correct sequencing using RTP Sequence Number field .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp [ 0:31 ]: Timestamp values are used in accordance with the rules established in [ RTP ]. Frequency of the clock used for generating timestamps MUST be 19.44 MHz based on a local reference .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : TUG-3 carried bit . If set to 1   the VC-3 payload is carried within the TUG-3 container . If set to 0   all the TUG-3 columns are not carried within the fractional VC-4 encapsulation . The TUG-3 columns are removed either because the VC-3 is unequipped or in AIS mode .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : VC-3 AIS bit . The A bit MUST be set to 0 when the T bit is 1 ( i.e .  when the TUG-3 columns are carried within the fractional VC-4 encapsulation ). The A bit indicate the reason for removal of the entire TUG-3 columns . If set to 0   the TUG-3 columns were removed because the VC-3 is unequipped . If set to 1   the TUG-3 columns were removed because the VC-3 is in AIS mode .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T3 : When set   indicates that the PE sending the label-mapping request is configured to send Fractional SPE packets with T3 bandwidth reduction .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: The code field is one octet in length defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests . The Identifier field MUST be changed on each Request packet . The Identifier field in the Response packet MUST match the Identifier field from the corresponding request .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   Flags   Ver   Message Length   and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and should be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 43 for EAP-FAST
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: L Length included; set to indicate the presence of the four - octet Message Length field
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M More fragments; set on all but the last fragment
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Reserved ( must be zero )
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: This field contains the version of the protocol . This document describes version 1 ( 001 in binary ) of EAP-FAST .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: The Message Length field is four octets   and is present only if the L bit is set . This field provides the total length of the message that may be fragmented over the data fields of multiple packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is two octets . It is set to 0x0004 for Authority ID
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length filed is two octets   which contains the length of the ID field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: ID
description: Hint of the identity of the server . It should be unique across the deployment .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 Optional TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: A 14-bit field   denoting the TLV type . Allocated Types include :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 3 for Result TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The Status field is two octets . Values include :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: TLV Type
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 4 for NAK TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The Vendor-Id field is four octets   and contains the Vendor-Id of the TLV that was not supported . The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order three octets are the Structure of Management Information ( SMI ) Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order . The Vendor-Id field MUST be zero for TLVs that are not Vendor-Specific TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: NAK-Type
description: The NAK-Type field is two octets . The field contains the Type of the TLV that was not supported . A TLV of this Type MUST have been included in the previous packet .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 5 for Error TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Error-Code
description: The Error-Code field is four octets . Currently defined values for Error-Code include :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 or 1
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 7 for Vendor Specific TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 4 + cumulative length of all included Vendor TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The Vendor-Id field is four octets   and contains the Vendor-Id of the TLV . The high-order octet is 0 and the low-order 3 octets are the SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the Vendor in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 9 for EAP-Payload TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: length of embedded EAP packet + cumulative length of additional TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 10 for Intermediate-Result TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2 + cumulative length of the embedded associated TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The Status field is two octets . Values include :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory   set to ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: R
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 12 for Crypto-Binding TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version field is a single octet   which is set to the version of Crypto-Binding TLV the EAP method is using . For an implementation compliant with this version of EAP-FAST   the version number MUST be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: The Sub-Type field is one octet . Defined values include :
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: The Nonce field is 32 octets . It contains a 256-bit nonce that is temporally unique   used for compound MAC key derivation at each end . The nonce in a request MUST have its least significant bit set to 0 and the nonce in a response MUST have the same value as the request nonce except the least significant bit MUST be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Compound MAC
description: The Compound MAC field is 20 octets . This can be the Server MAC ( B1_MAC ) or the Client MAC ( B2_MAC ). The computation of the MAC is described in Section 5.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Mandatory set to one ( 1 )
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 19 for Request-Action TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Action
description: The Action field is two octets . Values include :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16 ( Mobility Agent Advertisement )
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I Regional Registration . This domain supports regional registration as specified in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: GFA IP Address
description: Type 46 ( GFA IP Address ) ( non-skippable )
:LABEL: field

name: Replay Protection Style
description: When a MN uses Mobile IPv4 to register a care-of address with its HA   the style of replay protection used for the registration messages is assumed to be known by way of a mobility security association that is required to exist between the MN and the HA receiving the request . No such pre-existing security association between the MN and the GFA is likely to be available . By default   the MN SHOULD treat replay protection for Regional Registration messages exactly as specified in Mobile IPv4 [ RFC3344 ] for timestamp-based replay protection .
:LABEL: field

name: Replay Protection Style
description: Type 141 ( Replay Protection Style ) ( skippable )
:LABEL: field

name: Regional Registration Lifetime
description: Type 142 ( Regional Registration Lifetime ) ( skippable )
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: variable MTU - a link that does not have a well-defined MTU ( e.g .  IEEE 802.5 token rings ). Many links ( e.g .  Ethernet ) have a standard MTU defined by the link - layer protocol or by the specific document describing how to run IP over the link layer .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: variable MTU - Neighbor Discovery allows routers to specify an MTU for the link   which all nodes then use . All nodes on a link must use the same MTU ( or Maximum Receive Unit ) in order for multicast to work properly . Otherwise   when multicasting   a sender   which can not know which nodes will receive the packet   could not determine a minimum packet size that all receivers can process ( or Maximum Receive Unit ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 133
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 134
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Cur Hop Limit
