description: Cur Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . The default value that should be placed in the Hop Count field of the IP header for outgoing IP packets . A value of zero means unspecified ( by this router ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M 1-bit " Managed address configuration " flag . When set   it indicates that addresses are available via Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol [ DHCPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O 1-bit " Other configuration " flag . When set   it indicates that other configuration information is available via DHCPv6 . Examples of such information are DNS-related information or information on other servers within the network .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved A 6-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Retrans Timer
description: Retrans Timer 32-bit unsigned integer . The time   in milliseconds   between retransmitted Neighbor Solicitation messages . Used by address resolution and the Neighbor Unreachability Detection algorithm ( see Sections 7.2 and 7.3 ). A value of zero means unspecified ( by this router ).
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU SHOULD be sent on links that have a variable MTU ( as specified in the document that describes how to run IP over the particular link type ). MAY be sent on other links .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 135
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 136
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Router flag . When set   the R-bit indicates that the sender is a router . The R-bit is used by Neighbor Unreachability Detection to detect a router that changes to a host .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Solicited flag . When set   the S-bit indicates that the advertisement was sent in response to a Neighbor Solicitation from the Destination address . The S-bit is used as a reachability confirmation for Neighbor Unreachability Detection . It MUST NOT be set in multicast advertisements or in unsolicited unicast advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O Override flag . When set   the O-bit indicates that the advertisement should override an existing cache entry and update the cached link-layer address . When it is not set the advertisement will not update a cached link-layer address though it will update an existing Neighbor Cache entry for which no link-layer address is known . It SHOULD NOT be set in solicited advertisements for anycast addresses and in solicited proxy advertisements . It SHOULD be set in other solicited advertisements and in unsolicited advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 29-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 137
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The ICMP checksum . See [ ICMPv6 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8-bit identifier of the type of option . The options defined in this document are :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the type and length fields ) in units of 8 octets . The value 0 is invalid . Nodes MUST silently discard an ND packet that contains an option with length zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the option ( including the type and length fields ) in units of 8 octets . For example   the length for IEEE 802 addresses is 1 [ IPv6-ETHER ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The number of leading bits in the Prefix that are valid . The value ranges from 0 to 128 . The prefix length field provides necessary information for on-link determination ( when combined with the L flag in the prefix information option ). It also assists with address autoconfiguration as specified in [ ADDRCONF ]  for which there may be more restrictions on the prefix length .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L 1-bit on-link flag . When set   indicates that this prefix can be used for on-link determination . When not set the advertisement makes no statement about on-link or off-link properties of the prefix . In other words   if the L flag is not set a host MUST NOT conclude that an address derived from the prefix is off-link . That is   it MUST NOT update a previous indication that the address is on-link .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A 1-bit autonomous address-configuration flag . When set indicates that this prefix can be used for stateless address configuration as specified in [ ADDRCONF ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved1 6-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved2 This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix An IP address or a prefix of an IP address . The Prefix Length field contains the number of valid leading bits in the prefix . The bits in the prefix after the prefix length are reserved and MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver . A router SHOULD NOT send a prefix option for the link-local prefix and a host SHOULD ignore such a prefix option .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the option in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved These fields are unused . They MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 5
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 1
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU 32-bit unsigned integer . The recommended MTU for the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 12 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer representing the length of the CGA Parameters field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: CGA Parameters
description: This field contains up to 255 bytes of the CGA Parameters data structure defined in [ 2 ]. The concatenation of all CGA Parameters options in the order they appear in the Binding Update message MUST result in the original CGA Parameters data structure . All CGA Parameters options in the Binding Update message except the last one MUST contain exactly 255 bytes in the CGA Parameters field   and the Option Length field MUST be set to 255 accordingly . All CGA Parameters options MUST appear directly one after another   that is   a mobility option of a different type MUST NOT be placed in between two CGA Parameters options .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 13 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer representing the length of the Signature field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature
description: This field contains the mobile or correspondent node's signature   generated with the mobile or correspondent node's private key as specified in Section 4.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 14 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer representing the length of the Permanent Home Keygen Token field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Permanent Home Keygen Token
description: This field contains the permanent home keygen token generated by the correspondent node . The content of this field MUST be encrypted with the mobile node's public key as defined in Section 4.7 . The length of the permanent home keygen token is 8 octets before encryption   though the ciphertext [ 4 ] and   hence   the Permanent Home Keygen Token field may be longer .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: This field MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: This field MUST be set to 8 . It represents the length of the Care-of Keygen Token field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Keygen Token
description: This field contains the care-of keygen token generated by the correspondent node   as specified in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of this mobility option . Its value is 11 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: This field MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: CMR
description: CMR ( 4 bits ): Indicates a codec mode request sent to the speech encoder at the site of the receiver of this payload . The value of the CMR field is set to the frame type index of the corresponding speech mode being requested . The frame type index may be 0-7 for AMR   as defined in Table 1a in [ 2 ]  or 0-8 for AMR-WB   as defined in Table 1a in [ 4 ]. CMR value 15 indicates that no mode request is present   and other values are for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): If set to 1   indicates that this frame is followed by another speech frame in this payload; if set to 0   indicates that this frame is the last frame in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits ): Frame type index   indicating either the AMR or AMR-WB speech coding mode or comfort noise ( SID ) mode of the corresponding frame carried in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( 1 bit ): Frame quality indicator . If set to 0   indicates the corresponding frame is severely damaged   and the receiver should set the RX_TYPE ( see [ 6 ]) to either SPEECH_BAD or SID_BAD depending on the frame type ( FT ).
:LABEL: field

name: CMR
description: R : is a reserved bit that MUST be set to zero . All R bits MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : is a reserved bit that MUST be set to zero . All R bits MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: ILL
description: ILL ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signalled out-of-band for the session . ILL=L indicates to the receiver that the interleaving length is L+1   in number of frame-blocks .
:LABEL: field

name: ILP
description: ILP ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): This is an OPTIONAL field that is present only if interleaving is signalled . ILP MUST take a value between 0 and ILL   inclusive   indicating the interleaving index for frame-blocks in this payload in the interleaving group . If the value of ILP is found greater than ILL   the payload SHOULD be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): see definition in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): see definition in Section 4.3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: P bits : padding bits   MUST be set to zero   and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved bits
description: Reserved bits : MUST be set to 0 when written   and a reader MUST ignore them .
:LABEL: field

name: CHAN
description: CHAN ( 4 bits   unsigned integer ): Indicates the number of audio channels contained in this storage file . The valid values and the order of the channels within a frame-block are specified in Section 4.1 in [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: When set   forces the recovery LSP to be temporarily unavailable to transport traffic ( either normal or extra traffic ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: When set to 1   this bit indicates that the requested LSP is a secondary LSP . When set to 0 ( default )  it indicates that the requested LSP is a primary LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: When set to 1   this bit indicates that the requested LSP is a protecting LSP . When set to 0 ( default )  it indicates that the requested LSP is a working LSP . The combination   S set to 1 with P set to 0 is not valid .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: When set to 1   this bit indicates that the control plane message exchange is only used for notification during protection switching . When set to 0 ( default )  it indicates that the control plane message exchanges are used for protection-switching purposes . The N bit is only applicable when the LSP Protection Type Flag is set to either 0x04 ( 1:N Protection with Extra-Traffic )  or 0x08 ( 1+1 Unidirectional Protection )  or 0x10 ( 1+1 Bidirectional Protection ). The N bit MUST be set to 0 in any other case .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: When set to 1   this bit indicates that the protecting LSP is carrying the normal traffic after protection switching . The O bit is only applicable when the P bit is set to 1   and the LSP Protection Type Flag is set to either 0x04 ( 1:N Protection with Extra-Traffic )  or 0x08 ( 1+1 Unidirectional Protection ) or 0x10 ( 1+1 Bidirectional Protection ). The O bit MUST be set to 0 in any other case .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt . These bits SHOULD be passed through unmodified by transit nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt . These bits SHOULD be passed through unmodified by transit nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Flags
description: Indicates the desired link protection type ( see [ RFC3471 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Association Type
description: Indicates the type of association being identified . Note that this value is considered when determining association . The following are values defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Association ID
description: A value assigned by the LSP head-end . When combined with the Association Type and Association Source   this value uniquely identifies an association .
:LABEL: field

name: Association Type
description: The following values defined for the Association Type ( 16 bits ) field of the ASSOCIATION object .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 37 Protection
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: As defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.3.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: The C-Type of the included PROTECTION object .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: When set ( 1 ) indicates that failure to establish the indicated protection should result in a failure of the LSP being protected .
:LABEL: field

name: Seg.Flags
description: This field is used to indicate when an upstream node desires LSP Segment recovery to be dynamically initiated where possible . The values used in this field are identical to the values defined for LSP Flags; see [ RFC4872 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute
description: Interface attribute values 0 indicates that the interface or set of interfaces associated with the IPv4 prefix should be excluded or avoided .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute
description: Interface attribute value 0 indicates that the interface or set of interfaces associated with the IPv6 prefix should be excluded or avoided .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute
description: Interface attribute value 0 indicates that the Interface ID specified should be excluded or avoided .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: This is a new Mobile IPv4 message carried on UDP ( destination port 434 ) [ 1 ]. The UDP header is followed by the fields below .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16 ( Handoff Request )
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Source-triggered handoff request . When set and the N bit is unset   indicates that the request was the result of an L2-ST at oFA .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N Target triggered handoff request . When set and the H bit is unset   indicates that the request was the result of an L2-TT at nFA .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Set if the request is an HRqst(r ) ( i.e .  a request to renew the tunnel   H and N bits must be unset ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M The FA issuing the HRqst will use Minimal Encapsulation as defined in [ 1 5 ] for the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G The FA issuing the HRqst will use Generic Routing Encapsulation ( GRE ) [ 4 ] as defined in [ 1 5 ] for the tunnel . Extensions of HRqst containing GRE type and key Fields are outside the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T For an HRqst(s )  indicates that the oFA is willing to support both forward and reverse tunnel service . For an HRqst(t )  indicates that the nFA is requesting reverse tunnel service .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B When sent in an HRqst(s )  indicates that the MN has requested a reverse tunnel to the HA and that the nFA SHOULD use a reverse tunnel to the HA if it will not be reverse tunneling to the oFA .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime The lifetime of the tunnel in seconds . If this is an HRqst(t )  then the lifetime represents a request by nFA for a reverse tunnel . If this is an HRqst(s )  then the lifetime represents the maximum amount of time that oFA is willing to maintain both forward and reverse tunnels . If this is an HRqst(r )  then the lifetime represents a request for the amount of time to renew the tunnel's lifetime . A value of 0 on an HRqst(s ) indicates that the oFA is unwilling to grant tunnel service . A value of 0 on an HRqst(t ) indicates that the nFA does not require reverse tunnel service . A value of 0 on an HRqst(r ) indicates that the tunnel should be terminated . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity .
:LABEL: field

name: MN Home Address
description: MN Home Address For HRqst(s )  the home address of the MN .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification As defined in [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: This is a new Mobile IPv4 message carried on UDP ( destination port 434 ) [ 1 ]. The UDP header is followed by the fields below .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 17 ( Handoff Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code A value indicating the result of the Handoff Request . Only two codes are currently supported   0   indicating success   and 1   indicating that the handoff cannot be performed . The remaining values are for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime The lifetime   in seconds   for which the bidirectional tunnel for the MN will be maintained . If this is an HRply(s )  then the lifetime represents a request by nFA   and it can be any value up to the maximum value sent in the HRqst(s ). Larger values are assumed to default to oFA's maximum . If this is an HRply(t )  then the lifetime represents the maximum amount of time that the oFA will grant to the nFA . If this is an HRply(r )  then the lifetime represents the amount of time by which the tunnel life will be extended . If the Code field indicates that handoff failed   the Lifetime field will be ignored and SHOULD be set to zero . A value of 0 on an HRply(t ) indicates that the oFA is unwilling to grant service . A value of 0 on an HRply(s ) indicates that the nFA does not
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Source-triggered handoff reply . When set and the N bit is unset   indicates that the reply is in response to an HRqst(s ).
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N Target-triggered handoff reply . When set and the H bit is unset   indicates that the reply is in response to an HRqst(t ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Set if the reply is an HRply(r ). Neither the H nor the N bit are set .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M The FA issuing the HRqst will use Minimal Encapsulation as defined in [ 1 5 ] for the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G The FA issuing the HRqst will use GRE [ 4 ] Encapsulation as defined in [ 1 5 ] for the tunnel . When this flag bit is set   the HRply may require extensions containing the GRE type and key fields   but they are outside the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T For an HRply(s )  indicates that the nFA is requesting to reverse tunnel service . For an HRply(t )  indicates that the oFA is willing to provide both forward and reverse tunnel service .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B When sent in an HRply(t )  indicates that the MN has requested a reverse tunnel to the HA and that the nFA SHOULD use a reverse tunnel to the HA if it will not be reverse tunneling to the oFA . It can be set in HRply(t ) only if the T bit was unset in the corresponding HRqst(t ).
:LABEL: field

name: MN Home Address
description: MN Home Address For HRply(t )  the home IPv4 address of the MN .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification As defined in [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: The Handoff to Third message has the same format as the Handoff Request and Handoff Reply messages   except both the H and N bits are set . If the HTT message is in response to an L2-ST and is sent to initiate a handoff   then   with the exception of the H and N bits   the message has the same fields set and includes the same extensions as an HRqst(s ). If the HTT message is sent in response to an HRqst(t )  then   with the exception of the H and N bits   the message has the same fields set and includes the same extensions as an HRply(t ). The tunnel bits MUST NOT be set in the HTT message because BET construction is not negotiated between oFA and nFA; it is negotiated between nFA and aFA in the ensuing HRqst(t)/HRply(t ).
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: In general and to a greater extent in wireless networks   packets carrying handoff signaling may be dropped or lost due to errors on the link . In this section   we consider mechanisms for recovery from handoff signaling failures .
:LABEL: field

description: 2 ) Loss of the solicitation by an FA to obtain another neighboring FA's Advertisement or loss of the neighboring FA's advertisement .
:LABEL: field

description: Of these   case 3 ) is handled by standard Mobile IPv4 mechanisms described in [ 1 ]. Case 2 ) is expected to be a rare event because spontaneous packet drop rates on the fixed network are caused by congestion or router failure . Since bit error rates on wireless links are higher than on fixed links   case 1 ) is more likely to occur . In the following subsections   cases 1 ) and 2 ) are considered .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 138 ( skippable ) [ 1 ] - when used in Registration Requests 140 ( skippable ) [ 1 ] - when used in Agent Advertisements
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the Link Layer Address + the one-octet Sub-Type field
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: This field contains the Link Layer sub-type identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the IMSI field + the one-octet Sub-Type field
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 2 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the IMSI field + the one-octet Sub-Type field
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 3 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 7 ( includes the Sub-Type field )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 4 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 9 ( includes the Sub-Type field )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 5 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 5 ( includes the Sub-Type field )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 6 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 5 ( includes the Sub-Type field )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 7 ( skippable ) [ 1 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 5 ( includes the Sub-Type field )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Sections 4.5 and 4.6 define two new Mobile IPv4 message types : Handoff Request and Handoff Reply . These require two type numbers to be assigned by IANA from the Mobile IPv4 Control message type address space . The Handoff Reply message also introduces its own Code field that requires IANA to manage a new Code address space . This specification makes use of the Code values 0-1   where 0 identifies a successful handoff and 1 defines a generic handoff failure . All other values are available for assignment via IETF consensus [ 14 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: ICMP extension version number . This is version 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The one's complement of the one's complement sum of the data structure   with the checksum field replaced by zero for the purpose of computing the checksum . An all-zero value means that no checksum was transmitted . See Section 5.2 for a description of how this field is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of the object   measured in octets   including the object header and object payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value is the length of the Random Number in bytes plus 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : 0   1   2   or 3 bytes ( unsigned integer ) If the length of the Random Number is not a multiple of 4 bytes   the sender MUST pad the parameter with all zero bytes to make the parameter 32-bit aligned . The Padding MUST NOT be longer than 3 bytes and it MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value is the number of listed Chunk Types plus 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Type n
description: Chunk Type n : 1 byte ( unsigned integer ) Each Chunk Type listed is required to be authenticated when sent by the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : 0   1   2   or 3 bytes ( unsigned integer ) If the number of Chunk Types is not a multiple of 4   the sender MUST pad the parameter with all zero bytes to make the parameter 32-bit aligned . The Padding MUST NOT be longer than 3 bytes and it MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value is the number of HMAC Identifiers multiplied by 2   plus 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: HMAC Identifier n
description: HMAC Identifier n : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) The values expressed are a list of HMAC Identifiers that may be used by the peer . The values are listed by preference   with respect to the sender   where the first HMAC Identifier listed is the one most preferable to the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : 0 or 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) If the number of HMAC Identifiers is not even   the sender MUST pad the parameter with all zero bytes to make the parameter 32-bit aligned . The Padding MUST be 0 or 2 bytes long and it MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: HMAC Identifier
description: HMAC Identifier : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value is the HMAC Identifier which is not supported .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) The sender MUST pad the error cause with all zero bytes to make the cause 32-bit aligned . The Padding MUST be 2 bytes long and it MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 1 byte ( unsigned integer ) SHOULD be set to zero on transmit and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the length of the HMAC in bytes plus 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Shared Key Identifier
description: Shared Key Identifier : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value describes which endpoint pair shared key is used .
:LABEL: field

name: HMAC Identifier
description: HMAC Identifier : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value describes which message digest is being used . Table 2 shows the currently defined values .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : 0   1   2   or 3 bytes ( unsigned integer ) If the length of the HMAC is not a multiple of 4 bytes   the sender MUST pad the chunk with all zero bytes to make the chunk 32-bit aligned . The Padding MUST NOT be longer than 3 bytes and it MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD copy the BECN field from the incoming Frame Relay header into this field . The egress router   R2   MUST generate a new BECN field based on the value of the B bit .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD copy the FECN field from the incoming Frame Relay header into this field . The egress router   R2   MUST generate a new FECN field based on the value of the F bit .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD copy the DE field from the incoming Frame Relay header into this field . The egress router   R2   MUST generate a new DE field based on the value of the D bit .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD copy the C/R bit from the received Frame Relay PDU to the C bit of the control word . The egress router   R2   MUST copy the C bit into the output frame .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Bit ( T ) of the control word indicates whether the packet contains an ATM cell or an AAL5 CPCS-SDU . If set   the packet contains an ATM cell   encapsulated according to the ATM cell mode section below; otherwise   it contains an AAL5 CPCS-SDU . The ability to transport an ATM cell in the AAL5 mode is intended to provide a means of enabling Operations and Management ( OAM ) functionality over the AAL5 VC .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the EFCI bit of the final cell of those that transported the AAL5 CPCS-SDU is set to 1   or if the EFCI bit of the single ATM cell to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise   this bit SHOULD be set to 0 . The egress router   R2   SHOULD set the EFCI bit of all cells that transport the AAL5 CPCS-SDU to the value contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The ingress router   R1   SHOULD set this bit to 1 if the CLP bit of any of the ATM cells that transported the AAL5 CPCS-SDU is set to 1   or if the CLP bit of the single ATM cell to be transported in the packet is set to 1 . Otherwise   this bit SHOULD be set to 0 . The egress router   R2   SHOULD set the CLP bit of all cells that transport the AAL5 CPCS-SDU to the value contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: When FRF.8.1 Frame Relay / ATM PVC Service Interworking [ FRF.8.1 ] traffic is being transported   the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 CPCS-SDU may contain the Frame Relay C/R bit . The ingress router   R1   SHOULD copy this bit to the C bit of the control word . The egress router   R2   SHOULD copy the C bit to the CPCS-UU Least Significant Bit ( LSB ) of the AAL5 CPCS PDU .
:LABEL: field

name: VPI
description: The ingress router MUST copy the VPI field from the incoming cell into this field . For particular emulated VCs   the egress router MAY generate a new VPI and ignore the VPI contained in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: VCI
description: The ingress router MUST copy the VCI field from the incoming ATM cell header into this field . For particular emulated VCs   the egress router MAY generate a new VCI .
:LABEL: field

name: PTI
description: The PTI and CLP fields are the PTI and CLP fields of the incoming ATM cells . The cell headers of the cells within the packet are the ATM headers ( without HEC ) of the incoming cell .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: VC Type
description: 0x0001 Frame Relay DLCI 0x0002 ATM AAL5 VCC transport 0x0003 ATM transparent cell transport 0x0004 Ethernet VLAN 0x0005 Ethernet 0x0006 HDLC 0x0007 PPP 0x8008 CEM [ CEM ] 0x0009 ATM VCC cell transport 0x000A ATM VPC cell transport
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The highest order bit ( C ) of the VC type is used to flag the presence of a control word ( defined in [ RFC4905 ]) as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Application Layer
description: The transport layer provides indications to the application layer by propagating Internet layer indications ( such as IP address configuration and changes )  as well as providing its own indications   such as connection teardown .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Layer
description: The characteristics of wireless links have been found to vary considerably depending on the environment .
:LABEL: field

name: Application Layer
description: In " Application-oriented Link Adaptation for IEEE 802.11 " [ Haratcherev2 ]  rate information generated by a link layer utilizing improved rate adaptation algorithms is provided to a video application   and used for codec adaptation . Coupling the link and application layers results in major improvements in the Peak Signal to Noise Ratio ( PSNR ). Since this approach assumes that the link represents the path bottleneck bandwidth   it is not universally applicable to use over the Internet .
:LABEL: field

name: Router ID
description: The TE Router ID ( TLV type 8 ) or the Router ID ( TLV type 21 ) used to identify the node within the IGP .
:LABEL: field

name: OSPF Area Identifier
description: The 4-octet area identifier for the node . This identifies the area where the failure has occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of the actual ( non-padded ) IS-IS Area Identifier in octets . Valid values are from 2 to 11 inclusive .
:LABEL: field

name: IS-IS Area Identifier
description: The variable-length IS-IS area identifier . Padded with trailing zeroes to a four-octet boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Autonomous System Number
description: The AS Number of the associated Autonomous System . Note that if 16-bit AS numbers are in use   the low order bits ( 16 through 31 ) should be used and the high order bits ( 0 through 15 ) should be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Total Length
description: Total Length ( 32 bits ): The total length of the EPP data unit measured in octets in network ( big endian ) byte order . The octets contained in this field MUST be included in the total length calculation .
:LABEL: field

name: EPP XML Instance
description: EPP XML Instance ( variable length ): The EPP XML instance carried in the data unit .
:LABEL: field

name: Dispatch
description: Dispatch 6-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Dispatch Header .
:LABEL: field

name: type-specific header
description: Figure 1 : Dispatch Type and Header
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : This 1-bit field SHALL be zero if the Originator ( or " Very first ") Address is an IEEE extended 64-bit address ( EUI-64 )  or 1 if it is a short 16-bit addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : This 1-bit field SHALL be zero if the Final Destination Address is an IEEE extended 64-bit address ( EUI-64 )  or 1 if it is a short 16-bit addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: datagram_size
description: datagram_size : This 11-bit field encodes the size of the entire IP packet before link-layer fragmentation ( but after IP layer fragmentation ). The value of datagram_size SHALL be the same for all link-layer fragments of an IP packet . For IPv6   this SHALL be 40 octets ( the size of the uncompressed IPv6 header ) more than the value of Payload Length in the IPv6 header [ RFC2460 ] of the packet . Note that this packet may already be fragmented by hosts involved in the communication   i.e .  this field needs to encode a maximum length of 1280 octets ( the IEEE 802.15.4 link MTU   as defined in this document ).
:LABEL: field

name: datagram_tag
description: datagram_tag : The value of datagram_tag ( datagram tag ) SHALL be the same for all link fragments of a payload ( e.g .  IPv6 ) datagram . The sender SHALL increment datagram_tag for successive   fragmented datagrams . The incremented value of datagram_tag SHALL wrap from 65535 back to zero . This field is 16 bits long   and its initial value is not defined .
:LABEL: field

name: datagram_offset
description: datagram_offset : This field is present only in the second and subsequent link fragments and SHALL specify the offset   in increments of 8 octets   of the fragment from the beginning of the payload datagram . The first octet of the datagram ( e.g .  the start of the IPv6 header ) has an offset of zero; the implicit value of datagram_offset in the first link fragment is zero . This field is 8 bits long .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This is the length of this option ( including the type and length fields ) in units of 8 octets . The value of this field is 2 if using EUI-64 addresses   or 1 if using 16-bit short addresses .
:LABEL: field

description: 00 : PI   II
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 0 : not compressed   carried " in-line " ( Section 10.3.2 )
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : This 8-bit field SHALL be incremented by the originator whenever it sends a new mesh broadcast or multicast packet . Full specification of how to handle this field is out of the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: o Transmission Sequence Number ( TSN ): A 32-bit sequence number used internally by SCTP . One TSN is attached to each chunk containing user data to permit the receiving SCTP endpoint to acknowledge its receipt and detect duplicate deliveries .
:LABEL: field

name: Verification Tag
description: o Verification Tag : A 32-bit unsigned integer that is randomly generated . The Verification Tag provides a key that allows a receiver to verify that the SCTP packet belongs to the current association and is not an old or stale packet from a previous association .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: TSN - Transmission Sequence Number
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port Number
description: This is the SCTP sender's port number . It can be used by the receiver in combination with the source IP address   the SCTP destination port   and possibly the destination IP address to identify the association to which this packet belongs . The port number 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port Number
description: This is the SCTP port number to which this packet is destined . The receiving host will use this port number to de-multiplex the SCTP packet to the correct receiving endpoint/application . The port number 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Verification Tag
description: The receiver of this packet uses the Verification Tag to validate the sender of this SCTP packet . On transmit   the value of this Verification Tag MUST be set to the value of the Initiate Tag received from the peer endpoint during the association initialization   with the following exceptions :
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: This field contains the checksum of this SCTP packet . Its calculation is discussed in Section 6.8 . SCTP uses the CRC32c algorithm as described in Appendix B for calculating the checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Type
description: This field identifies the type of information contained in the Chunk Value field . It takes a value from 0 to 254 . The value of 255 is reserved for future use as an extension field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: The usage of these bits depends on the Chunk type as given by the Chunk Type field . Unless otherwise specified   they are set to 0 on transmit and are ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Length
description: This value represents the size of the chunk in bytes   including the Chunk Type   Chunk Flags   Chunk Length   and Chunk Value fields . Therefore   if the Chunk Value field is zero-length   the Length field will be set to 4 . The Chunk Length field does not count any chunk padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Value
description: The Chunk Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the chunk . The usage and format of this field is dependent on the Chunk Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Should be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field indicates the length of the DATA chunk in bytes from the beginning of the type field to the end of the User Data field excluding any padding . A DATA chunk with one byte of user data will have Length set to 17 ( indicating 17 bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: This value represents the TSN for this DATA chunk . The valid range of TSN is from 0 to 4294967295 ( 2**32 - 1 ). TSN wraps back to 0 after reaching 4294967295 .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier S
description: Identifies the stream to which the following user data belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Sequence Number n
description: This value represents the Stream Sequence Number of the following user data within the stream S . Valid range is 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Protocol Identifier
description: This value represents an application ( or upper layer ) specified protocol identifier . This value is passed to SCTP by its upper layer and sent to its peer . This identifier is not used by SCTP but can be used by certain network entities   as well as by the peer application   to identify the type of information being carried in this DATA chunk . This field must be sent even in fragmented DATA chunks ( to make sure it is available for agents in the middle of the network ). Note that this field is NOT touched by an SCTP implementation; therefore   its byte order is NOT necessarily big endian . The upper layer is responsible for any byte order conversions to this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Initiate Tag
description: The receiver of the INIT ( the responding end ) records the value of the Initiate Tag parameter . This value MUST be placed into the Verification Tag field of every SCTP packet that the receiver of the INIT transmits within this association .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Outbound Streams
description: Defines the number of outbound streams the sender of this INIT chunk wishes to create in this association . The value of 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Inbound Streams
description: Defines the maximum number of streams the sender of this INIT chunk allows the peer end to create in this association . The value 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial TSN
description: Defines the initial TSN that the sender will use . The valid range is from 0 to 4294967295 . This field MAY be set to the value of the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: Contains an IPv4 address of the sending endpoint . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: Contains an IPv6 [ RFC2460 ] address of the sending endpoint . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: Host Name
description: This field contains a host name in " host name syntax " per RFC 1123 Section 2.1 [ RFC1123 ]. The method for resolving the host name is out of scope of SCTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Initiate Tag
description: The receiver of the INIT ACK records the value of the Initiate Tag parameter . This value MUST be placed into the Verification Tag field of every SCTP packet that the INIT ACK receiver transmits within this association .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Outbound Streams
description: Defines the number of outbound streams the sender of this INIT ACK chunk wishes to create in this association . The value of 0 MUST
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Inbound Streams
description: Defines the maximum number of streams the sender of this INIT ACK chunk allows the peer end to create in this association . The value 0 MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial TSN
description: Defines the initial TSN that the INIT ACK sender will use . The valid range is from 0 to 4294967295 . This field MAY be set to the value of the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Value :
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : Variable size .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to all ' 0's on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Cumulative TSN Ack
description: This parameter contains the TSN of the last DATA chunk received in sequence before a gap . In the case where no DATA chunk has been received   this value is set to the peer's Initial TSN minus one .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertised Receiver Window Credit
description: Advertised Receiver Window Credit ( a_rwnd ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and the Heartbeat Information field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Ack Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and the Heartbeat Information field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Reserved : 7 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 7 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and all the Error Cause fields present .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the length of the parameter . Set to 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Cumulative TSN Ack
description: This parameter contains the TSN of the last chunk received in sequence before any gaps .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the chunk header and all the Error Cause fields present .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Code
description: Defines the type of error conditions being reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Length
description: Set to the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Cause Code   Cause Length   and Cause-Specific Information fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier
description: Contains the Stream Identifier of the DATA chunk received in error .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It is set to all 0's on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Unresolvable Address
description: Unresolvable Address : Indicates that the sender is not able to resolve the specified address parameter ( e.g .  type of address is not supported by the sender ). This is usually sent in combination with or within an ABORT .
:LABEL: field

name: Unresolvable Address
description: Unresolvable Address : Indicates that the sender is not able to resolve the specified address parameter ( e.g .  type of address is not supported by the sender ). This is usually sent in combination with or within an ABORT .
:LABEL: field

name: Unresolvable Address
description: The Unresolvable Address field contains the complete Type   Length   and Value of the address parameter ( or Host Name parameter ) that contains the unresolvable address or host name .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Chunk
description: The Unrecognized Chunk field contains the unrecognized chunk from the SCTP packet complete with Chunk Type   Chunk Flags   and Chunk Length .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Parameters
description: Unrecognized Parameters : This error cause is returned to the originator of the INIT ACK chunk if the receiver does not recognize one or more Optional TLV parameters in the INIT ACK chunk .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Parameters
description: Unrecognized Parameters : This error cause is returned to the originator of the INIT ACK chunk if the receiver does not recognize one or more Optional TLV parameters in the INIT ACK chunk .
:LABEL: field

name: Unrecognized Parameters
description: The Unrecognized Parameters field contains the unrecognized parameters copied from the INIT ACK chunk complete with TLV . This error cause is normally contained in an ERROR chunk bundled with the COOKIE ECHO chunk when responding to the INIT ACK   when the sender of the COOKIE ECHO chunk wishes to report unrecognized parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN value
description: The TSN value field contains the TSN of the DATA chunk received with no user data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the size of the chunk in bytes   including the 4 bytes of the chunk header and the size of the cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Cookie
description: This field must contain the exact cookie received in the State Cookie parameter from the previous INIT ACK .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Reserved : 7 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Set to 0 on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B ) " Z " shall respond immediately with an INIT ACK chunk . The destination IP address of the INIT ACK MUST be set to the source IP address of the INIT to which this INIT ACK is responding . In the response   besides filling in other parameters   " Z " must set the Verification Tag field to Tag_A   and also provide its own Verification Tag ( Tag_Z ) in the Initiate Tag field .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: C ) An old State Cookie is received from someone that the receiver is not interested in having an association with and the ABORT chunk was lost .
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier
description: Every DATA chunk MUST carry a valid stream identifier . If an endpoint receives a DATA chunk with an invalid stream identifier   it shall acknowledge the reception of the DATA chunk following the normal procedure   immediately send an ERROR chunk with cause set to " Invalid Stream Identifier " ( see Section 3.3.10 )  and discard the DATA chunk . The endpoint may bundle the ERROR chunk in the same packet as the SACK as long as the ERROR follows the SACK .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: C ) Re-enable heartbeat on a specific destination transport address of a given association   and
:LABEL: field

name: Verification Tag
description: The Verification Tag rules defined in this section apply when sending or receiving SCTP packets that do not contain an INIT   SHUTDOWN COMPLETE   COOKIE ECHO ( see Section 5.1 )  ABORT   or SHUTDOWN ACK chunk . The rules for sending and receiving SCTP packets containing one of these chunk types are discussed separately in Section 8.5.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: - The endpoint MUST always fill in the Verification Tag field of the outbound packet with the destination endpoint's tag value   if it is known .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: - If the receiver is in COOKIE-ECHOED or COOKIE-WAIT state the procedures in Section 8.4 SHOULD be followed; in other words   it should be treated as an Out Of The Blue packet .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Format : ASSOCIATE(local SCTP instance name   destination transport addr   outbound stream count ) -> association id [  destination transport addr list ] [  outbound stream count ]
:LABEL: field

name: Upper Layer Abort Reason
description: o Upper Layer Abort Reason - reason of the abort to be passed to the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Format : SEND(association id   buffer address   byte count [  context ] [  stream id ] [  life time ] [  destination transport address ] [  unordered flag ] [  no-bundle flag ] [  payload protocol-id ] ) -> result
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: If a message cannot be delivered   SCTP shall invoke this notification on the ULP .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: When SCTP loses communication to an endpoint completely ( e.g .  via Heartbeats ) or detects that the endpoint has performed an abort operation   it shall invoke this notification on the ULP .
:LABEL: field

name: Upper Layer Abort Reason
description: o Upper Layer Abort Reason - the abort reason specified in case of a user-initiated abort .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type A 16-bit field set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the value portion in octets and will be a multiple of 4 octets dependent on the number of capabilities advertised . Initially   the length will be 4   denoting 4 octets of informational capability bits .
:LABEL: field

name: LSP
description: LSP stands for " Label-Switched Path ". An LSP is a TE circuit path in a packet network . The terms " LSP " and " TE circuit path " are used synonymously in the context of packet networks .
:LABEL: field

name: TE
description: A TE node is a node in the traffic engineering ( TE ) network . A TE node has a minimum of one TE link attached to it . Associated with each TE node is a set of supported TE metrics . A TE node may also participate in a native IP network .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-TE TLVs
description: TLVs used to describe the TE capabilities of a TE node .
:LABEL: field

name: Link-TE TLVs
description: TLVs used to describe the TE capabilities of a TE link .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x81
description: The TE-router LSA ( 0x81 ) is modeled after the router LSA and has the same flooding scope as the router LSA . However   the scope is restricted to only the OSPF-xTE nodes within the area . The TE router LSA describes the TE metrics of the router as well as the TE links attached to the router . Below is the format of the TE-router LSA . Unless specified explicitly otherwise   the fields carry the same meaning as they do in a router LSA . Only the differences are explained below . Router-TE flags   Router-TE TLVs   Link-TE options   and Link-TE TLVs are each described in the following sub-sections .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-TE TLVs
description: The following Router-TE TLVs are defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Link-TE TLVs
description: 8.1.4 . Link-TE TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Bandwidth is expressed in units of 32 bytes/sec ( 256 bits/sec ). A 32-bit field for bandwidth would permit specification not exceeding 1 terabit/sec .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Bandwidth is expressed in units of 32 bytes/sec ( 256 bits/sec ). A 32-bit field for bandwidth would permit specification not exceeding 1 terabit/sec .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Bandwidth is expressed in units of 32 bytes/sec ( 256 bits/sec ). A 32-bit field for bandwidth would permit specification not exceeding 1 terabit/sec .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x8d
description: A significant difference between a native OSPF network and a TE network is that the latter may be subject to frequent real-time circuit pinning and is likely to undergo TE-state updates . Some links might undergo changes more frequently than others . Flooding the network with TE-router LSAs at the aggregated speed of all link metric changes is simply not desirable . A smaller in size TE - incremental-link-update LSA is designed to advertise only the incremental link updates .
:LABEL: field

name: Link State ID
description: This would be exactly the same as would have been specified for Link ID   for a link within the router LSA .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Data
description: This specifies the router ID the link belongs to . In majority of cases   this would be same as the advertising router . This choice for Link Data is primarily to facilitate proxy advertisement for incremental link updates .
:LABEL: field

name: Link State ID
description: The ID of the far-end router or the far-end link-ID to which the TE circuit path(s ) is being advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: CktType
description: CktType - This 4-bit field specifies the circuit type of the Forward Equivalency Class ( FEC ).
:LABEL: field

name: No . of TE Circuit Paths
description: This specifies the number of pre-engineered TE circuit paths between the advertising router and the router specified in the Link State ID .
:LABEL: field

name: Circuit-TE ID
description: This is the ID of the far-end router for a given TE circuit path segment .
:LABEL: field

name: Circuit-TE Data
description: This is the virtual link identifier on the near-end router for a given TE circuit path segment . This can be a private interface or handle the near-end router uses to identify the virtual link .
:LABEL: field

name: Circuit-TE flags
description: This lists the zero or more TE-link TLVs that all member elements of the LSP meet .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x83
description: A TE-Summary network LSA may be used to advertise reachability of TE-networks accessible to areas external to the originating area . The content and the flooding scope of a TE-Summary LSA is different from that of a native Summary LSA .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x84
description: A TE-Summary router LSA may be used to advertise the availability of area border routers ( ABRs ) and AS border routers ( ASBRs ) that are TE-capable . The TE-Summary router LSAs are originated by the Area Border Routers . The scope of flooding for the TE-Summary router LSA is the non-backbone area the advertising ABR belongs to .
:LABEL: field

name: Link State ID
description: The ID of the area border router or the AS border router whose TE capability is being advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertising Router
description: The ABR that advertises its TE capabilities ( and the OSPF areas it belongs to ) or the TE capabilities of an ASBR within one of the areas for which the ABR is a border router .
:LABEL: field

name: No . of Areas
description: Specifies the number of OSPF areas the link state ID belongs to .
:LABEL: field

name: Area-ID
description: Specifies the OSPF area(s ) the link state ID belongs to . When the link state ID is same as the advertising router ID   the Area-ID lists all the areas the ABR belongs to . In the case the link state ID is an ASBR   the Area-ID simply lists the area the ASBR belongs to . The advertising router is assumed to be the ABR from the same area the ASBR is located in .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-TE flags
description: TE capabilities of the link-state-ID router .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-TE TLVs
description: TE capabilities of the link-state-ID router .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x85
description: TE-AS-external LSAs are the Type 0x85 LSAs . This is modeled after AS-external LSA format and flooding scope . TE-AS-external LSAs are originated by AS boundary routers with TE extensions   and describe the TE networks and pre-engineered circuit paths external to the AS . As with AS-external LSA   the flooding scope of the TE-AS-external LSA is AS-wide   with the exception of stub areas .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Mask
description: The IP address mask for the advertised TE destination . For example   this can be used to specify access to a specific TE node or TE link with an mask of 0xffffffff . This can also be used to specify access to an aggregated set of destinations using a different mask . ex : 0xff000000 .
:LABEL: field

name: Link-TE flags
description: The TE attributes of this route . These fields are optional and are provided only when one or more pre-engineered circuits can be specified with the advertisement . Without these fields   the LSA will simply state TE reachability info .
:LABEL: field

name: Link-TE TLVs
description: The TE attributes of this route . These fields are optional and are provided only when one or more pre-engineered circuits can be specified with the advertisement . Without these fields   the LSA will simply state TE reachability info .
:LABEL: field

name: Forwarding address
description: Data traffic for the advertised destination will be forwarded to this address . If the Forwarding address is set to 0.0.0.0   data traffic will be forwarded instead to the LSA's originator ( i.e .  the responsible AS boundary router ).
:LABEL: field

name: External Route Tag
description: A 32-bit field attached to each external route . This is not used by the OSPF protocol itself . It may be used to communicate information between AS boundary routers; the precise nature of such information is outside the scope of this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x81
description: The following fields are used to describe each router link ( i.e .  interface ). Each router link is typed ( see the below Type field ). The Type field indicates the kind of link being described .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: A new link type " Positional-Ring Type " ( value 5 ) is defined . This is essentially a connection to a TDM-Ring . TDM ring network is different from LAN/NBMA transit network in that nodes on the TDM ring do not necessarily have a terminating path between themselves . Second   the order of links is important in determining the circuit path . Third   the protection switching and the number of fibers from a node going into a ring are determined by the ring characteristics   for example   2-fiber vs . 4-fiber ring and Unidirectional Path Switched Ring ( UPSR ) vs . Bidirectional Line Switched Ring ( BLSR ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description __________________________________________________ 1 Point-to-point connection to another router 2 Connection to a transit network 3 Connection to a stub network 4 Virtual link 5 Positional-Ring type .
:LABEL: field

name: Link ID
description: Identifies the object that this router link connects to . Value depends on the link's Type . For a positional-ring type   the Link ID shall be IP Network/Subnet number just as the case with a broadcast transit network . The following table summarizes the updated Link ID values .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Link ID ______________________________________ 1 Neighboring router's Router ID 2 IP address of Designated Router 3 IP network/subnet number 4 Neighboring router's Router ID 5 IP network/subnet number
:LABEL: field

name: Link Data
description: This depends on the link's Type field . For type-5 links   this specifies the router interface's IP address .
:LABEL: field

name: TDM
description: TDM   LSC   FSC bits - Same as defined for router TE options .
:LABEL: field

name: LSC
description: TDM   LSC   FSC bits - Same as defined for router TE options .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x82
description: Network LSA is adequate for packet TE networks . A new TE - positional-ring-network LSA is defined to represent type-5 link networks   found in non-packet networks such as SONET/SDH TDM rings . A type-5 ring is a collection of network elements ( NEs ) forming a closed loop . Each NE is connected to two adjacent NEs via a duplex connection to provide redundancy in the ring . The sequence in which the NEs are placed on the Ring is pertinent . The NE that provides the OSPF-xTE functionality is termed the Gateway Network Element ( GNE ). The GNE selection criteria is outside the scope of this document . The GNE is also termed the Designated Router for the ring .
:LABEL: field

name: Link State ID
description: This is the IP interface address of the network's Gateway Network Element   which is also the designated router .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertising Router
description: Router ID of the network's Designated Router .
:LABEL: field

name: Capacity Unit
description: Two units are currently defined   as follows .
:LABEL: field

name: Ring capacity
description: Ring capacity expressed in number of Capacity Units .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Element Node Id
description: The Router ID of each of the routers in the positional-ring network . The list must start with the designated router as the first element . The Network Elements ( NEs ) must be listed in strict clockwise order as they appear on the ring   starting with the Gateway Network Element ( GNE ). The number of NEs in the ring can be deduced from the LSA header's length field .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x8e
description: This is a variation to the TE-router LSA in that the TE-router LSA is not advertised by the network element   but rather by a trusted TE - router Proxy . This is typically the scenario in a non-packet TE network   where some of the nodes do not have OSPF functionality and count on a helper node to do the advertisement for them . One such example would be the SONET/SDH Add-Drop Multiplexer ( ADM ) nodes in a TDM ring . The nodes may principally depend upon the GNE ( Gateway Network Element ) to do the advertisement for them . TE-router-Proxy LSA shall not be used to advertise area border routers and/or AS border routers .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The OSPF interface type can also be of type " Positional-Ring ". The Positional-Ring type is different from other types ( such as broadcast and NBMA ) in that the exact location of the nodes on the ring is relevant   even though they are all on the same ring . SONET ADM ring is a good example of this . Complete ring positional-ring description may be provided by the GNE on a ring as a TE-network LSA for the ring .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Copyright ( C ) The IETF Trust ( 2007 ).
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4
description: Class = SESSION   Class-Num = 1   C-Type = 7(IPv4)/8(IPv6 )
:LABEL: field

name: Call_ID
description: A 16-bit identifier used in the SESSION object that remains constant over the life of the Call . The Call_ID value MUST be set to zero when there is no corresponding Call .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID : 16 bits ( see [ RFC3209 ])
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: Extended Tunnel ID : 32 bits/128 bits ( see [ RFC3209 ])
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reflect ( R ): 1 bit - see [ RFC3471 ] Testing ( T ): 1 bit - see [ RFC3471 ] Administratively down ( A ): 1 bit - see [ RFC3471 ] Deletion in progress ( D ): 1 bit - see [ RFC3471 ] Call Management ( C ): 1 bit
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R - to cause the egress to respond C - to indicate that the Notify message is managing a Call .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Flags : See [ rfc3344 ]. The ' S ' and ' B ' flags in [ rfc3344 ] are sent as zero   and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: Lifetime : The number of seconds remaining before the binding expires . This value MUST NOT exceed 10 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The number of seconds remaining before the binding expires . This value MUST NOT exceed 10 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: Home Address : MUST be either the co-located CoA or the Home Address itself ( in FA-CoA mode )
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: Care-of Address : The New Access Router's global IP address . Even when a New CoA is provided to the MN ( see Section 5.4 )  NAR's IP address MUST be used for this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification : a 64-bit number used for matching an FBU with FBack . Identical to usage in [ rfc3344 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 21
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 : FBU Accepted 1 : FBU Accepted   NCoA supplied 128 : FBU Not Accepted   reason unspecified 129 : Administratively prohibited 130 : Insufficient resources
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: Lifetime : The granted number of seconds remaining before binding expires .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The granted number of seconds remaining before binding expires .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: Home Address : either the co-located CoA or the Home Address itself ( in FA-Coa mode )
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: Identification : a 64-bit number used for matching FBU . Copied from the field in FBU for which this FBack is a reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification : a 64-bit number used for matching FBU . Copied from the field in FBU for which this FBack is a reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Checksum : The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum and the Reserved fields are set to 0 . See [ rfc1256 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum and the Reserved fields are set to 0 . See [ rfc1256 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : MUST be set by the sender so that replies can be matched to this Solicitation .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum and the Reserved fields are set to 0 . See [ rfc1256 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : Copied from Router Solicitation for Proxy Advertisement or set to Zero if unsolicited .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum and the Reserved fields are set to 0 . See [ rfc1256 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: S : Assigned address configuration flag . When set   this message requests a new CoA to be returned by the destination . May be set when Code = 0 . MUST be 0 when Code = 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Assigned address configuration flag . When set   this message requests a new CoA to be returned by the destination . May be set when Code = 0 . MUST be 0 when Code = 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : Buffer flag . When set   the destination SHOULD buffer any packets towards the node indicated in the options of this message . Used when Code = 0   SHOULD be set to 0 when Code = 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : MUST be set by the sender so replies can be matched to this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message   starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the Checksum and the Reserved fields are set to 0 . See [ rfc1256 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : Copied from the corresponding field in the Handover Initiate message this message is in response to .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 20
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the option ( including the Type   Length and Option-Code fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The length of the option ( including the Type   Length and Option-Code fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the option ( including the Type   Length and Option-Code fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: New IPv4 Address
description: New IPv4 Address : NAR's IPv4 address or the NCoA assigned by NAR .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The length of the option ( including the Type   Length and Option-Code fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the option ( including the Type   Length and Option-Code fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: AII Type
description: AII Type 1 has been allocated by IANA for use with provisioning models requiring a fixed-length 32-bit value [ L2VPN-SIG ]. This value is unique on the local PE .
:LABEL: field

name: AII Type
description: The AII Type 2 structure permits varying levels of AII summarization to take place   thus reducing the scaling burden on the aforementioned AII distribution mechanisms and PE memory . In other words   it no longer becomes necessary to distribute or configure all individual AII values ( which could number in the tens of thousands or more ) on local PEs prior to establishing PWs to remote PEs . The details of how and where the aggregation of AII values is performed and then distributed as AII reachability information are not discussed in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8-bit identifier of the RDNSS option type as assigned by the IANA : 25
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) is in units of 8 octets . The minimum value is 3 if one IPv6 address is contained in the option . Every additional RDNSS address increases the length by 2 . The Length field is used by the receiver to determine the number of IPv6 addresses in the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime 32-bit unsigned integer . The maximum time   in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent )  over which this RDNSS address MAY be used for name resolution . Hosts MAY send a Router Solicitation to ensure the RDNSS information is fresh before the interval expires . In order to provide fixed hosts with stable DNS service and allow mobile hosts to prefer local RDNSSes to remote RDNSSes   the value of Lifetime should be at least as long as the Maximum RA Interval ( MaxRtrAdvInterval ) in RFC 4861   and be at most as long as two times MaxRtrAdvInterval; Lifetime SHOULD be bounded as follows : MaxRtrAdvInterval <= Lifetime <= 2*MaxRtrAdvInterval . A value of all one bits ( 0xffffffff ) represents infinity . A value of zero means that the RDNSS address MUST no longer be used .
:LABEL: field

name: link-address
description: link-address A global address that will be used by the server to identify the link to which the query applies   or 0::0 if unspecified .
:LABEL: field

name: query-type
description: query-type The query requested ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: link-address
description: link-address A global address used by the server to identify the link on which the client is located .
:LABEL: field

description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code The suboption code ( 10 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The suboption length   1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags The Relay Agent flags for this forwarded packet .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: unicast = 1 broadcast = 0
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : MUST BE ZERO ( reserved for future use )
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Value : 0001 ( binary )
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Value : 0000 ( binary )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Range : 5 - 100003 ( decimal )
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: DNS-UPDATE-TYPE ( 17 )
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option excluding the type and length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the result of the dynamic DNS update procedure . This field MUST be set to 0 and ignored by the receiver when the DNS Update mobility option is included in a Binding Update message . When the DNS Update mobility option is included in the Binding Acknowledgement message   values of the Status field less than 128 indicate that the dynamic DNS update was performed successfully by the Home Agent . Values greater than or equal to 128 indicate that the dynamic DNS update was not completed by the HA . The following Status values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This bit MUST be set to zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: A unique identifier for the MIP6_HOME_PREFIX attribute ( 16 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length in octets of Value field ( Home Prefix   Prefix Lifetime and Prefix Length ). This can be 0 or 21 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Lifetime
description: The lifetime of the Home Prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Prefix
