The length of the IV is inferred from the HIP transform . Encrypted The data is encrypted using an encryption algorithm data as defined in HIP transform .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 832 Length length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding Reserved zero when sent   ignored when received Notify Message specifies the type of notification Type Notification informational or error data transmitted in addition Data to the Notify Message Type . Values for this field are type specific ( see below ). Padding any Padding   if necessary   to make the parameter a multiple of 8 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 897 Length variable Opaque data opaque data   supposed to be meaningful only to the node that sends ECHO_REQUEST_SIGNED and receives a corresponding ECHO_RESPONSE_SIGNED or ECHO_RESPONSE_UNSIGNED .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 63661 Length variable Opaque data opaque data   supposed to be meaningful only to the node that sends ECHO_REQUEST_UNSIGNED and receives a corresponding ECHO_RESPONSE_UNSIGNED .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 961 Length variable Opaque data opaque data   copied unmodified from the ECHO_REQUEST_SIGNED or ECHO_REQUEST_UNSIGNED parameter that triggered this response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 63425 Length variable Opaque data opaque data   copied unmodified from the ECHO_REQUEST_SIGNED or ECHO_REQUEST_UNSIGNED parameter that triggered this response .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Type
description: The 7-bit Packet Type field in a HIP protocol packet describes the type of a HIP protocol message . It is defined in Section 5.1 . The current values are defined in Sections 5.3.1 through 5.3.8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Group ID
description: The eight-bit Group ID values appear in the DIFFIE_HELLMAN parameter and are defined in Section 5.2.6 . New values either from the reserved or unassigned space are assigned through IETF Consensus .
:LABEL: field

name: Notify Message Type
description: The 16-bit Notify Message Type values in a NOTIFICATION parameter are defined in Section 5.2.16 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65 Length 12 KEYMAT Index Index   in bytes   where to continue to draw ESP keys from KEYMAT . If the packet includes a new Diffie-Hellman key and the ESP_INFO is sent in an UPDATE packet   the field MUST be zero . If the ESP_INFO is included in base exchange messages   the KEYMAT Index must have the index value of the point from where the ESP SA keys are drawn . Note that the length of this field limits the amount of keying material that can be drawn from KEYMAT . If that amount is exceeded   the packet MUST contain a new Diffie-Hellman key . OLD SPI old SPI for data sent to address(es ) associated with this SA . If this is an initial SA setup   the OLD SPI value is zero .
:LABEL: field

name: NEW SPI
description: NEW SPI new SPI for data sent to address(es ) associated with this SA .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4095 Length length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and padding Reserved zero when sent   ignored when received Suite ID defines the ESP Suite to be used
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 930 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Min Lifetime Minimum registration lifetime . Max Lifetime Maximum registration lifetime . Reg Type The registration types offered by the registrar .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 932 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Lifetime Requested registration lifetime . Reg Type The preferred registration types in order of preference .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 934 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Lifetime Granted registration lifetime . Reg Type The granted registration types in order of preference .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 936 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Failure Type Reason for failure . Reg Type The registration types that failed with the specified reason .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65500 Length Variable . Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . HMAC HMAC computed over the HIP packet   excluding the RVS_HMAC parameter and any following parameters . The HMAC is keyed with the appropriate HIP integrity key ( HIP-lg or HIP-gl ) established when rendezvous registration happened . The HIP " checksum " field MUST be set to zero   and the HIP header length in the HIP common header MUST be calculated not to cover any excluded parameter when the HMAC is calculated . The size of the HMAC is the natural size of the hash computation output depending on the used hash function .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65498 Length 16 Address An IPv6 address or an IPv4-in-IPv6 format IPv4 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65502 Length Variable Address An IPv6 address or an IPv4-in-IPv6 format IPv4 address .
:LABEL: field

name: HIT
description: For any HIP node   its Host Identity ( HI )  the associated Host Identity Tag ( HIT )  and the FQDN of its possible RVSs can be stored in a DNS HIP RR . Any conforming implementation may store a Host Identity ( HI ) and its associated Host Identity Tag ( HIT ) in a DNS HIP RDATA format . HI and HIT are defined in Section 3 of the HIP specification [ RFC5201 ].
:LABEL: field

name: HIT
description: www.example.com . IN HIP ( 2 200100107B1A74DF365639CC39F1D578 AwEAAbdxyhNuSutc5EMzxTs9LBPCIkOFH8cIvM4p 9+LrV4e19WzK00+CI6zBCQTdtWsuxKbWIy87UOoJTwkUs7lBu+Upr1gsNrut79ryra+bSRGQ b1slImA8YVJyuIDsj7kwzG7jnERNqnWxZ48AWkskmdHaVDP4BcelrTI3rMXdXF5D rvs.example.com . )
:LABEL: field

name: HIT
description: www.example.com . IN HIP ( 2 200100107B1A74DF365639CC39F1D578 AwEAAbdxyhNuSutc5EMzxTs9LBPCIkOFH8cIvM4p 9+LrV4e19WzK00+CI6zBCQTdtWsuxKbWIy87UOoJTwkUs7lBu+Upr1gsNrut79ryra+bSRGQ b1slImA8YVJyuIDsj7kwzG7jnERNqnWxZ48AWkskmdHaVDP4BcelrTI3rMXdXF5D rvs1.example.com . rvs2.example.com . )
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: This document defines a generalization of an address called a " locator ". A locator specifies a point-of-attachment to the network but may also include additional end-to-end tunneling or per-host demultiplexing context that affects how packets are handled below the logical HIP sublayer of the stack . This generalization is useful because IP addresses alone may not be sufficient to describe how packets should be handled below HIP . For example   in a host multihoming context   certain IP addresses may need to be associated with certain ESP SPIs to avoid violating the ESP anti-replay window . Addresses may also be affiliated with transport ports in certain tunneling scenarios . Locators may simply be traditional network addresses . The format of the locator fields in the LOCATOR parameter is defined in Section 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Length in octets   excluding Type and Length fields   and excluding padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length in octets   excluding Type and Length fields   and excluding padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Type
description: Traffic Type : Defines whether the locator pertains to HIP signaling   user data   or both .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Type
description: Locator Length : Defines the length of the Locator field   in units of 4-byte words ( Locators up to a maximum of 4*255 octets are supported ).
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Length
description: Locator Length : Defines the length of the Locator field   in units of 4-byte words ( Locators up to a maximum of 4*255 octets are supported ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: P : Preferred locator . Set to one if the locator is preferred for that Traffic Type; otherwise   set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Preferred locator . Set to one if the locator is preferred for that Traffic Type; otherwise   set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Lifetime
description: Locator : The locator whose semantics and encoding are indicated by the Locator Type field . All Locator sub-fields are integral multiples of four octets in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: Locator : The locator whose semantics and encoding are indicated by the Locator Type field . All Locator sub-fields are integral multiples of four octets in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Type
description: The following Traffic Type values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Type
description: The following Locator Type values are defined   along with the associated semantics of the Locator field :
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: The following Locator Type values are defined   along with the associated semantics of the Locator field :
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: A new flag ( P ) is included in the Binding Update message to indicate to the local mobility anchor that the Binding Update message is a proxy registration . The flag MUST be set to the value of 1 for proxy registrations and MUST be set to 0 for direct registrations sent by a mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Handoff Indicator option
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: A new flag ( P ) is included in the Binding Acknowledgement message to indicate that the local mobility anchor that processed the corresponding Proxy Binding Update message supports proxy registrations . The flag is set to a value of 1 only if the corresponding Proxy Binding Update had the Proxy Registration Flag ( P ) set to value of 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Handoff Indicator option
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: An 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the disposition of the Proxy Binding Update . Values of the Status field less than 128 indicate that the Proxy Binding Update was accepted by the local mobility anchor . Values greater than or equal to 128 indicate that the Proxy Binding Update message was rejected by the local mobility anchor . Section 8.9 defines the Status values that can used in Proxy Binding Acknowledgement message .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the type and length fields . This field MUST be set to 18 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This 8-bit field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: This 8-bit field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the prefix length of the IPv6 prefix contained in the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Network Prefix
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the mobile node's IPv6 Home Network Prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: A new option   Handoff Indicator option is defined for use with the Proxy Binding Update and Proxy Binding Acknowledgement messages exchanged between a local mobility anchor and a mobile access gateway . This option is used for exchanging the mobile node's handoff-related hints .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the type and length fields . This field MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This 8-bit field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: R

:LABEL: field

name: H

:LABEL: field

name: HI
description: An 8-bit field that specifies the type of handoff . The values ( 0 - 255 ) will be allocated and managed by IANA . The following values are currently defined .

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the type and length fields . This field MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This 8-bit field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .

name: R

name: Reserved

name: Link-local Address
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the link-local address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length in octets of the option   excluding the type and length fields . The value for this field MUST be set to 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: A 64-bit unsigned integer field containing a timestamp . The value indicates the number of seconds since January 1   1970   00:00 UTC   by using a fixed point format . In this format   the integer number of seconds is contained in the first 48 bits of the field   and the remaining 16 bits indicate the number of 1/65536 fractions of a second .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: The rest of the values in the 16-bit field are reserved . New values can be assigned by Standards Action or IESG approval .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: The rest of the values in the 8-bit field are reserved . New values can be assigned by Standards Action or IESG approval .

name: V

name: PT
description: An RTP profile for a class of applications is expected to assign a payload type for this format   or a dynamically allocated payload type SHOULD be chosen that designates the payload as Vorbis .

name: Ident
description: This 24-bit field is used to associate the Vorbis data to a decoding Configuration . It is stored as a network byte order integer .
:LABEL: field

name: F

:LABEL: field

name: VDT
description: This field specifies the kind of Vorbis data stored in this RTP packet . There are currently three different types of Vorbis payloads . Each packet MUST contain only a single type of Vorbis packet ( e.g .  you must not aggregate configuration and comment packets in the same RTP payload ).
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests . The Identifier field MUST be changed on each Request packet .

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and MUST be ignored on reception .

The National Institute of Standards and Technology ( NIST ) also offers advice on appropriate key sizes in [ SP800-57 ].

name: EAP
description: EAP-AKA is defined in [ RFC4187 ]. The EAP-AKA Session-Id is the concatenation of the EAP Type Code ( 0x17 ) with the contents of the RAND field from the AT_RAND attribute   followed by the contents of the AUTN field in the AT_AUTN attribute :
:LABEL: field

name: EAP
description: EAP-SIM is defined in [ RFC4186 ]. The EAP-SIM Session-Id is the concatenation of the EAP Type Code ( 0x12 ) with the contents of the RAND field from the AT_RAND attribute   followed by the contents of the NONCE_MT field in the AT_NONCE_MT attribute :
:LABEL: field

name: EAP
description: EAP-PSK is defined in [ RFC4764 ]. The EAP-PSK Session-Id is the concatenation of the EAP Type Code ( 0x2F ) with the peer ( RAND_P ) and server ( RAND_S ) nonces :
:LABEL: field

name: EAP

description: RSVD-1 and RSVD-2 Reserved bits   which MUST be set to 0 by the PW endpoint distributing this FEC and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: PT Indicates the value of Payload Type in the RTP header expected by the PW endpoint distributing this FEC . A value of 0 means that the PT value check will not be used for detecting malformed packets .
:LABEL: field

name: FREQ
description: FREQ Frequency of timestamping clock in units of 8 kHz .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: SSRC Indicates the value of the Synchronization source ID ( SSRC ID ) in the RTP header expected by the PW endpoint distributing this FEC . A value of 0 means that the SSRC ID value check will not be used for detecting misconnections . Alternatively   Length can be set to 8 in this case .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet . The Identifier field MUST be the same if an EAP-Initiate packet is retransmitted due to a timeout while waiting for a Finish message . Any new ( non-retransmission ) Initiate message MUST use a new Identifier field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This field indicates that this is an ERP exchange . Two type values are defined in this document for this purpose -- Re-auth-Start ( assigned Type 1 ) and Re-auth ( assigned Type 2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved   MUST be zero . Set to zero on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: SEQ : A 16-bit sequence number is used for replay protection . The SEQ number field is initialized to 0 every time a new rRK is derived .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Tag
description: Authentication Tag : This field contains the integrity checksum over the ERP packet   excluding the authentication tag field itself . The length of the field is indicated by the Cryptosuite .
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: SEQ : A 16-bit sequence number is used for replay protection . The SEQ number field is initialized to 0 every time a new rRK is derived .

name: Authentication Tag

name: A
description: A ( 1 ) the " Acknowledgement Requested " bit . Set to 1 if the ITE wishes to receive an explicit acknowledgement from the ETE .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( 1 ) the " Report Fragmentation " bit . Set to 1 if the ITE wishes to receive a report from the ETE if any IPv4 fragmentation occurs .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M ( 1 ) the " More Segments " bit . Set to 1 if this SEAL protocol packet contains a non-final segment of a multi-segment mid-layer packet .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: RSV ( 2 ) a 2-bit field reserved for future use . Must be set to 0 for the purpose of this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: SEG
description: SEG ( 3 ) a 3-bit segment number . Encodes a segment number between 0 - 7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type A 16-bit field set to 3 . Length A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the value portion in octets . For this TLV   it is always 16 . Value A stable and routable IPv6 address .

description: 19 - Local Interface IPv6 Address ( 16N octets   where N is the number of IPv6 addresses )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type A 16-bit field set to 18 . Length A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the value portion in octets . For this sub-TLV   it is always 8 . Value The neighbor's Interface ID and Router ID .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type A 16-bit field set to 19 . Length A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the value portion in octets . For this sub-TLV   it MUST always be a multiple of 16 octets dependent on the number of IPv6 global addresses advertised . Value A list of one or more local IPv6 interface addresses each consuming 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type A 16-bit field set to 20 . Length A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the value portion in octets . For this sub-TLV   it MUST be a multiple of 16 octets dependent on the number of IPv6 global addresses advertised . Value A variable-length Remote Interface IPv6 Address list .

name: H
description: Handlespace : A cohesive structure of Pool Handles and relations that may be queried by an internal or external agent .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: When set to ' 1 '  this flag indicates that the ENRP server sending this message has rejected the registration . Otherwise   when this flag is set to ' 0 '  this indicates the registration has been granted .

name: Operational Error Parameter
description: Operational Error Parameter ( optional ):
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: When set to ' 1 '  indicates that the ENRP server that sends this message wants to be the Home ENRP server of the receiver of this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Server Identifier
description: Server Identifier : 32 bits ( unsigned integer )
:LABEL: field

name: Server Identifier

name: H
description: At any time   a PE or PU may wish to resolve a handle . This usually will occur when an ASAP Endpoint sends a Pool Handle ( Section 6.5.1 ) to its Home ENRP server or requests a cache population ( Section 6.3 ). It may also occur for other reasons ( e.g .  the internal ASAP PE wishes to know its peers to send a message to all of them ). When an ASAP Endpoint ( PE or PU ) wishes to resolve a pool handle to a list of accessible transport addresses of the member PEs of the pool   it MUST take the following actions :
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Three types of failure may occur when the ASAP Endpoint at either the PE or PU tries to communicate with an ENRP server :
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A ) SCTP send failure
:LABEL: field

description: The ASAP Endpoint   in response   looks up the pool " new-handle " in its local cache   but fails to find it .
:LABEL: field

description: The ASAP Endpoint   in response   looks up the pool " new-handle " in its local cache and finds the mapping information .
:LABEL: field

name: Sending Server's ID
description: This is the ID of the ENRP server that sent this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Receiving Server's ID
description: This is the ID of the ENRP server to which this message is intended . If the message is not intended for an individual server ( e.g .  the message is group-casted to a group of servers )  this field MUST be sent with all 0s . If the message is sent point-to-point   this field MAY be sent with all 0s .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: Set to ' 1 ' if the sender of this message is only requesting information about the PEs owned by the message receiver . Otherwise   set to ' 0 '.
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Set to ' 1 ' if the sender of this message has more pool entries to send in subsequent ENRP_HANDLE_TABLE_RESPONSE messages . Otherwise   set to ' 0 '.
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: MUST be set to ' 1 ' if the sender of this message is rejecting a handlespace request . In this case   pool entries MUST NOT be included . This might happen if the sender of this message is in the middle of initializing its database or is under high load .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Indicates the entire length of the message   including the header   in number of octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Indicates the entire length of the message   including the header   in number of octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Update Action
description: This field indicates the requested action of the specified PE . The field MUST be set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: This flag MUST be set to ' 1 ' if the sender of this message is rejecting a PEER_LIST_REQUEST message . If this case occurs   the message MUST NOT include any Server Information Parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Indicates the entire length of the message in number of octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Targeting Server's ID
description: This is the ID of the peer ENRP that is the target of this takeover attempt .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Type
description: Parameter Type : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The Type field is a 16-bit identifier of the type of parameter . It takes a value of 0 to 65534 . The value of 65535 is reserved for IETF-defined extensions . Values   other than those defined in the specific ENRP parameter description   are reserved by IETF . ( Additional types   when needed   will be defined in the future through appropriate IETF/ IANA procedures .) The Parameter Types are encoded such that the two bits of the highest-order specify the action that must be taken if the processing endpoint does not recognize the Parameter Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The Parameter Length field contains the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Parameter Type   Parameter Length   and Parameter Value fields . Thus   a parameter with a zero-length Parameter Value field would have a Length field of 4 . The total length of a parameter ( including Type   Parameter Length and Value fields ) MUST be a multiple of 4 bytes . If the length of the parameter is not a multiple of 4 bytes   the sender MUST pad the parameter at the end ( i.e .  after the Parameter Value field ) with all zero bytes . The length of this padding is not included in the Parameter Length field . A sender MUST NOT pad with more than 3 bytes . The receiver MUST ignore the padding bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: IPv4 Address : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Contains an IPv4 address . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: IPv6 Address : 128 bits ( unsigned integer ) Contains an IPv6 address . It is binary encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: DCCP Port
description: DCCP Port : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The DCCP port number signed to this DCCP user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: DCCP Service Code
description: DCCP Service Code : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) The DCCP service code signed to this DCCP user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: SCTP Port
description: SCTP Port : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The SCTP port number signed to this SCTP user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: Transport Use
description: Transport Use : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) This field represents how the pool element intends this transport address to be used . The field MUST be populated with one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 or IPv6 Address #1
description: IPv4 or IPv6 Address #1 - #n Each indicates an IPv4 or IPv6 address parameter ( as defined above in Section 3.1 and Section 3.2 ) assigned to this SCTP user transport . An SCTP Transport parameter may have a mixed list of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and at least one IP address parameter MUST be present in an SCTP Transport parameter .
:LABEL: field

name: TCP Port
description: TCP Port : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The TCP port number signed to this TCP user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: UDP Port
description: UDP Port : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The UDP port number signed to this UDP user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: UDP Port
description: UDP Port : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) The UDP-Lite port number signed to this UDP-Lite user transport .
:LABEL: field

name: Policy Type
description: Policy Type : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Specifies the type of selection policy . The values are defined in [ RFC5356 ].
:LABEL: field

name: PE Identifier
description: PE Identifier : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Uniquely identifies the PE in the pool . The PE picks its identifier when it starts up .
:LABEL: field

name: Home ENRP Server Identifier
description: Home ENRP Server Identifier : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Indicates the current Home ENRP server of this PE . Set to all 0s if the PE's Home ENRP server is undetermined .
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Life
description: Registration Life : 32 bits ( signed integer ) Indicates the lifetime of the registration in number of seconds . A value of - 1 indicates infinite lifetime .
:LABEL: field

name: Server ID
description: Server ID : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) This is the ID of the ENRP server   as defined in [ RFC5353 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Server Transport
description: Server Transport : This is an SCTP Transport Parameter   as defined in Section 3.4   that contains the network access address(es )  SCTP port number   etc . of the ENRP server .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Code
description: Cause Code : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) Defines the type of error condition being reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause Length
description: Cause Length : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) Set to the size of the parameter in bytes   including the Cause Code   Cause Length   and Cause-Specific Information fields   but not including any padding at the end of this error cause TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Cookie
description: Cookie : variable length The Cookie is an arbitrary byte string of ( Length - 4 ) bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: PE Identifier
description: PE Identifier : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) Uniquely identifies the PE in the pool . The PE picks its identifier when it starts up . See [ RFC5352 ] for recommendations on PE identifier generation .
:LABEL: field

name: PE Checksum
description: PE Checksum : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) An overall checksum of all PEs in the current handlespace owned by an ENRP server ( which is normally the sender of this TLV ). The definition and calculation of this checksum is defined in [ RFC5353 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Opaque Transport Data
description: Opaque Transport Data : variable length The Opaque Transport Data is an arbitrary byte string of ( Length - 4 ) bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type : 8 bits ( unsigned integer ) This field identifies the type of information contained in the Message Value field . It takes a value from 0 to 254 . The value of 255 is reserved for future use as an extension field . Message Types are encoded such that the two bits of the highest order specify the action that must be taken if the message receiver does not recognize the Message Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) This value represents the size of the message in bytes   including the Message Type   Message Flags   Message Length   and Message Value fields . Therefore   if the Message Value field is zero length   the Length field will be set to 4 . Note   the value in the Message Length field will NOT cover any padding at the end of this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Value
description: Message Value : variable length The Message Value field contains the actual information to be transferred in the message . The usage and format of this field is dependent on the Message Type . The total length of a message ( including Type   Length   and Value fields ) MUST be a multiple of 4 bytes . If the length of the message is not a multiple of 4 bytes   the sender MUST pad the
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: The term load is a value specifying how much a pool element's resources are currently utilized . 0x00000000 states that the pool element is not utilized ( 0 %); 0xffffffff states that it is fully utilized ( 100 %). Defining what utilization means is application - dependent and out of the scope of RSerPool . However   it is required that all pool elements of the same pool using load information have the same definition of load .
:LABEL: field

name: Weight
description: Weight defines a pool element's service capacity relative to other pool elements of the same pool . Theoretically   there is no upper limit for weight values ( although limited by datatype size ). Defining what value weights compare is application-dependent and out of the scope of RSerPool . However   it is required that all pool elements of the same pool using weight information have the same definition of weight .
:LABEL: field

name: Weight
description: o Weight ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Weight constant for the WRR process .
:LABEL: field

name: Weight
description: o Weight ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Weight constant for the WRAND process .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: o Priority ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Larger numbers mean higher priorities .
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: o Load ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Current load of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: o Load ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Current load of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: Load Degradation
description: o Load Degradation ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Load Degradation constant of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: o Load ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Current load of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: Load Degradation
description: o Load Degradation ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Load Degradation constant of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: o Load ( 32 bits   unsigned integer ): Current load of the pool element .
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: o X : If set to 1   the policy is user defined and not standardized . All standards policies reserved by the IETF use X=0 .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o A : If set to 1   the policy is adaptive . Otherwise   it is non - adaptive .
:LABEL: field

name: Policy Number
description: Nine initial policy types have been assigned and are maintained in a new table   " RSerPool Policy Types ":
:LABEL: field

name: tp
description: This field indicates how a JPEG 2000 image is scanned ( progressive or interlace ).
:LABEL: field

name: MHF
description: MHF indicates whether a main header or packet of a main header is in the RTP packet .
:LABEL: field

name: mh_id
description: Main header identification value . This is used for JPEG 2000 main header recovery .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: The T bit indicates whether the tile number field is valid or invalid . A sender MUST set the T bit to 1 when invalid and 0 when valid .
:LABEL: field

name: priority
description: The priority field indicates the importance of the JPEG 2000 packet included in the payload . Typically   a higher priority value is set in the packets containing JPEG 2000 packets that contain the lower sub-bands .
:LABEL: field

name: tile number
description: This field shows the tile number of the payload . This field is only valid when the T bit is 0 . If the T bit is set to 1   the receiver MUST ignore this field .
:LABEL: field

name: fragment offset
description: This value MUST be set to the byte offset of the current payload in relation to the very beginning of each JPEG 2000 codestream ( JPEG 2000 frame ).
:LABEL: field

description: This document is subject to the rights   licenses and restrictions contained in BCP 78   and except as set forth therein   the authors retain all their rights .
:LABEL: field

name: mh_id
description: Main header identification value . This is used for JPEG 2000 main header recovery .
:LABEL: field

name: priority
description: The priority field indicates the importance of the JPEG 2000 packet included in the payload . Typically   a higher priority value is set in the packets containing JPEG 2000 packets containing the lower sub-bands .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: If set to 1   it indicates a MAP registration .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: IPv6 Neighbour Discovery option . Its value is 23 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option and MUST be set to 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Dist
description: A 4-bit unsigned integer identifying the distance between MAP and the receiver of the advertisement   measure in the number of hops and starting from 1 if the MAP is on the same link as the mobile node . A distance value of zero MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Pref
description: The preference field   used as an indicator of operator preference . A 4-bit unsigned integer . A decimal value of 15 indicates the highest preference . When comparing two potential MAPs   the mobile node SHOULD inspect this field as a tie-breaker for MAPs that have equal Dist values .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: When set to 1   it indicates that the mobile node is allocated the RCoA by the MAP based on Section 9 of [ RFC4877 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Valid Lifetime
description: The minimum value ( in seconds ) of both the valid lifetime of the prefix used to form the MAP's address and that used to form the RCoA . This value indicates the validity of the MAP's address and the RCoA .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( 1 bit ): If set to 1   indicates that this ToC entry is followed by another ToC entry; if set to zero   indicates that this ToC entry is the last one in the ToC .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L ( 5 bits ): A field that gives the frame length of each individual frame within the frame-block .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( 2 bits ): Reserved bits . SHALL be set to zero on sending and SHALL be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Padd
description: Padd ( 4 bits ): To ensure octet alignment   4 padding bits SHALL be included at the end of the ToC entry in case there is an odd number of frame-blocks in the group referenced by this ToC entry . These bits SHALL be set to zero and SHALL be ignored by the receiver . If a group containing an even number of frames is referenced by this ToC entry   these padding bits SHALL NOT be included in the payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: Echo Request : The WTP receives an Echo Request message ( Section 6.5 )  to which it MUST respond with an Echo Response ( see Section 6.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The 16-bit length field contains the number of bytes in the Payload . The field is encoded as an unsigned number . If the LWAPP packet is encrypted   the length field includes the Advanced Encryption Standard Counter with CBC-MAC ( AES-CCM ) MIC ( see Section 10.2 for more information ).
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The interpretation of this 16-bit field is binding-specific . Refer to the transport portion of the binding for a wireless technology for the specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Frag ID
description: This field is not used with this transport   and MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery
description: Discovery : LWAPP Discovery messages are used to identify potential ACs   their load and capabilities .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The Message Type field identifies the function of the LWAPP control message . The valid values for a Message Type are the following :
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: The Session ID is a 32-bit unsigned integer that is used to identify the security context for encrypted exchanges between the WTP and the AC . Note that a Session ID is a random value that MUST be unique between a given AC and any of the WTPs with which it may be communicating .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 104 for Vendor Specific
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 7
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor Identifier
description: Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes " [ 13 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Element ID
description: Element ID : A 16-bit Element Identifier that is managed by the vendor .
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery Type
description: The Discovery message element is used to configure a WTP to operate in a specific mode .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 58 for Discovery Type
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery Type
description: Discovery Type : An 8-bit value indicating how the AC was discovered . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 3 for WTP Descriptor
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16
:LABEL: field

name: Hardware Version
description: Hardware Version : A 32-bit integer representing the WTP's hardware version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Software Version
description: Software Version : A 32-bit integer representing the WTP's Firmware version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Boot Version
description: Boot Version : A 32-bit integer representing the WTP's boot loader's version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Max Radios
description: Max Radios : An 8-bit value representing the number of radios ( where each radio is identified via the RID field ) supported by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Encryption Capabilities
description: Encryption Capabilities : This 16-bit field is used by the WTP to communicate its capabilities to the AC . Since most WTPs support link-layer encryption   the AC may make use of these services . There are binding-dependent encryption capabilites . A WTP that does not have any encryption capabilities would set this field to zero ( 0 ). Refer to the specific binding for the specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 4 for WTP Radio Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Radio Type
description: Radio Type : The type of radio present . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 2 for AC Address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 7
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The MAC address of the AC
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 6 for AC Descriptor
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 17
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero
:LABEL: field

name: Hardware Version
description: Hardware Version : A 32-bit integer representing the AC's hardware version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Software Version
description: Software Version : A 32-bit integer representing the AC's Firmware version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Stations
description: Stations : A 16-bit integer representing the number of mobile stations currently associated with the AC .
:LABEL: field

name: Limit
description: Limit : A 16-bit integer representing the maximum number of stations supported by the AC .
:LABEL: field

name: Radios
description: Radios : A 16-bit integer representing the number of WTPs currently attached to the AC .
:LABEL: field

name: Max Radio
description: Max Radio : A 16-bit integer representing the maximum number of WTPs supported by the AC .
:LABEL: field

name: Security
description: Security : An 8-bit bitmask specifying the security schemes supported by the AC . The following values are supported ( see Section 10 ):
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 31 for AC Name
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Name : A variable-length ASCII string containing the AC's name .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 99 for WTP Manager Control IPv4 Address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 6
:LABEL: field

name: IP Address
description: IP Address : The IP address of an interface .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Count
description: WTP Count : The number of WTPs currently connected to the interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 137 for WTP Manager Control IPv6 Address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 6
:LABEL: field

name: IP Address
description: IP Address : The IP address of an interface .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Count
description: WTP Count : The number of WTPs currently connected to the interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery Type
description: The Discovery Type message element is defined in Section 5.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

description: Type : 5 for WTP Name
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : > 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 35 for Location Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : > 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 44 for Certificate
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : > 0
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: The Session ID message element value contains a randomly generated [ 4 ] unsigned 32-bit integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 45 for Session ID
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: Session ID : 32-bit random session identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 18 for Test
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : > 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 111 for XNonce
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce : 1 16-octet random nonce .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code message element value is a 32-bit integer value   indicating the result of the request operation corresponding to the sequence number in the message . The Result Code is included in a successful Join Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 2 for Result Code
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: 0 Success
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The Status message element is sent by the AC to the WTP in a non - successful Join Response message . This message element is used to indicate the reason for the failure and should only be accompanied with a Result Code message element that indicates a failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 60 for Status
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : The Status field indicates the reason for an LWAPP failure . The following values are supported :

description: The Session ID message element is defined in Section 6.1.7 .

name: Echo Request
description: The Echo Request message is a keepalive mechanism for the LWAPP control message .
:LABEL: field

description: The Session ID message element is defined in Section 6.1.7 .

:LABEL: field

description: The Session ID message element is defined in Section 6.1.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 27 for Administrative State
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure . The Radio ID field may also include the value of 0xff   which is used to identify the WTP itself . Therefore   if an AC wishes to change the administrative state of a WTP   it would include 0xff in the Radio ID field .
:LABEL: field

name: Admin State
description: Admin State : An 8-bit value representing the administrative state of the radio . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 90 for AC Name with Index
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 5
:LABEL: field

name: Index
description: Index : The index of the preferred server ( e.g .  1=primary   2=secondary ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 50 for WTP Board Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 26
:LABEL: field

name: Card ID
description: Card ID : A hardware identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Card Revision
description: Card Revision : 4-byte Revision of the card .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Model
description: WTP Model : 8-byte WTP Model Number .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A 4-byte reserved field that MUST be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Ethernet MAC Address
description: Ethernet MAC Address : MAC address of the WTP's Ethernet interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: The Statistics Timer message element value is used by the AC to inform the WTP of the frequency that it expects to receive updated statistics .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 37 for Statistics Timer
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: Statistics Timer : A 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the time   in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 82 for WTP Static IP Address Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 13
:LABEL: field

name: IP Address
description: IP Address : The IP address to assign to the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Netmask
description: Netmask : The IP Netmask .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway
description: Gateway : The IP address of the gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Netmask
description: Netmask : The IP Netmask .
:LABEL: field

name: Static
description: Static : An 8-bit Boolean stating whether or not the WTP should use a static IP address . A value of zero disables the static IP address   while a value of one enables it .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 67 for WTP Reboot Statistics
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 7
:LABEL: field

name: Crash Count
description: Crash Count : The number of reboots that have occurred due to a WTP crash .
:LABEL: field

name: LWAPP Initiated Count
description: LWAPP Initiated Count : The number of reboots that have occurred at the request of some LWAPP message   such as a change in configuration that required a reboot or an explicit LWAPP reset request .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Failure Count
description: Link Failure Count : The number of times that an LWAPP connection with an AC has failed .
:LABEL: field

name: Failure Type
description: Failure Type : The last WTP failure . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 38 for Decryption Error Report Period
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 3
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier : typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Report Interval
description: Report Interval : A 16-bit   unsigned integer indicating the time   in seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 26 for Change State Event
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 3
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier : typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: State
description: State : An 8-bit Boolean value representing the state of the radio . A value of one disables the radio   while a value of two enables it .
:LABEL: field

name: Cause
description: Cause : In the event of a radio being inoperable   the Cause field would contain the reason the radio is out of service . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 68 for LWAPP Timers
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery
description: Discovery : The number of seconds between LWAPP Discovery packets when the WTP is in the discovery mode .
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: Echo Request : The number of seconds between WTP Echo Request LWAPP messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 91 for WTP Fallback
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : The 8-bit Boolean value indicates the status of automatic LWAPP fallback on the WTP . A value of zero disables the fallback feature   while a value of one enables it . When enabled   if the WTP detects that its primary AC is available   and it is not connected to it   it SHOULD automatically disconnect from its current AC and reconnect to its primary . If disabled   the WTP will only reconnect to its primary through manual intervention ( e.g .  through the Reset Request command ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 97 for Idle Timeout
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Timeout
description: Timeout : The current idle timeout to be enforced by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: The Statistics Timer message element is defined in Section 7.2.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 65 for Add Blacklist Entry
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 7
:LABEL: field

name: Num of Entries
description: Num of Entries : The number of MAC addresses in the array .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : An array of MAC addresses to add to the blacklist entry .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 66 for Delete Blacklist Entry
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

description: Num of Entries : The number of MAC addresses in the array .

name: MAC Address

name: Type
description: Type : 70 for Delete Blacklist Entry
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Num of Entries
description: Num of Entries : The number of MAC addresses in the array .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : An array of MAC addresses to add to the permanent blacklist entry .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 71 for Delete Blacklist Entry
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 7
:LABEL: field

name: Num of Entries
description: Num of Entries : The number of MAC addresses in the array .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : An array of MAC addresses to delete from the static blacklist entry .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code message element is defined in Section 6.2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Image Data
description: The Image Data message element is present when sent by the AC and contains the following fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 33 for Image Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 5
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: Opcode : An 8-bit value representing the transfer opcode . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : A 16-bit value containing a checksum of the Image Data that follows .
:LABEL: field

name: Image Data
description: Image Data : The Image Data field contains 1024 characters   unless the payload being sent is the last one ( end of file ).
:LABEL: field

description: Type : 39 for Decryption Error Report
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 8
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .

description: Num Of Entries : An 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the number of mobile MAC addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile MAC Address
description: Mobile MAC Address : An array of mobile station MAC addresses that have caused decryption errors .
:LABEL: field

description: The Result Code message element is defined in Section 6.2.1 .

name: E
description: o E-x{Kpub   M } - RSA encryption of M using X's public key .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The interpretation of this 16-bit field depends on the direction of transmission of the packet . Refer to the figure in Section 3.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: When an LWAPP packet is transmitted from a WTP to an AC   this field is called the Status field and indicates radio resource information associated with the frame . When the message is an LWAPP control message this field is transmitted as zero .
:LABEL: field

name: RSSI
description: RSSI : RSSI is a signed   8-bit value . It is the received signal strength indication   in dBm .
:LABEL: field

name: SNR
description: SNR : SNR is a signed   8-bit value . It is the signal-to-noise ratio of the received IEEE 802.11 frame   in dB .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 29 for Add Mobile
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 36
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio .
:LABEL: field

name: Association ID
description: Association ID : A 16-bit value specifying the 802.11 Association Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The mobile station's MAC address .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : The 1-bit field is set by the AC to inform the WTP that it MUST NOT accept any 802.11 data frames   other than 802.1X frames . This is the equivalent of the WTP's 802.1X port for the mobile station to be in the closed state . When set   the WTP MUST drop any non-802.1X packets it receives from the mobile station .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : The 1-bit field is set by the AC to inform the WTP that encryption services will be provided by the AC . When set   the WTP SHOULD police frames received from stations to ensure that they comply to the stated encryption policy   but does not need to take specific cryptographic action on the frame . Similarly   for transmitted frames   the WTP only needs to forward already encrypted frames .
:LABEL: field

name: Encryption Policy
description: Encryption Policy : The policy field informs the WTP how to handle packets from/to the mobile station . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Capabilities
description: Capabilities : A 16-bit field containing the 802.11 capabilities to use with the mobile .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: WME Mode
description: WME Mode : An 8-bit Boolean used to identify whether the station is WME capable . A value of zero is used to indicate that the station is not Wireless Multimedia Extension ( WME ) capable   while a value of one means that the station is WME capable .
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: QoS : An 8-bit value specifying the QoS policy to enforce for the station . The following values are supported : PRC : TO CHECK
:LABEL: field

name: Supported Rates
description: Supported Rates : The supported rates to be used with the mobile station .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 105 for IEEE 802.11 Mobile Session Key
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 11

:LABEL: field

description: QoS Profile : An 8-bit value specifying the QoS policy to enforce for the station . The following values are supported :

description: DSCP Tag : The DSCP label to use if packets are to be DSCP tagged .

:LABEL: field

description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio .
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio .
:LABEL: field

name: Tx Fragment Count
description: Tx Fragment Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of fragmented frames transmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Tx Count
description: Multicast Tx Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of multicast frames transmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Failed Count
description: Failed Count : A 32-bit value representing the transmit excessive retries .
:LABEL: field

name: Retry Count
description: Retry Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of transmit retries .
:LABEL: field

name: Multiple Retry Count
description: Multiple Retry Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of transmits that required more than one retry .
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Duplicate Count
description: Frame Duplicate Count : A 32-bit value representing the duplicate frames received .
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Success Count
description: RTS Success Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of successfully transmitted Ready To Send ( RTS ).
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Failure Count
description: RTS Failure Count : A 32-bit value representing the failed transmitted RTS .
:LABEL: field

name: ACK Failure Count
description: ACK Failure Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of failed acknowledgements .
:LABEL: field

name: Rx Fragment Count
description: Rx Fragment Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of fragmented frames received .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast RX Count
description: Multicast RX Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of multicast frames received .
:LABEL: field

name: FCS Error Count
description: FCS Error Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of Frame Check Sequence ( FCS ) failures .
:LABEL: field

name: Decryption Errors
description: Decryption Errors : A 32-bit value representing the number of Decryption errors that occurred on the WTP . Note that this field is only valid in cases where the WTP provides encryption/ decryption services .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 7 for IEEE 802.11 Add WLAN
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 298
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN Capability
description: WLAN Capability : A 16-bit value containing the capabilities to be advertised by the WTP within the Probe and Beacon messages .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : A 16-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Encryption Policy
description: Encryption Policy : A 32-bit value specifying the encryption scheme to apply to traffic to and from the mobile station .
:LABEL: field

name: Shared Key
description: Shared Key : A 1-byte Boolean that specifies whether the key included in the Key field is a shared WEP key . A value of zero is used to state that the key is not a shared WEP key   while a value of one is used to state that the key is a shared WEP key .
:LABEL: field

name: WPA Data Len
description: WPA Data Len : Length of the WPA Information Element ( IE ).
:LABEL: field

name: RSN Data Len
description: RSN Data Len : Length of the Robust Security Network ( RSN ) IE .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A 49-byte reserved field   which MUST be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: WME Data Len
description: WME Data Len : Length of the WME IE .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: Auth Type : An 8-bit value specifying the station's authentication type .
:LABEL: field

name: Broadcast SSID
description: Broadcast SSID : A Boolean indicating whether the SSID is to be broadcast by the WTP . A value of zero disables SSID broadcast   while a value of one enables it .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A 40-byte reserved field .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: WLAN Capability
description: WLAN Capability : A 16-bit value containing the capabilities to be advertised by the WTP within the Probe and Beacon messages .

:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : This 8-bit unsigned integer includes the WLAN Identifier   on which the MIC failure occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The MAC address of the mobile station that caused the MIC failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 95 for WTP Radio Fail Alarm Indication
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The type of radio failure detected . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : An 8-bit Boolean indicating whether the radio failure is being reported or cleared . A value of zero is used to clear the event   while a value of one is used to report the event .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad
description: Pad : Reserved field MUST be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 8 for IEEE 802.11 WTP WLAN Radio Configuration
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 20
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero
:LABEL: field

name: Occupancy Limit
description: Occupancy Limit : This attribute indicates the maximum amount of time   in Time Units ( TUs )  that a point coordinator MAY control the usage of the wireless medium without relinquishing control for long enough to allow at least one instance of Distributed Coordination Function ( DCF ) access to the medium . The default value of this attribute SHOULD be 100   and the maximum value SHOULD be 1000 .
:LABEL: field

name: CFP Maximum Duration
description: CFP Maximum Duration : The attribute describes the maximum duration of the CFP in TU that MAY be generated by the Point Coordination Function ( PCF ).
:LABEL: field

name: BSSID
description: BSSID : The WLAN Radio's base MAC address . For WTPs that support more than a single WLAN   the value of the WLAN Identifier is added to the last octet of the BSSID . Therefore   a WTP that supports 16 WLANs MUST have 16 MAC addresses reserved for it   and the last nibble is used to represent the WLAN ID .
:LABEL: field

name: Beacon Period
description: Beacon Period : This attribute specifies the number of TUs that a station uses for scheduling Beacon transmissions . This value is transmitted in Beacon and Probe Response frames .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 16 for IEEE 802.11 Rate Set
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure .
:LABEL: field

name: Rate Set
description: Rate Set : The AC generates the Rate Set that the WTP is to include in its Beacon and Probe messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 10 for IEEE 802.11 Multi-Domain Capability
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: First Channel #: This attribute indicates the value of the lowest channel number in the subband for the associated domain country string .
:LABEL: field

name: First Channel #
description: First Channel #: This attribute indicates the value of the lowest channel number in the subband for the associated domain country string .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Channels
description: Number of Channels : This attribute indicates the value of the total number of channels allowed in the subband for the associated domain country string .
:LABEL: field

name: Max Tx Power Level
description: Max Tx Power Level : This attribute indicates the maximum transmit power   in dBm   allowed in the subband for the associated domain country string .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 11 for IEEE 802.11 MAC Operation
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Threshold
description: RTS Threshold : This attribute indicates the number of octets in a Management Protocol Data Unit ( MPDU )  below which an RTS/CTS ( clear to send ) handshake MUST NOT be performed . An RTS/CTS handshake MUST be performed at the beginning of any frame exchange sequence where the MPDU is of type Data or Management   the MPDU has an individual address in the Address1 field   and the length of the MPDU is greater than this threshold . Setting this attribute to be larger than the maximum MAC Service Data Unit ( MSDU ) size MUST have the effect of turning off the RTS/CTS handshake for frames of Data or Management type transmitted by this Station ( STA ). Setting this attribute to zero MUST have the effect of
:LABEL: field

name: Short Retry
description: Short Retry : This attribute indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame   the length of which is less than or equal to RTSThreshold   that MUST be made before a failure condition is indicated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Long Retry
description: Long Retry : This attribute indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame   the length of which is greater than dot11RTSThreshold   that MUST be made before a failure condition is indicated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragmentation Threshold
description: Fragmentation Threshold : This attribute specifies the current maximum size   in octets   of the MPDU that MAY be delivered to the PHY . An MSDU MUST be broken into fragments if its size exceeds the value of this attribute after adding MAC headers and trailers . An MSDU or MAC Management Protocol Data Unit ( MMPDU ) MUST be fragmented when the resulting frame has an individual address in the Address1 field   and the length of the frame is larger than this threshold . The default value for this attribute MUST be the lesser of 2346 or the aMPDUMaxLength of the attached PHY and MUST never exceed the lesser of 2346 or the aMPDUMaxLength of the attached PHY . The value of this attribute MUST never be less than 256 .
:LABEL: field

name: Tx MSDU Lifetime
description: Tx MSDU Lifetime : This attribute specifies the elapsed time in TU   after the initial transmission of an MSDU   after which   further attempts to transmit the MSDU MUST be terminated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 512 .
:LABEL: field

name: Rx MSDU Lifetime
description: Rx MSDU Lifetime : This attribute specifies the elapsed time   in TU   after the initial reception of a fragmented MMPDU or MSDU   after which   further attempts to reassemble the MMPDU or MSDU MUST be terminated . The default value MUST be 512 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type

:LABEL: field

description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero

description: Current Tx Power : This attribute contains the transmit output power in mW .

description: TI Threshold : The threshold being used to detect a busy medium ( frequency ). CCA MUST report a busy medium upon detecting the RSSI above this threshold .

name: Length

:LABEL: field

description: 1 - Enabled ( may only be true if the antenna can be used as a receive antenna )
:LABEL: field

name: Combiner
description: Combiner : An 8-bit value specifying the combiner selection . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The type field is not currently used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 51 for IEEE 802.11 Broadcast Probe Mode
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : An 8-bit Boolean indicating the status of whether a WTP shall respond to a NULL SSID Probe request . A value of zero disables the NULL SSID Probe response   while a value of one enables it .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 12
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 12
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Tag Packets
description: Tag Packets : A value indicating whether LWAPP packets should be tagged for QoS purposes . The following values are currently supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Queue Depth
description: Queue Depth : The number of packets that can be on the specific QoS transmit queue at any given time .
:LABEL: field

name: CWMin
description: CWMin : The Contention Window minimum value for the QoS transmit queue .
:LABEL: field

name: CWMax
description: CWMax : The Contention Window maximum value for the QoS transmit queue .
:LABEL: field

name: AIFS
description: AIFS : The Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing to use for the QoS transmit queue .
:LABEL: field

name: CBR
description: CBR : The Constant Bit Rate ( CBR ) value to observe for the QoS transmit queue .
:LABEL: field

name: Dot1P Tag
description: Dot1P Tag : The 802.1P precedence value to use if packets are to be 802.1P tagged .
:LABEL: field

name: DSCP Tag
description: DSCP Tag : The DSCP label to use if packets are to be DSCP tagged .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 79 for IEEE 802.11 MIC Error Report From Mobile
:LABEL: field

description: Length : 14
:LABEL: field

description: Client MAC Address : The Client MAC address of the station reporting the MIC failure .
:LABEL: field

name: BSSID
description: BSSID : The BSSID on which the MIC failure is being reported .

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .

name: WLAN ID

:LABEL: field

name: Maj
description: Min ( 4 bits ): the minor number of the SLAPP version
:LABEL: field

name: Min
description: Min ( 4 bits ): the minor number of the SLAPP version
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( two octets ): the length of the SLAPP message   including the entire SLAPP header
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( two octets ): the length of the SLAPP message   including the entire SLAPP header
:LABEL: field

name: Transaction ID
description: The transaction ID is a randomly generated   32-bit number that is maintained during one phase of the SLAPP discovery process . It is generated by a WTP starting a discovery process . When one discovery method fails to find an AC and the WTP attempts another discovery
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Identifier
description: This field allows the WTP to specify a unique identifier for itself . This MAY be   for instance   its 48-bit MAC address or it could be any other string such as a serial number .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field is used to indicate certain things about the discover request . For example   bit 0 in the Flags field indicates whether the discover request packet is being sent to the AC   if unicast   based on a configuration at the WTP or based on some other means of discovery . This bit should always be set to the discover mode if the SLAPP discover request packet is being sent to either a broadcast or multicast address . Here are the valid values for various bits in the Flags field .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Vendor ID
description: This 32-bit field is the WTP vendor's Structure of Management Information ( SMI ) enterprise code in network octet order ( these enterprise codes can be obtained from   and registered with   IANA ).
:LABEL: field

name: WTP HW Version
description: This 32-bit field indicates the version of hardware present in the WTP . This is a number that is totally left to the WTP vendor to choose .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP SW Version
description: This 32-bit field indicates the version of software present in the WTP . This is a number that is totally left to the WTP vendor to choose .
:LABEL: field

name: Transaction ID
description: The value of the Transaction ID field should be identical to its value in the SLAPP discover request packet sent by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP Identifier
description: The WTP Identifier that was sent in the corresponding SLAPP discover request frame .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: This field is unused by this version of SLAPP . It MUST be set to zero ( 0 ) on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: AC HW Version
description: If the value of the Status field is 1   then this 32-bit field contains the value of the AC's hardware version . This value is chosen by the AC vendor . If the value of the Status field is not 1   then this field should be set to 0 by the AC and ignored by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: AC SW Version
description: If the value of the Status field is 1   then this 32-bit field contains the value of the AC's software version . This value is chosen by the AC vendor . If the value of the Status field is not 1   then this field should be set to 0 by the AC and ignored by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

description: 4 : De-Registration Response - sent by the recipient of the corresponding request
:LABEL: field

description: 9 : Status Request - sent by the AC to the WTP
:LABEL: field

name: Information Elements
description: Information elements ( IEs ) are used to communicate capability   configuration   status   and statistics information between the AC and the WTP .
:LABEL: field
