name: RESERVED
description: RESERVED : Unused in this version of SLAPP   MUST be zero ( 0 ) on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : The " More " bit indicating that the current packet is not the final one .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : The " Request " bit . This bit MUST be set to one ( 1 ) when the packet is the response to a request and zero ( 0 ) otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: packet sequence number
description: packet sequence number : A monotonically increasing counter that assigns a unique number to each slice of the image .
:LABEL: field

name: image data slice
description: image data slice : A portion of the bootable image .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: RESERVED : Unused in this version of SLAPP   MUST be zero on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : The " More " bit . This MUST be equal to the one ( 1 ) when negatively acknowledging a missed packet and set to zero ( 0 ) when indicating the end of the Image Download protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: packet sequence number : The packet sequence number of the missing image data slice .
:LABEL: field

name: packet sequence number
description: packet sequence number : The packet sequence number of the missing image data slice .
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: Echo Request : The WTP sends an Echo Request message ( Section 7.1 ) or receives the corresponding Echo Response message   ( see Section 7.2 ) from the AC . When the WTP receives the Echo Response   it resets its EchoInterval timer ( see Section 4.7.7 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: Echo Request : The AC receives an Echo Request message ( see Section 7.1 )  to which it MUST respond with an Echo Response message ( see Section 7.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: CAPWAP Preamble
description: The CAPWAP preamble is common to all CAPWAP transport headers and is used to identify the header type that immediately follows . The reason for this preamble is to avoid needing to perform byte comparisons in order to guess whether or not the frame is DTLS encrypted . It also provides an extensibility framework that can be used to support additional transport types . The format of the preamble is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version : A 4-bit field that contains the version of CAPWAP used in this packet . The value for this specification is zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : A 4-bit field that specifies the payload type that follows the UDP header . The following values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: CAPWAP Preamble
description: CAPWAP Preamble : The CAPWAP Preamble is defined in Section 4.1 . The CAPWAP Preamble's Payload Type field MUST be set to one ( 1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The 24-bit field is reserved for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: CAPWAP Preamble
description: CAPWAP Preamble : The CAPWAP Preamble is defined in Section 4.1 . The CAPWAP Preamble's Payload Type field MUST be set to zero ( 0 ). If the CAPWAP DTLS Header is present   the version number in both CAPWAP Preambles MUST match . The reason for this duplicate field is to avoid any possible tampering of the version field in the preamble that is not encrypted or authenticated .
:LABEL: field

name: HLEN
description: HLEN : A 5-bit field containing the length of the CAPWAP transport header in 4-byte words ( similar to IP header length ). This length includes the optional headers .
:LABEL: field

name: RID
description: RID : A 5-bit field that contains the Radio ID number for this packet   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 . Given that MAC Addresses are not necessarily unique across physical radios in a WTP   the Radio Identifier ( RID ) field is used to indicate with which physical radio the message is associated .
:LABEL: field

name: WBID
description: WBID : A 5-bit field that is the wireless binding identifier . The identifier will indicate the type of wireless packet associated with the radio . The following values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : The Type ' T ' bit indicates the format of the frame being transported in the payload . When this bit is set to one ( 1 )  the payload has the native frame format indicated by the WBID field . When this bit is zero ( 0 )  the payload is an IEEE 802.3 frame .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : The Fragment ' F ' bit indicates whether this packet is a fragment . When this bit is one ( 1 )  the packet is a fragment and MUST be combined with the other corresponding fragments to reassemble the complete information exchanged between the WTP and AC .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The Last ' L ' bit is valid only if the ' F ' bit is set and indicates whether the packet contains the last fragment of a fragmented exchange between WTP and AC . When this bit is one ( 1 )  the packet is the last fragment . When this bit is ( zero ) 0   the packet is not the last fragment .
:LABEL: field

name: W
description: W : The Wireless ' W ' bit is used to specify whether the optional Wireless Specific Information field is present in the header . A value of one ( 1 ) is used to represent the fact that the optional header is present .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : The Radio MAC ' M ' bit is used to indicate that the Radio MAC Address optional header is present . This is used to communicate the MAC address of the receiving radio .
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: K : The Keep-Alive ' K ' bit indicates the packet is a Data Channel Keep-Alive packet . This packet is used to map the data channel to the control channel for the specified Session ID and to maintain freshness of the data channel . The ' K ' bit MUST NOT be set for data packets containing user data .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : A set of reserved bits for future flags in the CAPWAP Header . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment ID
description: Fragment ID : A 16-bit field whose value is assigned to each group of fragments making up a complete set . The Fragment ID space is managed individually for each direction for every WTP/AC pair . The value of Fragment ID is incremented with each new set of fragments . The Fragment ID wraps to zero after the maximum value has been used to identify a set of fragments .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The 3-bit field is reserved for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the MAC address field . The formats and lengths specified in [ EUI-48 ] and [ EUI-64 ] are supported .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: Wireless Specific Information : This optional field contains technology-specific information that may be used to carry per - packet wireless information . This field is only present if the ' W ' bit is set . The WBID field in the CAPWAP Header is used to identify the format of the Wireless-Specific Information optional field . The HLEN field assumes 4-byte alignment   and this field MUST be padded with zeroes ( 0x00 ) if it is not 4-byte aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The 8-bit field contains the length of the data field   with a maximum size of 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Element Length
description: Message Element Length : The 16-bit Length field indicates the number of bytes following the CAPWAP Header   with a maximum size of 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: Session ID   see Section 4.6.37 .
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery
description: Discovery : CAPWAP Discovery messages are used to identify potential ACs   their load and capabilities .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The Message Type field identifies the function of the CAPWAP Control message . To provide extensibility   the Message Type field is comprised of an IANA Enterprise Number [ RFC3232 ] and an enterprise - specific message type number . The first three octets contain the IANA Enterprise Number in network byte order   with zero used for CAPWAP base protocol ( this specification ) defined message types . The last octet is the enterprise-specific message type number   which has a range from 0 to 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Element Length
description: The Length field indicates the number of bytes following the Sequence Number field .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 43 WTP MAC Type 44 WTP Name 45 Unused/Reserved 46 WTP Radio Statistics 47 WTP Reboot Statistics 48 WTP Static IP Address Information 49
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1 for AC Descriptor
:LABEL: field

name: Length

:LABEL: field

name: Stations

:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Active WTPs
description: Active WTPs : The number of WTPs currently attached to the AC

name: Security
description: Security : An 8-bit mask specifying the authentication credential type supported by the AC ( see Section 2.4.4 ). The field has the following format :

All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .

name: R

:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R-MAC Field : The AC supports the optional Radio MAC Address field in the CAPWAP transport header ( see Section 4.3 ). The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: DTLS Policy
description: DTLS Policy : The AC communicates its policy on the use of DTLS for the CAPWAP data channel . The AC MAY communicate more than one supported option   represented by the bit field below . The WTP MUST abide by one of the options communicated by AC . The field has the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : DTLS-Enabled Data Channel Supported
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Clear Text Data Channel Supported
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : A reserved bit for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: AC Information Vendor Identifier
description: AC Information Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " Structure of Management Information ( SMI ) Network Management Private Enterprise Codes ".
:LABEL: field

name: AC Information Type
description: AC Information Type : Vendor-specific encoding of AC information in the UTF-8 format [ RFC3629 ]. The following enumerated values are supported . Both the Hardware and Software Version sub - elements MUST be included in the AC Descriptor message element . The values listed below are used in conjunction with the AC Information Vendor Identifier field   whose value MUST be set to zero ( 0 ). This field   combined with the AC Information Vendor Identifier set to a non-zero ( 0 ) value   allows vendors to use a private namespace .
:LABEL: field

name: AC Information Length
description: AC Information Length : Length of vendor-specific encoding of AC information   with a maximum size of 1024 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 2 for AC IPv4 List
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 4
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 3 for AC IPV6 List
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 16
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 4 for AC Name
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 for AC Name with Priority
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 2
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: Priority : A value between 1 and 255 specifying the priority order of the preferred AC . For instance   the value of one ( 1 ) is used to set the primary AC   the value of two ( 2 ) is used to set the secondary   etc .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 6 for AC Timestamp
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp : The AC's current time   allowing all of the WTPs to be time synchronized in the format defined by Network Time Protocol ( NTP ) in RFC 1305 [ RFC1305 ]. Only the most significant 32 bits of the NTP time are included in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: Echo Request : The number of seconds between WTP Echo Request CAPWAP messages . This value is used to configure the EchoInterval timer ( see Section 4.7.7 ). The AC sets its EchoInterval timer to this value   plus the maximum retransmission time as described in Section 4.5.3 .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : The status of the duplicate IP address . The value MUST be set to 1 when a duplicate address is detected   and 0 when the duplicate address has been cleared .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the MAC Address field . The formats and lengths specified in [ EUI-48 ] and [ EUI-64 ] are supported .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The MAC address of the offending device .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 22 for Duplicate IPv6 Address
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 24
:LABEL: field

name: IP Address
description: IP Address : The IP address currently used by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : The status of the duplicate IP address . The value MUST be set to 1 when a duplicate address is detected   and 0 when the duplicate address has been cleared .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the MAC Address field . The formats and lengths specified in [ EUI-48 ] and [ EUI-64 ] are supported .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The MAC address of the offending device .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 23 for Idle Timeout
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Timeout
description: Timeout : The current Idle Timeout   in seconds   to be enforced by the WTP . The default value for this message element is specified in Section 4.7.8 .
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: The ECN Support message element is sent by both the WTP and the AC to indicate their support for the Explicit Congestion Notification ( ECN ) bits   as defined in [ RFC3168 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 53 for ECN Support
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: ECN Support : An 8-bit value representing the sender's support for ECN   as defined in [ RFC3168 ]. All CAPWAP Implementations MUST support the Limited ECN Support mode . Full ECN Support is used if both the WTP and AC advertise the capability for " Full and Limited ECN " Support; otherwise   Limited ECN Support is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 24 for Image Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: Data Type
description: Data Type : An 8-bit value representing the image Data Type . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 25 for Image Identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 5
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor Identifier
description: Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes ".
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 26 for Image Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 20
:LABEL: field

name: File Size
description: File Size : A 32-bit value containing the size of the file   in bytes   that will be transferred by the AC to the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Hash
description: Hash : A 16-octet MD5 hash of the image using the procedures defined in [ RFC1321 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 27 for Initiate Download
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 28 for Location Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Message Length
description: The Maximum Message Length message element is included in the Join Request message by the WTP to indicate the maximum CAPWAP message length that it supports to the AC . The Maximum Message Length message element is optionally included in Join Response message by the AC to indicate the maximum CAPWAP message length that it supports to the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 29 for Maximum Message Length
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Message Length
description: Maximum Message Length A 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the maximum message length .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 52 for MTU Discovery Padding
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 31 for Radio Administrative State
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 . The Radio ID field MAY also include the value of 0xff   which is used to identify the WTP . If an AC wishes to change the administrative state of a WTP   it includes 0xff in the Radio ID field .
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 . The Radio ID field MAY also include the value of 0xff   which is used to identify the WTP . If an AC wishes to change the administrative state of a WTP   it includes 0xff in the Radio ID field .
:LABEL: field

name: Admin State
description: Admin State : An 8-bit value representing the administrative state of the radio . The default value for the Admin State field is listed in Section 4.8.1 . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 32 for Radio Operational State
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 3
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier refers to an interface index on the WTP   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 . A value of 0xFF is invalid   as it is not possible to change the WTP's operational state .
:LABEL: field

name: State
description: State : An 8-bit Boolean value representing the state of the radio . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Cause
description: Cause : When a radio is inoperable   the cause field contains the reason the radio is out of service . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code message element value is a 32-bit integer value   indicating the result of the Request message corresponding to the sequence number included in the Response message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 33 for Result Code
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: 0 Success
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 34 for Returned Message Element
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 6
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: Reason : The reason the configuration in the offending message element could not be applied by the WTP . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the Message Element field   which MUST NOT exceed 255 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: The Session ID message element value contains a randomly generated unsigned 128-bit integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 35 for Session ID
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: Session ID : A 128-bit unsigned integer used as a random session identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: The Statistics Timer message element value is used by the AC to inform the WTP of the frequency with which it expects to receive updated statistics .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 36 for Statistics Timer
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: Statistics Timer : A 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the time   in seconds . The default value for this timer is specified in Section 4.7.14 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 37 for Vendor Specific Payload
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes " [ RFC3232 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor Identifier
description: Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes " [ RFC3232 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Element ID
description: Element ID : A 16-bit Element Identifier that is managed by the vendor .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 38 for WTP Board Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 14
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor Identifier
description: Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes "  identifying the WTP hardware manufacturer . The Vendor Identifier field MUST NOT be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Board Data Type
description: Board Data Type : The Board Data Type field identifies the data being encoded . The CAPWAP protocol defines the following values   and each of these types identify whether their presence is mandatory or optional :
:LABEL: field

name: Board Data Length
description: Board Data Length : The length of the data in the Board Data Value field   whose length MUST NOT exceed 1024 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 39 for WTP Descriptor
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Max Radios : An 8-bit value representing the number of radios ( where each radio is identified via the Radio ID field ) supported by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Max Radios
description: Max Radios : An 8-bit value representing the number of radios ( where each radio is identified via the Radio ID field ) supported by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Radios in use
description: Radios in use : An 8-bit value representing the number of radios in use in the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Encrypt
description: Num Encrypt : The number of 3-byte Encryption sub-elements that follow this field . The value of the Num Encrypt field MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd : The 3-bit field is reserved for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: WBID
description: WBID : A 5-bit field that is the wireless binding identifier . The identifier will indicate the type of wireless packet associated with the radio . The WBIDs defined in this specification can be found in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Encryption Capabilities
description: Encryption Capabilities : This 16-bit field is used by the WTP to communicate its capabilities to the AC . A WTP that does not have any encryption capabilities sets this field to zero ( 0 ). Refer to the specific wireless binding for further specification of the Encryption Capabilities field .
:LABEL: field

name: Descriptor Vendor Identifier
description: Descriptor Vendor Identifier : A 32-bit value containing the IANA-assigned " SMI Network Management Private Enterprise Codes ".
:LABEL: field

name: Descriptor Type
description: Descriptor Type : The Descriptor Type field identifies the data being encoded . The format of the data is vendor-specific encoded in the UTF-8 format [ RFC3629 ]. The CAPWAP protocol defines the following values   and each of these types identify whether their presence is mandatory or optional . The values listed below are used in conjunction with the Descriptor Vendor Identifier field   whose value MUST be set to zero ( 0 ). This field   combined with the Descriptor Vendor Identifier set to a non-zero ( 0 ) value   allows vendors to use a private namespace .
:LABEL: field

name: Descriptor Length
description: Descriptor Length : Length of the vendor-specific encoding of the Descriptor Data field   whose length MUST NOT exceed 1024 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 40 for WTP Fallback
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode : The 8-bit value indicates the status of automatic CAPWAP fallback on the WTP . When enabled   if the WTP detects that its primary AC is available   and that the WTP is not connected to the primary AC   the WTP SHOULD automatically disconnect from its current AC and reconnect to its primary AC . If disabled   the WTP will only reconnect to its primary AC through manual intervention ( e.g .  through the Reset Request message ). The default value for this field is specified in Section 4.8.9 . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 41 for WTP Frame Tunnel Mode
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Reservd
description: Reservd : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : Native Frame Tunnel mode requires the WTP and AC to encapsulate all user payloads as native wireless frames   as defined by the wireless binding ( see for example Section 4.4 )
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : The 802.3 Frame Tunnel Mode requires the WTP and AC to encapsulate all user payload as native IEEE 802.3 frames ( see Section 4.4 ). All user traffic is tunneled to the AC . This value MUST NOT be used when the WTP MAC Type is set to Split MAC .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : When Local Bridging is used   the WTP does not tunnel user traffic to the AC; all user traffic is locally bridged . This value MUST NOT be used when the WTP MAC Type is set to Split MAC .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : A reserved bit for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: MAC Type : The MAC mode of operation supported by the WTP . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 45 for WTP Name
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : >= 1
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 47 for WTP Radio Statistics
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 20
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The radio ID of the radio to which the statistics apply   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Last Failure Type
description: Last Failure Type : The last WTP failure . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Reset Count
description: Reset Count : The number of times that the radio has been reset .
:LABEL: field

name: SW Failure Count
description: SW Failure Count : The number of times that the radio has failed due to software-related reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: HW Failure Count
description: HW Failure Count : The number of times that the radio has failed due to hardware-related reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Other Failure Count
description: Other Failure Count : The number of times that the radio has failed due to known reasons   other than software or hardware failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Unknown Failure Count
description: Unknown Failure Count : The number of times that the radio has failed for unknown reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Config Update Count
description: Config Update Count : The number of times that the radio configuration has been updated .
:LABEL: field

name: Channel Change Count
description: Channel Change Count : The number of times that the radio channel has been changed .
:LABEL: field

name: Current Noise Floor
description: Current Noise Floor : A signed integer that indicates the noise floor of the radio receiver in units of dBm .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 48 for WTP Reboot Statistics
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 15
:LABEL: field

name: Reboot Count
description: Reboot Count : The number of reboots that have occurred due to a WTP crash . A value of 65535 implies that this information is not available on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: AC Initiated Count
description: AC Initiated Count : The number of reboots that have occurred at the request of a CAPWAP protocol message   such as a change in configuration that required a reboot or an explicit CAPWAP protocol reset request . A value of 65535 implies that this information is not available on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Link Failure Count
description: Link Failure Count : The number of times that a CAPWAP protocol connection with an AC has failed due to link failure .
:LABEL: field

name: SW Failure Count
description: SW Failure Count : The number of times that a CAPWAP protocol connection with an AC has failed due to software-related reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: HW Failure Count
description: HW Failure Count : The number of times that a CAPWAP protocol connection with an AC has failed due to hardware-related reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Other Failure Count
description: Other Failure Count : The number of times that a CAPWAP protocol connection with an AC has failed due to known reasons   other than AC initiated   link   SW or HW failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Unknown Failure Count
description: Unknown Failure Count : The number of times that a CAPWAP protocol connection with an AC has failed for unknown reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Last Failure Type
description: Last Failure Type : The failure type of the most recent WTP failure . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 49 for WTP Static IP Address Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 13
:LABEL: field

name: IP Address
description: IP Address : The IP address to assign to the WTP . This field is only valid if the static field is set to one .
:LABEL: field

name: Netmask
description: Netmask : The IP Netmask . This field is only valid if the static field is set to one .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway
description: Gateway : The IP address of the gateway . This field is only valid if the static field is set to one .
:LABEL: field

name: Static
description: Static : An 8-bit Boolean stating whether or not the WTP should use a static IP address . A value of zero disables the static IP address   while a value of one enables it .
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery Type
description: o WTP Board Data   see Section 4.6.40
:LABEL: field

name: Discovery Type
description: o WTP Board Data   see Section 4.6.40
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: o Session ID   see Section 4.6.37
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: At least one of the following message element MUST be included in the Join Request message .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Message Length
description: o WTP Reboot Statistics   see Section 4.6.47
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: o Result Code   see Section 4.6.35
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: One of the following message elements MUST be included in the Join Response Message :
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Message Length
description: o Maximum Message Length   see Section 4.6.31
:LABEL: field

name: Echo Request
description: The Echo Request message is a keep-alive mechanism for CAPWAP control messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: o Statistics Timer   see Section 4.6.38
:LABEL: field

name: Statistics Timer
description: o Statistics Timer   see Section 4.6.38
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The following message elements MAY be present in the Configuration Update Response message .
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: One or more of the following message elements MAY be present in the Change State Event Request message :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The following message element MAY be included in the Clear Configuration Request message :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The following message element MAY be included in the Image Data Response message :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: o Result Code   see Section 4.6.35
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The following message element MAY be included in the Data Transfer Response message :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The following message element MAY be included in the Station Configuration Response message :
:LABEL: field

name: AC Information Type
description: The Information Type field in the AC Descriptor message element ( see Section 4.6.1 ) is used to represent information about the AC . The namespace is 16 bits ( 0-65535 )  where the value of zero ( 0 ) is reserved and must not be assigned . This field   combined with the AC Information Vendor ID   allows vendors to use a private namespace . This specification defines the AC Information Type namespace when the AC Information Vendor ID is set to zero ( 0 )  for which the values four ( 4 ) and five ( 5 ) are allocated in this specification   and can be found in Section 4.6.1 . This namespace is managed by IANA and assignments require an Expert Review . IANA created the AC Information Type registry   whose format is :
:LABEL: field

name: AC Information Type
description: AC Information Type Type Value Reference
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: The ECN Support field in the ECN Support message element ( see Section 4.6.25 ) is used by the WTP to represent its ECN Support . The namespace is 8 bits ( 0-255 ). The values zero ( 0 ) and one ( 1 ) are allocated in this specification   and can be found in Section 4.6.25 . This namespace is managed by IANA and assignments require an Expert Review . IANA created the ECN Support registry   whose format is :
:LABEL: field

name: ECN Support
description: ECN Support Type Value Reference
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: The Result Code field in the Result Code message element ( see Section 4.6.35 ) is used to indicate the success or failure of a CAPWAP Control message . The namespace is 32 bits ( 0-4294967295 )  where the value of zero ( 0 ) through 22 are allocated in this specification   and can be found in Section 4.6.35 . This namespace is managed by IANA and assignments require an Expert Review . IANA created the Result Code registry   whose format is :
:LABEL: field

name: Result Code
description: Result Code Type Value Reference
:LABEL: field

name: RSSI
description: RSSI : Received Signal Strength Indication ( RSSI ) is a signed   8-bit value . It is the received signal strength indication   in dBm .
:LABEL: field

name: SNR
description: SNR : SNR is a signed   8-bit value . It is the signal-to-noise ratio of the received IEEE 802.11 frame   in dB .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Rate
description: Data Rate : The data rate field is a 16-bit unsigned value . The data rate field is a 16-bit unsigned value expressing the data rate of the packets received by the WTP in units of 0.1 Mbps . For instance   a packet received at 5.5 Mbps would be set to 55   while 11 Mbps would be set to 110 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID bitmap
description: WLAN ID bitmap : This bit field indicates the WLAN ID ( see Section 6.1 ) on which the WTP will transmit the included frame . For instance   if a multicast packet is to be transmitted on WLANs 1 and 3   the bits for WLAN 1 and 3 of this field would be enabled . WLAN 1 is represented by bit 15 in the figure above   or the least significant bit   while WLAN 16 would be represented by bit zero ( 0 )  or the most significant bit   in the figure . This field is to be set to all zeroes for unicast packets and is unused if the WTP is not providing IEEE 802.11 encryption .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1024 for IEEE 802.11 Add WLAN
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Capability
description: Capability : A 16-bit value containing the Capability information field to be advertised by the WTP in the Probe Request and Beacon frames . Each bit of the Capability field represents a different WTP capability   which are described in detail in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]. The format of the field is :
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E ( ESS ): The AC MUST set the Extended Service Set ( ESS ) subfield to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I ( IBSS ): The AC MUST set the Independent Basic Service Set ( IBSS ) subfield to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C ( CF-Pollable ): The AC sets the Contention Free Pollable ( CF - Pollable ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( CF-Poll Request ): The AC sets the CF-Poll Request subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P ( Privacy ): The AC sets the Privacy subfield based on the confidentiality requirements of the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S ( Short Preamble ): The AC sets the Short Preamble subfield based on whether the use of short preambles is permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Short Preamble
description: S ( Short Preamble ): The AC sets the Short Preamble subfield based on whether the use of short preambles is permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B ( PBCC ): The AC sets the Packet Binary Convolutional Code ( PBCC ) modulation option subfield based on whether the use of PBCC is permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A ( Channel Agility ): The AC sets the Channel Agility subfield based on whether the WTP is capable of supporting the High Rate Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum ( HR/DSSS )  as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M ( Spectrum Management ): The AC sets the Spectrum Management subfield according to the value of the dot11SpectrumManagementRequired MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( QoS ): The AC sets the Quality of Service ( QoS ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: Q ( QoS ): The AC sets the Quality of Service ( QoS ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T ( Short Slot Time ): The AC sets the Short Slot Time subfield according to the value of the WTP's currently used slot time value   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D ( APSD ): The AC sets the Automatic Power Save Delivery ( APSD ) subfield according to the value of the dot11APSDOptionImplemented Management Information Base ( MIB ) variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V ( Reserved ): The AC sets the Reserved subfield to zero   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: V ( Reserved ): The AC sets the Reserved subfield to zero   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O ( DSSS-OFDM ): The AC sets the DSSS-OFDM subfield to indicate the use of Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum with Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing ( DSSS-OFDM )  as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: K ( Delayed Block ACK ): The AC sets the Delayed Block ACK subfield according to the value of the dot11DelayedBlockAckOptionImplemented MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L ( Immediate Block ACK ): The AC sets the Delayed Block ACK subfield according to the value of the dot11ImmediateBlockAckOptionImplemented MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Key Status
description: Key Status : A 1-byte value that specifies the state and usage of the key that has been included . Note this field is ignored if the Key Length field is set to zero ( 0 ). The following values describe the key usage and its status :
:LABEL: field

name: Key Length
description: Key Length : A 16-bit value representing the length of the Key field .
:LABEL: field

name: Group TSC
description: Group TSC : A 48-bit value containing the Transmit Sequence Counter ( TSC ) for the updated group key . The WTP will set the TSC for broadcast/multicast frames to this value for the updated group key .
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: QoS : An 8-bit value specifying the default QoS policy for the WTP to apply to network traffic received for a non-WMM enabled STA .
:LABEL: field

description: 2 - Voice
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: Auth Type : An 8-bit value specifying the supported authentication type .
:LABEL: field

description: MAC Mode : This field specifies whether the WTP should support the WLAN in Local or Split MAC mode . Note that the AC MUST NOT request a mode of operation that was not advertised by the WTP during the discovery process ( see Section 4.6.43 in [ RFC5415 ]). The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Mode
description: MAC Mode : This field specifies whether the WTP should support the WLAN in Local or Split MAC mode . Note that the AC MUST NOT request a mode of operation that was not advertised by the WTP during the discovery process ( see Section 4.6.43 in [ RFC5415 ]). The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel Mode
description: Tunnel Mode : This field specifies the frame tunneling type to be used for 802.11 data frames from all stations associated with the WLAN . The AC MUST NOT request a mode of operation that was not advertised by the WTP during the discovery process ( see Section 4.6.42 in [ RFC5415 ]). All IEEE 802.11 management frames MUST be tunneled using 802.11 Tunnel mode . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Suppress SSID
description: Suppress SSID : A boolean indicating whether the SSID is to be advertised by the WTP . A value of zero suppresses the SSID in the 802.11 Beacon and Probe Response frames   while a value of one will cause the WTP to populate the field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1025 for IEEE 802.11 Antenna
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Diversity
description: Diversity : An 8-bit value specifying whether the antenna is to provide receiver diversity . The value of this field is the same as the IEEE 802.11 dot11DiversitySelectionRx MIB element   see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]. The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Combiner
description: Combiner : An 8-bit value specifying the combiner selection . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1026 for IEEE 802.11 Assigned WTP BSSID
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: BSSID
description: BSSID : The BSSID assigned by the WTP for the WLAN created as a result of receiving an IEEE 802.11 Add WLAN .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1027 for IEEE 802.11 Delete WLAN
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1028 for IEEE 802.11 Direct Sequence Control
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Current CCA
description: Current CCA : The current Clear Channel Assessment ( CCA ) method in operation   whose value can be found in the IEEE 802.11 dot11CCAModeSupported MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]). Valid values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Energy Detect Threshold
description: Energy Detect Threshold : The current Energy Detect Threshold being used by the DSSS PHY . The value can be found in the IEEE 802.11 dot11EDThreshold MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1029 for IEEE 802.11 Information Element
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : When set   the WTP is to include the Information Element in IEEE 802.11 Beacons associated with the WLAN .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : When set   the WTP is to include the Information Element in Probe Responses associated with the WLAN .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1030 for IEEE 802.11 MAC Operation
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Threshold
description: RTS Threshold : This attribute indicates the number of octets in an MAC Protocol Data Unit ( MPDU )  below which a Request To Send/Clear To Send ( RTS/CTS ) handshake MUST NOT be performed . An RTS/CTS handshake MUST be performed at the beginning of any frame exchange sequence where the MPDU is of type Data or Management   the MPDU has an individual address in the Address1 field   and the length of the MPDU is greater than this threshold . Setting this attribute to be larger than the maximum MSDU size MUST have the effect of turning off the RTS/CTS handshake for frames of Data or Management type transmitted by this STA . Setting this attribute to zero MUST have the effect of turning on the RTS/CTS handshake for all frames of Data or Management type transmitted by this STA . The default value of this attribute MUST be 2347 . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RTSThreshold MIB element   ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Short Retry
description: Short Retry : This attribute indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame   the length of which is less than or equal to RTSThreshold   that MUST be made before a failure condition is indicated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 7 . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11ShortRetryLimit MIB element   ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Long Retry
description: Long Retry : This attribute indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame   the length of which is greater than dot11RTSThreshold   that MUST be made before a failure condition is indicated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 4 . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11LongRetryLimit MIB element   ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Fragmentation Threshold
description: Fragmentation Threshold : This attribute specifies the current maximum size   in octets   of the MPDU that MAY be delivered to the PHY . A MAC Service Data Unit ( MSDU ) MUST be broken into fragments if its size exceeds the value of this attribute after adding MAC headers and trailers . An MSDU or MAC Management Protocol Data Unit ( MMPDU ) MUST be fragmented when the resulting frame has an individual address in the Address1 field   and the length of the frame is larger than this threshold . The default value for this attribute MUST be the lesser of 2346 or the aMPDUMaxLength of the attached PHY and MUST never exceed the lesser of 2346 or the
:LABEL: field

name: Tx MSDU Lifetime
description: Tx MSDU Lifetime : This attribute specifies the elapsed time in Time Units ( TUs )  after the initial transmission of an MSDU   after which further attempts to transmit the MSDU MUST be terminated . The default value of this attribute MUST be 512 . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MaxTransmitMSDULifetime MIB element   ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Rx MSDU Lifetime
description: Rx MSDU Lifetime : This attribute specifies the elapsed time in TU   after the initial reception of a fragmented MMPDU or MSDU   after which further attempts to reassemble the MMPDU or MSDU MUST be terminated . The default value MUST be 512 . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MaxReceiveLifetime MIB element   ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1031 for IEEE 802.11 MIC Countermeasures
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : This 8-bit unsigned integer includes the WLAN Identifier   on which the MIC failure occurred . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The MAC Address of the station that caused the MIC failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1032 for IEEE 802.11 Multi-Domain Capability
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: First Channel #
description: First Channel #: This attribute indicates the value of the lowest channel number in the sub-band for the associated domain country string . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11FirstChannelNumber MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Channels
description: Number of Channels : This attribute indicates the value of the total number of channels allowed in the sub-band for the associated domain country string ( see Section 6.23 ). The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11NumberofChannels MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Max Tx Power Level
description: Max Tx Power Level : This attribute indicates the maximum transmit power   in dBm   allowed in the sub-band for the associated domain country string ( see Section 6.23 ). The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MaximumTransmitPowerLevel MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1033 for IEEE 802.11 OFDM Control
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Band Supported : The capability of the OFDM PHY implementation to operate in the three Unlicensed National Information Infrastructure ( U-NII ) bands . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11FrequencyBandsSupported MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ])  coded as a bit field   whose values are :
:LABEL: field

name: TI Threshold
description: TI Threshold : The threshold being used to detect a busy medium ( frequency ). CCA MUST report a busy medium upon detecting the RSSI above this threshold . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11TIThreshold MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1034 for IEEE 802.11 Rate Set
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1035 for IEEE 802.11 RSNA Error Report From Station
:LABEL: field

name: Client MAC Address
description: Client MAC Address : The Client MAC Address of the station .
:LABEL: field

name: BSSID
description: BSSID : The BSSID on which the failures are being reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : The WLAN ID on which the RSNA failures are being reported . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: TKIP ICV Errors
description: TKIP ICV Errors : A 32-bit value representing the number of Temporal Key Integrity Protocol ( TKIP ) ( as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]) ICV errors encountered when decrypting packets from the station . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNAStatsTKIPICVErrors MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: TKIP Local MIC Failures
description: TKIP Local MIC Failures : A 32-bit value representing the number of MIC failures encountered when checking the integrity of packets received from the station . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNAStatsTKIPLocalMICFailures MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: TKIP Remote MIC Failures
description: TKIP Remote MIC Failures : A 32-bit value representing the number of MIC failures reported by the station encountered ( possibly via the EAPOL-Key frame ). The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNAStatsTKIPRemoteMICFailures MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: CCMP Replays
description: CCMP Replays : A 32-bit value representing the number of CCMP MPDUs discarded by the replay detection mechanism . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNACCMPReplays MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: CCMP Decrypt Errors
description: CCMP Decrypt Errors : A 32-bit value representing the number of CCMP MDPUs discarded by the decryption algorithm . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNACCMPDecryptErrors MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: TKIP Replays
description: TKIP Replays : A 32-bit value representing the number of TKIP Replays detected in frames received from the station . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RSNAStatsTKIPReplays MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1036 for IEEE 802.11 Station
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Association ID
description: Association ID : A 16-bit value specifying the IEEE 802.11 Association Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The station's MAC Address
:LABEL: field

name: Capabilities
description: Capabilities : A 16-bit field containing the IEEE 802.11 Capabilities Information Field to use with the station .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Supported Rates
description: Supported Rates : The variable-length field containing the supported rates to be used with the station   as found in the IEEE 802.11 dot11OperationalRateSet MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]). This field MUST NOT exceed 126 octets and specifies the set of data rates at which the station may transmit data   where each octet represents a data rate .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1037 for IEEE 802.11 Station QoS Profile
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The station's MAC Address
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1038 for IEEE 802.11 Station Session Key
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The station's MAC Address
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support . The following bits are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : The 1-bit AKM-Only field is set by the AC to inform the WTP that is MUST NOT accept any 802.11 Data Frames other than AKM frames . This is the equivalent of the WTP's IEEE 802.1X port for the station to be in the closed state . When set   the WTP MUST drop any non-IEEE 802.1X packets it receives from the station .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : The 1-bit field is set by the AC to inform the WTP that encryption services will be provided by the AC . When set   the WTP SHOULD police frames received from stations to ensure that they are properly encrypted as specified in the RSN Information Element   but does not need to take specific cryptographic action on the frame . Similarly   for transmitted frames   the WTP only needs to forward already encrypted frames . Since packets received by the WTP will be encrypted   the WTP cannot modify the contents of the packets   including modifying the DSCP markings of the encapsulated packet . In this case   this function would be the responsibility of the AC .
:LABEL: field

name: Pairwise TSC
description: Pairwise TSC : The 6-byte Transmit Sequence Counter ( TSC ) field to use for unicast packets transmitted to the station .
:LABEL: field

name: Pairwise RSC
description: Pairwise RSC : The 6-byte Receive Sequence Counter ( RSC ) to use for unicast packets received from the station .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1039 for IEEE 802.11 Statistics
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Tx Fragment Count
description: Tx Fragment Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of fragmented frames transmitted . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11TransmittedFragmentCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Tx Count
description: Multicast Tx Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of multicast frames transmitted . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MulticastTransmittedFrameCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Failed Count
description: Failed Count : A 32-bit value representing the transmit excessive retries . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11FailedCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Retry Count
description: Retry Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of transmit retries . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RetryCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Multiple Retry Count
description: Multiple Retry Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of transmits that required more than one retry . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MultipleRetryCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Frame Duplicate Count
description: Frame Duplicate Count : A 32-bit value representing the duplicate frames received . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11FrameDuplicateCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Success Count
description: RTS Success Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of successfully transmitted Ready To Send ( RTS ). The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RTSSuccessCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: RTS Failure Count
description: RTS Failure Count : A 32-bit value representing the failed transmitted RTS . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11RTSFailureCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: ACK Failure Count
description: ACK Failure Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of failed acknowledgements . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11ACKFailureCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Rx Fragment Count
description: Rx Fragment Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of fragmented frames received . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11ReceivedFragmentCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast RX Count
description: Multicast RX Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of multicast frames received . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11MulticastReceivedFrameCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: FCS Error Count
description: FCS Error Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of FCS failures . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11FCSErrorCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Decryption Errors
description: Decryption Errors : A 32-bit value representing the number of Decryption errors that occurred on the WTP . Note that this field is only valid in cases where the WTP provides encryption/ decryption services . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11WEPUndecryptableCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Discarded QoS Fragment Count
description: Discarded QoS Fragment Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of discarded QoS fragments received . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11QoSDiscardedFragmentCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Associated Station Count
description: Associated Station Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of number of associated stations . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11AssociatedStationCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: QoS CF Polls Received Count
description: QoS CF Polls Received Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of (+) CF-Polls received . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11QosCFPollsReceivedCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: QoS CF Polls Unused Count
description: QoS CF Polls Unused Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of (+) CF-Polls that have been received   but not used . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11QosCFPollsUnusedCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: QoS CF Polls Unusable Count
description: QoS CF Polls Unusable Count : A 32-bit value representing the number of (+) CF-Polls that have been received   but could not be used due to the Transmission Opportunity ( TXOP ) size being smaller than the time that is required for one frame exchange sequence . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11QosCFPollsUnusableCount MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1040 for IEEE 802.11 Supported Rates
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Supported Rates
description: Supported Rates : The WTP includes the Supported Rates that its hardware supports . The format is identical to the Rate Set message element and is between 2 and 8 bytes in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Current Tx Power
description: Current Tx Power : This attribute contains the current transmit output power in mW   as described in the dot11CurrentTxPowerLevel MIB variable   see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1042 for IEEE 802.11 Tx Power Level
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Levels
description: Num Levels : The number of power level attributes . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11NumberSupportedPowerLevels MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1043 for IEEE 802.11 Update Station QoS
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : The station's MAC Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: RSV : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: DSCP Tag
description: DSCP Tag : The 6-bit DSCP label to use if packets are eligible to be DSCP tagged   specifically an IPv4 or IPv6 packet ( see [ RFC2474 ]). This field is used only if the ' D ' bit in the WTP Quality of Service message element was set; otherwise   its contents MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1044 for IEEE 802.11 Update WLAN
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between one ( 1 ) and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Capability
description: Capability : A 16-bit value containing the Capability information field to be advertised by the WTP in the Probe Request and Beacon frames . Each bit of the Capability field represents a different WTP capability   which are described in detail in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]. The format of the field is :
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E ( ESS ): The AC MUST set the Extended Service Set ( ESS ) subfield to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I ( IBSS ): The AC MUST set the Independent Basic Service Set ( IBSS ) subfield to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C ( CF-Pollable ): The AC sets the Contention Free Pollable ( CF - Pollable ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( CF-Poll Request ): The AC sets the CF-Poll Request subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P ( Privacy ): The AC sets the Privacy subfield based on the confidentiality requirements of the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S ( Short Preamble ): The AC sets the Short Preamble subfield based on whether the use of short preambles are permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Short Preamble
description: S ( Short Preamble ): The AC sets the Short Preamble subfield based on whether the use of short preambles are permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B ( PBCC ): The AC sets the Packet Binary Convolutional Code ( PBCC ) modulation option subfield based on whether the use of PBCC is permitted on the WLAN   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A ( Channel Agility ): The AC sets the Channel Agility subfield based on whether the WTP is capable of supporting the High Rate Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum ( HR/DSSS )  as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M ( Spectrum Management ): The AC sets the Spectrum Management subfield according to the value of the dot11SpectrumManagementRequired MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q ( QoS ): The AC sets the Quality of Service ( QoS ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: QoS
description: Q ( QoS ): The AC sets the Quality of Service ( QoS ) subfield based on the table found in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T ( Short Slot Time ): The AC sets the Short Slot Time subfield according to the value of the WTP's currently used slot time value   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D ( APSD ): The AC sets the APSD subfield according to the value of the dot11APSDOptionImplemented Management Information Base ( MIB ) variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V ( Reserved ): The AC sets the Reserved subfield to zero   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: V ( Reserved ): The AC sets the Reserved subfield to zero   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O ( DSSS-OFDM ): The AC sets the DSSS-OFDM subfield to indicate the use of Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum with Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing ( DSSS-OFDM )  as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: K ( Delayed Block ACK ): The AC sets the Delayed Block ACK subfield according to the value of the dot11DelayedBlockAckOptionImplemented MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L ( Immediate Block ACK ): The AC sets the Delayed Block ACK subfield according to the value of the dot11ImmediateBlockAckOptionImplemented MIB variable   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Key Status
description: Key Status : A 1-byte value that specifies the state and usage of the key that has been included . The following values describe the key usage and its status :
:LABEL: field

name: Key Length
description: Key Length : A 16-bit value representing the length of the Key field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1045 for IEEE 802.11 WTP Quality of Service
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Tagging Policy
description: Tagging Policy : A bit field indicating how the WTP is to mark packets for QoS purposes . The required WTP behavior is defined in Section 2.6.1 . The field has the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: Rsvd
description: Rsvd : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : When set   the WTP is to employ the 802.1p QoS mechanism ( see Section 2.6.1.1 )  and the WTP is to use the ' Q ' bit .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q : When the ' P ' bit is set   the ' Q ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how 802.1p QoS is to be enforced . Details on the behavior of the ' Q ' bit are specified in Section 2.6.1.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : When set   the WTP is to employ the DSCP QoS mechanism ( see Section 2.6.1.2 )  and the WTP is to use the ' O ' and ' I ' bits .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O : When the ' D ' bit is set   the ' O ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how DSCP QoS is to be enforced on the outer ( tunneled ) header . Details on the behavior of the ' O ' bit are specified in Section 2.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : When the ' D ' bit is set   the ' I ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how DSCP QoS is to be enforced on the station's packet ( inner ) header . Details on the behavior of the ' I ' bit are specified in Section 2.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Queue Depth
description: Queue Depth : The number of packets that can be on the specific QoS transmit queue at any given time .
:LABEL: field

name: CWMin
description: CWMin : The Contention Window minimum ( CWmin ) value for the QoS transmit queue . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11EDCATableCWMin MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: CWMax
description: CWMax : The Contention Window maximum ( CWmax ) value for the QoS transmit queue . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11EDCATableCWMax MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: AIFS
description: AIFS : The Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing ( AIFS ) to use for the QoS transmit queue . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11EDCATableAIFSN MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: RSV : All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: DSCP Tag
description: DSCP Tag : The 6-bit DSCP label to use if packets are eligible to be DSCP tagged   specifically an IPv4 or IPv6 packet ( see [ RFC2474 ]). This field is used only if the ' D ' bit is set; otherwise   its contents MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1046 for IEEE 802.11 WTP WLAN Radio Configuration
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : An 8-bit value representing the radio to configure   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: Short Preamble
description: Short Preamble : An 8-bit value indicating whether short preamble is supported . The following enumerated values are currently supported :
:LABEL: field

name: BSSID
