description: BSSID : The WLAN Radio's base MAC Address .
:LABEL: field

name: DTIM Period
description: DTIM Period : This attribute specifies the number of Beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacons frames containing a Traffic Indication Map ( TIM ) element whose Delivery Traffic Indication Message ( DTIM ) Count field is 0 . This value is transmitted in the DTIM Period field of Beacon frames . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11DTIMPeriod MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Beacon Period
description: Beacon Period : This attribute specifies the number of Time Unit ( TU ) that a station uses for scheduling Beacon transmissions . This value is transmitted in Beacon and Probe Response frames . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11BeaconPeriod MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Country String
description: Country String : This attribute identifies the country in which the station is operating . The value of this field comes from the IEEE 802.11 dot11CountryString MIB element ( see [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ]). Some regulatory domains do not allow WTPs to have user configurable country string   and require that it be a fixed value during the manufacturing process . Therefore   WTP vendors that wish to allow for the configuration of this field will need to validate this behavior during its radio certification process . Other WTP vendors may simply wish to treat this WTP configuration parameter as read-only . The country strings can be found in [ ISO.3166-1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1047 for IEEE 802.11 WTP Radio Fail Alarm Indication
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   typically refers to some interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The type of radio failure detected . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : An 8-bit boolean indicating whether the radio failure is being reported or cleared . A value of zero is used to clear the event   while a value of one is used to report the event .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad
description: Pad : All implementations complying with version zero of this protocol MUST set these bits to zero . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1048 for IEEE 802.11 WTP Radio Information
:LABEL: field

name: Radio ID
description: Radio ID : The Radio Identifier   whose value is between one ( 1 ) and 31   which typically refers to an interface index on the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Radio Type
description: Radio Type : The type of radio present . Note this is a bit field that is used to specify support for more than a single type of PHY/MAC . The field has the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: Reservd
description: Reservd : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to zero any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : An IEEE 802.11n radio .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G : An IEEE 802.11g radio .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : An IEEE 802.11a radio .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : An IEEE 802.11b radio .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : WTP supports AES-CCMP   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ].
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : WTP supports TKIP and Michael   as defined in [ IEEE.802-11.2007 ] and [ WPA ]  respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: AC IPv4 Address
description: AC IPv4 Address : IPv4 address of a CAPWAP AC that the WTP may use . The ACs are listed in the order of preference for use by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: AC IPv6 Address
description: AC IPv6 Address : IPv6 address of a CAPWAP AC that the WTP may use . The ACs are listed in the order of preference for use by the WTP .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The identifier of the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the total length of the TLV in octets . That is   the combined length of the Type   Length   and Value fields   i.e .  four plus the length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . This length must be a multiple of four and must be at least eight .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV 1 - Mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 11 - PAC TLV
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Two octets containing the length of the PAC attributes field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type field is two octets   denoting the attribute type . Allocated Types include :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Two octets containing the length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 - PAC-Key
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2-octet length indicating a 32-octet key
:LABEL: field

name: Key
description: The value of the PAC-Key .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 2 - PAC-Opaque
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length filed is two octets   which contains the length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 9 - PAC-Info
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2-octet Length field containing the length of the attributes field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8 - PAC-Acknowledgement
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of this field is two octets containing a value of 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Result
description: The resulting value MUST be one of the following :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 10 - PAC-Type
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 2-octet Length field with a value of 2
:LABEL: field

name: PAC Type
description: This 2-octet field defines the type of PAC being requested or provisioned . The following values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Non-mandatory TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 18 - Server-Trusted-Root TLV [ RFC4851 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: >= 2 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Credential-Format
description: The Credential-Format field is two octets . Values include :
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: 0 - Optional TLV
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved   set to zero ( 0 )
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Type
description: 20 - PKCS#7 TLV [ RFC4851 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the PKCS #7 Data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver ( Version - 3 bits ): PCEP version number . Current version is version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 5 bits ): No flags are currently defined . Unassigned bits are considered as reserved . They MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: OT
description: The Object-Class and Object-Type fields are managed by IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Flags ( 5 bits ): No flags are currently defined . Unassigned bits are considered as reserved . They MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 5 bits ): No flags are currently defined . Unassigned bits are considered as reserved . They MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Keepalive
description: Keepalive ( 8 bits ): maximum period of time ( in seconds ) between two consecutive PCEP messages sent by the sender of this message . The minimum value for the Keepalive is 1 second . When set to 0   once the session is established   no further Keepalive messages are sent to the remote peer . A RECOMMENDED value for the keepalive frequency is 30 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: DeadTimer
description: DeadTimer ( 8 bits ): specifies the amount of time after the expiration of which the PCEP peer can declare the session with the sender of the Open message to be down if no PCEP message has been received . The DeadTimer SHOULD be set to 0 and MUST be ignored if the Keepalive is set to 0 . A RECOMMENDED value for the DeadTimer is 4 times the value of the Keepalive .
:LABEL: field

name: SID
description: SID ( PCEP session ID - 8 bits ): unsigned PCEP session number that identifies the current session . The SID MUST be incremented each time a new PCEP session is established . It is used for logging and troubleshooting purposes . Each increment SHOULD have a value of 1 and may cause a wrap back to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 32 bits )
:LABEL: field

name: Pri
description: o Pri ( Priority - 3 bits ): the Priority field may be used by the requesting PCC to specify to the PCE the request's priority from 1 to 7 . The decision of which priority should be used for a specific request is a local matter; it MUST be set to 0 when unused . Furthermore   the use of the path computation request priority by the PCE's scheduler is implementation specific and out of the scope of this document . Note that it is not required for a PCE to support the priority field : in this case   it is RECOMMENDED that the PCC set the priority field to 0 in the RP object . If the PCE does not take into account the request priority   it is RECOMMENDED to set the priority field to 0 in the RP object carried within the corresponding PCRep message   regardless of the priority value contained in the RP object carried within the corresponding PCReq message . A higher numerical value of the priority field reflects a higher priority . Note that it is the responsibility of the network administrator to make use of the priority values in a consistent manner across the various PCCs . The ability of a PCE to support request prioritization MAY be dynamically discovered by the PCCs by means of PCE capability discovery . If not advertised by the PCE   a PCC may decide to set the request priority and will learn the ability of the PCE to support request prioritization by observing the Priority field of the RP object received in the PCRep message . If the value of the Pri field is set to 0   this means that the PCE does not support
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o R ( Reoptimization - 1 bit ): when set   the requesting PCC specifies that the PCReq message relates to the reoptimization of an existing TE LSP . For all TE LSPs except zero-bandwidth LSPs   when the R bit is set   an RRO ( see Section 7.10 ) MUST be included in the PCReq message to show the path of the existing TE LSP . Also   for all TE LSPs except zero-bandwidth LSPs   when the R bit is set   the existing bandwidth of the TE LSP to be reoptimized MUST be supplied in a BANDWIDTH object ( see Section 7.7 ). This BANDWIDTH object is in addition to the instance of that object used to describe the desired bandwidth of the reoptimized LSP . For zero - bandwidth LSPs   the RRO and BANDWIDTH objects that report the characteristics of the existing TE LSP are optional .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: o B ( Bi-directional - 1 bit ): when set   the PCC specifies that the path computation request relates to a bi-directional TE LSP that has the same traffic engineering requirements including fate sharing   protection and restoration   LSRs   TE links   and resource requirements ( e.g .  latency and jitter ) in each direction . When cleared   the TE LSP is unidirectional .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: o O ( strict/loose - 1 bit ): when set   in a PCReq message   this indicates that a loose path is acceptable . Otherwise   when cleared   this indicates to the PCE that a path exclusively made of strict hops is required . In a PCRep message   when the O bit is set this indicates that the returned path is a loose path; otherwise ( when the O bit is cleared )  the returned path is made of strict hops .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 16 bits ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: o Bandwidth of an existing TE LSP for which a reoptimization is requested . BANDWIDTH Object-Type is 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: Bandwidth ( 32 bits ): The requested bandwidth is encoded in 32 bits in IEEE floating point format ( see [ IEEE.754.1985 ])  expressed in bytes per second . Refer to Section 3.1.2 of [ RFC3471 ] for a table of commonly used values .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 16 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Three values are currently defined : * T=1 : IGP metric * T=2 : TE metric * T=3 : Hop Counts
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: * B ( Bound - 1 bit ): When set in a PCReq message   the metric - value indicates a bound ( a maximum ) for the path metric that must not be exceeded for the PCC to consider the computed path as acceptable . The path metric must be less than or equal to the value specified in the metric-value field . When the B flag is cleared   the metric-value field is not used to reflect a bound constraint .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: * B ( Bound - 1 bit ): When set in a PCReq message   the metric - value indicates a bound ( a maximum ) for the path metric that must not be exceeded for the PCC to consider the computed path as acceptable . The path metric must be less than or equal to the value specified in the metric-value field . When the B flag is cleared   the metric-value field is not used to reflect a bound constraint .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: * C ( Computed Metric - 1 bit ): When set in a PCReq message   this indicates that the PCE MUST provide the computed path metric value ( should a path satisfying the constraints be found ) in the PCRep message for the corresponding metric .
:LABEL: field

name: Setup Prio
description: Setup Prio ( Setup Priority - 8 bits ): The priority of the TE LSP with respect to taking resources   in the range of 0 to 7 . The value 0 is the highest priority . The Setup Priority is used in deciding whether this session can preempt another session .
:LABEL: field

name: Holding Prio
description: Holding Prio ( Holding Priority - 8 bits ): The priority of the TE LSP with respect to holding resources   in the range of 0 to 7 . The value 0 is the highest priority . Holding Priority is used in deciding whether this session can be preempted by another session .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: L flag : Corresponds to the " Local Protection Desired " bit ([ RFC3209 ]) of the SESSION-ATTRIBUTE Object . When set   this means that the computed path must include links protected with Fast Reroute as defined in [ RFC4090 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 24 bits ): Defines the potential dependency between the set of path computation requests .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: * L ( Link diverse ) bit : when set   this indicates that the computed paths corresponding to the requests specified by the following RP objects MUST NOT have any link in common .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: * N ( Node diverse ) bit : when set   this indicates that the computed paths corresponding to the requests specified by the following RP objects MUST NOT have any node in common .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: * S ( SRLG diverse ) bit : when set   this indicates that the computed paths corresponding to the requests specified by the following RP objects MUST NOT share any SRLG ( Shared Risk Link Group ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 8 bits ): No flags are currently defined . Unassigned flags MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: NT
description: NT ( Notification Type - 8 bits ): The Notification-type specifies the class of notification .
:LABEL: field

name: NV
description: NV ( Notification Value - 8 bits ): The Notification-value provides addition information related to the nature of the notification .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 8 bits ): no flag is currently defined . This flag MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 16 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 8 bits ): No flag is currently defined . The Flags field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 16 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 8 bits ): No flags are currently defined . The Flag field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: Reason ( 8 bits ): specifies the reason for closing the PCEP session . The setting of this field is optional . IANA manages the codespace of the Reason field . The following values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: OpenWait
description: OpenWait : the timer that corresponds to the amount of time a PCEP peer will wait to receive an Open message from the PCEP peer after the expiration of which the system releases the PCEP resource and goes back to the Idle state . The OpenWait timer has a fixed value of 60 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: KeepWait
description: KeepWait : the timer that corresponds to the amount of time a PCEP peer will wait to receive a Keepalive or a PCErr message from the PCEP peer after the expiration of which the system releases the PCEP resource and goes back to the Idle state . The KeepWait timer has a fixed value of 60 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: DeadTimer
description: DeadTimer : period of timer after the expiration of which a PCEP peer declares the session down if no PCEP message has been received .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV
description: o A generalized type-length-value ( TLV ) format representing attributes . Each TLV can be associated with a packet   a message   or one or more addresses or address prefixes in a single Address Block . Multiple TLVs can be included   each associated with a packet   a message   and the same   different   or overlapping sets of addresses or address prefixes .
:LABEL: field

name: Message
description: Message - The fundamental entity carrying protocol information   in the form of address objects and TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV
description: TLV - A type-length-value structure . This is a generic way in which an attribute can be represented and correctly parsed without the parser having to understand the attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Message
description: This section illustrates possible options for the < message > element . These are differentiated by their second ( flags ) octet . The length of the Message Body is determined using the Message Size field   which is the combined length of all the fields shown . The field labeled MAL defines the length of all addresses ( including the Originator Address   if present   and all addresses in Address Blocks ) in octets   as one more than the value in the field .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Body
description: This section illustrates the format of a Message Body ( the < message > element excluding its initial < msg-header > element ). The Message Body includes one Message TLV Block ( containing zero or more TLVs ) and may include any number ( zero or more ) of Address Block and Address Block TLV Block pairs .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Block
description: This section illustrates possible options for the < addr-block > element . These are differentiated by their second ( flags ) octet . The number of Mid elements is equal to the number of addresses ( except when mid-length is zero   when there are no Mid elements ). Where a variable number of prefix length fields is shown   their number is equal to the number of addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV
description: This section illustrates possible options for the < tlv > element . These are differentiated by their second ( flags ) octet . If there are no Index fields   then this may be a Packet TLV   Message TLV   or Address Block TLV; if there are one or two Index fields   then this must be an Address Block TLV . The Length field gives the length of the Value field ( in octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Instance ID
description: Transfer-Length : a non-negative integer less than 2^^48   indicating the length of the object in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 octet ): an unsigned integer that specifies the length of the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI in four-octet words ( including this length field )  except that the value zero indicates that no Instance-specific FEC OTI Information is provided . When the Length is zero   three padding bytes containing value zero SHALL follow the Length field to maintain 4-octet alignment .
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Instance ID
description: Transfer-Length : a non-negative integer less than 2^^48   indicating the length of the object in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_KDF_INPUT
description: The format of the AT_KDF_INPUT attribute is shown below .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_KDF_INPUT
description: This is set to 23 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the attribute   calculated as defined in [ RFC4187 ]  Section 8.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Actual Network Name Length
description: This is a 2 byte actual length field   needed due to the requirement that the previous field is expressed in multiples of 4 bytes per the usual EAP-AKA rules . The Actual Network Name Length field provides the length of the network name in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Network Name
description: This field contains the network name of the access network for which the authentication is being performed . The name does not include any terminating null characters . Because the length of the entire attribute must be a multiple of 4 bytes   the sender pads the name with 1   2   or 3 bytes of all zero bits when necessary .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_KDF
description: AT_KDF is an attribute that the server uses to reference a specific key derivation function . It offers a negotiation capability that can be useful for future evolution of the key derivation functions .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_KDF
description: This is set to 24 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the attribute   MUST be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Derivation Function
description: An enumerated value representing the key derivation function that the server ( or peer ) wishes to use . Value 1 represents the default key derivation function for EAP-AKA '  i.e .  employing CK ' and IK ' as defined in Section 3.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: AT_CHECKCODE
description: When used within EAP-AKA '  the AT_CHECKCODE attribute is changed as follows . First   a 32-byte value is needed to accommodate a 256-bit hash output :
:LABEL: field

name: AT_BIDDING
description: This is set to 136 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the attribute   MUST be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: This bit is set to 1 if the sender supports EAP-AKA '  is willing to use it   and prefers it over EAP-AKA . Otherwise   it should be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field MUST be set to zero when sent and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Willingness
description: Willingness - is an 8-bit unsigned integer field that specifies the willingness of the router to flood link-state information on behalf of other routers . It can be set to any integer value from 1 to 6 . By default   a router SHOULD advertise a willingness of WILL_DEFAULT = 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved - is an 8-bit field that SHOULD be cleared (' 0 ') on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved - is a 14-bit field that SHOULD be cleared (' 0 ') on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R - is a binary flag   cleared (' 0 ') if the costs advertised in the TLV are direct ( i.e .  the costs of the links from the router to the neighbors )  or set (' 1 ') if the costs advertised are reverse ( i.e .  the costs of the links from the neighbors to the router ). By default   R is cleared (' 0 ').
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U - is a binary flag   cleared (' 0 ') if the cost for each link from the sending router and to each advertised neighbor is explicitly included ( shown in Figure 3 )  or set (' 1 ') if a single metric value is included that applies to all links ( shown in Figure 4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Cost n
description: Cost n - is an 8-bit unsigned integer field that specifies the cost of the link   in the direction specified by the R flag   between this router and the neighbor listed at the n-th position in the Hello packet when counting from the beginning of the Hello packet and with the first neighbor being at position 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding - is a 16-bit field that SHOULD be cleared (' 0 ') on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on reception . Padding is included in order that the TLV is 32-bit aligned . Padding MUST be included when the TLV contains an even number of Cost fields and MUST NOT be included otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved - is a 6-bit field that SHOULD be cleared (' 0 ') on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U - is a binary flag   cleared (' 0 ') if the cost for each link from each advertised neighbor in the PMPR TLV and to the sending router is explicitly included ( as shown in Figure 6 )  or set (' 1 ') if a single metric value is included that applies to all links ( as shown in Figure 7 ).
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S - is a binary flag   cleared (' 0 ') if the router brings up adjacencies only with neighbors in its MPR set and MPR-selector set   as per Section 5.3   or set (' 1 ') if the router brings up adjacencies with all MANET neighbors as a Synch router   as per Section 5.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor ID
description: Neighbor ID - is a 32-bit field that specifies the router ID of a symmetric 1-hop neighbor of an OSPFv3 MANET interface of the router .
:LABEL: field

name: Cost n
description: Cost n - is a 16-bit unsigned integer field that specifies the cost of the link in the direction from the n-th listed advertised neighbor in the PMPR TLV and towards this router . A default value of 0xFFFF ( i.e .  infinity ) MUST be advertised unless information received via Hello packets from the neighbor specifies otherwise   in which case the received information MUST be advertised . If a neighbor is reachable via more than one interface   the cost advertised MUST be the minimum of the costs by which that neighbor can be reached .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding - is a 16-bit field that SHOULD be cleared (' 0 ') on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on reception . Padding is included in order that the PMPR TLV is 32-bit aligned . Padding MUST be included when the TLV contains an odd number of Cost fields and MUST NOT be included otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 152 ( Dual-Stack Mobile IPv4 ( DSMIPv4 ) Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 1 ( IPv6 Prefix Request )
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix; all insignificant ( low-order ) bits ( beyond the Prefix Length ) MUST be set to 0 by the originator of the option and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 152 ( DSMIPv4 Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 2 ( IPv6 Prefix Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: A value indicating the result of the registration request with respect to the IPv6 home prefix registration . See below for currently defined Codes .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Indicates the prefix length of the prefix included in the Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix field . A value of 255 indicates that a link - local address is included in the Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Set to 0 by the sender   ignored by the receiver
:LABEL: field

name: Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix
description: A sixteen-byte field containing the Mobile IPv6 Network Prefix; all insignificant ( low-order ) bits ( beyond the Prefix Length ) MUST be set to 0 by the originator of the option and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 152 ( DSMIPv4 Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: 3 ( IPv6 Tunneling Mode )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Set to 0 by the sender   ignored by the receiver
:LABEL: field

name: CT
description: CT ( Class-Type ): A set of Traffic Trunks governed by a set of bandwidth constraints . Used for the purpose of link bandwidth allocation   constraint-based routing and admission control . A given Traffic Trunk belongs to the same CT on all links .
:LABEL: field

name: CT
description: CT : 3-bit field that indicates the Class-Type . Values allowed are 1   2   ...   7 . The value of 0 is Reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 29-bit reserved field . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: IE
description: Information Element ( IE ): A discrete data unit appended to an IAX frame that specifies user - or call-specific data .
:LABEL: field

name: Source call number
description: This 15-bit value specifies the call number the transmitting client uses to identify this call . The source call number for an active call MUST NOT be in use by another call on the same client . Call numbers MAY be reused once a call is no longer active   i.e .  either when there is positive acknowledgment that the call has been destroyed or when all possible timeouts for the call have expired .
:LABEL: field

name: OSeqno
description: The 8-bit OSeqno field is the outbound stream sequence number . Upon initialization of a call   its value is 0 . It increases incrementally as Full Frames are sent . When the counter overflows   it silently resets to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: ISeqno
description: The 8-bit ISeqno field is the inbound stream sequence number . Upon initialization of a call   its value is 0 . It increases incrementally as Full Frames are received . At any time   the ISeqno of a call represents the next expected inbound stream sequence number . When the counter overflows   it silently resets to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Source call number
description: The source call number is the number that is used by the transmitting peer to identify the current call .
:LABEL: field

name: time-stamp
description: Mini frames carry a 16-bit time-stamp   which is the lower 16 bits of the transmitting peer's full 32-bit time-stamp for the call . The time-stamp allows synchronization of incoming frames so that they MAY be processed in chronological order instead of the ( possibly different ) order in which they are received . The 16-bit time-stamp wraps after 65.536 seconds   at which point a full frame SHOULD be sent to notify the remote peer that its time-stamp has been reset . A call MUST continue to send mini frames starting with time-stamp 0 even if acknowledgment of the resynchronization is not received .
:LABEL: field

name: Meta Indicator
description: The meta indicator is a 15-bit field of all zeroes   used to indicate that the frame is a Meta Frame . Meta Frames are identifiable because the first 16 bits will always be zero in any Meta Frame   whereas Full or Mini Frames will have either the ' F ' bit set or some ( nonzero ) value for the source call number ( or both ).
:LABEL: field

name: Source call number
description: The call number that is used by the transmitting peer to identify this video call .
:LABEL: field

name: time-stamp
description: Meta video frames carry a 16-bit time-stamp   which is the lower 16 bits of the transmitting peer's full 32-bit time-stamp for the call . When this time-stamp wraps   a Full Frame SHOULD be sent to notify the remote peer that the time-stamp has been reset to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Meta Indicator
description: The meta indicator is a 15-bit field of all zeroes   used to indicate that the frame is a Meta Frame . Meta Frames are identifiable because the first 16 bits will always be zero in any Meta Frame   whereas Full or Mini Frames will have either the ' F ' bit set or some ( nonzero ) value for the source call number ( or both ).
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: This 8-bit field specifies flags for options that apply to a trunked call . The least significant bit of the field is the ' trunk time-stamps ' flag . A value of 0 indicates that the calls in the trunk do not include their individual time-stamps . A value of 1 indicates that the calls do each include their own time - stamp . All other bits are reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: time-stamp
description: Meta trunk frames carry a 32-bit time-stamp   which represents the actual time of transmission of the trunk frame . This is distinct from the time-stamps of the calls included in the trunk .
:LABEL: field

name: TC
description: This three-bit field is used to carry traffic class information   and the change of the name is applicable to all places it occurs in IETF RFCs and other IETF documents .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label : Label Value   20 bits Exp : Experimental Use   3 bits S : Bottom of Stack   1 bit TTL : Time to Live   8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label : Label Value   20 bits TC : Traffic Class field   3 bits S : Bottom of Stack   1 bit TTL : Time to Live   8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: TC
description: TC Traffic Class ( replaces the term EXP )
:LABEL: field

name: hours
description: hours ( 5 bits ) -- 0 to 23; the values 24-31 are reserved
:LABEL: field

name: minutes
description: seconds ( 6 bits ) -- 0 to 59; 60-63 are reserved
:LABEL: field

name: seconds
description: seconds ( 6 bits ) -- 0 to 59; 60-63 are reserved
:LABEL: field

name: frames
description: Note that these fields are larger than the provision in SMPTE 12M   where BCD ( binary-coded decimal ) is used ( and notably   where only two bits are provided for the tens digit of the frame-count   so frame numbers above 39 cannot be represented ).
:LABEL: field

name: max_n
description: max_n the maximum number of encoding symbols generated for any source block .
:LABEL: field

name: m
description: m the length of the elements in the finite field   in bits . In this document   m belongs to { 2..16 }.
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G the number of encoding symbols per group   i.e .  the number of symbols sent in the same packet .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: o G : a non-negative integer indicating the number of encoding symbols per group used for the object . The default value is 1   meaning that each packet contains exactly one symbol . When no G parameter is communicated to the decoder   then the latter MUST assume that G = 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: m
description: o m : The m parameter is the length of the finite field elements   in bits . It also characterizes the number of elements in the finite field : q = 2^^m elements . The default value is m = 8 . When no finite field size parameter is communicated to the decoder   then the latter MUST assume that m = 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: max_n
description: o FEC-OTI-Max-Number-of-Encoding-Symbols ( max_n )
:LABEL: field

name: max_n
description: o FEC-OTI-Max-Number-of-Encoding-Symbols ( max_n )
:LABEL: field

name: m
description: The finite field size parameter   m   defines the number of non-zero elements in this field   which is equal to : q - 1 = 2^^m - 1 . Note that q - 1 is also the theoretical maximum number of encoding symbols that can be produced for a source block . For instance   when m = 8 ( default ) there is a maximum of 2^^8 - 1 = 255 encoding symbols .
:LABEL: field

name: max_n
description: max_n : Maximum number of encoding symbols generated for any source block .
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: n : Number of encoding symbols generated for this source block .
:LABEL: field

name: max_n
description: max_n : Extracted from the received FEC OTI .
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: n
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel Type
description: * Tunnel Type ( 2 octets ): identifies the type of tunneling technology being signaled . This document defines the following types :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: * Value ( variable ): comprised of multiple sub-TLVs . Each sub-TLV consists of three fields : a 1-octet type   1-octet length   and zero or more octets of value . The sub-TLV is structured as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The L bit SHOULD NOT be set   so that the subobject represents a strict hop in the explicit route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Subobject Type for a Path-Key with 32-bit PCE ID ( 64 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: As above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Subobject Type for a Path-Key with 128-bit PCE ID ( 65 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 16 bits - MUST be set to zero on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: F ( Fail - 1 bit ): when set   the requesting PCC requires the computation of a new path for an existing TE LSP that has failed . If the F bit is set   the path of the existing TE LSP MUST be provided in the PCReq message by means of a Record Route Object ( RRO ) defined in [ RFC5440 ]. This allows the path computation to take into account the previous path and reserved resources to avoid double bandwidth booking should the Traffic Engineering Database ( TED ) have not yet been updated or the corresponding resources not be yet been released . This will usually be used in conjunction with the exclusion from the path computation of the failed resource that caused the LSP to fail .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F ( Fail - 1 bit ): when set   the requesting PCC requires the computation of a new path for an existing TE LSP that has failed . If the F bit is set   the path of the existing TE LSP MUST be provided in the PCReq message by means of a Record Route Object ( RRO ) defined in [ RFC5440 ]. This allows the path computation to take into account the previous path and reserved resources to avoid double bandwidth booking should the Traffic Engineering Database ( TED ) have not yet been updated or the corresponding resources not be yet been released . This will usually be used in conjunction with the exclusion from the path computation of the failed resource that caused the LSP to fail .
:LABEL: field

name: LS age
description: As defined in [ RFC5340 ].
:LABEL: field

name: LS type
description: As defined in [ RFC5340 ]. The U-bit MUST be set to 1   and the S1 and S2 bits MUST be set to indicate either area or Autonomous System ( AS ) scoping . The LSA Function Code portion of this field MUST be set to 14   i.e .  the OSPFv3 L1VPN LSA .
:LABEL: field

name: Advertising Router
description: As defined in [ RFC5340 ].
:LABEL: field

description: LS checksum
:LABEL: field

name: LS checksum
description: As defined in [ RFC5340 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L1VPN TLV Type
description: The type of the TLV ( see above ).
:LABEL: field

name: Link-Local Identifier
description: This field is used to support unnumbered links . When an unnumbered PE TE link is represented   this field MUST contain a value advertised by the LSA originator per [ RFC5340 ] in a Router LSA . When a numbered link is represented   this field MUST be set to zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: A field of variable length and of sufficient size to ensure that the TLV is aligned on a 4-byte boundary . This field is only required when the L1VPN Auto-Discovery Information field is not 4-byte aligned . This field MUST be less than 4 bytes long   and MUST NOT be present when the size of L1VPN Auto-Discovery Information field is 4-byte aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header : The payload that follows this header .
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len : 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Shim6 header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : A single bit to distinguish Shim6 Payload Extension headers from control messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header

:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len : 0 ( since the header is 8 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Set to one . A single bit to distinguish this from the Shim6 control messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Receiver Context Tag
description: Receiver Context Tag : 47-bit unsigned integer . Allocated by the receiver to identify the context .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header

:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len : 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Shim6 header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Set to zero . A single bit to distinguish this from the Shim6 Payload Extension header .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 7-bit unsigned integer . Identifies the actual message from the table below . Type codes 0-63 will not trigger R1bis messages on a missing context   while codes 64-127 will trigger R1bis .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : A single bit set to zero that allows Shim6 and HIP to have a common header format yet still distinguishes between Shim6 and HIP messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : 16-bit unsigned integer . The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the entire Shim6 header message   starting with the Shim6
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type-specific : Part of the message that is different for different message types .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len : At least 1   since the header is 16 octets when there are no options .

name: R

name: Responder Nonce

name: Next Header
description: Next Header : NO_NXT_HDR ( 59 ).
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: R

description: Hdr Ext Len : At least 1   since the header is 16 octets . Depends on the specific Error Data .

name: Error Code
description: Error Code : 7-bit field describing the error that generated the Error message . See Error Code list below .
:LABEL: field

name: Pointer
description: Pointer : 16-bit field . Identifies the octet offset within the invoking packet where the error was detected .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet in error
description: Packet in error : As much of invoking packet as possible without the Error message packet exceeding the minimum IPv6 MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 15-bit identifier of the type of option . The options defined in this document are below .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Critical . One   if this parameter is critical and MUST be recognized by the recipient; zero otherwise . An implementation might view the C-bit as part of the Type field by multiplying the type values in this specification by two .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the Contents   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Contents
description: Contents : Parameter-specific   defined by Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Table 3
:LABEL: field

name: Validator
description: Validator : Variable length content whose interpretation is local to the responder .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Padding   0-7 bytes   added if needed . See Section 5.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator List Generation
description: Locator List Generation : 32-bit unsigned integer . Indicates a generation number that is increased by one for each new locator list . This is used to ensure that the index in the Locator Preferences refers to the right version of the locator list .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Locators
description: Num Locators : 8-bit unsigned integer . The number of locators that are included in the option . We call this number " N " below .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Padding   0-7 bytes   added if needed so that the Locators start on a multiple-of-8-octet boundary . Note that for this option   there is never a need to pad at the end since the Locators are a multiple-of-8 - octets in length . This internal padding is included in the Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator List Generation
description: Locator List Generation : 32-bit unsigned integer . Indicates a generation number for the locator list to which the elements should apply .
:LABEL: field

name: Element Len
description: Element Len : 8-bit unsigned integer . The length in octets of each element . This specification defines the cases when the length is 1   2   or 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Padding   0-7 bytes   added if needed . See Section 5.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: CGA Parameter Data Structure
description: CGA Parameter Data Structure : Variable length content . Content defined in [ 2 ] and [ 3 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Padding   0-7 bytes   added if needed . See Section 5.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: CGA Signature
description: CGA Signature : A variable-length field containing a PKCS#1 v1.5 signature   constructed by using the sender's private key over the following sequence of octets :
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding : Padding   0-7 bytes   added if needed . See Section 5.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sender ULID
description: Sender ULID : A 128-bit IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Receiver ULID
description: Receiver ULID : A 128-bit IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Forked Instance Identifier
description: Forked Instance Identifier : 32-bit field containing the identifier of the particular forked instance .
:LABEL: field

name: Sta
description: Sta ( State ) This 2-bit State field is used to inform the peer about the state of the sender . It has three legal values :
:LABEL: field

name: Keepalive Timeout
description: Upon a timeout on the Keepalive Timer   the node sends one last Keepalive message . This can only happen in the Operational state .
:LABEL: field

name: OF Code
description: OF Code ( 2 bytes ): Objective Function code point identifier . IANA manages the " PCE Objective Function " code point registry ( see Section 6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OF Code
description: OF Code ( 2 bytes ): The identifier of the objective function . IANA manages the " PCE Objective Function " code point registry ( see Section 6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 2 bytes ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The L bit SHOULD NOT be set   so that the subobject represents a strict hop in the explicit route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Subobject Type for a Path Key with a 32-bit PCE-ID as assigned by IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: As above .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Subobject Type for a Path Key with a 128-bit PCE-ID as assigned by IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The Length is always 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix-len
description: The length of the prefix allocated to the mobile node . If only a single address is allocated   this field MUST be set to 32 . In the first binding update requesting a prefix   the field contains the prefix length requested . However   in the following binding updates   this field must contain the length of the prefix allocated . A value of zero is invalid and MUST be considered an error .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: A flag indicating   when set   that the mobile node requests a mobile network prefix . This flag is only relevant for new requests   and must be ignored for binding refreshes .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future use . It MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: When set   this flag indicates a request for forcing UDP encapsulation regardless of whether a NAT is present on the path between the mobile node and the home agent . This flag may be set by the mobile node if it is required to use UDP encapsulation regardless of the presence of a NAT . This flag SHOULD NOT be set when the mobile node is configured with an IPv6 care-of address -- with the exception of the scenario mentioned in Section 4.4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Indicates success or failure for the IPv4 home address binding . Values from 0 to 127 indicate success . Higher values indicate failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Pref-len
description: The prefix length of the address allocated . This field is only valid in case of success and MUST be set to zero and ignored in case of failure . This field overrides what the mobile node requested ( if not equal to the requested length ).
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: This field is reserved for future use . It MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: This flag indicates to the mobile node that UDP encapsulation is required . When set   this flag indicates that the mobile node MUST use UDP encapsulation even if a NAT is not located between the mobile node and home agent . This flag SHOULD NOT be set when the mobile node is assigned an IPv6 care-of address -- with the exception of accommodating the scenarios discussed in Section 4.4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future use . It MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: After the mobile node detects movement   it configures a new care-of address . If the mobile node is in an IPv4-only network   it removes binding update list entries for correspondent nodes   since route optimisation cannot be supported . This may cause inbound packet losses   as remote correspondent nodes are unaware of such movement . To avoid confusion in the correspondent node   the mobile node SHOULD deregister its binding with each correspondent node by sending a deregistration binding update . The deregistration binding update message is tunnelled to the home agent and onto the correspondent node . This is done after the mobile node updates the home agent with its new location as discussed below .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 Length : Variable
:LABEL: field

name: Delete Order
description: Delete Order : 32-bit integer that indicates the order in which the old TE LSP should be removed .
:LABEL: field

name: Setup Order
description: Setup Order : 32-bit integer that indicates the order in which the new TE LSP should be setup .
:LABEL: field

name: MH
description: MH ( Max Hop : 8 bits ): 8-bit integer that indicates the maximum hop count for all the TE LSPs .
:LABEL: field

name: MU
description: MU ( Max Utilization Percentage : 8 bits ) : 8-bit integer that indicates the upper-bound utilization percentage by which all links should be bound . Utilization = ( Link Capacity - Allocated Bandwidth on the Link)/ Link Capacity . MU is intended to be an integer that can only be between 0 and 100 .
:LABEL: field

name: mU
description: mU ( minimum Utilization Percentage : 8 bits ) : 8-bit integer that indicates the lower-bound utilization percentage by which all links should be bound . mU is intended to be an integer that can only be between 0 and 100 .
:LABEL: field

name: OB
description: OB ( Over Booking factor Percentage : 8 bits ) : 8-bit integer that indicates the overbooking percentage that allows the reserved bandwidth to be overbooked on each link beyond its physical capacity limit . The value   for example   10% means that 110 Mbps can be reserved on a 100 Mbps link .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U-bit : Unknown TLV bit   as described in [ RFC5036 ]. The value could be either 0 or 1 as specified in the Capability document associated with the given capability .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F-bit : Forward unknown TLV bit   as described in [ RFC5036 ]. The value of this bit MUST be 0 since a Capability Parameter TLV is sent only in Initialization and Capability messages   which are not forwarded .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Code Point
description: TLV Code Point : The TLV type that identifies a specific capability . This is an IANA-assigned code point ( from TLV Type namespace ) for a given capability as requested in the associated capability document .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-bit : The State Bit . It indicates whether the sender is advertising or withdrawing the capability corresponding to the TLV code point . The State Bit value is used as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 47 ( Proxy Mobile IPv4 Non-Skippable Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: 1 ( PMIPv4 Per-Node Authentication Method )
:LABEL: field

name: Method
description: An 8-bit field that specifies the authentication type for protecting the signaling messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 147 ( Proxy Mobile IPv4 Skippable Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the extension in octets   excluding Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: 1 ( PMIPv4 Interface ID )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 147 ( Proxy Mobile IPv4 Skippable Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the extension in octets   excluding Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: 2 ( PMIPv4 Device ID )
:LABEL: field

name: ID-Type
description: An 8-bit field that specifies the device ID type .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 147 ( Proxy Mobile IPv4 Skippable Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the extension in octets   excluding Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: 3 ( PMIPv4 Subscriber ID )
:LABEL: field

name: ID-Type
description: An 8-bit field that specifies the subscriber ID type .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 147 ( Proxy Mobile IPv4 Skippable Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Type
description: 4 ( Access Technology Type )
:LABEL: field

name: Tech-Type
description: An 8-bit field that specifies the access technology through which the mobile device is connected to the access network .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Handover : A process of terminating existing connectivity and obtaining new IP connectivity .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Handover Initiate ( HI ): A message from the PAR to the NAR regarding an MN's handover .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: Handover Acknowledge ( HAck ): A message from the NAR to the PAR as a response to HI .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: The MN expects a PrRtAdv in response to its RtSolPr message . If the MN does not receive a PrRtAdv message even after RTSOLPR_RETRIES   it must assume that the PAR does not support the fast handover protocol and stop sending any more RtSolPr messages .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 154
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code : 0
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The ICMPv6 checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : MUST be set by the sender so that replies can be matched to this Solicitation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 154
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : The ICMPv6 checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: Identifier : Copied from the Router Solicitation for Proxy Advertisement or set to zero if unsolicited .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: The Handover Initiate ( HI ) is a Mobility Header message sent by an Access Router ( typically a PAR ) to another access router ( typically a NAR ) to initiate the process of an MN's handover .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence #
description: Sequence #: MUST be set by the sender so replies can be matched to this message .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: The Handover Acknowledge message is a new Mobility Header message that MUST be sent ( typically by the NAR to the PAR ) as a reply to the Handover Initiate message .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence #
description: Sequence #: Copied from the corresponding field in the HI message to which this message is a response   to enable the receiver to match this HAck message with an outstanding HI message .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : This field is unused . MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The requested time in seconds for which the sender wishes to have a binding .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the disposition of the Fast Binding Update . Values of the Status field that are less than 128 indicate that the Binding Update was accepted by the receiving node . The following such Status values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Sequence Number : Copied from the FBU message for use by the MN in matching this acknowledgment with an outstanding FBU .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The granted lifetime in seconds for which the sender of this message will retain a binding for traffic redirection .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The size of this option in 8 octets including the Type   Option-Code   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The size of this option in 8 octets including the Type   Option-Code   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : 8-bit unsigned integer that indicates the length of the IPv6 Address Prefix . The value ranges from 0 to 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The size of this option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The size of this option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : 8-bit unsigned integer that indicates the length of the IPv6 Address Prefix . The value ranges from 0 to 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The size of this option in 8 octets including the Type   Option-Code   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The size of this option in 8 octets including the Type   Option-Code   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The size of this option in octets not including the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The size of this option in octets not including the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 21
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: SPI : Security Parameter Index . SPI = 0 is reserved for the Authenticator computed using SEND-based handover keys .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI : Security Parameter Index . SPI = 0 is reserved for the Authenticator computed using SEND-based handover keys .
:LABEL: field

name: Authenticator
description: Authenticator : Same as in RFC 3775   with " correspondent " replaced by the PAR's IP address   and Kbm ( binding management key ) replaced by the shared key between the MN and the PAR .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in 8 octets . The length is 1 when a new CoA is not supplied . The length is 3 when a new CoA is present ( immediately following the Reserved field )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in 8 octets . The length is 1 when a new CoA is not supplied . The length is 3 when a new CoA is present ( immediately following the Reserved field )
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the disposition of the Unsolicited Neighbor Advertisement message . The following Status values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : 28-bit field . Set by the tunnel client . Value is increased by one for every new packet sent to the tunnel broker . The return packet from the broker contains the unaltered sequence number .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp : 32-bit field . Set by the tunnel client . Generated from the client local-time value . The return packet from the broker contains the unaltered timestamp .
:LABEL: field

name: BCN
description: BCN Backward Credit Notification . The BCN represents the number of remaining credits at the local node that were granted by peer node . The local node uses these credits to transmit payload back to the peer node . BCN ranges from 0-65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: FCN
description: FCN Forward Credit Notification . The FCN represents the credits that the local node is granting to the peer node . The peer node uses these granted credits to transmit payload back to the local node . FCN ranges from 0-65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Resources
description: Resources - a percentage   0-100   representing the amount of remaining or available resources   such as battery power . If resources cannot be calculated   a value of 100 should be reported .
:LABEL: field

name: RLQ
description: Relative Link Quality ( RLQ ) - a non-dimensional number   0-100   representing the relative link quality . A value of 100 represents a link of the highest quality . If the RLQ cannot be calculated   a value of 100 should be reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved - reserved fields are zeroed unless otherwise specified .
:LABEL: field

name: CD
description: CD Scale : 00 == kbit/s ( default ) 01 == Mbit/s 10 == Gbit/s 11 == Tbit/s
:LABEL: field

name: MD
description: MD Scale : 00 == kbit/s ( default ) 01 == Mbit/s 10 == Gbit/s 11 == Tbit/s
:LABEL: field

name: Current Datarate
description: Current Datarate - the Current Datarate   in un-scaled units per second   achieved on the RLP link . If the Radio makes no distinction between Maximum Datarate and Current Datarate   Current Datarate should equal the Maximum Datarate . When metrics are reported   the Current Datarate must be reported . The Current Datarate must be less than or equal to the Maximum Datarate .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Datarate
description: Maximum Datarate - the maximum theoretical data rate   in un-scaled units per second   that the RLP link is capable of providing . When metrics are reported   the Maximum Datarate must be reported .
:LABEL: field

name: Index
description: The 16-bit unsigned integer value allows this attribute to provide information relating to the information included in the Location - Data Attribute to which it refers ( via the Index ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: This field indicates the content of the location profile carried in the Location-Data Attribute . Two profiles are defined in this document -- namely   a civic location profile ( see Section 4.3.1 ) that uses value ( 0 ) and a geospatial location profile ( see Section 4.3.2 ) that uses the value ( 1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Entity
description: This field encodes which location this attribute refers to as an unsigned 8-bit integer value . Location information can refer to different entities . This document registers two entity values   namely :
:LABEL: field

name: Sighting Time
description: This field indicates when the location information was accurate . The data type of this field is a string   and the content is expressed in the 64-bit Network Time Protocol ( NTP ) timestamp format [ RFC1305 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Time-to-Live
description: This field gives a hint regarding for how long location information should be considered current . The data type of this field is a string and the content is expressed in the 64-bit Network Time Protocol ( NTP ) timestamp format [ RFC1305 ]. Note that the Time-to-Live field is different than the Retention Expires field used in the Basic-Location-Policy-Rules Attribute   see Section 4.4 . The Retention Expires field indicates the time the recipient is no longer permitted to possess the location information .
:LABEL: field

name: Index
description: The 16-bit unsigned integer value allows this attribute to associate the Location-Data Attribute with the Location - Information Attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The Flags field is a bit mask . Only the first bit ( R ) is defined in this document   and it corresponds to the Retransmission Allowed field :
:LABEL: field

name: Retention Expires
description: This field specifies an absolute date at which time the Recipient is no longer permitted to possess the location information . The data type of this field is a string and the format is a 64-bit NTP timestamp [ RFC1305 ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Version(V ): 2 bits Set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Padding(P ): 1 bit If the padding bit is set   the packet contains one or more additional padding octets at the end   which are not part of the payload . The last octet of the padding contains a count of how many padding octets should be ignored   including itself . Padding may be needed by some encryption algorithms with fixed block sizes or for carrying several RTP packets in a lower-layer protocol data unit ( see [ 1 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: Extension(X ): 1 bit Defined by the RTP profile used .
:LABEL: field

name: CC
description: CSRC count(CC ): 4 bits See RFC 3550 [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker ( M ): 1 bit Set to 1 if the packet is the first packet after a silence period; otherwise   it MUST be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): 7 bits The assignment of an RTP payload type for this packet format is outside the scope of this document; it is specified by the RTP profile under which this payload format is used   or signaled dynamically out-of-band ( e.g .  using the Session Description Protocol ( SDP )).
:LABEL: field

name: sequence number
description: sequence number : 16 bits A sequential number for the RTP packet . It ranges from 0 to 65535 and repeats itself periodically .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Continuation Flag ( C ) : 1 bit The packet that corresponds to the last part of the audio frame data in a fragmentation MUST have this bit set to 0; otherwise   it's set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: FrgNo
description: Fragment Number ( FrgNo ): 3 bits In the event of data fragmentation   this value is one for the first packet   and increases sequentially for the remaining fragmented data
:LABEL: field

name: NFrames
description: Number of Frames ( NFrames ): 4 bits The number of audio frames in this packet are field value + 1 . This allows for a maximum of 16 ATRAC-encoded audio frames per packet   with 0 indicating one audio frame . Each audio frame MUST be complete in the packet if fragmentation is not applied . In the case of fragmentation   the data for only one audio frame is allowed to be fragmented   and this value MUST be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Layer Type Flag ( E ): 1 bit Set to 1 if the corresponding ATRAC frame is from an enhancement layer . 0 indicates a base layer encoded frame .
:LABEL: field

name: ATRAC frame
description: ATRAC frame : The encoded ATRAC audio data .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: o transition from one to zero of the Continuation bit ( C )
:LABEL: field

name: channelID
description: channelID : Indicates the number of channels and channel layout according to the table1 in Section 7.4 . Note that this layout is different from that proposed in RFC 3551 [ 3 ]. However   as channelID = 0 defines an ambiguous channel layout   the channel mapping defined in Section 4.1 of [ 3 ] could be used . Permissible values are 0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7 .
:LABEL: field

name: channelID
description: channelID : Indicates the number of channels and channel layout according to the table1 in Section 7.4 . Note that this layout is different from that proposed in RFC 3551 [ 3 ]. However   as channelID = 0 defines an ambiguous channel layout   the channel mapping defined in Section 4.1 of [ 3 ] could be used in this case . Permissible values are 0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7 .
:LABEL: field

name: ACH
description: ACH : Associated Channel Header
:LABEL: field

name: GAL
description: G-ACh packet : Any packet containing a message belonging to a protocol that is carried on a PW   LSP   or MPLS Section associated control channel . Examples include maintenance protocols such as OAM functions   signaling communications   or management communications .
:LABEL: field

name: ACH TLV Header
description: The ACH TLV Header defines the length of the set of ACH TLVs that follow .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 133 for Framed-Management-Protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is a four-octet enumerated value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 134 for Management-Transport-Protection .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is a four-octet enumerated value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 135 for Management-Policy-Id .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 136 for Management-Privilege-Level .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is a four-octet Integer   denoting a management privilege level .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Set to 14 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Hello Sequence Number : A circular two-octet unsigned integer indicating the current HSN for the transmitting interface . The HSN for the interface is incremented by 1 ( modulo 2^16 ) every time a ( differential or full ) Hello is sent on the interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Hello Sequence Number
description: o Hello Sequence Number : A circular two-octet unsigned integer indicating the current HSN for the transmitting interface . The HSN for the interface is incremented by 1 ( modulo 2^16 ) every time a ( differential or full ) Hello is sent on the interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : Set to 0 . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o D ( 1 bit ): Set to 1 for a differential Hello and 0 for a full Hello .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D ( 1 bit ): Set to 1 for a differential Hello and 0 for a full Hello .
:LABEL: field

name: N1
description: o N1 ( 8 bits ): The number of neighbors listed in the Hello that are in state Down . N1 is zero if the Hello is not differential .
:LABEL: field

name: N2
description: o N2 ( 8 bits ): The number of neighbors listed in the Hello that are in state Init .
:LABEL: field

name: N3
description: o N3 ( 8 bits ): The number of neighbors listed in the Hello that are Dependent .
:LABEL: field

name: N4
description: o N4 ( 8 bits ): The number of neighbors listed in the Hello that are Selected Advertised Neighbors .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Set to 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o DR : The same Router ID that is included in the DR field of a Hello sent by the router ( see Section A.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: DR
description: o DR : The same Router ID that is included in the DR field of a Hello sent by the router ( see Section A.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Backup DR
description: o Backup DR : The same Router ID that is included in the Backup DR field of a Hello sent by the router ( see Section A.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : Set to 4 + 6*N if the I bit is 1   and to 4 + 2*N if the I bit is 0   where N is the number of neighbors included in the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Set to 4 + 6*N if the I bit is 1   and to 4 + 2*N if the I bit is 0   where N is the number of neighbors included in the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Default Metric
description: o Default Metric : If the I bit is 1   this is the link metric that applies to every bidirectional neighbor listed in the body of the Hello whose RID is not listed in the Metric TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: DR
description: o DR : This field is the router's Parent   or is 0.0.0.0 if the Parent is null . The Parent of an MDR is always the router's own RID .
:LABEL: field

name: Backup DR
description: o Backup DR : This field is the router's Backup Parent   or is 0.0.0.0 if the Backup Parent is null . The Backup Parent of a BMDR is always the router's own RID .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: An alarm or fault has occurred at the local Attachment Circuit such that it is unable to receive traffic . It can still transmit traffic .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: A fault has occurred at the local Attachment Circuit such that it is unable to transmit traffic . It can still receive traffic .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: A fault has occurred in the receive direction between the local endpoint and the remote L2TP endpoint .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: A fault has occurred in the transmit direction between the local endpoint and the remote L2TP endpoint .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The pseudowire has been placed into a Standby mode   which means that although it was signaled ( during setup of the PW ) and is operational   it is NOT switching user traffic . Any received user traffic SHOULD be dropped . User traffic MUST NOT be transmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o The ( A ) bit MUST NOT be set until all fault status bits are cleared . This behavior allows an endpoint to be backwards compatible with a remote endpoint that does not understand these new status bits .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o The ( S ) bit can be set in conjunction with any other bit   including ( A ). A pseudowire endpoint in Standby ( S bit set ) can be up/active/ready ( A bit set ) or experiencing a fault ( A bit cleared and one or more of the fault status bits ( R   T   I   E ) set .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o The ( S ) bit can be set in conjunction with any other bit   including ( A ). A pseudowire endpoint in Standby ( S bit set ) can be up/active/ready ( A bit set ) or experiencing a fault ( A bit cleared and one or more of the fault status bits ( R   T   I   E ) set .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o The usage of the ( N ) bit has been deprecated .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: o The usage of the ( N ) bit has been deprecated .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Dynamic Hostname TLV Type ( 7 ; see Section 6 )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Total length of the hostname ( Value field ) in octets   not including the optional padding .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: When this flag is set   all the binding cache entries for a mobile node are replaced by new entries registering with this Binding Update message . This flag is only used when the BID mobility option is carried with the Binding Update .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: 6-bit Reserved field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields . It MUST be set to either 4   8   or 20 depending on the Care-of Address field . When the care-of address is not carried by this option   the length value MUST be set to 4 . If the IPv4 care-of address is stored in the Care-of Address field   the length MUST be 8 . Otherwise   the length value MUST be set to 20 for IPv6 care-of addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: The Status field is an 8-bit unsigned integer . When the Binding Identifier mobility option is included in a Binding Acknowledgement   this field overwrites the Status field in the Binding Acknowledgement only for this BID . If this field is set to zero   the receiver ignores this field and uses the registration status stored in the Binding Acknowledgement message . The receiver MUST ignore this field if the Binding Identifier mobility option is not carried within either the Binding Acknowledgement or the Care-of Test messages . The possible status codes are the same as the status codes of the Binding Acknowledgement . This Status field is also used to carry error information related to the care-of address test in the Care-of Test message .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: This flag indicates that the mobile node registers multiple bindings to the home agent while it is attached to the home link . This flag is valid only for a Binding Update sent to the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: 7-bit Reserved field . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender   and SHOULD be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: Indicates the LCT version number . The LCT version number for this specification is 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C=0 indicates the Congestion Control Information ( CCI ) field is 32 bits in length . C=1 indicates the CCI field is 64 bits in length . C=2 indicates the CCI field is 96 bits in length . C=3 indicates the CCI field is 128 bits in length .
