:LABEL: field

name: M
description: This bit is reserved for future point-to-multipoint extensions to BFD . It MUST be zero on both transmit and receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Detect Mult
description: Detection time multiplier . The negotiated transmit interval   multiplied by this value   provides the Detection Time for the receiving system in Asynchronous mode .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of the BFD Control packet   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: My Discriminator
description: A unique   nonzero discriminator value generated by the transmitting system   used to demultiplex multiple BFD sessions between the same pair of systems .
:LABEL: field

name: Your Discriminator
description: The discriminator received from the corresponding remote system . This field reflects back the received value of My Discriminator   or is zero if that value is unknown .
:LABEL: field

name: Desired Min TX Interval
description: This is the minimum interval   in microseconds   that the local system would like to use when transmitting BFD Control packets   less any jitter applied ( see section 6.8.2 ). The value zero is reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: Required Min RX Interval
description: This is the minimum interval   in microseconds   between received BFD Control packets that this system is capable of supporting   less any jitter applied by the sender ( see section 6.8.2 ). If this value is zero   the transmitting system does not want the remote system to send any periodic BFD Control packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Required Min Echo RX Interval
description: This is the minimum interval   in microseconds   between received BFD Echo packets that this system is capable of supporting   less any jitter applied by the sender ( see section 6.8.9 ). If this value is zero   the transmitting system does not support the receipt of BFD Echo packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: The authentication type in use   if the Authentication Present ( A ) bit is set .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Len
description: The length   in bytes   of the authentication section   including the Auth Type and Auth Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: The Authentication Type   which in this case is 1 ( Simple Password ).
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Len
description: The length of the Authentication Section   in bytes . For Simple Password authentication   the length is equal to the password length plus three .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Key ID
description: The authentication key ID in use for this packet . This allows multiple keys to be active simultaneously .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: The Authentication Type   which in this case is 2 ( Keyed MD5 ) or 3 ( Meticulous Keyed MD5 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Len
description: The length of the Authentication Section   in bytes . For Keyed MD5 and Meticulous Keyed MD5 authentication   the length is 24 .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Key ID
description: The authentication key ID in use for this packet . This allows multiple keys to be active simultaneously .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This byte MUST be set to zero on transmit   and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The sequence number for this packet . For Keyed MD5 Authentication   this value is incremented occasionally . For Meticulous Keyed MD5 Authentication   this value is incremented for each successive packet transmitted for a session . This provides protection against replay attacks .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Type
description: The Authentication Type   which in this case is 4 ( Keyed SHA1 ) or 5 ( Meticulous Keyed SHA1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Len
description: The length of the Authentication Section   in bytes . For Keyed SHA1 and Meticulous Keyed SHA1 authentication   the length is 28 .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Key ID
description: The authentication key ID in use for this packet . This allows multiple keys to be active simultaneously .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This byte MUST be set to zero on transmit and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The sequence number for this packet . For Keyed SHA1 Authentication   this value is incremented occasionally . For Meticulous Keyed SHA1 Authentication   this value is incremented for each successive packet transmitted for a session . This provides protection against replay attacks .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: If the Multipoint ( M ) bit is nonzero   the packet MUST be discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Sta
description: Set bfd.RemoteState to the value of the State ( Sta ) field .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: Set bfd.RemoteDemandMode to the value of the Demand ( D ) bit .
:LABEL: field

name: Diag
description: Set to bfd.LocalDiag .
:LABEL: field

name: Sta
description: Set to the value indicated by bfd.SessionState .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Set to 1 if the local system is sending a Poll Sequence   or 0 if not .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: Set to 1 if the local system is responding to a Control packet received with the Poll ( P ) bit set   or 0 if not .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Set to 1 if the local system's BFD implementation is independent of the control plane ( it can continue to function through a disruption of the control plane ).
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: Set to 1 if authentication is in use on this session ( bfd.AuthType is nonzero )  or 0 if not .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: Set to bfd.DemandMode if bfd.SessionState is Up and bfd.RemoteSessionState is Up . Otherwise   it is set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Detect Mult
description: Set to bfd.DetectMult .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Set to the appropriate length   based on the fixed header length ( 24 ) plus any Authentication Section .
:LABEL: field

name: My Discriminator
description: Set to bfd.LocalDiscr .
:LABEL: field

name: Your Discriminator
description: Set to bfd.RemoteDiscr .
:LABEL: field

name: Desired Min TX Interval
description: Set to bfd.DesiredMinTxInterval .
:LABEL: field

name: Required Min RX Interval
description: Set to bfd.RequiredMinRxInterval .
:LABEL: field

name: Required Min Echo RX Interval
description: Set to the minimum required Echo packet receive interval for this session . If this field is set to zero   the local system is unwilling or unable to loop back BFD Echo packets to the remote system   and the remote system will not send Echo packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 24 bits
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L ( Liveness ) - 1 bit : when set   this indicates that the state metric of interest is the PCE's liveness and thus the PCE MUST include a PCE-ID object in the corresponding reply . The L bit MUST always be ignored in a PCMonRep or PCRep message .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G ( General ) - 1 bit : when set   this indicates that the monitoring request is a general monitoring request . When the requested performance metric is specific   the G bit MUST be cleared . The G bit MUST always be ignored in a PCMonRep or PCRep message .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P ( Processing Time ) - 1 bit : the P bit of the MONITORING object carried in a PCMonReq or a PCReq message is set to indicate that the processing times is a metric of interest . If allowed by policy   a PROC-TIME object MUST be inserted in the corresponding PCMonRep or PCRep message . The P bit MUST always be ignored in a PCMonRep or PCRep message .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C ( Overload ) - 1 bit : The C bit of the MONITORING object carried in a PCMonReq or a PCReq message is set to indicate that the overload status is a metric of interest   in which case an OVERLOAD object MUST be inserted in the corresponding PCMonRep or PCRep message . The C bit MUST always be ignored in a PCMonRep or PCRep message .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I ( Incomplete ) - 1 bit : If a PCE supports a received PCMonReq message and that message does not trigger any policy violation   but the PCE cannot provide any of the set of requested performance metrics for unspecified reasons   the PCE MUST set the I bit . The I bit has no meaning in a request and SHOULD be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: E ( Estimated ) - 1 bit : when set   this indicates that the reported metric value is based on estimated processing time as opposed to actual computations .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E ( Estimated ) - 1 bit : when set   this indicates that the reported metric value is based on estimated processing time as opposed to actual computations .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Overload duration - 16 bits : This field indicates the amount of time   in seconds   that the responding PCE expects that it may continue to be overloaded from the time that the response message was generated . The receiver MAY use this value to decide whether or not to send further requests to the same PCE .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 137 for PKM-SS-Cert
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 138 for PKM-CA-Cert
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 139 for PKM-Config-Settings
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Wait Timeout
description: The Auth Wait Timeout field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Authorize wait timeout " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Reauth Wait Timeout
description: The Reauth Wait Timeout field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Reauthorize wait timeout " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Grace Time
description: The Auth Grace Time field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Authorize grace time " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Op Wait Timeout
description: The Op Wait Timeout field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Operational wait timeout " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Rekey Wait Timeout
description: The Rekey Wait Timeout field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Rekey wait timeout " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: TEK Grace Time
description: The TEK Grace Time field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " TEK grace time " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Rej Wait Timeout
description: The Auth Rej Wait Timeout field is 4 octets in length and corresponds to the " Authorize reject wait timeout " field of the 802.16 " PKM configuration settings " attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 140 for PKM-Cryptosuite-List
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: 2 + 3n < 39   where ' n ' is the number of cryptosuite identifiers in the list .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 141 for PKM-SAID
:LABEL: field

name: SAID
description: The SAID field is two octets in length and corresponds to the Value field of the 802.16 PKM SAID attribute
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 142 for PKM-SA-Descriptor
:LABEL: field

name: SAID
description: The SAID field is two octets in length and contains a PKM SAID ( Section 3.5 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SA Type
description: The SA Type field is one octet in length . The contents correspond to those of the Value field of an IEEE 802.16 SA-Type attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Cryptosuite
description: The Cryptosuite field is 3 octets in length . The contents correspond to those of the Value field of an IEEE 802.16 Cryptographic-Suite attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 143 for PKM-AUTH-Key
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The Lifetime field is 4 octets in length and represents the lifetime   in seconds   of the authorization key . For more information   see Section 11.9.4 of [ IEEE.802.16-2004 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence
description: The Sequence field is one octet in length . The contents correspond to those of the Value field of an IEEE 802.16 Key - Sequence-Number attribute ( see [ IEEE.802.16-2004 ]  Section 11.9.5 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Mode
description: Mode ( mode ): 3-bit integer representing the mode   with values defined in Figure 10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Stratum
description: Stratum ( stratum ): 8-bit integer representing the stratum   with values defined in Figure 11 .
:LABEL: field

name: Poll
description: Poll : 8-bit signed integer representing the maximum interval between successive messages   in log2 seconds . Suggested default limits for minimum and maximum poll intervals are 6 and 10   respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Precision : 8-bit signed integer representing the precision of the system clock   in log2 seconds . For instance   a value of - 18 corresponds to a precision of about one microsecond . The precision can be determined when the service first starts up as the minimum time of several iterations to read the system clock .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Delay
description: Root Delay ( rootdelay ): Total round-trip delay to the reference clock   in NTP short format .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Dispersion
description: Root Dispersion ( rootdisp ): Total dispersion to the reference clock   in NTP short format .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference ID
description: Reference ID ( refid ): 32-bit code identifying the particular server or reference clock . The interpretation depends on the value in the stratum field . For packet stratum 0 ( unspecified or invalid )  this is a four-character ASCII [ RFC1345 ] string   called the " kiss code "  used for debugging and monitoring purposes . For stratum 1 ( reference clock )  this is a four-octet   left-justified   zero-padded ASCII string assigned to the reference clock . The authoritative list of Reference Identifiers is maintained by IANA; however   any string beginning with the ASCII character " X " is reserved for unregistered experimentation and development . The identifiers in Figure 12 have been used as ASCII identifiers :
:LABEL: field

name: Key Identifier
description: Key Identifier ( keyid ): 32-bit unsigned integer used by the client and server to designate a secret 128-bit MD5 key .
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Element Type
description: FEC Element Type : One-octet FEC Element Type that specifies the FEC Element Type to be wildcarded . Please see Section 3.4.1 of RFC 5036 .
:LABEL: field

name: Len FEC Type Info
description: Len FEC Type Info : One octet that specifies the length in octets of the FEC Type Specific information field . It MUST be set to 0 if there is no Additional FEC Type-specific Information .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U and F bits : MUST be 1 and 0   respectively   as per Section 3 of LDP Capabilities [ RFC5561 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Two octets . It MUST be set to 0x0001 .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-bit : MUST be 1 ( indicates that capability is being advertised ).
:LABEL: field

name: FEC Element Type
description: FEC Element Type : " Prefix " FEC Element ( 0x02   per RFC 5036 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Len FEC Type Info
description: Address Family : Two-octet quantity containing a value from the " ADDRESS FAMILY NUMBERS " registry on http://www.iana.org .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U - and F-bits : MUST be 1 and 0   respectively   as per Section 3 of LDP Capabilities [ RFC5561 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Upon receiving a Notification with an unrecognized Status Code   an LDP speaker MAY generate a console or system log message for trouble shooting purposes .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: For the purposes of interoperability   compliant EAP-pwd implementations SHALL support the following parameters :
:LABEL: field

name: PRF
description: o PRF : HMAC-SHA256 defined in [ RFC4634 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Either 1 ( for Request ) or 2 ( for Response); see [ RFC3748 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet and aids in matching responses with requests . The Identifier field MUST be changed on each Request packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the length of the EAP packet including the Code   Identifier   Length   Type   and Data fields . Octets outside the range of the Length field should be treated as Data Link Layer padding and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 52 - EAP-pwd
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The L bit ( Length included ) is set to indicate the presence of the two-octet Total-Length field   and MUST be set for the first fragment of a fragmented EAP-pwd message or set of messages .
:LABEL: field

name: PWD-Exch
description: The PWD-Exch field identifies the type of EAP-pwd payload encapsulated in the Data field . This document defines the following values for the PWD-Exch field :
:LABEL: field

name: Total-Length
description: The Total-Length field is two octets in length   and is present only if the L bit is set . This field provides the total length of the EAP-pwd message or set of messages that is being fragmented .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: A router on a mobile node's home network that tunnels datagrams for delivery to the mobile node when it is away from home   and maintains current location information for the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The termination point of a tunnel toward a mobile node   for datagrams forwarded to the mobile node while it is away from home . The protocol can use two different types of care-of address : a " foreign agent care-of address " is an address of a foreign agent with which the mobile node is registered   and a " co-located care - of address " is an externally obtained local address that the mobile node has associated with one of its own network interfaces .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: An IP address that is assigned for an extended period of time to a mobile node . It remains unchanged regardless of where the node is attached to the Internet .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: An index identifying a security context between a pair of nodes   among the contexts available in the Mobility Security Association . SPI values 0 through 255 are reserved and MUST NOT be used in any Mobility Security Association .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Indicates the particular type of Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the Data field within this Extension . The length does NOT include the Type and Length bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length indicates the length ( in bytes ) of the Data field within this Extension . It does NOT include the Type   Length   and Sub-Type bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type is the type   which describes a collection of extensions having a common data type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the extension   in bytes   excluding the extension Type and the extension Length fields . This field MUST be set to 1 plus the total length of the Data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The maximum length of time that the Advertisement is considered valid in the absence of further Advertisements .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Addrs
description: The number of router addresses advertised in this message . Note that in an Agent Advertisement message   the number of router addresses specified in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message MAY be set to 0 . See Section 2.3.1 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 16
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 6 + 4*N )  where 6 accounts for the number of bytes in the Sequence Number   Registration Lifetime   flags   and reserved fields   and N is the number of care-of addresses advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The count of Agent Advertisement messages sent since the agent was initialized ( Section 2.3.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Lifetime
description: The longest lifetime ( measured in seconds ) that this agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . This field has no relation to the " Lifetime " field within the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Registration required . Registration with this foreign agent ( or another foreign agent on this link ) is required even when using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Busy . The foreign agent will not accept registrations from additional mobile nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H Home agent . This agent offers service as a home agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F Foreign agent . This agent offers service as a foreign agent on the link on which this Agent Advertisement message is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use minimal encapsulation [ 15 ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G Generic Routing Encapsulation ( GRE ) encapsulation . This agent implements receiving tunneled datagrams that use GRE encapsulation [ 13 ].
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Foreign agent supports reverse tunneling as specified in [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U Mobility agent supports UDP Tunneling as specified in [ 27 ].
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: X Mobility agent supports Registration Revocation as specified in [ 28 ].
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I Foreign agent supports Regional Registration as specified in [ 29 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The advertised foreign agent care-of address(es ) provided by this foreign agent . An Agent Advertisement MUST include at least one care-of address if the ' F ' bit is set . The number of care-of addresses present is determined by the Length field in the Extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 19 ( Prefix-Lengths Extension )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length N   where N is the value ( possibly zero ) of the Num Addrs field in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the Agent Advertisement .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: The number of leading bits that define the network number of the corresponding router address listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message . The prefix length for each router address is encoded as a separate byte   in the order that the router addresses are listed in the ICMP Router Advertisement portion of the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 ( Registration Request )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Simultaneous bindings . If the ' S ' bit is set   the mobile node is requesting that the home agent retain its prior mobility bindings   as described in Section 3.6.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B Broadcast datagrams . If the ' B ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that the home agent tunnel to it any broadcast datagrams that it receives on the home network   as described in Section 4.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D Decapsulation by mobile node . If the ' D ' bit is set   the mobile node will itself decapsulate datagrams that are sent to the care-of address . That is   the mobile node is using a co-located care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Minimal encapsulation . If the ' M ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use minimal encapsulation [ 16 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G GRE encapsulation . If the ' G ' bit is set   the mobile node requests that its home agent use GRE encapsulation [ 13 ] for datagrams tunneled to the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: r Sent as zero; ignored on reception . SHOULD NOT be allocated for any other uses .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T Reverse Tunneling requested; see [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: x Sent as zero; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates a request for deregistration . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The IP address for the end of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number   constructed by the mobile node   used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . See Sections 5.4 and 5.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 ( Registration Reply )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: A value indicating the result of the Registration Request . See below for a list of currently defined code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: If the Code field indicates that the registration was accepted   the Lifetime field is set to the number of seconds remaining before the registration is considered expired . A value of zero indicates that the mobile node has been deregistered . A value of 0xffff indicates infinity . If the Code field indicates that the registration was denied   the contents of the Lifetime field are unspecified and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent
description: The IP address of the mobile node's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number used for matching Registration Requests with Registration Replies   and for protecting against replay attacks of registration messages . The value is based on the Identification field from the Registration Request message from the mobile node   and on the style of replay protection used in the security context between the mobile node and its home agent ( defined by the Mobility Security Association between them   and SPI value in the authorization-enabling extension ). See Sections 5.4 and 5.7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The default authentication algorithm uses HMAC-MD5 [ 10 ] to compute a 128-bit " message digest " of the registration message . The data over which the HMAC is computed is defined as :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Note that the Authenticator field itself and the UDP header are NOT included in the computation of the default Authenticator value . See Section 5.1 for information about support requirements for message authentication codes   which are to be used with the various authentication Extensions .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 32
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 33
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 4 plus the number of bytes in the Authenticator .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 34
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SPI
description: SPI Security Parameter Index ( 4 bytes ). An opaque identifier ( see Section 1.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: In this case   the Lifetime field in the Registration Reply will contain the maximum Lifetime value that the foreign agent is willing to accept in any Registration Request . The mobile node MAY attempt to register with this same agent   using a Lifetime in the Registration Request that MUST be less than or equal to the value specified in the Reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 133 : ( Denied by home agent   registration Identification mismatch )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: This code is returned by a home agent when the mobile node is performing dynamic home agent address resolution as described in Sections 3.6.1.1 and 3.6.1.2 . In this case   the Home Agent field within the Reply will contain the unicast IP address of the home agent returning the Reply . The mobile node MAY then attempt to register with this home agent in future Registration Requests . In addition   the mobile node SHOULD adjust the parameters it uses to compute the Identification field based upon the corresponding field in the Registration Reply   before issuing any future Registration Requests .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: H : Header Type ( 1 bit ). Shall be set to zero   indicating that it is a Generic MAC PDU .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : Encryption Control . 0 = Payload is not encrypted; 1 = Payload is encrypted .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: C : Cyclic Redundancy Check ( CRC ) Indicator . 1 = CRC is included; 0 = No CRC is included .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Cyclic Redundancy Check ( CRC ) Indicator . 1 = CRC is included; 0 = No CRC is included .
:LABEL: field

name: EKS
description: LEN : The Length   in bytes   of the MAC PDU   including the MAC header and the CRC   if present ( 11 bits ).
:LABEL: field

name: LEN
description: LEN : The Length   in bytes   of the MAC PDU   including the MAC header and the CRC   if present ( 11 bits ).
:LABEL: field

name: HCS
description: CRC : An optional 8-bit field . The CRC is appended to the PDU after encryption .
:LABEL: field

name: TYPE
description: TYPE : This field indicates the subheaders ( Mesh subheader   Fragmentation subheader   Packing subheader   etc .) and special payload types ( e.g .  Automatic Repeat reQuest ( ARQ )) present in the message payload .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Previous Access Network ( P-AN ): The access network to which the Mobile Node ( MN ) is attached before handover .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Same as [ RFC5568 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code Code values 0 through 4 and 128 through 130 are defined in [ RFC5568 ]. When the ' P ' flag is set   the meaning of Code value 0 is as defined in this specification; 128 through 130 are reused; and 5   6   131   and 132 are newly defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: Option-Type 40
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Length
description: Option-Length The length in octets of this option   not including the Option Type and Option Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: Option-Type 41
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Length
description: Option-Length 18 or 6
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Code
description: 1 IPv6 address of the local mobility anchor ( LMAA )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Type
description: Option-Type 42
:LABEL: field

name: Option-Length
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Identifier
description: The Interface Identifier value used for the mobile node's IPv6 Link-local address in the P-AN .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: 0 ) Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4MaskLen
description: IPv4MaskLen The number of high-order bits that are identical across all CE IPv4 addresses within a given 6rd domain . For example   if there are no identical bits   IPv4MaskLen is 0 and the entire CE IPv4 address is used to create the 6rd delegated prefix . If there are 8 identical bits ( e.g .  the Private IPv4 address range 10.0.0.0/8 is being used )  IPv4MaskLen is equal to 8 and IPv4MaskLen high-order bits are stripped from the IPv4 address before constructing the corresponding 6rd delegated prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4MaskLen
description: IPv4MaskLen The number of high-order bits that are identical across all CE IPv4 addresses within a given 6rd domain . This may be any value between 0 and 32 . Any value greater than 32 is invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type As specified in Section 2.2 of [ RFC4578 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Major
description: Major As specified in Section 2.2 of [ RFC4578 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Minor
description: The list of valid Type   Major   and Minor values is maintained in the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface specification [ UEFI23 ].
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: Datagram Mode ( D-mode ): A mode of sending GIST messages between nodes without using any transport layer state or security protection . Datagram mode uses UDP encapsulation   with source and destination IP addresses derived either from the flow definition or previously discovered adjacency information .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Connection Mode ( C-mode ): A mode of sending GIST messages directly between nodes using point-to-point messaging associations ( see below ). Connection mode allows the re-use of existing transport and security protocols where such functionality is required .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Routing Information
description: Message Routing Information ( MRI ): The set of data item values that is used to route a signalling message according to a particular MRM; for example   for routing along a flow path   the MRI includes flow source and destination addresses   and protocol and port numbers . See Section 3.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: Datagram mode ( D-mode ): used for small   infrequent messages with modest delay constraints and no security requirements . A special case of D-mode called Query-mode ( Q-mode ) is used when no routing state exists .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: Connection mode ( C-mode ): used for all other signalling traffic . In particular   it can support large messages and channel security and provides congestion control for signalling traffic .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Routing Information
description: Message Routing Information ( MRI ): This defines the method to be used to route the message   the direction in which to send the message   and any associated addressing information; see Section 3.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLP Identifier ( NSLPID ): This is an IANA-assigned identifier associated with the NSLP that is generating messages for this flow; see Section 3.8 . The inclusion of this identifier allows the routing state to be different for different NSLPs .
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q-mode encapsulation : Where GIST is sending messages to be intercepted by the appropriate peer rather than directly addressed to it ( in particular   Query messages )  these are UDP encapsulated   and MAY include an IP Router Alert Option ( RAO ) if required by the MRM . Each GIST node can therefore see every such message   but unless the message exactly matches the Q-mode encapsulation rules ( Section 5.3.2 ) it MUST be forwarded transparently at the IP level . If it does match   GIST MUST check the NSLPID in the common header . The case where the NSLPID does not match a local signalling application at all is considered below in Section 4.3.4; otherwise   the message MUST be passed up to the GIST layer for further processing .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version : The version number of the GIST protocol . This specification defines GIST version 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The number of 32-bit words in the message following the common header .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: Upper layer identifier ( NSLPID ): This gives the specific NSLP for which this message is used .
:LABEL: field

name: MA-Protocol-ID
description: o A specification of the ( non-negotiable ) policies about how the protocol should be used   for example   in which direction a connection should be opened .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Routing Information
description: For the path-coupled MRM   the message routing information ( MRI ) is conceptually the Flow Identifier as in the NSIS framework [ 29 ]. Minimally   this could just be the flow destination address; however   to account for policy-based forwarding and other issues a more complete set of header fields SHOULD be specified if possible ( see Section 4.3.4 and Section 7.2 for further discussion ).
:LABEL: field

name: Message Routing Information
description: For the loose-end MRM   only a simplified version of the Flow Identifier is needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version ( 8 bits ): The GIST protocol version number . This specification defines version number 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: GIST hops
description: GIST hops ( 8 bits ): A hop count for the number of GIST-aware nodes this message can still be processed by ( including the destination ).
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length ( 16 bits ): The total number of 32-bit words in the message after the common header itself .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLPID ( 16 bits ): IANA-assigned identifier of the signalling application to which the message refers .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C-flag : C=1 if the message has to be able to be interpreted in the absence of routing state ( Section 5.2.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: S-flag : S=1 if the IP source address is the same as the signalling source address   S=0 if it is different .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-flag : S=1 if the IP source address is the same as the signalling source address   S=0 if it is different .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R-flag : R=1 if a reply to this message is explicitly requested .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The rules governing the use of the R-flag depend on the GIST message type . It MUST always be set ( R=1 ) in Query messages   since these always elicit a Response   and never in Confirm   Data   or Error messages . It MAY be set in an MA-Hello; if set   another MA-Hello MUST be sent in reply . It MAY be set in a Response   but MUST be set if the Response contains a Responder-Cookie; if set   a Confirm MUST be sent in reply . The E-flag MUST NOT be set unless the message type is a Data message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 12 bits ): Length has the units of 32-bit words   and measures the length of Value . If there is no Value   Length=0 . If the Length is not consistent with the contents of the object   an " Object Value Error " message ( Appendix A.4.4.10 ) with subcode 0 " Incorrect Length " MUST be returned and the message dropped .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 12 bits ): Length has the units of 32-bit words   and measures the length of Value . If there is no Value   Length=0 . If the Length is not consistent with the contents of the object   an " Object Value Error " message ( Appendix A.4.4.10 ) with subcode 0 " Incorrect Length " MUST be returned and the message dropped .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value ( variable ): Value is ( therefore ) a whole number of 32-bit words . If there is any padding required   the length and location are be defined by the object-specific format information; objects that contain variable-length ( e.g .  string ) types may need to include additional length subfields to do so .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Message-Routing-Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: MRM-ID ( 8 bits ): An IANA-assigned identifier for the message routing method .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N-flag : If set ( N=1 )  this means that NATs do not need to translate this MRM; if clear ( N=0 )  it means that the method-specific information contains network or transport layer information that a NAT must process .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Protocol ( 8 bits ): The IP protocol number . This MUST be ignored if P=0 . In the case of IPv6   the Protocol field refers to the true upper layer protocol carried by the packets   i.e .  excluding any IP option headers . This is therefore not necessarily the same as the Next Header value from the base IPv6 header .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: Protocol ( 8 bits ): The IP protocol number . This MUST be ignored if P=0 . In the case of IPv6   the Protocol field refers to the true upper layer protocol carried by the packets   i.e .  excluding any IP option headers . This is therefore not necessarily the same as the Next Header value from the base IPv6 header .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T-flag : T=1 means that the Diffserv field ( DS-field ) is significant .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F-flag : F=1 means that flow label is present and is significant . F MUST NOT be set if IP-Ver is not 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Label
description: Flow Label ( 20 bits ): The flow label; only present if F=1 . If F=0   the entire 32-bit word containing the Flow Label is absent .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-flag : S=1 means that the SPI field is present and is significant . The S-flag MUST be 0 if the P-flag is 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D-flag : The Direction flag has the following meaning : the value 0 means ' in the same direction as the flow ' ( i.e .  downstream )  and the value 1 means ' in the opposite direction to the flow ' ( i.e .  upstream ).
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D-flag : The Direction flag has the following meaning : the value 0 means ' towards the edge of the network '  and the value 1 means ' from the edge of the network '. Note that for Q-mode messages   the only valid value is D=0 ( see Section 5.8.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Session-Identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Fixed ( 4 32-bit words )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Network-Layer-Information
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: PI-Length ( 8 bits ): The byte length of the Peer Identity field .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Identity
description: Peer Identity ( variable ): The Peer Identity field . Note that the Peer-Identity field itself is padded to a whole number of words .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Address
description: Interface Address ( variable ): The IP address allocated to the interface   matching the IP-Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing State Validity Time
description: Routing State Validity Time ( 32 bits ): The time for which the routing state for this flow can be considered correct without a refresh . Given in milliseconds . The value 0 ( zero ) is reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Variable ( depends on number of profiles and size of each profile )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable ( depends on number of profiles and size of each profile )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Variable ( depends on number of protocols and size of each MA-protocol-options field )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable ( depends on number of protocols and size of each MA-protocol-options field )
:LABEL: field

name: Profile
description: Profile ( 8 bits ): Tag indicating which profile from the accompanying Stack-Proposal object this applies to . Profiles are numbered from 1 upwards; the special value 0 indicates ' applies to all profiles '.
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 8 bits ): The byte length of MA-protocol-options field that follows . This will be zero-padded up to the next word boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D-flag : If set ( D=1 )  this protocol MUST NOT be used for a messaging association .
:LABEL: field

name: Options Data
description: Options Data ( variable ): Any options data for this protocol . Note that the format of the options data might differ depending on whether the field is in a Query or Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Query-Cookie
description: Type : Query-Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Query-Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The content is defined by the implementation . See Section 8.5 for further discussion .
:LABEL: field

name: Responder-Cookie
description: Type : Responder-Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Responder-Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The content is defined by the implementation . See Section 8.5 for further discussion .
:LABEL: field

name: Hello-ID
description: Type : Hello-ID
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Hello-ID
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The content is defined by the implementation . See Section 5.2.2 for further discussion .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NAT-Traversal
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This object is used to support the NAT traversal mechanisms described in Section 7.2.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type-Count ( 8 bits ): The number of objects in the ' List of translated objects ' field .
:LABEL: field

name: List of translated objects
description: List of translated objects ( variable ): This field lists the types of objects that were translated by every NAT through which the message has passed . Each element in the list is a 16-bit field containing the first 16 bits of the object TLV header   including the AB extensibility flags   2 reserved bits   and 12-bit object type . The list is initialised by the first NAT on the path; subsequent NATs may delete elements in the list . Padded with 2 null bytes if necessary .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NSLP-Data
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This object is used to deliver data between NSLPs . GIST regards the data as a number of complete 32-bit words   as given by the length field in the TLV; any padding to a word boundary must be carried out within the NSLP itself .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Error
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The flags are : S - S=1 means the Session ID object is present . M - M=1 means MRI object is present . C - C=1 means a debug Comment is present after header . D - D=1 means the original message was received in D-mode . Q - Q=1 means the original message was received Q-mode encapsulated ( can't be set if D=0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Additional Information Fields
description: The Common Error Header may be followed by some Additional Information fields . Each Additional Information field has a simple TLV format as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Real Object Length
description: Real Object Length ( 12 bits ): Since the length in the original TLV header may be inaccurate   this field provides the actual length of the object ( including the TLV header ) included in the error message . Measured in 32-bit words .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset ( 16 bits ): The byte in the object at which the GIST node found the error . The first byte in the object has offset=0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Object
description: Object ( variable ): The invalid TLV object ( including the TLV header ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: 2 ( Protocol-Error ): the message has been rejected because of a protocol error ( e.g .  an error in message format ).
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: Session-ID : The NSIS session identifier . Note that it is assumed that the signalling application provides this to GIST rather than GIST providing a value itself .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLPID : An identifier indicating which NSLP this message is for .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NetworkNotification ( NSLPID   MRI   Network-Notification-Type )
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: MRI : Provides the message routing information to which the network notification applies .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLPID : Provides the NSLPID to which the routing state lifetime applies .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLPID : Provides the NSLPID to which the routing state lifetime applies .
:LABEL: field

name: NSLPID
description: NSLPID : The NSLP originating the message . May be null ( in which case   the invalidation applies to all signalling applications ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_LT ( 0x00C )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_EXTERNAL_IP ( 0x00D )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_EXTERNAL_BINDING ( 0x00E )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_EFI ( 0x00F )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_INFO ( 0x010 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_NONCE ( 0x011 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_MSN ( 0x012 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : variable . Maximum 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: o P : P=1 means that ' dst port number ' and ' src port number ' are present and should be interpreted .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: o P : P=1 means that ' dst port number ' and ' src port number ' are present and should be interpreted .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The SPI field is only present if S is set . The port numbers are only present if P is set . The flags P and S MUST NOT be set at the same time . An error RESPONSE of class ' Protocol error ' ( 3 ) with response code ' Invalid Flag-Field combination ' ( 0x09 ) MUST be generated if they are both set . If either P or S is set   I MUST be set as well and the protocol field MUST carry the particular protocol . An error RESPONSE of class ' Protocol error ' ( 3 ) with response code ' Invalid Flag-Field combination ' ( 0x09 ) MUST be generated if S or P is set but I is not set .
:LABEL: field

name: sender prefix
description: o ( data ) sender prefix : This parameter indicates the prefix length of the ' data sender's IP address ' in bits . For instance   a full IPv4 address requires ' sender prefix ' to be set to 32 . A value of 0 indicates an IP address wildcard .
:LABEL: field

name: protocol
description: o protocol : The IP protocol field . This field MUST be interpreted if I=1; otherwise   it MUST be set to 0 and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: DR port number
description: o DR port number : The port number at the data receiver ( DR )  i.e .  the destination port . A value of 0 indicates a port wildcard   i.e .  the destination port number is not known . Any other value indicates the destination port number .
:LABEL: field

name: DS port number
description: o DS port number : The port number at the data sender ( DS )  i.e .  the source port . A value of 0 indicates a port wildcard   i.e .  the source port number is not known . Any other value indicates the source port number .
:LABEL: field

name: data sender's IPv4 address
description: o data sender's IPv4 address : The source IP address of the data sender . This field MUST be set to zero if no IP address is provided   i.e .  a complete wildcard is desired ( see the dest prefix field above ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NATFW_ICMP_TYPES ( 0x014 )
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P-QNE : Proxy-QNE   a node set to reply to messages with the PROXY scope flag set .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: SCOPING ( S ) - when set   indicates that the message is scoped and should not travel down the entire path but only as far as the next QNE ( scope="next hop "). By default   this flag is not set ( default scope="whole path ").
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: PROXY ( P ) - when set   indicates that the message is scoped   and should not travel down the entire path but only as far as the P-QNE . By default   this flag is not set .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: BREAK ( B ) - when set   indicates that there are routers along the path where QoS cannot be provided .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: TEAR ( T ) - when set   indicates that reservation state and QoS NSLP operation state should be torn down . The former is indicated to the RMF . Depending on the QoS model   the tear message may include a QSPEC to further specify state removal   e.g .  for an aggregation   the QSPEC may specify the amount of resources to be removed from the aggregate .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: REPLACE ( R ) - when set   the flag has two uses . First   it indicates that a RESERVE with different MRI ( but same SID ) replaces an existing one   so the old one MAY be torn down immediately . This is the default situation . This flag may be unset to indicate a desire from an upstream node to keep an existing reservation on an old branch in place . Second   this flag is also used to indicate whether the reserved resources on the old branch should be torn down or not when a data path change happens . In this case   the MRI is the same and only the route path changes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x001
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : An identifier that MUST be ( probabilistically ) unique within the context of a SESSION-ID and SHOULD be different every time a RESPONSE is desired . Used by a QNE to match back a RESPONSE to a request in a RESERVE or QUERY message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x002
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : An incrementing sequence number that indicates the order in which state-modifying actions are performed by a QNE   and an epoch identifier to allow the identification of peer restarts . The RSN has local significance only   i.e .  between a QNE and its downstream stateful peers . The RSN is not reset when the downstream peer changes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x003
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : The refresh timeout period R used to generate this message; in milliseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x004
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : contains an 8-bit Binding_Code that indicates the nature of the binding . The rest specifies the SESSION-ID ( as specified in GIST [ RFC5971 ]) of the session that MUST be bound to the session associated with the message carrying this object .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x005
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: X - Source Address and Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Y
description: Y - Destination Address and Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P - Protocol
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T - Diffserv Code Point
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F - Flow Label
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S - SPI
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A - Source Port
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: The flags indicate which fields from the MRI MUST be used by the packet classifier . This allows a subset of the information in the MRI to be used for identifying the set of packets that are part of the reservation . Flags MUST only be set if the data is present in the MRI ( i.e .  where there is a corresponding flag in the GIST MRI   the flag can only be set if the corresponding GIST MRI flag is set ). It should be noted that some flags in the PACKET-CLASSIFIER ( X and Y ) relate to data that is always present in the MRI   but are optional to use for QoS NSLP packet classification . The appropriate set of flags set may depend   to some extent   on the QoS model being used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x006
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : Contains 8 reserved bits   an 8-bit error code   a 4-bit error class   a 4-bit error source identifier type   and an 8-bit error source identifier length ( in 32-bit words )  an error source identifier   and optionally variable-length error-specific information .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Source Identifier
description: The Error Source Identifier is for diagnostic purposes and its inclusion is OPTIONAL . It is suggested that implementations use this for the IP address   host name   or other identifier of the QNE generating the INFO-SPEC to aid diagnostic activities . A QNE SHOULD NOT be used in any purpose other than error logging or being presented to the user as part of any diagnostic information . A QNE SHOULD NOT attempt to send a message to that address .
:LABEL: field

name: Error Source Identifier
description: Error Source Identifier : IPv4
:LABEL: field

name: Error Source Identifier
description: Error Source Identifier : IPv6
:LABEL: field

name: Error Source Identifier
description: Error Source Identifier : FQDN in UTF-8
:LABEL: field

name: Real Object Length
description: Real Object Length : Since the length in the original TLV header may be inaccurate   this field provides the actual length of the object ( including the TLV Header ) included in the error message .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset : Indicates which part of the erroneous object is included . When this field is set to " 0 "  the complete object is included . If Offset is bigger than " 0 "  the erroneous object from offset ( calculated from the beginning of the object ) to the end of the object is included .
:LABEL: field

name: Object
description: This object carries information about a TLV object that was found to be invalid in the original message . An error message may contain more than one Object Value Info object .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x007
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : A list of 128-bit SESSION-IDs used in summary refresh and summary tear messages . All SESSION-IDs are concatenated together .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x008
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : A list of 32-bit Reservation Sequence Number ( RSN ) values . All RSN are concatenated together .
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: Type : 0x009
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x009
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : contains a 1-bit Message_Binding_Type ( D ) that indicates the dependency relation of a message binding . The rest specifies a 128-bit randomly generated value that " uniquely " identifies this particular message .
:LABEL: field

name: Bound Message ID
description: Type : 0x00A
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x00A
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : contains a 1-bit Message_Binding_Type ( D ) that indicates the dependency relation of a message binding . The rest specifies a 128-bit randomly generated value that refers to a Message ID in another message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x00B
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : Variable-length QSPEC ( QoS specification ) information   which is dependent on the QoS model .
:LABEL: field

name: QSPEC Objects
description: The QSPEC is the object of QoS NSLP containing QSPEC objects and parameters . QSPEC objects are the main building blocks of the QSPEC parameter set that is input or output of an RMF operation . QSPEC parameters are the parameters appearing in a QSPEC   which must include the traffic model parameter ( TMOD )  and may optionally include constraints ( e.g .  path latency )  traffic handling directives ( e.g .  excess treatment )  and traffic classifiers ( e.g .  PHB class ). The RMF implements functions that are related to resource management and processes the QSPEC parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: r
description: o rate ( r ) specified in octets per second o bucket size ( b ) specified in octets o peak rate ( p ) specified in octets per second o minimum policed unit ( m ) specified in octets o maximum packet size ( MPS ) specified in octets
:LABEL: field

name: Vers .
description: Vers .: Identifies the QSPEC version number . QSPEC Version 0 is assigned by this specification in Section 7 ( IANA Considerations ).
:LABEL: field

name: QSPEC Proc .
description: QSPEC Proc .: Identifies the QSPEC procedure and is composed of two times 4 bits . The first field identifies the Message Sequence; the second field identifies the QSPEC Object Combination used for this particular message sequence :
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : Initiator/Local QSPEC bit identifies whether the QSPEC is an initiator QSPEC or a Local QSPEC   and is set to the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The total length of the QSPEC ( in 32-bit words ) excluding the common header
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter ID
description: Parameter ID : Assigned consecutively to each QSPEC parameter . Parameter IDs are assigned to each QSPEC parameter defined in this document in Sections 5.2 and 7 ( IANA Considerations ).
:LABEL: field

name: Preemption Priority
description: Preemption Priority : The priority of the new flow compared with the defending priority of previously admitted flows . Higher values represent higher priority .
:LABEL: field

name: Defending Priority
description: Defending Priority : Once a flow is admitted   the preemption priority becomes irrelevant . Instead   its defending priority is used to compare with the preemption priority of new flows .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter ID
description: Parameter ID ( 12 bits ): The following values are allocated by this specification : 1-14 : assigned as specified in Section 5.2 : 1 : < TMOD-1 > 2 : < TMOD-2 > 3 : < Path Latency > 4 : < Path Jitter > 5 : < Path PLR > 6 : < Path PER > 7 : < Slack Term > 8 : < Preemption Priority > and < Defending Priority > 9 : < Admission Priority > 10 : < RPH Priority > 11 : < Excess Treatment > 12 : < PHB Class > 13 : < DSTE Class Type > 14 : < Y.1541 QoS Class > Further values are as follows : 15-255 : Unassigned 256-259 : Private/Experimental Use 260-4095 : Reserved The registration procedure is Specification Required . ( A specification is required to depreciate   delete   or modify Parameter IDs .)
:LABEL: field

name: EOR
description: Extent of Restoration ( EOR ) Field ( 4-bit unsigned integer ): Percentage of traffic belonging to the restoration class that can be restored . This percentage depends on the amount of spare capacity engineered . All high-priority restoration traffic   for example   may be " guaranteed " at 100% by the service provider . Other classes may offer lesser chances for successful restoration . The restoration extent for these lower priority classes depend on SLAs developed between the service provider and the customer .
:LABEL: field

name: EOR
description: The Extent of Restoration ( EOR ) Field is 4 bits in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter ID
description: Parameter ID : 12-bit field   indicating the PHR type : PHR_Resource_Request   PHR_Release_Request   PHR_Refresh_Update .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter ID
description: Parameter ID : 12-bit field identifying the type of < PDR container > field .
:LABEL: field

description: Any signaling message could be delayed by an adversary . For example   if RESERVE ' messages are delayed over the duration of the refresh period   then the resource units ( bandwidth ) reserved along the nodes for corresponding sessions will be removed . In this situation   the Ingress node does not receive the RESPONSE within a certain period   and considers that the signaling message has failed   which may cause a retransmission of the " failed " message . The Egress node may distinguish between the two messages   i.e .  the delayed message and the retransmitted message   and it could get a proper response .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : NODE_CAPABILITY_TUNNEL ( 0x015 ) from the shared NSLP object type space
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The bits marked ' A ' and ' B ' define the desired behavior for objects whose Type field is not recognized . If a node does not recognize the NODE_CAPABILITY_TUNNEL object   the desired behavior is " Forward ". That is   the object must be retained unchanged and forwarded as a result of message processing . This is satisfied by setting ' AB ' to ' 10 '.
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Variable   contains length of session authorization object list in units of 32-bit words .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable   contains length of session authorization object list in units of 32-bit words .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field is two octets and indicates the actual length of the attribute ( including Length   X-Type   and SubType fields ) in number of octets . The length does NOT include any padding of the value field to make the attribute's length a multiple of 4 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: START_TIME
description: 5 . START_TIME : The starting time for the session .
:LABEL: field

name: SubType
description: Session authorization attribute sub-type is one octet in length . The value of the SubType depends on the X-Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: IPV4_ADDRESS
description: 1 . IPV4_ADDRESS : IPv4 address represented in 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: IPV4_ADDRESS
description: 1 . IPV4_ADDRESS : IPv4 address represented in 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute in number of octets   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: IPV4_ADDRESS
description: 1 . IPV4_ADDRESS : IPv4 address represented in 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: SubType
description: SubType : No sub-types for NSLP_OBJECT_LIST are currently defined . This field MUST be set to 0 and ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the attribute   which MUST be > 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: SubType
description: SubType : No sub-types for AUTHENTICATION_DATA are currently defined . This field MUST be set to 0 and ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: SOURCE_ADDR
description: o SOURCE_ADDR : the source address of the entity that created the HMAC
:LABEL: field

name: START_TIME
description: o START_TIME : the timestamp when the HMAC signature was calculated . This MUST be different for any two messages in sequence in order to prevent replay attacks . The NTP timestamp currently provides a resolution of 200 picoseconds   which should be sufficient .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : This flag is specified in [ RFC4380 ]  and its use is modified in Section 3.2 below .
:LABEL: field

name: z
description: z : This flag is reserved . It MUST be set to zero when the address is constructed   as specified in [ RFC4380 ].
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : This flag is specified in [ RFC4380 ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G : This flag is specified in [ RFC4380 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : Follow flag; 1 denotes that more ToC elements follow; 0 denotes the last ToC element .
:LABEL: field

name: FT
description: FT : Frame type 000 = Good Speech frame 001 = Reserved 010 = Good SID frame 011 = Reserved 100 = Reserved 101 = Reserved 110 = Reserved 111 = No_Data frame
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload ( 1 octet ) - Indicates the type of payload that immediately follows the header . The format and value of each payload are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: Exchange Type
description: o Exchange Type ( 1 octet ) - Indicates the type of exchange being used . This constrains the payloads sent in each message in an exchange . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: o Flags ( 1 octet ) - Indicates specific options that are set for the message . Presence of options is indicated by the appropriate bit in the flags field being set . The bits are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: * R ( Response ) - This bit indicates that this message is a response to a message containing the same Message ID . This bit MUST be cleared in all request messages and MUST be set in all responses . An IKE endpoint MUST NOT generate a response to a message that is marked as being a response ( with one exception; see Section 2.21.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: * V ( Version ) - This bit indicates that the transmitter is capable of speaking a higher major version number of the protocol than the one indicated in the major version number field . Implementations of IKEv2 MUST clear this bit when sending and MUST ignore it in incoming messages .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: * I ( Initiator ) - This bit MUST be set in messages sent by the original initiator of the IKE SA and MUST be cleared in messages sent by the original responder . It is used by the recipient to determine which eight octets of the SPI were generated by the recipient . This bit changes to reflect who initiated the last rekey of the IKE SA .
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: o Message ID ( 4 octets   unsigned integer ) - Message identifier used to control retransmission of lost packets and matching of requests and responses . It is essential to the security of the protocol because it is used to prevent message replay attacks . See Sections 2.1 and 2.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length ( 4 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of the total message ( header + payloads ) in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload ( 1 octet ) - Identifier for the payload type of the next payload in the message . If the current payload is the last in the message   then this field will be 0 . This field provides a " chaining " capability whereby additional payloads can be added to a message by appending each one to the end of the message and setting the " Next Payload " field of the preceding payload to indicate the new payload's type . An Encrypted payload   which must always be the last payload of a message   is an exception . It contains data structures in the format of additional payloads . In the header of an Encrypted payload   the Next Payload field is set to the payload type of the first contained payload ( instead of 0); conversely   the Next Payload field of the last contained payload is set to zero ). The payload type values are listed here . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 7 bits ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: o Payload Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length in octets of the current payload   including the generic payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 1 octet ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Proposal Length
description: o Proposal Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of this proposal   including all transforms and attributes that follow .
:LABEL: field

name: Proposal Num
description: o Proposal Num ( 1 octet ) - When a proposal is made   the first proposal in an SA payload MUST be 1   and subsequent proposals MUST be one more than the previous proposal ( indicating an OR of the two proposals ). When a proposal is accepted   the proposal number in the SA payload MUST match the number on the proposal sent that was accepted .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the IPsec protocol identifier for the current negotiation . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - For an initial IKE SA negotiation   this field MUST be zero; the SPI is obtained from the outer header . During subsequent negotiations   it is equal to the size   in octets   of the SPI of the corresponding protocol ( 8 for IKE   4 for ESP and AH ).
:LABEL: field

name: Num Transforms
description: o Num Transforms ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the number of transforms in this proposal .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o Transform Length - The length ( in octets ) of the Transform Substructure including Header and Attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Length
description: o Transform Length - The length ( in octets ) of the Transform Substructure including Header and Attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Type
description: o Transform Type ( 1 octet ) - The type of transform being specified in this transform . Different protocols support different Transform Types . For some protocols   some of the transforms may be optional . If a transform is optional and the initiator wishes to propose that the transform be omitted   no transform of the given type is included in the proposal . If the initiator wishes to make use of the transform optional to the responder   it includes a transform substructure with Transform ID = 0 as one of the options .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform ID
description: o Transform ID ( 2 octets ) - The specific instance of the Transform Type being proposed .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Attributes
description: Each transform in a Security Association payload may include attributes that modify or complete the specification of the transform . The set of valid attributes depends on the transform . Currently   only a single attribute type is defined : the Key Length attribute is used by certain encryption transforms with variable - length keys ( see below for details ).
:LABEL: field

name: AF
description: o Attribute Format ( AF ) ( 1 bit ) - Indicates whether the data attribute follows the Type/Length/Value ( TLV ) format or a shortened Type/Value ( TV ) format . If the AF bit is zero ( 0 )  then the attribute uses TLV format; if the AF bit is one ( 1 )  the TV format ( with two-byte value ) is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: o Attribute Type ( 15 bits ) - Unique identifier for each type of attribute ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: ID Type
description: o ID Type ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the type of Identification being used .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o Identification Data ( variable length ) - Value   as indicated by the Identification Type . The length of the Identification Data is computed from the size in the ID payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification Data
description: o Identification Data ( variable length ) - Value   as indicated by the Identification Type . The length of the Identification Data is computed from the size in the ID payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Certificate Data
description: o Certificate Data ( variable length ) - Actual encoding of certificate data . The type of certificate is indicated by the Certificate Encoding field .
:LABEL: field

name: Certification Authority
description: o Certification Authority ( variable length ) - Contains an encoding of an acceptable certification authority for the type of certificate requested .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Method
description: o Auth Method ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the method of authentication used . The types of signatures are listed here . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: o Authentication Data ( variable length ) - see Section 2.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce Data
description: o Nonce Data ( variable length ) - Contains the random data generated by the transmitting entity .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - If this notification concerns an existing SA whose SPI is given in the SPI field   this field indicates the type of that SA . For notifications concerning Child SAs   this field MUST contain either ( 2 ) to indicate AH or ( 3 ) to indicate ESP . Of the notifications defined in this document   the SPI is included only with INVALID_SELECTORS and REKEY_SA . If the SPI field is empty   this field MUST be sent as zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the IPsec protocol ID or zero if no SPI is applicable . For a notification concerning the IKE SA   the SPI Size MUST be zero and the field must be empty .
:LABEL: field

name: Notify Message Type
description: o Notify Message Type ( 2 octets ) - Specifies the type of notification message .
:LABEL: field

name: Notification Data
description: o Notification Data ( variable length ) - Status or error data transmitted in addition to the Notify Message Type . Values for this field are type specific ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Must be 1 for an IKE SA   2 for AH   or 3 for ESP .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the protocol ID . It MUST be zero for IKE ( SPI is in message header ) or four for AH and ESP .
:LABEL: field

name: Num of SPIs
description: o Num of SPIs ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - The number of SPIs contained in the Delete payload . The size of each SPI is defined by the SPI Size field .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of TSs
description: o Number of TSs ( 1 octet ) - Number of Traffic Selectors being provided .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED - This field MUST be sent as zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: TS Type
description: o IP protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Value specifying an associated IP protocol ID ( such as UDP   TCP   and ICMP ). A value of zero means that the protocol ID is not relevant to this Traffic Selector -- the SA can carry all protocols .
:LABEL: field

name: Selector Length
description: o Selector Length - Specifies the length of this Traffic Selector substructure including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload - The payload type of the first embedded payload . Note that this is an exception in the standard header format   since the Encrypted payload is the last payload in the message and therefore the Next Payload field would normally be zero . But because the content of this payload is embedded payloads and there was no natural place to put the type of the first one   that type is placed here .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
