description: o Payload Length - Includes the lengths of the header   initialization vector ( IV )  Encrypted IKE payloads   Padding   Pad Length   and Integrity Checksum Data .
:LABEL: field

name: CFG Type
description: o CFG Type ( 1 octet ) - The type of exchange represented by the Configuration Attributes . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 3 octets ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Configuration Attributes
description: o Configuration Attributes ( variable length ) - These are type length value ( TLV ) structures specific to the Configuration payload and are defined below . There may be zero or more Configuration Attributes in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Configuration Attributes
description: 3.15.1 . Configuration Attributes
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: o Attribute Type ( 15 bits ) - A unique identifier for each of the Configuration Attribute Types .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Value ( 0 or more octets ) - The variable-length value of this Configuration Attribute . The following lists the attribute types .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: o Value ( 0 or more octets ) - The variable-length value of this Configuration Attribute . The following lists the attribute types .
:LABEL: field

name: Lower Encoding
description: Contains one of the LSP Encoding Type values specified in Section 3.1.1 of [ RFC3471 ] and updates .
:LABEL: field

name: Upper Encoding
description: Set to the encoding of the available adjustment capacity and to 0xFF when the corresponding SC value has no access to the wire   i.e .  there is no ISC sub-TLV for this upper switching capability . The adjustment capacity is the set of resources associated to the upper switching capability .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: 0 indicates that the attribute specified MUST be excluded .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type of the XRO SC subobject is 35 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The total length of the subobject in bytes ( including the Type and Length fields ). The Length of the XRO SC subobject is 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute
description: 0 reserved value .
:LABEL: field

name: Switching Cap
description: Switching Capability value to be excluded .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: 0 indicates that the attribute specified MUST be excluded .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The Type of the XRO Label subobject is 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The total length of the subobject in bytes ( including the Type and Length fields ). The Length is always divisible by 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: See [ RFC3471 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: The C-Type of the included Label Object . Copied from the Label Object ( see [ RFC3471 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: The identifier of the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the total length of the TLV in octets . That is   the combined length of the Type   Length   and Value fields   i.e .  four plus the length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: C-Type
description: Class Type ( C-Type ):
:LABEL: field

name: Action
description: See [ RFC3471 ] for definition of actions . Range actions SHOULD be used when possible to minimize the size of the Channel_Set LABEL Object .
:LABEL: field

name: Label Type
description: See [ RFC3473 ] for a description of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: Padding is used to ensure that the length of a Channel_Set Subobject meets the multiple of 4 byte size requirement stated above . The field is only required when the Subchannel field is not 32-bit aligned and the number of included Subchannel fields result in the Subobject not being 32-bit aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Switching Granularity
description: This field indicates the type of link that comprises the requested Ethernet LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: This is a two-octet value indicating the MTU in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Defined values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Indicates the length in bytes of the whole TLV including the Type and Length fields . A value field whose length is not a multiple of four MUST be zero-padded ( with trailing zeros ) so that the TLV is four-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Profile
description: This field is defined as a bit vector of binary flags . The following flags are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Index
description: The Index field is used to reference bandwidth allocated for a given traffic class in case a multiple-class LSP is being requested . The Index field value MUST correspond to at least one of the Class-Type values included either in the CLASSTYPE object [ RFC4124 ] or in the EXTENDED_CLASSTYPE object [ MCOS ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits SHOULD be set to zero when sent and MUST be ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: CIR
description: The value of the CIR is in units of bytes per second . The CIR is encoded as a 32-bit IEEE single-precision floating-point number ( see [ RFC4506 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: CBS
description: The value of the CBS is in units of bytes . The CBS is encoded as a 32-bit IEEE single-precision floating-point number ( see [ RFC4506 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: EIR
description: The value of the EIR is in units of bytes per second . The EIR is encoded as a 32-bit IEEE single-precision floating-point number ( see [ RFC4506 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: EBS
description: The value of the EBS is in units of bytes . The EBS is encoded as a 32-bit IEEE single-precision floating-point number ( see [ RFC4506 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type and Length fields are defined in [ RFC6001 ]. Note that as defined in [ RFC6001 ]  the Length field is set to length of the whole TLV including the Type   Length   and Endpoint ID fields .
:LABEL: field

name: IL2CP
description: This field controls processing of Layer 2 Control Protocols on a receiving interface . Valid usage is service specific   see [ MEF10.1 ]  [ G.8011.1 ]  and [ G.8011.2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: EL2CP
description: This field controls processing of Layer 2 Control Protocols on a transmitting interface . When MEF services are used a value of 1 MUST be used   other valid usage is service specific   see [ G.8011.1 ] and [ G.8011.2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt . This field SHOULD be passed unmodified by transit nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt . This field SHOULD be passed unmodified by transit nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: VLAN ID
description: A VLAN identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Name Reference ---- ----------- --------- 2 Endpoint ID [ RFC6004 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Cookie 8 to 16 bytes ( Length - 2 ): an unpredictable value .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: ( R)eserved 5 bits : default zero . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: 1 . 32-bit timestamps .
:LABEL: field

name: TS Value
description: TS Value 4   8   or 16 bytes . The current value of the timestamp for the sender .
:LABEL: field

name: TS Echo Reply
description: TS Echo Reply 4   8   or 16 bytes . A copy of the most recently received TS Value .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D : Number of rows of the source block .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D : Number of rows of the source block . D is a positive integer that is less than or equal to 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D : Number of rows of the source block . D is a positive integer that is less than or equal to 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D : Number of rows of the source block . D is a positive integer that is less than or equal to 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o D : Number of rows of the source block . D is a positive integer that is less than or equal to 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: o The NA field MUST be set to the number of rows of the source block ( D ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: the type of the MDT TLV . In this specification   types 1 and 4 are defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: the total number of octets in the TLV for this type   including both the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: the content of the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Must be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Must be set to 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: C-source
description: the IPv4 address of the traffic source in the VPN .
:LABEL: field

name: C-group
description: the IPv4 address of the multicast traffic destination address in the VPN .
:LABEL: field

name: P-group
description: the IPv4 group address that the PE router is going to use to encapsulate the flow ( C-source   C-group ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Must be set to 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Must be set to 40 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: C-source
description: the IPv6 address of the traffic source in the VPN .
:LABEL: field

name: C-group
description: the IPv6 address of the multicast traffic destination address in the VPN .
:LABEL: field

name: P-group
description: the IPv4 group address that the PE router is going to use to encapsulate the flow ( C-source   C-group ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and the Length fields . This field MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and the Length fields . This field MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L-Flag : Indicates that the LMA applies late path switch according to the transient BCE state . If the L-flag is set to 1   the LMA continues to forward downlink packets towards the pMAG . Different setting of the L-Flag may be for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : Maximum lifetime of a Transient-L state in multiple of 100 ms .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value E Description 0x0000003A 0 PW Loop Detected
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Length Description
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Type code for the parameter . 16 bits long   C-bit being part of the Type code . C Critical . One if this parameter is critical   and MUST be recognized by the recipient; zero otherwise . The C bit is considered to be a part of the Type field . Consequently   critical parameters are always odd and non-critical ones have an even value . Length Length of the Contents   in octets . Contents Parameter specific   defined by Type . Padding Padding   0-7 octets   added if needed .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4481 Length 4 Sequence number 32-bit unsigned integer in network byte order that MUST NOT be reused before it has been acknowledged by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4545 Length variable ( multiple of 4 ) Acked Sequence number A sequence of 32-bit unsigned integers in network byte order corresponding to the sequence numbers being acknowledged .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4577 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Next Header Identifies the data that is protected by this MIC . The values for this field are defined by IANA " Protocol Numbers " [ PROTOCOL-NUMBERS ]. Payload Data Last 8 octets of the payload data over which the MIC is calculated . This field is used to uniquely bind the PAYLOAD_MIC parameter to the Next Header   in case there are multiple copies of the same type . MIC Value MIC computed over the data to which the Next Header and Payload Data point . The size of the MIC is the natural size of the computation output depending on the function used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4580 Length Length of the Identifier   in octets Identifier The identifier value Padding 0-7 octets of padding if needed
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4592 Length Length of the Identifier   in octets Identifier The identifier value Padding 0-7 bytes of padding if needed
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 64011 Length 4 TTL The Time-to-Live value Reserved Reserved for future use
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce : A time-variant random value used in the connection setup phase to prevent message replay and other types of attacks .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: Port-Preserving NAT : A NAT that translates a local address/port to a mapped address/port such that the mapped port has the same value as the local port   as long as that same mapped address/port has not already been used for a different local address/port .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: Port-Restricted NAT : A restricted NAT that accepts packets from an external host's IP address X and port Y only if the internal host has sent a packet destined to IP address X and port Y . In the terminology of [ RFC4787 ]  this is a NAT with Endpoint-Independent Mapping and Address and Port-Dependent Filtering .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: Port-Symmetric NAT : A symmetric NAT that has only a single external IP address and hence only assigns different ports when communicating with different external hosts .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 1 byte ): 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Value field of this trailer   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 byte ): 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Value field of this trailer   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 1 byte ): The Trailer Option type . This field MUST be set to 0x01 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 byte ): The length in bytes of the rest of the option . This field MUST be set to 0x04 .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce ( 4 bytes ): The nonce value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 1 byte ): The Trailer Option type . This field MUST be set to 0x03 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 byte ): The length in bytes of the rest of the option . The value of this field MUST be in the range 8 to 26 ( i.e .  2 bytes for the Reserved field   and 6 bytes for each entry in the Alternate Address/Port List ). This allows for a minimum of one address/port mapping and a maximum of four address/port mappings to be advertised . It SHOULD be at most 14 as a maximum of two address/port mappings can be determined by Teredo : one local address/port and one obtained using UPnP . Because the length of the alternate address/port is 6 bytes   the valid range of values is only 8   14   20   and 26 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 2 bytes ): This field MUST be set to 0x0000 and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: IPv4 Address ( 4 bytes ): An IPv4 address in network byte order . This field MUST contain a valid unicast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: Port ( 2 bytes ): A port number in network byte order . This field MUST NOT be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 1 byte ): The Trailer Option type . This field MUST be set to 0x04 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 byte ): The length in bytes of the rest of the option . This field MUST be set to 0x04 .
:LABEL: field

name: DiscoveryType
description: DiscoveryType ( 1 byte ): This field MUST be set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 3 bytes ): This field MUST be set to 0x000000 on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 1 byte ): The Trailer Option type . This field MUST be set to 0x05 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 1 byte ): The length in bytes of the rest of the option . This field MUST be set to 0x02 .
:LABEL: field

name: Port
description: Port-Preserving NAT flag : This is a Boolean value   set to TRUE if the Teredo client is positioned behind a port-preserving NAT .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: 4n if A   B   C   D   E   or F is set
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: 4n if A   B   C   D   E   or F is set
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: 4n if A   B   C   D   E   or F is set
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: 4n if A   B   C   D   E   or F is set
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: 2n if G   H   I   or J is set
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: 2n if G   H   I   or J is set
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: Figure 1 : IPv4 binary traffic selector
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Figure 1 : IPv4 binary traffic selector
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: This field identifies the first source address   from the range of 32-bit IPv4 addresses to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . In other words   this is one of the addresses of the correspondent node .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: If more than one contiguous source address needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Source Address field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Source Address field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the addresses between fields ( A ) and ( B )  inclusive of ( A ) and ( B ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This field identifies the first destination address   from the range of 32-bit IPv4 addresses to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . In other words   this is one of the registered home addresses of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: If more than one contiguous destination address needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Destination Address field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Destination Address field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the addresses between fields ( C ) and ( D )  inclusive of ( C ) and ( D ).
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: This field identifies the first 32-bit IPsec SPI value   from the range of SPI values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . This field is defined in [ RFC4303 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: If more than one contiguous SPI value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start IPsec SPI field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start IPsec SPI field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the SPI values between fields ( E ) and ( F )  inclusive of ( E ) and ( F ).
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: This field identifies the first 16-bit source port number   from the range of port numbers to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . This is from the range of port numbers defined by IANA ( http://www.iana.org ).
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: If more than one contiguous source port number needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Source Port field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Source Port field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the port numbers between fields ( G ) and ( H )  inclusive of ( G ) and ( H ).
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field identifies the first 16-bit destination port number   from the range of port numbers to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: J
description: If more than one contiguous destination port number needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Destination Port field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Destination Port field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the port numbers between fields ( I ) and ( J )  inclusive of ( I ) and ( J ).
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: This field identifies the first differential services value   from the range of differential services values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . Note that this field is called a " Type of Service field " in [ RFC0791 ]. [ RFC3260 ] then clarified that the field has been redefined as a 6-bit DS field with 2 bits reserved   later claimed by Explicit Congestion Notification ( ECN ) [ RFC3168 ]. For the purpose of this specification   the ( K)Start DS field is 8 bits long   where the 6 most significant bits indicate the DS field to be matched and the 2 least significant bits ' values MUST be ignored in any comparison .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: If more than one contiguous DS value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start DS field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start DS field is included . When this field is included   it MUST be coded the same way as defined for ( K ). When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the values between fields ( K ) and ( L )  inclusive of ( K ) and ( L ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: This field identifies the first 8-bit protocol value   from the range of protocol values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: If more than one contiguous protocol value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Protocol field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Protocol field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the values between fields ( M ) and ( N )  inclusive of ( M ) and ( N ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . These bits MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: 8n if A   B   C   or D is set
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: 8n if A   B   C   or D is set
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: 4n if E   F   G   or H is set
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: 4n if E   F   G   or H is set
:LABEL: field

name: J
description: 2n if I   J   K   or L is set
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: 2n if I   J   K   or L is set
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Figure 2 : IPv6 binary traffic selector
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: Figure 2 : IPv6 binary traffic selector
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: This field identifies the first source address   from the range of 128-bit IPv6 addresses to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . In other words   this is one of the addresses of the correspondent node .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: If more than one contiguous source address needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Source Address field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Source Address field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the addresses between fields ( A ) and ( B )  inclusive of ( A ) and ( B ).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: This field identifies the first destination address   from the range of 128-bit IPv6 addresses to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . In other words   this is one of the registered home addresses of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: If more than one contiguous destination address needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Destination Address field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Destination Address field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the addresses between fields ( C ) and ( D )  inclusive of ( C ) and ( D ).
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: This field identifies the first 32-bit IPsec SPI value   from the range of SPI values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . This field is defined in [ RFC4303 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: If more than one contiguous SPI value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start IPsec SPI field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start IPsec SPI field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the SPI values between fields ( E ) and ( F )  inclusive of ( E ) and ( F ).
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: This field identifies the first flow label value   from the range of flow label values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . According to [ RFC2460 ]  the flow label is 24 bits long . For the purpose of this specification   the sender of this option MUST prefix the flow label value with 8 bits of " 0 " before inserting it in the ( G)Start Flow Label field . The receiver SHOULD ignore the first 8 bits of this field before using it in comparisons with flow labels in packets .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: If more than one contiguous flow label value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Flow Label field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Flow Label field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the flow label values between fields ( G ) and ( H )  inclusive of ( G ) and ( H ). When this field is included   it MUST be coded the same way as defined for ( G ).
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field identifies the first 16-bit source port number   from the range of port numbers to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: J
description: If more than one contiguous source port number needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Source Port field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Source Port field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the port numbers between fields ( I ) and ( J )  inclusive of ( I ) and ( J ).
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: This field identifies the first 16-bit destination port number   from the range of port numbers to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: If more than one contiguous destination port number needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start Destination Port field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start Destination Port field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the port numbers between fields ( K ) and ( L )  inclusive of ( K ) and ( L ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: This field identifies the first traffic class value   from the range of traffic class values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent . This field is equivalent to the Start DS field in the IPv4 traffic selector in Figure 1 . As per [ RFC3260 ]  the field is defined as a 6-bit DS field with 2 bits reserved   later claimed by Explicit Congestion Notification ( ECN ) [ RFC3168 ]. For the purpose of this specification   the ( M)Start TC field is 8 bits long   where the 6 most significant bits indicate the DS field to be matched and the 2 least significant bits ' values MUST be ignored in any comparison .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: If more than one contiguous TC value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start TC field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start TC field is included . When this
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: field is included   it MUST be coded the same way as defined for ( M ). When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the values between fields ( M ) and ( N )  inclusive of ( M ) and ( N ).
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: This field identifies the first 8-bit next header value   from the range of next header values to be matched   on data packets sent from a corresponding node to the mobile node as seen by the home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: If more than one contiguous next header value needs to be matched   then this field can be used to indicate the end value of a range starting from the value of the Start NH field . This field MUST NOT be included unless the Start next header field is included . When this field is included   the receiver will match all of the values between fields ( O ) and ( P )  inclusive of ( O ) and ( P ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . These bits MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: BID-PRI
description: This is a 7-bit unsigned integer placing each BID to a relative priority ( PRI ) with other registered BIDs . Value ' 0 ' is reserved and MUST NOT be used . A lower number in this field indicates a higher priority   while BIDs with the same BID-PRI value have equal priority meaning that   the BID used is an implementation issue . This is consistent with current practice in packet classifiers .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Len
description: Length of the option in octets as per [ RFC3775 ].
:LABEL: field

name: FID
description: The Flow Identifier field is a 16-bit unsigned integer that includes the unique identifier for the flow binding . This field is used to refer to an existing flow binding or to create a new flow binding . The value of this field is set by the mobile node . FID = 0 is reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: FID-PRI
description: This is a 16-bit unsigned integer priority field to indicate the priority of a particular option . This field is needed in cases where two different flow descriptions in two different options overlap . The priority field decides which policy should be executed in those cases . A lower number in this field indicates a higher priority . Value ' 0 ' is reserved and MUST NOT be used . FID-PRI MUST be unique to each of the flows pertaining to a given MN . In other words   two FIDs MUST NOT be associated with the same FID-PRI value .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This 8-bit unsigned integer field indicates the success or failure of the flow binding operation for the particular flow in the option . This field is not relevant to the binding update message as a whole or to other flow identification options . This field is only relevant when included in the Binding Acknowledgement message and must be ignored in the
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Opt Type
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the sub-option Type . When processing a flow identification mobility option containing an option for which the sub-option Type value is not recognized by the receiver   the receiver MUST silently ignore and skip over the sub-option   correctly handling any remaining sub-options in the same option .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Opt Len
description: 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length in octets of the flow identification sub-option . This field indicates the length of the sub-option not including the Sub-Opt Type and Sub-Opt Length fields . Note that Sub-Opt Type ' 0 ' ( Section 4.2.1.1 ) is a special case that does not take a Sub - Opt Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Opt Len
description: Set to the length of the sub-option .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Opt Len
description: Variable
:LABEL: field

name: BID
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the BID that the mobile node wants to associate with the flow identification option . One or more BID fields can be included in this sub-option . Since each BID is 2 bytes long   the value of the Sub-opt Len field indicates the number of BIDs present . Number of BIDs = Sub-Opt Len/2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-Opt Len
description: Variable
:LABEL: field

name: TS Format
description: An 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the Traffic Selector Format . Value " 0 " is reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: An 8-bit reserved field . It MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: FID
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer indicating a registered FID . One or more FID fields can be included in this option . Number of FIDs = Option Len/2 .
:LABEL: field

name: FID
description: o FID ( Flow Identifier ): For a given mobile node   identified by its primary home address   the FID MUST uniquely identify an entry   i.e .  a unique flow binding . Each mobile node can only have a single entry identified by a given FID at any one time . A given FID number space is used for all the addresses associated to a given MN by the HA ( e.g .  via [ RFC3963 ]). Different mobile nodes use the same FID number space .
:LABEL: field

name: BID
description: o BID(s ): The list of BIDs associated with the entry as defined by the binding reference sub-option included in the FID option that created it .
:LABEL: field

name: FID
description: o FID-PRI : This field indicates the priority of the flow binding and is used to break the tie between overlapping flow bindings .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: This specification ( see Section 4.1 ) updates the definition of the binding identifier mobility option   originally defined in [ RFC5648 ]. According to this specification   the BID option includes a BID-PRI field assigning each registered care-of address a priority   and thus places them in an ordered list ( see Section 4.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: When the home agent receives a binding update that includes at least one flow identification mobility option   it first performs the operation described in section 10.3.1 of RFC 3775   followed by the operations defined in Section 5.3.1 of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: If the FID field of the flow identification mobility option is not already present in the list of flow binding entries for this mobile node   then this is a request for a new entry .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: If the FID field of the flow identification mobility option is already present in the list of flow binding entries for this mobile node   then this is a request to update the existing entry .
:LABEL: field

name: H
description: When the home agent receives a binding update that includes flow summary mobility options   it first performs the operation described so far in Section 5.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 22
:LABEL: field

name: MD
description: This memo defines the semantics of the following MD field value :
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: This bit indicates whether the notification message MUST be acknowledged by the recipient . If the " A " bit has been set during the message   but the sender doesn't receive any acknowledgement message   then the sender will have to re-send the notification message again .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be sent as 0   and ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The home address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent Address
description: The IP address of the mobile node's HA .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The mobile node's care-of address   either the co-located care-of address or the foreign agent care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number   constructed by the sender   used for matching GNM with GNAM and for protecting against replay attacks of notification messages . See Sections 7.1.1 and 7.1.2 for more on the use of timestamps and nonces in this field . Support for the use of timestamps is REQUIRED   and support for nonces is OPTIONAL .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 23
:LABEL: field

name: MD
description: This memo defines the semantics of the following MD field value :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: A value indicating the result of the GNM . See below for a list of currently defined Code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Address
description: The home address of the mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Agent Address
description: The IP address of the sender's home agent .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: The mobile node's care-of address   either the co-located care-of address or the foreign agent care-of address .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: A 64-bit number used for matching the GNM with the GNAM and for protecting against replay attacks of notification messages . See Sections 7.1.1 and 7.1.2 for more on the use of timestamps and nonces in this field . Support for the use of timestamps is REQUIRED   and support for nonces is OPTIONAL . The value is based on the Identification field from the GNM from the sender   and on the style of replay protection used in the security context between the sender and its receiver ( defined by the mobility security association between them   and the Security Parameter Index ( SPI ) value in the authorization-enabling extension ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) is in units of 8 octets . The minimum value is 3 if one IPv6 address is contained in the option . Every additional RDNSS address increases the length by 2 . The Length field is used by the receiver to determine the number of IPv6 addresses in the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime 32-bit unsigned integer . The maximum time   in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent )  over which this RDNSS address MAY be used for name resolution . Hosts MAY send a Router Solicitation to ensure the RDNSS information is fresh before the interval expires . In order to provide fixed hosts with stable DNS service and allow mobile hosts to prefer local RDNSSes to remote RDNSSes   the value of Lifetime SHOULD be bounded as MaxRtrAdvInterval <= Lifetime <= 2*MaxRtrAdvInterval where MaxRtrAdvInterval is the Maximum RA Interval defined in [ RFC4861 ]. A value of all one bits ( 0xffffffff ) represents infinity . A value of zero means that the RDNSS address MUST no longer be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) is in units of 8 octets . The minimum value is 2 if at least one domain name is contained in the option . The Length field is set to a multiple of 8 octets to accommodate all the domain names in the field of Domain Names of DNS Search List .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime 32-bit unsigned integer . The maximum time   in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent )  over which this DNSSL domain name MAY be used for name resolution . The Lifetime value has the same semantics as with the RDNSS option . That is   Lifetime SHOULD be bounded as follows : MaxRtrAdvInterval <= Lifetime <= 2*MaxRtrAdvInterval .
:LABEL: field

name: LSR's Router ID
description: Unchanged from the definition in [ RFC3477 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Actions
description: This field specifies how the LSP that is being set up is to be treated .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The Reserved bits MUST be set to zero on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: TLVs
description: Zero   one   or more TLVs may be present . Each TLV is encoded as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Interface Address
description: The address assigned to the interface that the sender applies to this LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: Actions
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: TLVs
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Actions
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: TLVs
description: See Section 3.1.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: IGP Instance Identifier
description: A 32-bit identifier assigned to each of the IGP instances within a network   such that ingress and egress LSRs have the same understanding of these numbers . This is a management configuration exercise outside the scope of this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Component Link Identifier
description: Unnumbered identifier that is assigned to this component link within the bundle [ RFC4201 ].
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: The IPv4 address that is assigned to this component link within the bundle .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: The IPv6 address that is assigned to this component link within the bundle .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Relative times are carried as 16-bit values specifying a number of centiseconds ( hundredths of a second ). This allows times up to roughly 11 minutes with a granularity of 10 ms   which should cover all reasonable applications of Babel .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-Id
description: A router-id is an arbitrary 8-octet value . Router-ids SHOULD be assigned in modified EUI-64 format [ ADDRARCH ].
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: o AE 0 : wildcard address . The value is 0 octets long .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: o AE 1 : IPv4 address . Compression is allowed . 4 octets or less .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: o AE 3 : link-local IPv6 address . The value is 8 octets long   a prefix of fe80::/64 is implied .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: o AE 3 : link-local IPv6 address . The value is 8 octets long   a prefix of fe80::/64 is implied .
:LABEL: field

name: Magic
description: Magic The arbitrary but carefully chosen value 42 ( decimal ); packets with a first octet different from 42 MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version This document specifies version 2 of the Babel protocol . Packets with a second octet different from 2 MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Body length
description: Body length The length in octets of the body following the packet header .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type The type of the TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields . If the body is longer than the expected length of a given type of TLV   any extra data MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 0 to indicate a Pad1 TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 1 to indicate a PadN TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 2 to indicate an Acknowledgement Request TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Nonce An arbitrary value that will be echoed in the receiver's Acknowledgement TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce An arbitrary value that will be echoed in the receiver's Acknowledgement TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Interval A time interval in centiseconds after which the sender will assume that this packet has been lost . This MUST NOT be 0 . The receiver MUST send an acknowledgement before this time has elapsed ( with a margin allowing for propagation time ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 3 to indicate an Acknowledgement TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce Set to the Nonce value of the Acknowledgement Request that prompted this Acknowledgement .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 4 to indicate a Hello TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Seqno The value of the sending node's Hello seqno for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Seqno
description: Seqno The value of the sending node's Hello seqno for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Interval An upper bound   expressed in centiseconds   on the time after which the sending node will send a new Hello TLV . This MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 5 to indicate an IHU TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: AE The encoding of the Address field . This should be 1 or 3 in most cases . As an optimisation   it MAY be 0 if the TLV is sent to a unicast address   if the association is over a point-to-point link   or when bidirectional reachability is ascertained by means outside of the Babel protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Rxcost The rxcost according to the sending node of the interface whose address is specified in the Address field . The value FFFF hexadecimal ( infinity ) indicates that this interface is unreachable .
:LABEL: field

name: Rxcost
description: Rxcost The rxcost according to the sending node of the interface whose address is specified in the Address field . The value FFFF hexadecimal ( infinity ) indicates that this interface is unreachable .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Interval An upper bound   expressed in centiseconds   on the time after which the sending node will send a new IHU; this MUST NOT be 0 . The receiving node will use this value in order to compute a hold time for this symmetric association .
:LABEL: field

name: Router-Id
description: A Router-Id TLV establishes a router-id that is implied by subsequent Update TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 6 to indicate a Router-Id TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Router-Id The router-id for routes advertised in subsequent Update TLVs
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 7 to indicate a Next Hop TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: AE The encoding of the Address field . This SHOULD be 1 or 3 and MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Next hop The next-hop address advertised by subsequent Update TLVs   for this address family .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 8 to indicate an Update TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: Flags The individual bits of this field specify special handling of this TLV ( see below ). Every node MUST be able to interpret the flags with values 80 and 40 hexadecimal; unknown flags MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags The individual bits of this field specify special handling of this TLV ( see below ). Every node MUST be able to interpret the flags with values 80 and 40 hexadecimal; unknown flags MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Plen
description: Plen The length of the advertised prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: Omitted
description: Omitted The number of octets that have been omitted at the beginning of the advertised prefix and that should be taken from a preceding Update TLV with the flag with value 80 hexadecimal set .
:LABEL: field

name: Interval
description: Interval An upper bound   expressed in centiseconds   on the time after which the sending node will send a new update for this prefix . This MUST NOT be 0 and SHOULD NOT be less than 10 . The receiving node will use this value to compute a hold time for this routing table entry . The value FFFF hexadecimal ( infinity ) expresses that this announcement will not be repeated unless a request is received ( Section 3.8.2.3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Seqno
description: Seqno The originator's sequence number for this update .
:LABEL: field

name: Metric
description: Metric The sender's metric for this route . The value FFFF hexadecimal ( infinity ) means that this is a route retraction .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 9 to indicate a Route Request TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: AE The encoding of the Prefix field . The value 0 specifies that this is a request for a full routing table dump ( a wildcard request ).
:LABEL: field

name: Plen
description: Prefix The prefix being requested . This field's size is Plen/8 rounded upwards .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Set to 10 to indicate a Seqno Request message .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: AE
description: AE The encoding of the Prefix field . This MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Plen
description: Plen The length of the requested prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: Seqno
description: Seqno The sequence number that is being requested .
:LABEL: field

name: LOCAL_IF
description: Note : This information is recorded here for clarity and for use elsewhere in this specification . The information required by IANA is included in the descriptions of the Address Block TLVs allocated in Section 18.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: LINK_STATUS
description: Note : This information is recorded here for clarity and for use elsewhere in this specification . The information required by IANA is included in the descriptions of the Address Block TLVs allocated in Section 18.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : the type of the REQUESTED-ADDRESS-FAMILY attribute is 0x0017 . As specified in [ RFC5389 ]  attributes with values between 0x0000 and 0x7FFF are comprehension-required   which means that the client or server cannot successfully process the message unless it understands the attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : this 16-bit field contains the length of the attribute in bytes . The length of this attribute is 4 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Family
description: Family : there are two values defined for this field and specified in [ RFC5389 ]  Section 15.1 : 0x01 for IPv4 addresses and 0x02 for IPv6 addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : at this point   the 24 bits in the Reserved field MUST be set to zero by the client and MUST be ignored by the server .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Total number of bytes contained in the value field   including the length of the sub-TLVs carried in this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o Topology Identifier : MT ID is a 12-bit field containing the MT ID of the topology being announced . This field when set to zero implies that it is being used to carry base topology information .
:LABEL: field

name: Topology Identifier
description: o Topology Identifier : MT ID is a 12-bit field containing the MT ID of the topology being announced . This field when set to zero implies that it is being used to carry base topology information .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Total number of bytes contained in the value field given by 5 + 6*n bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Confidence
description: o Confidence : This carries an 8-bit quantity indicating the confidence level in the MAC addresses being transported . Whether this field is used   and its semantics if used   are further defined by the specific protocol using Layer-2 IS-IS . If not used   it MUST be set to zero on transmission and be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o VLAN-ID : This carries a 12-bit VLAN identifier that is valid for all subsequent MAC addresses in this TLV   or the value zero if no VLAN is specified .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit forbidden_zero_bit . The H.264 specification declares a value of 1 as a syntax violation .
:LABEL: field

name: NRI
description: NRI : 2 bits nal_ref_idc . A value of 00 indicates that the content of the NAL unit is not used to reconstruct reference pictures for inter picture prediction . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of the reference pictures . Values greater than 00 indicate that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of the reference pictures .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 bits nal_unit_type . This component specifies the NAL unit payload type as defined in Table 7-1 of [ 1 ] and later within this memo . For a reference of all currently defined NAL unit types and their semantics   please refer to Section 7.4.1 in [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: decoding order number ( DON ): A field in the payload structure or a derived variable indicating NAL unit decoding order . Values of DON are in the range of 0 to 65535   inclusive . After reaching the maximum value   the value of DON wraps around to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: DON : Decoding Order Number DONB : Decoding Order Number Base DOND : Decoding Order Number Difference FEC : Forward Error Correction FU : Fragmentation Unit IDR : Instantaneous Decoding Refresh IEC : International Electrotechnical Commission ISO : International Organization for Standardization ITU-T : International Telecommunication Union   Telecommunication Standardization Sector MANE : Media-Aware Network Element MTAP : Multi-Time Aggregation Packet
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker bit ( M ): 1 bit Set for the very last packet of the access unit indicated by the RTP timestamp   in line with the normal use of the M bit in video
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload type ( PT ): 7 bits The assignment of an RTP payload type for this new packet format is outside the scope of this document and will not be specified here . The assignment of a payload type has to be performed either through the profile used or in a dynamic way .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit forbidden_zero_bit . A value of 0 indicates that the NAL unit type octet and payload should not contain bit errors or other syntax violations . A value of 1 indicates that the NAL unit type octet and payload may contain bit errors or other syntax violations .
:LABEL: field

name: NRI
description: NRI : 2 bits nal_ref_idc . The semantics of value 00 and a non-zero value remain unchanged from the H.264 specification . In other words   a value of 00 indicates that the content of the NAL unit is not used to reconstruct reference pictures for inter picture prediction . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of the reference pictures . Values greater than 00 indicate that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of the reference pictures .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: In the interleaved packetization mode   the transmission order of NAL units is allowed to differ from the decoding order of the NAL units . Decoding order number ( DON ) is a field in the payload structure or a derived variable that indicates the NAL unit decoding order . Rationale and examples of use cases for transmission out of decoding order and for the use of DON are given in Section 13 .
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) < 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = DON(n ) - DON(m )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) < 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = DON(n ) - DON(m )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) >= 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = 65536 - DON(m ) + DON(n )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) >= 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = 65536 - DON(m ) + DON(n )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) >= 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = - ( DON(m ) + 65536 - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) >= 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = - ( DON(m ) + 65536 - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) < 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = - ( DON(m ) - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) < 32768 )  don_diff(m n ) = - ( DON(m ) - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 bits The NAL unit payload type as defined in Table 7-1 of [ 1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) < 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) + DON(n ) - DON(m )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) < 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) + DON(n ) - DON(m )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) >= 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) + 65536 - DON(m ) + DON(n )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) >= 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) + 65536 - DON(m ) + DON(n )
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) >= 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) - ( DON(m ) + 65536 - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) < DON(n ) and DON(n ) - DON(m ) >= 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) - ( DON(m ) + 65536 - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) < 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) - ( DON(m ) - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: DON
description: If ( DON(m ) > DON(n ) and DON(m ) - DON(n ) < 32768 )  AbsDON(n ) = AbsDON(m ) - ( DON(m ) - DON(n ))
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit forbidden_zero_bit . H.264/AVC declares a value of 1 as a syntax violation .
:LABEL: field

name: NRI
description: NRI : 2 bits nal_ref_idc . A value of " 00 " ( in binary form ) indicates that the content of the NAL unit is not used to reconstruct reference pictures for future prediction . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of the reference pictures in the same layer . A value greater than " 00 " indicates that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of reference pictures in the same layer or that the NAL unit contains parameter sets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 bits nal_unit_type . This component specifies the NAL unit type as defined in Table 7-1 of [ H.264 ]  and later within this memo . For a reference of all currently defined NAL unit types and their semantics   please refer to Section 7.4.1 in [ H.264 ].
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : 1 bit reserved_one_bit . Reserved bit for future extension . R must be equal to 1 . The value of R must be ignored by decoders .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : 1 bit idr_flag . This component specifies whether the layer representation is an instantaneous decoding refresh ( IDR ) layer representation ( when equal to 1 ) or not ( when equal to 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: PRID
description: PRID : 6 bits priority_id . This flag specifies a priority identifier for the NAL unit . A lower value of PRID indicates a higher priority .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : 1 bit no_inter_layer_pred_flag . This flag specifies   when present in a coded slice NAL unit   whether inter-layer prediction may be used for decoding the coded slice ( when equal to 1 ) or not ( when equal to 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: DID
description: DID : 3 bits dependency_id . This component indicates the inter-layer coding dependency level of a layer representation . At any access unit   a layer representation with a given dependency_id may be used for inter-layer prediction for coding of a layer representation with a higher dependency_id   while a layer representation with a given dependency_id shall not be used for inter-layer prediction for coding of a layer representation with a lower dependency_id .
:LABEL: field

name: QID
description: QID : 4 bits quality_id . This component indicates the quality level of an MGS layer representation . At any access unit and for identical dependency_id values   a layer representation with quality_id equal to ql uses a layer representation with quality_id equal to ql-1 for inter-layer prediction .
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: TID : 3 bits temporal_id . This component indicates the temporal level of a layer representation . The temporal_id is associated with the frame rate   with lower values of _temporal_id corresponding to lower frame rates . A layer representation at a given temporal_id typically depends on layer representations with lower temporal_id values   but it never depends on layer representations with higher temporal_id values .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : 1 bit use_ref_base_pic_flag . A value of 1 indicates that only reference base pictures are used during the inter prediction process . A value of 0 indicates that the reference base pictures are not used during the inter prediction process .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : 1 bit discardable_flag . A value of 1 indicates that the current NAL unit is not used for decoding NAL units with values of dependency_id higher than the one of the current NAL unit   in the current and all subsequent access units . Such NAL units can be discarded without risking the integrity of layers with higher dependency_id values . discardable_flag equal to 0 indicates that the decoding of the NAL unit is required to maintain the integrity of layers with higher dependency_id .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O : 1 bit output_flag : Affects the decoded picture output process as defined in Annex C of [ H.264 ].
:LABEL: field

name: RR
description: RR : 2 bits reserved_three_2bits . Reserved bits for future extension . RR MUST be equal to " 11 " ( in binary form ). The value of RR must be ignored by decoders .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: o If the X bit is equal to 1   the bits A   P   and C are specified as below . Otherwise   the bits A   P   and C are unspecified   and receivers MUST ignore the values of these bits . The X bit SHOULD be identical for all the PACSI NAL units in all the RTP sessions carrying the same SVC bitstream .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : configuration for sending and receiving streams P : properties of the stream to be sent R : receiver capabilities S : out-of-band parameter sets O : operation point selection X : MUST NOT be present -: not usable   when present SHOULD be ignored
:LABEL: field

name: Grid
description: The value for Grid is set to 1 for the ITU-T DWDM grid as defined in [ G.694.1 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C.S .
description: DWDM channel spacing is defined as follows .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field in lambda label format is used to distinguish different lasers ( in one node ) when they can transmit the same frequency lambda . The Identifier field is a per-node assigned and scoped value . This field MAY change on a per-hop basis . In all cases but one   a node MAY select any value   including zero ( 0 )  for this field . Once selected   the value MUST NOT change until the LSP is torn down   and the value MUST be used in all LSP-related messages   e.g .  in Resv messages and label Record Route Object ( RRO ) subobjects . The sole special case occurs when this label format is used in a label Explicit Route Object ( ERO ) subobject . In this case   the special value of zero ( 0 ) means that the referenced node MAY assign any Identifier field value   including zero ( 0 )  when establishing the corresponding LSP . When a non-zero value is assigned to the Identifier field in a label ERO subobject   the referenced node MUST use the assigned value for the Identifier field in the corresponding LSP-related messages .
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: n is a two's-complement integer to take either a positive   negative   or zero value . This value is used to compute the frequency as shown above .
:LABEL: field

name: Grid
description: The value for Grid is set to 2 for the ITU-T CWDM grid as defined in [ G.694.2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C.S .
description: ( 2 ) C.S . ( channel spacing ): 4 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field in lambda label format is used to distinguish different lasers ( in one node ) when they can transmit the same frequency lambda . The Identifier field is a per-node assigned and scoped value . This field MAY change on a per-hop basis . In all cases but one   a node MAY select any value   including zero ( 0 )  for this field . Once selected   the value MUST NOT change until the LSP
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: n is a two's-complement integer . This value is used to compute the wavelength as shown above .
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: Frequency ( THz ) = 193.1 THz + n * channel spacing ( THz )
:LABEL: field

name: n
description: Wavelength ( nm ) = 1471 nm + n * 20 nm
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of entire attribute including type and length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: 4 octets encoding the Cisco Vendor ID of 9
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-length
description: Length of the sub-attribute including the sub-type and sub-length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of entire attribute including type and length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: 4 octets encoding the Cisco Vendor ID of 9
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-length
description: Length of the sub-attribute including the sub-type and sub-length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Enc Type
description: The Enc Type field indicates the method used to encrypt the contents of the Data field . This document defines only one value ( decimal ) for this field :
:LABEL: field

name: App ID
description: The App ID field is 4 octets in length and identifies the type of application for which the key material is to be used . This allows for multiple keys for different purposes to be present in the same message . This document defines two values for the App ID :
:LABEL: field

name: KEK ID
description: The KEK ID field is 16 octets in length . The combination of the KEK ID and the client and server IP addresses together uniquely identify a key shared between the RADIUS client and server . As a result   the KEK ID need not be globally unique . The KEK ID MUST refer to an encryption key of a type and length appropriate for use with the algorithm specified by the Enc Type field ( see above ). This key is used to protect the contents of the Data field ( below ). The KEK ID is a constant that is configured through an out-of-band mechanism . The same value is configured on both the RADIUS client and server . If no KEK ID is configured   then the field is set to 0 . If only a single KEK is configured for use between a given RADIUS client and server   then 0 can be used as the default value .
:LABEL: field

name: KM ID
description: The KM ID field is 16 octets in length and contains an identifier for the contents of the Data field . The KM ID MAY be used by communicating parties to identify the material being transmitted . The combination of App ID and KM ID MUST uniquely identify the keying material between the parties utilizing it . The KM ID is assumed to be known to the parties that derived the keying material . If the KM ID is not used   it is set to 0 . The KM ID for the EAP Master Session Key ( MSK ) application is set to 0 . Another application that uses the KM ID field can be defined in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: The Lifetime field is an integer [ RFC2865 ] representing the period of time ( in seconds ) for which the keying material is valid .
:LABEL: field

name: IV
description: The length of the IV field depends upon the value of the Enc Type field   but is fixed for any given value thereof . When the value of the Enc Type field is 0 ( decimal )  the IV field MUST be 8 octets in length ( as illustrated above )  and the value of the IV field MUST be as specified in [ RFC3394 ]. If the IV for Enc Type 0 does not match [ RFC3394 ]  then the receiver MUST NOT use the key material from this attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: Keying Material Data
description: The Keying Material Data field is of variable length and contains the actual encrypted keying material .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of entire attribute including type and length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: 4 octets encoding the Cisco Vendor ID of 9
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-length
description: Length of the sub-attribute including the sub-type and sub-length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of entire attribute including type and length fields
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: 4 octets encoding the Cisco Vendor ID of 9
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-length
description: Length of the sub-attribute including the sub-type and sub-length fields
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Type
description: The MAC Type field specifies the algorithm used to create the value in the MAC field . This document defines six values for the MAC Type field :
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Key ID
description: The MAC Key ID field is 16 octets in length and contains an identifier for the key . The combination of the MAC Key ID and the client and server IP addresses together uniquely identify a key shared between the RADIUS client and server . As a result   the MAC Key ID need not be globally unique . The MAC Key ID MUST refer to a key of a type and length appropriate for use with the algorithm specified by the MAC Type field ( see above ).
:LABEL: field

name: MAC
description: Both the length and value of the MAC field depend upon the algorithm specified by the value of the MAC Type field . If the algorithm specified is HMAC-SHA-1   HMAC-SHA-256   or HMAC-SHA-512   the MAC field MUST be 20   32   or 64 octets in length   respectively . If the algorithm specified is CMAC-AES-128   CMAC-AES-192   or CMAC-AES-256   the MAC field SHOULD be 64 octets in length . The derivation of the MAC field value for all the algorithms specified in this document is identical   except for the algorithm used . There are differences   however   depending upon whether the MAC is being computed for a request message or a response . These differences are detailed below   with the free variable HASH-ALG representing the actual algorithm used .
:LABEL: field

name: OptLen
description: LatUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents latitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: LatUnc
description: LatUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents latitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: Latitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: LongUnc
description: LongUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents longitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Longitude
description: Longitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: AType
description: AType : 4 bits . Altitude Type   defined in Section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: AltUnc
description: AltUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents altitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
description: Altitude : A 30-bit value defined by the AType field   described in Section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver : The Ver field is 2 bits   providing for four potential versions . This specification defines the behavior of version 1 . The Ver field is always located at the same offset from the beginning of the option   regardless of the version in use . DHCPv6 clients implementing this specification MUST support receiving version 1 responses . DHCPv6 servers implementing this specification MUST send version 1 responses .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res : 3 bits . The Res field is reserved . These bits have been used by [ IEEE-802.11y ]  but are not defined within this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Datum
description: Datum : 3 bits . The Map Datum used for the coordinates given in this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 bits . The length of the option   in octets . The option length is 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: LaRes
description: LaRes : 6 bits . This field represents latitude resolution .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: Latitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of signed integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: LoRes
description: LoRes : 6 bits . This field represents longitude resolution .
:LABEL: field

name: Longitude
description: Longitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of signed integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: AType
description: AType : 4 bits . Altitude Type   defined in Section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: AltRes
description: AltRes : 6 bits . This field represents altitude resolution .
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
description: Altitude : A 30-bit value defined by the AType field   described in Section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res : 5 bits . The Res field is reserved . These bits have been used by IEEE 802.11y [ IEEE-802.11y ]  but are not defined within this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Datum
description: Datum : 3 bits . The Map Datum used for the coordinates given in this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 bits . The length of the option   in octets . For version 1   the option length is 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: LatUnc
description: LatUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents latitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: Latitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: LongUnc
description: LongUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents longitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Longitude
description: Longitude : A 34-bit fixed-point value consisting of 9 bits of integer and 25 bits of fraction   interpreted as described in Section 2.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: AType
description: AltUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents altitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: AltUnc
description: AltUnc : 6 bits . When the Ver field = 1   this field represents altitude uncertainty . The contents of this field are undefined for other values of the Ver field .
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
description: Altitude : A 30-bit value defined by the AType field   described in Section 2.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver : The Ver field is 2 bits   providing for four potential versions . This specification defines the behavior of version 1 . The Ver field is always located at the same offset from the beginning of the option   regardless of the version in use .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res : 3 bits . The Res field is reserved . These bits have been used by [ IEEE-802.11y ]  but are not defined within this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Datum
description: Datum : 3 bits . The Map Datum used for the coordinates given in this option .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: The latitude and longitude values in this specification are encoded as 34-bit   two's complement   fixed-point values with 9 integer bits and 25 fractional bits . The exact meaning of these values is determined by the datum; the description in this section applies to the datums defined in this document . This document uses the same definition for all datums it specifies .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: In the DHCPv4 GeoConf Option 123   the LaRes value encodes the number of high-order latitude bits that MUST be considered valid . Any bits entered to the right of this limit MUST NOT be considered valid and might be purposely false   or zeroed by the sender . The examples in Appendix B illustrate that a smaller value in the resolution field increases the area within which the device is located . A value of 2 in the LaRes field indicates a precision of no greater than 1/6th that of the globe ( see the first example of Appendix B ). A value of 34 in the LaRes field indicates a precision of about 3.11 mm in latitude at the equator .
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude
description: In the DHCPv6 GeoLoc Option 63 and the DHCPv4 GeoLoc Option 144   the Latitude and Longitude Uncertainty fields ( LatUnc and LongUnc ) quantify the amount of uncertainty in each of the latitude and longitude values   respectively . A value of 0 is reserved to indicate that the uncertainty is unknown; values greater than 34 are reserved .
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
description: How the altitude value is interpreted depends on the Altitude Type ( AType ) value and the selected datum . Three Altitude Type values are defined in this document : unknown ( 0 )  meters ( 1 )  and floors ( 2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Datum
description: The Datum field determines how coordinates are organized and related to the real world . Three datums are defined in this document   based on the definitions in [ OGP.Geodesy ]:
:LABEL: field

name: Datum
description: Datum : An integer   refers to the value used in the DHCPv4 GeoConf and the DHCPv4 and DHCPv6 GeoLoc options described in this document . Value 0 is Reserved . Values 1 - 3 are assigned . Values 4 - 7 are Unassigned [ RFC5226 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
