description: o SFGMP Join Time ( 32 bits ): TLV element that denotes the greater of zero or the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the SFGMP Join message was sent and the instant the first packet was
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Application Request-to-Multicast Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the application became aware it would join a new multicast session and the instant the first RTP packet was received from the primary multicast stream . If no such packet has been received   this element MUST NOT exist in the report block .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Application Request-to-Presentation Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the application became aware it would join a new multicast session and the instant the media was first presented . If the RTP receiver cannot successfully present the media   this element MUST NOT exist in the report block .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: We next present the TLV elements that can be used when the RTP receiver supports and uses the RAMS method described in [ RFC6285 ]. However   if the RTP receiver does not send a rapid acquisition request   the following TLV elements MUST NOT exist in the MA report block . Some elements may or may not exist depending on whether or not the RTP receiver receives any packet from the unicast burst and/or the primary multicast stream . These are explained below .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o RAMS Request-to-RAMS Information Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the rapid acquisition request was sent and the instant the
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o RAMS Request-to-Burst Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the rapid acquisition request was sent and the instant the first burst packet was received in the unicast session . If no burst packet has been received   this element MUST NOT exist in the report block .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o RAMS Request-to-Multicast Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the rapid acquisition request was sent and the instant the first RTP packet was received from the primary multicast stream . If no such packet has been received   this element MUST NOT exist in the report block .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o RAMS Request-to-Burst-Completion Delta Time ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the time difference ( in ms ) between the instant the rapid acquisition request was sent and the instant the last burst packet was received in the unicast session . If no burst packet has been received   this element MUST NOT exist in the report block .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Number of Duplicate Packets ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the number of duplicate packets due to receiving the same packet in both unicast and primary multicast RTP sessions . If no RTP packet has been received from the primary multicast stream   this element MUST NOT exist . If no burst packet has been received in the unicast session   the value of this element MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Size of Burst-to-Multicast Gap ( 32 bits ): OPTIONAL TLV element that denotes the greater of zero or the difference between the sequence number of the first multicast packet ( received from the primary multicast stream ) and the sequence number of the last burst packet minus 1 ( considering the wrapping of the sequence
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 17
:LABEL: field

name: Signal Type
description: The signal types can never be mixed in a VCG; hence   a VCAT call contains only one signal type . This field can take the following values and MUST never change over the lifetime of a VCG [ ANSI-T1.105 ] [ ITU-T-G.707 ] [ ITU-T-G.709 ] [ ITU-T-G.7043 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Members
description: This field is an unsigned integer that MUST indicate the total number of members in the VCG ( not just the call ). This field MUST be changed ( over the life of the VCG ) to indicate the current number of members .
:LABEL: field

name: LCR
description: This field can take the following values and MUST NOT change over the life of a VCG :
:LABEL: field

name: Action
description: This field is used to indicate the relationship between the call and the VCG and has the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Only LCP Code values 1 through 7 ( Configure-Request   Configure-Ack   Configure-Nak   Configure-Reject   Terminate-Request   Terminate-Ack   and Code-Reject ) are used . All other codes SHOULD result in a TNCP Code-Reject reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: These are as documented for LCP .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: These are as documented for LCP .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: When the message arrives at B   the following timestamp is recorded in the message :
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: At this point   B transmits the message back to A   recording within it the following timestamp :
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: When the message arrives back at A   the following timestamp is recorded in the message :
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: ( Strictly speaking   it is not necessary that the fourth timestamp   T4   actually be written in the message   but this is convenient for some implementations and useful if the message is to be forwarded on to an external measurement system .)
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version : Currently set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The format of the Flags field is shown below .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : Query/Response indicator . Set to 0 for a Query and 1 for a Response .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : Traffic-class-specific measurement indicator . Set to 1 when the measurement operation is scoped to packets of a particular traffic class ( DSCP value )  and 0 otherwise . When set to 1   the DS field of the message indicates the measured traffic class .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Code
description: Control Code : Set as follows according to whether the message is a Query or a Response as identified by the R flag .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length : Set to the total length of this message in bytes   including the Version   Flags   Control Code   and Message Length fields as well as the TLV Block   if any .
:LABEL: field

name: DFlags
description: DFlags : The format of the DFlags field is shown below .
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: X : Extended counter format indicator . Indicates the use of extended ( 64-bit ) counter values . Initialized to 1 upon creation ( and prior to transmission ) of an LM Query and copied from an LM Query to an LM response . Set to 0 when the LM message is transmitted or received over an interface that writes 32-bit counter values .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : Octet ( byte ) count . When set to 1   indicates that the Counter 1-4 fields represent octet counts . The octet count applies to all packets within the LM scope ( Section 2.9.9 )  and the octet count of a packet sent or received over a channel includes the total length of that packet ( but excludes headers   labels   or framing of the channel itself ). When set to 0   indicates that the Counter 1-4 fields represent packet counts .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Identifier
description: Session Identifier : Set arbitrarily in a query and copied in the response   if any . This field uniquely identifies a measurement operation ( also called a session ) that consists of a sequence of messages . All messages in the sequence have the same Session Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: DS
description: DS : When the T flag is set to 1   this field is set to the DSCP value [ RFC3260 ] that corresponds to the traffic class being measured . For MPLS   where the traffic class of a channel is identified by the three-bit Traffic Class in the channel's LSE [ RFC5462 ]  this field
:LABEL: field

name: Origin Timestamp
description: Origin Timestamp : Timestamp recording the transmit time of the query message .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Block
description: TLV Block : Zero or more TLV fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Flags : As specified in Section 3.1 . The T flag in a DM message is set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : As specified in Section 3.1 . The T flag in a DM message is set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Code
description: Message Length : Set to the total length of this message in bytes   including the Version   Flags   Control Code   and Message Length fields as well as the TLV Block   if any .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length : Set to the total length of this message in bytes   including the Version   Flags   Control Code   and Message Length fields as well as the TLV Block   if any .
:LABEL: field

name: Session Identifier
description: Session Identifier : As specified in Section 3.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: DS
description: Timestamp 1-4 : Referring to Section 2.4   when a query is sent from A   Timestamp 1 is set to T1 and the other timestamp fields are set to 0 . When the query is received at B   Timestamp 2 is set to T2 . At this point   B copies Timestamp 1 to Timestamp 3 and Timestamp 2 to Timestamp 4   and re-initializes Timestamp 1 and Timestamp 2 to 0 . When B transmits the response   Timestamp 1 is set to T3 . When the response is received at A   Timestamp 2 is set to T4 . The actual formats of the timestamp fields written by A and B are indicated by the Querier Timestamp Format and Responder Timestamp Format fields respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Block
description: TLV Block : Zero or more TLV fields .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: The PT field indicates the currently configured protection architecture type   this SHOULD be validated to be consistent for both ends of the protection domain . If an inconsistency is detected   then an alarm SHALL be sent to the management system . The following are the possible values :
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: This field indicates that the transmitting end point is configured to work in revertive mode . If there is an inconsistency between the two end points   i.e .  one end point is configured for revertive action and the second end point is in non-revertive mode   then the management system SHOULD be notified . The following are the possible values :
:LABEL: field

name: FPath
description: The FPath field indicates which path ( i.e .  working or protection ) is identified to be in a fault condition or affected by an administrative command   when a fault or command is indicated by the Request field to be in effect . The following are the possible values :
:LABEL: field

name: Path
description: The Path field indicates which data is being transported on the protection path . Under normal conditions   the protection path ( especially   in 1:1 or 1:n architecture ) does not need to carry any user data traffic . If there is a failure/degrade condition on one of the working paths   then that working path's data traffic will be transported over the protection path . The following are the possible values :
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : indicates the number of bytes included in the optional TLV information . For the basic PSC protocol operation described in this document   this value MUST be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Optional TLVs
description: o Optional TLVs : this includes any additional information formatted as TLV units . There are no TLV units defined for the basic PSC operation .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The P2MP Capability TLV MUST be advertised in the LDP Initialization message . Advertisement of the P2MP Capability indicates support of the procedures for P2MP LSP setup detailed in this document . If the peer has not advertised the corresponding capability   then label messages using the P2MP FEC Element SHOULD NOT be sent to the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Address Family : Two octet quantity containing a value from IANA's " Address Family Numbers " registry that encodes the address family for the Root LSR Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: Address Family : Two octet quantity containing a value from IANA's " Address Family Numbers " registry that encodes the address family for the Root LSR Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Length
description: Root Node Address : A host address encoded according to the Address Family field .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Node Address
description: Root Node Address : A host address encoded according to the Address Family field .
:LABEL: field

name: Opaque Length
description: Opaque Value : One or more MP opaque value elements   uniquely identifying the P2MP LSP in the context of the root node . This is described in the next section .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The Type of the LDP MP opaque value element . IANA maintains a registry of basic types ( see Section 11 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Extended Type : The Extended Type of the LDP MP opaque value element . IANA maintains a registry of extended types ( see Section 11 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Type
description: Extended Type : The Extended Type of the LDP MP opaque value element . IANA maintains a registry of extended types ( see Section 11 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : A 32-bit integer   unique in the context of the root   as identified by the root's address .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : A 32-bit integer   unique in the context of the root   as identified by the root's address .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: The MP2MP Capability TLV MUST be advertised in the LDP Initialization message . Advertisement of the MP2MP Capability indicates support of the procedures for MP2MP LSP setup detailed in this document . If the peer has not advertised the corresponding capability   then label messages using the MP2MP upstream and downstream FEC Elements SHOULD NOT be sent to the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the LDP MP Status Value in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : One or more LDP MP Status Value elements .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The type of the LDP MP Status Value Element . IANA maintains a registry of status value types ( see Section 11 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : String of Length octets   to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Status Code
description: 2 = MBB ack
:LABEL: field

name: LDP MP MBB Capability
description: LDP MP MBB Capability : The MBB Capability Parameter ( 0x050A )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: If an LSR has not advertised that it is MBB capable   its LDP peers MUST NOT send it messages that include MBB parameters . If an LSR receives a Label Mapping message with an MBB parameter from downstream LSR-D and its upstream LSR-U has not advertised that it is MBB capable   the LSR MUST send an MBB notification immediately to LSR-U ( see Section 8.4 ). If this happens   an MBB MP LSP will not be established   but a normal MP LSP will be the result .
:LABEL: field

name: Typed Wcard
description: Type : The type of FEC Element Type . Either the P2MP FEC Element or the MP2MP FEC Element using the values defined for those FEC Elements when carried in the FEC TLV as defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The type of FEC Element Type . Either the P2MP FEC Element or the MP2MP FEC Element using the values defined for those FEC Elements when carried in the FEC TLV as defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI
description: AFI : Address Family   two-octet quantity containing a value from IANA's " Address Family Numbers " registry .
:LABEL: field

name: Local Interface Identifier
description: The 32-bit Local Interface Identifier is selected such that it is unique among the router's PIM-enabled interfaces . That is   there MUST NOT be two PIM interfaces with the same Local Interface Identifier . While an interface is up   the Identifier MUST always be the same once it has been allocated . If an interface goes down and comes up   the router SHOULD use the same Identifier . If a node goes down and comes up again   the Identifier for each interface MAY change . Many systems make use of an ifIndex [ RFC2863 ] as a Local Interface Identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: Router Identifier
description: The 32-bit Router Identifier may be used to uniquely identify the router . The requirements for the scope in which the Router Identifier needs to be unique depend on the protocols that utilize it . It may need to be unique within some administrative domain   or it may possibly be globally unique .
:LABEL: field

name: Router Identifier
description: Router Identifier : The Router Identifier is a 4-byte identifier uniquely identifying the router within some scope . It MAY be 0 when no protocols require a Router Identifier . The field MUST contain a valid Router Identifier or the value zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Local Interface Identifier
description: Local Interface Identifier : The Local Interface Identifier is a 4-byte identifier that is unique among all PIM-enabled interfaces on a router .
:LABEL: field

name: Collector BGP ID
description: Collector Latitude : Geographic latitude of the BGP collector in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Collector Latitude
description: Collector Latitude : Geographic latitude of the BGP collector in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Collector Longitude
description: Collector Longitude : Geographic longitude of the BGP collector in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Count
description: Peer Count : Defined in the MRT format [ RFC6396 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Type
description: Peer Type : Defined in the MRT format [ RFC6396 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Peer BGP ID
description: Peer Latitude : Geographic latitude of the BGP peer in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Latitude
description: Peer Latitude : Geographic latitude of the BGP peer in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Longitude
description: Peer Longitude : Geographic longitude of the BGP peer in WGS84 [ WGS-84 ] datum decimal degrees format stored as a single precision float .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Packets
description: o Key Packets ( variable ) -- Several types of key packets are defined . Each key packet has the following format .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Packet Attributes
description: o Key Packet Attributes ( variable length ) -- Contains key information . The format of this field is specific to the value of the KD Type field . The following sections describe the format of each KD Type .
:LABEL: field

name: KEK Attributes
description: The registration procedure is Standards Action . Values 9-127 have been added and are designated Unassigned . Values 128-255 have been added and are designated Private Use . Values 256-32767 have been added and are designated Unassigned .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): The assignment of an RTP payload type for this packet format is outside the scope of this document and will not be specified here . It is expected that the RTP profile for a particular class of applications will assign a payload type for this encoding   or if that is not done   then a payload type in the dynamic range SHALL be chosen by means of an out-of-band signaling protocol ( e.g .  H.245   SIP ).
:LABEL: field

name: X
description: Sequence Number : Incremented by 1 for each RTP data packet sent   starting   for security reasons   with a random initial value .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker ( M ) bit : The marker bit is set to 1 to indicate the last RTP packet ( or only RTP packet ) of a VOP . When multiple VOPs are carried in the same RTP packet   the marker bit is set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): The assignment of an RTP payload type for this packet format is outside the scope of this document and will only be restricted here . It is expected that the RTP profile for a particular class of applications will assign a payload type for this encoding   or if that is not done   then a payload type in the dynamic range shall be chosen by means of an out-of-band signaling protocol ( e.g .  H.245   SIP ). In the dynamic assignment of RTP payload types for scalable streams   the server SHALL assign a different value to each layer . The dependency relationships between the enhanced layer and the base layer MUST be signaled as specified in [ RFC5583 ]. An example of the use of such signaling for scalable audio streams can be found in [ RFC5691 ].
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker ( M ) bit : The marker bit indicates audioMuxElement boundaries . It is set to 1 to indicate that the RTP packet contains a complete audioMuxElement or the last fragment of an audioMuxElement .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The MTU is the size in octets of the largest MPLS frame ( including label stack ) that fits on the interface to the Downstream Label Switching Router ( LSR ).
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the Downstream IP Address and Downstream Interface fields .
:LABEL: field

name: DS Flags
description: The DS Flags field is a bit vector of various flags .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: The Return Code is set to zero by the sender . The receiver can set it to one of the values specified in the " Multi-Protocol Label Switching ( MPLS ) Label Switched Paths ( LSPs ) Ping Parameters " registry   " Return Codes " sub-registry .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Subcode
description: The Return Subcode is set to zero by the sender . The receiver can set it to one of the values specified in the " Multi-Protocol Label Switching ( MPLS ) Label Switched Paths ( LSPs ) Ping Parameters " registry   " Return Codes " sub-registry . This field is filled in with the stack-depth for those codes that specify the stack-depth . For all other codes   the Return Subcode MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-tlv Length
description: Total length in bytes of the sub-TLVs associated with this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Type
description: The type of the encoding for the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Length
description: The length in octets of the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Label
description: A Downstream label is 24 bits   in the same format as an MPLS label minus the Time to Live ( TTL ) field   i.e .  the MSBit of the label is bit 0   the LSBit is bit 19   the Traffic Class ( TC ) field [ RFC5462 ] is bits 20-22   and S is bit 23 . The replying router SHOULD fill in the TC field and S bit; the LSR receiving the echo reply MAY choose to ignore these .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: This specifies the label distribution protocol for the Downstream label .
:LABEL: field

name: Operation Type
description: The operation type specifies the action associated with the FEC stack change . The following operation types are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates the remote peer's address type . The Address Type is set to one of the following values . The length of the peer address is determined based on the address type . The address type MAY be different from the address type included in the Downstream Detailed Mapping TLV . This can happen when the LSP goes over a tunnel of a different address family . The address type MAY be set to Unspecified if the peer address is either unavailable or the transit router does not wish to provide it for security or administrative reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future use and MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: Two-octet quantity containing a value from ADDRESS FAMILY NUMBERS in [ IANA-AF ] that encodes the address family for the Root LSR Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Length
description: Length of the Root LSR Address in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Opaque Length
description: The length of the opaque value   in octets . Depending on the length of the Root LSR Address   this field may not be aligned to a word boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version Number is currently 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Two flags are defined . The reserved flags in this field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Refresh Timer
description: The maximum time between successive FM messages specified in seconds . The range is 1 to 20 . The value 0 is not permitted .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Encodes how the Value field is to be interpreted .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Specifies the length of the Value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Octet string of Length octets that encodes information to be interpreted as specified by the Type field .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value TLV Name ----- ------- 0 Reserved ( not available for allocation ) 1 Interface Identifier TLV 2 Global Identifier
:LABEL: field

name: Port Range Mask
description: The Port Range Value and Port Range Mask are used to specify one range of ports ( contiguous or non-contiguous ) pertaining to a given IP address . Concretely   the Port Range Mask and Port Range Value are used to notify a remote peer about the Port Mask to be applied when selecting a port value as a source port . The Port Range Value is used to infer a set of allowed port values . A Port Range Mask defines a set of ports that all have in common a subset of pre-positioned bits . This set of ports is also referred to as the port range .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: o M : mode bit . The mode bit indicates the mode for which the port range is allocated . A value of zero indicates that the port ranges are delegated   while a value of 1 indicates that the port ranges are port-forwarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Port Range Value
description: o Port Range Value ( PRV ): The PRV indicates the value of the significant bits of the Port Mask . By default   no PRV is assigned .
:LABEL: field

name: Port Range Mask
description: o Port Range Mask ( PRM ): The Port Range Mask indicates the position of the bits that are used to build the Port Range Value . By default   no PRM value is assigned . The 1 values in the Port Range Mask indicate by their position the significant bits of the Port Range Value .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: o M : mode bit . The mode bit indicates the mode for which the port range is allocated . A value of zero indicates that the port ranges are delegated   while a value of 1 indicates that the port ranges are port-forwarded .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The Reserved field MUST be set to zero on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Refresh Timer
description: Refresh Timer : The Refresh Timer is the maximum time between successive LI messages specified in seconds . The default value is 1 . The value 0 is not permitted . When a lock is applied   a refresh timer is chosen . This value MUST NOT be changed for the duration of that lock . A node receiving an LI message with a changed refresh timer MAY ignore the new value and continue to apply the old value .
:LABEL: field

name: MEP Source ID TLV
description: MEP Source ID TLV : This is one of the three MEP Source ID TLVs defined in [ 3 ] and identifies the MEP that originated the LI message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 2 octets ) specifies the length of the value field . Depending on the option type   it can be from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 2 octets ) specifies the length of the value field . Depending on the option type   it can be from 0 to 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: FIN
description: Indicates that this is the final fragment in a message . The first fragment MAY also be the final fragment .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV1
description: MUST be 0 unless an extension is negotiated that defines meanings for non-zero values . If a nonzero value is received and none of the negotiated extensions defines the meaning of such a nonzero value   the receiving endpoint MUST _Fail the WebSocket Connection _.
:LABEL: field

name: RSV2
description: MUST be 0 unless an extension is negotiated that defines meanings for non-zero values . If a nonzero value is received and none of the negotiated extensions defines the meaning of such a nonzero value   the receiving endpoint MUST _Fail the WebSocket Connection _.
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Redirect-Capability mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The Option Length MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Redirect-Capability mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The Option Length MUST be set to 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : This field is reserved for future use . This field MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Redirect mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . If the ' K ' flag is set and ' N ' is unset   then the length MUST be 18 . If the ' K ' flag is unset and ' N ' is set   then the length MUST be 6 . Both the ' K ' and ' N ' flags cannot be set or unset simultaneously .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Redirect mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . If the ' K ' flag is set and ' N ' is unset   then the length MUST be 18 . If the ' K ' flag is unset and ' N ' is set   then the length MUST be 6 . Both the ' K ' and ' N ' flags cannot be set or unset simultaneously .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : This field is reserved for future use . MUST be set to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Optional IPv6 r2LMA Address
description: o Optional IPv6 r2LMA Address : the unicast IPv6 address of the r2LMA . This value is present when the corresponding PBU was sourced from an IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Optional IPv4 r2LMA Address
description: o Optional IPv4 r2LMA Address : the IPv4 address of the r2LMA . This value is present when the corresponding PBU was sourced from an IPv4 address ( for IPv4 transport   see [ RFC5844 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Load Information mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The length is set to 18 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Load Information mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The length is set to 18 .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: o Priority : 16-bit unsigned integer   representing the priority of an LMA . The lower value   the higher the priority . The priority only has meaning among a group of LMAs under the same administration   for example   determined by a common LMA FQDN   a domain name   or a realm .
:LABEL: field

name: Sessions in Use
description: o Sessions in Use : 32-bit unsigned integer   representing the number of parallel mobility sessions the LMA has in use .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Sessions
description: o Maximum Sessions : 32-bit unsigned integer   representing the maximum number of parallel mobility sessions the LMA is willing to accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Used Capacity
description: o Used Capacity : 32-bit unsigned integer   representing the used bandwidth/throughput capacity of the LMA in kilobytes per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum Capacity
description: o Maximum Capacity : 32-bit unsigned integer   representing the maximum bandwidth/throughput capacity in kilobytes per second the LMA is willing to accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Load Information mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The length is set to 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: o Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length of the Load Information mobility option in octets   excluding the Option Type and Length fields . The length is set to 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: TLV length is always 4 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Bit B   in position 31 above   is set to request the S-PE bypass mode . R bits are to be allocated by IANA as described in the IANA section . If they are not allocated   they are to be considered as reserved for future use and MUST be zero on transmission and ignored on reception of this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length of the option ( including the Type   Length   Reserved   Key Hash   Digital Signature   and Padding fields ) in units of 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: A 16-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender   and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Hash
description: A 128-bit field containing the most significant ( leftmost ) 128 bits of a SHA-1 [ SHA1 ] hash of the public key used for constructing the signature . Its purpose is to associate the signature to a particular key known by the receiver . Such a key MUST be the same one within the corresponding Secure Proxy ND certificate .
:LABEL: field

name: Digital Signature
description: A variable-length field containing a PKCS#1 v1.5 signature   constructed by using the sender's private key over the following sequence of octets :
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: This variable-length field contains padding . The length of the padding field is determined by the length of the Proxy Signature option minus the length of the other fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Type
description: 16-bit field identifying the type of authentication . The following values are defined in this specification :
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Data Len
description: The length in octets of the Authentication Trailer ( AT ) including both the 16-octet fixed header and the variable length message digest .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved . It SHOULD be set to 0 when sending protocol packets and MUST be ignored when receiving protocol packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 16 bits ): the total number of octets in the Type   Length   and Value fields combined
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): the total number of octets in the Type   Length   and Value fields combined
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: In this specification   only one type of S-PMSI Join is defined . A Type 1 S-PMSI Join is used when the S-PMSI tunnel is a PIM tunnel that is used to carry a single multicast stream   where the packets of that stream have IPv4 source and destination IP addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 8 bits ): 1
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field SHOULD be zero when transmitted   and MUST be ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): This field SHOULD be zero when transmitted   and MUST be ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 16 bits ): 40   the length in octets of the entire S-PMSI Join message   including the Type   Length   Reserved   C-source   C-group   and P-group fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): 40   the length in octets of the entire S-PMSI Join message   including the Type   Length   Reserved   C-source   C-group   and P-group fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 8 bits ): this field SHOULD be zero when transmitted and MUST be ignored when received .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: RFC 5944 [ RFC5944 ] defines a care-of address as the termination point of a tunnel toward a mobile node   for datagrams forwarded to the mobile node while it is away from home . The protocol can use two different types of CoA : a " foreign agent care-of address "  which is an address of a foreign agent with which the mobile node is registered   and a " co-located care-of address "  which is an externally obtained local address that the mobile node has associated with one of its own network interfaces . However   in the case of Network Mobility   foreign agents are not used   so no foreign CoAs are used either .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 153 ( skippable ); if the HA does not support route optimization advertisements   it can ignore this request and simply not include any information in the reply . " short " extension format .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype 1
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: A Advertise my networks . If the ' A ' bit is set   the HA is allowed to advertise the networks managed by this MR to other MRs . This also indicates that the MR is capable of receiving route optimization Registration Requests . In effect   this allows the MR to work in the CR role .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A Advertise my networks . If the ' A ' bit is set   the HA is allowed to advertise the networks managed by this MR to other MRs . This also indicates that the MR is capable of receiving route optimization Registration Requests . In effect   this allows the MR to work in the CR role .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R Request mobile network information . If the ' R ' bit is set   the HA MAY respond with information about mobile networks in the same domain .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Solicit prefixes managed by a specific MR . The MR is specified in the Optional Mobile Router HoA field .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O Explicitly specify that the requesting router is only able to initiate outgoing connections and not accept any incoming connections   due to a NAT device   stateful firewall   or similar issue on any interface . This is reflected by the HA in the reply and distributed in Prefix Advertisements to other MRs .
:LABEL: field

name: Optional Mobile Router HoA
description: Solicited mobile router's home address . This field is only included if the ' S ' flag is set .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 49 ( non-skippable ); " short " extension format .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype 1
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O The ' O ' flag in the Mobile Router Route Optimization Capability Extension was set during registration .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N NAT was detected by the HA . This informs the MR that it is located behind a NAT . The detection procedure is specified in RFC 3519 [ RFC3519 ] and is based on the discrepancy between the registration packet's source address and indicated CoA . The MR can use this information to make decisions about route optimization strategy .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Responding to a solicitation . If the ' S ' bit was present in the MR's Route Optimization Capability Extension ( Section 5.1 )  this bit is set; otherwise   it is unset .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 49 ( non-skippable ); " short " extension format .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype 2
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Set to zero; MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Nonce Index
description: Home Nonce Index in use . If using a pre-shared KRm   set to zero and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Nonce Index
description: Care-of Nonce Index in use . If using a pre-shared KRm   set to zero and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 49 ( non-skippable ); " short " extension format .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Total length of the packet . When processing the information structures   if Length octets have been reached   this is an indication that the final information structure was reached as well .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype 3
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Address
description: Care-of address(es ) that may be used for a tunnel with the MR   in order of priority . Multiple CoAs MAY be listed to facilitate faster NAT traversal processing .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 50 ( non-skippable ); " long " extension format .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: Subtype 1
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Total length of the packet . When processing the information structures   if Length octets have been reached   this is an indication that the final information structure was reached as well .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D Delta . If D = 1   the prefix is a delta from the last Prefix   where D = 0 . MUST be zero on the first information structure containing a Prefix; MAY be zero or one on subsequent information structures . If D = 1   the Prefix field is one octet in length . See Section 4.1 for details .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M Mobile Router HoA bit . If M = 1   the next field is Mobile Router HoA   and Prefix and Realm are omitted . If M = 0   the next field is Prefix followed by Realm   and Mobile Router HoA is omitted . For the first information structure   M MUST be set to 1 . If M = 1   the ' D ' bit is set to zero and ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 24
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Set to zero; MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Init Cookie
description: 64-bit field that contains a random value   the Home Init Cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 25
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Care-of Init Cookie
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Init Cookie
description: 64-bit field that contains a random value   the Care-of Init Cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 26
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Set to zero; MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce Index
description: This field will be echoed back by the MR to the CR in a subsequent Registration Request's authentication extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Init Cookie
description: 64-bit field that contains a random value   the Home Init Cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Keygen Token
description: This field contains the 64-bit home keygen token used in the RR procedure . Generated from cookie + nonce .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 27
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Set to zero; MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Nonce Index
description: This field will be echoed back by the MR to the CR in a subsequent Registration Request's authentication extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Init Cookie
description: 64-bit field that contains a random value   the Care-of Init Cookie .
:LABEL: field

name: Care-of Keygen Token
description: This field contains the 64-bit care-of keygen token used in the RR procedure . Generated from cookie + nonce .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Flags
description: Chunk Flags : 1 byte ( unsigned integer ) This field is set to 0 by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Chunk Length
description: Chunk Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length of the chunk in bytes   including the Chunk Type   Chunk Flags   and Chunk Length .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length in bytes of the parameter; the value MUST be 16 + 2 * N   where N is the number of stream numbers listed .
:LABEL: field

name: Sender's Last Assigned TSN
description: Sender's Last Assigned TSN : 4 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the next TSN minus 1 -- in other words   the last TSN that this sender assigned .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length in bytes of the parameter; the value MUST be 8 + 2 * N .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length in bytes of the parameter; the value MUST be 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Result
description: Result : 4 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value describes the result of the processing of the request . It is encoded as indicated in Table 3 :
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length in bytes of the parameter; the value MUST be 12 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of new streams
description: Number of new streams : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the number of additional outgoing streams that the sender requests be added to the association . Streams are added in order and are consecutive; e.g .  if an association has 4 outgoing streams ( 0-3 ) and a request is made to add 3 streams   then the new streams will be 4   5   and 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field is reserved . It SHOULD be set to 0 by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Parameter Length
description: Parameter Length : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the length in bytes of the parameter; the value MUST be 12 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of new streams
description: Number of new streams : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This value holds the number of additional incoming streams that the sender requests be added to the association . Streams are added in order and are consecutive; e.g .  if an association has 4 outgoing streams ( 0-3 ) and a request is made to add 3 streams   then the new streams will be 4   5   and 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 2 bytes ( unsigned integer ) This field is reserved . It SHOULD be set to 0 by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Rank
description: Rank : A node's Rank defines the node's individual position relative to other nodes with respect to a DODAG root . Rank strictly increases in the Down direction and strictly decreases in the Up direction . The exact way Rank is computed depends on the DAG's Objective Function ( OF ). The Rank may analogously track a simple topological distance   may be calculated as a function of link metrics   and may consider other properties such as constraints .
:LABEL: field

name: OCP
description: Objective Code Point ( OCP ): An OCP is an identifier that indicates which Objective Function the DODAG uses .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : A RPLInstanceID is a unique identifier within a network . DODAGs with the same RPLInstanceID share the same Objective Function .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID : A DODAGID is the identifier of a DODAG root . The DODAGID is unique within the scope of a RPL Instance in the LLN . The tuple ( RPLInstanceID   DODAGID ) uniquely identifies a DODAG .
:LABEL: field

name: Security
description: RPL supports message confidentiality and integrity . It is designed such that link-layer mechanisms can be used when available and appropriate; yet   in their absence   RPL can use its own mechanisms . RPL has three basic security modes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Function : The Rank is the expression of a relative position within a DODAG Version with regard to neighbors   and it is not necessarily a good indication or a proper expression of a distance or a path cost to the root .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: taking both Nodes ( A ) and ( C ) as DODAG parents . Now Node ( B ) is deeper than both Nodes ( A ) and ( C ) and is satisfied with two DAG parents .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Counter is Time ( T ): If the counter's Time flag is set   then the Counter field is a timestamp . If the flag is cleared   then the counter is an incrementing counter . Section 10.5 describes the details of the ' T ' flag and Counter field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 7-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Algorithm
description: Security Algorithm ( Algorithm ): The Security Algorithm field specifies the encryption   MAC   and signature scheme the network uses . Supported values of this field are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: KIM
description: Key Identifier Mode ( KIM ): The Key Identifier Mode is a 2-bit field that indicates whether the key used for packet protection is determined implicitly or explicitly and indicates the particular representation of the Key Identifier field . The Key Identifier Mode is set one of the values from the table below :
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd : 3-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: LVL
description: Security Level ( LVL ): The Security Level is a 3-bit field that indicates the provided packet protection . This value can be adapted on a per-packet basis and allows for varying levels of data authenticity and   optionally   for data confidentiality . The KIM field indicates whether signatures are used and the meaning of the Level field . Note that the assigned values of Security Level are not necessarily ordered -- a higher value of LVL does not necessarily equate to increased security . The Security Level is set to one of the values in the tables below :
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 8-bit unused field reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Counter
description: Counter : The Counter field indicates the non-repeating 4-octet value used to construct the cryptographic mechanism that implements packet protection and allows for the provision of semantic security . See Section 10.9.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Identifier
description: Key Identifier : The Key Identifier field indicates which key was used to protect the packet . This field provides various levels of granularity of packet protection   including peer-to-peer keys   group keys   and signature keys . This field is represented as indicated by the Key Identifier Mode field and is formatted as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Key Source
description: Key Source : The Key Source field   when present   indicates the logical identifier of the originator of a group key . When present   this field is 8 bytes in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Index
description: Key Index : The Key Index field   when present   allows unique identification of different keys with the same originator . It is the responsibility of each key originator to make sure that actively used keys that it issues have distinct key indices and that all key indices have a value unequal to 0x00 . Value 0x00 is reserved for a preinstalled   shared key . When present this field is 1 byte in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 8-bit unused field reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 8-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: Grounded ( G ): The Grounded ' G ' flag indicates whether the DODAG advertised can satisfy the application-defined goal . If the flag is set   the DODAG is grounded . If the flag is cleared   the DODAG is floating .
:LABEL: field

name: MOP
description: Mode of Operation ( MOP ): The Mode of Operation ( MOP ) field identifies the mode of operation of the RPL Instance as administratively provisioned at and distributed by the DODAG root . All nodes who join the DODAG must be able to honor the MOP in order to fully participate as a router   or else they must only join as a leaf . MOP is encoded as in the figure below :
:LABEL: field

name: Prf
description: DODAGPreference ( Prf ): A 3-bit unsigned integer that defines how preferable the root of this DODAG is compared to other DODAG roots within the instance . DAGPreference ranges from 0x00 ( least preferred ) to 0x07 ( most preferred ). The default is 0 ( least preferred ). Section 8.2 describes how DAGPreference affects DIO processing .
:LABEL: field

name: Version Number
description: Version Number : 8-bit unsigned integer set by the DODAG root to the DODAGVersionNumber . Section 8.2 describes the rules for DODAGVersionNumbers and how they affect DIO processing .
:LABEL: field

name: Rank
description: Rank : 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the DODAG Rank of the node sending the DIO message . Section 8.2 describes how Rank is set and how it affects DIO processing .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field set by the DODAG root that indicates of which RPL Instance the DODAG is a part .
:LABEL: field

name: DTSN
description: Destination Advertisement Trigger Sequence Number ( DTSN ): 8-bit unsigned integer set by the node issuing the DIO message . The Destination Advertisement Trigger Sequence Number ( DTSN ) flag is used as part of the procedure to maintain Downward routes . The details of this process are described in Section 9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 8-bit unused field reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 8-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID : 128-bit IPv6 address set by a DODAG root that uniquely identifies a DODAG . The DODAGID MUST be a routable IPv6 address belonging to the DODAG root .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field indicating the topology instance associated with the DODAG   as learned from the DIO .
:LABEL: field

name: K
description: K : The ' K ' flag indicates that the recipient is expected to send a DAO-ACK back . ( See Section 9.3 .)
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : The ' D ' flag indicates that the DODAGID field is present . This flag MUST be set when a local RPLInstanceID is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The 6 bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 8-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: DAOSequence
description: DAOSequence : Incremented at each unique DAO message from a node and echoed in the DAO-ACK message .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID ( optional ): 128-bit unsigned integer set by a DODAG root that uniquely identifies a DODAG . This field is only present when the ' D ' flag is set . This field is typically only present when a local RPLInstanceID is in use   in order to identify the DODAGID that is associated with the RPLInstanceID . When a global RPLInstanceID is in use   this field need not be present .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field indicating the topology instance associated with the DODAG   as learned from the DIO .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : The ' D ' flag indicates that the DODAGID field is present . This would typically only be set when a local RPLInstanceID is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: DAOSequence : Incremented at each DAO message from a node   and echoed in the DAO-ACK by the recipient . The DAOSequence is used to correlate a DAO message and a DAO ACK message and is not to be confused with the Transit Information option Path Sequence that is associated to a given Target Down the DODAG .
:LABEL: field

name: DAOSequence
description: DAOSequence : Incremented at each DAO message from a node   and echoed in the DAO-ACK by the recipient . The DAOSequence is used to correlate a DAO message and a DAO ACK message and is not to be confused with the Transit Information option Path Sequence that is associated to a given Target Down the DODAG .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : Indicates the completion . Status 0 is defined as unqualified acceptance in this specification . The remaining status values are reserved as rejection codes . No rejection status codes are defined in this specification   although status codes SHOULD be allocated according to the following guidelines in future specifications :
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID ( optional ): 128-bit unsigned integer set by a DODAG root that uniquely identifies a DODAG . This field is only present when the ' D ' flag is set . Typically   this field is only present when a local RPLInstanceID is in use in order to identify the DODAGID that is associated with the RPLInstanceID . When a global RPLInstanceID is in use   this field need not be present .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field indicating the topology instance associated with the DODAG   as learned from the DIO .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : The ' R ' flag indicates whether the CC message is a response . A message with the ' R ' flag cleared is a request; a message with the ' R ' flag set is a response .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The 7 bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: CC Nonce
description: CC Nonce : 16-bit unsigned integer set by a CC request . The corresponding CC response includes the same CC nonce value as the request .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: Destination Counter : 32-bit unsigned integer value indicating the sender's estimate of the destination's current security counter value . If the sender does not have an estimate   it SHOULD set the Destination Counter field to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Counter
description: Destination Counter : 32-bit unsigned integer value indicating the sender's estimate of the destination's current security counter value . If the sender does not have an estimate   it SHOULD set the Destination Counter field to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type : 8-bit identifier of the type of option . The Option Type values are assigned by IANA ( see Section 20.4 .)
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : 8-bit unsigned integer   representing the length in octets of the option   not including the Option Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: Option Data : A variable length field that contains data specific to the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : For N octets of padding   where 2 <= N <= 7   the Option Length field contains the value N-2 . An Option Length of 0 indicates a total padding of 2 octets . An Option Length of 5 indicates a total padding of 7 octets   which is the maximum padding size allowed with the PadN option .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : For N octets of padding   where 2 <= N <= 7   the Option Length field contains the value N-2 . An Option Length of 0 indicates a total padding of 2 octets . An Option Length of 5 indicates a total padding of 7 octets   which is the maximum padding size allowed with the PadN option .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: Option Data : For N ( N > 1 ) octets of padding   the Option Data consists of N-2 zero-valued octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : The Option Length field contains the length in octets of the Metric Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : The Option Length field contains the length in octets of the Metric Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Metric Data
description: Metric Data : The order   content   and coding of the DAG Metric Container data is as specified in [ RFC6551 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : Variable   length of the option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields . Note that this length is expressed in units of single octets   unlike in IPv6 ND .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : Variable   length of the option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields . Note that this length is expressed in units of single octets   unlike in IPv6 ND .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . The number of leading bits in the prefix that are valid . The value ranges from 0 to 128 . The Prefix field has the number of bytes inferred from the Option Length field   that must be at least the Prefix Length . Note that in RPL   this means that the Prefix field may have lengths other than 0   8   or 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Prf
description: Prf : 2-bit signed integer . The Route Preference indicates whether to prefer the router associated with this prefix over others   when multiple identical prefixes ( for different routers ) have been received . If the Reserved ( 10 ) value is received   the RIO MUST be ignored . Per [ RFC4191 ]  the Reserved ( 10 ) value MUST NOT be sent . ([ RFC4191 ] restricts the Preference to just three values to reinforce that it is not a metric .)
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd : Two 3-bit unused fields . They MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Route Lifetime
description: Route Lifetime : 32-bit unsigned integer . The length of time in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent ) that the prefix is valid for route determination . A value of all one bits ( 0xFFFFFFFF ) represents infinity .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix : Variable-length field containing an IP address or a prefix of an IPv6 address . The Prefix Length field contains the number of valid leading bits in the prefix . The bits in the prefix after the prefix length ( if any ) are reserved and MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver . Note that in RPL   this field may have lengths other than 0   8   or 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type : 0x04
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Flags : The 4-bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The 4-bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: Authentication Enabled ( A ): 1-bit flag describing the security mode of the network . The bit describes whether a node must authenticate with a key authority before joining the network as a router . If the DIO is not a secure DIO   the ' A ' bit MUST be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: PCS
description: Path Control Size ( PCS ): 3-bit unsigned integer used to configure the number of bits that may be allocated to the Path Control field ( see Section 9.9 ). Note that when PCS is consulted to determine the width of the Path Control field   a value of 1 is added   i.e .  a PCS value of 0 results in 1 active bit in the Path Control field . The default value of PCS is DEFAULT_PATH_CONTROL_SIZE .
:LABEL: field

name: MaxRankIncrease
description: MaxRankIncrease : 16-bit unsigned integer used to configure DAGMaxRankIncrease   the allowable increase in Rank in support of local repair . If DAGMaxRankIncrease is 0   then this mechanism is disabled .
:LABEL: field

name: MinHopRankIncrease
description: MinHopRankIncrease : 16-bit unsigned integer used to configure MinHopRankIncrease as described in Section 3.5.1 . The default value of MinHopRankInc is DEFAULT_MIN_HOP_RANK_INCREASE .
:LABEL: field

name: OCP
description: Objective Code Point ( OCP ): 16-bit unsigned integer . The OCP field identifies the OF and is managed by the IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 7-bit unused field . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime Unit
description: Lifetime Unit : 16-bit unsigned integer . Provides the unit in seconds that is used to express route lifetimes in RPL . For very stable networks   it can be hours to days .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : Variable   length of the option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : Variable   length of the option in octets excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 8-bit unused field reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of valid leading bits in the IPv6 Prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : Variable   depending on whether or not the DODAG Parent Address subfield is present .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : Variable   depending on whether or not the DODAG Parent Address subfield is present .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: External ( E ): 1-bit flag . The ' E ' flag is set to indicate that the parent router redistributes external targets into the RPL network . An external Target is a Target that has been learned through an alternate protocol . The external targets are listed in the Target options that immediately precede the Transit Information option . An external Target is not expected to support RPL messages and options .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The 7 bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Control
description: Path Control : 8-bit bit field . The Path Control field limits the number of DAO parents to which a DAO message advertising connectivity to a specific destination may be sent   as well as providing some indication of relative preference . The limit provides some bound on overall DAO message fan-out in the LLN . The assignment and ordering of the bits in the Path Control also serves to communicate preference . Not all of these bits may be enabled as according to the PCS in the DODAG Configuration . The Path Control field is divided into four subfields that contain two bits each : PC1   PC2   PC3   and PC4   as illustrated in Figure 27 . The subfields are ordered by preference   with PC1 being the most preferred and PC4 being the least preferred . Within a subfield   there is no order of preference . By grouping the parents ( as in ECMP ) and ordering them   the parents may be associated with specific bits in the Path Control field in a way that communicates preference .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Sequence
description: Path Sequence : 8-bit unsigned integer . When a RPL Target option is issued by the node that owns the Target prefix ( i.e .  in a DAO message )  that node sets the Path Sequence and increments the Path Sequence each time it issues a RPL Target option with updated information .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Lifetime
description: Path Lifetime : 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of time in Lifetime Units ( obtained from the Configuration option ) that the prefix is valid for route determination . The period starts when a new Path Sequence is seen . A value of all one bits ( 0xFF ) represents infinity . A value of all zero bits ( 0x00 ) indicates a loss of reachability . A DAO message that contains a Transit Information option with a Path Lifetime of 0x00 for a Target is referred as a No-Path ( for that Target ) in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type : 0x07
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: V : The ' V ' flag is the Version predicate . The Version predicate is true if the receiver's DODAGVersionNumber matches the requested Version Number . If the ' V ' flag is cleared   then the Version field is not valid and the Version field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : The ' V ' flag is the Version predicate . The Version predicate is true if the receiver's DODAGVersionNumber matches the requested Version Number . If the ' V ' flag is cleared   then the Version field is not valid and the Version field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : The ' I ' flag is the InstanceID predicate . The InstanceID predicate is true when the RPL node's current RPLInstanceID matches the requested RPLInstanceID . If the ' I ' flag is cleared   then the RPLInstanceID field is not valid and the RPLInstanceID field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : The ' D ' flag is the DODAGID predicate . The DODAGID predicate is true if the RPL node's parent set has the same DODAGID as the DODAGID field . If the ' D ' flag is cleared   then the DODAGID field is not valid and the DODAGID field MUST be set to zero on transmission and ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : The 5 bits remaining unused in the Flags field are reserved for flags . The field MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Version Number
description: Version Number : 8-bit unsigned integer containing the value of DODAGVersionNumber that is being solicited when valid .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit unsigned integer containing the RPLInstanceID that is being solicited when valid .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID : 128-bit unsigned integer containing the DODAGID that is being solicited when valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Length : 30 . Note that this length is expressed in units of single octets   unlike in IPv6 ND .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : 30 . Note that this length is expressed in units of single octets   unlike in IPv6 ND .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . The number of leading bits in the Prefix field that are valid . The value ranges from 0 to 128 . The Prefix Length field provides necessary information for on-link determination ( when combined with the ' L ' flag in the PIO ). It also assists with address autoconfiguration as specified in [ RFC4862 ]  for which there may be more restrictions on the prefix length .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : 1-bit on-link flag . When set   it indicates that this prefix can be used for on-link determination . When not set   the advertisement makes no statement about on-link or off-link properties of the prefix . In other words   if the ' L ' flag is not set   a RPL node MUST NOT conclude that an address derived from the prefix is off-link . That is   it MUST NOT update a previous indication that the address is on-link . A RPL node acting as a router MUST NOT propagate a PIO with the ' L ' flag set . A RPL node acting as a router MAY propagate a PIO with the ' L ' flag not set .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : 1-bit autonomous address-configuration flag . When set   it indicates that this prefix can be used for stateless address configuration as specified in [ RFC4862 ]. When both protocols ( ND RAs and RPL DIOs ) are used to carry PIOs on the same link   it is possible to use either one for SLAAC by a RPL node . It is also possible to make either protocol ineligible for SLAAC operation by forcing the ' A ' flag to 0 for PIOs carried in that protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : 1-bit router address flag . When set   it indicates that the Prefix field contains a complete IPv6 address assigned to the sending router that can be used as parent in a target option . The indicated prefix is the first prefix length bits of the Prefix field . The router IPv6 address has the same scope and conforms to the same lifetime values as the advertised prefix . This use of the Prefix field is compatible with its use in advertising the prefix itself   since Prefix Advertisement uses only the leading bits . Interpretation of this flag bit is thus independent of the processing required for the on-link ( L ) and autonomous address-configuration ( A ) flag bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved1 : 5-bit unused field . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Valid Lifetime
description: Valid Lifetime : 32-bit unsigned integer . The length of time in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent ) that the prefix is valid for the purpose of on-link determination . A value of all one bits ( 0xFFFFFFFF ) represents infinity . The Valid Lifetime is also used by [ RFC4862 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Preferred Lifetime
description: Preferred Lifetime : 32-bit unsigned integer . The length of time in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is sent ) that addresses generated from the prefix via stateless address autoconfiguration remain preferred [ RFC4862 ]. A value of all one bits ( 0xFFFFFFFF ) represents infinity . See [ RFC4862 ]. Note that the value of this field MUST NOT exceed the Valid Lifetime field to avoid preferring addresses that are no longer valid .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved2 : This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix : An IPv6 address or a prefix of an IPv6 address . The Prefix Length field contains the number of valid leading bits in the prefix . The bits in the prefix after the prefix length are reserved and MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and ignored by the receiver . A router SHOULD NOT send a prefix option for the link-local prefix   and a host SHOULD ignore such a prefix option . A non-storing node SHOULD refrain from advertising a prefix till it owns an address of that prefix   and then it SHOULD advertise its full address in this field   with the ' R ' flag set . The children of a node that so advertises a full address with the ' R ' flag set may then use that address to determine the content of the DODAG Parent Address subfield of the Transit Information option .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type : 0x09
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: Option Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Descriptor
description: Descriptor : 32-bit unsigned integer . Opaque .
:LABEL: field

name: DAOSequence
description: DAOSequence : This sequence counter is present in the DAO Base to correlate a DAO message and a DAO ACK message . The DAOSequence number is locally significant to the node that issues a DAO message for its own consumption to detect the loss of a DAO message and enable retries .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Sequence
description: Path Sequence : This sequence counter is present in the Transit Information option in a DAO message . The purpose of this counter is to differentiate a movement where a newer route supersedes a stale one from a route redundancy scenario where multiple routes exist in parallel for the same target . The Path Sequence is globally significant in a DODAG and indicates the freshness of the route to the associated target . An older ( lesser ) value received from an originating router indicates that the originating router holds stale routing states and the originating router should not be considered anymore as a potential next hop for the target . The Path Sequence is computed by the node that advertises the target   that is the Target itself or a router that advertises a Target on behalf of a host   and is unchanged as the DAO content is propagated towards the root by parent routers . If a host does not pass a counter to its router   then the router is in charge of computing the Path Sequence on behalf of the host and the host can only register to one router for that purpose . If a DAO message containing the same Target is issued to multiple parents at a given point in time for the purpose of route redundancy   then the Path Sequence is the same in all the DAO messages for that same target .
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: DODAGID : The DODAGID is a Global or Unique Local IPv6 address of the root . A node that joins a DODAG SHOULD provision a host route via a DODAG parent to the address used by the root as the DODAGID .
:LABEL: field

name: Rank
description: 1 . A node MUST NOT advertise a Rank less than or equal to any member of its parent set within the DODAG Version .
:LABEL: field

name: Path Control
description: A DAO message from a node contains one or more Target options . Each Target option specifies either a prefix advertised by the node   a prefix of addresses reachable outside the LLN   the address of a destination in the node's sub-DODAG   or a multicast group to which a node in the sub-DODAG is listening . The Path Control field of the Transit Information option allows nodes to request or allow for multiple Downward routes . A node constructs the Path Control field of a Transit Information option as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Source Identifier
