description: Source Identifier : 8 bytes . Source Identifier is set to the logical identifier of the originator of the protected packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Counter
description: Counter : 4 bytes . Counter is set to the ( uncompressed ) value of the corresponding field in the Security option of the RPL control message .
:LABEL: field

name: KIM
description: Key Identifier Mode ( KIM ): 2 bits . KIM is set to the value of the corresponding field in the Security option of the RPL control message .
:LABEL: field

name: LVL
description: Security Level ( LVL ): 3 bits . Security Level is set to the value of the corresponding field in the Security option of the RPL control message .
:LABEL: field

name: Rank
description: Rank-Error ' R ': 1-bit flag indicating whether a Rank error was detected . A Rank error is detected when there is a mismatch in the relative Ranks and the direction as indicated in the ' O ' bit . A host or RPL leaf node MUST set the ' R ' bit to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field indicating the DODAG instance along which the packet is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: o RPLInstanceID [ DIO message   in DIO Base message ]. Although the RPLInstanceID must be configured on the DODAG root   it must also be configured as a policy on every node in order to determine whether or not the node should join a particular DODAG . Note that a second RPLInstanceID can be configured on the node   should it become root of a floating DODAG .
:LABEL: field

name: MOP
description: o Route Information ( and preference ) [ DIO message   in Route Information option ]
:LABEL: field

name: MinHopRankIncrease
description: o MinHopRankIncrease [ DIO message   in DODAG Configuration option ]
:LABEL: field

name: DAOSequence
description: o DAOSequence : Incremented at each unique DAO message   echoed in the DAO-ACK message [ DAO and DAO-ACK messages ]
:LABEL: field

name: MinHopRankIncrease
description: o MinHopRankIncrease [ DIO message   in DODAG Configuration option ]
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: o RPLInstanceID
:LABEL: field

name: DODAGID
description: o DODAGID
:LABEL: field

name: Rank
description: o Rank
:LABEL: field

name: DTSN
description: o DTSN
:LABEL: field

name: Path Sequence
description: * Path Sequence
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: o RPLInstanceID
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Description
:LABEL: field

name: MOP
description: IANA has created a registry for the 3-bit Mode of Operation ( MOP )  which is contained in the DIO Base .
:LABEL: field

name: OCP
description: IANA has created a registry to manage the codespace of the Objective Code Point ( OCP ) field .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Code
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: IANA has created a registry for the DIS ( DODAG Informational Solicitation ) Flags field .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: IANA has created a registry for the 8-bit DODAG Information Object ( DIO ) Flags field .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: IANA has created a registry for the 8-bit Consistency Check ( CC ) Flags field .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: o I ( Included ): the ' I ' bit is only relevant when the node type is used as a constraint . For example   the path must only traverse mains-powered nodes . Conversely   battery-operated nodes must be excluded . The ' I ' bit is used to stipulate inclusion versus exclusion . When set   this indicates that nodes of the type specified in the node type field MUST be included . Conversely   when cleared   this indicates that nodes of type specified in the node type field MUST be excluded .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: o T ( node Type ): 2-bit field indicating the node type . T=0 designates a mains-powered node   T=1 a battery-powered node   and T=2 a node powered by an energy scavenger .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: o E ( Estimation ): when the ' E ' bit is set for a metric   the estimated percentage of remaining energy on the node is indicated in the E_E 8-bit field . When cleared   the estimated percentage of remaining energy is not provided . When the ' E ' bit is set for a constraint   the E_E field defines a threshold for the inclusion/ exclusion : if an inclusion   nodes with values higher than the threshold are to be included; if an exclusion   nodes with values lower than the threshold are to be excluded .
:LABEL: field

name: E_E
description: E_E ( Estimated-Energy ): 8-bit unsigned integer field indicating an estimated percentage of remaining energy . The E_E field is only relevant when the ' E ' flag is set   and it MUST be set to 0 when the ' E ' flag is cleared .
:LABEL: field

name: Throughput
description: Many LLNs support a wide range of throughputs . For some links   this may be due to variable coding . For the deeply duty-cycled links found in many LLNs   the variability comes as a result of trading power consumption for bit rate . There are several MAC layer protocols that allow for the effective bit rate of a link to vary over more than three orders of magnitude with a corresponding change in power consumption . For efficient operation   it may be desirable for nodes to report the range of throughput that their links can handle in addition to the currently available throughput .
:LABEL: field

name: Throughput
description: Throughput : 32 bits . The Throughput is encoded in 32 bits in unsigned integer format   expressed in bytes per second .
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: Similar to throughput   the latency of many LLN MAC sub-layers can vary over many orders of magnitude   again with a corresponding change in power consumption . Some LLN MAC link layers will allow the latency to be adjusted globally on the subnet   on a link-by-link basis   or not at all . Some will insist that it be fixed for a given link   but allow it to be variable from link to link .
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: Latency : 32 bits . The Latency is encoded in 32 bits in unsigned integer format   expressed in microseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Val
description: Val : LQL value from 0 to 7 where 0 means undetermined and 1 indicates the highest link quality .
:LABEL: field

name: Counter
description: Counter : number of links with that value .
:LABEL: field

name: ETX
description: ETX : 16 bits . The ETX * 128 is encoded using 16 bits in unsigned integer format   rounded off to the nearest whole number . For example   if ETX = 3.569   the object value will be 457 . If ETX > 511.9921875   the object value will be the maximum   which is 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 5 bits ): Reserved field . This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Opt Data Len : 8-bit field indicating the length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: Opt Data Len : 8-bit field indicating the length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Opt Data Len fields .
:LABEL: field

name: RPLInstanceID
description: RPLInstanceID : 8-bit field as defined in Section 11.2 of [ RFC6550 ]. The processing SHALL follow the rules described in Section 11.2 of [ RFC6550 ].
:LABEL: field

name: SenderRank
description: SenderRank : 16-bit field as defined in Section 11.2 of [ RFC6550 ]. The processing SHALL follow the rules described in Section 11.2 of [ RFC6550 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Routing header . Uses the same values as the IPv6 Next Header field [ RFC2460 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Routing header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets . Note that when Addresses[1..n ] are compressed ( i.e .  value of CmprI or CmprE is not 0 )  Hdr Ext Len does not equal twice the number of Addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Type
description: Routing Type 8-bit selector . Identifies the particular Routing header variant . An SRH should set the Routing Type to 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Segments Left
description: Segments Left 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination . The originator of an SRH sets this field to n   the number of addresses contained in Addresses[1..n ].
:LABEL: field

name: CmprI
description: CmprI 4-bit unsigned integer . Number of prefix octets from each segment   except than the last segment   ( i.e .  segments 1 through n-1 ) that are elided . For example   an SRH carrying full IPv6 addresses in Addresses[1..n-1 ] sets CmprI to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: CmprE
description: CmprE 4-bit unsigned integer . Number of prefix octets from the last segment ( i.e .  segment n ) that are elided . For example   an SRH carrying a full IPv6 address in Addresses[n ] sets CmprE to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Pad
description: Pad 4-bit unsigned integer . Number of octets that are used for padding after Address[n ] at the end of the SRH .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: TCP Connection ID AFI
description: TCP Connection ID AFI : The AFI value to describe the address family of the address of the TCP Connection ID field . Note that this value does not need to match the address family of the PIM Hello message that carries it . When this field is 0   a mechanism outside the scope of this document is used to obtain the addresses used to establish the TCP connection .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Exp
description: Exp : For experimental use [ RFC3692 ]. One expected use of these bits would be to signal experimental capabilities . For example   if a router supports an experimental feature   it may set a bit to indicate this . The default behavior   unless a router supports a particular experiment   is to ignore the bits on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: TCP Connection ID
description: TCP Connection ID : An IPv4 or IPv6 address used to establish the TCP connection . This field is omitted ( length 0 ) for the Connection ID AFI 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: SCTP Connection ID AFI
description: SCTP Connection ID AFI : The AFI value to describe the address family of the address of the SCTP Connection ID field . Note that this value does not need to match the address family of the PIM Hello message that carries it . When this field is 0   a mechanism outside the scope of this document is used to obtain the addresses used to establish the SCTP connection .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Exp
description: Exp : For experimental use [ RFC3692 ]. One expected use of these bits would be to signal experimental capabilities . For example   if a router supports an experimental feature   it may set a bit to indicate this . The default behavior   unless a router supports a particular experiment   is to ignore the bits on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SCTP Connection ID
description: SCTP Connection ID : An IPv4 or IPv6 address used to establish the SCTP connection . This field is omitted ( length 0 ) for the Connection ID AFI 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface ID
description: All Hello messages containing PIM-over-TCP-Capable or PIM-over-SCTP - Capable Hello Options MUST also contain the Interface ID Hello Option [ RFC6395 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length : Length in bytes for the value part of the Type/ Length/Value encoding . If no PORT Options are included   the length is 12 . If n PORT Options with Option Value lengths L1   L2   ...  Ln are included   the message length is 12 + 4*n + L1 + L2 + ... + Ln .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface ID
description: Interface ID : This MUST be the Interface ID of the Interface ID Hello Option contained in the PIM Hello messages that the PIM router is sending to the PIM neighbor . It indicates to the PIM neighbor what interface to associate the Join/Prune with . The Interface ID allows us to do connection sharing .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length : Length in bytes for the value part of the Type/ Length/Value encoding . If no PORT Options are included   the length is 6 . If n PORT Options with Option Value lengths L1   L2   ...  Ln are included   the message length is 6 + 4*n + L1 + L2 + ... + Ln .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Holdtime : This specifies a Holdtime in seconds for the connection . A non-zero value means that the connection SHOULD be gracefully shut down if no further PORT messages are received within the specified time . This is measured on the receiving side by measuring the time from when one PORT message has been processed until the next has been processed . Note that this MUST be done for any PORT message   not just keep-alive messages . A Holdtime of 0 disables the keep-alive mechanism .
:LABEL: field

name: Holdtime
description: Holdtime : This specifies a Holdtime in seconds for the connection . A non-zero value means that the connection SHOULD be gracefully shut down if no further PORT messages are received within the specified time . This is measured on the receiving side by measuring the time from when one PORT message has been processed until the next has been processed . Note that this MUST be done for any PORT message   not just keep-alive messages . A Holdtime of 0 disables the keep-alive mechanism .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Value Length
description: Option Value Length : The number of bytes that make up the PIMv2 Join/Prune message .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Value Length
description: Option Value Length : The number of bytes that make up the PIMv2 Join/Prune message .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the extension header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA_IP_PARAM ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the extension header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Area Number
description: The area number indicates the 32-bit Area ID to which the route belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: The Options field indicates the options that are associated with the OSPFv3 route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Mobile-Node-Identifier 145 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : In octets   including Type and Length fields (>= 3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Service-Selection 146 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : In octets   including Type and Length fields (>= 3 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-LMA-IPv6-Address 147 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 18 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Home LMA IPv6 address
description: Home LMA IPv6 address : 128-bit IPv6 address of the assigned home LMA IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-LMA-IPv6-Address 148 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 18 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Visited LMA IPv6 address
description: Visited LMA IPv6 address : 128-bit IPv6 address of the assigned visited LMA IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-LMA-IPv4-Address 149 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Home LMA IPv4 address
description: Home LMA IPv4 address : 32-bit IPv4 address of the assigned LMA .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-LMA-IPv4-Address 150 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-HN-Prefix 151 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = at least 4 and no larger than 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Reserved for future use . The bits MUST be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-HN-Prefix 152 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = at least 4 and no larger than 20 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Reserved for future use . The bits MUST be set to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-Interface-ID 153 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 10 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Interface Identifier
description: Home Interface Identifier : The 64-bit long interface identifier ( 8 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-Interface-ID 154 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 10 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Visited Interface Identifier
description: Visited Interface Identifier : The 64-bit long interface identifier ( 8 octets ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-IPv4-HoA 155 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 8 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Home IPv4 HoA
description: Home IPv4 HoA : This field is of type Address and contains the IPv4 home address of the MN in the home network .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-IPv4-HoA 156 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 8 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The 10-bit field reserved for future use . The value MUST be initialized to zero by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Visited IPv4 HoA
description: Visited IPv4 HoA : This field is of type Address and contains the IPv4 home address of the MN in the visited network .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-DHCP4-Server-Address 157 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Home DHCPv4 server address
description: Home DHCPv4 server address : This field is of type Address and contains a 4-octet IPv4 address of the DHCP server .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-DHCP4-Server-Address 158 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Visited DHCPv4 server address
description: Visited DHCPv4 server address : This field is of type Address and contains a 4-octet IPv4 address of the DHCPv4 server .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-DHCP6-Server-Address 159 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 18 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Home DHCPv6 server address
description: Home DHCPv6 server address : This field is of type Address and contains 16-octet IPv6 address of the DHCPv6 server .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-DHCP6-Server-Address 160 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 18 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Visited DHCPv6 server address
description: Visited DHCPv6 server address : This field is of type Address and contains the 16-octet IPv6 address of the DHCPv6 server .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Home-IPv4-Gateway 161 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : PMIP6-Visited-IPv4-Gateway 162 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : = 6 octets
:LABEL: field

name: IRD
description: Inbound RDMA Read Queue Depth ( IRD ): The maximum number of incoming simultaneous RDMA Read Request Messages an RDMA connection can handle . See [ RDMAC ].
:LABEL: field

name: IRD
description: MPA Fencing : MPA responder connection establishment logic that ensures that no ULP messages will be transferred until the initiator's first message has been received .
:LABEL: field

name: ORD
description: Outbound RDMA Read Queue Depth ( ORD ): The maximum number of simultaneous RDMA Read Requests that can be issued for the RDMA connection . This should be less than or equal to the peer's IRD . See [ RDMAC ].
:LABEL: field

name: ORD
description: Outbound RDMA Read Queue Depth ( ORD ): The maximum number of simultaneous RDMA Read Requests that can be issued for the RDMA connection . This should be less than or equal to the peer's IRD . See [ RDMAC ].
:LABEL: field

name: Private Data
description: Private Data : A block of data exchanged between MPA endpoints during initial connection setup . See [ RFC5044 ].
:LABEL: field

name: ORD
description: Outbound RDMA Read Queue Depth ( ORD ). ORD is used to limit the number of simultaneous RDMA Read Requests such that the local endpoint does not overrun the remote endpoint's IRRQ depth or IRD . Note that outbound RDMA Reads are submitted to a QP's Send Queue at the local peer   not to a separate outbound RDMA Read Request queue on the local peer . The local endpoint uses ORD to strictly limit simultaneous Read Requests so that IRRQ overruns do not occur at the remote endpoint .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : Unchanged from [ RFC5044 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Unchanged from [ RFC5044 ].
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: S : One   if the Private Data begins with the enhanced RDMA connection establishment data; 0 otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : One   if the Private Data begins with the enhanced RDMA connection establishment data; 0 otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res : One bit smaller than in [ RFC5044 ]; otherwise unchanged . In [ RFC5044 ]  the ' Res ' field   in which the newly defined ' S ' bit resides   is reserved for future use . [ RFC5044 ] specifies that ' Res ' MUST be set to zero when sending and MUST NOT be checked on reception   making use of ' S ' bit backwards compatibility with the original MPA Frame format . When the ' S ' bit is set to zero   no additional Private Data is used for enhanced RDMA connection establishment; therefore   the resulting MPA Request and Reply Frames are identical to the unenhanced protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Rev
description: Rev : This field contains the revision of MPA . To use any enhanced connection establishment feature   this MUST be set to two or higher . If no enhanced connection establishment features are desired   it MAY be set to one . A host accepting MPA connections MUST continue to accept MPA Requests with version one   even if it supports version two .
:LABEL: field

name: PD_Length
description: PD_Length : Unchanged from [ RFC5044 ]. This is the total length of the Private Data field   including the enhanced RDMA connection establishment data   if present .
:LABEL: field

name: Private Data
description: Private Data : Unchanged from [ RFC5044 ]. However   if the ' S ' flag is set   Private Data MUST begin with enhanced RDMA connection establishment data ( see Section 9 ).
:LABEL: field

name: IRD
description: IRD : Inbound RDMA Read Queue Depth .
:LABEL: field

name: ORD
description: ORD : Outbound RDMA Read Queue Depth .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Control Flag for connection model .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : Control Flag for use of a zero-length FULPDU ( Send ) RTR indication .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Control Flag for use of a zero-length RDMA Write RTR indication .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : Control Flag for use of a zero-length RDMA Read RTR indication .
:LABEL: field

name: IRD
description: The IRD and ORD are used for negotiation of Inbound RDMA Read Request Queue depths for both endpoints of the RDMA connection . The IRD is used to configure the depth of the Inbound RDMA Read Request Queue ( IRRQ ) on each endpoint . ORD is used to limit the number of simultaneous outbound RDMA Read Requests allowed at any given point in time in order to avoid IRRQ overruns at the remote endpoint . In order to describe the negotiation of both local endpoint and remote endpoint ORD and IRD values   four terms are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: ASID
description: The ASID identifies the source authentication scheme or protocol in use . The association between the ASID value and the actual authentication scheme is defined out-of-band   at session startup .
:LABEL: field

name: rsvd
description: This is a reserved field that MUST be set to zero and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature
description: The Signature field contains a Digital Signature of the message . If need be   this field is padded ( with 0 ) up to a multiple of 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: ASID
description: The ASID identifies the source authentication scheme or protocol in use . The association between the ASID value and the actual authentication scheme is defined out-of-band   at session startup .
:LABEL: field

name: rsvd
description: This is a reserved field that MUST be set to zero and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature
description: The Signature field contains a Digital Signature of the message . If need be   this field is padded ( with 0 ) up to a multiple of 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: ASID
description: The ASID identifies the source authentication scheme or protocol in use . The association between the ASID value and the actual authentication scheme is defined out-of-band   at session startup .
:LABEL: field

name: rsvd
description: This is a reserved field that MUST be set to zero and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Group-keyed MAC
description: The Group-keyed MAC field contains a truncated Group-keyed MAC of the message . If need be   this field is padded ( with 0 ) up to a multiple of 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: ASID
description: The ASID identifies the source authentication scheme or protocol in use . The association between the ASID value and the actual authentication scheme is defined out-of-band   at session startup .
:LABEL: field

name: rsvd
description: This is a reserved field that MUST be set to zero and ignored by receivers .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature
description: The Signature field contains a Digital Signature of the message . If need be   this field is padded ( with 0 ) up to a multiple of 32 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code The option code ( 221 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The option length   minimum 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type and VSS Information -- see Section 3.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code The sub-option code ( 151 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The sub-option length   minimum 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type and VSS Information -- see Section 3.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code The sub-option code ( 152 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The sub-option length   0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type and VSS Information -- see Section 3.5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Network Identifier FQDN
description: Home Network Identifier FQDN : A Fully Qualified Domain Name ( FQDN ) that identifies a mobile IP home network for which the client is seeking configuration information . This is encoded in accordance with RFC 3315   Section 8   " Representation and Use of Domain Names ".
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options : One or more options   specifying information about the local ASP ( visited domain ).
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options : One or more options   specifying information about the home network identified by a Home Network Identifier FQDN option sent by a mobile node .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options : One or more options   specifying information about some home network as specified by the DHCP server administrator .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix-len : Length of prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Prefix : Home Network Prefix
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: Address : IP Address of home agent
:LABEL: field

name: Address
description: Address : FQDN resolving to one or more IPv4 and/or IPv6 addresses for the home agent . This is encoded in accordance with RFC 3315   Section 8   " Representation and Use of Domain Names ".
:LABEL: field

name: TidTy
description: A portion of the option data content in the SMF_DPD is the Tagger Identifier Type ( TidTy )  which provides a context for the optionally included TaggerId .
:LABEL: field

name: SMF_TYPE
description: This document defines one Message TLV Type   " SMF_TYPE "  which has been allocated from the " HELLO Message-Type-specific Message TLV Types " registry   defined in [ RFC6130 ].
:LABEL: field

name: SMF_NBR_TYPE
description: This document defines one Address Block TLV Type   " SMF_NBR_TYPE "  which has been allocated from the " HELLO Message-Type-specific Address Block TLV Types " registry   defined in [ RFC6130 ].
:LABEL: field

name: ICV
description: The basic ICV   represented by way of an ICV TLV with type extension = 0   is a simple bit-field containing the cryptographic ICV . This assumes that the mechanism stipulating how ICVs are calculated and verified is established outside of this specification   e.g .  by way of administrative configuration or external out-of-band signaling . Thus   the < ICV-value >  when using type extension = 0   is
:LABEL: field

name: ICV
description: One common way of calculating an ICV is applying a cryptographic function over a hash value of the content . This decomposition is specified in this section   using a type extension = 1 in the ICV TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: As defined in Section 5.3.2 of [ RFC5296 ]  this field is 16-bit sequence number and used for replay protection .
:LABEL: field

name: Cryptosuite
description: This field indicates the integrity algorithm used for ERP/AAK . Key lengths and output lengths are either indicated or obvious from the cryptosuite name   e.g .  HMAC-SHA256-128 denotes Hashed Message Authentication Code ( HMAC ) computed using the SHA-256 function [ RFC4868 ] with 256-bit key length and the output truncated to 128 bits [ RFC2104 ]. We specify some cryptosuites below :
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Tag
description: This field contains an integrity checksum over the ERP/AAK packet from the first bit of the Code field to the last bit of the Cryptosuite field   excluding the Authentication Tag field itself . The value field is calculated using the integrity algorithm indicated in the Cryptosuite field and rIK specified in [ RFC5296 ] as the secret key . The length of the field is indicated by the Cryptosuite .
:LABEL: field

name: Resved
description: SEQ
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: As defined in Section 5.3.3 of [ RFC5296 ]  this field is a 16-bit sequence number and is used for replay protection .
:LABEL: field

name: Cryptosuite
description: This field indicates the integrity algorithm and PRF used for ERP/ AAK . HMAC-SHA256-128 is REQUIRED to implement   and it SHOULD be enabled in the default configuration . Key lengths and output lengths are either indicated or obvious from the cryptosuite name .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Tag
description: This field contains the integrity checksum over the ERP/AAK packet from the first bit of the Code field to the last bit of the Cryptosuite field   excluding the Authentication Tag field itself . The value field is calculated using the integrity algorithm indicated in the Cryptosuite field and the rIK [ RFC5296 ] as the integrity key . The length of the field is indicated by the corresponding Cryptosuite .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The rest of the values in the 8-bit field are reserved . New values can be assigned by Standards Action or IESG Approval [ RFC5226 ].
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The rest of the values in the 8-bit field are reserved . New values can be assigned by Standards Action or IESG Approval .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The rest of the values in the 8-bit field are reserved . New values can be assigned by Standards Action or IESG approval .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: SSRC - Synchronization Source
:LABEL: field

name: PID
description: The PID field is used to specify a lost packet . The PID field refers to the RTP sequence number of the lost packet .
:LABEL: field

name: BLP
description: The BLP allows for reporting losses of any of the 16 RTP packets immediately following the RTP packet indicated by the PID . The BLP's definition is identical to that given in Section 6.2.1 of [ RFC4585 ].
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC
description: The SSRC value of the media source that is already aware   or in the process of being made aware   that some receiver lost synchronization with the media stream and for which the PSLEI receiver's own response to any such error is suppressed .
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len = Length of the suboption ( always 2 for this suboption ) ( 1 octet ) Flags = Flags field . ( all unused bits must be zero )
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len = Length of the suboption ( min . length of 8 ) ( 1 octet ) Flags = Various flags that apply to ALL Subnet Prefix Information fields specified in this suboption . Unused flags must be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix
description: Network = IPv4 network number ( 4 octets ) Prefix = Prefix length ( 1 octet ) Flags = Flags field ( Undefined bits must be zero ) ( 1 octet )
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: The Subnet-Name suboption may be used in order to pass a subnet name to the Server for use during allocation . This name may be used for any purpose but is intended to tell the Server something extra about the needed subnet; for example   " sales department "  " customer 1002 "  " address pool FOO "  or some such . The " name " should NOT be NULL terminated since the " len " field already specifies the length of the name . The " Name " in this suboption MUST be given using UTF-8 [ RFC3629 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len = length of the suboption ( always 4 for this suboption ) ( 1 octet )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Two octets of length in network byte order   indicating the length of the NS-Specific data . The NSID and length octets are not included .
:LABEL: field

name: NSID
description: NSID : Namespace identifier . One octet describing the namespace from which the attributes are drawn . See Section 5.3.3 for a description of how to encode RADIUS attributes in channel-binding data and responses . RADIUS uses a namespace identifier of 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Highest Sequence Number
description: Extended Highest Sequence Number : The 32-bit extended highest sequence number received   as defined by [ RFC3550 ]. Indicates the highest RTP sequence number to which this report relates .
:LABEL: field

name: Lost Packets Counter
description: Lost Packets Counter : The cumulative number of RTP packets that the receiver expected to receive minus the number of packets it actually received that are not a duplicate of an already received packet   from this SSRC since the receiver joined the RTP session . Note that packets that arrive late are not counted as lost . The receiver should keep track of this value using a local representation that is at least 32 bits and only include the 16 bits with least significance . In other words   the field will wrap if more than 65535 packets are lost .
:LABEL: field

name: Duplication Counter
description: Duplication Counter : The cumulative number of RTP packets received that are a duplicate of an already received packet from this SSRC since the receiver joined the RTP session . The receiver should keep track of this value using a local representation that is at least 32 bits and only include the 16 bits with least significance . In other words   the field will wrap if more than 65535 duplicate packets have been received .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: BT : Block Type identifying the ECN Summary Report block . Value is 13 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : All bits SHALL be set to 0 on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Block Length
description: Block Length : The length of this XR report block   including the header   in 32-bit words minus one . Used to indicate the number of ECN Summary Report data blocks present in the ECN Summary Report . This length will be 5*n   where n is the number of ECN Summary Report blocks   since blocks are a fixed size . The block length MAY be zero if there is nothing to report . Receivers MUST discard reports where the block length is not a multiple of five   since these cannot be valid .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Media Sender
description: SSRC of Media Sender : The SSRC identifying the media sender this report is for .
:LABEL: field

name: Lost Packets Counter
description: Lost Packets Counter : as in Section 5.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Duplication Counter
description: The extended highest sequence number counter for each SSRC is not present in an RTCP XR report   in contrast to the feedback version . The reason is that this summary report will rely on the information sent in the Sender Report ( SR ) or Receiver Report ( RR ) blocks part of the same RTCP compound packet . The extended highest sequence number is available from the SR or RR .
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : Valid ( 1 bit ) ECN Echo value field is valid when set to 1 and invalid when set 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: ECF
description: ECF : ECN Echo value field ( 2 bits ) contains the ECN field value of the STUN packet it echoes back when the field is valid . If invalid   the content is arbitrary .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Reserved bits ( 29 bits ) SHALL be set to 0 on transmission and SHALL be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Lost Packets Counter
description: Lost Packets Counter : The number of RTP packets that where expected based on sequence numbers but never received .
:LABEL: field

name: Duplication Counter
description: Duplication Counter : The number of received RTP packets that are duplicates of already received ones .
:LABEL: field

name: MSBL
description: MSBL : Maximum Source Block Length
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: o P[i ] denote s[i]*T-(l[i]+3 ) zero octets . Note : P[i ] are padding octets to align the start of each UDP packet with the start of a symbol .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Then   a source data block is constructed by concatenating ADUI[i ] for i = 0   1   2   ... n-1 . The source data block size   S   is then given by sum { s[i]*T   i=0   ...  n-1 }. Symbols are allocated integer encoding symbol IDs ( ESI ) consecutively starting from zero within the source block . Each ADU is associated with the ESI of the first symbol containing SPI for that packet . Thus   the encoding symbol ID value associated with the j-th source packet   ESI[j ]  is given by ESI[j ] = 0   for j=0 and ESI[j ] = sum{s[i ]  i=0 ... (j-1 )}  for 0 < j < n .
:LABEL: field

name: MSBL
description: MSBL : The maximum source block length . A non-negative integer less than 8192 for FEC Scheme 1 and less than 56403 for FEC Scheme 2   in units of symbols . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : The payload ID format indicator . The P bit shall be set to zero to indicate payload ID format A or to one to indicate payload ID format B . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: SBN
description: Source Block Number ( SBN )  ( 16 bits ): Identifier for the source block that the source data within the packet relates . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI )  ( 16 bits ): The starting symbol index of the source packet in the source block . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: SBN
description: Source Block Number ( SBN )  ( 8 bits ): Identifier for the source block that the source data within the packet relates . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI )  ( 24 bits ): The starting symbol index of the source packet in the source block . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: SBN
description: Source Block Number ( SBN )  ( 16 bits ): Identifier for the source block that the repair symbols within the packet relate . For format A   it is of size 16 bits . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI )  ( 16 bits ): Identifier for the encoding symbols within the packet . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Block Length
description: Source Block Length ( SBL )  ( 16 bits ): The number of source symbols in the source block . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: SBN
description: Source Block Number ( SBN )  ( 8 bits ): Identifier for the source block that the repair symbols within the packet relate . For format B   it is of size 8 bits . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI )  ( 24 bits ): Identifier for the encoding symbols within the packet . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Block Length
description: Source Block Length ( SBL )  ( 16 bits ): The number of source symbols in the source block . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial Sequence Number
description: Initial Sequence Number ( Flow i ISN )  ( 16 bits ): This field specifies the lowest 16 bits of the sequence number of the first packet to be included in this sub-block . If the sequence numbers are shorter than 16 bits   then the received Sequence Number SHALL be logically padded with zero bits to become 16 bits in length   respectively . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Block Length
description: Source Block Length ( SBL )  ( 16 bits ): This field specifies the length of the source block in symbols . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI )  ( 16 bits ): This field indicates which repair symbols are contained within this repair packet . The ESI provided is the ESI of the first repair symbol in the packet . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial Sequence Number
description: Initial Sequence Number ( Flow i ISN )  ( 16 bits ): This field specifies the lowest 16 bits of the sequence number in the first packet to be included in this sub-block . If the sequence numbers are shorter than 16 bits   then the received Sequence Number SHALL be logically padded with zero bits to become 16 bits in length   respectively . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Block Length
description: Source Block Length ( SBL )  ( 16 bits ): This field specifies the length of the source block in symbols . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding Symbol ID
description: Encoding Symbol ID ( ESI ); ( 24 bits ): This field indicates which repair symbols are contained within this repair packet . The ESI provided is the ESI of the first repair symbol in the packet . The field type is unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Header
description: Figure 5 : PRoPHET Message Header
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Data
description: Timer The Timer field is used to inform the receiver of the timer value used in the Hello processing of the sender . The timer specifies the nominal time between periodic Hello messages . It is a constant for the duration of a session . The timer field is specified in units of 100 ms and is encoded as an SDNV .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Data
description: RIBD Entry Count Number of entries in the database . Encoded as SDNV .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Data
description: RIB String Count Number of routing entries in the TLV . Encoded as an SDNV .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Data
description: Bundle Offer Count Number of bundle offer/response entries . Encoded as an SDNV . Note that 0 is an acceptable value . In particular   a Bundle Response TLV with 0 entries is used to signal that a cycle of information exchange and bundle passing is completed .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Flags
description: * Routing Information Base ( RIB ) TLV Flags ( Section 4.3.4 )
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Two code values are defined for the purpose of ERP :
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: The Identifier field is one octet . The Identifier field MUST be the same if an EAP-Initiate packet is retransmitted due to a timeout while waiting for an EAP-Finish message . Any new ( non-retransmission ) EAP-Initiate message MUST use a new Identifier field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This field indicates that this is an ERP exchange . Two type values are defined in this document for this purpose -- Re-auth-Start ( Type 1 ) and Re-auth ( Type 2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Set to zero on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: SEQ : An unsigned 16-bit sequence number is used for replay protection . The SEQ field is initialized to 0 every time a new rRK is derived . The field is encoded in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Cryptosuite
description: Cryptosuite : This field indicates the integrity algorithm used for ERP . Key lengths and output lengths are either indicated or are obvious from the cryptosuite name . We specify some cryptosuites below :
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Tag
description: Authentication Tag : This field contains the integrity checksum over the ERP packet   excluding the Authentication Tag field itself . The length of the field is indicated by the cryptosuite .
:LABEL: field

name: SEQ
description: SEQ : An unsigned 16-bit sequence number is used for replay protection . The SEQ field is initialized to 0 every time a new rRK is derived . The field is encoded in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Cryptosuite
description: Cryptosuite : This field indicates the integrity algorithm and the PRF used for ERP . Key lengths and output lengths are either indicated or are obvious from the cryptosuite name .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Tag
description: Authentication Tag : This field contains the integrity checksum over the ERP packet   excluding the Authentication Tag field itself . The length of the field is indicated by the cryptosuite .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code : 90 ( Authentication ) per [ RFC3118 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : contains the length of the protocol
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: Protocol : 3 ( Reconfigure Key ) per [ RFC3118 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Algorithm
description: Algorithm : 1 ( HMAC-MD5 ) per [ RFC3118 ] and [ RFC3315 ]
:LABEL: field

name: RDM
description: Replay Detection Method ( RDM ): 0
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Information
description: The format of the Authentication Information for the Forcerenew Nonce Authentication Protocol is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 1 Forcerenew nonce Value ( used in ACK message )
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Lifetime : The requested time   in seconds   for which the sender wishes to have local forwarding . A value of 0xffff ( all ones ) indicates an infinite lifetime . When set to 0   indicates a request to stop localized routing .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The requested time   in seconds   for which the sender wishes to have local forwarding . A value of 0xffff ( all ones ) indicates an infinite lifetime . When set to 0   indicates a request to stop localized routing .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Status : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the result of processing the Localized Routing Acknowledgment message . Values of the Status field less than 128 indicate that the Localized Routing Acknowledgment was processed successfully by the mobility entities(LMA or MAG ). Values greater than or equal to 128 indicate that the Localized Routing Acknowledgment was rejected by the mobility entities . The following Status values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the result of processing the Localized Routing Acknowledgment message . Values of the Status field less than 128 indicate that the Localized Routing Acknowledgment was processed successfully by the mobility entities(LMA or MAG ). Values greater than or equal to 128 indicate that the Localized Routing Acknowledgment was rejected by the mobility entities . The following Status values are currently defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime : The time   in seconds   for which local forwarding is supported . It is typically copied from the corresponding field in the LRI message .
:LABEL: field

name: MAG IPv6 Address
description: The MAG IPv6 address mobility option contains the IPv6 address of a MAG involved in localized routing . The MAG IPv6 address option has an alignment requirement of 8n+4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the type and length fields . This field MUST be set to 18 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This 8-bit field is unused . The value MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Length
description: This field MUST be set to 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: MAG IPv6 Address
description: A 16-byte field containing the MAG's IPv6 address .
:LABEL: field

description: the byte(s ) used to indicate the size of the padding . If the value is 255   then the size of the additional padding is 254 bytes   plus the padding value encoded in the next byte . There MUST be at least one more byte in the packet in this case [ R6 R7 ]. The additional padding bytes appear at the end of the packet and MUST be set to zero by the encoder to avoid creating a covert channel . The decoder MUST accept any value for the padding bytes   however .

name: s
description: The MDCT output is divided into bands that are designed to match the ear's critical bands for the smallest ( 2.5 ms ) frame size . The larger frame sizes use integer multiples of the 2.5 ms layout . For each band   the encoder computes the energy that will later be encoded . Each band is then normalized by the square root of the *unquantized* energy   such that each band now forms a unit vector X . The energy and the normalization are computed by compute_band_energies () and normalise_bands () ( bands.c )  respectively .
:LABEL: field
