:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Number of trees to compute : An unsigned 16-bit integer as specified in Section 4.5 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Number of trees to compute
description: o Number of trees to compute : An unsigned 16-bit integer as specified in Section 4.5 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum trees able to compute
description: o Maximum trees able to compute : An unsigned 16-bit integer as specified in Section 4.5 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Number of trees to use
description: o Number of trees to use : An unsigned 16-bit integer as specified in Section 4.5 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 8 ( TREE-RT-IDs ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Starting Tree Number : This identifies the starting tree number of the nicknames that are trees for the domain . This is set to 1 for the sub-TLV containing the first list . Other Tree-Identifiers sub-TLVs will have the number of the starting list they contain . In the event the same tree identifier can be computed from two such sub-TLVs and they are different   then it is assumed that this is a transient condition that will get cleared . During this transient time   such a tree SHOULD NOT be computed unless such computation is indicated by all relevant sub-TLVs present .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting Tree Number
description: o Starting Tree Number : This identifies the starting tree number of the nicknames that are trees for the domain . This is set to 1 for the sub-TLV containing the first list . Other Tree-Identifiers sub-TLVs will have the number of the starting list they contain . In the event the same tree identifier can be computed from two such sub-TLVs and they are different   then it is assumed that this is a transient condition that will get cleared . During this transient time   such a tree SHOULD NOT be computed unless such computation is indicated by all relevant sub-TLVs present .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : The nickname at which a distribution tree is rooted .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 10 ( INT-VLAN ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Nickname : As specified in [ RFC6325 ]  Section 4.2.4.4   this field may be used to associate a nickname held by the originating IS with the VLAN range indicated . When not used in this way   it is set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : As specified in [ RFC6325 ]  Section 4.2.4.4   this field may be used to associate a nickname held by the originating IS with the VLAN range indicated . When not used in this way   it is set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Interested VLANS
description: o Interested VLANS : The Interested VLANs field is formatted as shown below .
:LABEL: field

name: Appointed Forwarder Status Lost Counter
description: o Appointed Forwarder Status Lost Counter : This is a count of how many times a port that was Appointed Forwarder for the VLANs in the range given has lost the status of being an Appointed Forwarder for some port as discussed in Section 4.8.3 of [ RFC6325 ]. It is initialized to zero at an IS when the zeroth LSP sequence number is initialized . No special action need be taken at rollover; the counter just wraps around .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Bridges
description: o Root Bridges : The list of zero or more spanning tree root bridge IDs is the set of root bridge IDs seen for all ports for which the IS is Appointed Forwarder for the VLANs in the specified range as discussed in [ RFC6325 ]  Section 4.9.3.2 . While   of course   at most one spanning tree root could be seen on any particular port   there may be multiple ports in the same VLANs connected to different bridged LANs with different spanning tree roots .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 14 ( VLAN-GROUP ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 4 + 2*n   where n is the number of secondary VLAN ID fields beyond the first . n MAY be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o RESV : a 4-bit field that MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Primary VLAN ID
description: o Secondary VLAN ID : This identifies a secondary VLAN in the VLAN Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Secondary VLAN ID
description: o Secondary VLAN ID : This identifies a secondary VLAN in the VLAN Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Interested Labels
description: An IS that can handle fine-grained labeling [ RFC7172 ] announces its fine-grained label connectivity and related information in the Interested Labels and Spanning Tree Roots sub-TLV ( INT-LABEL ). It is a variation of the Interested VLANs and Spanning Tree Roots sub-TLV ( INT-VLAN ) and is structured as follows .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 15 ( INT-LABEL ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Nickname : This field may be used to associate a nickname held by the originating IS with the Interested Labels indicated . When not used in this way   it is set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : This field may be used to associate a nickname held by the originating IS with the Interested Labels indicated . When not used in this way   it is set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Interested Labels
description: o Interested Labels : The Interested Labels field is seven bytes long and formatted as shown below .
:LABEL: field

name: Appointed Forwarder Status Lost Counter
description: o Appointed Forwarder Status Lost Counter : This is a count of how many times a port that was Appointed Forwarder for a VLAN mapping to the fine-grained label in the range or bit-map given has lost the status of being an Appointed Forwarder as discussed in Section 4.8.3 of [ RFC6325 ]. It is initialized to zero at an IS when the zeroth LSP sequence number is initialized . No special action need be taken at rollover; the counter just wraps around .
:LABEL: field

name: Root Bridges
description: o Root Bridges : The list of zero or more spanning tree root bridge IDs is the set of root bridge IDs seen for all ports for which the IS is Appointed Forwarder for a VLAN mapping to the fine-grained label in the specified range or bit-map . ( See [ RFC6325 ]  Section 4.9.3.2 .) While   of course   at most one spanning tree root could be seen on any particular port   there may be multiple relevant ports connected to different bridged LANs with different spanning tree roots .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability RBridge Channel Protocols sub-TLV   set to 16 ( RBCHANNELS ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Bit Vectors : Zero or more byte-aligned bit vectors where a one bit indicates support of a particular RBridge Channel protocol . Each byte-aligned bit vector is formatted as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 17 ( AFFINITY ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : size of all Affinity Records included   where an Affinity Record listing n tree roots is 4+2*n bytes long .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : 16-bit nickname of the IS whose associations to the multi-destination trees listed in the Affinity Record are through the originating IS .
:LABEL: field

name: Affinity Flags
description: o Affinity Flags : 8 bits reserved for future needs to provide additional information about the affinity being announced . MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of trees
description: o Number of trees : A one-byte unsigned integer giving the number of trees for which affinity is being announced by this Affinity Record .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Router Capability and MT-Capability sub-TLV type   set to 18 ( LABEL-GROUP ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 6 + 3*n   where n is the number of secondary VLAN ID fields beyond the first . n MAY be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Primary Label ID
description: o Secondary Label ID : This identifies a secondary Label ID in the Label Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Secondary Label ID
description: o Secondary Label ID : This identifies a secondary Label ID in the Label Group .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Extended Reachability and MT-ISN sub-TLV type   set to MTU sub-TLV 28 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o F : Failed . This bit is a one if MTU testing failed on this link at the required campus-wide MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: o F : Failed . This bit is a one if MTU testing failed on this link at the required campus-wide MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o MTU : This field is set to the largest successfully tested MTU size for this link or zero if it has not been tested   as specified in Section 4.3.2 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: o MTU : This field is set to the largest successfully tested MTU size for this link or zero if it has not been tested   as specified in Section 4.3.2 of [ RFC6325 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 1 + ( SIZE+3)*n   where n is the number of neighbor records   which may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 1 + ( SIZE+3)*n   where n is the number of neighbor records   which may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o S : Smallest flag . If this bit is a one   then the list of neighbors includes the neighbor with the smallest MAC address considered as an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: o L : Largest flag . If this bit is a one   then the list of neighbors includes the neighbor with the largest MAC address considered as an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: o R   RESV : These bits are reserved and MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o R   RESV : These bits are reserved and MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SIZE
description: o SIZE : The SNPA size as an unsigned integer in bytes except that 6 is encoded as zero . An actual size of zero is meaningless and cannot be encoded . The meaning of the value 6 in this field is reserved   and TRILL Neighbor TLVs received with a SIZE of 6 are ignored . The SIZE is inherent to the technology of a link and is fixed for all TRILL Neighbor TLVs on that link but may vary
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: o F : Failed . This bit is a one if MTU testing to this neighbor failed at the required campus-wide MTU ( see [ RFC6325 ]  Section 4.3.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: o O : OOMF . This bit is a one if the IS sending the enclosing TRILL Neighbor TLV is willing to offer the Overload Originated Multi - destination Frame ( OOMF ) service [ RFC7180 ] to the IS whose port has the SNPA in the enclosing Neighbor RECORD .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: o MTU : This field is set to the largest successfully tested MTU size for this neighbor or to zero if it has not been tested .
:LABEL: field

name: CHV
description: CHV - Channel Header Version
:LABEL: field

name: RBridge Channel Header
description: As shown in Figure 2   the RBridge Channel Header starts with the RBridge-Channel Ethertype ( see Section 7.2 ). Following that is a four-byte quantity with four sub-fields as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: CHV
description: CHV : A 4-bit field that gives the RBridge Channel Header Version . This document specifies version zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Channel Protocol
description: Channel Protocol : A 12-bit unsigned integer that specifies the particular RBridge Channel protocol to which the message applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: ERR : A 4-bit unsigned integer used in connection with error reporting at the RBridge Channel level as described in Section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: ERR
description: ERR : A 4-bit unsigned integer used in connection with error reporting at the RBridge Channel level as described in Section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: The parameter TC_HOP_LIMIT is the hop limit set in each TC message . TC_HOP_LIMIT MAY be a single fixed value or MAY be different in TC messages sent by the same router . However   each other router   at any hop count distance   MUST see a regular pattern of TC messages in order that meaningful values of TLVs with Type = INTERVAL_TIME and Type = VALIDITY_TIME at each hop count distance can be included as defined in [ RFC5497 ]. Thus   the pattern of TC_HOP_LIMIT MUST be
:LABEL: field

name: NBR_ADDR_TYPE
description: Note : This section does not require any IANA action   as the required information is included in the descriptions of the MPR and NBR_ADDR_TYPE Address Block TLVs allocated in Section 24.5 . This information is recorded here for clarity and for use elsewhere in this specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version ( 4 bits ): Protocol version . This is set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Message Length ( 16 bits ): Size in octets of this message   i.e .  of the portion of the packet following the Associated Channel Header .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: Message Length ( 16 bits ): Size in octets of this message   i.e .  of the portion of the packet following the Associated Channel Header .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Identifier
description: Message Identifier ( MI ) ( 32 bits ): Unique identifier of this message . For disambiguation   a sender MUST NOT reuse an MI over a given channel until it is confident that all ADBs associated with it have been expired by the receiver . The sole purpose of this field is duplicate detection in the event of a message burst ( Section 5.1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp : 64-bit Network Time Protocol ( NTP ) transmit timestamp   as specified in Section 6 of [ RFC5905 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Application ID
description: Application ID ( 16 bits ): Identifies the application this element describes; an IANA registry has been created to track the values for this field . More than one block element with the same Application ID may be present in the same ADB   and block elements with different Application IDs may also be present in the same ADB . The protocol rules for the mechanism   including what ADB elements are present and which TLVs are contained in an ADB element   are to be defined in the document that specifies the application-specific usage .
:LABEL: field

name: Element Length
description: Element Length ( 16 bits ): Specifies the total length in octets of this block element ( including the Application ID and Element Length fields ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 8 bits ): Identifies the TLV Object and is scoped to a specific application; each application creates an IANA registry to track its Type values .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Length ( 16 bits ): The length in octets of the Value field . The Value field need not be padded to provide alignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): The length in octets of the Value field . The Value field need not be padded to provide alignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: TC
description: o Traffic Class ( TC ): Traffic Class consists of a 6-bit DSCP field followed by a 2-bit reserved field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The last two bits in the Traffic Class field are currently unused . These bits MUST be initialized by the sender to ( 0 ) and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: OC
description: o Operational Code ( OC ): 1-octet Operational code indicates the type of QoS request .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : ( 6 ) to ( 255 ) Currently not used . Receiver MUST ignore the option received with any value in this range .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : This field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized to a value of ( 0 ) by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the type of the QoS attribute . This specification reserves the following values .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the number of octets needed to encode the Value   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: o Value : The format of this field is based on the Type value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : The length in octets of the attribute   excluding the Type and Length fields . This value is set to ( 6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length

name: S
description: o Service ( S ) flag : This flag is used for extending the scope of the target flows for Per-Session-Agg-Max-DL-Bit-Rate to the mobile node's other mobility sessions sharing the same Service Identifier . 3GPP Access Point Name ( APN ) is an example of a Service Identifier   and that identifier is carried using the Service Selection mobility option [ RFC5149 ].

name: E
description: o Exclude ( E ) flag : This flag is used to request that the downlink flows for which the network is providing Guaranteed-Bit-Rate service be excluded from the target IP flows for which Per - Session-Agg-Max-DL-Bit-Rate is measured .

name: TS Format
description: o TS Format : An 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the Traffic Selector Format . The values are allocated from the " Traffic Selector Format " namespace for the traffic selector sub-option defined in [ RFC6089 ]; those defined in [ RFC6089 ] are repeated here for clarity . Value ( 0 ) is reserved and MUST NOT be used . When the value of the TS Format field is set to ( 1 )  the format that follows is the IPv4 Binary Traffic Selector specified in Section 3.1 of [ RFC6088 ]  and when the value of TS Format field is set to ( 2 )  the format that follows is the IPv6 Binary Traffic Selector specified in Section 3.2 of [ RFC6088 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : The length of the attribute in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

description: o Length : The length of the attribute in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : This field is unused for now . The value MUST be initialized by the sender to 0 and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor ID
description: o Vendor ID : The Vendor ID is the SMI ( Structure of Management Information ) Network Management Private Enterprise Code of the IANA-maintained " Private Enterprise Numbers " registry [ SMI ].
:LABEL: field

name: SR-ID
description: ( OC=ALLOCATE   SR-ID   QoS attributes   etc .). The equivalent QoS treatment is provided by the Wi-Fi AP toward the MN on the Wi-Fi link .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: ( E ): AP may enforce uplink QoS rules according to priority class set by the MN ( F ): MAG can enforce a default QoS class until the local mobility anchor classifies the new flow ( notified with PBA ) or the mobile access gateway classifies new flow and proposes the associated QoS class to the local mobility anchor for validation ( proposed with PBU   notification of validation result with PBA )
:LABEL: field

name: Option Code
description: o Reserved : This field is initialized as specified in Section 7.3 of [ RFC6887 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : This field is initialized as specified in Section 7.3 of [ RFC6887 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: o Option Length : Indicates in octets the length of the enclosed data .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix64 Length
description: o Prefix64 Length : Indicates in octets the length of the Pref64::/n . The allowed values are specified in [ RFC6052 ] ( i.e .  4   5   6   7   8   or 12 ).
:LABEL: field

name: flags
description: flags : A one-byte field containing optional connection flags . The first four bits are unused and MUST be set to zero upon transmission and MUST be ignored upon reception . The last four bits are interpreted as shown in Table 1 below .
:LABEL: field

name: type
description: type : Indicates the type of the message as per Table 2 below
:LABEL: field

name: flags
description: flags : Optional flags defined based on message type .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: Block Type ( BT ): 8 bits . A Bytes Discarded Packets Report Block is identified by the constant 26 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Interval Metric flag ( I ): 2 bits . It is used to indicate whether the discard metric is an Interval or a Cumulative metric   that is   whether the reported value applies to the most recent measurement
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Early bit ( E ): It is introduced to distinguish between packets discarded due to early arrival and those discarded due to late arrival . The E bit is set to ' 1 ' if it reports bytes discarded due to early arrival and is set to ' 0 ' if it reports bytes discarded due to late arrival . If a duplicate packet is received and discarded   these duplicate packets are ignored and not reported . In case both early and late discarded packets shall be reported   two Bytes Discarded report blocks MUST be included .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 5 bits . This field is reserved for future definition . In the absence of such definition   the bits in this field MUST be set to zero and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Block length
description: Block length : 16 bits . It MUST be set to 2   in accordance with the definition of this field in [ RFC3611 ]. The block MUST be discarded if the block length is set to a different value .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of RTP payload bytes discarded
description: Number of RTP payload bytes discarded : It is a 32-bit unsigned integer value indicating the total number of bytes discarded . The ' bytes discarded ' corresponds to the RTP payload size of every RTP packet that is discarded ( due to early or late arrival ). Hence   the ' bytes discarded ' ignores the size of any RTP header extensions and the size of the padding bits . Also the discarded packet is associated to the interval in which it was discarded   not when it was expected .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: The RTP Flow Initial Synchronization Delay Metrics Block is identified by the constant 27 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future definition . In the absence of such a definition   the bits in this field MUST be set to zero and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Block length
description: The constant 2   in accordance with the definition of this field in Section 3 of RFC 3611 [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of source
description: The SSRC of the media source SHALL be set to the value of the SSRC identifier carried in any arbitrary component of RTP sessions belonging to the same multimedia session .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial Synchronization Delay
description: The average delay   expressed in units of 1/65536 seconds   from the beginning of the multimedia session [ RFC6051 ] to the time when RTCP packets are received on all of the component RTP sessions . It is recommended that the beginning of the multimedia session is
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: The RTP Flow General Synchronization Offset Metrics Block is identified by the constant 28 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field is used to indicate whether the Burst/Gap Discard Summary Statistics metrics are Sampled   Interval   or Cumulative metrics :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future definition . In the absence of such a definition   the bits in this field MUST be set to zero and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Block length
description: The constant 3   in accordance with the definition of this field in Section 3 of RFC 3611 [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Source
description: The SSRC of the media source SHALL be set to the value of the SSRC identifier of the reporting RTP stream to which the XR relates .
:LABEL: field

name: RD
description: RD : Route Distinguisher   an identifier that makes a route unique in the context of a VRF .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Version ( Ver ): 2-bit unsigned integer . Indicates the CoAP version number . Implementations of this specification MUST set this field to 1 ( 01 binary ). Other values are reserved for future versions . Messages with unknown version numbers MUST be silently ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Type ( T ): 2-bit unsigned integer . Indicates if this message is of type Confirmable ( 0 )  Non-confirmable ( 1 )  Acknowledgement ( 2 )  or Reset ( 3 ). The semantics of these message types are defined in Section 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: TKL
description: Token Length ( TKL ): 4-bit unsigned integer . Indicates the length of the variable-length Token field ( 0-8 bytes ). Lengths 9-15 are reserved   MUST NOT be sent   and MUST be processed as a message format error .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code : 8-bit unsigned integer   split into a 3-bit class ( most significant bits ) and a 5-bit detail ( least significant bits )  documented as " c.dd " where " c " is a digit from 0 to 7 for the 3-bit subfield and " dd " are two digits from 00 to 31 for the 5-bit subfield . The class can indicate a request ( 0 )  a success response ( 2 )  a client error response ( 4 )  or a server error response ( 5 ). ( All other class values are reserved .) As a special case   Code 0.00 indicates an Empty message . In case of a request   the Code field indicates the Request Method; in case of a response   a Response Code . Possible values are maintained in the CoAP Code Registries ( Section 12.1 ). The semantics of requests and responses are defined in Section 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: Message ID : 16-bit unsigned integer in network byte order . Used to detect message duplication and to match messages of type Acknowledgement/Reset to messages of type Confirmable/Non - confirmable . The rules for generating a Message ID and matching messages are defined in Section 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: GET
description: The GET method retrieves a representation for the information that currently corresponds to the resource identified by the request URI . If the request includes an Accept Option   that indicates the preferred content-format of a response . If the request includes an ETag Option   the GET method requests that ETag be validated and that the representation be transferred only if validation failed . Upon success   a 2.05 ( Content ) or 2.03 ( Valid ) Response Code SHOULD be present in the response .
:LABEL: field

name: GET
description: The GET method requests the proxy to return a representation of the HTTP resource identified by the request URI .
:LABEL: field

name: GET
description: The GET method requests the proxy to return a representation of the CoAP resource identified by the Request-URI .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV
description: o Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV ( defined in Section 5.2 ). This TLV associates a Multicast Service Profile with the access line specified by the extension block and   in the case of white and black lists   delegates conditional access to the AN for the specified access line and channels .
:LABEL: field

name: Target TLV
description: o Target TLV : The Target TLV is defined in Section 4.3 of [ RFC6320 ]. It MUST appear once and only once . It is encoded as specified in [ RFC6320 ] or extensions and identifies the AN port subject to the request for admission or release .
:LABEL: field

name: Accounting
description: o Accounting : Meaningful only when the Command Code is " Add " ( 1 ). In that case   0 indicates flow accounting is disabled   and 1 indicates that octet accounting for the flow is requested . The sender MUST set the Accounting field to 0   and the receiver MUST ignore the Accounting field for other Command Code values .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : Reserved for future use . MUST be set to zeroes by the sender and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Other embedded TLV data
description: o Other embedded TLV data : No other embedded TLVs are currently specified within the Multicast Replication Control message and Command TLV . However   see the description of the Multicast Admission Control message ( Section 4.4 ). Unrecognized embedded TLVs SHOULD be silently discarded .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : ANCP agent at the AN .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : ANCP agent at the AN .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : control application at the AN .
:LABEL: field

name: Target TLV
description: o Target TLV : The Target TLV is defined in [ RFC6320 ]. It MUST appear once and only once in the Multicast Admission Control message . It is encoded as specified in [ RFC6320 ] or extensions and identifies the AN port subject to the request for admission or release .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : control application at the receiver of the Bandwidth Reallocation Request message .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : control application at the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: x
description: Where detected : control application at the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Target TLV
description: o Target TLV(s ). The Target TLV MUST appear once per AN port on which the multicast flow identified in the preceding Multicast - Flow TLV is active .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV : described in Section 5.2 . The Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV MUST contain an identifier that is unique over all profiles provisioned to the same AN partition . This identifier will be used to refer to the profile when activating it for a given target within a Port Management message ( see Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV
description: The Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV carries the identifier of a multicast service profile provisioned on the AN . It is illustrated in Figure 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Multicast service profile identifier : an opaque sequence of octets identifying a specific multicast service profile .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast service profile identifier
description: o Multicast service profile identifier : an opaque sequence of octets identifying a specific multicast service profile .
:LABEL: field

name: List-Action TLV
description: The List-Action TLV identifies multicast flows to be added to or removed from a list of white -  black -  or grey-listed flows . It is meaningful only in association with a Multicast-Service-Profile-Name TLV identifying the profile to which the List-Action TLV applies . Such an association can be achieved by placing both TLVs in the same base message payload or as embedded TLVs of another TLV such as the Multicast-Service-Profile TLV . The List-Action TLV is shown in Figure 9 .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Operation : operation to be performed upon the white   black   or grey list identified by the List Type field within the profile identified by the associated Multicast-Service-Profile-Name embedded TLV . The possible values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Operation
description: o Operation : operation to be performed upon the white   black   or grey list identified by the List Type field within the profile identified by the associated Multicast-Service-Profile-Name embedded TLV . The possible values are :
:LABEL: field

name: List Type
description: o List Type : the list type being modified by this List-Action TLV . The possible values are 1 " White "  2 " Black "  or 3 " Grey ".
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : a sender MUST set this field to zeroes . A receiver MUST ignore the contents of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Family
description: o Address Family : the IP version of the set of multicast flow fields that follow   encoded according to [ PIMreg ]. Possible values are 1 " IPv4 " or 2 " IPv6 ". Either an IPv4 list or an IPv6 list or both MAY be present in the List-Action TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of flow fields
description: o Number of flow fields : the number of multicast flow fields of the given address family that follows .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Sequence number : the sequence number of a specific entity within a series   where numbering starts from 1 for the first entity in the series . Represented as a 32-bit binary number   most significant bit first .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence number
description: o Sequence number : the sequence number of a specific entity within a series   where numbering starts from 1 for the first entity in the series . Represented as a 32-bit binary number   most significant bit first .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Delegated amount : the bandwidth amount delegated to the AN for admission of multicast video on a given port   kilobits per second . Represented as a 32-bit binary value   most significant bit first .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : 0   since the TLV contains no data other than the TLV header .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : 0   since the TLV contains no data other than the TLV header .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Required amount : the minimum or maximum amount   depending on whether the sender is the AN or the NAS respectively   of delegated video bandwidth that is being requested   in kilobits per second . Represented as a 32-bit binary value   most significant bit first .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Unicast address : IP address of the source of a multicast flow join request   in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : either 6 octets ( MAC-48 or EUI-48 ) or 8 octets ( EUI - 64 ).
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Identifier value : local device identifier value   known to the AN and AAA . Given that the scope of the identifier is a single customer network   32 bits is a more-than-sufficient numbering space .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier value
description: o Identifier value : local device identifier value   known to the AN and AAA . Given that the scope of the identifier is a single customer network   32 bits is a more-than-sufficient numbering space .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : ranges from a minimum of 8 ( for an ASM IPv4 flow ) upwards . Total length is 4 + 4*(Number of Source Addresses + 1 ) for IPv4 or 4 + 16*(Number of Source Addresses + 1 ) for IPv6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Type
description: o Flow Type : 1 " Any-Source Multicast ( ASM )"  2 " Source-Specific Multicast ( SSM )".
:LABEL: field

name: Addr Family
description: o Addr Family : address family of the multicast source and group addresses   encoded in accordance with the IANA " PIM Address Family " registry ([ PIMreg ]). 1 indicates IPv4; 2 indicates IPv6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Source Addresses
description: o Multicast Group Address : a multicast group address within the given address family . The group address MUST always be present .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Group Address
description: o Multicast Group Address : a multicast group address within the given address family . The group address MUST always be present .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o Buffering Time is a 32-bit unsigned integer containing a time value in milliseconds ( ms ).
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Length
description: o TLV Length : 4 octets plus the length of the Target TLV   including its header and any padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Target TLV
description: o Target TLV : identifies the access line to which this amount of multicast bandwidth is currently committed .
:LABEL: field

name: OAM Type
description: OAM Type : specifies the technology-specific OAM method . When carried in the LSP_REQUIRED_ATTRIBUTES object   if the requested OAM method is not supported at any given node an error MUST be generated : " OAM Problem/Unsupported OAM Type ". When carried in the LSP_ATTRIBUTES object   intermediate nodes not supporting the OAM Type pass the object forward unchanged as specified in [ RFC5420 ]. Ingress and egress nodes that support the OAM Configuration TLV but that do not support a specific OAM Type MUST respond with an error indicating " OAM Problem/Unsupported OAM Type ".
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : indicates the total length of the TLV in octets . The TLV MUST be zero-padded so that the TLV is 4-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: The MOS Metrics Block is identified by the constant 29 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field is used to indicate whether the MOS Metrics are Sampled   Interval   or Cumulative [ RFC6792 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future definition . In the absence of such a definition   the bits in this field MUST be set to zero and ignored by the receiver ( see RFC 6709   Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Block Length
description: The length of this report block in 32-bit words   minus one . For the MOS Metrics Block   the block length is variable length .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of source
description: As defined in Section 4.1 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: This field is used to identify the segment type used in this report block . A zero identifies this as a single-channel audio/video per SSRC segment . Single channel means there is only one media stream carried in one RTP stream . The single-channel audio/video per SSRC segment can be used to report the MOS value associated with the media stream identified by SSRC . If there are multiple media streams and they want to use the single-channel audio/video per SSRC segment to report the MOS value   they should be carried in the separate RTP streams with each identified by different SSRC . In this case   multiple MOS Metrics Blocks are
:LABEL: field

name: CAID
description: The 8-bit CAID is the session specific reference to the calculation algorithm and associated qualifiers indicated in SDP ( see Section 4.1 ) and used to compute the MOS score for this segment .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: MOS Metrics reporting depends on the payload format in use . This field identifies the RTP payload type in use during the reporting interval . The binding between RTP payload types and RTP payload formats is configured via a signaling protocol   for example   an SDP offer/answer exchange . If the RTP payload type used is changed during an RTP session   separate reports SHOULD be sent for each RTP payload type   with corresponding measurement information blocks indicating the time period to which they relate .
:LABEL: field

name: MOS Value
description: The estimated mean opinion score ( MOS ) for multimedia application performance is estimated using an algorithm that includes the impact of delay   loss   jitter and other impairments that affect media quality . This is an unsigned fixed-point 7:9 value representing the MOS   allowing the MOS score up to 127 in the integer part . MOS ranges are defined as part of the specification of the MOS estimation algorithm ( Calculation Algorithm in this document )  and are normally ranges like 1-5   0-10   or 0-100 . Two values are reserved : a value of 0xFFFE indicates that the measurement is out of range and a value of 0xFFFF indicates that the measurement is unavailable . Values outside of the range defined by the Calculation Algorithm   other than the two reserved values   MUST NOT be sent and MUST be ignored by the receiving system .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: This field is used to identify the segment type used in this report block . A one identifies this as a multi-channel audio segment .
:LABEL: field

name: CAID
description: The 8-bit CAID is the session specific reference to the calculation algorithm and associated qualifiers indicated in SDP ( see Section 4.1 ) and used to compute the MOS score for this segment .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: As defined in Section 3.2.1 of this document
:LABEL: field

name: CHID
description: If multiple channels of audio are carried in one RTP stream   each channel of audio will be viewed as an independent channel ( e.g .  left channel audio   right channel audio ). This field is used to identify each channel carried in the same media stream . The default channel mapping follows static ordering rule described in Section 4.1 of [ RFC3551 ]. However   there are some payload formats that use different channel mappings   e.g .  AC-3 audio over RTP [ RFC4184 ] only follow AC-3 channel order scheme defined in [ ATSC ]. Enhanced AC-3 audio over RTP [ RFC4598 ] uses a dynamic channel transform mechanism . In order for the appropriate channel mapping to be determined   MOS metrics reports need to be tied to an RTP payload format . The reports should include the payload type of the reported media according to [ RFC6792 ]  so that it can be used to determine the appropriate channel mapping .
:LABEL: field

name: MOS Value
description: The estimated MOS for multimedia application performance is defined as including the effects of delay   loss   discard   jitter and other effects that would affect media quality . This is an unsigned fixed-point 7:6 value representing the MOS   allowing the MOS score up to 127 in the integer part . MOS ranges are defined as part of the specification of the MOS estimation algorithm
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer . The two most significant octets MUST be set to zero by the sender and are ignored by the receiver; the two least significant octets contain the Mobility Domain Identifier ( MDID ) defined in Section 8.4.2.49 of [ IEEE-802.11 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The field is 4 octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer encoding the maximum time in seconds that pre-authentication state should be retained by the NAS .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer . The two most significant octets MUST be set to zero by the sender   and are ignored by the receiver; the two least significant octets contain the Venue Group and Venue Type fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Venue Group
description: The Venue Group field is a single octet and describes the broad category of the venue   e.g .  " Assembly ". See Section 8.4.1.34 of [ IEEE-802.11 ] for Venue Group codes and descriptions .
:LABEL: field

name: Venue Type
description: The Venue Type field is a single octet and describes the venue in a finer granularity within the Venue Group   e.g .  " Library ". See Section 8.4.1.34 of [ IEEE-802.11 ] for Venue Type codes and descriptions .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer . The two most significant octets MUST be set to zero by the sender and are ignored by the receiver; the two least significant octets contain the Reason Code values defined in Table 8-36 of Section 8.4.1.7 of [ IEEE-802.11 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer   in Suite selector format as specified in Figure 8-187 within Section 8.4.2.27.2 of [ IEEE-802.11 ]  with values of OUI and Suite Type drawn from Table 8-99 .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer   in Suite selector format as specified in Figure 8-187 within Section 8.4.2.27.2 of [ IEEE-802.11 ]  with values of OUI and Suite Type drawn from Table 8-99 .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer   in Suite selector format as specified in Figure 8-187 within Section 8.4.2.27.2 of [ IEEE-802.11 ]  with values of OUI and Suite Type drawn from Table 8-101 :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer   in Suite selector format as specified in Figure 8-187 within Section 8.4.2.27.2 of [ IEEE-802.11 ]  with values of OUI and Suite Type drawn from Table 8-99 :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The Value field is four octets   containing a 32-bit unsigned integer . The three most significant octets MUST be set to zero by the sender and are ignored by the receiver; the least significant octet contains the RF Band field   whose values are defined by the IEEE 802.11 Band ID field ( Table 8-53a of [ IEEE-802.11ad ])
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: Block Type ( BT ): 8 bits . It identifies the block format . Its value is set to 12 .
:LABEL: field

name: SPST
description: Synchronization Packet Sender Type ( SPST ): 4 bits . This field identifies the role of the packet sender for this specific Extended Report . It can have the following values   as enumerated in a registry maintained by IANA ( see Section 13.4 ):
:LABEL: field

name: Resrv
description: Reserved bits ( Resrv ): 3 bits . These bits are reserved for future definition . In the absence of such a definition   the bits in this field MUST be set to zero at transmission and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: Packet Presented NTP timestamp flag ( P ): 1 bit . Bit set to 1 if the Packet Presented NTP timestamp field contains a value   0 if it is empty . If this flag is set to 0   then the Packet Presented NTP timestamp SHALL be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): 7 bits . This field identifies the format of the media payload   according to [ RFC3551 ]. This is the payload type of the RTP packet reported upon . The PT field is needed in the case where the MSAS is neither the media server nor a receiver of the media stream   i.e .  it is implemented as a third-party entity . In such cases   the MSAS needs the PT to determine the rate of advancement of the timestamps of the RTP media stream to be able to relate reports from different SCs on different RTP timestamp values .
:LABEL: field

name: Resrv
description: Reserved bits ( Resrv ): 25 bits . These bits are reserved for future use and SHALL be set to 0 at transmission and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Media Stream Correlation Identifier
description: Media Stream Correlation Identifier : 32 bits . This identifier is used to correlate synchronized media streams . The value 0 ( all bits are set " 0 ") indicates that this field is empty . The value 2^32-1 ( all bits are set " 1 ") is reserved for future use . If the RTCP Packet Sender is an SC ( SPST=1 )  then the Media Stream Correlation Identifier field contains the Synchronization Group Identifier ( SyncGroupId ) to which the report applies .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Received RTP timestamp
description: Packet Received RTP timestamp : 32 bits . This timestamp has the value of the RTP timestamp carried in the RTP header [ RFC3550 ] of the RTP packet to which the XR IDMS relates . Several consecutive RTP packets will have equal timestamps if they are ( logically ) generated at once   e.g .  belong to the same video frame . It may well be the case that one receiver reports on the first RTP packet that has a certain RTP timestamp   and a second receiver reports on the last RTP packet that has that same RTP timestamp . This would lead to an error in the
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Presented NTP timestamp
description: Packet Presented NTP timestamp : 32 bits . This timestamp reflects the wallclock time at the moment the rendered media unit ( e.g .  video frame or audio sample ) contained in the first byte of the associated RTP packet is presented to the user . It is based on the time format used by NTP and consists of the least significant 16 bits of the NTP seconds part and the most significant 16 bits of the NTP fractional second part . If no Packet Presented NTP timestamp is available   this field SHALL be set to 0 and be considered empty   and the Packet Presented NTP timestamp flag ( P ) SHALL be set to 0 . With regards to NTP epoch and rollover   the value of the Packet Presented NTP timestamp is considered to always be greater than the Packet Received NTP timestamp and to be within 2^16 seconds of it . Presented in this context means the moment the data is played out to the user of the system   i.e .  sound played out through speakers   video images being displayed on some display   etc . The accuracy resulting from the synchronization algorithm will only be as good as the accuracy with which the SCs can determine the delay between receiving packets and presenting them to the end user . If no presentation timestamps are reported by SCs   the ability to accurately synchronize playout may be limited .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: SSRC : 32 bits . The SSRC of the media source is set to the value of the SSRC identifier of the media source carried in the RTP header [ RFC3550 ] of the RTP packet to which the RTCP IDMS Settings Packet relates .
:LABEL: field

name: Media Stream Correlation Identifier
description: Media Stream Correlation Identifier : 32 bits . This identifier is used to correlate synchronized media streams . The value 0 ( all bits are set " 0 ") indicates that this field is empty . The value 2^32-1 ( all bits are set " 1 ") is reserved for future use . The Media Stream Correlation Identifier contains the SyncGroupId of the group to which this packet is sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Received RTP timestamp
description: Packet Received RTP timestamp : 32 bits . This timestamp has the value of the RTP timestamp carried in the RTP header [ RFC3550 ] of the RTP packet to which the XR IDMS relates . This SHOULD relate to the first arriving RTP packet containing this particular RTP timestamp   in case multiple consecutive RTP packets contain the same RTP timestamp .
:LABEL: field

name: Packet Presented NTP timestamp
description: Packet Presented NTP timestamp : 64 bits . This timestamp reflects the wallclock time at the reference client at the moment it presented the rendered media unit ( e.g .  video frame or audio sample ) contained in the first octet of the associated RTP packet to the user . The timestamp is formatted based on the NTP timestamp format as specified in [ RFC5905 ]. If no Packet Presented NTP timestamp is available   this field SHALL be set to 0 and be considered empty . This field MAY be left empty if none or only one of the receivers reported on presentation timestamps . Presented here means the moment the data is played out to the user of the system .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Length : Length of all included data in octets . The minimum length is 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Length of all included data in octets . The minimum length is 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: A Loss Concealment Metrics Block is identified by the constant 30 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field is used to indicate whether the loss concealment metrics are Sampled   Interval   or Cumulative metrics :
:LABEL: field

name: plc
description: This field is used to identify the packet loss concealment method in use at the receiver   according to the following code :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: resv
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: block length
description: The length of this report block in 32-bit words   minus one . For the Loss Concealment Metrics Block   the block length is equal to 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Source
description: As defined in Section 4.1 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Loss Concealment Duration
description: The duration   expressed in units of RTP timestamp   of audio playout corresponding to Loss-Type concealment .
:LABEL: field

name: Buffer Adjustment Concealment Duration
description: The duration   expressed in units of RTP timestamp   of audio playout corresponding to Buffer Adjustment-Type concealment   if known .
:LABEL: field

name: Playout Interrupt Count
description: The number of interruptions to normal playout that occurred during the reporting period .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Mean Playout Interrupt Size
description: The mean duration   expressed in units of RTP timestamp   of interruptions to normal playout that occurred during the reporting period .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: A Concealed Seconds Metrics Block is identified by the constant 31 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field is used to indicate whether the Concealed Seconds metrics are Sampled   Interval   or Cumulative metrics :
:LABEL: field

name: plc
description: This field is used to identify the packet loss concealment method in use at the receiver   according to the following code :
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: resv
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Source
description: As defined in Section 4.1 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Unimpaired Seconds
description: A count of the number of Unimpaired Seconds that have occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: Concealed Seconds
description: A count of the number of Concealed Seconds that have occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: Severely Concealed Seconds
description: A count of the number of Severely Concealed Seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SCS Threshold
description: The SCS Threshold is defined as the percentage of packets corresponding to lost or discarded frames that must occur within a one second period in order for the second to be classified as a Severely Concealed Second . This is expressed in numeric format 0:8 and hence can represent a range of 0 to 99.6 percent loss or discard .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload ( 1 octet ) - Indicates the type of payload that immediately follows the header . The format and value of each payload are defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: Exchange Type
description: o Exchange Type ( 1 octet ) - Indicates the type of exchange being used . This constrains the payloads sent in each message in an exchange . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: o Flags ( 1 octet ) - Indicates specific options that are set for the message . Presence of options is indicated by the appropriate bit in the flags field being set . The bits are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: * R ( Response ) - This bit indicates that this message is a response to a message containing the same Message ID . This bit MUST be cleared in all request messages and MUST be set in all responses . An IKE endpoint MUST NOT generate a response to a message that is marked as being a response ( with one exception; see Section 2.21.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: * V ( Version ) - This bit indicates that the transmitter is capable of speaking a higher major version number of the protocol than the one indicated in the major version number field . Implementations of IKEv2 MUST clear this bit when sending and MUST ignore it in incoming messages .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: * I ( Initiator ) - This bit MUST be set in messages sent by the original initiator of the IKE SA and MUST be cleared in messages sent by the original responder . It is used by the recipient to determine which eight octets of the SPI were generated by the recipient . This bit changes to reflect who initiated the last rekey of the IKE SA .
:LABEL: field

name: Message ID
description: o Message ID ( 4 octets   unsigned integer ) - Message identifier used to control retransmission of lost packets and matching of requests and responses . It is essential to the security of the protocol because it is used to prevent message replay attacks . See Sections 2.1 and 2.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length ( 4 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of the total message ( header + payloads ) in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload ( 1 octet ) - Identifier for the payload type of the next payload in the message . If the current payload is the last in the message   then this field will be 0 . This field provides a " chaining " capability whereby additional payloads can be added to a message by appending each one to the end of the message and setting the Next Payload field of the preceding payload to indicate the new payload's type . An Encrypted payload   which must always be the last payload of a message   is an exception . It contains data structures in the format of additional payloads . In the header of an Encrypted payload   the Next Payload field is set to the payload type of the first contained payload ( instead of 0); conversely   the Next Payload field of the last contained payload is set to zero . The payload type values are listed here . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 7 bits ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: o Payload Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length in octets of the current payload   including the generic payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Last Substruc
description: o Last Substruc ( 1 octet ) - Specifies whether or not this is the last Proposal Substructure in the SA . This field has a value of 0 if this was the last Proposal Substructure   and a value of 2 if there are more Proposal Substructures . This syntax is inherited from ISAKMP   but is unnecessary because the last Proposal could be identified from the length of the SA . The value ( 2 ) corresponds to a payload type of Proposal in IKEv1   and the first four octets of the Proposal structure are designed to look somewhat like the header of a payload .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 1 octet ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Proposal Length
description: o Proposal Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of this proposal   including all transforms and attributes that follow .
:LABEL: field

name: Proposal Num
description: o Proposal Num ( 1 octet ) - When a proposal is made   the first proposal in an SA payload MUST be 1   and subsequent proposals MUST be one more than the previous proposal ( indicating an OR of the two proposals ). When a proposal is accepted   the proposal number in the SA payload MUST match the number on the proposal sent that was accepted .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the IPsec protocol identifier for the current negotiation . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - For an initial IKE SA negotiation   this field MUST be zero; the SPI is obtained from the outer header . During subsequent negotiations   it is equal to the size   in octets   of the SPI of the corresponding protocol ( 8 for IKE   4 for ESP and AH ).
:LABEL: field

name: Num Transforms
description: o Num Transforms ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the number of transforms in this proposal .
:LABEL: field

name: Last Substruc
description: o Last Substruc ( 1 octet ) - Specifies whether or not this is the last Transform Substructure in the Proposal . This field has a value of 0 if this was the last Transform Substructure   and a
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o Transform Length - The length ( in octets ) of the Transform Substructure including Header and Attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Length
description: o Transform Length - The length ( in octets ) of the Transform Substructure including Header and Attributes .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Type
description: o Transform Type ( 1 octet ) - The type of transform being specified in this transform . Different protocols support different Transform Types . For some protocols   some of the transforms may be optional . If a transform is optional and the initiator wishes to propose that the transform be omitted   no transform of the given type is included in the proposal . If the initiator wishes to make use of the transform optional to the responder   it includes a transform substructure with Transform ID = 0 as one of the options .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform ID
description: o Transform ID ( 2 octets ) - The specific instance of the Transform Type being proposed .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Attributes
description: Each transform in a Security Association payload may include attributes that modify or complete the specification of the transform . The set of valid attributes depends on the transform . Currently   only a single attribute type is defined : the Key Length attribute is used by certain encryption transforms with variable - length keys ( see below for details ).
:LABEL: field

name: AF
description: o Attribute Format ( AF ) ( 1 bit ) - Indicates whether the data attribute follows the Type/Length/Value ( TLV ) format or a shortened Type/Value ( TV ) format . If the AF bit is zero ( 0 )  then the attribute uses TLV format; if the AF bit is one ( 1 )  the TV format ( with two-byte value ) is used .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: o Attribute Type ( 15 bits ) - Unique identifier for each type of attribute ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: ID Type
description: o ID Type ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the type of Identification being used .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o Identification Data ( variable length ) - Value   as indicated by the Identification Type . The length of the Identification Data is computed from the size in the ID payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification Data
description: o Identification Data ( variable length ) - Value   as indicated by the Identification Type . The length of the Identification Data is computed from the size in the ID payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Certificate Data
description: o Certificate Data ( variable length ) - Actual encoding of certificate data . The type of certificate is indicated by the Certificate Encoding field .
:LABEL: field

name: Certification Authority
description: o Certification Authority ( variable length ) - Contains an encoding of an acceptable certification authority for the type of certificate requested .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Method
description: o Auth Method ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the method of authentication used . The types of signatures are listed here . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: o Authentication Data ( variable length ) - see Section 2.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce Data
description: o Nonce Data ( variable length ) - Contains the random data generated by the transmitting entity .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - If this notification concerns an existing SA whose SPI is given in the SPI field   this field indicates the type of that SA . For notifications concerning Child SAs   this field MUST contain either ( 2 ) to indicate AH or ( 3 ) to indicate ESP . Of the notifications defined in this document   the SPI is included only with INVALID_SELECTORS   REKEY_SA   and CHILD_SA_NOT_FOUND . If the SPI field is empty   this field MUST be sent as zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the IPsec protocol ID or zero if no SPI is applicable . For a notification concerning the IKE SA   the SPI Size MUST be zero and the field must be empty .
:LABEL: field

name: Notify Message Type
description: o Notify Message Type ( 2 octets ) - Specifies the type of notification message .
:LABEL: field

name: Notification Data
description: o Notification Data ( variable length ) - Status or error data transmitted in addition to the Notify Message Type . Values for this field are type specific ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Must be 1 for an IKE SA   2 for AH   or 3 for ESP .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the protocol ID . It MUST be zero for IKE ( SPI is in message header ) or four for AH and ESP .
:LABEL: field

name: Num of SPIs
description: o Num of SPIs ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - The number of SPIs contained in the Delete payload . The size of each SPI is defined by the SPI Size field .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of TSs
description: o Number of TSs ( 1 octet ) - Number of Traffic Selectors being provided .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED - This field MUST be sent as zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: TS Type
description: o IP protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Value specifying an associated IP protocol ID ( such as UDP   TCP   and ICMP ). A value of zero means that the protocol ID is not relevant to this Traffic Selector -- the SA can carry all protocols .
:LABEL: field

name: Selector Length
description: o Selector Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Specifies the length of this Traffic Selector substructure including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload - The payload type of the first embedded payload . Note that this is an exception in the standard header format   since the Encrypted payload is the last payload in the message and therefore the Next Payload field would normally be zero . But because the content of this payload is embedded payloads and there was no natural place to put the type of the first one   that type is placed here .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: o Payload Length - Includes the lengths of the header   initialization vector ( IV )  Encrypted IKE payloads   Padding   Pad Length   and Integrity Checksum Data .
:LABEL: field

name: CFG Type
description: o CFG Type ( 1 octet ) - The type of exchange represented by the Configuration Attributes . The values in the following table are only current as of the publication date of RFC 4306 . Other values may have been added since then or will be added after the publication of this document . Readers should refer to [ IKEV2IANA ] for the latest values .
:LABEL: field

name: RESERVED
description: o RESERVED ( 3 octets ) - MUST be sent as zero; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Configuration Attributes
description: o Configuration Attributes ( variable length ) - These are type length value ( TLV ) structures specific to the Configuration payload and are defined below . There may be zero or more Configuration Attributes in this payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Configuration Attributes
description: 3.15.1 . Configuration Attributes
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: o Attribute Type ( 15 bits ) - A unique identifier for each of the Configuration Attribute Types .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Value ( 0 or more octets ) - The variable-length value of this Configuration Attribute . The following lists the attribute types .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: o Value ( 0 or more octets ) - The variable-length value of this Configuration Attribute . The following lists the attribute types .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Code ( 1 octet ) - Indicates whether this message is a Request ( 1 )  Response ( 2 )  Success ( 3 )  or Failure ( 4 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: o Identifier ( 1 octet ) - Used in PPP to distinguish replayed messages from repeated ones . Since in IKE   EAP runs over a reliable protocol   the Identifier serves no function here . In a response message   this octet MUST be set to match the identifier in the corresponding request .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - The length of the EAP message . MUST be four less than the Payload Length of the encapsulating payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type ( 1 octet ) - Present only if the Code field is Request ( 1 ) or Response ( 2 ). For other codes   the EAP message length MUST be four octets and the Type and Type_Data fields MUST NOT be present . In a Request ( 1 ) message   Type indicates the data being requested . In a Response ( 2 ) message   Type MUST either be Nak or match the type of the data requested . Note that since IKE passes an indication of initiator identity in the first message in the IKE_AUTH exchange   the responder SHOULD NOT send EAP Identity requests ( type 1 ). The initiator MAY   however   respond to such requests if it receives them .
:LABEL: field

name: KeyID
description: A 16-bit unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length   in octets   of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: PacketCounter
description: PacketCounter A 16-bit unsigned integer in network byte order -- the PC part of a TS/PC number stored in this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp A 32-bit unsigned integer in network byte order -- the TS part of a TS/PC number stored in this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length The length   in octets   of the body   exclusive of the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: KeyID
description: KeyID A 16-bit unsigned integer in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: KeyID
description: KeyID Set to LocalKeyID modulo 2^16 of the current key of the current CSA .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Set to 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: PacketCounter
description: PacketCounter Set to the current value of the LocalPC variable of the current outgoing interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp Set to the current value of the LocalTS variable of the current outgoing interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length Set to 2 plus the digest length of HashAlgo of the current ESA .
:LABEL: field

name: KeyID
description: KeyID Set to KeyID of the current ESA .
:LABEL: field

name: Immediate Data
description: Immediate Data - a small fixed-size portion of data sent from the Data Source to a Data Sink .
:LABEL: field

name: RV
description: The RDMA Version ( RV ) field : 01b .
:LABEL: field

name: Invalidate STag
description: Figure 2 : Additional RDMA Usage of DDP Fields
:LABEL: field

description: if ( bit != 0 ) bit_location = bit_location << 1
:LABEL: field

description: The FetchAdd operation is performed in the endian format of the target memory . The " Original Remote Data Value " is converted from the endian format of the target memory for return and returned to the Requester . The fields are in big-endian format on the wire .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote STag
description: o Remote STag
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Tagged Offset
description: o Remote Tagged Offset
:LABEL: field

name: Remote STag
description: o Remote STag
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Tagged Offset
description: o Remote Tagged Offset
:LABEL: field

name: Compare Data
description: o Compare Data
:LABEL: field

name: Compare Mask
description: The Responder returns :
:LABEL: field

name: Original Remote Data Value
description: The following pseudocode describes the masked CmpSwap operation result .
:LABEL: field

name: Compare Mask
description: Compare Mask ))
:LABEL: field

name: AOpCode
description: See Figure 5 . All Atomic Operation Codes from Figure 5 MUST be implemented by an RNIC that supports Atomic Operations .
:LABEL: field

name: Request Identifier
description: The Request Identifier specifies a number that is used to identify the Atomic Operation Request Message . The value used in this field is selected by the RNIC that sends the message   and it is reflected back to the Local Peer in the Atomic Operation Response message .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote STag
description: The Remote STag identifies the Remote Peer's Tagged Buffer targeted by the Atomic Operation . The Remote STag is associated with the RDMAP Stream through a mechanism that is outside the scope of the RDMAP specification .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Tagged Offset
description: The Remote Tagged Offset specifies the starting offset   in octets   from the base of the Remote Peer's Tagged Buffer targeted by the Atomic Operation . The Remote Tagged Offset MAY start at an arbitrary offset but MUST represent a ULP Buffer address that is 64-bit aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Add or Swap Data
description: The Add or Swap Data field specifies the 64-bit " Add Data " value in an Atomic FetchAdd Operation or the 64-bit " Swap Data " value in an Atomic Swap or CmpSwap Operation .
:LABEL: field

name: Add or Swap Mask
description: This field is used in masked Atomic Operations ( FetchAdd and CmpSwap ) to perform a bitwise logical AND operation as specified in the definition of these operations . For non - masked Atomic Operations ( Swap )  this field is set to ffffffffffffffffh on transmit and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Compare Data
description: The Compare Data field specifies the 64-bit " Compare Data " value in an Atomic CmpSwap Operation . For Atomic Operations FetchAdd and Atomic Swap   the Compare Data field is set to zero on transmit and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Compare Mask
description: This field is used in masked Atomic Operation CmpSwap to perform a bitwise logical AND operation as specified in the definition of these operations . For Atomic Operations FetchAdd and Swap   this field is set to ffffffffffffffffh on transmit and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Original Request Identifier
description: The Original Request Identifier is set to the value specified in the Request Identifier field that was originally provided in the corresponding Atomic Operation Request Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Original Remote Data Value
description: The Original Remote Value specifies the original 64-bit value stored at the ULP Buffer address targeted by the Atomic Operation .
:LABEL: field

name: Immediate Data
description: The Immediate Data operation is typically used in conjunction with an RDMA Write Operation to improve ULP processing efficiency . The efficiency is gained by causing an RDMA Completion to be generated immediately following the RDMA Write operation . This RDMA Completion delivers 8 bytes of Immediate Data at the Remote Peer . The combination of an RDMA Write Message followed by an Immediate Data Operation has the same behavior as the RDMA Write with Immediate Data operation found in InfiniBand . An Immediate Data operation that is not preceded by an RDMA Write operation causes an RDMA Completion .
:LABEL: field

name: Immediate Data
description: Immediate Data : 64 bits . 8 bytes of data transferred from the Data Source to an untagged Buffer at the Data Sink .
:LABEL: field

name: Immediate Data
description: 0x8   Immediate Data   this specification
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U-bit : MUST be 1 so that the TLV will be silently ignored by a recipient if it is unknown   according to the rules of [ RFC5036 ].
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: o F-bit : MUST be 0 as per Section 3 (" Specifying Capabilities in LDP Messages ") of LDP Capabilities [ RFC5561 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: o S-bit : MUST be 1 if used in LDP " Initialization " message . MAY be set to 0 or 1 in dynamic " Capability " message to advertise or withdraw the capability   respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o The encoding of the Typed Wildcard FEC element   as defined in [ RFC5918 ]  is defined in Section 4.1 (" Typed Wildcard FEC element ") of this document . The MT-ID field of the MT Typed Wildcard FEC element MUST be set to " Wildcard Topology " when it is specified in the MT Capability TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: MSB
description: MSB : Most Significant Byte of a 24-bit coded sample
:LABEL: field

name: MB
description: MB : Middle Byte of a 24-bit coded sample
:LABEL: field

name: LSB
description: LSB : Least Significant Byte of a 24-bit coded sample
:LABEL: field

name: flags
description: flags : Specifies flags providing additional information required by the server to process the DHCPv4 message encapsulated in the DHCPv4-query message   or required by the client to process a DHCPv4 message encapsulated in the DHCPv4-response message .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : Unicast flag . If set to 1   it indicates that the DHCPv4 message encapsulated within the DHCPv4-query message would be sent to a unicast address if it were sent using IPv4 . If this flag is set to 0   it indicates that the DHCPv4 message would be sent to the broadcast address if it were sent using IPv4 . The usage of the flag is described in detail in Section 8 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : Bits MUST be set to zero when sending and MUST be ignored when receiving .
:LABEL: field

name: MEL
description: o Maintenance Entity group Level ( MEL ): The MEL value to set and check MUST be configurable . The DEFAULT value MUST be " 111 ". With co-routed bidirectional transport paths   the configured MEL MUST be the same in both directions .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: o Version : 0x00
:LABEL: field

name: OpCode
description: o OpCode : 0x27 (= 0d39 )
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: o Flags : 0x00
:LABEL: field

name: TLV Offset
description: o TLV Offset : 4
:LABEL: field

name: End TLV
description: o End TLV : 0x00
:LABEL: field

name: Pr.Type
description: The four bits are used to specify the protection type .
:LABEL: field

name: A
