If the initiator wishes to make use of the transform optional to the responder   it includes a transform substructure with Transform ID = 0 as one of the options .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform ID
description: o Transform ID ( 2 octets ) - The specific instance of the Transform Type being proposed .
:LABEL: field

name: Transform Attributes
description: Transform Type 1 ( Encryption Algorithm ) transforms might include one transform attribute : Key Length .
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Type
description: o Attribute Type ( 15 bits ) - Unique identifier for each type of attribute ( see below ).
:LABEL: field

name: Attribute Value
description: o Attribute Value - Value of the attribute associated with the attribute type .
:LABEL: field

name: ID Type
description: o ID Type ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the type of Identification being used .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification Data
description: o Identification Data ( variable length ) - Value   as indicated by the Identification Type . The length of the Identification Data is computed from the size in the ID payload header .
:LABEL: field

name: Certificate Data
description: o Certificate Data ( variable length ) - Actual encoding of certificate data . The type of certificate is indicated by the Certificate Encoding field .
:LABEL: field

name: Auth Method
description: o Auth Method ( 1 octet ) - Specifies the method of authentication used .
:LABEL: field

name: Authentication Data
description: o Authentication Data ( variable length ) - see Section 2.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce Data
description: o Nonce Data ( variable length ) - Contains the random data generated by the transmitting entity .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o Protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - If this notification concerns an existing SA whose SPI is given in the SPI field   this field indicates the type of that SA . If the SPI field is empty   this field MUST be sent as zero and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the IPsec protocol ID or zero if no SPI is applicable . For a notification concerning the IKE SA   the SPI Size MUST be zero and the SPI field must be empty .
:LABEL: field

name: Notify Message Type
description: o Notify Message Type ( 2 octets ) - Specifies the type of notification message .
:LABEL: field

name: Notification Data
description: o Notification Data ( variable length ) - Status or error data transmitted in addition to the Notify Message Type . Values for this field are type specific .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of TSs
description: o Number of TSs ( 1 octet ) - Number of Traffic Selectors being provided .
:LABEL: field

name: TS Type
description: o IP protocol ID ( 1 octet ) - Value specifying an associated IP protocol ID ( such as UDP   TCP   and ICMP ). A value of zero means that the protocol ID is not relevant to this Traffic Selector -- the SA can carry all protocols .
:LABEL: field

name: Selector Length
description: o Selector Length - Specifies the length of this Traffic Selector substructure including the header .
:LABEL: field

name: Start Port
description: o Start Port ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Value specifying the smallest port number allowed by this Traffic Selector . For protocols for which port is undefined ( including protocol 0 )  or if all ports are allowed   this field MUST be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: End Port
description: o End Port ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Value specifying the largest port number allowed by this Traffic Selector . For protocols for which port is undefined ( including protocol 0 )  or if all ports are allowed   this field MUST be 65535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting Address
description: o Starting Address - The smallest address included in this Traffic Selector ( length determined by TS Type ).
:LABEL: field

name: Ending Address
description: o Ending Address - The largest address included in this Traffic Selector ( length determined by TS Type ).
:LABEL: field

name: Next Payload
description: o Next Payload - The payload type of the first embedded payload . Note that this is an exception in the standard header format   since the Encrypted payload is the last payload in the message; therefore   the Next Payload field would normally be zero . But because the content of this payload is embedded payloads and there was no natural place to put the type of the first one   that type is placed here .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: o Payload Length - Includes the lengths of the header   initialization vector ( IV )  Encrypted IKE payloads   Padding   Pad Length   and Integrity Checksum Data .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol ID
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the protocol ID . It MUST be zero for IKE ( SPI is in the message header ).
:LABEL: field

name: SPI Size
description: o SPI Size ( 1 octet ) - Length in octets of the SPI as defined by the protocol ID . It MUST be zero for IKE ( SPI is in the message header ).
:LABEL: field

name: Num of SPIs
description: o Num of SPIs ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - The number of SPIs contained in the Delete payload . This MUST be zero for IKE .
:LABEL: field

name: Field Type
description: A dedicated Field Type value is used to identify the Checksum Complement extension . See Section 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: The extension field includes a 22-octet MBZ ( MUST be zero ) field . This field MUST be set to 0 and MUST be ignored by the recipient . The MBZ field is used for padding the extension field to 28 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum Complement
description: The Checksum Complement extension includes the Checksum Complement field   residing in the last 2 octets of the extension .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port
description: Source Port Picked by originator of packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 4 Checksum Reference 2 describes rules for computing checksum . Field contains zero if unused .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: As described in [ RFC6929 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: As described in [ RFC6929 ].
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: As described in [ RFC6929 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: As described in [ RFC6929 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of option . Set to the value 30 ( 0x1E ) allocated for experimental work .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option in octets ( excluding the Option Type and Option Length fields ). Set to the value 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: res
description: These four bits are not used in the current specification . They are set to zero by the sender and are ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Pre-skip
description: There is some amount of latency introduced during the decoding process   to allow for overlap in the CELT mode   stereo mixing in the SILK mode   and resampling . The encoder might have introduced additional latency through its own resampling and analysis ( though the exact amount is not specified ). Therefore   the first few samples produced by the decoder do not correspond to real input audio   but are instead composed of padding inserted by the encoder to compensate for this latency . These samples need to be stored and decoded   as Opus is an asymptotically convergent predictive codec   meaning the decoded contents of each frame depend on the recent history of decoder inputs . However   a player will want to skip these samples after decoding them .
:LABEL: field

name: Pre-skip
description: This is the number of samples ( at 48 kHz ) to discard from the decoder output when starting playback   and also the number to subtract from a page's granule position to calculate its PCM sample position . When cropping the beginning of existing Ogg Opus streams   a pre-skip of at least 3 840 samples ( 80 ms ) is RECOMMENDED to ensure complete convergence in the decoder .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor String Length
description: This field gives the length of the following vendor string   in octets . It MUST NOT indicate that the vendor string is longer than the rest of the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: User Comment List Length
description: This field indicates the number of user-supplied comments . It MAY indicate there are zero user-supplied comments   in which case there are no additional fields in the packet . It MUST NOT indicate that there are so many comments that the comment string lengths would require more data than is available in the rest of the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: o Version ( 1 byte ): Indicates the BMP version . This is set to ' 3 ' for all messages defined in this specification . (' 1 ' and ' 2 ' were used by draft versions of this document .) Version 0 is reserved and MUST NOT be sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Length
description: o Message Length ( 4 bytes ): Length of the message in bytes ( including headers   data   and encapsulated messages   if any ).
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Type
description: o Peer Type ( 1 byte ): Identifies the type of peer . Currently   three types of peers are identified :
:LABEL: field

name: Peer Flags
description: o Peer Flags ( 1 byte ): These flags provide more information about the peer . The flags are defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Peer AS
description: o Peer AS : The Autonomous System number of the peer from which the encapsulated PDU was received . If a 16-bit AS number is stored in this field [ RFC6793 ]  it should be padded with zeroes in the 16 most significant bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Peer BGP ID
description: o Peer BGP ID : The BGP Identifier of the peer from which the encapsulated PDU was received .
:LABEL: field

name: Information Type
description: o Information Type ( 2 bytes ): Type of information provided . Defined types are :
:LABEL: field

name: Information Length
description: o Information Length ( 2 bytes ): The length of the following Information field   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Information Type
description: o Information Type ( 2 bytes ): Type of information provided . Defined types are :
:LABEL: field

name: Information Length
description: o Information Length ( 2 bytes ): The length of the following Information field   in bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Stat Type
description: o Stat Type ( 2 bytes ): Defines the type of the statistic carried in the Stat Data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Stat Len
description: This specification defines the following statistics . A BMP implementation MUST ignore unrecognized stat types on receipt   and likewise MUST ignore unexpected data in the Stat Data field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason 1 : The local system closed the session . Following the Reason is a BGP PDU containing a BGP NOTIFICATION message that would have been sent to the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason 2 : The local system closed the session . No notification message was sent . Following the reason code is a 2-byte field containing the code corresponding to the Finite State Machine ( FSM ) Event that caused the system to close the session ( see Section 8.1 of [ RFC4271 ]). Two bytes both set to 0 are used to indicate that no relevant Event code is defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason 3 : The remote system closed the session with a notification message . Following the Reason is a BGP PDU containing the BGP NOTIFICATION message as received from the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason 4 : The remote system closed the session without a notification message . This includes any unexpected termination of the transport session   so in some cases both the local and remote systems might consider this to apply .
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: o Reason 5 : Information for this peer will no longer be sent to the monitoring station for configuration reasons . This does not   strictly speaking   indicate that the peer has gone down   but it does indicate that the monitoring station will not receive updates for the peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Local Port
description: o Local Port : The local port number associated with the peering TCP session   or 0 if no TCP session actually exists ( see Section 8.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Port
description: o Remote Port : The remote port number associated with the peering TCP session   or 0 if no TCP session actually exists ( see Section 8.2 ). ( The remote address can be found in the Peer Address field of the fixed header .)
:LABEL: field

name: Sent OPEN Message
description: o Sent OPEN Message : The full OPEN message transmitted by the monitored router to its peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Received OPEN Message
description: o Received OPEN Message : The full OPEN message received by the monitored router from its peer .
:LABEL: field

name: Home Network Prefix
description: The following terms used in this document are defined in the Multiple Care-of Addresses Registration [ RFC5648 ] and Flow Bindings in Mobile IPv6 and Network Mobility ( NEMO ) Basic Support [ RFC6089 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: Home Network Prefix
description: A new flag ( L ) is included in the Home Network Prefix Option to indicate to the MAG whether the conveyed prefix has to be hosted on - link or not on the point-to-point interface with the MN . A prefix is hosted off-link for the flow mobility purposes defined in this document . The rest of the Home Network Prefix Option format remains the same as defined in [ RFC5213 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: The Off-link Home Network Prefix Flag is set to indicate to the MAG that the HNP conveyed in the option is not to be hosted on - link   but has to be considered for flow mobility purposes   and therefore added to the MAG routing table . If the flag is set to 0   the MAG assumes that the HNP has to be hosted on-link .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: A Video Loss Concealment Report Block is identified by the constant 34 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field indicates whether the reported metrics are interval   cumulative   or sampled metrics [ RFC6792 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: This field is used to identify the video loss concealment method type used at the receiver . The value is defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: These bits are reserved for future use . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see Section 4.2 of [ RFC6709 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Block Length
description: This field is in accordance with the definition in [ RFC3611 ]. In this report block   it MUST be set to 5 when V=10 and set to 4 when V=11 . The block MUST be discarded if the block length is set to a different value .
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Source
description: As defined in Section 4.1 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Impaired Duration
description: The total duration   expressed in units of RTP timestamp from the sending side of the reporting block   of video impaired by transmission loss before applying any loss concealment methods .
:LABEL: field

name: Concealed Duration
description: The total duration   expressed in units of RTP timestamp from the sending side of the reporting block   of concealed damaged video pictures on which the loss concealment method corresponding to the Video Loss Concealment Method Type is applied .
:LABEL: field

name: MIFP
description: Mean Impaired Frame Proportion is the mean proportion of each video frame impaired by loss before applying any loss concealment method during the interval   expressed as a fixed-point number with the binary point at the left edge of the field . It is calculated by summing the impaired proportion of each video frame and dividing by the number of frames during this period . The impaired proportion of each video frame is obtained by dividing the number of missing macroblocks from this video frame by the total macroblock number of the video frame   which is equivalent to multiplying the result of the division by 256   limiting the maximum value to 255 ( to avoid overflow )  and taking the integer part .
:LABEL: field

name: MCFP
description: Mean Concealed Frame Proportion is the mean proportion of each video frame to which loss concealment ( depicted as " V " in the definition of " Video Loss Concealment Method Type ") was applied during the interval   expressed as a fixed-point number with the binary point at the left edge of the field . It is calculated by summing the concealed proportion of each video frame and dividing by the number of frames during this period . The concealed proportion of each video frame is obtained by dividing the number of concealed macroblocks from this video frame by the total macroblock number of the video frame   which is equivalent to multiplying the result of the division by 256   limiting the maximum value to 255 ( to avoid overflow )  and taking the integer part .
:LABEL: field

name: FFSC
description: Fraction of Frames Subject to Concealment is calculated by dividing the number of frames to which loss concealment ( using Video Loss Concealment Method Type ) was applied by the total number of frames and expressing this value as a fixed-point number with the binary point at the left edge of the field . It is equivalent to multiplying the result of the division by 256   limiting the maximum value to 255 ( to avoid overflow )  and taking the integer part .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: These bits are reserved for future use . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see Section 4.2 of [ RFC6709 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: AFI
description: Address Family Identifier ( AFI ): Identity of the network-layer protocol reachability information being advertised [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: Topology Identifier ( TID ): A number that is used to mark prefixes as belonging to a specific sub-topology .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Type   Length   Value ( TLV ): An encoding format for information elements used in EIGRP messages to exchange information . Each TLV-formatted information element consists of three generic fields : Type identifying the nature of information carried in this element   Length describing the length of the entire TLV triplet   and Value carrying the actual information . The Value field may   itself   be internally structured; this depends on the actual type of the information element . This format allows for extensibility and backward compatibility .
:LABEL: field

name: Jitter
description: Use of Jitter-based Path Selection results in a path calculation with the lowest reported Jitter . Jitter is reported as the interval between the longest and shortest packet delivery and is expressed in microseconds . Higher values result in a higher aggregate metric when compared to those having lower Jitter calculations .
:LABEL: field

name: Jitter
description: o Jitter - accumulative o Energy - accumulative
:LABEL: field

name: Type high
description: Type high : 0x88 Type low :
:LABEL: field

name: Header Version
description: Header Version : EIGRP Packet Header Format version . Current Version is 2 . This field is not the same as the TLV Version field .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: Opcode : Indicates the type of the message . It will be one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum : Each packet will include a checksum for the entire contents of the packet . The checksum will be the standard ones ' complement of the ones ' complement sum . For purposes of computing the checksum   the value of the checksum field is zero . The packet is discarded if the packet checksum fails .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Defines special handling of the packet . There are currently four defined flag bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : Each packet that is transmitted will have a 32-bit sequence number that is unique with respect to a sending router . A value of 0 means that an acknowledgment is not required .
:LABEL: field

name: Acknowledgment Number
description: Acknowledgment Number : The 32-bit sequence number that is being acknowledged with respect to the receiver of the packet . If the value is 0   there is no acknowledgment present . A non-zero value can only be present in unicast-addressed packets . A HELLO packet with a non-zero ACK field should be decoded as an ACK packet rather than a HELLO packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Autonomous System Number
description: Autonomous System Number : 16-bit unsigned number of the sending system . This field is indirectly used as an authentication value . That is   a router that receives and accepts a packet from a neighbor must have the same AS number or the packet is ignored . The range of valid AS numbers is 1 through 65 535 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type Low
description: Type Low : 1 octet that defines the TLV Opcode; see TLV Definitions in Section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0001
description: This TLV is used in HELLO packets to convey the EIGRP metric coefficient values : noted as " K-values " as well as the Hold Time values . This TLV is also used in an initial UPDATE packet when a neighbor is discovered .
:LABEL: field

name: Hold Time
description: Hold Time : The amount of time in seconds that a receiving router should consider the sending neighbor valid . A valid neighbor is one that is able to forward packets and participates in EIGRP . A router that considers a neighbor valid will store all routing information advertised by the neighbor .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0002
description: This TLV may be used in any EIGRP packet and conveys the authentication type and data used . Routers receiving a mismatch in authentication shall discard the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x02
description: MD5 Authentication will use Auth Type code 0x02   and the Auth Data will be the MD5 Hash value .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x03
description: SHA2-256 Authentication will use Type code 0x03   and the Auth Data will be the 256-bit SHA2 [ 6 ] Hash value .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0003
description: This TLV is used for a sender to tell receivers to not accept packets with the CR-Flag set . This is used to order multicast and unicast addressed packets .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Length
description: Address Length : Number of octets for the address that follows . For IPv4   the value is 4 . For IPv6   it is 16 . For AppleTalk   the value is 4; for Novell IPX   the value is 10 ( both are no longer in use ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Address
description: Protocol Address : Neighbor address on interface in which the HELLO with SEQUENCE TLV is sent . Each address listed in the HELLO packet is a neighbor that should not enter Conditionally Received mode .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0004
description: Field Length Vender OS major version 1 Vender OS minor version 1 EIGRP major revision 1 EIGRP minor revision 1
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0005
description: The next multicast SEQUENCE TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0007
description: This TLV is used in HELLO packets to notify the list of neighbor(s ) the router has reset the adjacency . This TLV is used in HELLO packets to notify the list of neighbors that the router has reset the adjacency . This is used anytime a router needs to reset an adjacency   or signal an adjacency it is going down .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x0008
description: List of sub-topology identifiers   including the Base Topology   supported by the router .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field ----------- Source Withdraw ( Bit 0 ) - Indicates if the router that is the original source of the destination is withdrawing the route from the network or if the destination is lost due as a result of a network failure .
:LABEL: field

name: Scaled Delay
description: Scaled Delay : An administrative parameter assigned statically on a per-interface-type basis to represent the time it takes along an unloaded path . This is expressed in units of tens of microseconds divvied by 256 . A delay of 0xFFFFFFFF indicates an unreachable route .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU : The minimum MTU size for the path to the destination .
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Count
description: Reliability : The current error rate for the path   measured as an error percentage . A value of 255 indicates 100% reliability
:LABEL: field

name: Reliability
description: Reliability : The current error rate for the path   measured as an error percentage . A value of 255 indicates 100% reliability
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: Load : The load utilization of the path to the destination   measured as a percentage . A value of 255 indicates 100% load .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field : See Section 6.8.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Administrative Tag
description: Administrative Tag : A tag assigned by the network administrator that is untouched by EIGRP . This allows a network administrator to filter routes in other EIGRP border routers based on this value .
:LABEL: field

name: External Protocol Metric
description: External Protocol Metric : 32-bit value of the composite metric that resides in the routing table as learned by the foreign protocol . If the External Protocol is IGRP or another EIGRP routing process   the value can optionally be the composite metric or 0   and the metric information is stored in the metric section .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field : See Section 6.8.1
:LABEL: field

name: Subnet Mask Bit Count
description: Subnet Mask Bit Count : 8-bit value used to indicate the number of bits in the subnet mask . A value of 0 indicates the default network   and no address is present .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Destination
description: IPv4 Destination : The IPv4 address with which the community information should be stored .
:LABEL: field

name: Community Length
description: Community Length : A 2-octet unsigned number that indicates the length of the Community List . The length does not include the IPv4 Address   Reserved   or Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Community List
description: Community List : One or more 8-octet EIGRP communities   as defined in Section 6.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Community Length
description: Community Length : A 2-octet unsigned number that indicates the length of the Community List . The length does not include the IPv6 Address   Reserved   or Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Community List
description: Community List : One or more 8-octet EIGRP communities   as defined in Section 6.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset : Number of 16-bit words in the Extended Attribute section that are used to determine the start of the destination information . A value of zero indicates no Extended Attributes are attached .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: Priority : Priority of the prefix when processing a route . In an AS using priority values   a destination with a higher priority receives preferential treatment and is serviced before a destination with a lower priority . A value of zero indicates no priority is set .
:LABEL: field

name: Reliability
description: Reliability : The current error rate for the path . Measured as an error percentage . A value of 255 indicates 100% reliability
:LABEL: field

name: Load
description: Load : The load utilization of the path to the destination   measured as a percentage . A value of 255 indicates 100% load .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: MTU : The minimum MTU size for the path to the destination . Not used in metric calculation but available to underlying protocols
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Count
description: Delay : The one-way latency along an unloaded path to the destination expressed in units of picoseconds per kilobit . This number is not scaled; a value of 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF indicates an unreachable route .
:LABEL: field

name: Delay
description: Delay : The one-way latency along an unloaded path to the destination expressed in units of picoseconds per kilobit . This number is not scaled; a value of 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF indicates an unreachable route .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Opaque Flags : 16-bit protocol-specific flags . Values currently defined by Cisco are :
:LABEL: field

name: Opaque Flags
description: Opaque Flags : 16-bit protocol-specific flags . Values currently defined by Cisco are :
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: Offset : Number of 16-bit words in the application-specific information . Offset does not include the length of the Opcode or Offset .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset : Number of 16-bit words in the application-specific information . Offset does not include the length of the Opcode or Offset .
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: Data : Zero or more octets of data as defined by Opcode .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x00
description: This is used to pad the attribute section to ensure 32-bit alignment of the metric encoding section .
:LABEL: field

name: Opcode
description: Opcode : Transmitted as zero ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset : Transmitted as zero ( 0 ) indicating no data is present .
:LABEL: field

name: Data
description: Data : No data is present with this attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x01
description: If a route is received from a back-rev neighbor   and the route is selected as the best path   the scaled metric received in the older UPDATE may be attached to the packet . If received   the value is for informational purposes and is not affected by K6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Scaled Bandwidth : The minimum bandwidth along a path expressed in units of 2 560 000 000/kbps . A bandwidth of 0xFFFFFFFF indicates an unreachable route .
:LABEL: field

name: Scaled Delay
description: Scaled Delay : An administrative parameter assigned statically on a per-interface-type basis to represent the time it takes along an unloaded path . This is expressed in units of tens of microseconds divvied by 256 . A delay of 0xFFFFFFFF indicates an unreachable route .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x02
description: EIGRP administrative tag does not alter the path decision-making process . Routers can set a tag value on a route and use the flags to apply specific routing polices within their network .
:LABEL: field

name: Administrator Tag
description: Administrator Tag : A tag assigned by the network administrator that is untouched by EIGRP . This allows a network administrator to filter routes in other EIGRP border routers based on this value .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x03
description: EIGRP communities themselves do not alter the path decision-making process   communities can be used as flags in order to mark a set of routes . Upstream routers can then use these flags to apply specific routing polices within their network .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Community List : One or more 8-octet EIGRP communities   as defined in Section 6.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Community List
description: Community List : One or more 8-octet EIGRP communities   as defined in Section 6.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x04
description: ( Optional ) EIGRP can carry one-way Jitter in networks that carry UDP traffic if the node is capable of measuring UDP Jitter . The Jitter reported to will be averaged with any existing Jitter data and include in the route updates . If no Jitter value is reported by the peer for a given destination   EIGRP will use the locally collected value .
:LABEL: field

name: Jitter
description: Jitter : The measure of the variability over time of the latency across a network measured in measured in microseconds .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x05
description: ( Optional ) EIGRP can carry energy usage by nodes in networks if the node is capable of measuring energy . The Quiescent Energy reported will be added to any existing energy data and include in the route updates . If no energy data is reported by the peer for a given destination   EIGRP will use the locally collected value .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x06
description: ( Optional ) EIGRP can carry energy usage by nodes in networks if the node is capable of measuring energy . The active Energy reported will be added to any existing energy data and include in the route updates . If no energy data is reported by the peer for a given destination   EIGRP will use the locally collected value .
:LABEL: field

name: 0x07
description: The Add Path enables EIGRP to advertise multiple best paths to adjacencies . There will be up to a maximum of four AddPaths supported   where the format of the field will be as follows .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: AddPath : Length of this field will vary in length based on whether it contains IPv4 or IPv6 data .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field : See Section 6.8.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field : See Section 6.8.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: External Protocol Metric
description: External Protocol Metric : A 32-bit value of the metric used by the routing table as learned by the foreign protocol . If the External Protocol is IGRP or EIGRP   the value can ( optionally ) be 0   and the metric information is stored in the metric section .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags Field
description: Flags Field : See Section 6.8.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Subnet Mask Bit Count
description: Subnet Mask Bit Count : 8-bit value used to indicate the number of bits in the subnet mask . A value of 0 indicates the default network and no address is present .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length - This field represents the total length of the discriminator(s ) that appears in the Value field   in octets . Each discriminator is 4 octets   so the Length is four times the number of discriminators included in the TLV . There is no optional padding for this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length - This field represents the total length of the discriminator(s ) that appears in the Value field   in octets . Each discriminator is 4 octets   so the Length is four times the number of discriminators included in the TLV . There is no optional padding for this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The length depending on the Address Family ( IPv4 or IPv6 ) of the Encoded-Unicast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length depending on the Address Family ( IPv4 or IPv6 ) of the Encoded-Unicast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value : Encoded-Unicast address . This SHOULD be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address of an upstream router .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  and its usage in the IRO subobject is defined in [ RFC7896 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : 8 ( total length of the subobject in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 ( total length of the subobject in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: AS Number : The 4-byte AS number . Note that if 2-byte AS numbers are in use   the low-order bits ( 16 through 31 ) MUST be used   and the high-order bits ( 0 through 15 ) MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  and its usage in the IRO subobject is defined in [ RFC7896 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 6 ( indicating a 4-byte OSPF Area ID ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 ( total length of the subobject in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Zero at transmission; ignored at receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  and its usage in the IRO subobject is defined in [ RFC7896 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Variable . The length MUST be at least 8 and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable . The length MUST be at least 8 and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: IS-IS Area ID : The variable-length IS-IS area identifier . Padded with trailing zeroes to a 4-byte boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  i.e .  it's set if the subobject represents a loose hop in the explicit route . If the bit is not set   the subobject represents a strict hop in the explicit route .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5 ( indicating a 4-byte AS number ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 ( total length of the subobject in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: AS Number : The 4-byte AS number . Note that if 2-byte AS numbers are in use   the low-order bits ( 16 through 31 ) MUST be used   and the high-order bits ( 0 through 15 ) MUST be set to zero . For the purpose of this experiment   it is advised to use a 4-byte AS number subobject as the default .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 6 ( indicating a 4-byte OSPF Area ID ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8 ( total length of the subobject in bytes ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Zero at transmission; ignored at receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L bit is an attribute of the subobject as defined in [ RFC3209 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Variable . The length MUST be at least 8 and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Variable . The length MUST be at least 8 and MUST be a multiple of 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: IS-IS Area ID : The variable-length IS-IS area identifier . Padded with trailing zeroes to a 4-byte boundary .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: The Version field indicates the format of the internet header . This document describes version 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: IHL
description: Internet Header Length is the length of the internet header in 32 bit words   and thus points to the beginning of the data . Note that the minimum value for a correct header is 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type of Service
description: The Type of Service provides an indication of the abstract parameters of the quality of service desired . These parameters are to be used to guide the selection of the actual service parameters when transmitting a datagram through a particular network . Several networks offer service precedence   which somehow treats high precedence traffic as more important than other traffic ( generally by accepting only traffic above a certain precedence at time of high load ). The major choice is a three way tradeoff between low-delay   high-reliability   and high-throughput .
:LABEL: field

name: Total Length
description: Total Length is the length of the datagram   measured in octets   including internet header and data . This field allows the length of a datagram to be up to 65 535 octets . Such long datagrams are impractical for most hosts and networks . All hosts must be prepared to accept datagrams of up to 576 octets ( whether they arrive whole or in fragments ). It is recommended that hosts only send datagrams larger than 576 octets if they have assurance that the destination is prepared to accept the larger datagrams .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: An identifying value assigned by the sender to aid in assembling the fragments of a datagram .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Various Control Flags .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: This field indicates where in the datagram this fragment belongs .
:LABEL: field

name: Time to Live
description: This field indicates the maximum time the datagram is allowed to remain in the internet system . If this field contains the value zero   then the datagram must be destroyed . This field is modified in internet header processing . The time is measured in units of seconds   but since every module that processes a datagram must decrease the TTL by at least one even if it process the datagram in less than a second   the TTL must be thought of only as an upper bound on the time a datagram may exist . The intention is to cause undeliverable datagrams to be discarded   and to bound the maximum datagram lifetime .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: This field indicates the next level protocol used in the data portion of the internet datagram . The values for various protocols are specified in " Assigned Numbers " [ 9 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Header Checksum
description: A checksum on the header only . Since some header fields change ( e.g .  time to live )  this is recomputed and verified at each point that the internet header is processed .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: The source address . See section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: The destination address . See section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: The options may appear or not in datagrams . They must be implemented by all IP modules ( host and gateways ). What is optional is their transmission in any particular datagram   not their implementation .
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: The internet header padding is used to ensure that the internet header ends on a 32 bit boundary . The padding is zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: The choice of the Identifier for a datagram is based on the need to provide a way to uniquely identify the fragments of a particular datagram . The protocol module assembling fragments judges fragments to belong to the same datagram if they have the same source   destination   protocol   and Identifier . Thus   the sender must choose the Identifier to be unique for this source   destination pair and protocol for the time the datagram ( or any fragment of it ) could be alive in the internet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type of Service
description: The type of service ( TOS ) is for internet service quality selection . The type of service is specified along the abstract parameters precedence   delay   throughput   and reliability . These abstract parameters are to be mapped into the actual service parameters of the particular networks the datagram traverses .
:LABEL: field

name: Time to Live
description: The time to live is set by the sender to the maximum time the datagram is allowed to be in the internet system . If the datagram is in the internet system longer than the time to live   then the datagram must be destroyed .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: The options are optional in each datagram   but required in implementations . That is   the presence or absence of an option is the choice of the sender   but each internet module must be able to parse every option . There can be several options present in the option field .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 21 ( Node-Admin-Tag )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : An 8-bit field that indicates the length of the Value portion in octets; this will be a multiple of 4 octets   depending on the number of tags advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 = net unreachable;
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 = time to live exceeded in transit;
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 = pointer indicates the error .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Pointer
description: If code = 0   identifies the octet where an error was detected .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 = Redirect datagrams for the Network .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Internet Address
description: Address of the gateway to which traffic for the network specified in the internet destination network field of the original datagram's data should be sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8 for echo message;
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . If the total length is odd   the received data is padded with one octet of zeros for computing the checksum . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: If code = 0   an identifier to aid in matching echos and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: If code = 0   a sequence number to aid in matching echos and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 13 for timestamp message;
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: If code = 0   an identifier to aid in matching timestamp and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: If code = 0   a sequence number to aid in matching timestamp and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 15 for information request message;
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit ones's complement of the one's complement sum of the ICMP message starting with the ICMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero . This checksum may be replaced in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: If code = 0   an identifier to aid in matching request and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: If code = 0   a sequence number to aid in matching request and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port
description: The source port number .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port
description: The destination port number .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: The sequence number of the first data octet in this segment ( except when SYN is present ). If SYN is present the sequence number is the initial sequence number ( ISN ) and the first data octet is ISN+1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Acknowledgment Number
description: If the ACK control bit is set this field contains the value of the next sequence number the sender of the segment is expecting to receive . Once a connection is established this is always sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Offset
description: The number of 32 bit words in the TCP Header . This indicates where the data begins . The TCP header ( even one including options ) is an integral number of 32 bits long .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved for future use . Must be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: URG
description: URG : Urgent Pointer field significant ACK : Acknowledgment field significant PSH : Push Function RST : Reset the connection SYN : Synchronize sequence numbers FIN : No more data from sender
:LABEL: field

name: Window
description: The number of data octets beginning with the one indicated in the acknowledgment field which the sender of this segment is willing to accept .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum field is the 16 bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of all 16 bit words in the header and text . If a segment contains an odd number of header and text octets to be checksummed   the last octet is padded on the right with zeros to form a 16 bit word for checksum purposes . The pad is not transmitted as part of the segment . While computing the checksum   the checksum field itself is replaced with zeros .
:LABEL: field

name: Urgent Pointer
description: This field communicates the current value of the urgent pointer as a positive offset from the sequence number in this segment . The urgent pointer points to the sequence number of the octet following the urgent data . This field is only be interpreted in segments with the URG control bit set .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options may occupy space at the end of the TCP header and are a multiple of 8 bits in length . All options are included in the checksum . An option may begin on any octet boundary . There are two cases for the format of an option :
:LABEL: field

name: Padding
description: The TCP header padding is used to ensure that the TCP header ends and data begins on a 32 bit boundary . The padding is composed of zeros .
:LABEL: field

name: SYN
description: SYN-SENT - represents waiting for a matching connection request after having sent a connection request .
:LABEL: field

name: SYN
description: SYN-RECEIVED - represents waiting for a confirming connection request acknowledgment after having both received and sent a connection request .
:LABEL: field

name: FIN
description: FIN-WAIT-1 - represents waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP   or an acknowledgment of the connection termination request previously sent .
:LABEL: field

name: FIN
description: FIN-WAIT-2 - represents waiting for a connection termination request from the remote TCP .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: For OSPFv3 over IPv4   the source address is the primary IPv4 address for the interface over which the packet is transmitted . All OSPFv3 routers on the link should share the same IPv4 subnet for IPv4 transport to function correctly .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: As defined in OSPFv2   the IPv4 destination address of an OSPF protocol packet is either an IPv4 multicast address or the IPv4 unicast address of an OSPFv2 neighbor . Two well-known link-local multicast addresses are assigned to OSPFv2   the AllSPFRouters address ( 224.0.0.5 ) and the AllDRouters address ( 224.0.0.6 ). The multicast address used depends on the OSPF packet type   the OSPF interface type   and the OSPF router's role on multi-access networks .
:LABEL: field

name: Tenant ID
description: Tenant ID : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Tenant ID
description: Tenant ID : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Set to the TENANT-GWMAC-LABEL sub-TLV type ( 7 ). 2 bytes   because this APPsub-TLV appears in an extended TLV [ RFC7356 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : If the Label1 field is used to represent a VLAN   the value of the Length field is 12 . If the Label1 and Label2 fields are used to represent an FGL   the value of the Length field is 14 .
:LABEL: field

name: Tenant ID
description: o Tenant ID : This identifies a Tenant ID unique across the TRILL campus .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Set to the IPV4-PREFIX sub-TLV type ( 8 ). 2 bytes   because this APPsub-TLV appears in an extended TLV [ RFC7356 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Total Length
description: o Total Length : This 2-byte unsigned integer indicates the total length of the Tenant ID   Prefix Length   and Prefix fields   in octets . A value of 0 indicates that no IPv4 prefix is being advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Tenant ID
description: o Tenant ID : This identifies a Tenant ID unique across the TRILL campus .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Set to the IPV6-PREFIX sub-TLV type ( 9 ). 2 bytes   because this APPsub-TLV appears in an extended TLV [ RFC7356 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Total Length
description: o Total Length : This 2-byte unsigned integer indicates the total length of the Tenant ID   Prefix Length   and Prefix fields   in octets . A value of 0 indicates that no IPv6 prefix is being advertised .
:LABEL: field

name: Tenant ID
description: o Tenant ID : This identifies a Tenant ID unique across the TRILL campus .
:LABEL: field

name: SZX
description: o the size of the block ( SZX );
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: o the relative number of the block ( NUM ) within a sequence of blocks with the given size .
:LABEL: field

name: NUM
description: NUM : Block Number   indicating the block number being requested or provided . Block number 0 indicates the first block of a body ( i.e .  starting with the first byte of the body ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: M : More Flag (" not last block "). For descriptive usage   this flag   if unset   indicates that the payload in this message is the last block in the body; when set   it indicates that there are one or more additional blocks available . When a Block2 Option is used in a request to retrieve a specific block number (" control usage ")  the M bit MUST be sent as zero and ignored on reception . ( In a Block1 Option in a response   the M flag is used to indicate atomicity   see below .)
:LABEL: field

name: SZX
description: SZX : Block Size . The block size is represented as a three-bit unsigned integer indicating the size of a block to the power of two . Thus   block size = 2**(SZX + 4 ). The allowed values of SZX are 0 to 6   i.e .  the minimum block size is 2**(0+4 ) = 16 and the maximum is 2**(6+4 ) = 1024 . The value 7 for SZX ( which would indicate a block size of 2048 ) is reserved   i.e .  MUST NOT be sent and MUST lead to a 4.00 Bad Request response code upon reception in a request .
:LABEL: field

name: AFN
description: AFN : Address Family Number ( http://www.iana.org/assignments/address-family-numbers /)
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: Nickname : A 16-bit TRILL switch identifier   as specified in Section 3.7 of [ RFC6325 ] and as updated by Section 4 of [ RFC7780 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Variable; minimum 7 . If Length is 6 or less or if the APPsub-TLV extends beyond the size of an encompassing TRILL GENINFO TLV or other context   the APPsub-TLV MUST be ignored . For manageability   a counter reflecting the receipt of such malformed IA APPsub-TLVs should be maintained .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr Sets End
description: o Addr Sets End : The unsigned integer byte number   within the IA APPsub-TLV value part   of the last byte of the last Address Set   where the first byte is numbered 1 . This will be the number of the byte just before the first sub-sub-TLV if any sub-sub-TLVs are present ( see Section 3 ). The processing is as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : The nickname ( see Section 1.1 ) of the TRILL switch by which the Address Sets are reachable . If 0   the Address Sets are reachable from the TRILL switch originating the message containing the APPsub-TLV ( for example   an ESADI [ RFC7357 ] message ).
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: D : Directory flag : If D is 1   the APPsub-TLV contains directory information [ RFC7067 ].
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : Directory flag : If D is 1   the APPsub-TLV contains directory information [ RFC7067 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : Local flag : If L is 1   the APPsub-TLV contains information learned locally by observing ingressed frames [ RFC6325 ]. ( Both D and L can be set to 1 in the same IA APPsub-TLV if a TRILL switch had learned an address locally and also advertised it as a directory .)
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: RESV : Additional reserved flag bits that MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Confidence
description: o Confidence : This 8-bit unsigned quantity in the range 0 to 254 indicates the confidence level in the addresses being transported ( see Section 4.8.2 of [ RFC6325 ]). A value of 255 is treated as if it was 254 .
:LABEL: field

name: AFN
description: o AFN : A 2-byte Address Family Number . The number of AFNs present is given by K   except that there are no AFNs if K is greater than 31 . The AFN sequence specifies the structure of the Address Sets occurring later in the TLV . For example   if the Template size is 2 and the two AFNs present are the AFNs for a 48-bit MAC and an IPv4 address   in that order   then each Address Set present will consist of a 6-byte MAC address followed by a 4-byte IPv4 address . If any AFNs are present that are unknown to the receiving IS and the length of the corresponding address is not provided by a sub-sub-TLV as specified below   the receiving IS will be unable to parse the Address Sets and MUST ignore the IA APPsub-TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 3*N   where N is the number of AFN Size Records present . If Length is not a multiple of 3   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: AFN
description: o AFN : The AFN whose length is being specified by the AFN Size Record .
:LABEL: field

name: AdrSize
description: o AdrSize : The length   in bytes   of addresses specified by the AFN field as an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Variable; minimum 2 . If Length is 0 or 1   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: AFN
description: o Fixed Address : The address of the Type indicated by the preceding AFN field that is considered to be part of every Address Set in the IA APPsub-TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 2 or 3 . If Length is some other value   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 2 . If Length is some other value   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o RESV : 4 reserved bits . MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Topology
description: o Topology : The 12-bit topology number [ RFC5120 ].
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C ( Co-routed path ) bit : This bit informs the remote T-PE/S-PEs about the properties of the underlying LSPs . When set   the remote T-PE/S-PEs SHOULD select the co-routed LSP ( as the forwarding tunnel ) as the reverse PSN tunnel . If there is no such tunnel available   it may trigger the remote T-PE/S-PEs to establish a new LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S ( Strict ) bit : This bit instructs the PEs with respect to the handling of the underlying LSPs . When set   the remote PE MUST use the tunnel/LSP specified in the PSN Tunnel Sub-TLV as the PSN tunnel on the reverse direction of the PW   or the PW will fail to be established .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T ( Tunnel Representation ) bit : This bit indicates the format of the LSP tunnels . When the bit is set   the tunnel uses the tunnel information to identify itself   and the LSP Number fields in the PSN Tunnel sub-TLV ( Section 3.1.1 ) MUST be set to zero . Otherwise   both the tunnel and LSP information of the PSN tunnel are required . The default is set . The motivation for the T-bit is to support the MPLS protection operation where the LSP Number fields may be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: PSN Tunnel Sub-TLV
description: PSN Tunnel Sub-TLVs are designed for inclusion in the PSN Tunnel Binding TLV to specify the tunnel/LSPs to which a PW is required to bind .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: If the Label Mapping message is for the forward direction   and S-PE1 accepts the requested tunnel/LSPs from T-PE1   S-PE1 MUST save the tunnel/LSP information for reverse-direction processing later on . If the PSN Binding request is not acceptable   S-PE1 MUST reply with a Label Release Message to the upstream PE ( T-PE1 ) with the status code set to " Reject - unable to use the suggested tunnel/LSPs " ( 0x0000003B ).
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 6*n bytes   where there are n Tree-VLAN RECORDs . Thus   the value of Length can be used to determine n . If Length is not a multiple of 6   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : The nickname identifying the distribution tree by its root .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o Start.VLAN   End.VLAN : These fields are the VLAN IDs of the allowed VLAN range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single VLAN   the VLAN's ID appears as both the start and end VLAN . If End.VLAN is less than Start.VLAN   the Tree-VLAN RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Start.VLAN
description: o Start.VLAN   End.VLAN : These fields are the VLAN IDs of the allowed VLAN range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single VLAN   the VLAN's ID appears as both the start and end VLAN . If End.VLAN is less than Start.VLAN   the Tree-VLAN RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: End.VLAN
description: o Start.VLAN   End.VLAN : These fields are the VLAN IDs of the allowed VLAN range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single VLAN   the VLAN's ID appears as both the start and end VLAN . If End.VLAN is less than Start.VLAN   the Tree-VLAN RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 8*n bytes   where there are n Tree-FGL RECORDs . Thus   the value of Length can be used to determine n . If Length is not a multiple of 8   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : The nickname identifying the distribution tree by its root .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o Start.FGL   End.FGL : These fields are the FGL IDs of the allowed FGL range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single FGL   the FGL's ID appears as both the start and end FGL . If End.FGL is less than Start.FGL   the Tree-FGL RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Start.FGL
description: o Start.FGL   End.FGL : These fields are the FGL IDs of the allowed FGL range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single FGL   the FGL's ID appears as both the start and end FGL . If End.FGL is less than Start.FGL   the Tree-FGL RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: End.FGL
description: o Start.FGL   End.FGL : These fields are the FGL IDs of the allowed FGL range on the tree   inclusive . To specify a single FGL   the FGL's ID appears as both the start and end FGL . If End.FGL is less than Start.FGL   the Tree-FGL RECORD MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 2 + the length of the Group Sub-Sub TLVs that are included .
:LABEL: field

name: Nickname
description: o Nickname : The nickname identifying the distribution tree by its root .
:LABEL: field

name: SubERR
description: SubERR : This field provides further details when an error is indicated in the RBridge Channel ERR field . If ERR is zero   then SubERR MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt . See Section 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: RESV4 : This field MUST be sent as zero . If non-zero when received   this is an error condition . See Section 5 .
:LABEL: field

name: SType
description: SType : This field describes the type of security information and features   including keying material   being used or provided by the extended RBridge Channel message . See Section 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: PType
description: PType : Payload Type . This describes the tunneled data . See Section 3 .
:LABEL: field

name: PType
description: PType Description Reference ----- ----------- --------- 0 Reserved 1 Null Section 3.1 of RFC 7978 2 Ethertyped Payload Section 3.2 of RFC 7978 3 Ethernet Frame Section 3.3 of RFC 7978 4-14 Unassigned 15 Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: SType
description: SType Description Reference ----- ----------- --------- 0 None Section 4.2 of RFC 7978 1 IS-IS CRYPTO_AUTH-Based Section 4.3 of RFC 7978 Authentication 2 DTLS Pairwise Security Section 4.4 of RFC 7978 3 Composite Security Section 4.5 of RFC 7978 4-14 Unassigned 15 Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o RESV : Four bits that MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Size
description: o Key ID : specifies the keying value and authentication algorithm that the Key ID specifies for TRILL IS-IS LSP [ RFC5310 ] Authentication TLVs . The keying material actually used is always derived as shown in Section 4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key ID
description: o Key ID : specifies the keying value and authentication algorithm that the Key ID specifies for TRILL IS-IS LSP [ RFC5310 ] Authentication TLVs . The keying material actually used is always derived as shown in Section 4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Req
description: Req : Number of times the request is transmitted with the same transaction ID to the server .
:LABEL: field

name: Resp
description: Resp : Number of times a response with the same transaction ID is sent from the server . MUST be set to zero in requests and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 8 bits )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length field contains the total length of the subobject in octets   including the Type and Length fields . The Length depends on the number of SRLG IDs .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This 15-bit field is reserved . It SHOULD be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 768 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . CERT group Group ID grouping multiple related CERT parameters . CERT count Total count of certificates that are sent   possibly in several consecutive HIP control packets . CERT ID The sequence number for this certificate . CERT Type Indicates the type of the certificate . Padding Any Padding   if necessary   to make the TLV a multiple of 8 bytes . Any added padding bytes MUST be zeroed by the sender   and their values SHOULD NOT be checked by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Certificate
description: Certificate : Data : Version : 3 ( 0x2 ) Serial Number : 12705268244493839545 ( 0xb0522e27291b2cb9 ) Signature Algorithm : sha256WithRSAEncryption Issuer : DC=Example   DC=com   CN=Example issuing host Validity Not Before : Feb 25 11:28:29 2016 GMT Not After : Feb 24 11:28:29 2017 GMT Subject : DC=Example   DC=com   CN=Example issuing host Subject Public Key Info : Public Key Algorithm : rsaEncryption Public-Key : ( 2048 bit ) Modulus : 00:c9:b0:85:94:af:1f:3a:77:39:c9:d5:81:a5:ee : d2:b5:6b:72:91:5d:22:2c:1e:59:e5:06:29:bd:a2 : 19:f6:ac:ca:eb:f7:88:d8:54:55:41:01:58:d8:87 : 64:d8:c8:cf:6e:c2:38:81:22:1a:ae:e9:a6:80:22 : 03:ee:f3:1b:7e:68:11:e3:f4:7b:98:33:28:bf:40 : ec:4f:19:e8:10:8a:8b:07:60:f7:9f:e4:82:f8:a7 : 58:04:3d:42:07:c8:34:ca:99:6d:11:eb:73:c1:d9 : 96:93:55:e5:c7:ed:80:4f:8a:f2:1a:6f:83:c8:15 : a4:8f:b8:6a:fe:f3:4f:49:1a:5c:1f:89:bb:30:e6 : 98:bc:ce:a3:a2:37:85:b1:79:1c:26:e6:44:0c:b9 : 3e:d8:37:81:46:f4:02:25:46:a2:ea:da:25:5c:46 : a2:a3:c5:58:80:53:1f:c5:e5:11:a0:da:d8:f2:ad : d6:98:d4:ce:55:35:cc:0b:d3:5b:09:48:ef:57:65 : 80:cb:65:79:fd:cb:4d:5b:b3:8d:1a:ff:2a:58:3e : 96:65:10:3e:04:81:78:2b:d5:ca:89:78:ea:28:5c : bc:02:4a:54:cd:aa:a9:99:8d:d6:39:e9:5e:a9:73 : 1a:5d:93:55:39:9b:72:1a:c2:a0:1f:e3:4c:b0:41 : 98:97 Exponent : 65537 ( 0x10001 ) X509v3 extensions : X509v3 Subject Alternative Name : IP Address:2001:27:DCFC:CB8:F885:D53F:4E63:48B7 X509v3 Issuer Alternative Name : IP Address:2001:2D:F878:64C1:67E3:9716:88BD:68E4
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 930 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Min Lifetime Minimum registration lifetime . Max Lifetime Maximum registration lifetime . Reg Type The registration types offered by the registrar .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 932 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Lifetime Requested registration lifetime . Reg Type The preferred registration types in order of preference .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 934 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Lifetime Granted registration lifetime . Reg Type The granted registration types in order of preference .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 936 Length Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding . Failure Type Reason for failure . Reg Type The registration types that failed with the specified reason .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65500 Length Variable . Length in octets   excluding Type   Length   and Padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65498 Length 16 Address An IPv6 address or an IPv4-in-IPv6 format IPv4 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 65502 Length Variable Address An IPv6 address or an IPv4-in-IPv6 format IPv4 address .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: o Label-Based Load Balancer : An LSR that load balances on an entropy label from an MPLS label stack ( i.e .  flow label or entropy label ) and does not consider fields from an IP header ( and possibly fields from upper layers ) for load-balancing purposes .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: o Label and IP-Based Load Balancer : An LSR that load balances on both entropy labels from an MPLS label stack and fields from an IP header ( and possibly fields from upper layers ).
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E ELI/EL push indicator This flag MUST be cleared in the echo request . An LSR that pushes ELI/EL MUST set this flag in the echo reply . An LSR that does not push ELI/EL MUST NOT set this flag in the echo reply .
:LABEL: field

name: IPMultipathType
description: * 0 when " IP Multipath Information " is omitted . Otherwise   one of the IP Multipath Information values : { 2   4   8 }.
:LABEL: field

name: LbMultipathType
description: * 0 when the " Label Multipath Information " is omitted . Otherwise   the Label Multipath Information value { 9 }.
:LABEL: field

name: Bursts
description: The terms " burst " and " gap " are used in a manner consistent with that of RTCP XR [ RFC3611 ]. RTCP XR views an RTP stream as being divided into bursts   which are periods during which the discard rate is high enough to cause noticeable quality degradation ( generally a discard rate over 5 percent )  and gaps   which are periods during which discarded packets are infrequent   and hence quality is generally acceptable .
:LABEL: field

name: BT
description: An Independent Burst/Gap Discard Metrics Block is identified by the constant 35 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: This field is used to indicate whether the burst/gap discard metrics are Sampled   Interval   or Cumulative metrics [ RFC6792 ]:
:LABEL: field

name: resv
description: These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to zero by senders and ignored by receivers ( see [ RFC6709 ]  Section 4.2 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SSRC of Source
description: As defined in Section 4 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Threshold
description: The Threshold is equivalent to Gmin in [ RFC3611 ]  i.e .  the number of successive packets that have to be received prior to   and following   a discarded packet in order for that discarded packet to be regarded as part of a gap . Note that the Threshold is set in accordance with the Gmin calculation defined in Section 4.7.2 of [ RFC3611 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Packets Discarded in Bursts
description: The total number of packets discarded during discard bursts   as defined in Section 3.2 of [ RFC7002 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Total Packets Expected in Bursts
description: The total number of packets expected during the discard bursts ( that is   the sum of received packets and lost packets ). The metric is defined in [ RFC7003 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Discard Count
description: Number of packets discarded over the period ( Interval or Cumulative ) covered by this report   as defined in Section 3.2 of [ RFC7002 ].
:LABEL: field

name: PRF
description: o PRF ( 2 octets ) -- Transform ID of the PRF algorithm that MUST be used to solve the puzzle . Readers should refer to the " Transform Type 2 - Pseudorandom Function Transform IDs " subregistry on [ IKEV2-IANA ] for the list of possible values .
:LABEL: field

name: Difficulty
description: o Difficulty ( 1 octet ) -- Difficulty level of the puzzle . Specifies the minimum number of trailing zero bits ( ZBC ) that each of the results of PRF must contain . Value 0 means that the Responder doesn't request any specific difficulty level   and the Initiator is free to select an appropriate difficulty level on its own ( see Section 7.1.1.1 for details ).
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U and F bits : both are set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : length of the TLV in octets excluding the U-bit   F-bit   Type   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol Version
description: o Protocol Version : the version of this PON-specific protocol for the purposes of inter-chassis communication . This is set to 0x0001 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Optional Sub-TLVs : there are no optional Sub-TLVs defined for this version of the protocol . The structure of optional Sub-TLVs is defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : length of the TLV in octets   excluding the U-bit   F-bit   Type   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U and F bits : both are set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : length of the TLV in octets excluding the U-bit   F-bit   Type   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U and F bits : both are set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : length of the TLV in octets excluding the U-bit   F-bit   Type   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: System ID
description: o System ID : 8 octets encoding the System ID used by the OLT   which is the chassis Media Access Control ( MAC ) address . If a 6-octet System ID is used   the least significant 2 octets of the 8-octet field will be encoded as 0000 .
:LABEL: field

name: System Priority
description: o System Priority : a 2-octet value assigned by management or administration policy; the OLT with the numerically lower value of System Priority has the higher priority .
:LABEL: field

name: Port ID
description: o Port ID : 2-octet PON Port ID .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: o U and F bits : both are set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : length of the TLV in octets excluding the U-bit   F-bit   Type   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: ROID
description: o ROID : Redundant Object ID ( ROID ) as defined in Section 4.3 of [ RFC7275 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Local PON Port State
description: o Local PON Port State : the status of the local PON port as determined by the sending OLT ( PE ). The last bit is defined as Fault indication of the PON Port associated with this PW ( 1 - in fault; 0 - in normal ).
:LABEL: field

name: Remote PON Port State
description: o Remote PON Port State : the status of the remote PON port as determined by the remote peer of the sending OLT ( i.e .  the sending PE ). The last bit is defined as Fault indication of the PON Port associated with this PW ( 1 - in fault; 0 - in normal ).
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 MPLS Echo Request 2 MPLS Echo Reply
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 Do not reply 2 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet 3 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet with Router Alert 4 Reply via application-level control channel
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 0 No Return Code 1 Malformed echo request received 2 One or more of the TLVs was not understood 3 Replying router is an egress for the FEC at stack-depth < RSC > 4 Replying router has no mapping for the FEC at stack-depth < RSC > 5 Downstream Mapping Mismatch ( See Note 1 ) 6 Upstream Interface Index Unknown ( See Note 1 ) 7 Reserved 8 Label switched at stack-depth < RSC > 9 Label switched but no MPLS forwarding at stack-depth < RSC > 10 Mapping for this FEC is not the given label at stack-depth < RSC > 11 No label entry at stack-depth < RSC > 12 Protocol not associated with interface at FEC stack-depth < RSC > 13 Premature termination of ping due to label stack shrinking to a single label 14 See DDMAP TLV for meaning of Return Code and Return Subcode ( See Note 2 ) 15 Label switched with FEC change
:LABEL: field

name: Sender's PE IPv6 Address
description: Sender's PE IPv6 Address : The source IP address of the target IPv6 LDP session . 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote PE IPv6 Address
description: Remote PE IPv6 Address : The destination IP address of the target IPv6 LDP session . 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: PW ID
description: PW ID : Same as FEC 128 Pseudowire IPv4 in Section 3.2.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: PW Type
description: PW Type : Same as FEC 128 Pseudowire IPv4 in Section 3.2.9 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sender's PE IPv6 Address
description: Sender's PE IPv6 Address : The source IP address of the target IPv6 LDP session . 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote PE IPv6 Address
description: Remote PE IPv6 Address : The destination IP address of the target IPv6 LDP session . 16 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The MTU is the size in octets of the largest MPLS frame ( including label stack ) that fits on the interface to the downstream LSR .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the Downstream IP Address and Downstream Interface fields . The Address Type is set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: DS Flags
description: The DS Flags field is a bit vector of various flags with the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Two flags are defined currently   I and N . The remaining flags MUST be set to zero when sending and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Echo request messages will be used to diagnose non-IP flows . However   these messages are carried in IP packets . For a router that alters its ECMP algorithm based on the FEC or deep packet examination   this flag requests that the router treat this as it would if the determination of an IP payload had failed .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Code
description: The Return Code is set to zero by the sender of an echo request . The receiver of said echo request can set it in the corresponding echo reply that it generates to one of the values specified in Section 3.1 other than 14 .
:LABEL: field

name: Return Subcode
description: The Return Subcode is set to zero by the sender . The receiver can set this field to an appropriate value as specified in Section 3.1 : The Return Subcode is filled in with the stack-depth for those codes that specify the stack-depth . For all other codes   the Return Subcode MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sub-TLV Length
description: Total length in octets of the sub-TLVs associated with this TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Type
description: The type of the encoding for the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Length
description: The length in octets of the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
