description: MUST be set to zero when sending; MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Label
description: A downstream label is 24 bits   in the same format as an MPLS label minus the TTL field   i.e .  the MSBit of the label is bit 0   the LSBit is bit 19   the TC field [ RFC5462 ] is bits 20-22   and S is bit 23 . The replying router SHOULD fill in the TC field and S bit; the LSR receiving the echo reply MAY choose to ignore these .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: This specifies the label distribution protocol for the Downstream label . Protocol values are taken from the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: Operation Type
description: The operation type specifies the action associated with the FEC stack change . The following operation types are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates the remote peer's address type . The Address Type is set to one of the following values . The length of the peer address is determined based on the address type . The address type MAY be different from the address type included in the Downstream Detailed Mapping TLV . This can happen when the LSP goes over a tunnel of a different address family . The address type MAY be set to Unspecified if the peer address is either unavailable or the transit router does not wish to provide it for security or administrative reasons .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is reserved for future use and MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 0 Reserved 1 Drop Pad TLV from reply 2 Copy Pad TLV to reply 3-250 Unassigned 251-254 Reserved for Experimental Use 255 Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the IP Address and Interface fields . The resulting total for the initial part of the TLV is listed in the table below as " K Octets ". The Address Type is set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label-L : the label from the actual stack currently being examined . Requires no initialization .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label-stack-depth : the depth of the label being verified . Initialized to the number of labels in the received label stack S .
:LABEL: field

description: /* This step assumes there is always an entry for well-known label values */
:LABEL: field

description: If the label operation is " Swap or Pop and Switch based on Popped Label " {
:LABEL: field

description: If no Downstream Detailed Mapping TLV is present   or the Downstream IP Address is set to the ALLROUTERS multicast address   go to step 7 ( Send Reply Packet ).
:LABEL: field

description: 3 . Check the FEC label mapping that describes how traffic received on the LSP is further switched or which application it is associated with . If no mapping exists   set FEC-return-code to Return 4   " Replying router has no mapping for the FEC at stack - depth ". Set FEC-status to 1 . Return .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 MPLS Echo Request 2 MPLS Echo Reply
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: Value Meaning ----- ------- 1 Do not reply 2 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet 3 Reply via an IPv4/IPv6 UDP packet with Router Alert 4 Reply via application-level control channel
:LABEL: field

name: Global Flags
description: IANA has created a " Global Flags " subregistry of the " Multiprotocol Label Switching ( MPLS ) Label Switched Paths ( LSPs ) Ping Parameters " registry .
:LABEL: field

name: DS Flags
description: This document defines the Downstream Mapping ( DSMAP ) TLV and the Downstream Detailed Mapping ( DDMAP ) TLV   which have Type 2 and Type 20   respectively   assigned from the " TLVs " subregistry of the " Multiprotocol Label Switching ( MPLS ) Label Switched Paths ( LSPs ) Ping Parameters " registry .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The MTU is the size in octets of the largest MPLS frame ( including label stack ) that fits on the interface to the downstream LSR .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Type
description: The Address Type indicates if the interface is numbered or unnumbered . It also determines the length of the Downstream IP Address and Downstream Interface fields . The resulting total for the initial part of the TLV is listed in the table below as " K Octets ". The Address Type is set to one of the following values :
:LABEL: field

name: DS Flags
description: The DS Flags field is a bit vector with the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: Two flags are defined currently   I and N . The remaining flags MUST be set to zero when sending and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Echo request messages will be used to diagnose non-IP flows . However   these messages are carried in IP packets . For a router that alters its ECMP algorithm based on the FEC or deep packet examination   this flag requests that the router treat this as it would if the determination of an IP payload had failed .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Type
description: The following Multipath Types are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Depth Limit
description: The Depth Limit is applicable only to a label stack and is the maximum number of labels considered in the hash; this SHOULD be set to zero if unspecified or unlimited .
:LABEL: field

name: Multipath Length
description: The length in octets of the Multipath Information .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Label
description: The set of labels in the label stack as it would have appeared if this router were forwarding the packet through this interface . Any Implicit Null labels are explicitly included . Labels are treated as numbers   i.e .  they are right justified in the field .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: The protocol is taken from the following table :
:LABEL: field

name: templateId
description: o ( scope ) templateId [ IANA-IPFIX ]
:LABEL: field

name: informationElementIndex
description: o mibObjectIdentifier ( Section 11.2.2.1 ) or mibSubIdentifier ( Section 11.2.2.2 )
:LABEL: field

name: Field Length
description: The length of the encoded MIB object data in the corresponding Data Records   in octets . See [ RFC7011 ] for a detailed definition . Note that the Field Length can be expressed using reduced-size encoding per [ RFC7011 ]. Note that the Field Length may be encoded using variable-length encoding per [ RFC7011 ].
:LABEL: field

name: templateId
description: The first Scope Field is an IPFIX Information Element that denotes that a Template Identifier will be exported as part of the MIB Field Options Data Record . This Template Identifier   paired with an index into that Template ( the " informationElementIndex " field )  uniquely references one mibObjectValue Information Element being exported .
:LABEL: field

name: informationElementIndex
description: The second Scope Field is an IPFIX Information Element that denotes a zero-based index into the fields defined by a Template . When paired with a " templateId "  this uniquely references one mibObjectValue Information Element being exported .
:LABEL: field

name: templateId
description: The templateId for the MIB option that will be exported .
:LABEL: field

name: templateId
description: The templateId used will be for the Template referred to in the subTemplateList of the mibObjectValueRow that will be exported .
:LABEL: field

name: mibSubIdentifier
description: The sub-identifier that specifies the columnar object's ID within the conceptual row .
:LABEL: field

name: mibSubIdentifier
description: The mibSubIdentifier fields will contain the extra sub-identifier that   when added to the OID for the conceptual row   gives the full OID for the object .
:LABEL: field

name: mibSubIdentifier
description: A new Information Element " mibSubIdentifier " has been allocated in IANA's IPFIX registry [ IANA-IPFIX ]  with the following definition :
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: A description of any attribute-specific limitations on the values carried by the specified data type . If there are no attribute-specific limitations   then the description of this field can be omitted   so long as the Description field is sufficiently explanatory .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field   which is reserved and MUST be present   is always set to zero . This field is one octet in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix-Length
description: The length of the prefix   in bits . At least 0 and no larger than 128 . This field is one octet in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field   which is reserved and MUST be present   is always set to zero . This field is one octet in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix-Length
description: The length of the prefix   in bits . The values MUST be no larger than 32 . This field is one octet in length . Note that this definition differs from that given in [ RFC6572 ].
:LABEL: field

name: TLV-Type
description: This field is one octet . Up-to-date values of this field are specified according to the policies and rules described in [ RFC6929 ]  Section 10 . Values of 254-255 are reserved for use by future extensions to RADIUS . The value 26 has no special meaning and MUST NOT be treated as a Vendor-Specific Attribute .
:LABEL: field

name: TLV-Length
description: The TLV-Length field is one octet and indicates the length of this TLV   including the TLV-Type   TLV-Length   and TLV-Value fields . It MUST have a value between 3 and 255 . If a client or server receives a TLV with an invalid TLV-Length   then the attribute that encapsulates that TLV MUST be considered to be an invalid attribute and is handled as per [ RFC6929 ]  Section 2.8 .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The 4 octets are the Network Management Private Enterprise Code [ PEN ] of the vendor in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended-Type
description: The Extended-Type field is one octet . Up-to-date values of this field are specified according to the policies and rules described in [ RFC6929 ]  Section 10 . Unlike the Type field defined in [ RFC2865 ]  Section 5   no values are allocated for experimental or implementation-specific use . Values 241-255 are reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended-Type
description: This field is identical to the Extended-Type field defined above in Section 3.15 .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: The More field ( M flag ) is one ( 1 ) bit in length and indicates whether or not the current attribute contains " more " than 251 octets of data . The More field MUST be clear ( 0 ) if the Length field has a value less than 255 . The More field MAY be set ( 1 ) if the Length field has a value of 255 .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: This field is one bit in size and is called " T " for Truncation . It indicates that the attribute is intentionally truncated in this chunk and is to be continued in the next chunk of the sequence . The combination of the M flag and the T flag indicates that the attribute is fragmented ( M flag ) but that all of the fragments are not available in this chunk ( T flag ). Proxies implementing [ RFC6929 ] will see these attributes as
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is six bits long and is reserved for future use . Implementations MUST set it to zero ( 0 ) when encoding an attribute for sending in a packet . The contents SHOULD be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Id
description: The 4 octets are the Network Management Private Enterprise Code [ PEN ] of the vendor in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Vendor-Type
description: The Vendor-Type field is one octet . Values are assigned at the sole discretion of the vendor .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: The number of the data type . The Value field is an artifact of the registry and has no on-the-wire meaning .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field indicates the total length in octets of all fields of this attribute   including the Type   Length   Extended-Type   and the entire length of the embedded TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field indicates the total length in octets of all fields of this attribute   including the Type   Length   Extended-Type   and the entire length of the embedded TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: This field indicates the total length in octets of all fields of this attribute   including the Type   Length   Extended-Type   and the entire length of the embedded TLVs .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol-Number
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned8 ) of the protocol number defined in [ ProtocolNumbers ]  right justified   and the unused bits in this field MUST be set to zero . Protocols that do not use a port number ( e.g .  the Resource Reservation Protocol ( RSVP ) or IP Encapsulating Security Payload ( ESP )) MUST NOT be included in the IP-Port-Type TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: sourceTransportPortsLimit
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned16 ) of sourceTransportPortsLimit ( 458 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and the unused bits in this field MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: postNATSourceIPv4Address
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( ipv4Address ) of postNATSourceIPv4Address ( 225 ) defined in IPFIX .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: sourceIPv4Address
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( ipv4Address ) of sourceIPv4Address ( 8 ) defined in IPFIX .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Eighteen octets
:LABEL: field

name: sourceIPv6Address
description: IPv6 address ( 128 bits ). This field contains the data ( ipv6Address ) of sourceIPv6Address ( 27 ) defined in IPFIX .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: sourceTransportPort
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned16 ) of sourceTransportPort ( 7 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and unused bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: postNAPTSourceTransportPort
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned16 ) of postNAPTSourceTransportPort ( 227 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and unused bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: natEvent
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned8 ) of natEvent ( 230 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and unused bits MUST be set to zero . It indicates the allocation or deallocation of a range of IP ports as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: portRangeStart
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned16 ) of portRangeStart ( 361 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and unused bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Six octets
:LABEL: field

name: portRangeEnd
description: Integer . This field contains the data ( unsigned16 ) of portRangeEnd ( 362 ) defined in IPFIX   right justified   and unused bits MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Variable number of octets
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Description Data Type Reference ---- ----------- --------- --------- 241.5 IP-Port-Limit-Info tlv Section 3.1.1 241.6 IP-Port-Range tlv Section 3.1.2 241.7 IP-Port-Forwarding-Map tlv Section 3.1.3
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: This document defines a generalization of an address called a " locator ". A locator specifies a point of attachment to the network but may also include additional end-to-end tunneling or a per-host demultiplexing context that affects how packets are handled below the logical HIP sublayer of the stack . This generalization is useful because IP addresses alone may not be sufficient to describe how packets should be handled below HIP . For example   in a host multihoming context   certain IP addresses may need to be associated with certain ESP SPIs to avoid violating the ESP anti-replay window . Addresses may also be affiliated with transport ports in certain tunneling scenarios . Locators may simply be traditional network addresses . The format of the Locator fields in the LOCATOR_SET parameter is defined in Section 4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : Length in octets   excluding Type and Length fields   and excluding padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length in octets   excluding Type and Length fields   and excluding padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Type
description: Traffic Type : Defines whether the locator pertains to HIP signaling   user data   or both .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Type
description: Locator Length : Defines the length of the Locator field   in units of 4-byte words ( Locators up to a maximum of 4*255 octets are supported ).
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Length
description: Locator Length : Defines the length of the Locator field   in units of 4-byte words ( Locators up to a maximum of 4*255 octets are supported ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: P : Preferred locator . Set to one if the locator is preferred for that Traffic Type; otherwise   set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : Preferred locator . Set to one if the locator is preferred for that Traffic Type; otherwise   set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Lifetime
description: Locator : The locator whose semantics and encoding are indicated by the Locator Type field . All sub-fields of the Locator field are integral multiples of four octets in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: Locator : The locator whose semantics and encoding are indicated by the Locator Type field . All sub-fields of the Locator field are integral multiples of four octets in length .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Type
description: The following Traffic Type values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Locator Type
description: The following Locator Type values are defined   along with the associated semantics of the Locator field :
:LABEL: field

name: Locator
description: The following Locator Type values are defined   along with the associated semantics of the Locator field :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length of the Transport Attribute value . MUST be set to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Transport
description: Transport : The type of transport being requested . Set to zero for multicast . Set to 1 for unicast . The values from 2 to 255 may be assigned in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length in octets of the attribute value . MUST be set to the length in octets of the receiver RLOC address plus 1 octet to account for the Address Family field .
:LABEL: field

name: Addr Family
description: Addr Family : The PIM Address Family of the receiver RLOC as defined in [ RFC7761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Receiver RLOC
description: Receiver RLOC : The RLOC address on which the receiver ETR wishes to receiver the unicast-encapsulated flow .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : this 8-bit field is for future definition and use . For now   set to zero on transmission and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : this 8-bit field is specific to the LISP Canonical Address Format encodings . Both approved and unapproved values are listed below . Unapproved values are indicated; see Section 5 for more details .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 0 : Null Body
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1 : AFI List
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 2 : Instance ID
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3 : AS Number
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 4 : Application Data ( unapproved ; see Section 5 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 5 : Geo-Coordinates
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 6 : Opaque Key ( unapproved ; see Section 5 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 7 : NAT-Traversal
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8 : Nonce Locator ( unapproved ; see Section 5 )

name: Type
description: Type 9 : Multicast Info
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 10 : Explicit Locator Path
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 11 : Security Key
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 12 : Source/Dest Key
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 13 : Replication List Entry
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 14 : JSON Data Model ( unapproved ; see Section 5 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 15 : Key/Value Address Pair ( unapproved ; see Section 5 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : this 16-bit field is in units of bytes and covers all of the LISP Canonical Address payload   starting and including the byte after the Length field . When including the AFI   an LCAF-encoded address will have a minimum length of 8 bytes when the Length field is 0 . The 8 bytes include the AFI   Flags   Type   Rsvd1   Rsvd2   and Length fields . When the AFI is not next to an encoded address in a control message   the encoded address will have a minimum length of 6 bytes when the Length field is 0 . The 6 bytes include the Flags   Type   Rsvd1   Rsvd2   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : this 16-bit field is in units of bytes and covers all of the LISP Canonical Address payload   starting and including the byte after the Length field . When including the AFI   an LCAF-encoded address will have a minimum length of 8 bytes when the Length field is 0 . The 8 bytes include the AFI   Flags   Type   Rsvd1   Rsvd2   and Length fields . When the AFI is not next to an encoded address in a control message   the encoded address will have a minimum length of 6 bytes when the Length field is 0 . The 6 bytes include the Flags   Type   Rsvd1   Rsvd2   and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Instance ID
description: Instance ID : the low-order 24 bits that can go into a LISP data header when the I bit is set . See [ RFC6830 ] for details . The reason for the length difference is so that the maximum number of instances supported per mapping system is 2^32   while conserving space in the LISP data header . This comes at the expense of limiting the maximum number of instances per xTR to 2^24 . If an xTR is configured with multiple Instance IDs where the value in the high-order 8 bits is the same   then the low-order 24 bits MUST be unique .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: This LISP Canonical Address Type can be used to encode either EID or RLOC addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: AS Number
description: AS Number : the 32-bit AS number of the autonomous system that has been assigned to either the EID or RLOC that follows .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: The AS Number LCAF Type can be used to encode either EID or RLOC addresses . The former is used to describe the LISP-ALT AS number the EID prefix for the site is being carried for . The latter is used to describe the AS that is carrying RLOC based prefixes in the underlying routing system .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: Latitude Degrees : Valid values range from 0 to 90 degrees above or below the equator ( northern or southern hemisphere   respectively ).
:LABEL: field

name: Latitude Degrees
description: Latitude Degrees : Valid values range from 0 to 90 degrees above or below the equator ( northern or southern hemisphere   respectively ).
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Longitude Degrees : Valid values are from 0 to 180 degrees right or left of the Prime Meridian .
:LABEL: field

name: Longitude Degrees
description: Longitude Degrees : Valid values are from 0 to 180 degrees right or left of the Prime Meridian .
:LABEL: field

name: Altitude
description: Altitude : Height relative to sea level in meters . This is a two's complement signed integer meaning that the altitude could be below sea level . A value of 0x7fffffff indicates no Altitude value is encoded .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: The Geo-Coordinates LCAF Type can be used to encode either EID or RLOC addresses . When used for EID encodings   you can determine the physical location of an EID along with the topological location by observing the locator-set .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: MS UDP Port Number
description: MS UDP Port Number : this is the UDP port number of the Map-Server and is set to 4342 .
:LABEL: field

name: ETR UDP Port Number
description: ETR UDP Port Number : this is the port number returned to a LISP system that was copied from the source port from a packet that has flowed through a NAT device .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: Global ETR RLOC Address : this is an address known to be globally unique built by NAT-traversal functionality in a LISP router .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Instance ID : the low-order 24 bits that can go into a LISP data header when the I bit is set . See [ RFC6830 ] for details . The use of the Instance ID in this LCAF Type is to associate a multicast forwarding entry for a given VPN . The Instance ID describes the VPN and is registered to the mapping database system as a 3-tuple of ( Instance ID   S-prefix   G-prefix ).
:LABEL: field

name: Instance ID
description: Instance ID : the low-order 24 bits that can go into a LISP data header when the I bit is set . See [ RFC6830 ] for details . The use of the Instance ID in this LCAF Type is to associate a multicast forwarding entry for a given VPN . The Instance ID describes the VPN and is registered to the mapping database system as a 3-tuple of ( Instance ID   S-prefix   G-prefix ).
:LABEL: field

name: Source MaskLen
description: Source MaskLen : the mask length of the source prefix that follows . The length is the number of high-order mask bits set .
:LABEL: field

name: Group MaskLen
description: Group MaskLen : the mask length of the group prefix that follows . The length is the number of high-order mask bits set .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. When a specific address family has a multicast address semantic   this field must be either a group address or a broadcast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: Lookup bit ( L ): this is the Lookup bit used to indicate to the user of the ELP not to use this address for encapsulation but to look it up in the mapping database system to obtain an encapsulating RLOC address .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: RLOC Probe bit ( P ): this is the RLOC Probe bit that means the Reencap Hop allows RLOC-probe messages to be sent to it . When the R bit is set to 0   RLOC-probes must not be sent . When a Reencap Hop is an anycast address then multiple physical Reencap Hops are using the same RLOC address . In this case   RLOC-probes are not needed because when the closest RLOC address is not reachable   another RLOC address can be reachable .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: Strict bit ( S ): this is the Strict bit   which means the associated Reencap Hop is required to be used . If this bit is 0   the re-encapsulator can skip this Reencap Hop and go to the next one in the list .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. When a specific AFI has its own encoding of a multicast address   this field must be either a group address or a broadcast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Count
description: Key Count : the Key Count field declares the number of Key sections included in this LCAF . A Key section is made up of Key Length and Key Material fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Algorithm
description: Key Algorithm : the Key Algorithm field identifies the key's cryptographic algorithm and specifies the format of the Public Key field . Refer to the [ LISP-DDT ] and [ RFC8061 ] use cases for definitions of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Length
description: Key Length : this field determines the length in bytes of the Key Material field .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. This is the locator address that owns the encoded security key .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Source-ML : the mask length of the source prefix that follows . The length is the number of high-order mask bits set .
:LABEL: field

name: Source
description: Source-ML : the mask length of the source prefix that follows . The length is the number of high-order mask bits set .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = y : y can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. When a specific address family has a multicast address semantic   this field must be either a group address or a broadcast address .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = y
description: AFI = y : y can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. When a specific address family has a multicast address semantic   this field must be either a group address or a broadcast address .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Level Value
description: Level Value : this value is associated with the level within the overlay distribution tree hierarchy where the RTR resides . The level numbers are ordered from lowest value being close to the ITR ( meaning that ITRs replicate to level-0 RTRs ) and higher levels are further downstream on the distribution tree closer to ETRs of multicast receiver sites .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. A specific AFI has its own encoding of either a unicast or multicast locator address . For efficiency reasons   all RTR/ETR entries for the same level should be combined by a Map-Server to avoid searching through the entire multilevel list of locator entries in a Map-Reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

description: Length2 : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length2 field .
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length2 : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length2 field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .

name: AFI = x
description: The Application Data LCAF Type is used for an EID encoding when an ITR wants a locator-set for a specific application . When used for an RLOC encoding   the ETR is supplying a locator-set for each specific application is has been configured to advertise .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Field Num
description: Key Field Num : the value of this field is the number of " Key " sub - fields minus 1   the Key field can be broken up into . So   if this field has a value of 0   there is one sub-field in the " Key ". The width of the sub-fields are fixed length . So   for a key size of 8 bytes   with a Key Field Num of 3   four sub-fields of 2 bytes each in length are allowed . Allowing for a reasonable number of 16 sub-field separators   valid values range from 0 to 15 .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Wildcard Fields
description: Key Wildcard Fields : describes which fields in the key are not used as part of the key lookup . This wildcard encoding is a bitfield . Each bit is a don't-care bit for a corresponding field in the key . Bit 0 ( the low-order bit ) in this bitfield corresponds the first field   the low-order field in the key   bit 1 the second field   and so on . When a bit is set in the bitfield   it is a don't-care bit and should not be considered as part of the database lookup . When the entire 16 bits are set to 0   then all bits of the key are used for the database lookup .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Nonce : a nonce value returned by an ETR in a Map-Reply locator - record to be used by an ITR or PITR when encapsulating to the locator address encoded in the AFI field of this LCAF Type . This nonce value is inserted in the nonce field in the LISP header encapsulation .
:LABEL: field

name: Nonce
description: Nonce : a nonce value returned by an ETR in a Map-Reply locator - record to be used by an ITR or PITR when encapsulating to the locator address encoded in the AFI field of this LCAF Type . This nonce value is inserted in the nonce field in the LISP header encapsulation .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: Usage : This is an experimental Type where the usage has not yet been defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: JSON length
description: JSON length : length in octets of the following JSON binary/text encoding field .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x can be any AFI value from [ AFN ]. A specific AFI has its own encoding of either a unicast or multicast locator address . All RTR/ETR entries for the same level should be combined by a Map-Server to avoid searching through the entire multilevel list of locator entries in a Map-Reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = x
description: AFI = x : x is the " Address as Key " AFI that can have any value from [ AFN ]. A specific AFI has its own encoding of either a unicast or a multicast locator address . All RTR/ETR entries for the same level should be combined by a Map-Server to avoid searching through the entire multilevel list of locator entries in a Map - Reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI = y
description: AFI = y : y is the " Address of Value " AFI that can have any value from [ AFN ]. A specific AFI has its own encoding of either a unicast or a multicast locator address . All RTR/ETR entries for the same level should be combined by a Map-Server to avoid searching through the entire multilevel list of locator entries in a Map-Reply message .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : length in bytes starting and including the byte after this Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved-for-Future-Encapsulations : must be set to zero and ignored on receipt . This field will get bits allocated to future encapsulations   as they are created .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept Generic UDP Encapsulation ( GUE ) using destination UDP port 6080 [ GUE ].
:LABEL: field

name: G
description: G : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept Geneve encapsulation using destination UDP port 6081 [ GENEVE ].
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: N : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept NV-GRE ( Network Virtualization - Generic Routing Encapsulation ) using IPv4/IPv6 protocol number 47 [ RFC7637 ].
:LABEL: field

name: v
description: v : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept VXLAN-GPE ( Generic Protocol Extension ) encapsulation using destination UDP port 4790 [ GPE-VXLAN ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept Virtual eXtensible Local Area Network ( VXLAN ) encapsulation using destination UDP port 4789 [ RFC7348 ].
:LABEL: field

name: l
description: l : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept Layer 2 LISP encapsulation using destination UDP port 8472 [ LISP-L2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The RLOCs listed in the AFI-encoded addresses in the next longword can accept Layer 3 LISP encapsulation using destination UDP port 4341 [ RFC6830 ].
:LABEL: field

name: ESC
description: ESC : The left-most octet is the ESC dispatch type containing ' 01000000 '.
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Dispatch Payload
description: Extended Dispatch Payload ( EDP ): This part of the frame format must be defined by the corresponding extension type . A specification is required to define the usage of each extension type and its corresponding Extension Payload . For the sake of interoperability   specifications of extension octets MUST NOT redefine the existing ESC Extension Type codes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8-bit identifier of the RDNSS option type as assigned by IANA : 25
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) is in units of 8 octets . The minimum value is 3 if one IPv6 address is contained in the option . Every additional RDNSS address increases the length by 2 . The Length field is used by the receiver to determine the number of IPv6 addresses in the option .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime 32-bit unsigned integer . The maximum time in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is received ) over which these RDNSS addresses MAY be used for name resolution . The value of Lifetime SHOULD by default be at least 3 * MaxRtrAdvInterval   where MaxRtrAdvInterval is the maximum RA interval as defined in [ RFC4861 ]. A value of all one bits ( 0xffffffff ) represents infinity . A value of zero means that the RDNSS addresses MUST no longer be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8-bit identifier of the DNSSL option type as assigned by IANA : 31
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( including the Type and Length fields ) is in units of 8 octets . The minimum value is 2 if at least one domain name is contained in the option . The Length field is set to a multiple of 8 octets to accommodate all the domain names in the " Domain Names of DNS Search List " field .
:LABEL: field

name: Lifetime
description: Lifetime 32-bit unsigned integer . The maximum time in seconds ( relative to the time the packet is received ) over which these DNSSL domain names MAY be used for name resolution . The Lifetime value has the same semantics as the semantics for the RDNSS option . That is   Lifetime SHOULD by default be at least 3 * MaxRtrAdvInterval . A value of all one bits ( 0xffffffff ) represents infinity . A value of zero means that the DNSSL domain names MUST no longer be used .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : The " DDT-originated " flag . This flag is set by a DDT client to indicate that the receiver SHOULD return Map-Referral messages as appropriate . The use of this flag is further described in Section 7.3.1 . This bit is allocated from LISP message header bits marked as " Reserved " in [ RFC6830 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Type value 6 was reserved for future use in [ RFC6830 ]. This document allocates this value to identify Map-Referral messages .
:LABEL: field

name: ACT
description: ACT : The ACT ( Action ) field of the mapping Record in a Map-Referral message encodes one of the following six action types : NODE-REFERRAL   MS-REFERRAL   MS-ACK   MS-NOT-REGISTERED   DELEGATION-HOLE   or NOT-AUTHORITATIVE . See Section 6.1 for descriptions of these action types .
:LABEL: field

name: Referral Count
description: Referral Count : Number of RLOCs in the current Referral Set . This number is equal to the number of " Ref " sections in the message ( as shown in the diagram above ).
:LABEL: field

name: SigCnt
description: SigCnt : Indicates the number of signatures ( Signature section ) present in the Record . If SigCnt is larger than 0   the signature information captured in a Signature section as described in Section 6.4.1 will be appended to the end of the Record . The number of Signature sections at the end of the Record MUST match the SigCnt . Note that bits occupied by SigCnt were marked as " Reserved " in Records embedded into messages defined by [ RFC6830 ] and were required to be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Original Record TTL
description: Original Record TTL : The original Record TTL for this Record that is covered by the signature . The Record TTL value is specified in minutes .
:LABEL: field

name: Key Tag
description: Key Tag : An identifier to specify which key is used for this signature if more than one valid key exists for the signing DDT node .
:LABEL: field

name: Sig Length
description: Sig-Algorithm : The identifier of the cryptographic algorithm used for the signature . Sig-Algorithm values defined in this specification are listed in Table 1 . Implementations conforming to this specification MUST implement at least RSA-SHA256 for DDT signing . Sig-Algorithm type 1 ( RSA-SHA1 ) is deprecated and SHOULD NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be set to 0 on transmit and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Signature
description: Signature : Contains the cryptographic signature that covers the entire Map-Referral Record to which this signature belongs . For the purpose of computing the signature   the Record TTL ( Section 6.4 ) value is set to the value of Original Record TTL and the Signature field is filled with zeros .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: MUST be set to the value of 62   indicating that it is an LMA-Controlled-MAG-Parameters option .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length in octets of the option   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the type of the LCMP sub-option . This specification defines the following types :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the number of octets needed to encode the Option Data   excluding the LCMP Type and LCMP Length fields of the sub-option .
:LABEL: field

name: LCMP Type
description: 1 for the Binding Re-registration Control Sub-Option .
:LABEL: field

name: Re-registration-Start-Time
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the number of time units before the expiry of the PMIPv6 binding lifetime when the registration refresh process needs to be activated . One time unit is 4 seconds .
:LABEL: field

name: Initial-Retransmission-Time
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating minimum delay in seconds before the first Proxy Binding Update ( PBU ) retransmission of the exponential backoff process .
:LABEL: field

name: Maximum-Retransmission-Time
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating maximum delay in seconds before the last PBU retransmission message of the exponential backoff process .
:LABEL: field

name: LCMP Type
description: 2 for the Heartbeat Control Sub-Option .
:LABEL: field

name: HB-Interval
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating the heartbeat interval   i.e .  time delay in seconds after a successful heartbeat exchange ( heartbeat request followed by response ) when the next heartbeat exchange can be triggered .
:LABEL: field

name: HB-Retransmission-Delay
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating minimum time delay in seconds before a heartbeat message is retransmitted .
:LABEL: field

name: HB-Max-Retransmissions
description: 16-bit unsigned integer indicating maximum number of heartbeat retransmissions .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 8-bit identifier of the type of option . The option identifier for the User Security Flag Option ( 0x7g ) has not been allocated by the IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option ( excluding the Option Type and Option Length fields ). The value MUST be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: UserSecFlag
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Bit 0 has the functionality defined in [ RFC3514 ]. The other bits are reserved and MUST be zero or one .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the 6LoRHE expressed in bytes   excluding the first 2 bytes . This enables a node to skip a 6LoRHE header that it does not support and/or cannot parse   for instance   if the Type is not recognized .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Type of the 6LoRHE
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type-Specific Extension ( TSE ): The meaning depends on the Type   which must be known in all of the nodes . The interpretation of the TSE depends on the Type field that follows . For instance   it may be used to transport control bits   the number of elements in an array   or the length of the remainder of the 6LoRHC expressed in a unit other than bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Type of the 6LoRHC
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O   R   and F bits : The O   R   and F bits are defined in Section 11.2 of RFC 6550 [ RFC6550 ].
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: O   R   and F bits : The O   R   and F bits are defined in Section 11.2 of RFC 6550 [ RFC6550 ].
:LABEL: field

name: FGL
description: FGL : Fine-Grained Label [ RFC7172 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 4 + size of bit map in bytes . If Length is less than 4   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 4 + size of bit map in bytes . If Length is less than 4   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Appointee Nickname
description: o Appointee Nickname : The nickname of the TRILL switch being appointed as forwarder .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o Starting VLAN ID : The smallest VLAN ID to which the bits in the Bit Map correspond .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting VLAN ID
description: o Starting VLAN ID : The smallest VLAN ID to which the bits in the Bit Map correspond .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 2 + 2 * k . If Length is not an even number   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 2 + 2 * k . If Length is not an even number   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Appointee Nickname
description: o Appointee Nickname : The nickname of the TRILL switch being appointed as forwarder .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o VLAN ID : A 12-bit VLAN ID for which the appointee is being appointed as the forwarder .
:LABEL: field

name: VLAN ID
description: o VLAN ID : A 12-bit VLAN ID for which the appointee is being appointed as the forwarder .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: This APPsub-TLV   when originated by the DRB   appoints the TRILL switch with Appointee Nickname to be the Appointed Forwarder for the VLAN IDs listed .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 5 + size of bit map in bytes . If Length is less than 5   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 5 + size of bit map in bytes . If Length is less than 5   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o Starting VLAN ID : Initial VLAN ID for the mapping information as discussed below .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting VLAN ID
description: o Starting VLAN ID : Initial VLAN ID for the mapping information as discussed below .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting FGL
description: o Bit Map : Map of bits for VLAN-ID-to-FGL mappings . The size of the bit map is Length minus 5 . If the size of the bit map is zero   no mappings are indicated .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : 5 * k . If Length is not a multiple of 5   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : 5 * k . If Length is not a multiple of 5   the APPsub-TLV is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: o RESV : 4 bits that MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: VLAN ID
description: o VLAN ID : 12-bit VLAN label .
:LABEL: field

name: FGL
description: Each Mapping RECORD indicates that the originating TRILL switch is configured to map between the FGL and VLAN given on egressing and ingressing native frames . However   VLAN ID 0x000 and VLAN ID 0xFFF are invalid; any Mapping RECORD that corresponds to an illegal VLAN ID is ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: msg-type
description: msg-type Identifies the DHCP message type; the available message types are listed below .
:LABEL: field

name: transaction-id
description: sent-time The time the message was transmitted ( set as close to transmission as practical )  in seconds since midnight ( UTC )  January 1   2000   modulo 2^32 . Used to determine the time skew of the failover partners .
:LABEL: field

name: sent-time
description: sent-time The time the message was transmitted ( set as close to transmission as practical )  in seconds since midnight ( UTC )  January 1   2000   modulo 2^32 . Used to determine the time skew of the failover partners .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_BINDING_STATUS
description: The binding-status is an implementation-independent representation of the status ( or the state ) of a lease on an IPv6 address or prefix .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS
description: This option provides flags that indicate attributes of the connecting server .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_REMOVAL_INFO
description: This option contains the information necessary to remove a DNS name that was entered by the failover partner .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_HOST_NAME
description: This option contains the hostname that was entered into the DNS by the failover partner .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_ZONE_NAME
description: This option contains the zone name that was entered into the DNS by the failover partner .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_FLAGS
description: This option provides flags that indicate what needs to be done to remove this DNS name .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_EXPIRATION_TIME
description: This option specifies the greatest lifetime that this server has ever acked to its partner in a BNDREPLY message for a particular lease or prefix . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD
description: This option specifies the maximum number of BNDUPD messages that this server is prepared to accept over the TCP connection without causing the TCP connection to block .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MCLT
description: The Maximum Client Lead Time ( MCLT ) is the upper bound on the difference allowed between the valid lifetime provided to a DHCP client by a server and the valid lifetime known by that server's failover partner . It is an interval   measured in seconds . See Section 4.4 .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME
description: This option specifies the time after which the partner can consider an IPv6 address expired and is able to reuse the IPv6 address . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME_SENT
description: This option indicates the time that was received in an OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME option ( Section 5.5.7 ). This is an exact duplicate ( echo ) of the time received in the OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME option; it is not adjusted in any way . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_DOWN_TIME
description: This option specifies the time that the server most recently lost communications with its failover partner . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_RAW_CLT_TIME
description: This option specifies the time when the partner most recently interacted with the DHCP client associated with this IPv6 address or prefix . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION
description: The protocol version allows one failover partner to determine the version of the protocol being used by the other partner   to allow for changes and upgrades in the future . Two components are provided   to allow large and small changes to be represented in one 32-bit number . The intent is that large changes would result in an increment of the value of major-version   while small changes would result in an increment of the value of minor-version . As subsequent updates and extensions of this document can define changes to these values in any way deemed appropriate   no attempt is made to further define " large " and " small " in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME
description: This option specifies the number of seconds ( an interval ) within which the server must receive a message from its partner   or it will assume that communications from the partner are not " OK ".
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_RECONFIGURE_DATA
description: This option contains the information necessary for one failover partner to use the reconfigure-key created on the other failover partner .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_RELATIONSHIP_NAME
description: This option specifies a name for this failover relationship . It is used to distinguish between relationships when there are multiple failover relationships between two failover servers .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS
description: The OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS option specifies information associated with the failover endpoint sending the option .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE
description: The OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE option specifies the endpoint state of the server sending the option .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE
description: The OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE option specifies the time at which the associated state began to hold its current value . When this option appears in a STATE message   the state to which it refers is the server endpoint state . When it appears in an IA_NA-options   IA_TA-options   or IA_PD-options field   the state to which it refers is the binding-status value in the OPTION_IA_NA   OPTION_IA_TA   or OPTION_IA_PD option   respectively . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_STATE_EXPIRATION_TIME
description: The OPTION_F_STATE_EXPIRATION_TIME option specifies the time at which the current state of this lease will expire . This MUST be an absolute time ( i.e .  seconds since midnight January 1   2000 UTC   modulo 2^32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION
description: o OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION - The secondary server decides if the protocol version of the primary server is supported by the secondary server . If it is not   return NotSupported in the OPTION_STATUS_CODE to reject the CONNECT message .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MCLT
description: o OPTION_F_MCLT - Use this MCLT supplied by the primary server . Remember this MCLT   and use it until a different MCLT is supplied by some subsequent CONNECT message .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME - Remember the keepalive-time as the FO_KEEPALIVE_TIME ( Section 6.5 ) when implementing the Unreachability Detection algorithm described in Section 6.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD
description: o OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD - Ensure that the maximum amount of unacked BNDUPD messages queued to the primary server never exceeds the value in the OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD option .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS - Ensure that the secondary server can process information from the primary server as specified in the flags . For example   if the secondary server cannot process prefix delegation with variable-sized prefixes delegated from the same delegable prefix and the primary server says that it can   the secondary should reject the connection .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION
description: o OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION - The primary server decides if the protocol version in use by the secondary server is supported by the primary server . If it is not   send a DISCONNECT message and drop the connection . If it is supported   continue processing . It is possible that the primary and secondary servers will each be sending different versions of the protocol to the other server .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MCLT
description: o OPTION_F_MCLT - Compare the MCLT received with the configured MCLT . If they are different   send a DISCONNECT message and drop the connection .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME - Remember the keepalive-time as the FO_KEEPALIVE_TIME ( Section 6.5 ) when implementing the Unreachability Detection algorithm described in Section 6.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD
description: o OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD - Ensure that the maximum amount of unacked BNDUPD messages queued to the secondary server never exceeds the value in the OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD option .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS - Ensure that the primary server can process information from the secondary server as specified in the flags . For example   if the primary server cannot process prefix delegation with variable-sized prefixes delegated from the same delegable prefix and the secondary server says that it can   the primary should drop the connection .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE
description: o OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE - If this represents a change in state for the failover partner   react according to the instructions in Section 8.1 . If the state is not PARTNER-DOWN   clear any memory of the partner-down-time .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS - Remember these flags in an appropriate data area so they can be referenced later .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE
description: o OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE - Remember this information in an appropriate data area so it can be referenced later .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_DOWN_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_DOWN_TIME - If the value of the OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE is PARTNER-DOWN   remember this information in an appropriate data area so it can be referenced later .
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME ( absolute ) containing the partner-lifetime *.
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_EXPIRATION_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_EXPIRATION_TIME ( absolute ) containing the expiration-time *.
:LABEL: field

name: partner-lifetime
description: partner-lifetime PARTNER_LIFETIME expiration-time
:LABEL: field

name: expiration-time
description: expiration-time EXPIRATION_TIME partner-lifetime partner-raw-clt-time PARTNER_RAW_CLT_TIME client-last-transaction-time
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A B Server Server
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_BINDING_STATUS
description: o OPTION_F_BINDING_STATUS ( 114 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_CONNECT_FLAGS ( 115 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_REMOVAL_INFO
description: o OPTION_F_DNS_REMOVAL_INFO ( 116 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_HOST_NAME
description: o OPTION_F_DNS_HOST_NAME ( 117 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_ZONE_NAME
description: o OPTION_F_DNS_ZONE_NAME ( 118 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_DNS_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_DNS_FLAGS ( 119 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_EXPIRATION_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_EXPIRATION_TIME ( 120 )
:LABEL: field

description: o OPTION_F_MAX_UNACKED_BNDUPD ( 121 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_MCLT
description: o OPTION_F_MCLT ( 122 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME ( 123 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME_SENT
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_LIFETIME_SENT ( 124 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_DOWN_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_DOWN_TIME ( 125 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PARTNER_RAW_CLT_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_PARTNER_RAW_CLT_TIME ( 126 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION
description: o OPTION_F_PROTOCOL_VERSION ( 127 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME
description: o OPTION_F_KEEPALIVE_TIME ( 128 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_RECONFIGURE_DATA
description: o OPTION_F_RECONFIGURE_DATA ( 129 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_RELATIONSHIP_NAME
description: o OPTION_F_RELATIONSHIP_NAME ( 130 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS
description: o OPTION_F_SERVER_FLAGS ( 131 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE
description: o OPTION_F_SERVER_STATE ( 132 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE
description: o OPTION_F_START_TIME_OF_STATE ( 133 )
:LABEL: field

name: OPTION_F_STATE_EXPIRATION_TIME
description: IANA has assigned values for the following new DHCPv6 status codes in the registry maintained at < http://www.iana.org/assignments / dhcpv6-parameters >:
:LABEL: field

name: RTM
description: RTM : Residence Time Measurement
:LABEL: field

name: RTM
description: o RTM ( capability ) is a 3-bit-long bitmap field with values defined as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: CSNP Time
description: CSNP Time : Complete Sequence Number Protocol Data Unit ( PDU ) time . See ESADI [ RFC7357 ] and Section 7.1 below .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver : Version of the Pull Directory protocol . An unsigned integer . Version 0 ( zero ) is specified in this document . See Section 3.1.1 for a discussion of version negotiation .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Section Name ---- ------- ------------ 0 - Reserved 1 3.2.1 Query 2 3.2.2 Response 3 3.3.1 Update 4 3.3.2 Acknowledge 5-14 - Unassigned 15 - Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Four flag bits whose meaning depends on the Pull Directory message type . Flags whose meanings are not specified are reserved   MUST be sent as zero   and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: Count : Some Pull Directory message types specified herein have zero or more occurrences of a Record as part of the type-specific payload . The Count field is the number of occurrences of that Record and is expressed as an unsigned integer . For any Pull Directory messages not structured with such occurrences   this field MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Err
description: Err   SubErr : A two-part error code . These fields are only used in Reply Messages . In messages that are requests or updates   these fields MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt . An Err field containing the value zero means no error . The meaning of values in the SubErr field depends on the value of the Err field   but in all cases   a zero SubErr field is allowed and provides no additional information beyond the value of the Err field .
:LABEL: field

name: SubErr
description: Err   SubErr : A two-part error code . These fields are only used in Reply Messages . In messages that are requests or updates   these fields MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt . An Err field containing the value zero means no error . The meaning of values in the SubErr field depends on the value of the Err field   but in all cases   a zero SubErr field is allowed and provides no additional information beyond the value of the Err field .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : An identifying 32-bit quantity set by the TRILL switch sending a request or other unsolicited message and returned in every corresponding reply or acknowledgment . It is used to match up responses with the message to which they respond .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Type : 1 for Query . Queries received by a TRILL switch that is not a Pull Directory for the relevant Data Label result in an error response ( see Section 3.6 ) unless inhibited by rate limiting . ( See [ RFC7178 ] for information on the Response Message that is generated if the recipient implements the RBridge Channel features but does not implement the Pull Directory RBridge Channel Protocol .)
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Type : 1 for Query . Queries received by a TRILL switch that is not a Pull Directory for the relevant Data Label result in an error response ( see Section 3.6 ) unless inhibited by rate limiting . ( See [ RFC7178 ] for information on the Response Message that is generated if the recipient implements the RBridge Channel features but does not implement the Pull Directory RBridge Channel Protocol .)
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1 for Query . Queries received by a TRILL switch that is not a Pull Directory for the relevant Data Label result in an error response ( see Section 3.6 ) unless inhibited by rate limiting . ( See [ RFC7178 ] for information on the Response Message that is generated if the recipient implements the RBridge Channel features but does not implement the Pull Directory RBridge Channel Protocol .)
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags   Err   and SubErr : MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Err
description: Flags   Err   and SubErr : MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: SubErr
description: Flags   Err   and SubErr : MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: Count : Count is the number of QUERY Records present . A Query Message Count of 0 is explicitly allowed   for the purpose of pinging a Pull Directory server to see if it is responding . On receipt of such an empty Query Message   a Response Message that also has a Count of 0 is returned unless inhibited by rate limiting .
:LABEL: field

name: Ver
description: Ver   Sequence Number : As specified in Section 3.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Ver   Sequence Number : As specified in Section 3.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 2 = Response .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Count : Count is the number of RESPONSE Records present in the Response Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Count
description: Count : Count is the number of RESPONSE Records present in the Response Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Err
description: Err   SubErr : A two-part error code . Zero   unless there was an error in the Query Message ( in which case   see Section 3.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: SubErr
description: Err   SubErr : A two-part error code . Zero   unless there was an error in the Query Message ( in which case   see Section 3.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: For tracking methods 2 and 3 in Section 3.3   a particular Update Message MUST have either the P flag or the N flag set   but not both . If both are set   the Update Message MUST be ignored   as this combination is only valid for method 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Signal Type
description: Signal Type : A 16-bit unsigned integer containing one of the DLEP Signal Type values defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length in octets   expressed as a 16-bit unsigned integer   of all of the DLEP Data Items contained in this Signal . This length MUST NOT include the length of the Signal Header itself .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: Message Type : A 16-bit unsigned integer containing one of the DLEP Message Type values defined in this document .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length in octets   expressed as a 16-bit unsigned integer   of all of the DLEP Data Items contained in this Message . This length MUST NOT include the length of the Message Header itself .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : A 16-bit unsigned integer field specifying the type of Data Item being sent .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length in octets   expressed as a 16-bit unsigned integer   of the Value field of the Data Item . This length MUST NOT include the length of the Data Item Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Interval
description: o Heartbeat Interval ( Section 13.5 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: If any optional extensions are supported by the implementation   they MUST be enumerated in the Extensions Supported Data Item . If an Extensions Supported Data Item does not exist in a Session Initialization Message   the modem MUST conclude that there is no support for extensions in the router .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Interval
description: o Maximum Data Rate ( Receive ) ( Section 13.12 )
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Session Initialization Response Message MUST contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item will be used during the lifetime of the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: If DLEP extensions are supported   the Session Initialization Response Message MUST contain an Extensions Supported Data Item ( Section 13.6 ).
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: The Session Initialization Response Message completes the DLEP session establishment; the modem should transition to the In-Session state when the Message is sent   and the router should transition to the In-Session state upon receipt of an acceptable Session Initialization Response Message .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: o IPv6 Address ( Section 13.9 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Attached Subnet
description: o IPv4 Attached Subnet ( Section 13.10 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: When sent by a modem   the Session Update Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items :
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: When sent by a modem   the Session Update Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item is in use by the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: If metrics are supplied with the Session Update Message ( e.g .  Maximum Data Rate )  these metrics are considered to be session-wide and therefore MUST be applied to all destinations in the information base associated with the DLEP session . This includes destinations for which metrics may have been stored based on received Destination Update messages .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: The Destination Up Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items :
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Destination Up Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item is in use by the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The Destination Up Message MAY contain one or more of each of the following Data Items   with different values :
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Attached Subnet
description: o IPv4 Attached Subnet ( Section 13.10 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: A router receiving a Destination Up Message allocates the necessary resources   creating an entry in the information base with the specifics ( MAC Address   Latency   Data Rate   etc .) of the destination . The information about this destination will persist in the router's information base until a Destination Down Message ( Section 12.15 ) is received   indicating that the modem has lost contact with the remote node or that the implementation transitions to the Session Termination state .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: o MAC Address ( Section 13.7 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: One of the advantages of implementing DLEP is to leverage the modem's knowledge of the links between remote destinations   allowing routers to avoid using probed neighbor discovery techniques; therefore   modem implementations SHOULD announce available destinations via the Destination Up Message   rather than relying on Destination Announce Messages .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: o MAC Address ( Section 13.7 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

description: o IPv4 Attached Subnet ( Section 13.10 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet

:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Destination Announce Response Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item is in use by the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: If a modem is unable to report information immediately about the requested information -- for example   if the destination is not currently reachable -- the status code in the Status Data Item MUST be set to 2 ' Request Denied'; see Table 2 .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: o MAC Address ( Section 13.7 )
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Destination Update Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item is in use by the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The Destination Update Message MAY contain one or more of each of the following Data Items   with different values :
:LABEL: field
