description: o IPv4 Address ( Section 13.8 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: o IPv6 Address ( Section 13.9 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Attached Subnet
description: o IPv4 Attached Subnet ( Section 13.10 )
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: Metrics supplied in this Message overwrite metrics provided in a previously received Session Message   Destination Message   or Link Characteristics Message ( e.g .  Session Initialization   Destination Up   Link Characteristics Response ).
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Link Characteristics Request Message MAY contain either a Current Data Rate ( Receive ) ( CDRR ) or Current Data Rate ( Transmit ) ( CDRT ) Data Item to request a different data rate than is currently allocated   a Latency Data Item to request that traffic delay on the link not exceed the specified value   or both .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: o MAC Address ( Section 13.7 )
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Link Characteristics Response Message MAY contain one of each of the following Data Items   if the Data Item is in use by the session :
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The Link Characteristics Response Message MUST contain a complete set of metric Data Items   referencing all metrics declared in the Session Initialization Response Message ( Section 12.6 ). The values in the metric Data Items in the Link Characteristics Response Message MUST reflect the link characteristics after the request has been processed .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 1
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1 + Length of Text   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Status Code
description: Text : UTF-8 encoded string of Unicode [ RFC3629 ] characters   describing the cause   used for implementation-defined purposes . Since this field is used for description purposes   implementations SHOULD limit characters in this field to printable characters .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 2
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 5 ( or 7 if TCP Port Number included ).
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: IPv4 Address : The IPv4 address listening on the modem .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : Use TLS flag   indicating whether the TCP connection to the given address and port requires the use of TLS [ RFC5246 ] ( 1 ) or not ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Left for future assignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 3
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 17 ( or 19 if TCP Port Number included ).
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: IPv6 Address : The IPv6 address listening on the modem .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T : Use TLS flag   indicating whether the TCP connection to the given address and port requires the use of TLS [ RFC5246 ] ( 1 ) or not ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Left for future assignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 1 + Length of Description   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Description : UTF-8 encoded string of Unicode [ RFC3629 ] characters . For example   a satellite modem might set this variable to " Satellite terminal ". Since this Data Item is intended to provide additional information for display commands   sending implementations SHOULD limit the data to printable characters .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : Secured Medium flag   used by a modem to indicate whether the shared RF medium implements access control ( 1 ) or not ( 0 ). The Secured Medium flag only has meaning in Signals and Messages sent by a modem .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Left for future assignment .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Interval
description: The Heartbeat Interval Data Item is used to specify a period in milliseconds for Heartbeat Messages ( Section 12.20 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 5
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Heartbeat Interval : The interval in milliseconds   expressed as a 32-bit unsigned integer   for Heartbeat Messages . This value MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Heartbeat Interval
description: Heartbeat Interval : The interval in milliseconds   expressed as a 32-bit unsigned integer   for Heartbeat Messages . This value MUST NOT be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Length : Length of the Extensions List in octets . This is twice ( 2x ) the number of extensions .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Length of the Extensions List in octets . This is twice ( 2x ) the number of extensions .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: The MAC Address Data Item contains the address of the destination on the remote node .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 7
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 6 for EUI-48 format or 8 for EUI-64 format .
:LABEL: field

name: MAC Address
description: MAC Address : MAC address of the destination .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: When included in the Session Update Message   this Data Item contains the IPv4 address of the peer . When included in Destination Messages   this Data Item contains the IPv4 address of the destination . In either case   the Data Item also contains an indication of whether this is ( 1 ) a new or existing address or ( 2 ) a deletion of a previously known address .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 8
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 5
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Address
description: IPv4 Address : The IPv4 address of the destination or peer .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Add/Drop flag   indicating whether this is a new or existing address ( 1 ) or a withdrawal of an address ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: When included in the Session Update Message   this Data Item contains the IPv6 address of the peer . When included in Destination Messages   this Data Item contains the IPv6 address of the destination . In either case   the Data Item also contains an indication of whether this is ( 1 ) a new or existing address or ( 2 ) a deletion of a previously known address .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 9
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 17
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Address
description: IPv6 Address : The IPv6 address of the destination or peer .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Add/Drop flag   indicating whether this is a new or existing address ( 1 ) or a withdrawal of an address ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Attached Subnet
description: The DLEP IPv4 Attached Subnet Data Item allows a device to declare that it has an IPv4 subnet ( e.g .  a stub network ) attached   that it has become aware of an IPv4 subnet being present at a remote destination   or that it has become aware of the loss of a subnet at the remote destination .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 10
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 6
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Attached Subnet
description: Prefix Length : Length of the prefix ( 0-32 ) for the IPv4 subnet . A prefix length outside the specified range MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : Length of the prefix ( 0-32 ) for the IPv4 subnet . A prefix length outside the specified range MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Add/Drop flag   indicating whether this is a new or existing subnet address ( 1 ) or a withdrawal of a subnet address ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: The DLEP IPv6 Attached Subnet Data Item allows a device to declare that it has an IPv6 subnet ( e.g .  a stub network ) attached   that it has become aware of an IPv6 subnet being present at a remote destination   or that it has become aware of the loss of a subnet at the remote destination .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 11
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 18
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : Flags field   defined below .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Attached Subnet
description: Prefix Length : Length of the prefix ( 0-128 ) for the IPv6 subnet . A prefix length outside the specified range MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: Prefix Length : Length of the prefix ( 0-128 ) for the IPv6 subnet . A prefix length outside the specified range MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A : Add/Drop flag   indicating whether this is a new or existing subnet address ( 1 ) or a withdrawal of a subnet address ( 0 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : MUST be zero . Reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 12
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Maximum Data Rate ( Receive ): A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the maximum theoretical data rate   in bits per second   that can be achieved while receiving on the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 13
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Maximum Data Rate ( Transmit ): A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the maximum theoretical data rate   in bits per second   that can be achieved while transmitting on the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 14
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Current Data Rate ( Receive ): A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the current data rate   in bits per second   that can currently be achieved while receiving traffic on the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 15
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Current Data Rate ( Transmit ): A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the current data rate   in bits per second   that can currently be achieved while transmitting traffic on the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: The Latency Data Item is used to indicate the amount of latency   in microseconds   on the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 16
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Latency : A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the transmission delay   in microseconds   that a packet encounters as it is transmitted over the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Latency
description: Latency : A 64-bit unsigned integer   representing the transmission delay   in microseconds   that a packet encounters as it is transmitted over the link .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 17
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Resources : An 8-bit unsigned integer percentage   0-100   representing the amount of resources available . Any value greater than 100 MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 18
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Relative Link Quality ( Receive ): A non-dimensional unsigned 8-bit integer   0-100   representing relative quality of the link for receiving traffic . Any value greater than 100 MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 19
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Relative Link Quality ( Transmit ): A non-dimensional unsigned 8-bit integer   0-100   representing relative quality of the link for transmitting traffic . Any value greater than 100 MUST be considered as invalid .
:LABEL: field

name: MTU
description: The Maximum Transmission Unit ( MTU ) Data Item is used to indicate the maximum size   in octets   of an IP packet that can be transmitted without fragmentation   including headers   but excluding any lower-layer headers .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Item Type
description: Data Item Type : 20
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Maximum Transmission Unit : The maximum size   in octets   of an IP packet that can be transmitted without fragmentation   including headers   but excluding any lower-layer headers .
:LABEL: field

name: ASN
description: Join Metric : Field in the TSCH Synchronization IE representing the topological distance between the node sending the EB and the PAN coordinator .
:LABEL: field

name: Join Metric
description: Join Metric : Field in the TSCH Synchronization IE representing the topological distance between the node sending the EB and the PAN coordinator .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : The length   in octets   of the " Flags " and " Router - Fingerprint " fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The length   in octets   of the " Flags " and " Router - Fingerprint " fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags : 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : These flags MUST be set to zero and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Changes in the way IP header options are encoded allows for more efficient forwarding   less stringent limits on the length of options   and greater flexibility for introducing new options in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version 4-bit Internet Protocol version number = 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Traffic Class
description: Traffic Class 8-bit Traffic Class field . See Section 7 .
:LABEL: field

name: Flow Label
description: Flow Label 20-bit flow label . See Section 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: Payload Length 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of the IPv6 payload   i.e .  the rest of the packet following this IPv6 header   in octets . ( Note that any extension headers ( see Section 4 ) present are considered part of the payload   i.e .  included in the length count .)
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the IPv6 header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . Decremented by 1 by each node that forwards the packet . When forwarding   the packet is discarded if Hop Limit was zero when received or is decremented to zero . A node that is the destination of a packet should not discard a packet with Hop Limit equal to zero; it should process the packet normally .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Source Address 128-bit address of the originator of the packet . See [ RFC4291 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Two of the currently defined extension headers specified in this document -- the Hop-by-Hop Options header and the Destination Options header -- carry a variable number of " options " that are type-length - value ( TLV ) encoded in the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: Option Type 8-bit identifier of the type of option .
:LABEL: field

name: Opt Data Len
description: Opt Data Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Option Data field of this option   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Option Data
description: Option Data Variable-length field . Option-Type-specific data .
:LABEL: field

description: The three high-order bits described above are to be treated as part of the Option Type   not independent of the Option Type . That is   a particular option is identified by a full 8-bit Option Type   not just the low-order 5 bits of an Option Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Hop-by-Hop Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Hop-by-Hop Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options Variable-length field   of length such that the complete Hop-by-Hop Options header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long . Contains one or more TLV-encoded options   as described in Section 4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Routing header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Routing header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Routing Type
description: Routing Type 8-bit identifier of a particular Routing header variant .
:LABEL: field

name: Segments Left
description: Segments Left 8-bit unsigned integer . Number of route segments remaining   i.e .  number of explicitly listed intermediate nodes still to be visited before reaching the final destination .
:LABEL: field

name: type-specific data
description: type-specific data Variable-length field   of format determined by the Routing Type   and of length such that the complete Routing header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the initial header type of the Fragmentable Part of the original packet ( defined below ). Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 8-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: Fragment Offset 13-bit unsigned integer . The offset   in 8-octet units   of the data following this header   relative to the start of the Fragmentable Part of the original packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res 2-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification 32 bits . See description below .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the Destination Options header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Destination Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Options Variable-length field   of length such that the complete Destination Options header is an integer multiple of 8 octets long . Contains one or more TLV-encoded options   as described in Section 4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Options
description: Defining new IPv6 extension headers is not recommended   unless there are no existing IPv6 extension headers that can be used by specifying a new option for that IPv6 extension header . A proposal to specify a new IPv6 extension header must include a detailed technical explanation of why an existing IPv6 extension header can not be used for the desired new function . See [ RFC6564 ] for additional background information .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Header
description: Next Header 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of header immediately following the extension header . Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [ IANA-PN ].
:LABEL: field

name: Hdr Ext Len
description: Hdr Ext Len 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the Destination Options header in 8-octet units   not including the first 8 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Subcode
description: Subcode : the Error Subcode value MUST be one of the following values : 2 (" Administrative Shutdown ") or 4 (" Administrative Reset ").
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : this 8-bit field represents the length of the Shutdown Communication field in octets . The length value MUST range from 0 to 128 inclusive . When the length value is zero   no Shutdown Communication field follows .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C-VLAN : Customer VLAN identifier .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B If set to 1 in multihoming Single-Active scenarios   this flag indicates that the advertising PE is the backup PE .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C If set to 1   a control word [ RFC4448 ] MUST be present when sending EVPN packets to this PE . It is recommended that the control word be included in the absence of an entropy label [ RFC6790 ].
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P Advertising PE is the primary PE . B Advertising PE is the backup PE . C Control word [ RFC4448 ] MUST be present .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o To the virtual interconnection node group ( including Nodes F and A ): R1cW_F&A   R1aW_F&A   R1cP_F&A   R1aP_F&A
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o To the virtual interconnection node group ( including Nodes F and A ): R2cW_F&A   R2aW_F&A   R2cP_F&A   R2aP_F&A
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of the IKE packet   including the Length field and non-ESP marker .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length ( 2 octets   unsigned integer ) - Length of the ESP packet   including the Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Type
description: Gateway Type 12 ( decimal )
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Type
description: Gateway Type Acknowledgments are type 2 . Negative acknowledgments are type 10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Type
description: Gateway Type 8 for echo message; 0 for echo reply .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Type
description: Gateway Type 9
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 5
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : This contains an array of units of 32-bit flags with the most significant bit as 0 . Each bit represents one PCE capability .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U ( LSP-UPDATE-CAPABILITY - 1 bit ): if set to 1 by a PCC   the U flag indicates that the PCC allows modification of LSP parameters; if set to 1 by a PCE   the U flag indicates that the PCE is capable of
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: SRP-ID-number ( 32 bits ): The SRP-ID-number value in the scope of the current PCEP session uniquely identifies the operation that the PCE has requested the PCC to perform on a given LSP . The SRP-ID-number is incremented each time a new request is sent to the PCC   and it may wrap around .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: D ( Delegate - 1 bit ): On a PCRpt message   the D flag set to 1 indicates that the PCC is delegating the LSP to the PCE . On a PCUpd message   the D flag set to 1 indicates that the PCE is confirming the LSP delegation . To keep an LSP delegated to the PCE   the PCC must set the D flag to 1 on each PCRpt message for the duration of the delegation -- the first PCRpt with the D flag set to 0 revokes the delegation . To keep the delegation   the PCE must set the D flag to 1 on each PCUpd message for the duration of the delegation -- the first PCUpd with the D flag set to 0 returns the delegation .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D ( Delegate - 1 bit ): On a PCRpt message   the D flag set to 1 indicates that the PCC is delegating the LSP to the PCE . On a PCUpd message   the D flag set to 1 indicates that the PCE is confirming the LSP delegation . To keep an LSP delegated to the PCE   the PCC must set the D flag to 1 on each PCRpt message for the duration of the delegation -- the first PCRpt with the D flag set to 0 revokes the delegation . To keep the delegation   the PCE must set the D flag to 1 on each PCUpd message for the duration of the delegation -- the first PCUpd with the D flag set to 0 returns the delegation .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S ( SYNC - 1 bit ): The S flag MUST be set to 1 on each PCRpt sent from a PCC during State Synchronization . The S flag MUST be set to 0 in other messages sent from the PCC . When sending a PCUpd message   the PCE MUST set the S flag to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( Remove - 1 bit ): On PCRpt messages   the R flag indicates that the LSP has been removed from the PCC and the PCE SHOULD remove all state from its database . Upon receiving an LSP State Report with the R flag set to 1 for an RSVP-signaled LSP   the PCE SHOULD remove all state for the path identified by the LSP-IDENTIFIERS
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A ( Administrative - 1 bit ): On PCRpt messages   the A flag indicates the PCC's target operational status for this LSP . On PCUpd messages   the A flag indicates the LSP status that the PCE desires for this LSP . In both cases   a value of ' 1 ' means that the desired operational state is active   and a value of ' 0 ' means that the desired operational state is inactive . A PCC ignores the A flag on a PCUpd message unless the operator's policy allows the PCE to control the corresponding LSP's administrative state .
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O ( Operational - 3 bits ): On PCRpt messages   the O field represents the operational status of the LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Tunnel Sender Address
description: IPv4 Tunnel Sender Address : contains the sender node's IPv4 address   as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.2.1   for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv4 Sender Template Object .
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: LSP ID : contains the 16-bit ' LSP ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.2.1 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv4 Sender Template Object . A value of 0 MUST be used if the LSP is not yet signaled .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID : contains the 16-bit ' Tunnel ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.1.1 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv4 Session Object .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: Extended Tunnel ID : contains the 32-bit ' Extended Tunnel ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.1.1 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv4 Session Object .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Tunnel Endpoint Address
description: IPv4 Tunnel Endpoint Address : contains the egress node's IPv4 address   as defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.1.1   for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv4 Sender Template Object .
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: LSP ID : contains the 16-bit ' LSP ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.2.2 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv6 Sender Template Object . A value of 0 MUST be used if the LSP is not yet signaled .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: Tunnel ID : contains the 16-bit ' Tunnel ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.1.2 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv6 Session Object .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: Extended Tunnel ID : contains the 128-bit ' Extended Tunnel ID ' identifier defined in [ RFC3209 ]  Section 4.6.1.2 for the LSP_TUNNEL_IPv6 Session Object .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 16 bits ): indicates the total length of the TLV in octets and MUST be greater than 0 . The TLV MUST be zero-padded so that the TLV is 4-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): indicates the total length of the TLV in octets and MUST be greater than 0 . The TLV MUST be zero-padded so that the TLV is 4-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length ( 16 bits ): indicates the total length of the TLV in octets . The TLV MUST be zero-padded so that the TLV is 4-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): indicates the total length of the TLV in octets . The TLV MUST be zero-padded so that the TLV is 4-octet aligned .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( 24 bits ): This field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 8 bits ): Represents the bandwidth utilization type . Two values are currently defined .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type
:LABEL: field

name: GAL
description: The G-ACh Label ( GAL ) and the next 4 octets ( including the PW OAM Message field as the Channel Type ) are explained in Section 2.1 of [ RFC5586 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Session ID
description: A non-zero locally selected session number that is not preserved if the local PE restarts .
:LABEL: field

name: Ack Session ID
description: The Acknowledgment Session ID received from the remote PE .
:LABEL: field

name: Refresh Timer
description: A non-zero unsigned 16-bit integer value greater than or equal to 10   expressed in milliseconds   that indicates the desired refresh interval . The default value of 30000 is RECOMMENDED .
:LABEL: field

name: Total Message Length
description: Total length in octets of the Checksum   Message Type   Flags   Message Sequence Number   and Control Message Body . A value of zero means that no control message is present and   therefore   that no Checksum or subsequent fields are present either .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: A 16-bit field containing the one's complement of the one's complement sum of the entire message ( including the G-ACh header )  with the Checksum field replaced by zero for the purpose of computing the checksum . An all-zero value means that no checksum was transmitted . Note that when the checksum is not computed   the header of the bundle message will not be covered by any checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Sequence Number
description: An unsigned 16-bit integer that is started from 1 when the protocol enters the ACTIVE state . The sequence number wraps back to 1 when the maximum value is reached . The value 0 is reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Type
description: The type of control message that follows . Control message types are allocated in this document and by IANA .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: Upon receipt of an unknown message or TLV   if U is clear ( 0 )  a notification message with code " Unknown TLV ( U-Bit=0 )" ( code 0x4 ) MUST be sent to the remote PE   and the keepalive session MUST be terminated by entering the STARTUP state; if U is set ( 1 )  the unknown message   or message containing an unknown TLV   MUST be acknowledged and silently ignored   and the following messages   or TLVs   if any   processed as if the unknown message or TLV did not exist . In this case   the PE MAY send back a single notification message per keepalive session with code " Unknown TLV ( U-Bit=1 )". This last step is OPTIONAL .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: The C-Bit is used to signal the end of PW configuration transmission . If it is set   the sending PE has finished sending all of its current configuration information .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: The remaining 6 bits of PW status refresh reduction Message Flags to be allocated by IANA . These unallocated bits MUST be set to 0 on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Control Message Body
description: The Control Message Body is defined in Section 5 and is specific to the type of message .
:LABEL: field

name: MPLS-TP Tunnel ID
description: This TLV contains the MPLS-TP Tunnel ID (" MPLS-TP " stands for " MPLS Transport Profile "). When the configuration message is used for a particular keepalive session   the MPLS-TP Tunnel ID sub-TLV MUST be sent at least once .
:LABEL: field

name: PW Configuration Message Sub-TLVs
description: IANA has set up the " PW Status Refresh Reduction Configuration Message Sub-TLVs " registry . This registry contains 8-bit values . Type values 1 through 3 are defined in this document . Type values 4 through 64 and 128 through 254 are to be assigned by IANA using the " Expert Review " policy defined in [ RFC8126 ]. Type values 65 through 127   0   and 255 are to be allocated using the " IETF Review " policy defined in [ RFC8126 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Option Type
description: 0x0F
:LABEL: field

name: Option Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer . Length of the option   in octets   excluding the Option Type and Option Length fields . This field MUST be set to 10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Delta Time Last Received
description: 16-bit unsigned integer . The value is set according to the scale in SCALEDTLR .
:LABEL: field

name: Delta Time Last Sent
description: 16-bit unsigned integer . The value is set according to the scale in SCALEDTLS .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type ( 2 octets ): This field indicates the type and structure of the information contained in the Value field .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 2 octets ): This field MUST be set to the size   in octets ( bytes )  of the Value field . The value of the field MUST be zero or divisible by 4 . Note that this implies that the Value field can be omitted or contain padding .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: Res : 4 bits These bits are reserved . They MUST be set to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: TSN
description: TSN : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) This value represents the TSN for this I-DATA chunk . Same as the TSN for DATA chunks   as specified in [ RFC4960 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier
description: Stream Identifier : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) Identifies the stream to which the user data belongs . Same as the Stream Identifier for DATA chunks   as specified in [ RFC4960 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) This field is reserved . It MUST be set to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Identifier
description: Message Identifier ( MID ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) The MID is the same for all fragments of a user message; it is used to determine which fragments ( enumerated by the FSN ) belong to the same user message . For ordered user messages   the MID is also used by the SCTP receiver to deliver the user messages in the correct order to the upper layer ( similar to the SSN of the DATA chunk defined in [ RFC4960 ]). The sender uses two counters for each outgoing stream : one for ordered messages and one for unordered messages . All of these counters are independent and initially 0 . They are incremented by 1 for each user message . Please note that the serial number arithmetic defined in [ RFC1982 ] using SERIAL_BITS = 32 applies . Therefore   the sender MUST NOT have more than 2**31 - 1 ordered messages for each outgoing stream in flight and MUST NOT have more than 2**31 - 1 unordered messages for each outgoing stream in flight . A message is considered in flight if at least one of its I-DATA chunks is not acknowledged in a way that cannot be reneged ( i.e .  not acknowledged by the cumulative TSN Ack ). Please note that the MID is in " network byte order "  a.k.a . Big Endian .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Protocol Identifier
description: Payload Protocol Identifier ( PPID ) / Fragment Sequence Number ( FSN ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) If the B bit is set   this field contains the PPID of the user message . Note that in this case   this field is not touched by an SCTP implementation; therefore   its byte order is not necessarily in network byte order . The upper layer is responsible for any byte order conversions to this field   similar to the PPID of DATA chunks . In this case   the FSN is implicitly considered to be 0 . If the B bit is not set   this field contains the FSN . The FSN is used to enumerate all fragments of a single user message   starting from 0 and incremented by 1 . The last fragment of a message MUST have the E bit set . Note that the FSN MAY wrap completely multiple times   thus allowing arbitrarily large user messages . For the FSN   the serial number arithmetic defined in [ RFC1982 ] applies with SERIAL_BITS = 32 . Therefore   a sender MUST NOT have more than 2**31 - 1 fragments of a single user message in flight . A fragment is considered in flight if it is not acknowledged in a way that cannot be reneged . Please note that the FSN is in " network byte order "  a.k.a . Big Endian .
:LABEL: field

name: New Cumulative TSN
description: New Cumulative TSN : 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) This indicates the New Cumulative TSN to the data receiver . Same as the New Cumulative TSN for FORWARD TSN chunks   as specified in [ RFC3758 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Stream Identifier
description: Stream Identifier ( SID ): 16 bits ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the stream number this entry refers to .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : 15 bits This field is reserved . It MUST be set to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Message Identifier
description: Message Identifier ( MID ): 32 bits ( unsigned integer ) This field holds the largest Message Identifier for ordered or unordered messages indicated by the U bit that was skipped for the stream specified by the Stream Identifier . For ordered messages   this is similar to the FORWARD-TSN chunk   just replacing the 16-bit SSN by the 32-bit MID .
:LABEL: field

description: In describing the Exterior Gateway Protocol   we have
:LABEL: field

description: Hello  messages from sources other than direct neighbors
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Downstream Bypass Assignment . Value is 38 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The length is 8 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Bypass Tunnel ID
description: The bypass tunnel identifier ( 16 bits ).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Downstream Bypass Assignment . Value is 39 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The Length contains the total length of the subobject in bytes   including the Type and Length fields . The length is 20 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Bypass Tunnel ID
description: The bypass tunnel identifier ( 16 bits ).
:LABEL: field

name: E1
description: The bits marked " E1 " and " E2 " control the presence of the field " Ext . SetID " and the presence of the field " Ext . Sequence Number "  respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: The bits marked " E1 " and " E2 " control the presence of the field " Ext . SetID " and the presence of the field " Ext . Sequence Number "  respectively .
:LABEL: field

name: SetID Lookup
description: This field acts as a lookup field for the SetIDs and provides shortcuts to often used SetIDs . Four values are defined :
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The length field has a fixed length of 10 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Due to the low sampling rate in typical WSNs   the " Sequence Number " field is only one byte long . However   some applications may have a large quantity of records per packet . In this case   the sequence field can be extended to 16 bit by setting the E2-bit to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The " Length " Field contains the total length of the TinyIPFIX Set   including the TinyIPFIX Set Header .
:LABEL: field

name: Field Count
description: The number of fields placed in the TinyIPFIX Template Record .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Enterprise bit . This is the first bit of the Field Specifier . If this bit is zero   the Information Element Identifier identifies an IETF-specified Information Element   and the four-octet Enterprise Number field MUST NOT be present . If this bit is one   the Information Element Identifier identifies an enterprise-specific Information Element   and the Enterprise Number field MUST be present .
:LABEL: field

name: Field Length
description: The length of the corresponding encoded Information Element   in octets . Refer to [ RFC7012 ]. The value 65535 is illegal in TinyIPFIX   as variable-length Information Elements are not supported .
:LABEL: field

name: Enterprise Number
description: IANA Private Enterprise Number of the authority defining the Information Element identifier in this Template Record .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: The IPFIX Message Length can only be calculated after the complete TinyIPFIX Message has been translated . The new length can be calculated by adding the length of the IPFIX Message Header   which is 16 octets   and the length of all Sets that are contained in the IPFIX Message .
:LABEL: field

name: Export Time
description: The " Export Time " MUST be generated by the Mediator   and contains the time in seconds since 00:00 UTC Jan 1   1970   at which the IPFIX Message leaves the Mediator .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: If the TinyIPFIX Sequence Number has a length of 4 octets   the original value MUST be used for the IPFIX Message . If the TinyIPFIX Sequence Number has a size of one or two octets   the TinyIPFIX Mediator MUST expand the TinyIPFIX Sequence Number into a four octet field . If the TinyIPFIX Sequence Number was omitted   the Mediator needs to calculate the Sequence Number as per [ RFC7011 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Template ID
description: The field needs to be expanded from one octet to two octets . The Template ID needs to be increased by a value of 128 .
:LABEL: field

name: Field Count
description: The field needs to be expanded from one octet to 2 octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : MAG Multipath Binding ( 63 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : MAG Multipath Binding ( 63 )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: If-ATT
description: This 8-bit field identifies the Access-Technology type of the interface through which the mobile node is connected . The permitted values for this are from the Access Technology Type registry < https://www.iana.org/assignments/mobility-parameters /> defined in [ RFC5213 ].
:LABEL: field

name: If-Label
description: This 8-bit unsigned integer represents the interface label .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: If set to a value of ( 1 )  this flag notifies the LMA to consider this as a request to update the binding lifetime of all the mobile node's bindings upon accepting this specific request . The ( B ) flag MUST NOT be set to a value of ( 1 ) if the value of the Registration Overwrite ( O ) flag is set to a value of ( 1 ).
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: This flag   if set to a value of ( 1 )  notifies the LMA that upon accepting this request   it should replace all of the mobile node's existing bindings with this binding . This flag MUST NOT be set to a value of ( 1 ) if the value of the Bulk Re-registration Flag ( B ) is set to a value of ( 1 ). This flag MUST be set to a value of ( 0 ) in De-Registration requests .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is unused in this specification . The value MUST be set to zero ( 0 ) by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : MAG Identifier ( 64 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : MAG Identifier ( 64 )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: 8-bit unsigned integer indicating the length of the option in octets   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Subtype
description: One-byte unsigned integer used for identifying the type of the Identifier field . Accepted values for this field are the registered type values from the " Mobile Node Identifier Option Subtypes " registry < https://www.iana.org/assignments/mobility - parameters />.
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: This field is unused in this specification . The value MUST be set to zero ( 0 ) by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I ( LSP-INSTANTIATION-CAPABILITY -- 1 bit ): If set to 1 by a PCC   the I flag indicates that the PCC allows instantiation of an LSP by a PCE . If set to 1 by a PCE   the I flag indicates that the PCE supports instantiating LSPs . The LSP-INSTANTIATION-CAPABILITY flag must be set by both the PCC and PCE in order to enable PCE-initiated LSP instantiation .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R ( LSP-REMOVE -- 1 bit ): If set to 0   it indicates a request to create an LSP . If set to 1   it indicates a request to remove an LSP .
:LABEL: field

name: Switching Type
description: Switching Type ( 8 bits ): see [ RFC3471 ] for a description of parameters .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding
description: A PCC may want to specify a Switching Capability   but not an Encoding . In this case   the Encoding MUST be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding
description: Optional TLVs : Optional TLVs MAY be included within the object to specify more specific server-layer path information ( e.g .  traffic parameters ). Such TLVs will be defined by other documents .
:LABEL: field

name: Optional TLVs
description: Optional TLVs : Optional TLVs MAY be included within the object to specify more specific server-layer path information ( e.g .  traffic parameters ). Such TLVs will be defined by other documents .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 Prefix
description: This field carries the IPv4 Prefix to which the Segment ID is assigned . In case of an Anycast Segment ID   this field will carry the IPv4 Anycast address . If the prefix is shorter than 32 bits   trailing bits SHOULD be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: The Prefix Length field is one octet . It gives the length of the prefix in bits ( values can be 1-32 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: This field is set to 1   if the responder MUST perform FEC validation using OSPF as the IGP protocol . Set to 2   if the responder MUST perform Egress FEC validation using the Intermediate System to Intermediate System ( IS-IS ) as the IGP protocol . Set to 0   if the responder can use any IGP protocol for Egress FEC validation .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: The Reserved field MUST be set to 0 when sent and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6 Prefix
description: This field carries the IPv6 prefix to which the Segment ID is assigned . In case of an Anycast Segment ID   this field will carry the IPv4 Anycast address . If the prefix is shorter than 128 bits   trailing bits SHOULD be set to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Prefix Length
description: The Prefix Length field is one octet   it gives the length of the prefix in bits ( values can be 1-128 ).
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: Set to 1 if the responder MUST perform FEC validation using OSPF as the IGP protocol . Set to 2 if the responder MUST perform Egress FEC validation using IS-IS as the IGP protocol . Set to 0 if the responder can use any IGP protocol for Egress FEC validation .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be set to 0 on send and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Adj . Type
description: Set to 1 when the Adjacency Segment is a Parallel Adjacency as defined in [ SR ]. Set to 4 when the Adjacency Segment is IPv4 based and is not a Parallel Adjacency . Set to 6 when the Adjacency Segment is IPv6 based and is not a Parallel Adjacency . Set to 0 when the Adjacency Segment is over an unnumbered interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Protocol
description: Set to 1 if the responder MUST perform FEC validation using OSPF as the IGP protocol . Set to 2 if the responder MUST perform Egress FEC validation using IS-IS as the IGP protocol . Set to 0 if the responder can use any IGP protocol for Egress FEC validation .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: MUST be set to 0 on send and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Base Header
description: Base Header : Provides information about the service header and the payload protocol .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Path Header
description: Service Path Header : Provides path identification and location within a service path .
:LABEL: field

name: TTL
description: TTL : Indicates the maximum SFF hops for an SFP . This field is used for service-plane loop detection . The initial TTL value SHOULD be configurable via the control plane; the configured initial value can be specific to one or more SFPs . If no initial value is explicitly provided   the default initial TTL value of 63 MUST be used . Each SFF involved in forwarding an NSH packet MUST decrement the TTL value by 1 prior to NSH forwarding lookup . Decrementing by 1 from an incoming value of 0 shall result in a TTL value of 63 . The packet MUST NOT be forwarded if TTL is   after decrement   0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The total length   in 4-byte words   of the NSH including the Base Header   the Service Path Header   the Fixed-Length Context Header   or Variable-Length Context Header(s ). The length MUST be 0x6 for MD Type 0x1   and it MUST be 0x2 or greater for MD Type 0x2 . The length of the Network Service Header MUST be an integer multiple of 4 bytes; thus   variable-length metadata is always padded out to a multiple of 4 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Metadata ( MD ) Type : Indicates the format of the NSH beyond the mandatory NSH Base Header and the Service Path Header . MD Type defines the format of the metadata being carried . Please see the IANA Considerations in Section 9.1.3 .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Protocol
description: Next Protocol : Indicates the protocol type of the encapsulated data . The NSH does not alter the inner payload   and the semantics on the inner protocol remain unchanged due to NSH SFC . Please see the IANA Considerations in Section 9.1.6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Path Header
description: Figure 4 shows the format of the Service Path Header :
:LABEL: field

name: Service Path Identifier
description: Service Path Identifier ( SPI ): 24 bits Service Index ( SI ): 8 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Service Path Identifier
description: Service Path Identifier ( SPI ): Uniquely identifies a Service Function Path ( SFP ). Participating nodes MUST use this identifier for SFP selection . The initial Classifier MUST set the appropriate SPI for a given classification result .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Index
description: Service Index ( SI ): Provides location within the SFP . The initial Classifier for a given SFP SHOULD set the SI to 255; however   the control plane MAY configure the initial value of the SI as appropriate ( i.e .  taking into account the length of the SFP ). The Service Index MUST be decremented by a value of 1 by Service Functions or by SFC Proxy nodes after performing required services; the new decremented SI value MUST be used in the egress packet's NSH . The initial Classifier MUST send the packet to the first SFF in the identified SFP for forwarding along an SFP . If re-classification occurs   and that re-classification results in a new SPI   the ( re-)Classifier is   in effect   the initial Classifier for the resultant SPI .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata Class
description: Metadata Class ( MD Class ): Defines the scope of the Type field to provide a hierarchical namespace . Section 9.1.4 defines how the MD Class values can be allocated to standards bodies   vendors   and others .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Indicates the explicit type of metadata being carried . The definition of the Type is the responsibility of the MD Class owner .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Indicates the length of the variable-length metadata   in bytes . In case the metadata length is not an integer number of 4-byte words   the sender MUST add pad bytes immediately following the last metadata byte to extend the metadata to an integer number of 4-byte words . The receiver MUST round the Length field up to the nearest 4-byte-word boundary   to locate and process the next field in the packet . The receiver MUST access only those bytes in the metadata indicated by the Length field ( i.e .  actual number of bytes ) and MUST ignore the remaining bytes up to the nearest 4-byte-word boundary . The length may be 0 or greater .
:LABEL: field

name: Service Path Identifier
description: Metadata information may influence the service path selection since the Service Path Identifier values can represent the result of classification . A given SPI can be defined based on classification results ( including metadata classification ). The imposition of the SPI and SI results in the packet being placed on the newly specified SFP at the position indicated by the imposed SPI and SI .
:LABEL: field

name: U
description: U-bit : The unknown TLV bit MUST be 1 . A router that does not recognize the MRT Capability TLV will silently ignore the TLV and process the rest of the message as if the unknown TLV did not exist .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F-bit : The forward unknown TLV bit MUST be 0 as required by Section 3 of [ RFC5561 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-bit : The State bit MUST be 1 if used in the LDP Initialization message . MAY be set to 0 or 1 in the dynamic Capability message to advertise or withdraw the capability   respectively   as described in [ RFC5561 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Length ( Len ): 4-bit unsigned integer . A value between 0 and 12 inclusive indicates the length of the message in bytes   starting with the first bit of the Options field . Three values are reserved for special constructs :
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len = 0 -------> 0x01 TKL = 1 ___/ Code = 7.02 Ping --> 0xe2 Token = 0x42
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len = 0 -------> 0x01 TKL = 1 ___/ Code = 7.03 Pong --> 0xe3 Token = 0x42
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 0x000A   16 bits
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 2 octets ( 16 bits )
:LABEL: field

name: Availability level
description: This field is a binary32-format floating-point number as defined by [ IEEE754-2008 ]. The bytes are transmitted in network order; that is   the byte containing the sign bit is transmitted first . This field describes the decimal value of the availability guarantee of the Switching Capability in the Interface Switching Capability Descriptor object [ RFC4202 ]. The value MUST be less than 1 . The Availability level field is usually expressed as the value 0.99/0.999/0.9999/0.99999 .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker bit ( M ): 1 bit The marker bit set to " 1 " indicates the last ANC data RTP packet for a frame ( for progressive scan video ) or the last ANC data RTP packet for a field ( for interlaced video ).
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Sequence Number
description: Extended Sequence Number : 16 bits The high-order bits of the extended 32-bit sequence number   in network byte order . This is the same as the Extended Sequence Number field in RFC 4175 [ RFC4175 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16 bits Number of octets of the ANC data RTP payload   beginning with the " C " bit of the first ANC packet data header   as an unsigned integer in network byte order . Note that all word_align fields contribute to the calculation of the Length field .
:LABEL: field

name: ANC_Count
description: ANC_Count : 8 bits This field is the count of the total number of ANC data packets carried in the RTP payload   as an unsigned integer . A single ANC data RTP packet payload cannot carry more than 255 ANC data packets .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 2 bits These two bits relate to signaling the field specified by the RTP timestamp in an interlaced SDI raster . A value of 0b00 indicates that either the video format is progressive or that no field is specified . A value of 0b10 indicates that the timestamp refers to the first field of an interlaced video signal . A value of 0b11 indicates that the timestamp refers to the second field of an interlaced video signal . The value 0b01 is not valid . Receivers SHOULD ignore an ANC data packet with an F field value of 0b01 and SHOULD process any other ANC data packets with valid F field values that are present in the RTP payload .
:LABEL: field

name: reserved
description: reserved : 22 bits The 22 reserved bits of value " 0 " follow the F field to ensure that the first ANC data packet header field in the payload begins 32-bit word-aligned with the start of the RTP header to ease implementation .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : 1 bit This flag   when set to " 1 "  indicates that the ANC data corresponds to the color-difference data channel ( C ). When set to " 0 "  this flag indicates either that the ANC data corresponds to the luma ( Y ) data channel   that the ANC data source is from an SD signal   or that the ANC data source has
:LABEL: field

name: Line_Number
description: Line_Number : 11 bits This field contains the digital interface line number that corresponds to the location of the ANC data packet as an unsigned integer in network byte order .
:LABEL: field

name: Horizontal_Offset
description: Horizontal_Offset : 12 bits This field defines the location of the ANC data packet in an SDI raster relative to the start of active video ( SAV ; a digital synchronizing signal present in SDI interfaces ) as an unsigned integer in network byte order . A value of 0 means that the ADF of the ANC data packet begins immediately
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S ( Data Stream Flag ): 1 bit This field indicates whether the data stream number of a multi-stream data mapping used to transport the ANC data packet is specified . If the S bit is ' 0 '  then the StreamNum field provides no guidance regarding the source data stream number of the ANC data packet . If the S bit is ' 1 '  then the StreamNum field carries information regarding the source data stream number of the ANC data packet .
:LABEL: field

name: StreamNum
description: StreamNum : 7 bits If the S bit ( Data Stream Flag ) is ' 1 '  then the StreamNum field MUST carry identification of the source data stream number of the ANC data packet . If the data stream is numbered   then the StreamNum field SHALL carry the number of the source data stream minus one . If the source multi-stream interface does not have numbered data streams   the following numbers SHALL be used in this field : ' 0 ' for link A data stream and ' 1 ' for link B data stream . For stereoscopic multi-stream interface formats that do not have numbered streams   the following numbers SHALL be used in this field : ' 0 ' for left eye stream and ' 1 ' for right eye stream .
:LABEL: field

name: DID
description: DID : 10 bits Data identification word
:LABEL: field

name: SDID
description: SDID : 10 bits Secondary data identification word . Used only for a " Type 2 " ANC data packet . Note that in a " Type 1 " ANC data packet   this word will actually carry the data block number ( DBN ).
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum_Word
description: Checksum_Word : 10 bits The Checksum_Word can be used to determine the validity of the ANC data packet from the DID word through the UDW . It consists of 10 bits   where bits b8 ( MSB ) through b0 ( LSB ) define the checksum value and bit b9 is the inverse ( logical NOT ) of bit b8 . The checksum value is equal to the nine least significant bits of the sum of the nine least significant bits of the DID word   the SDID word   the Data_Count word   and all User_Data_Words in the ANC data packet . The checksum is initialized to zero before calculation   and any " end carry " resulting from the checksum calculation is ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: word_align
description: word_align : bits as needed to complete 32-bit word Word_align contains enough " 0 " bits as needed to complete the last 32-bit word of an ANC data packet in the RTP payload . If an ANC data packet in the RTP payload ends and is aligned with a word boundary   there is no need to add any word alignment bits . Word align SHALL be used even for the last ANC data packet in an RTP packet . Word align SHALL NOT be used if there are zero ANC data packets being carried in the RTP packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Extended Echo Request . The value for ICMPv4 is 42 . The value for ICMPv6 is 160 .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Code : MUST be set to 0 and MUST be ignored upon receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: o Identifier : An Identifier to aid in matching Extended Echo Replies to Extended Echo Requests . May be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: o Identifier : An Identifier to aid in matching Extended Echo Replies to Extended Echo Requests . May be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: o Sequence Number : A Sequence Number to aid in matching Extended Echo Replies to Extended Echo Requests . May be 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o L ( local ): The L-bit is set if the probed interface resides on the proxy node . The L-bit is clear if the probed interface is directly connected to the proxy node .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: o L ( local ): The L-bit is set if the probed interface resides on the proxy node . The L-bit is clear if the probed interface is directly connected to the proxy node .
:LABEL: field

name: AFI
description: o Address Family Identifier ( AFI ): This 16-bit field identifies the type of address represented by the Address field . All values found in the IANA registry of Address Family Numbers ( available from < https://www.iana.org/assignments/address-family-numbers >) are valid in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Length
description: o Address Length : Number of significant bytes contained by the Address field . ( The Address field contains significant bytes and padding bytes .)
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Address : This variable-length field represents an address associated with the probed interface . If the address field would not otherwise terminate on a 32-bit boundary   it MUST be padded with zeroes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : Extended Echo Reply . The value for ICMPv4 is 43 . The value for ICMPv6 is 161 .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: o Code : Values are ( 0 ) No Error   ( 1 ) Malformed Query   ( 2 ) No Such Interface   ( 3 ) No Such Table Entry   and ( 4 ) Multiple Interfaces Satisfy Query .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: o Identifier : Copied from the Identifier field of the invoking Extended Echo Request packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: o Identifier : Copied from the Identifier field of the invoking Extended Echo Request packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: o Sequence Number : Copied from the Sequence Number field of the invoking Extended Echo Request packet .
:LABEL: field

name: State
description: o State : If Code is not equal to 0   this field MUST be set to 0 and ignored upon receipt . Likewise   if the probed interface resides upon the proxy node   this field MUST be set to 0 and ignored upon receipt . Otherwise   this field reflects the state of the ARP table or Neighbor Cache entry associated with the probed interface . Values are ( 0 ) Reserved   ( 1 ) Incomplete   ( 2 ) Reachable   ( 3 ) Stale   ( 4 ) Delay   ( 5 ) Probe   and ( 6 ) Failed .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: o A ( Active ): The A-bit is set if the Code is equal to 0   the probed interface resides on the proxy node   and the probed interface is active . Otherwise   the A-bit is clear .
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: o A ( Active ): The A-bit is set if the Code is equal to 0   the probed interface resides on the proxy node   and the probed interface is active . Otherwise   the A-bit is clear .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R-PE : Root PE ( ingress PE   PE initiating P2MP PW setup )
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S-PE : Switching Provider Edge ( of MS-PW )
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4
:LABEL: field

name: AC
description: Access Controller ( AC ): The network entity that provides WTP access to the network infrastructure in the data plane   control plane   management plane   or a combination therein .
:LABEL: field

name: WTP
description: Wireless Termination Point ( WTP ): The physical or network entity that contains a Radio Frequency ( RF ) antenna and wireless Physical layer ( PHY ) to transmit and receive station traffic for wireless access networks .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Length : The length in bytes; two bytes for each Alternative Tunnel-Type that is included
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : The length in bytes; two bytes for each Alternative Tunnel-Type that is included
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : 55 for Alternate Tunnel Encapsulations Type
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Tunnel-Type : The Tunnel-Type is specified by a 2-byte value . This specification defines the values from 0 to 6 as given below . The remaining values are reserved for future use .
:LABEL: field

name: Info Element
description: o Info Element : This field contains tunnel-specific configuration parameters to enable the WTP to set up the alternate tunnel . This specification provides details for this element for CAPWAP   PMIPv6   and GRE . This specification reserves the tunnel type values for the key tunnel types and defines the most common message elements . It is anticipated that message elements for the other protocols ( like L2TPv3 ) will be defined in other specifications in the future .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: o Type : 1062 for IEEE 802.11 WTP Alternate Tunnel Failure Indication
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between 1 and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: WLAN ID
description: o WLAN ID : An 8-bit value specifying the WLAN Identifier . The value MUST be between 1 and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: o Status : An 8-bit boolean indicating whether the radio failure is being reported or cleared . A value of 0 is used to clear the event   while a value of 1 is used to report the event .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: o Reserved : MUST be set to a value of 0 and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : A set of reserved bits for future use . All implementations complying with this protocol MUST set to 0 any bits that are reserved in the version of the protocol supported by that implementation . Receivers MUST ignore all bits not defined for the version of the protocol they support .
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : DTLS-Enabled Data Channel Supported ( see [ RFC5415 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C : Clear Text Data Channel Supported ( see [ RFC5415 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: AR Information : This means Access Router Information Element . In this context   each address in AR Information MUST be one of previously specified AR addresses .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: P : When set   the WTP is to employ the IEEE 802.1p QoS mechanism ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: P : When set   the WTP is to employ the IEEE 802.1p QoS mechanism ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Q
description: Q : When the ' P ' bit is set   the ' Q ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how IEEE 802.1p QoS is to be enforced ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : When set   the WTP is to employ the DSCP QoS mechanism ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: O
description: O : When the ' D ' bit is set   the ' O ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how Differentiated Services Code Point ( DSCP ) QoS is to be enforced on the outer ( tunneled ) header ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : When the ' D ' bit is set   the ' I ' bit is used by the AC to communicate to the WTP how DSCP QoS is to be enforced on the station's packet ( inner ) header ( see [ RFC5416 ]).
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 4
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Transport : The transport to use for the CAPWAP Data Channel . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Transport
description: Transport : The transport to use for the CAPWAP Data Channel . The following enumerated values are supported :
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: GRE Key
description: GRE Key : The Key field contains a 4-octet number that is inserted by the WTP according to [ RFC2890 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : This refers to the total length in octets of the element excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Minimum IPv6 MTU
description: Minimum IPv6 MTU : The field contains a 2-octet number indicating the minimum IPv6 MTU in the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Source Port
description: Downstream Source Port : This is the UDP port that the downstream device uses when forwarding Relay-forward messages to this relay agent device . This UDP port is to be used by this relay agent device when forwarding the Relay-reply messages to that downstream device .
:LABEL: field

name: SubOpt Code
description: SubOpt Code : SUBOPT_RELAY_PORT . 8-bit value   19 .
:LABEL: field

name: Len
description: Len : 8-bit value to be set to 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Downstream Source Port
description: Downstream Source Port : 16-bit value . To be set by the IPv6 relay either to the downstream relay agent's UDP source port used for the UDP packet   or to zero if only the local relay agent uses the non-DHCP UDP port ( not 547 ).
:LABEL: field

name: C.S .
description: o Channel Spacing ( C.S .): as defined in [ RFC7699 ] for flexi-grid   is set to 5 to denote 6.25 GHz .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length ( 16 bits ): The length of the value field of this sub-TLV in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Priority
description: Priority ( 8 bits ): A bitmap used to indicate which priorities are being advertised . The bitmap is in ascending order   with the leftmost bit representing priority level 0 ( i.e .  the highest ) and the rightmost bit representing priority level 7 ( i.e .  the lowest ). A bit is set ( 1 ) corresponding to each priority represented in the sub-TLV and clear ( 0 ) for each priority not represented in the sub - TLV . At least one priority level MUST be advertised . If only one priority level is advertised   it MUST be at priority level 0 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The Reserved field MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Max Slot Width at Priority k
description: Max Slot Width at Priority k ( 16 bits ): This field indicates maximal frequency slot width supported at a particular priority level   up to 8 . This field is set to max frequency slot width supported in the unit of 2*C.S .  for a particular priority level . One field MUST be present for each bit set in the Priority field   and each present field is ordered to match the Priority field . Fields MUST be present for priority levels that are indicated in the Priority field .
:LABEL: field

name: Unreserved Padding
description: Unreserved Padding ( 16 bits ): The Padding field is used to ensure the 32-bit alignment of Max Slot Width at Priority k . When k is an odd number   the Unreserved Padding field MUST be included . When k is an even number   the Unreserved Padding field MUST be omitted . This field MUST be set to 0 and MUST be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: C.S .
description: Starting n ( 16 bits ): As defined in [ RFC7699 ]. This value denotes the starting point of the nominal central frequency of the frequency availability bitmap sub-TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: Starting n
description: Starting n ( 16 bits ): As defined in [ RFC7699 ]. This value denotes the starting point of the nominal central frequency of the frequency availability bitmap sub-TLV .
:LABEL: field

name: No . of Effective Bits
description: No . of Effective Bits ( 12 bits ): Indicates the number of effective bits in the Bitmap field .
:LABEL: field

name: MatrixID
description: RstType ( Restriction Type   8 bits ): Takes the value of 5 to indicate the restrictions on a port to support flexi-grid .
:LABEL: field

name: Switching Cap
description: Switching Cap ( Switching Capability   8 bits ): As defined in [ RFC7579 ]  MUST be consistent with the one specified in ISCD as described in Section 4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Encoding
description: Encoding ( 8 bits ): As defined in [ RFC7579 ]  MUST be consistent with the one specified in ISCD as described in Section 4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: C.S .
description: C.S . ( 4 bits ): As defined in [ RFC7699 ]. For flexi-grid   it is 5 to denote 6.25 GHz .
:LABEL: field

name: C.F.G
description: C.F.G ( Central Frequency Granularity   8 bits ): A positive integer . Its value indicates the multiple of C.S .  in terms of central frequency granularity .
:LABEL: field

name: S.W.G
description: S.W.G ( Slot Width Granularity   8 bits ): A positive integer . Its value indicates the multiple of 2*C.S .  in terms of slot width granularity .
:LABEL: field

name: Min Slot Width
description: Min Slot Width ( 16 bits ): A positive integer . Its value indicates the multiple of 2*C.S . ( in GHz )  in terms of the supported minimal slot width .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : The Reserved field MUST be set to zero on transmission and SHOULD be ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: PIM Version   Reserved   and Checksum : As specified in [ RFC7761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: PIM Version   Reserved   and Checksum : As specified in [ RFC7761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: [ N]o-Forward bit : When set   this bit means that the PFM message is not to be forwarded . This bit is defined to prevent Bootstrap message forwarding in [ RFC5059 ].
:LABEL: field

name: N
description: [ N]o-Forward bit : When set   this bit means that the PFM message is not to be forwarded . This bit is defined to prevent Bootstrap message forwarding in [ RFC5059 ].
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: [ T]ransitive bit : Each TLV in the message includes a bit called the " Transitive " bit that controls whether the TLV is forwarded by routers that do not support the given type . See Section 3.4.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : This TLV has type 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Group Address : The group that sources are to be announced for . The format for this address is given in the Encoded-Group format in [ RFC7761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Src Count
description: Src Count : The number of source addresses that are included .
:LABEL: field

name: Src Holdtime
description: Src Address : The source address for the corresponding group . The format for these addresses is given in the Encoded-Unicast address in [ RFC7761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: V
description: V : The version number of the MT Label . This document specifies version zero .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : A 2-bit reserved field that MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 7
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 8
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : Remote IPv4 address . The remote IPv4 address is used to identify a particular link on the remote side when there are multiple parallel links between two nodes .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 9
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : 4 octets of the Local Interface ID followed by 4 octets of the Remote Interface ID .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 8
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 0
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 1121
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 0
:LABEL: field

name: CID
description: CID - Company Identifier [ 802 ]
:LABEL: field

name: OUI
description: OUI - Organizationally Unique Identifier [ RFC7042 ]
:LABEL: field

name: OUI
description: OUI : When the bottom two bits of the first byte of the Vendor ID are zero ( that is   the first byte is 0bXXXXXX00 )  the Vendor ID is an OUI .
:LABEL: field

name: CID
description: CID : When the bottom two bits of the first byte are a one followed by a zero ( that is   the first byte is 0bXXXXXX10 )  the Vendor ID is a CID .
:LABEL: field

name: VERR
description: Sub-Protocol : Actually   the vendor specifying their use of the Vendor Channel can do whatever they want with the bits after the VERR field . But it is strongly RECOMMENDED that they use the sub-protocol / sub-version fields indicated so that multiple and evolving uses can be specified based on a single OUI .
:LABEL: field

name: RESV
description: Start.VLAN   End.VLAN : These 12-bit fields give the beginning and ending VLAN IDs of a block of VLANs . The block includes both the starting and ending values; so   a block of size one is indicated by setting End.VLAN equal to Start.VLAN . If Start.VLAN is 0x000   it is treated as if it was 0x001 . If End.VLAN is 0xFFF   it is treated as if it was 0xFFE . If End.VLAN is smaller than Start.VLAN   considering both as unsigned integers   that VLAN block is ignored   but the address flush operation is still executed with other VLAN blocks in the message . VLAN blocks may overlap   in which case   the address flush operation is applicable to a VLAN covered by any one or more of the blocks in the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Start.VLAN
description: Start.VLAN   End.VLAN : These 12-bit fields give the beginning and ending VLAN IDs of a block of VLANs . The block includes both the starting and ending values; so   a block of size one is indicated by setting End.VLAN equal to Start.VLAN . If Start.VLAN is 0x000   it is treated as if it was 0x001 . If End.VLAN is 0xFFF   it is treated as if it was 0xFFE . If End.VLAN is smaller than Start.VLAN   considering both as unsigned integers   that VLAN block is ignored   but the address flush operation is still executed with other VLAN blocks in the message .
