VLAN blocks may overlap   in which case   the address flush operation is applicable to a VLAN covered by any one or more of the blocks in the message .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : The 8-bit TLV type as shown in the table below . See subsections of Section 2.2 for details on each type assigned below . If the type is reserved or not known by a receiving RBridge   that receiving RBridge ignores the value and skips to the next TLV by use of the Length byte . There is no provision for a list of VLAN ID TLVs as there are few enough of them that an arbitrary subset of VLAN IDs can be represented as a bit map .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The 8-bit unsigned integer length in bytes of the remaining information in the TLV after the Length byte . The Length MUST NOT imply that the value extends beyond the end of the RBridge Channel-Protocol-Specific Payload area . If it does   the Address Flush message is corrupt and MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Value
description: In an extensible Address Flush message   when the TLVs are parsed   those TLVs having unknown types are ignored by the receiving RBridge . There may be multiple instances of TLVs with the same Type in the same Address Flush message   and TLVs are not required to be in any particular order .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Holding Time : A time in seconds as an unsigned integer . It has the same meaning as the Holding Time field in IS-IS Hellos [ IS-IS ]. A Smart Endnode and an edge RBridge supporting Smart Endnodes MUST send a Smart-Hello at least three times during their Holding Time . If no Smart-Hellos are received from a Smart Endnode or edge RBridge within the most recent Holding Time it sent   it is assumed that it is no longer available .
:LABEL: field

name: Holding Time
description: o Holding Time : A time in seconds as an unsigned integer . It has the same meaning as the Holding Time field in IS-IS Hellos [ IS-IS ]. A Smart Endnode and an edge RBridge supporting Smart Endnodes MUST send a Smart-Hello at least three times during their Holding Time . If no Smart-Hellos are received from a Smart Endnode or edge RBridge within the most recent Holding Time it sent   it is assumed that it is no longer available .
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: o Flags : At this time   all of the Flags are reserved and MUST be sent as zero and ignored on receipt .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: o Length : Total number of bytes contained in the value field of the TLV   that is   the sum of the length of the F/M/RSV/FGL Data Label fields and six times the number of MAC addresses present . So   if there are n MAC addresses   this is 4+6*n .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: o F : 1 bit . If it is set to 1   it indicates that the endnode supports FGL Data Labels [ RFC7172 ]  and that this Smart-MAC APPsub-TLV has an FGL in the following VLAN/FGL field . Otherwise   the VLAN/FGL Data Label field is a VLAN ID . ( See below for the format of the VLAN/FGL Data Label field ).
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: o M : 1 bit . If it is set to 1   it indicates multihoming ( see Section 6 ). If it is set to 0   it indicates that the Smart Endnodes are not using multihoming .
:LABEL: field

name: RSV
description: o VLAN/FGL Data Label : 24 bits . If F is 1   this field is a 24-bit FGL Data Label for all subsequent MAC addresses in this APPsub - TLV . Otherwise   if F is 0   the lower 12 bits are the VLAN of all subsequent MAC addresses in this APPsub-TLV   and the upper 12 bits are not used ( sent as zero and ignored on receipt ). If there is no VLAN/FGL Data Label specified   the VLAN/FGL Data Label is zero .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The L flag is used in the same way as for the XRO subobjects defined in [ RFC4874 ]  that is :
:LABEL: field

name: XRO Type
description: XRO Type : The value is set to 38 for the IPv4 Diversity XRO subobject . The value is set to 39 for the IPv6 Diversity XRO subobject .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : Per [ RFC4874 ]  the Length contains the total length of the IPv4/IPv6 subobject in bytes   including the XRO Type and Length fields . The Length is variable   depending on the Diversity Identifier Value .
:LABEL: field

name: DI Type
description: Diversity Identifier Type ( DI Type ): Diversity Identifier Type ( DI Type ) indicates the way the reference LSP(s ) or route(s ) with which diversity is required is identified in the IPv4/IPv6 Diversity subobjects . The following three DI Type values are defined in this document :
:LABEL: field

name: Resvd
description: Resvd : This field is reserved . It MUST be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt for both IPv4/IPv6 Diversity XRO subobjects .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T When the bit value is 1   the PE announces the ability to send a PW packet that includes a flow label . When the bit value is 0   the PE is indicating that it will not send a PW packet containing a flow label .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R When the bit value is 1   the PE is able to receive a PW packet with a flow label present . When the bit value is 0   the PE is unable to receive a PW packet with the flow label present .
:LABEL: field

name: C
description: C Defined in [ RFC4761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S Defined in [ RFC4761 ].
:LABEL: field

name: P2P LSP Tunnel Egress IPv4 Address
description: o P2P LSP Tunnel Egress IPv4 Address : The IPv4 address of the egress node of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: o Tunnel ID ( refer to [ RFC4875 ] and [ RFC3209 ]): A 16-bit identifier that remains constant over the life of the tunnel and occupies the least significant 16 bits of the 32-bit word .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: o Extended Tunnel ID ( refer to [ RFC4875 ] and [ RFC3209 ]): A 4-byte identifier that remains constant over the life of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: Tunnel ID
description: o Tunnel ID ( refer to [ RFC4875 ] and [ RFC3209 ]): A 16-bit identifier that remains constant over the life of the tunnel and occupies the least significant 16 bits of the 32-bit word .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Tunnel ID
description: o Extended Tunnel ID ( refer to [ RFC4875 ] and [ RFC3209 ]): A 16-byte identifier that remains constant over the life of the tunnel .
:LABEL: field

name: BAR
description: IPA : IGP Algorithm . May be used to modify   enhance   or replace the calculation of underlay paths as defined by the BAR value .
:LABEL: field

name: IPA
description: IPA : IGP Algorithm . May be used to modify   enhance   or replace the calculation of underlay paths as defined by the BAR value .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type Name ---- ---- 1 BIER MPLS Encapsulation
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : As indicated in the IANA section .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: BAR : BIER Algorithm . Specifies a BIER-specific algorithm used to calculate underlay paths to reach BFERs . Values are allocated from the " BIER Algorithms " registry . 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: BAR
description: BAR : BIER Algorithm . Specifies a BIER-specific algorithm used to calculate underlay paths to reach BFERs . Values are allocated from the " BIER Algorithms " registry . 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: IPA
description: IPA : IGP Algorithm . Specifies an IGP Algorithm to either modify   enhance   or replace the calculation of underlay paths to reach BFERs as defined by the BAR value . Values are from the IGP Algorithm registry . 1 octet .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : Value of 1 indicating MPLS encapsulation .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Max SI : Maximum Set Identifier ( Section 1 of [ RFC8279 ]) used in the encapsulation for this BIER subdomain for this BitString length   1 octet . Each SI maps to a single label in the label range . The first label is for SI=0   the second label is for SI=1   etc . If the label associated with the Maximum Set Identifier exceeds the 20-bit range   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: Max SI
description: Max SI : Maximum Set Identifier ( Section 1 of [ RFC8279 ]) used in the encapsulation for this BIER subdomain for this BitString length   1 octet . Each SI maps to a single label in the label range . The first label is for SI=0   the second label is for SI=1   etc . If the label associated with the Maximum Set Identifier exceeds the 20-bit range   the sub-sub-TLV MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: BS Len
description: Local BitString Length ( BS Len ): Encoded BitString length as per [ RFC8296 ]. 4 bits .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label : First label of the range   20 bits . The labels are as defined in [ RFC8296 ].
:LABEL: field

name: PST
description: PST : Path Setup Type
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : The total length in bytes of the remainder of the TLV   that is   excluding the Type and Length fields .
:LABEL: field

name: Num of PSTs
description: Num of PSTs : The number of PSTs in the following list   excluding padding .
:LABEL: field

name: msg-type
description: msg-type Identifies the DHCP message type; the available message types are listed in Section 7.3 . A 1-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: transaction-id
description: transaction-id The transaction ID for this message exchange . A 3-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: msg-type
description: msg-type RELAY-FORW ( 12 ). A 1-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: hop-count
description: hop-count Number of relay agents that have already relayed this message . A 1-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: link-address
description: link-address An address that may be used by the server to identify the link on which the client is located . This is typically a globally scoped unicast address ( i.e .  GUA or ULA )  but see the discussion in Section 19.1.1 . A 16-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: peer-address
description: peer-address The address of the client or relay agent from which the message to be relayed was received . A 16-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: msg-type
description: msg-type RELAY-REPL ( 13 ). A 1-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: hop-count
description: hop-count Copied from the Relay-forward message . A 1-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: link-address
description: link-address Copied from the Relay-forward message . A 16-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: peer-address
description: peer-address Copied from the Relay-forward message . A 16-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: protocol
description: protocol 3
:LABEL: field

name: algorithm
description: algorithm 1
:LABEL: field

name: RDM
description: RDM 0
:LABEL: field

name: IA_NA-options
description: IA_NA-options Options associated with this IA_NA . A variable-length field ( 12 octets less than the value in the option-len field ).
:LABEL: field

name: IA_TA-options
description: IA_TA-options Options associated with this IA_TA . A variable-length field ( 4 octets less than the value in the option-len field ).
:LABEL: field

name: IPv6-address
description: IPv6-address An IPv6 address . A client MUST NOT form an implicit prefix with a length other than 128 for this address . A 16-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: preferred-lifetime
description: preferred-lifetime The preferred lifetime for the address in the option   expressed in units of seconds . A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: valid-lifetime
description: valid-lifetime The valid lifetime for the address in the option   expressed in units of seconds . A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: pref-value
description: pref-value The preference value for the server in this message . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: elapsed-time
description: elapsed-time The amount of time since the client began its current DHCP transaction . This time is expressed in hundredths of a second ( 10^-2 seconds ). A 2-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: DHCP-relay-message
description: DHCP-relay-message In a Relay-forward message   the received message   relayed verbatim to the next relay agent or server; in a Relay-reply message   the message to be copied and relayed to the relay agent or client whose address is in the peer-address field of the Relay-reply message . The length   in octets   is specified by option-len .
:LABEL: field

name: protocol
description: protocol The authentication protocol used in this Authentication option . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: algorithm
description: algorithm The algorithm used in the authentication protocol . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: RDM
description: RDM The replay detection method used in this Authentication option . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: server-address
description: server-address The 128-bit address to which the client should send messages delivered using unicast .
:LABEL: field

name: status-code
description: status-code The numeric code for the status encoded in this option . A 2-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: enterprise-number
description: enterprise-number The vendor's registered Enterprise Number as maintained by IANA [ IANA-PEN ]. A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: enterprise-number
description: enterprise-number The vendor's registered Enterprise Number as maintained by IANA [ IANA-PEN ]. A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: sub-opt-code
description: sub-opt-code The code for the sub-option . A 2-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: sub-option-len
description: sub-option-len An unsigned integer giving the length of the sub-option-data field in this sub-option in octets . A 2-octet field .
:LABEL: field

name: msg-type
description: msg-type 5 for Renew message   6 for Rebind message   11 for Information-request message . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: preferred-lifetime
description: preferred-lifetime The preferred lifetime for the prefix in the option   expressed in units of seconds . A value of 0xffffffff represents " infinity " ( see Section 7.7 ). A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: valid-lifetime
description: valid-lifetime The valid lifetime for the prefix in the option   expressed in units of seconds . A value of 0xffffffff represents " infinity ". A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: prefix-length
description: prefix-length Length for this prefix in bits . A 1-octet unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: information-refresh-time
description: information-refresh-time Time duration relative to the current time   expressed in units of seconds . A 4-octet field containing an unsigned integer .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L - On-link Flag [ RFC4861 ]
:LABEL: field

name: A
description: A - Autonomous Address Configuration Flag [ RFC4861 ]
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R - Router Address Flag [ RFC6275 ]
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved1
description: Reserved1 - Reserved
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 9
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: sub-domain-id : Unique value identifying the BIER sub-domain within the BIER domain   as described in Section 1 of [ RFC8279 ].
:LABEL: field

name: BAR
description: BAR : Single-octet BIER Algorithm used to calculate underlay paths to reach other BFRs . Values are allocated from the " BIER Algorithm " registry defined in [ RFC8401 ].
:LABEL: field

name: IPA
description: IPA : Single-octet IGP Algorithm used to either modify   enhance   or replace the calculation of underlay paths to reach other BFRs as defined by the BAR value . Values are defined in the " IGP Algorithm Types " registry [ IANA-IGP ].
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 10
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Max SI : A 1-octet field encoding the maximum Set Identifier ( SI ) ( see Section 1 of [ RFC8279 ]) used in the encapsulation for this BIER sub-domain for this BitString length .
:LABEL: field

name: Max SI
description: Max SI : A 1-octet field encoding the maximum Set Identifier ( SI ) ( see Section 1 of [ RFC8279 ]) used in the encapsulation for this BIER sub-domain for this BitString length .
:LABEL: field

name: Label
description: Label : A 3-octet field   where the 20 rightmost bits represent the first label in the label range . The 4 leftmost bits MUST be ignored .
:LABEL: field

name: BS Len
description: BS Len ( BitString Length ): A 4-bit field encoding the supported BitString length associated with this BFR-prefix . The values allowed in this field are specified in Section 2 of [ RFC8296 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : SHOULD be set to 0 on transmission and MUST be ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: M
description: Marker Bit ( M ): 1 bit . The marker bit MUST be set on any packet that contains the final slice in a coded picture and MUST NOT be set otherwise .
:LABEL: field

name: PT
description: Payload Type ( PT ): 7 bits . A dynamically allocated payload type field that designates the payload as VC-2-coded video .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: Sequence Number : 16 bits . Because the data rate of VC-2-coded Streams can often be very high   in the order of gigabits rather than megabits per second   the standard 16-bit RTP sequence number can cycle very quickly . For this reason   the sequence number is extended to 32 bits   and this field MUST hold the low-order 16 bits of this value .
:LABEL: field

name: Timestamp
description: Timestamp : 32 bits . If the packet contains Transform Parameters or Coded Slice data for a coded picture   then the timestamp corresponds to the sampling instant of the coded picture . A 90kHz clock SHOULD be used . A single RTP packet MUST NOT contain coded data for more than one coded picture   so there is no ambiguity here .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Sequence Number
description: Extended Sequence Number : 16 bits . MUST contain the high-order 16 bits of the 32-bit packet sequence number . This is needed since the high data rates of VC-2 Sequences mean that it is highly likely that the 16-bit sequence number will roll over too frequently to be of use for Stream synchronization .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : 1 bit . MUST be set to 1 if the packet contains the first byte of an Auxiliary Data Unit and otherwise MUST be 0 . If the recommendations in Section 4.4 (" Stream Constraints ") are followed   then every Auxiliary Data Unit will be small enough to fit in a single packet   and so this bit ( where present ) will always be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : 1 bit . MUST be set to 1 if the packet contains the final byte of an Auxiliary Data Unit and otherwise MUST be 0 . If the recommendations in Section 4.4 (" Stream Constraints ") are followed   then every Auxiliary Data Unit will be small enough to fit in a single packet   and so this bit ( where present ) will always be 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : 1 bit . MUST be set to 1 if the packet contains coded picture parameters or slice data from a field in an interlaced frame . MUST be set to 0 if the packet contains data from any part of a progressive frame .
:LABEL: field

name: F
description: F : 1 bit . MUST be set to 1 if the packet contains coded picture parameters or slice data from the second field of an interlaced frame . MUST be set to 0 if the packet contains data from the first field of an interlaced frame or any part of a progressive frame .
:LABEL: field

name: Parse Code
description: Parse Code ( PC ): 8 bits . Contains a Parse Code that MUST be the value indicated for the type of data in the packet .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Length
description: Data Length : 32 bits . For an auxiliary Data Unit   this contains the number of bytes of data contained in the payload section of this packet . If the recommendations in Section 4.4 (" Stream Constraints ") are followed   then no Auxiliary Data Unit will be large enough to cause a packet to exceed the MTU of the network .
:LABEL: field

name: Picture Number
description: Picture Number : 32 bits . MUST contain the Picture Number for the coded picture this packet contains data for   as described in Section 12.1 of the VC-2 specification [ VC2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Slice Prefix Bytes
description: Slice Prefix Bytes : 16 bits . MUST contain the Slice Prefix Bytes value for the coded picture this packet contains data for   as described in Section 12.3.4 of the VC-2 specification [ VC2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Slice Size Scaler
description: Slice Size Scaler : 16 bits . MUST contain the Slice Size Scaler value for the coded picture this packet contains data for   as described in Section 12.3.4 of the VC-2 specification [ VC2 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Length
description: Fragment Length : 16 bits . MUST contain the number of bytes of data contained in the coded payload section of this packet .
:LABEL: field

name: No . of Slices
description: No . of Slices : 16 bits . MUST contain the number of Coded Slices contained in this packet   which MUST be 0 for a packet containing Transform Parameters . In a packet containing Coded Slices   this number MUST be the number of whole slices contained in the packet   and the packet MUST NOT contain any partial slices .
:LABEL: field

name: Slice Offset X
description: Slice Offset X : 16 bits . MUST contain the X coordinate of the first slice in this packet   in slices   starting from the top left corner of the picture .
:LABEL: field

name: Slice Offset Y
description: Slice Offset Y : 16 bits . MUST contain the Y coordinate of the first slice in this packet   in slices   starting from the top left corner of the picture .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the value field in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : For OSPFv2   the link-level MSD-Value is advertised as an optional sub-TLV of the OSPFv2 Extended Link TLV as defined in [ RFC7684 ] and has a type of 6 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Value : consists of one or more pairs of a 1-octet MSD-Type and 1-octet MSD-Value .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: 6P Version ( Version ): The version of 6P . Only version 0 is defined in this document . Future specifications may define subsequent versions of 6P .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: Type ( T ): The type of message . The message types are defined in Section 6.2.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved ( R ): Reserved bits . These two bits SHOULD be set to zero when sending the message and MUST be ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: Reserved ( R ): Reserved bits . These two bits SHOULD be set to zero when sending the message and MUST be ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code : The Code field contains a 6P command identifier when the 6P message has a Type value of REQUEST . Section 6.2.3 lists the 6P command identifiers . The Code field contains a 6P return code when the 6P message has a Type value of RESPONSE or CONFIRMATION . Section 6.2.4 lists the 6P return codes . The same return codes are used in both 6P Response and 6P Confirmation messages .
:LABEL: field

name: SFID
description: 6top Scheduling Function Identifier ( SFID ): The identifier of the SF to use to handle this message . The SFID is defined in Section 4.1 .
:LABEL: field

name: SeqNum
description: SeqNum : The sequence number associated with the 6P Transaction . Used to match the 6P Request   6P Response   and 6P Confirmation of the same 6P Transaction . The value of SeqNum MUST be different for each new 6P Request issued to the same neighbor and using the same SF . The SeqNum is also used to ensure consistency between the schedules of the two neighbors . Section 3.4.6 details how the SeqNum is managed .
:LABEL: field

name: slotOffset
description: slotOffset : The slot offset of the cell .
:LABEL: field

name: channelOffset
description: The CellList is an opaque set of bytes   sent unmodified to the SF . The length of the CellList field is implicit and is determined by the IE Length field of the Payload IE header as defined in 802.15.4 . The SF MAY redefine the format of the CellList field; the routine that parses this field is therefore associated with a specific SF .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Used as extra signaling to the SF . The contents of the Metadata field are an opaque set of bytes passed unmodified to the SF . The meaning of this field depends on the SF and is out of scope for this document . For example   Metadata can specify in which slotframe to add the cells .
:LABEL: field

name: CellOptions
description: CellOptions : Indicates the options to associate with the cells to be added . If more than one cell is added ( NumCells > 1 )  the same options are associated with each one . This necessarily means that if node A needs to add multiple cells with different options it needs to initiate multiple 6P ADD Transactions .
:LABEL: field

name: NumCells
description: NumCells : The number of additional cells node A wants to schedule to node B .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Same usage as for the 6P ADD command; see Section 3.3.1 . Its format is the same as that in the 6P ADD command   but its content could be different .
:LABEL: field

name: CellOptions
description: CellOptions : Indicates the options that need to be associated with the cells to delete . Only cells matching the CellOptions can be deleted .
:LABEL: field

name: NumCells
description: NumCells : The number of cells from the specified CellList the sender wants to delete from the schedule of both sender and receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: CellOptions : Indicates the options that need to be associated with cells to be relocated .
:LABEL: field

name: CellOptions
description: CellOptions : Indicates the options that need to be associated with cells to be relocated .
:LABEL: field

name: NumCells
description: NumCells : The number of cells to relocate . MUST be greater than or equal to 1 .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Same usage as for the 6P ADD command; see Section 3.3.1 . Its format is the same as that in the 6P ADD command   but its content could be different .
:LABEL: field

name: CellOptions
description: CellOptions : Specifies which type of cell to be counted .
:LABEL: field

name: NumCells
description: NumCells : The number of cells that correspond to the fields of the request .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Same usage as for the 6P ADD command; see Section 3.3.1 . Its format is the same as that in the 6P ADD command   but its content could be different .
:LABEL: field

name: CellOptions
description: Reserved : Reserved bits . These bits SHOULD be set to zero when sending the message and MUST be ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved : Reserved bits . These bits SHOULD be set to zero when sending the message and MUST be ignored upon reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Offset
description: Offset : The offset of the first scheduled cell that is requested . The mechanism assumes that cells are ordered according to a rule defined in the SF . The rule MUST always order the cells in the same way .
:LABEL: field

name: MaxNumCells
description: MaxNumCells : The maximum number of cells to be listed . Node B MAY return fewer than MaxNumCells cells -- for example   if MaxNumCells cells do not fit in the frame .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Same usage as for the 6P ADD command; see Section 3.3.1 . Its format is the same as that in the 6P ADD command   but its content could be different .
:LABEL: field

name: Metadata
description: Metadata : Same usage as for the 6P ADD command; see Section 3.3.1 . Its format is the same as that in the 6P ADD command   but its content could be different .
:LABEL: field

name: SFID
description: Each SF has a 1-byte identifier . Section 6.2.5 defines the rules for applying for an SFID .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Describes the format of the Value field . For all the available types   please see Section 3.2 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Type   Length   and Value fields in octets . Minimum length required is 4 octets . The length MUST be a multiple of 4 octets . The maximum TLV length is not defined; however   the entire Mtrace2 packet length MUST NOT exceed the available MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of Type   Length   and Value fields in octets . Minimum length required is 4 octets . The length MUST be a multiple of 4 octets . The maximum TLV length is not defined; however   the entire Mtrace2 packet length MUST NOT exceed the available MTU .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 16 bits The Length field MUST be either 20 ( i.e .  8 + 3 * 4 ( IPv4 addresses )) or 56 ( i.e .  8 + 3 * 16 ( IPv6 addresses)); if the length is 20   then IPv4 addresses MUST be assumed   and if the length is 56   then IPv6 addresses MUST be assumed .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Address
description: Multicast Address : 32 bits or 128 bits This field specifies an IPv4 or IPv6 address   which can be either :
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Source Address : 32 bits or 128 bits This field specifies an IPv4 or IPv6 address   which can be either :
:LABEL: field

name: Mtrace2 Client Address
description: Mtrace2 Client Address : 32 bits or 128 bits This field specifies the Mtrace2 client's IPv4 address or IPv6 global address . This address MUST be a valid unicast address; therefore   it MUST NOT be all ones or an unspecified address . The Mtrace2 Reply will be sent to this address .
:LABEL: field

name: Query ID
description: Query ID : 16 bits This field is used as a unique identifier for this Mtrace2 Query so that duplicate or delayed Reply messages may be detected .
:LABEL: field

name: Client Port #
description: Client Port #: 16 bits This field specifies the destination UDP port number for receiving the Mtrace2 Reply packet .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : 8 bits This field MUST be zeroed on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Query Arrival Time
description: Query Arrival Time : 32 bits The Query Arrival Time is a 32-bit Network Time Protocol ( NTP ) timestamp specifying the arrival time of the Mtrace2 Query or Request packet at this router . The 32-bit form of an NTP timestamp consists of the middle 32 bits of the full 64-bit form; that is   the low 16 bits of the integer part and the high 16 bits of the fractional part .
:LABEL: field

name: Incoming Interface Address
description: Incoming Interface Address : 32 bits This field specifies the address of the interface on which packets from the source or the RP are expected to arrive   or 0 if unknown or unnumbered .
:LABEL: field

name: Outgoing Interface Address
description: Outgoing Interface Address : 32 bits This field specifies the address of the interface on which packets from the source or the RP are expected to transmit towards the receiver   or 0 if unknown or unnumbered . This is also the address of the interface on which the Mtrace2 Query or Request arrives .
:LABEL: field

name: Upstream Router Address
description: Upstream Router Address : 32 bits This field specifies the address of the upstream router from which this router expects packets from this source . This MAY be a multicast group ( e.g .  ALL-[protocol]-ROUTERS group ) if the upstream router is not known because of the workings of the multicast routing protocol . However   it MUST be 0 if the Incoming Interface address is unknown or unnumbered .
:LABEL: field

name: Input packet count on Incoming Interface
description: Input packet count on Incoming Interface : 64 bits This field contains the number of multicast packets received for all groups and sources on the Incoming Interface   or all ones if no count can be reported . This counter may have the same value as ifHCInMulticastPkts from the Interfaces Group MIB ( IF-MIB ) [ 9 ] for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Output packet count on Outgoing Interface
description: Output packet count on Outgoing Interface : 64 bits This field contains the number of multicast packets that have been transmitted or queued for transmission for all groups and sources on the Outgoing Interface   or all ones if no count can be reported . This counter may have the same value as ifHCOutMulticastPkts from the IF-MIB [ 9 ] for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Rtg Protocol
description: Rtg Protocol : 16 bits This field describes the unicast routing protocol running between this router and the upstream router   and it is used to determine the Reverse Path Forwarding ( RPF ) interface for the specified source or RP . This value should have the same value as ipMcastRouteRtProtocol from the IP Multicast MIB [ 14 ] for this entry . If the router is not able to obtain this value   all 0's must be specified .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Rtg Protocol
description: Multicast Rtg Protocol : 16 bits This field describes the multicast routing protocol in use between the router and the upstream router . This value should have the same value as ipMcastRouteProtocol from the IP Multicast MIB [ 14 ] for this entry . If the router cannot obtain this value   all 0's must be specified .
:LABEL: field

name: Fwd TTL
description: Fwd TTL : 8 bits This field contains the configured multicast TTL threshold   if any   of the Outgoing Interface .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : 1 bit If this bit is set   it indicates that the packet count for the source-group pair is for the source network   as determined by masking the source address with the Src Mask field .
:LABEL: field

name: Src Mask
description: Src Mask : 7 bits This field contains the number of 1's in the netmask the router has for the source ( i.e .  a value of 24 means the netmask is 0xffffff00 ). If the router is forwarding solely on group state   this field is set to 127 ( 0x7f ).
:LABEL: field

name: Forwarding Code
description: Forwarding Code : 8 bits This field contains a forwarding information/error code . Values with the high-order bit set ( 0x80-0xff ) are intended for use with conditions that are transitory or automatically recovered . Other Forwarding Code values indicate a need to fix a problem in the Query or a need to redirect the Query . Sections 4.1 and 4.2 explain how and when the Forwarding Code is filled . Defined values are as follows :
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : 8 bits This field MUST be zeroed on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Query Arrival Time
description: Query Arrival Time : 32 bits Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Incoming Interface ID
description: Incoming Interface ID : 32 bits This field specifies the interface ID on which packets from the source or RP are expected to arrive   or 0 if unknown . This ID should be the value taken from InterfaceIndex of the IF-MIB [ 9 ] for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Outgoing Interface ID
description: Outgoing Interface ID : 32 bits This field specifies the interface ID to which packets from the source or RP are expected to transmit   or 0 if unknown . This ID should be the value taken from InterfaceIndex of the IF-MIB [ 9 ] for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Local Address
description: Local Address : 128 bits This field specifies a global IPv6 address that uniquely identifies the router . A unique local unicast address [ 12 ] SHOULD NOT be used unless the router is only assigned link-local and unique local addresses . If the router is only assigned link-local addresses   its link-local address can be specified in this field .
:LABEL: field

name: Remote Address
description: Remote Address : 128 bits This field specifies the address of the upstream router   which   in most cases   is a link-local unicast address for the upstream router .
:LABEL: field

name: Input packet count on Incoming Interface
description: Input packet count on Incoming Interface : 64 bits Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Output packet count on Outgoing Interface
description: Output packet count on Outgoing Interface : 64 bits Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Rtg Protocol
description: Rtg Protocol : 16 bits Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: Multicast Rtg Protocol
description: Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ 2 : 15 bits This field MUST be zeroed on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: S
description: S : 1 bit Same definition as in IPv4   except the Src Prefix Len field is used to mask the source address .
:LABEL: field

name: Src Prefix Len
description: Src Prefix Len : 8 bits This field contains the prefix length this router has for the source . If the router is forwarding solely on group state   this field is set to 255 ( 0xff ).
:LABEL: field

name: Forwarding Code
description: Forwarding Code : 8 bits Same definition as in IPv4 .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : 8 bits This field MUST be zeroed on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Augmented Response Type
description: Augmented Response Type : 16 bits This field specifies the type of various responses from a multicast router that might need to communicate back to the Mtrace2 client as well as the multicast routers on the traced path .
:LABEL: field

name: MBZ
description: MBZ : 7 bits This field MUST be zeroed on transmission and ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: T-bit ( Transitive Attribute ): 1 bit If the TLV Type is unrecognized by the receiving router   then this TLV is either discarded or forwarded along with the Query   depending on the value of this bit . If this bit is set   then the router MUST forward this TLV . If this bit is clear   the router MUST send an Mtrace2 Reply with an UNKNOWN_QUERY error .
:LABEL: field

name: Extended Query Type
description: Extended Query Type : 16 bits This field specifies the type of the Extended Query Block .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: An Mtrace2 Request should be sent with the address of the Incoming Interface . However   if the Incoming Interface is unnumbered   the router can use one of its numbered interface addresses as the source address .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: An Mtrace2 Reply SHOULD be sent with the address of the router's Outgoing Interface . However   if the Outgoing Interface address is unnumbered   the router can use one of its numbered interface addresses as the source address .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: An Mtrace2 Query MUST be sent with the client's interface address   which is the Mtrace2 Client Address .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the Value field
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the Value field
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the Value field
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : variable ( multiple of 2 octets); represents the total length of the Value field
:LABEL: field

name: Flags
description: Flags ( 1 octet ) Metric ( 3 octets ) sub-TLV length ( 1 octet ) sub-TLV data ( 0 - 250 octets )
:LABEL: field

name: Metric
description: Flags ( 1 octet ) Metric ( 3 octets ) sub-TLV length ( 1 octet ) sub-TLV data ( 0 - 250 octets )
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: TID : Transaction ID ( a sequence counter in the EARO )
:LABEL: field

name: Registered Address
description: RFC 6775-only : An implementation   a type of node   or a message that behaves only as specified by [ RFC6775 ]  as opposed to the behavior specified in this document .
:LABEL: field

description: This specification introduces the EARO; the EARO is based on the ARO for use in NS and NA messages . The EARO includes a sequence counter called the Transaction ID ( TID )  which is used to determine the latest location of a registering mobile device . A new T flag indicates that the presence of the TID field is populated and that the option is an EARO . A 6LN requests routing or proxy services from a 6LR using a new R flag in the EARO .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 33
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 8-bit unsigned integer . The length of the option in units of 8 bytes .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status : 8-bit unsigned integer . Indicates the status of a registration in the NA response . MUST be set to 0 in NS messages . See Table 1 below .
:LABEL: field

name: Opaque
description: Opaque : An octet opaque to ND . The 6LN MAY pass it transparently to another process . It MUST be set to 0 when not used .
:LABEL: field

name: Rsvd
description: Rsvd ( Reserved ): This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Rsvd ( Reserved ): This field is unused . It MUST be initialized to 0 by the sender and MUST be ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: I
description: I : 2-bit integer . A value of 0 indicates that the Opaque field carries an abstract index that is used to decide in which routing topology the address is expected to be injected . In that case   the Opaque field is passed to a routing process with the indication that it carries topology information   and the value of 0 indicates default . All other values of " I " are reserved and MUST NOT be used .
:LABEL: field

name: R
description: R : The Registering Node sets the R flag to request reachability services for the Registered Address from a Routing Registrar .
:LABEL: field

name: T
description: TID : 1-byte unsigned integer . A Transaction ID that is maintained by the node and incremented with each transaction of one or more registrations performed at the same time to one or more 6LRs . This field MUST be ignored if the T flag is not set .
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: TID : 1-byte unsigned integer . A Transaction ID that is maintained by the node and incremented with each transaction of one or more registrations performed at the same time to one or more 6LRs . This field MUST be ignored if the T flag is not set .
:LABEL: field

name: Registration Lifetime
description: Registration Lifetime : 16-bit integer   expressed in minutes . A value of 0 indicates that the registration has ended and that the associated state MUST be removed .
:LABEL: field

name: TID
description: TID : 1-byte integer . Same definition and processing as the TID in the EARO as defined in Section 4.1 . This field MUST be ignored if the ICMP Code is null .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 36
:LABEL: field

name: D
description: D : The 6LBR supports EDAR and EDAC messages .
:LABEL: field

name: L
description: L : The node is a 6LR .
:LABEL: field

name: B
description: B : The node is a 6LBR .
:LABEL: field

name: P
description: E : The node is an IPv6 ND Registrar; i.e .  it supports registrations based on the EARO .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: E : The node is an IPv6 ND Registrar; i.e .  it supports registrations based on the EARO .
:LABEL: field

name: Version
description: Version 4-bit IP version number = decimal 6 . < to be confirmed >
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved 28-bit reserved field . Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Length
description: Payload Length 16-bit unsigned integer . Length of payload   i.e .  the rest of the packet following the SIP header   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: Payload Type 8-bit selector . Identifies the type of payload   e.g .  TCP .
:LABEL: field

name: Hop Limit
description: Hop Limit 8-bit unsigned integer . Decremented by 1 by each system that forwards the packet . The packet is discarded if Hop Limit is decremented to zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Address
description: Source Address 64 bits . See " Addresses " section   following .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Address
description: Destination Address 64 bits . See " Addresses " section   following .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Num Addrs
description: Num Addrs Number of addresses in the Source Routing header .
:LABEL: field

name: Next Addr
description: Next Addr Index of next address to be processed; initialized to 0 by the originating system .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: Payload Type Identifies the type of payload following the Source Routing header .
:LABEL: field

name: Identification
description: Identification A value that changes on each packet sent with the same Source Address   Destination Address   and preceding Payload Type .
:LABEL: field

name: Fragment Offset
description: Fragment Offset The offset   in 8-octet chunks   of the following payload   relative to the original   unfragmented payload .
:LABEL: field

name: Payload Type
description: Payload Type Identifies the type of payload following the Fragmentation header .
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Reserved Initialized to zero for transmission; ignored on reception .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type : 18
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length : 4 octets
:LABEL: field

name: Local Interface ID
description: Local Interface ID TLV signaling using LLS is applicable to all OSPF interface types other than virtual links .
:LABEL: field

name: IPv4 LSP Source Address
description: IPv4 source address of the forward LSP [ RFC3209 ].
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: 16-bit LSP ID of the forward LSP [ RFC3209 ].
:LABEL: field

name: LSP ID
description: 16-bit LSP ID of the forward LSP [ RFC3209 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reserved
description: Should be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: Res
description: SHOULD be set to all ' 0's and ignored by the receiver .
:LABEL: field

name: E
description: Format : SEND(association id   buffer address   byte count [  context ] [  stream id ] [  life time ] [  destination transport address ] [  unordered flag ] [  no-bundle flag ] [  payload protocol-id ] ) -> result
:LABEL: field

description: HMP messages are sent using the version 4 IP header as described in RFC-791 " Internet Protocol ." The HMP protocol number is 20 ( decimal ). The time to live field should be set to a reasonable value for the hosts being monitored .
:LABEL: field

name: Trap ID
description: This is usually the program counter at the trap . The ID identifies the trap   and does not have to be a program counter   provided it uniquely identifies the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Trap ID
description: This is ( usually ) the program counter at the trap . The ID identifies the trap   and does not have to be a program counter   provided that it uniquely identifies the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Version Number
description: The TAC's software version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Version Number
description: The TAC's software version number .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Version #
description: The software version number of the gateway sending the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Size of Trap Entry
description: The size in 16-bit words of the trap entry   not including the size field .
:LABEL: field

name: Time of Trap
description: The time in ( in 1/60 sec . ticks ) at which the trap occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: Trap ID
description: The number of the trap which is used to identify the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Process ID
description: The identifier of the process that executed the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of this Trap
description: The number of times that this trap occurred .
:LABEL: field

name: Version Number
description: The version number of the gateway sending the Status message .
:LABEL: field

name: Patch Version Number
description: The patch version number of the gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Time Since Gateway Restart
description: The time in minutes since the gateway was last restarted or reloaded .
:LABEL: field

name: Measurement Flags
description: Flags that   if set   indicate which measurements are turned on . Current values are :
:LABEL: field

name: Memory Idle
description: The number of bytes of buffer memory that have been allocated but are currently idle .
:LABEL: field

name: Memory Free
description: The number of bytes of buffer memory that has not been allocated .
:LABEL: field

name: # Allocated
description: The number of blocks of this size that have been allocated .
:LABEL: field

name: # Idle
description: The number of blocks of this size that are idle .
:LABEL: field

name: Buffers
description: The numbers on this interfaces write queue .
:LABEL: field

name: # of Buffers Allocated
description: The number of buffers allocated for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Data Size for Interface
description: The buffer size required for this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Address
description: The Internet address of this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor Address
description: The Internet address of the neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Version Number
description: The software version number of the gateway sending the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Interfaces
description: The number of interfaces this gateway has .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Neighbors
description: The number of neighbor gateways this gateway has .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Host Unreachable
description: The number of packets dropped because the Host was unreachable .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of Net Unreachable
description: The number of packets dropped because the Network was unreachable .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Address
description: The Internet address of this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Packets Dropped on Input
description: The number of packets on input to this interface because there were not enough buffers .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of IP Errors
description: The number of packets received with bad IP headers .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Datagrams for Us
description: The number of datagrams received addressed to this gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Datagrams to be Forwarded
description: The number of datagrams were not for this gateway and should be sent out another interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Datagrams Looped
description: The number of datagrams that were received on and sent out of this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Bytes Input
description: The number of bytes received on this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Datagrams From Us
description: The number of datagrams that originated at this gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Count that were Forwarded
description: The number of datagrams that were forwarded to another gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Local Net Dropped
description: The number of packets that were dropped because of local network flow control restrictions .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Queue full Dropped
description: The number of packets that were dropped because the output queue was full .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Bytes Output
description: The number of bytes sent out on this interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor Address
description: The Internet address of this neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Routing Updates TO
description: The number of routing updates sent to this neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Routing Updates FROM
description: The number of routing updates received from this neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Datagrams Local Net Dropped
description: The number of datagrams dropped to this neighbor gateway because of local network flow control restrictions .
:LABEL: field

name: Datagrams Queue full Dropped
description: The number of datagrams dropped to this neighbor because the output queue was full .
:LABEL: field

name: Count of Bytes send to Neighbor
description: The number of bytes sent to this neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Version Number
description: The software version number of this gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Overflow counter
description: The number of HTM entries lost because the HTM buffer was full .
:LABEL: field

name: Collection Time in Min
description: The time period in minutes in which the HTM data is being collected .
:LABEL: field

name: Number of HTM entries
description: The number of HTM reports included in this message .
:LABEL: field

name: IP Source Address
description: The source Internet address of the datagrams being counted .
:LABEL: field

name: IP Destination Address
description: The destination Internet address of the datagrams being counted .
:LABEL: field

name: IP Protocol
description: The protocol number of the datagrams .
:LABEL: field

name: Counter for SRC -> DST datagrams
description: The number of datagrams sent in the Source to Destination address direction .
:LABEL: field

name: Counter for DST -> SRC datagrams
description: The number of datagrams sent in the Destination to Source address direction .
:LABEL: field

name: Gateway Version #
description: The software version number of the gateway sending the trap .
:LABEL: field

name: Interface Address
description: The Internet address of the Interface .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor Address
description: The Internet address of the neighbor gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: # of Networks
description: The number of networks that are reachable from this gateway .
:LABEL: field

name: Distance
description: The distance in hops to this network . Zero hops means that the network is directly connected to this gateway . A negative number means that the network is currently unreachable .
:LABEL: field

name: Neighbor #
description: The neighbor gateway that is the next hop to reach this network . This is an index into the previous information on this gateway's neighbor gateways . This field is only valid if the Distance is greater than zero .
:LABEL: field

name: EGP Version #
description: EGP Version # assigned number identifying the EGP version ( currently 2 )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type identifies the message type
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code identifies the message code ( subtype )
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status contains message-dependent status information
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Checksum The EGP checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the EGP message starting with the EGP version number field . When computing the checksum the checksum field itself should be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Autonomous System #
description: Autonomous System # assigned number identifying the particular autonomous system
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence #
description: Sequence # send state variable ( commands ) or receive state variable ( responses and indications )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 3
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0 Request command 1 Confirm response 2 Refuse response 3 Cease command 4 Cease-ack response
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status ( see below ) 0 unspecified 1 active mode 2 passive mode 3 insufficient resources 4 administratively prohibited 5 going down 6 parameter problem 7 protocol violation
:LABEL: field

name: Hello Interval
description: Hello Interval minimum Hello command polling interval ( seconds )
:LABEL: field

name: Poll Interval
description: Poll Interval minumum Poll command polling interval ( seconds )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 5
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0 Hello command 1 I-H-U response
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status 0 indeterminate 1 Up state 2 Down state Exterior Gateway Protocol Formal Specification Page 21 D.L . Mills
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 2
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status 0 indeterminate 1 Up state 2 Down state
:LABEL: field

name: IP Source Network
description: IP Source Network IP network number of the network about which reachability information is being requested ( coded as 1   2 or 3 octets   left justified with trailing zeros ) Exterior Gateway Protocol Formal Specification Page 22 D.L . Mills
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 1
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status 0 indeterminate 1 Up state 2 Down state 128 unsolicited message bit
:LABEL: field

name: IP Source Network
description: IP Source Network IP network number of the network about which reachability information is being supplied ( coded as 1   2 or 3 octets   left justified with trailing zeros )
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: Type 8
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: Code 0
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: Status 0 indeterminate 1 Up state 2 Down state 128 unsolicited message bit
:LABEL: field

name: Reason
description: Reason ( see below ) 0 unspecified 1 bad EGP header format 2 bad EGP data field format 3 reachability info unavailable 4 excessive polling rate 5 no response
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: A1 for address format request message
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 for address format request message
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: An identifier to aid in matching request and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: A sequence number to aid in matching request and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Type
description: AM1 for address mask request message
:LABEL: field

name: Code
description: 0 for address mask request message
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's
:LABEL: field

name: Identifier
description: An identifier to aid in matching requests and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Sequence Number
description: A sequence number to aid in matching requests and replies   may be zero .
:LABEL: field

name: Address Mask
description: A 32-bit mask .
:LABEL: field

name: Status
description: This is a six-bit code indicating the status of the local clock . Values are assigned to indicate whether it is operating correctly or in one of several error states .
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: This is a 16-bit signed integer indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two . For instance   a 60-Hz line-frequency clock would be assigned the value - 6   while a 1000-Hz crystal clock would be assigned the value - 10 .
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Error
description: This is a 32-bit fixed-point number indicating the estimated error of the local clock at the time last set . The value is in seconds   with fraction point between bits 15 and 16   and is computed by the sender based on the reported error of the reference clock   the precision and drift rate of the local clock and the time the local clock was last set . For statistical purposes this quantity can be assumed equal to the estimated or computed standard deviation   as described in [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Drift Rate
description: This is a 32-bit signed fixed-point number indicating the estimated drift rate of the local clock . The value is dimensionless   with fraction point to the left of the high-order bit . While for most purposes this value can be estimated based on the hardware characteristics   it is possible to compute it quite accurately   as described in [ 12 ].
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Clock Identifier
description: This is a 32-bit code identifying the particular reference clock . The interpretation of its value depends on value of Reference Clock Type . In the case of a primary clock locally synchronized to Standard Time ( type 1 )  the value is an ASCII string identifying the clock . In the case of a secondary clock remotely synchronized to an Internet host via NTP ( type 2 )  the value is the 32-bit Internet address of that host . In other cases the value is undefined .
:LABEL: field

name: Source Port
description: UDP source port number . In the case of unsymmetric mode and a client request this field is assigned by the client host   while for a server reply it is copied from the Destination Port field of the client request . In the case of symmetric mode   both the Source Port and Destination Port fields are assigned the NTP service-port number 123 .
:LABEL: field

name: Destination Port
description: UDP destination port number . In the case of unsymmetric mode and a client request this field is assigned the NTP service-port number 123   while for a server reply it is copied form the Source Port field of the client request . In the case of symmetric mode   both the Source Port and Destination Port fields are assigned the NTP service-port number 123 .
:LABEL: field

name: Length
description: Length of the request or reply   including UDP header   in octets .
:LABEL: field

name: Checksum
description: Standard UDP checksum .
:LABEL: field

name: LI

name: Status
description: Code indicating status of local clock . Values are defined as follows :

description: Reference Clock Type ( Type )
:LABEL: field

name: Precision
description: Signed integer in the range + 32 to - 32 indicating the precision of the local clock   in seconds to the nearest power of two .
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Error
description: Fixed-point number indicating the estimated error of the local clock at the time last set   in seconds with fraction point between bits 15 and 16 .
:LABEL: field

name: Estimated Drift Rate
description: Signed fixed-point number indicating the estimated drift rate of the local clock   in dimensionless units with fraction point to the left of the high-order bit .
:LABEL: field

name: Reference Clock Identifier
description: Reference Clock Identifier
:LABEL: field

:LABEL: field

name: packet length
description: The length of entire packet in octets   including packet-header .
:LABEL: field

name: code
description: The type of TPDU . Values   in the context of this memo   are :
:LABEL: field

name: credit
description: This field is always ZERO on output and ignored on input .
:LABEL: field

name: source reference
description: This field is always ZERO on output and ignored on input .
:LABEL: field

name: class
description: This field is always 4 ( binary 0100 ) on output and ignored on input . It is anticipated that future versions of this protocol will make use of this field .
:LABEL: field

name: header length
description: This portion of the TPDU is of variable length . For most TPDUs   this portion is empty ( the header length field of the TPDU is exactly 6 ). The contents of the variable data consist of zero or more " parameters ". Each parameter has the following format :
:LABEL: field

name: packet length
description: 11 . user data ( packet length - header length - 5 ) octets
:LABEL: field

name: reason
description: This replaces the class/option fields of the CR or CC TPDU . Any value   as specified in [ ISO-8073 ]  may be used in this field . This memo makes use of several :
:LABEL: field

description: There are eight types of IGMP message :

description: In a Create Group Request message   the code field indicates if the new host group is to be public or private :
:LABEL: field

description: The checksum is the 16-bit one's complement of the one's complement sum of the IGMP message starting with the IGMP Type . For computing the checksum   the checksum field should be zero .
:LABEL: field
